report learned men worthy famous poet first thomas occleve lived day writeth thus book de regimine principis welaway mine hert woe honour english tongue deed wont counsail reed master dere fadre reuerent master chaucer floure eloquence mirror fructuous entendement universal fadre science ala thou thine excellent prudence thy bed mortal mightest bequeath eyld death ala would thee sle death didest harme singler slaughter land smerteth nathelesse yet hast thou power name sle hie vertue afterteth vnslain fro thee ay u lifely herteth book ornat enditing land enlumining author book dear maister god soule quite fader chaucer faine would taught young leered lite nought ala worthy maister honorable land treasure richesse death thy death hath harme irreparable vnto u done vengeable duresse dispoiled hath lond sweetnesse rhetorige unto tullius never man like among u also heire philosophy aristotle tongue thou steppe virgil poese thou suedest eken men know well inough combre world thee maister slough would slaine death hastife renne thee reve thee thy life might tarried vengeance man egal thee nay let knew wele ile may never man forth bring like unto thee office need must god trust best maister maister god thy soul rest dan john lidgate monk bury excellent poet travelled france italy learn language science john lidgate likewise prologue bocchas fall prince translated saith pthe wife bathe good wife also beside bathe deale defe scathe cloth making haunt passed hem ipre gaunt parish wife ne none offring gone certain right wroth charitee kerchers full large fine ground durst sweare waiden ten pound sonday upon hedde hosen fine scarlet redde full straite istrained shoe full new bold face redde hew worthy woman liue husband church doore fiue withouten company youth thereof needed speake nouth thrise ierusaleme passed many strong streme rome boloine cali sainct iames coloine couthe moche wandring way gat tothed sothly say vpon ambler easely satte iwimpled well hedde hatte brode bokeler targe foote mantell hippes large feete paire spurres sharpe fellowship well couth laugh carpe remedy loue could perchance couth arte old dance pthe parsone good manne religioun poore parsone toun rich holy thought werke eke learned man clerke christes gospel truly would preach parishens devoutly would teach benigne wonder diligent adversitie full pacient soch one proved oft sithes full loth curse tithe rather would yeuen doubt vnto poore parishens offring substaunce couthe little thing suffisaunce wide parish house fer asonder ne left neither raine ne thonder sikenesse ne mischiefe visite ferdest parish moch lite vpon foot hand stafe noble ensample shepe yafe first wrought afterward taught gospel word caught figure added eke thereto gold rust iron yef priest foule trust wonder leude man rust shame priest take kepe see shitten shepherd cleane shepe well ought priest ensample yeue clenenesse shepe liue set benefice hire let shepe acomber mire renne london sainct poules seken chauntrie soules brotherhede withold dwelt home kept well fold wolfe made hem miscary shepherd mercenarie though holy vertuous sinfull men dispitous ne speech daungerous ne digne teaching discrete benigne drawen folke heaven fairenesse good ensample besinesse persone obstinate whether hie low estate would snibbe sharply nonis better priest trowe none waited pompe ne reuerence ne maked spiced conscience christes lore apostle twelue taught first followed selue pthe plowman plowman brother iland dong many fother true swinker good living peace perfite charitee god loved best hart time though gained smart neighbour right himselfe would thresh thereto dike delfe christes sake every poore wight withouten hire lay might tithe payed full faire well proper swinke cattell tabard rod upon mare also reue millare sompnour pardoner also mansiple selfe mo pthe miller miller stout carle none full bigg braune eke bone proved well came wrastling would away ram short shuldred thick gnarre doore would heue bar breake renning hedde beard sowe fore redde thereto brode spade vpon coppe right nose hade werte thereon stode tufte heeres redde bristle sowes eares nostrels blacke wide swerd buckeler bare side mouth great furneis jangler golierdeis sinne harletrise well couth steale corne toll thrise yet thombe gold parde white coate blew hode weared bagpipe well couth blow soune therewithall brought u toune pthe mancile manciple temple catours might taken ensemple wise buying vitaile whether payed tooke taile algate waited ashate aye good estate god full faire grace soch leude mannes wit pace wisedome heape learned men maisters mo thrise ten lawe expert curious dosen hous worthy steward rent land lord england maken live proper good honour deptlesse wood live scarsly list desre able helpen shire case might fallen hap yet manciple set cap pthe reue reue slender cholerik man bearde shave nie ever heere eares round ishorne top docked like priest beforne full long leg eke full lene like staffe calfe seene well couth kepe garner binne none auditour coud win well wist drought raine yelding seed graine lord shepe nete deirie swine hors store pultrie holly reuis governing covenant yaue rekening sith lord twentie yeere age could man bring arerage na bailie herde hine ne knew sleight covine adradde death wonning full faire upon heath grene tree shadowed place couth better lord purchace full riche stored priuely lord could well please subtiliy yeue lene owne good thank yet coate hood youth learned good mystere whele wright carpentere reue satte upon right god stot pomell gray height scot long surcote perce upon hade side bare rustie blade norfolke reue tell biside toune men clepen baldeswell tucked frere euer rode hinderest route pthe sompnour sompnour u place fire red cherubins face saufleme iyen narow hot lecherous sparow scaled brow blacke pilled berde visage child fore afferde na quicksilver litarge ne brimstone borage ceruse ne oile tartar none ne ointment would cleanse bite might helpe whelk white ne knobbes sitting chekes well loued garlike onion lekes drink strong wine red blood would speak cry wood well idronke wine would speake word latine term coud two three learned degree wonder heard daie ye knowen well eke iaie clepe watte well pope couth thing grope spent philosophie questio quid juris would crie gentill harlot kind better fellow man find would suffer quart wine good fellow concubine twelue month excuse full full priuely eke finch couth pull found good fellawe would teachen none awe soch case arch deacon course man soul pourse pourse ipunished pourse arch deacon hell said well wote lieth right dede cursing ought eke sinfull man drede cursing woll slea asoiling saveth also ware significav daunger gise young girl diocise knew counsaile red garlond set upon hed great alestake buckler maked cake pthe pardoner rode gentle pardonere rouncevall friend compere strait come fro court rome full loud song come hider love sone sompnour bare stiff burdoun never trompe half great soun pardoner heer yellow wax somth hing doth stricke flax unces hing locke therewith shoulder oversprad full thinne laie culpons one one hode iolite ne weared none trussed wallet thought rode new set dishe vild save cappe rode bare soch glaring iyen hare vernacle sowed upon cappe wallet beforne lappe bret full pardon come rome al hote voice small hath gote berde ne never smoth new shave trow gelding mare craft fro barwike unto ware ne soch another pardonere male pillowhere said lady vaile said gobbet saile sanct peter went vpon sea till iesu christ hent cross latine full stone glass pigges bone relikes fond poore parsone dwelling uplond vpon day gat money parsone gat month twey thus fained flattering jape made parsone people ape truly tellen last church noble ecclesiast well couth read lesson storie alder best sang offitorie full well wist song song must preach well afile tong winne silver full well coud therefore song merily loud told sothly clause state araie eche number cause assembled companie southwerk gentell hostelrie hight tabard fast bell time tell baren u like night hostelrie alight woll tell voiage remnaunt pilgrimage first pray courtesie ye ne arrete follie though plainly speak matter tellen word eke chere ne though speak word properly ye knowen well shall tellen tale man mote rehearse nie ever everich word bee charge speak never rudely ne large else mote tellen tale untrue fein thing find word new may spare altho brother mote well say word another christ spake full brode holy writ well wotte villany eke plato saith rede word mote cosin dede also pray forgive set folk degree tale shoulden stand wit short ye may well understand great cheer made hoste u verichone supper set u anone served u vitaile best strong wine well drink u lest seemly man host marshal lord hall large man iyen stepe fairer burgeis none chepe bold speech wise well itaught manhood lacked right nought eke thereto right merry man supper plaien began speak n th among thing made reckoning said thus lordings truly ye welcome right heartily trouth lie saw year merry company atones borough fain wold mirth wist mirth right bethought ease shall cost nought ye gon canterbury god mote spede blissful martyr quite mede well wot ye gone way ye shapen talken play truly comfort ne mirth none riden way dumb stone therefore wold maken disport said erst done comfort liketh one assent stonden iudgment worchen shall say morrow riden way father soul deed ye merry give heed hold hand withouten speech counsail long sech v thouyt worth make nice graunted without avise bad say verdit lest lordings qd herkeneth best take nat pray disdain point speak plat plain ech shorten others way viage shall tellen tale tway canterbury ward mean homewards shall tell tale two venture whilom han befall hereth best sain tellen case tale best sentence solace shall supper alder cost place sitting post comen ayen canterbury make merry selven goodly ride right mine cost guide woll judgment say shall pay spend way yef ye vouchsafe tell anone without word mo woll erly shape therefore thing granted oath swore glad hert praiden also would vouchsafe would ben governour tale judge reportour set supper certain prise wollen ben demed devise hie low thus one assent ben accorded judgment thereupon wine fette anone dronken rest went ilke one withouten lenger tarying morrow day gan spring vp rose host alder cocke gadird u togedirs flocke forth riden little paas vnto watering saint thomas host began horse arest said lord herkeneth lest ye wote forward record eve song morrow song accord let see shall tell first tale ever mote drink wine ale rebel iudgment shall pay way spent draweth cut ye farther twin hath shortest shall begin sir knight qd maister lord draweth cut mine accord commeth nere qd lady prioress ye sir clerk let shamefastness ne studieth nought lay hand every man anone draw every wight began shortly tellen aventure chaunce caas sothe cut fill knight blith glad every wight tell must tale reason forward composition ye han heard nee deth word mo good man saw wise obedient keepen forward free assent said sithen shall begin game welcome cut goddesname let u ride herkeneth say word riden forth way began right merry chere tale anone right ye shall hear pthus endeth prologue canterbury tale knight tale palamon arcite pair friend fellowprisoners fight combat duke theseus lady emely sister queen ipolita wife theseus tale fitting person knight discourseth deed arm love lady whilome old story tellen u duke hight theseus athens lord governour time conquerour greater none son full many rich country wisdom chivalry conquered reigne feminy whilome ycleaped cithea wedded queene ipolita brought home country mikell glory solemnity eke young sister emely thus victory melody let worthy duke athens ride hoast armes beside certes nere long would told fully mannere wonnen reign feminy theseus chivalry great battaile none betweene athens amasones besieged ipolita young hardy queene cithea feast wedding tempest home coming thing mote forbear god wot large field ear weked ben ox plow remnant tale long ynow letten eke none rout let every fellow tell tale let see shall supper win left begin duke make mencioun come almost toun wele pride ware cast eye aside knee led hight wey company lady twey twey clad cloth black cry wo make world ni creature living ever heard waimenting cry nold never stenten till reines bridle henten folke ye mine home coming perturben feast cry quod theseus ye great envy mine honour thus complain cry hath misbode offended telleth may amended ye clothed thus black oldest lady spake sowned deadly chere ruth see said lord fortune hath yeve victory conquerour live nought greeveth u glory honour beseeke mercy succour mercy wo distress drop pity thy gentilness vpon u wretched woman let thou fall certes lord ni none u ne hath duchess queen caitives well iseen thanked fortune false wheel none estate assureth wele certes lord abide presence temple goddess clemence waiting fourtenight helpe u lord sith lieth thy might wretch weep wailen thus whylome wife king campaneus starfe thebe cursed day aray maken lamentacioun losten husband toun siege say yet old creon welaway lord thebe city fulfilled ire iniquity despight tyranny done dead body villany lord ben slaw hath body heap raw suffer hem none assent neither buried ne brent maketh hound eat hem despite word without repite fallen grofly crien pitously u wretched woman mercy let sorrow sinke thine hert gentle duke horse stert hert pitous heard hem speak thought hert would break saw hem pitous mate whylome great astate armes hem hent hem comforted full good intent swore oath true knight would done fer forthly might vpon tyrant creon hem wreake people greece speake creon theseus yserved hath death full well deserved right anon withouten abode banner displayed forth rode thebe ward hoost beside neere athens nold go ne ride ne take ease fully half day onward way night lay sent anon ipolita quene emely young sister shene vnto toune athens dwell forth rideth ni tell red statue mar spear targe shineth white banner large field glyttren doun banner borne penon gold full rich ybete minotaure crete thus rideth duke conquerour hoast chivalry flour till came thebe alight fair field thought fight shortly speaken thing creon thebe king fought slew manly knight plain battaile put folk flight saut wan city rent adowne wall spar rafter lady restord body husband slain done obsequies tho gise long devise great clamour weimenting lady made brenning body great honour theseus noble conquerour doth lady went shortly tellen mine intent worthy duke theseus hath creon slaine wan thebe thus still field took night rest country lest ransacke taas body deed hem strip harneis weed pillours business cure battaile discomfiture befell taas found though girt many grievous wound two young knight lying armes fame wrought full richely two arcite hight one hight palamon fully quick ne fully dead coat armour gere heraulds knew hem best special tho blood rial thebe sistren two yborn taas pillours hath hem torn han hem caried soft tent theseus full soon hem sent athens dwellen prison perpetuall nold hem raunson worthy duke thus idone tooke hoast home goth anone iawrel crowned conquerour liveth joy honour tearm life needeth word mo toure anguish wo dwelleth palamon fellow arcite evermore may gold hem quite thus passeth yere yere day day till fell morrow may emely fairer seen lilly upon stalke green fresher may floures new rose colour strofe hew fairer two er day wont arisen ready dight may woll slogardy night season pricketh every gentell hert maketh sleep stert saith arise may observaunce maketh emely remembrance done honour may rise iclothed fresh devise yellow haire broided tresse behind backe yard long gesse gardyn sunne uprist walketh downe list gathereth floures party white reed make subtell garland heed angel heavenly song great toure thick strong castell chefe dungeon wherein two knight prison told tellen shall even joynant gardyn wall emely playing bright sonne clere morning palamon woful prisoner wont leave gayler risen romed chambre high noble cite sigh eke gardyn full braunches grene fresh emely shene walk romed sorrowful prisoner palamon goth chambre roming fro complaining wo borne full oft said ala befell auenture caas window thick many bar yron great square spar cast eyen upon emilia therewith blent cried ha ha though stongen unto hert cry arcite anon stert said cosin mine eyleth thee art pale deadly see cryest thou hath thee offence goddes love take pacience prison may none fortune hath yeven u adversite wicked aspect disposition saturne constellation hath yeven u altho sworn stood heauen born mote endure short plain palamon answered said cosyn forsoth opinion thou hast vain imaginacion prison caused cry hurt right mine eye mine herte woll bane fairness lady se yond gardyn roming fro cause cry wo wher woman goddess venus sothly guess therewithall knee fyll said venus thy gardyn thus transfigure beforne sorrowful wretched creature prison help may scape destiny ishape eterne word dyen prison linage compassion low ybrought tyranny word arcite gan espy whereas lady romed fro sight beauty hurt palamon wounded sore arcite hurt much sigh said pitously fresh beauty sleeth sodenly rometh yonder place mercy grace may seen least way nam dead ny say palamon whan word herd dispitously looked answerd whether sayst thou ernest play nay quod arcite ernest fay god help list full yll pley palamon gan knit browes twey quod thee great honour false ne traytour thy cosyn thy brother isworne full depe u never dien pain till death depart shall u twain neither u love hindre ne none case leve brother thou shouldest truly every case thee thine oth mine also certain wot well thou darst withsain thus art thou counsell dout thou woldest falsly ben love lady love serve ever shall till mine hert sterve certes false arcite thou shalt loved first told thee wo counsell brother sworne told beforne thou art thounden knight helpen lye thy might else art thou false dare well sain arcite full proudly spake thou shalt quod rather false thou art false tell thee utterly paramour loved first thou wilt thou sain thou wist whether woman goddess thine affection holiness mine love creature told thee mine aventure cosin brother sworne suppose thou lovedst beforne wost thou well old clerk saw shall give lover law love greater law pan may yeven earthly man therefore positive law decree broken day love eche degree man mote need love maugre head may fleen tho shuld dead maid widow else wife eke likely thy life stonden grace shall well thou wost thy selfe verely thou damned prison perpetual u gaineth raunson striven hound bone fought day yet part none ther came cur wer wroth bare away bone hem therefore king court brother man none love thou list love aye shall soothly lefe brother prison mote endure everich u taken aventure great strife long betwixt hem twey leisure sey theffect happed day tell shortly may worthy duke hight perithous fellow duke theseus sith thilke day child lite come athens fellow visite play wont world loved man loved tenderly well loved old book saine one dead soothly tell fellow went sought hell storie list write duke perithous loved well arcite know thebe yere yere finally request prayere perithous withouten raunson duke theseus let prison freely gone whether list guise tellen shall forward plainly endite betwixt duke theseus arcite arcite yfound ever life day night stound countrey duke theseus caught accorded thus sword lese heed remedy ne reed taketh leave homeward sped let beware neck lieth wed great sorw suffereth arcite death feeleth hert smite weepeth waileth crieth pitously sleen waiteth prively said ala day borne prison worse beforne shap eternally dwell nought purgatorie hell ala ever knew perithous else dwelt theseus fettered prison evermo bliss wo sight set though never grace may deserve would sufficed right ynough deare cousin palamon quod thine victorie aventure full blissul prison maiest thou endure prison nay certes paradice well hath fortune thee turned dice hast sight thabsence possible sithens thou hast presence art knight worthy man able case since fortune changeable thou maiest sometime thy desire attain exiled barraine grace great despair ni water earth fire ne aire ne creature hem maked may heale done comfort well ought sterve wanhope distresse farewell life lust gladnesse ala playnen men commune purueyance god fortune yeueth hem full oft many gise well better hemselfe devise man desireth haue richesse cause murdre sicknesse soure man wold prison faine house meyne slaine infinite harmes bene mattere wote thing prayen faren dronke mouse dronken man wot well hath house wot right way thider dronken man way slider certes world faren seken fast felicite go wrong full oft truly thus may say namely wenden great opinion might scape fro prison oy perfite hele exiled fro wele sith may seene emely nam dead ny remedy pvpon side palamon whan wist arcite gon sorrow maketh great tour resowned yelling clamour pure fetter shinnes grete bitter salt teares wete ala quoth arcite cosyn mine strife god wot frute thine thou walkest thebe large wo thou yeuest little charge thou maist sith thou hast wisdom manhed assemble folke kindred make warre sharpe countre auenture treate thou maiest haue lady wife must nedes lese life way possibilite sith thou art thy large prison fre art lord great thine advantage mine sterve cage may wepe wayle while liue wo prison may yeue eke paine loue yeueth also doubleth tourment wo therewith fire jelousie vp stert within brest hent hert woodly likely behold boxe tree ashen deed cold said cruell goddes governe world word eterne written table athamant parliament eterne graunt mankind unto yhold shepe rouketh fold slain man right another beest dwelleth eke prison arrest hath sicknesse great adversite oft time giltlesse parde governance prescience giltlesse turmenteth innocence encreaseth thus penance man bounden obseruaunce god sake leten beest may lust fulfill whan beest dead hath pain death man mote wepe plain though world haue care wo without dout may stonden answere lete diuines well wote world great pine ala see serpent thefe many true man hath mischiefe gon large list may turn mote ben prison saturn eke iuno jalous eke wood hath stroied well nye blood thehes wast walles wide venus sleeth side ielousie feare arcite stint palamon alite let prison still dwell arcite forth woll tell sommer passeth night long encreaseth double wise paine strong lover prisoner hath wofuller mister shortly say palamon perpetuel damned prison chaines fetter deed arcite exiled heed euermore countre ne neuermore shall lady se louers aske question hath worse arcite palamon one may se lady day day prison mote dwell asway list may ride go sene lady shall neuer mo deemeth ye list ye woll tell forth tale began pwhan arcite thebe comen ful oft day swelt said ala sene lady shall neuer mo shortly conclude wo mikell sorrow made neuer creature shal world may dure slepe meat drinke byraft leane waxeth drie shaft eyen hollow grisly behold hew pale fallow ashen cold solitary ever alone wailing night making mone heard song instrument would wepe might stent feble spirit low changed man coud know speech ne voice though men herd gyre world ferd nought comly like louers malady eros rather like manie engendred humour melancolike beforne fell fantastike shortly turned vp doun habit disposicioun wofull louer arcite day wo endite whan endured yere two cruell torment paine wo thebe countre said vpon night slepe laid thought winged mercury beforne stood aud bad mery slepy yerd hand bare vpright hat weered vpon hair bright irayed god toke kepe argus tooke slepe said thus athens shali thou wend shapen thy woe end word arcite awoke stert truly sore ever smert quod athens right wol fare ne drede death shall spare see ladie loue serve presence recke sterve word caught gret mirrour saw chaunged colour saw visage another kind right anon ran mind sith face disfigured malady indured might well bare low live athens evermore unknow sene ladie welnigh day day right anon chaunged aray clad poore labourer alone saue squier knew privitie caas disguised poorly athens gone next way court went vpon day gate profered service drugge draw men would deuise shortly matter saine fell office chamberlaine dwelling emelie wise soone couth espie euery seruaunt serued well couth hewen wood water bere yong mightie none thereto strong big bone done wight gan deuise yere two service page chamber emelie bright philostrate said hight halfe wel beloued man ne none court degre gentill conditioun court renown said charitie theseus would enhauneen degre put worshipfull seruice might vertue exercise thus within name sprong deed good tong theseus hath taken nere chamber made squier yaue gold maintaine degre eke men brought countre fro yere yere full prively rent honestly slyly spent man wonderd three yere wise life lad bare peace eke wer na man theseus durst der blisse let arcite speake woll palamon alite darkenesse horrible strong prison seven yere hath sitten palamon forpined woe distresse feeleth double sore heuinesse palamon loue distraineth wood wit goeth wo eke thereto prisonere perpetuell onely yere coud rime english properly martirdome forsooth therefore passe lightly may befell seuenth yere may third night old bookes u saine storie tellen plaine aduenture destine thing shapen shal soone midnight palamon helping friend brake prison fleeth citie fast may go yeuen gailer drinke clarrie made certaine wine narcotise opie thebe fine night though men would shake gailer slept nught awake thus fleeth fast may night short fast day need cost mote himselfe hide grove fast beside dreadfull foot stalketh palamon shortly opinion grove would hide day night would take way thebe ward friend prie theseus help warrie shortly either would lese life win emelie unto wife effect intent plaine turne arcite againe little wist nie care til fortune brought snare merrie larke messenger day saleweth song morrow gray fierie phebus riseth bright orisont laugheth sight stremes drieth greues siluer drop hanging leues arcite court riall theseus squire principall risen looketh merrie day doen obseruaunces may remembring point desire courser startling fire riden fieldes pley court mile twey groue told aduenture way gan hold maken garlond greves woodbind hauthorn leves loud song ayenst sonne shene may thy floures thy grene welcome thou said faire fresh may hope greene thing get may courser lusty hert groue full hastily stert path romed vp doun aduenture palamon bush man might se sore afraied death nothing ne knew arcite god wot would trowed full lite sooth said gone sithen many yeres field hath iyen wood hath eres full fair man bear euin day men mete vnset steuin full little wote arcite felaw nigh hearken saw bush sitteth full still arcite romed fill songen roundell lustily studie fell sodenly doen louers queint gires crop doun brires vp doune boket well right friday soothly tell raineth shineth fast right gan gerie venus ouercast heart folke right day gerifull right chaungeth aray selde friday weeke ilike arcite song gan like set doune withouten ala qd day bore long iuno thy crueltee wilt thou warren thebe citee ala ybrought confusion bloodriall cadmus amphion cadmus say first man thebe built first toune began citie first crowned king linage spring line stocke riall caitife thrall mortall enemie mought serue squire poorely yet doeth iuno well shame dare know mine owne name wont hight arcite hight philostrat worth mite ala thou fell mar ala thou iuno thus hath ire linage fordo save onely wretched palamon theseus martireth prison ouer slean vtterly loue hath fierie dart brenningly sticked thorough true carefull hert shapen death erst shert ye slean eyen emelie ye cause wherefore die remnaunt mine care ne set mountaunce tare coud ought pleasaunce word fell doun traunce long time afterward vp stert palamon thought thro hert felt cold sword sodenly glide ire quoke lenger would bide heard arcites tale wood face dead pale stert vp bush thicke said arcite thou false traitour wicke art thou hent lovest ladie pain wo art blood counsell sworn full oft told thee beforn hast beyaped duke theseus falsely hast chaunged thy name thus dedde el thou shalt die thou shalt loue ladie emelie loue mo palamon thy mortall fo though weapon place prison astert grace dred nat either thou shalt die thou ne shalt nat louen emelie thou wilt thou shalt affert arcite full dispitous hert hym knew tale heard fers lion pulled swerd saied god sitteth aboue ne wer thou art sick wood love eke thou weapen hast place thou shouldest never grove pace thou ne shouldest dien mine hond defie suertie bond thou saist made thee fool think well love free love maugre thy might forasmoche thou art knight wilnest daren battaile truth morow fail without witting wight founden knight bringen harneis right inough thee chese best leave worst meat drinke night bring ynough thee clothes thy bedding thou ladie win slea wodde thou maiest well haue thy ladie palamon answered grant thee thus departed till morow ech hem laid faith borow cupide charitee oreigne wouldest haue felow thee full soth saied loue ne lordship woll nat thankes haue fellowship find arcite palamon arcite ridden anon toun morow day light full priuely two harneis dight sufficient mete darreigne battail field betwixt hem tweine horse alone borne carrieth harneis beforne groue time place iset arcite palamon met changen gan colour face right hunter reigne trace standeth gappe speare hunted lion beare hereth rushing leues breaketh bough greues thinketh cometh mortal enemy without faile must dedde either mote slea gap mote slea mishap ferden chaunging hew farre euerich knew na good day ne saluing streight without word rehearsing eueriche hem helped arme friendly owne brother sharp speares strong foinen ech wonder long thou mightest wenen palamon fighting wood lion cruell tigre arcite wild bore gan fight smite frothen white ixe wood vp ancle foughten blood wise let hem fighting dwell forth woll theseus tell destinie minister generall executeth world ouer purveiance god hath said beforne strong though world sworne contrary thing ye nay yet sometime shall fall day fell never yet thousand yere certainly appetite warre peace hate loue ruled sight aboue meane mightie theseus hunt desirous namely great hart may bed daweth day ni clad ready ride hunt horne hound beside hunting hath soch delite ioy appetite himselfe great hart bane mar serueth diane clere day haue told theseus ioy bliss ipolita faire quene emelie iclothed greene hunting ridden rially groue stood fast ther hart men told duke theseus streight way hath hold land rideth full right thither hart wont haue flight ouer brook forth wey duke woll haue course twey hound soch list commaund duke comeninto laund vnder sonne looked anon warre arcite palamon foughten breme bulles two bright sword wenten fro hidiously lest stroke semed would fellen oke nothing ne wote duke spors courser smote start betwixt hem two pulled sword cried ho paine lesing head mightie mar shall anone dead smiteth stroke may seen telleth mister men ye hardie fighten without iudge officere though listes rially palamon answered hastily said sir nedeth word mo haue death deserued two two wofull wretch caitiues encombred liues thou art rightfull lord iudge ne yeue v neither mercie ne refuge slea first saint charite slea fellow well slea first though thou know lite thy mortal foe arcite fro thy sand banished head hath deserved dead came unto thy yate saied hight philostrate thus hath iaped full many yere thou hast made thy chief squiere loveth emelie sith day come shall die make plainly confession thilke wofull palamon hath thy prison broke wickedly thy mortall foe loueth hot emelie bright woll die present sight wherefore aske death iewise slea fellow wise haue deserved slaine worthy duke answered anon againe saied short conclusion owne mouth owne confession hath damned woll record needeth pine cord ye shall dead mighty mar redde queene anon womanhedde gan weepe emelie lady companie great pitie thought hem euer chaunce befall gentleman great estate nothing loue debate saw bloudie wound wide sore criden lesse mercie lord upon v woman bare knee adoune fall wold haue kist foot stood till last assaked mood pitie renneth soone gentle hert though first ire quoke stert hath considered shortly clause trespass hem eke cause although ire gilt accused yet reason hem excused thus thought well euery man woll helpe himselfe loue eke deliue himselfe prison eke heart compassion woman weepen euer one gentle heart thought anone foft vnto himselfe saied fie vpon lord woll haue mercie lion word deed hem repentaunce dreed well proud dispitous man maintaine first began lord hath little discretion case diffinition weigheth pride humblenesse one shortly ire thus agone gan looken vp eyen light spake place word hight god loue ah benedicite mightie great lord againe might gaineth obstacle may cleaped god miracle maken owne gise everich hart list deuise lo arcite palamon quietly prison gon might haue liued thebe riasly knowne mortall enemie death power also yet hath loue maugre eyen two brought hem hither die looketh great follie may foole loue behold god sake sitteth aboue see bleed well araied thus hath lord god loue hem paied wage fee seruice yet wenen full wise serue loue ought may befall yet best game haue iollite con hem therefore much thanke wot hote fare god wot cuckow hare mote assaied hot cold man mote foole yong old wot selfe full yore agone time seruant one therefore sith know loues paine wot sore man distraine oft hath caught iaa foryeue wholly trespaas request queen kneeleth eke emely sister dere ye shall anon vnto swere ye shall neuer country dere ne make warre vpon night ne day friend ye may foryeue trespass every dele sware asking fair wele lordship mercie praid hem graunted grace thus said speake worthie linage richesse though queen princesse ilke worthie doubtlesse wed time nethelesse speake sister emelie ye haue strife ielousie ye wot selfe may wed two one though ye fighten euermo one loth lefe mot goe pipe yuie leafe say may haue ye neuer iealous ne wroth therefore put degre shall haue destine shape hearken wise lo end shall deuise plat conclusion without replication liketh take best euerich shall goe lest freely without ransome daungere day fiftie weekes ferre ne nere euerich shall bring c knight armed list upon right alredy darrein battaile behote withouten faile vpon truth true knight whether hath might say whether thou may hundred spake slea contrary list driue shall yeue emely wiue fortune yeueth fair grace list shall make place god wisely soule rew shall euen iudge trew ye shall none end make one shall dedde take ye thinken well isaid saith aduise hold well apaid end conclusion looketh lightly palamon springeth ioy arcite could tell could rightly endite great ioy made place theseus done fair grace doun knee went euery maner wight thanked hert might namely thebanes full many sith thus good hope hert blith taken leue homward gan ride thebe ward old wals wide trow men would deme negligence foryetten tell dispence thebe goeth busely maken vp list rially noble theatre dare well say world na circuit whereof mile walled stone diched round shape manner compas full degree hight sixtie paas man set one degree letted fellow see eastward stood gate marble white westward right another thopposite shortly conclude place none yearth little space lond na craft man geometrie arithmetike ne purtreiture ne caruer image theseus ne gaue meat wage theatre make deuise rite sacrifice eastward hath upon yate aboue worship venus goddesse loue doe make auter oratorie west side memorie mar maked another cost gold largely fother northward turret wall alabaster white red corall oratorie riche se worship diane goddes chastite hath theseus doe wrought noble wise yet foryetten deuise noble caruings purtreitures shape countenaunce figure oratory three first temple venus thou maiest see wrought wall full pitously behold broken sleepes sigh cold salt teares weimenting fire stroke desiring loues seruants life enduren othes couenants assuren pleasaunce hope desire foolehardinesse beautie youth braudrie richesse charmes sorcerie leasing flatterie dispence businesse ielousie weared yellow gold garland cuckow sitting hand feast instrument carol daunces iusts array circumstaunces loue reken reken shall order painted wall mo make mencion sothly mount citheron venus hath principall dwelling shewed wall purtreing ioy lustinesse nought foryetten portresse idlenesse ne narcissus faire yore agon ne yet follie king salomon ne yet great strength hercules thenchauntment medea circe ne turnus hardie corage rich cresus caitife seruage thus may seen wisdome ne richesse beautie ne slight strength ne hardinesse ne may venus hold champartie list world may gie lo folke cought laas till wo full oft said ala sufficeth one example two though coud reken thousand mo statue venus glorious see maked fleeting large see fro nauell doune couered waues grene bright glas citriole right hand shee hedde full semely see rose garland fresh well smelling aboue hedde doues flittering stood sonne cupido vpon shoulder wing two blind oft sene bow arrowes bright kene well tellen purgatory thereabout ouer within temple mightie mar rede painted wall length brede like estris grisly place hight great temple mar thrace thilke cold frostie region mar hath soueraine mancion first wall painted forrest wonneth nother man ne beast knottie knarie barrein tree old stub sharpe hidious behold romble swough though storme break euery bough downward hill vnder bent stood temple mar armipotent wrought burned stele thentre long streight gastly see thereout came rage vise made gate rise northern light dores shone window wall none throgh men might light discerne dores athamant eterne lenched ouerthwart head long yron tough maken strong every piller temple susteine tonne great yron bright shene saw first dark imagining fellonie eke compassing cruell ire red glede pickpurse also eke pale drede smiler knife cloke shepen brenning blacke smoke treason murdring bed open war wound bled conteke bloody kniues sharp manace full chirking sorrie place sleer himselfe yet saw heart blood hath bathed naile ydriuen shode hight cold death mouth gaping vpright amids temple sate mischaunce discomfort sorrie countenaunce yet saw woodnesse laughing rage armed complaint theft fierce courage carraine bush throte ycorue thousand slaine qualme istorue tirant prey force iraft toune destroied nothing ilaft yet saw brent ship hoppesteres hunter istrangled wild beres sow fretting child cradle cooke iscalded long ladle nought foryeten infortune mart carter ouerridden owne cart vnder wheele full low lay adoun also mart devision barbour botcher smith forgeth sharpe sword stith aboue depainted tour saw conquest sitting great honour sharpe sword right ouer head hanging subtill twined thread depainted slaughter iulius great nero antonius thilke time unborne yet death depainted beforne manacing mar right figure shewed portreiture depainted starres aboue shall dead el slaine loue sufficeth one ensample story old may reken though would statue mar vpon cart stood armed looked grim wood ouer head shinen two figure starres cleaped scripture one puella hight rubeus god armes araied thus wolfe stood beforne fete eyen red man ete subtill pensill painted storie redouting mar glorie temple diane chast shortly woll hast tell discriptioun depainted wals vp doun hunting shamefast chastite saw wofull calistope diane greeued turned fro woman bere afterward made loadsterre thus painted say ferre sonne eke starre men may see saw dane turned vnto tree meane goddesse diane venus daughter hight dane saw acteon hert ymaked vengeance saw diane naked saw hound haue cought freten knew nought yet painted little furthermore athalant hunted wild bore mellager many mo diane wrought care wo saw many another wonder storie list draw memorie goddesse full well vpon hart sete small hound abouten fete vnderneath foot moone wexing yet wane soone gaudie greene statue clothed bow hand arrowes caas iyen aye cast full low adoun pluto hath darke regioun woman trauelling child long vnbore full pitously lucina gan call said helpe thou maiest best well coud paint liuely wrought many florein hewes bought list made theseus great cost hath arayed thus temple theatre eueridele done liked wonder wele stint woll theseus alite speake palamon arcite day approcheth returning euerich c knight bring battaile darreine told athens couenants hold hath euerich hem brought c knight well armed warre right sikerly trowed many man never sithens world began speak knighthood hond farre god hath made sea lond na noble company every wight loued chiualry would thankes haue passing name hath praied might game well thereto chosen fell morrow caas ye know well euery lusty knight loueth paramour hath might england elsewhere would full faine willen fight lady ah benedicite lustie sight men se right farden palamon went knight many would armed habergeon brest plate light gippion would paire plate large wold haue pruce sheld som arge would armed leg wele haue axe mace stele na none new gise na old armed haue told euerich opinion pther maist thou se comming palamon ligurge himselfe great king trace blacke berd manly face sercles iyen hed glouden betwixt yellow red like lion looked kemped haires browes stout lims great brawnes hard strong shoulder brode armes round long guise countre full high upon chaire gold stood foure great white buls trasys instead coat armour ouer harnays nailes yellow bright gold hath beares skin cole blacke old long haire kempt behind backe raven feather shone blacke wreath gold arme great huge weight vpon head set full stone bright fine ruby clere diamands chaire went white allaunds twenty mo grete stere hunten lion wild bere followed mosell fast ybound collers gold torrettes filed round hundred lordes rout armed full well heart sterne stout arcite story men find great emetrius king inde vpon steed bay trapped stele covered cloth gold diapred wele came riding like god armes marce coat armure cloth trace well couched perle white round gret saddle brent gold new ybet mantle upon shoulder hanging brette full ruby red fire sparkling crispe haire like ring yron yellow glittering son nose high eyen bright cytryn lip ruddie colour sanguyn freckle face yspreint betwixt yellow somdele blacke ymeint lion eyen kest fiue twenty yere age gest beard well begun spring voice trumpet sowning vpon head weared laurer greene garland fresh lustie seene vpon hand bare delite eagle tame lilly white hundred lord armed saue head gere full richely manner thing trusteth well earles duke king gathered noble company loue encrease chiualry king ran euery part full many rame lion libart wise lord sunday citie come prime toune light duke worthy knight brought hem citee inned hem euerich degree feasted hem doth great labour easen hem done hem honour yet men wenen man wit none estate coud ne amend minstralcie seruice feast great yefts also least rich array throughout theseus paleis ne sat first ne last vpon deys lady fairest best dauncing hem best daunce sing ne feelingly speaketh loue ne haukes sitten perchen aboue ne hound liggen flour doun make mentioun effect thinketh best cometh point harkeneth list sunday night day gan spring palamon larke herd sing although day hour two yet song larke palamon right tho holy heart high corage rose vp wenden pilgrimage vnto blisfull cithera benigne mean venus honourable digne houre walketh foorth apaas vnto list temple doun kneleth humble chere hert full sore said ye shall pfairest faire lady mine venus doughter ioue spouse vulcanus thou glader mount citheron thilke loue thou haddest adon haue pity bitter teares smart take humble prayer thine heart ala ne haue language tell effect ne torment mine hell mine heart may mine harmes bewray confuse cannot say mercy lady bright wost wele thought seest harm fele consider rue vpon sore wisly shall euermore enforce might thy true seruant hold warre alway chastite make mine auow ye helpe keepe armes still yelpe ne aske morrow haue victory ne renounce case ne vaine glory prise armes blowen vp doun would haue full possessioun emely die service find thou maner wise retch may better haue victory hem haue lady mine armes though mar god armes vertue great heauen aboue list shall well haue loue thy temple shall worship euer mo thine aulter ride go woll done sacrifice fire bete woll lady swete pray morrow spear arcite doe heart beare reke haue lost life though arcite win wife effect end prayere yeue lady thou blisfull lady dere orison done palamon sacrifice anon full pitously circumstaunces tell obseruaunces last statue venus shoke made signe whereby toke prayer accepted day though signe shewed delay yet wist well graunted bone glad hart went home full sone third houre equall palamon began venus temple gon vp rose sunne vp rose emelie unto temple diane gan hie maiden thider lad full readily hem fire incense clothes remnant sacrifice longen shall horne full meeth gise lacked nought done sacrifise smoking temple full clothes faire emely heart debonaire body wisshe water well right dare tell thing generall yet game hear meaneth wel charge good man large bright haire vnkempt vntressed crown greene oke vnseriall vpon head set full faire mete two fire aulter gan bete thing men may behold stace thebe bookes old kindled fire pitous chere vnto diane spake ye may chast goddesse wood greene heauen earth see sene queen reigne pluto dark low goddess maiden hart hath know full many yeare wost desire keepe fro vengeance thine ire acteon abought cruelly chast goddesse well wost thou desire maid life ne neuer woll loue ne wife thou wost well thy company maid loue hunting venery walken wood wild wife child nought know company man helpe lady sith may three formes thou hast thee palamon hath loue eke arcite loueth sore grace pray thee withouten send loue peace betwixt hem two fro turn away heart hote loue desire busie torment fire queint turned another place thou wolt grace destiny shapen shall need one hem two send desireth behold goddesse cleane chastite bitter tear cheekes fall since thou art maid keeper v maidenhed thou keep well conserue liue maiden woll thee serue fire bren vpon aulter clere emely thus prayere sodeinly saw thing queint right anon one fire queint quicked againe anon fire queint agon queint made whistling done wet bronds brenning bronds end outran anone bloudy drop many one sore agast emely well nie mad gan cry ne wist signified onely feare thus cried wept pity heare therewithall diane gan appeare hond right hunteresse said doughter stint thine heavinesse among god high affirmed eterne word written confirmed thou shalt wedded one tho thee much care wo vnto hem may tell farwell may longer dwell fire mine aulter bren shall declaren ere thou gon hen auenture loue case word arrow case goddesse clatteren fast ring forth went made vanishing emely astonied said amounteth ala put vnder thy protection diane vnder thy disposition home goth anon next way effect say next houre mar following arcite vnto temple walked fierce mar done sacrifise might paymem wise pitous heart high deuotion right thus mar said orison strong god reignes cold trace honoured art lord yhold hast euery reigne euery lond armes bridle thine hond hem fortunest thee list deuise accept pitous sacrifise thought may deserue might worthy serue thy godhead may one thine pray thee thou rue pine thilke sore paine thilke hot fire thou brentest whylom desire thou vsedst faire beaute faire young venus fresh fre haddest thine armes thy although thou one time misfull vulcanus caught thee laas found thee ligging wife ala thilke sorrow thine hart ruth well paine smart young uncunning thou wost trow love offended ever life creature doth wo endure ne retcheth neuer sinke flete well wot mercy hete mote strength place well wot without help grace thee ne may strength auaile help lord morrow battaile thilke fire whilome brenned thee well fire brenneth mee morrow victory mine trauell thine glory thy soveraign temple woll honouren place alway labouren thy pleasaunce thy craft strong thy temple woll banner hong armes companie euermore untill day die eterne fire woll beforne thee find eke auow woll bind heard haire hongeth low adoun neuer yet felt offencioun rasour ne shere woll thee yeve thy true seuaunt liue lord ruth vpon sorrowes sore yeve victory aske thee praier stint arcite strong ring temple dore rong eke dores yclattren full fast arcite somewhat agast fire brennen upon auter bright gan temple light sweet smell anon ground yafe arcite anon hond hafe insence fire cast rite mo last statu mar began hautherke ring sound heard murmuring full low dim said thus victory yafe mar honor glory thus joy hope well fare arcite anon inne fare faine foule bright sun right anon strife begun thilke graunting heauen aboue betwixt venus goddess loue mar sterne god armipotent iupiter busie stent till pale saturnus cold knew many aventures old found experience art full soone hath pleased every part sooth said elde hath great auauntage sea wan mine prison darke coat mine strangling hanging throat murmure churles rebelling groning priuy enpoysoning vengeance plaine correction dwell signe lion mine ruine high hals falling toures wals vpon minor carpenter slew sampson shaking pillers mine also malady cold darke treason cast old looking father pestilence weep shall diligence palamon thine owne knight shall lady thou behight though mar shal help knight natheles betwixt mot sometime pee ye one complection couseth day deuision thine ayle ready thy weep woll thy lust fulfill woll stenten god aboue mar venus goddesse loue plainely woll tellen great effect began great feast athens day eke lusty season may made euery wight ben pleasaunce day iusten daunce spenden venus high seruise shoulden arise early see great strange sight vnto rest went quickly night morrow day gan spring horse harneis noise clattering hostelry pallace rode many rout lord upon great steed palfreis maiest thou see deuising harneis vncouth rich wrought wele goldsmithry braudry stele shield bright tester trapper gold hewen helm hauberk coat armers lord paraments courser knight retinue eke squiers nailing speares helmes bokeling gigging shield lamers battaile blowne bloudie souns pallace full people doun three ten holding questioun deuining theban knight two said thus said hold black berd som balled som thick herd said looked grim would fight hath sparth twenty pound weight thus hall full deuining long sunne gam spring great theseus sleepe gan wake minstralcie noise make held yet chamber pallace rich till theban knight ylich honoured place yfet duke theseus window set arayed right god trone people preased thyderward full sone seen done high reuerence eke heare hest sentence herauld scaffold made oo till noise people ydo saw people noise still thus shewed forth mighty duke lord hath high discretion considered destruction gentle blood fighten gise mortall battell emprise wherefore shapen shall die woll first purpose modifie man therefore paine losse life manner shot polax ne short knife list send thider bring ne short sword sticke point biting man ne draw ne heare side ne man shall fellow ride one course sharp grounden spere foin list foot shall mischiefe shall take slaine brought unto stake shal ben ordained either side thider shall force abide fall cheefetaine take either side el sleen make longer shall turnament last god speed goth layeth fast sword long ma fighten fill goth way lord voice people touched heuen loud cried mery steuen god saue lord good willeth destruction blood vp goth trompes melody list rideth company ordinance throughout cite large hanged cloth gold sarge full like lord noble duke gan ride two theban either side rode queene emely another company one degree thus pasten throughout citee list comen time na day yet fully prime set theseus full rich hie ipolita queene emelie lady degree vnto seat preaseth rout westward yates mart arcite eke hundred part banner red entred right anon selue moment entred palamon venus eastward place banner white hardy cheare face world seken doun euen without variatioun na company twey none wise coud sey auauntage worthinesse ne estate ne age euen chosen gesse renges faire hem dresse name red euerichone number gile none tho gate shut cried loud deuoir yong knight proud heraulds left pricking doun ringen trompes loud clarioun say east west goth sharpe speres sadly arrest goth sharpe spur side see men iust ride shiueren shaft upon sheilds thicke feeleth hert spoone pricke vp springeth speres twenty foot hight goth sword siluer bright helmes hew shred burst blood sterne stremes red mighty mace bone breke thro thickest throng gan threke stumblen steed strong doun gon rolled foot doth ball foineth foot tronchoun hurleth horse adoun body hurt sith ytake maugre head brought unto stake forward right must abide another lad side sometime doth hem theseus rest hem refresh drinke hem lest full oft day theban two together met done ech wo vnhorsed hath ech hem twey tigre vale colaphey whelpe stole lite cruell hunt arcite jealous hert upon palamon ne belmarie fell lion hunted hunger wood ne prey desireth blood palamon slee foe arcite iealous stroke helmes bite renneth blood side reed sometime end euery deed ere sunne unto rest went strong king emetrius gan hent palamon fought arcite made sword deepe flesh bite force twenty take vnyolden drawne slake rescous palamon strong king ligurge borne adoun king emetrius strength borne saddle sword length hurt palamon take naught brought stake hardy heart might helpen naught must abide caught force eke composition sorroweth wofull palamon mote gone againe fight theseus seen sight cried ho ne none shall lenger fellow gon woll true iudge party arcite thebe shall haue emely fortune hath faire ywon anon noise people begon ioy loud high withall seemed listes shoulden fall faire venus done aboue saith doth quene loue wepeth wanting till teares adowne list fell said ashamed doutles saturnus said fair daughter hold thy pee mar hath al wil kniyt hath boon mine dead thou shait eased soon trumpes loud minstralcie heraulds loud yell crie wele loue dan arcite hearkeneth stinteth noise alite miracle befell anon fierce arcite hath helme ydon courser shew face pricketh endlong large place looking vpward vpon emelie ayen cast friendly eye woman speak commune followen favour fortune chere hert ground fire infernall stert pluto sent request saturne horse feare gan turne leape aside foundred lepe ere arcite may taken kepe pight pomell head place lay dead breast brosten saddle bow blacke lay coale crow blood yroune face anon ybrought place hart full sore theseus paleis tho coruen harneis bed ybrought full faire bliue yet memory liue alway cry emely duke theseus company comen home athens cite blisse great solemnite albeit auenture fall would discomfort hem men said eke arcite die ben healed maladie another thing faine hem none islaine sore hurt namely one spere thirled brest bone two wound two broken arm salues charm sundry fermaces hearbes eke saue dronken would liues haue noble duke well comforteth honoureth euery man made great reuell long night vnto straunge lord right ne na hold discomforting iusts turneying soothly na discomfiture falling hold auenture ne force unto stake vnyolden twenty knight take one person withouten mo harted forth arme foot eke steed driuen forth staues footman yeoman knaues arretted villanie may man cleape cowardie anon duke theseus cry stinten rancour enuy gre well one side either side like others brother yaue hem gyfts degree helden feast fully date three conueyed knight worthily toune day iourney largely home went euery man right way na farwell haue good day battel woll endite speake palamon arcite swelleth breast arcite sore encreaseth heart still clottered blood lee chcraft corrumped bouke last neither veineblood ne vent ousing ne drinke hearbes may helping vertue expulsiue animall thilke vertue cleaped naturall ne may venim void ne expell pipe lung began swell euery lacerte breast adoun shent venim corruptioun gaineth neither get life vomit vpward ne downward laxatife brusten thilke region nature hath domination certainly ther nature woll wirch farwell physicke go beare corse chirch arcire must die sendeth emelie palamon cosyn deare said thus ye shall heare nought may wofull spirit hart declare point sorrow smart lady love bequeath service gost abouen creature since life may lenger dure ala wo ala paine strong haue suffered long ala death ala mine emely ala departing company ala mine heart queene ala liues wife mine heart ladie ender life world asken men haue loue cold graue alone withouten company farwell sweet foe mine emely soft doe take armes twey loue god hearkeneth say haue cousin palamon strife rancour many day agon loue iealousie iupiter wisely soule gie speaken seruant properly circumstance truly say trouth honor knighthede wisdome humblesse estate high kinrede freedome longeth art iupiter soule part world right know non worthy loued palamon serueth woll doen life shall euer wife foryet palamon gentleman word speech faile began foot vnto breast come cold death ouernome yet moreouer armes two vitall strength lost ago saue intellect without dwelleth heart sicke sore gan failen wher hart felt death dusked iyen two failed breath ladie yet cast iye last word mercy emelie spirit chaunged went whitherward cannot tell ne therfore stint diuinistre soules find registre ne list thilke opinion tell hem though writen dwel arcite cold mar soule gie woll speake forth emelie shright emelie houlen palamon theseus sister vp tooke anon swouning bare fro corse away helpeth tarrie forth day tellen wept euen morow case woman haue much sorow husband fro hem go part sorowen el fallen maladie last certainely die infinit sorow teares old folke folke tender yeares toune death theban weepeth child man great weeping certaine hector brought fresh yssaine troy ala pitie scratching cheekes renting eke woldest thou dead thus woman crie haddest gold inough emelie man ne may gladen theseus saving old father egeus knew world transmutatioun seene vp doun ioy wo wo gladnesse shewed ensamples likenesse right died neuer man qd ne liued yearth degree right liued neuer man saied world sometime ne deied world throughfare full wo pilgrimes passing fro death end euery world sore yet said much effect full wisely exhort people hem recomfort duke theseus busie cure casteth sepulture good arcite shall best ymaked bee eke honourable degree last tooke conclusion arcite palamon love battaile hem betweene selue groue sweet greene amorous desire complaint loue hote fire would make fire offis funerall mighten accomplis hath anon commaunded hack hew okes old lay hem rew culpons well araied brenne officer swift foot renne right anon commaundement theseus hath ysent large bere ouersprad cloth gold richest sute clothed arcite vpon hand gloues white eke head croune laurell grene hand sword full bright kene laied bare visaged bere therewith wept pitie people seene day brought hall roreth cry soun tho come wofull theban palamon glitering beard ruddie shining here clothes blacke dropped teres passing weeping emelie rufullest companie much seruice bee noble rich degree duke theseus let foorth steed bring trapped steele glittering couered armes dan arcite vpon steed great lilly white saten folk one bare shield another speare hand held third bare bow turkes brent gold case harnes ridden forth apace sorie chere toward groue ye shall noblest greek vpon shoulder caried bere slacke pace eyen red wete throughout citie maister strete sprad black wonder hie right street ywrie vpon right hand went egeus side duke theseus vessel hand gold full fine full hony milke blood wine eke palamon full great companie came wofull emelie fire hand time gise doen office funerall seruice hie labour full great apparelling seruice fire making green top heaven raught twenty fadome bred armes straught saine boughes broad straw first laid many load fire maken vp height eke name tree hight oke firre beech aspe elder elme popelere willow holme plane boxe chesten laurere maple thorne beech ewe hasell whipuitre feld shall told ne god runnen vp doun disherited habitatioun wonned rest pee nimphes faunies amadriades ne beast ne bird fledden feare tree fall ne ground agast light wont see sunne bright ne fire couched first stre drie stickes clouen thre greene wood spicerie cloth gold perrie garland hanging many flour mirrhe incense sweet odour ne arcite lay among ne richesse body ne emely guise put fire funerall service ne souned made fire ne spake ne desire ne iewels men fire cast fire great brent fast ne cast shield spere vestment cup full wine milke blood fire brent wood ne greekes huge rout thrice riden fire vpon left hand loud shouting thrice right speres clatering thrice lady gan crie ne led homeward emelie ne arcite brent ashen cold ne liche wake yhold night long ne greek play wake play ne keepe say wrestled best naked oile annoint ne bare best euery point woll tellen eke gone home athens play done shortly point woll wend maken long tale end processe length certain yeares stinten mourning teares greekes one generall assent seemed parliament athens vpon certain point caas among point yspoken haue certaine country alliance haue thebanes fully obeisance noble theseus anon let send gentle palamon vnwist cause blacke clothes sorrowfully came commaundement hie tho sent theseus emelie set husht place theseus abidden hath space word came wise brest eyen set lest sad visage siked still right thus saied first mouer cause aboue first made faire chaine loue great theffect high intent well wist thereof ment faire chaine loue bond fire aire water lond certaine bond may flee prince mouer qd hath stablisht wretched world adoun certaine day duracioun engendred place ouer day may pace mow yet tho day abredge needeth none authority ledge proued experience list declare sentence may men order discerne thilke mouer stable eterne well may men know foole every part deriued hoole nature hath taken beginning one part cantle thing thing perfit stable descending till corrumpable therefore wise purueyanuce hath well beset ordinaunce space thing progression shullen endure succession eterne without lie maiest thou vnderstand see eie lo oke hath long norishing fro time beginneth first spring hath long life ye may see yet last wasted tree considereth eke hard stone vnder foot tread gone yet wasteth lieth wey broad riuer sometime wexeth drey great tounes see wane wend ye see thing hath end man woman see shall also nedeth one tearmes two saine youth el age mote dead king well page bed deepe see large field ye may see helpeth goeth ilke wey may see thing mote dey maketh iupiter king prince cause thing converting proper deriued sooth tell creature liue degree auaileth striue wisdome thinketh make vertue necessite take well may eschew namly v dew grutcheth ought doth follie rebell may gie certainely man hath honour dien excellence flour siker good name hath frends ne shame glader ought friend death honour iyold vp breath name apaled age foryetten vassellage best worthy fame dien best name contrary wilfulnesse grutchen haue heauinesse good arcite chiualry flour departed dutie honour foule prison life grutchen cosin wife welfare loueth wele hem thank nay god wot neuer adele soule eke himselfe offend yet mow lust amend may conclude long storie sorrow rede v merrie thanke iupiter grace ere departen place rede maken sorrowes two one perfit ioy lasting euermo look sorrow herein woll first amend begin sister qd full assent people parlement gentle palamon owne knight serueth wil hart might euer hath done sith ye first knew ye shall grace vpon rew take husband lord lend hand accord let see womanly pite king brother sonne parde though poore batchelere since hath serued many yere great aduersite must ben considered leueth gentle mercy ought passen right said thus palamon knight trow need little sermoning make assenten thing commeth nere take lady hond betwixt hem maked anon bond hight matrimonie mariage counsaile baronage thus blisse melody hath palamon iwedded emely god world hath ywrought send loue hath dere bought palamon wele liuing blisse richesse hele emely loueth tenderly serueth gentilly neuer word hem betwene iealousie tene thus endeth palamon emely god saue faire company miller tale nicholas scholar oxford practiseth alison carpenter wife osney deceive husband end rewarded accordingly pthe miller prologue knight thus tale ytold company na yong ne old ne said noble storie worthie drawne memorie namely gentile eueriehone host lough sware mote gone goeth aright vnbokeled male let see shall tell another tale truly game well begon telleth u sit monke somewhat quite knight tale miller dronken pale vnneths vpon horse sat ne nold availe neither hood ne hat ne abide man courtesie pilats voice began crie armes blood bone noble tale none woll quite knight tale host saw dronken ale said abide robin leue brother better man shall tell v first another abide let v wirch thriftely god soule qd woll woll speake el goe way host answered tell deuill way thou art foole thy wit ouercome hearketh qd miller first make protestatioun drunke know soun therefore mispeake say wite ale southwarke pray woll tell legend life carpenter wife clarke set wright cap reue answered said stint thy clap let thy leaud drunken harlottrie sinne eke great follie apairen man defame eke bring wiues blame thou maiest inough thing faine drunken miller spake full soon againe saied leue brother oswold hath wife cokewold say therefore thou art one full good wiues many one art thou angry tale haue wife parde well thou yet ox plough take vpon inough deemen selfe one woll beleeue well none husband inquisitife god priuity ne wife find god foison remnant needeth enquere say millere nold word man forbere told churles tale mannere forthinketh shall rehearce therefore euery gentle wight pray deemeth god loue say euill intent mote rehearse tale better werse else falsen matere therefore list turne ouer leafe chuse another tale ye shall find ynow great smale historiall thing touching gentlenesse eke moralitie holinesse blame ye chuse amis miller churle ye know well reue eke mo harlotrie told eke two auise put blame eke men make ernest game pthe miller tale whylome dwelling oxenford rich gnofe gests helden bord craft carpenter dwelling poor scholler learned art fantasie turned learne astrologie coud certaine conclusion demen interrogation men asken certain hour men shoulden drought shours men asked shuld befal every thing may reken clarke cleped hend nicholas berne loue coud solas thereto slie right priuee ilike maiden meeke see chamber hostelrie alone withouten companie full tetously dight hearbes sote himselfe sweet rote licores seduwall almagiste bookes great small asterlagour longing art augrim stone lying faire apart shelues couched bed hed presse icouered folding red aboue lay gay sautrie made night melodie sweetly chamber rong angelus ad virginem song song king note full oft blessed merry throte thus sweet clarke time spent friend finding rent carpenter wedded new wife loved life eighteene yeare gesse age iealous kept strait cage wild young old deemed cokewold knew cato wit rude bade men wed similitude men shoulden wed estate youth elde often debate sith fallen snare must enduren folke care faire young wife therewithall wisele bodie gentle small seinte weared barred silke barme cloth white morrow milke vpon lendes full many gore white smock embrouded eke behind colere cole blacke silke within eke without tape white volipere sute colere fillet broad silke set full hie sikerly likerous eie full small ypulled browes two tho bent blacke much blisful see new perienet tree softer wool weather girdle hung purse leather tassed silke perled latoun world seeken ni man wise couth thence gay popelote gay wench full brighter shining hew toure noble forged new song loud yerne swallow sitting berne thereto couth skip make game kid calfe following dame mouth sweet braket meth hord apple lying hay heth winsing jolly colt long mast upright bolt brooch bare sow collere broad bosse bucklere shoe laced leg hie primrose piggesnie lord liggen bed yet good yoman wed sir eft sir befell caas day hende nicholas fell yong wife rage pley husband oseney clerkes ben full subtill queint priuily caught queint saied wi haue derne loue thee lemman spill held full fast haunch bone saied lemman loue well one woll dien also god saue sprong colt traue head wrieth fast away saied woll kiss thee fay let qd let nicholas woll crie harrow ala doe away hand courtesie nicholas gan mercy crie spake faire profered fast loue graunted last swore oth thomas rent would commandement may leisure well espie husband full jealousie ye wait well priue wot right well nam dead qd ye mote full derne caas nay thereof care ye qd nicholas clarke litherly beset couth carpenter beguile thus accorded worne awaiten time haue said beforne nicholas thus euery dele thacked lends wele kissed sweet taketh sautrie plaieth fast maketh melodie fell thus parish chirch christes owne workes wirch good wife went upon holy day forehead shone bright day wash lete werke chirch parish clerke whiche cleaped absolon croule haire gold shon strouted fanne large brode full straight even lay jolly shode rode red eyen gray goo pole windowes coruen shoos hosen redde went fetously gird full small properly kirtle light waget full faire thicke point set thereupon gay surplise white blossome rise merrie child god saue well coud let bloud clippe shaue make charter lond quitaunce twenty manner coud trip daunce schoole oxenford tho leg casten fro play song small ribible thereto song sometime loud quinible well coud play geterne toune na brewhouse ne tauerne gay girle tapstere ne visited solas sooth say somwhat squaimus farting speech daungerous absolon jolly gay goeth censer sunday censing wiues parish fast many louely looke hem cast namely carpenter wife looke thought merry life proper sweet licorous dare well saine mous cat would haue anon parish clerke jolly absolon hath heart loue longing wife tooke none offering courtesie saied would haue none moon night ful bright shone absolon geterne hath ytake paramour thought wake foorth goeth jealous amorous till came carpenter hous little cockes yerow dressed shot window upon carpenter wall singeth voice gentle small deare lady thy pray ye would rew full well according geterning carpenter awoke heard sing spake unto wife said anon alison heares thou absolon chaunteth thus vnder boures wall answerd husband therewithall yes god wot heare euery dele passeth forth wol ye bet wele fro day day jolly absolon woeth woe begon waketh night day kembeth lock broad made gay woeth meanes brocage swore would page singeth brokking nighttingale sent piment methe spiced ale wafres piping hot glede roun profered mede folke woll richesse stroke gentlenesse somtime shew lightnesse mastrie plaieth heraudes skaffold hie auaileth caas loueth hende nicholas absolon may blow buckes horne ne labour scorne thus maketh absolon ape request tourneth yape forsooth proverbe lie men say thus alway nye slie still maketh ferre loue lothe though absolon wood wrothe ferre sight nie nicholas stood light beare thee well hend nicholas absolon may waile sing ala befell saterday carpenter gone osnay hende nicholas alison accorded conclusion nicholas shapen hem silly jealous carpenter beguile game went aright sleep armes night desire also right anon withouten word mo nicholas longer would tarie doth full soft vnto chamber carie meat drinke day twey husbond sey asked nicholas aunswere mst day saw eie trowed maladie crie maid coud call nold answer nought might befall thus passeth forth like saturday nicholas still chamber lay eat dranke slept list till sunday sunne goeth rest silly carpenter hath great marueile nicholas thing might eile said adrad saint thomas stondeth aright nicholas god shilde died sodainely world full tickle sekerly saw day corse horne cherch monday last saw werch goe qd unto knaue anone cleape dore knocke fast stone looke tell boldely knaue goeth vp full sturdely chamber dore stood cried knocked wood doe ye maister nicholay may ye sleepen long day nought heard word hole found full low vpon bord cat wont creepe hole looked full deepe last sight nicholas sat euer gaping vpright keyked new moone adowne goeth told maister soone array saw ylke man carpenter blissen began said helpe v saint frideswide man wote little shall betide man fallen astronomie woodnesse agonie thought aye well shoulden men shoulden know god priuite yea blessed alway leaud man naught beleefe right ferd another clarke astronomy walked field pry vpon starre wete befall till marlepit yfall saw yet saint thomas reweth sore hende nicholas shall arated studying may iesus heauen king get staffe may underspore thou robin heauest vp dore shall studying gesse chamber dore gan dresse knaue strong carle none haspe bare vp dore one floore dore fell anone nicholas sat still stone euer gaped vpward aire carpenter wend despaire hent shoulder mightily shoke hard cried pitously nicholas looke adoun awake thinke christ passioun crouch elues wiked wight therewith night spell said anon right foure halues house dreshfold dore without iesu christ sainte benedight blisse house euery wicked wight fro night mare wite pater noster wonnest thou saint peter sister last hende nicholas gan sike sore said ala shall world lost eftsoones carpenter answerd saiest thou think god men swink nicholas answerd fetch drink woll speake priuite certaine thing toucheth thee woll tell none man certaine carpenter goth doun cometh againe brought mighty ale large quart hem dranken part nicholas chamber dore fast shet doune carpenter set said iohan hoast mine lefe dere thou shalt vpon thy trouth swere wight thou shalt counsel wrey christ counsaile say thou tell man thou art forlore vengeance thou shalt haue therfore thou wray thou shalt wood nay christ forbid holy blood qd tho silly man blabbe ne though say nam lefe gabbe say thou wolt shall neuer tell child ne wife harrowed hell iohn qd nicholas woll lie haue yfounden mine astrologie haue looked moone bright munday next quarter night shall fall raine wild wood halfe great neuer no flood world said lesse houre shall orient hidous shoure thus shall mankind drench lese life carpenter answerd said ala wife shall drench ala mine alisoun sorrow fell almost adoun said remedy caas yes yes full good qd hende nicholas thou wolt werchafter lore rede thou maist werchen thine hede thus saith salomon full trew worke counsel thou shalt rew thou wilt werken good counsaile vndertake without mast saile yet shall saue thee hast thou heard saved noe lord warned beforne world water shuld lorne yes qd carpenter full yore ago hast thou heard qd nicholas also sorrow noe fellowship might get wife ship leuer dare well undertake thilke time wether blake ship selfe alone therfore wost thou best done asketh hast hasty thing men may preach ne make tarrying anon goe get v fast inn kneding trough el kemelyn ech v looke large men mow swimmen barge haue therein victual sufficiaunt day fie remnaunt water shall aslake gone away abouten prime vpon next day robin may weten thy knave ne eke thy maid gille may save aske though thou aske woll tellen god privite sufficeth thee thy wit mad haue great grace noe thy wife shall well save doubt goe thy way speed thee hereabout thou hast thee ygetten v kneading tub thre shalt thou hang hem roofe full hie man purueyaunce espie thou hast thus haue said hast vitaile faire hem ylaid eke axe smite cord arwo water commeth may go breake hole high vpon gable vnto garden ward ouer stable may freely passen forth way great shoure gone away shalt thou swim mery vndertake doth white ducke drake woll cleape alison iohn merry flood woll passe anon thou wolt saine haile maister nicholay good morrow see well day shall lord life world noe wife one thing warne thee full right well auised ilke night benentred ship bord none u ne speake word ne clepe ne crie prayere done god owne hest dere thy wife thou mote hang fer twinne betwixt shall sinne looking shall deed ordinaunce said go god thee speed morow night men ben asleepe kneading tub woll creepe sitten abiding god grace go thy way haue longer space make longer sermoning men saine thus send wise say nothing thou art wise needeth thee teach goe saue liues thee beseech silly carpenter goeth forth way full oft said ala welaway wife told privite ware knew bet queint cast sey natheles ferde would dey said ala go forth thy way anone helpe v scape dead eachone thy true wedded wife go deare spouse help saue life lo great thing affection men may die imagination deep may impression take silly carpenter beginneth quake thinketh verily may see no flood come waltering see drenchen alison hony dere weepeth waileth maketh sory chere siketh many sorry thought goth geteth kneading trough tub kemelin priuily sent hem hing hem roofe full priuilie hand made ladder thre climben ronges stalkes tub honging balkes hem vitailed trough tubbe bread cheese good ale iubbe sufficing right ynow day er made array sent knaue eke weuch also vpon need london go munday drew night shut dore without candle light dressed thing bee shortly clomben vp three sitten still fully furlong way pater noster clum said nicholay clum qd iohan clum said alison carpenter said deuotion still sit biddeth prayere awayting raine dead sleepe wery businesse fell carpenter right gesse curfewe time little trauaile ghost groneth sore est routeth head mislay doune ladder stalketh nicholay alison full loft sped withouten word mo went bed carpenter wont lie reuell melodie thus lieth alison nicholas businesse mirth solas till bell laudes gan ring freres chaunsell gone sing parish clerke amorous absolon loue alway wo bygon vpon monday osenay company disport play asked vpon case cloisterere full priuily iohn carpentere drew apart chirch said saw wirch sith saturday trow went timbre abbot hath sent wont timbre go dwellen graunge day two el house certaine cannot sorthly saine absolon full iolly light thouyt time walk night sikerly saw nat stering dore sith day began spring mote thriue shall cockes crow full priuily knocke window stant full low vpon boures wall alison woll tellen loue longing yet shall misse least way shall kisse manner comfort shall haue parfay mouth hath itched long day signe kissing least night mette eke feast therefore woll goe sleepe houre twey night woll walke pley first cocke hath crow anon vp rist iolly louer absolon arayeth gay queint deuice first cheweth greins licorice smellen sote kempt vnder tongue true loue bere thereby wend graciouse cometh carpenter house still stant shot window vnto breast raught low soft knocked semely soun doe honycombe sweet alisoun faire bird sweet sinnamon awake lemman mine speketh absolon full little thinken ye upon wo loue swelt go wonder though swelt sweat mourne doth lambe teat wi lemman haue loue longing like turtle true mourning may eaten may maid go fro window iacke fool said help god sweet saint iame loue another el blame well bet thee iesu absolon goe forth thy way woll cast stone let sleepe twenty diuell way ala qd absolon welaway true loue euer yuell besette kisse since may bette iesus loue loue wilt thou go thy way therewith qd ye tertes lemman qd absolon make thee ready qd come anon vnto nicholas said still peace thou shalt laugh thy fill absolon doun set knee said
