lord degree hope commeth lemman thy grace sweet bird thy nore window vndoth hast haue qd come speed thee fast least neighbour thee espie absolon gan wipe mouth full drie darke night pitch cole window put er hole absolon sped neither bet ne wers mouth kist bare er full sauorly ware abacke stert thought amis well wist woman berde felt thing rowe long herde said fie ala haue te qd clapt window absolon goeth forth sorrie paas heard beard said hende nicholas god corpus goeth faire wele silly absolon heard every dele lip gan anger bite himselue said shall thee quite rubbeth froteth lip dust sond straw chip absolon saith full oft ala soule take sathanas lever toun qd despight awreken ala qd ala ne bleint hot loue cold yqueint fro time kist er paramour set kers healed maladie full oft paramour gan defie weepe doth child ybete soft pace went ouer strete vnto smith men callen dan gerueys forge smiteth plow harneis sharpeth share culters busily absolon knocketh easily said vndo gerueys anon art thou absolon absolon christ sweet tre rise ye rath eye benedicite eileth gay girle god wote hath brought thus merytote saint neotes ye wote wele mene absolon ne raught bene play word againe gaffe towe vpon distaffe garuays knew said friend dere hot culter chimney lene haue therewith done woll bring thee againe full sone geruays answerd certes gold poke noble vntold thou shouldest haue true smith eye christ foot wol ye therwith thereof qd absolon may shall well tellen thee morrow day caught culter cold stele full soft dore gan stele went vnto carpenter wall coughed first knocked therewithall vpon window right ere alison answerd knocketh warrant hee thefe nay qd god wot sweet lefe thine absolon thine owne derling gold qd haue thee brought ring mother yaue god saue full fine thereto well ygraue woll yeue thee thou kisse nicholas risen pisse thought would amenden iape kisse er ere scape vp window hastily er put full priuily buttocke haunch therwith spake clerke absolon speak sweet bird thou art nicholas anon let fleen fart great thunder dent stroke well nie yb ent readie yron hote nicholas arse smote goeth skin hondbrede hot cultor brend tout smart wend die wood gan crie helpe water water god hert carpenter slumber slert heard one crie water wood thought ala commeth no flood set vp withouten word mo axe smote corde wo doun goeth found neither sell bread ne ale doune shortly fell vpon floore swowne lay vp stert alison hende nicholay cried harrow street neighbor small great ronne gauren man swoune lay palish wan fall brosten hath arme stonden must vnto owne harme spake yborne adoun hende nicholas alisoun told euery man wood agast sore no flood fantasie vanite getten kneading tub thre hem honged roofe aboue paried hem god loue sitten roofe par companie folke gan laughen fantasie roofe kyken gape turned earnest jape carpenter answerd nought man reason herd othes great ysworne adoun holden wood toun euerich clerke anon held said man wood leue brother euery wight gan laughen strife thus swiued carpenter wife keeping jealousie absolon hath kist nether eie nicholas scalded tout tale done god saue rout pthe reues prologue folke laughed nice caas absolon hende nicholas diuers folke hereof diuersly said part lough plaid ne tale saw man greue onely oswolde reue carpenter craft little ire heart ylaft gan grutchen blame lite soothly qd full well couth thee quite blearing proud miller eie list speake ribaudrie old lust play age grasse time done fodder forage white top writeth mine old yeres sometime yelow white ben min here yet fare doth open er ilke fruit euer lenger wers till rotten molloke stre old men dreaden fare till rotten ripe hoppen alway world wol pipe stiketh euer naile haue hore head greene taile hath leke though might gone desireth folly euer one may wol speken yet ashen cold fire yreken four gledes han shall deuise auaunting lying anger couetise foure sparkle longen unto elde old lims mow well vnwelde ne shall faile sooth yet alway colt tooth many yeare passed henne since tap life began renne sikerly borne anone death drew tap life let gone euer since hath tap pronne till almost emptie tonne streme life droppeth chimb silly tongue may well ring climb wretchednesse passed full yore old folke saue dotage host heard sermoning gan speake lordly king said amounteth wit shall speake day holy writ diuel thinke made reue preche souter shipman leche say forth thy tale tary time lo depford halfe way prime lo greenwiche many shrew time thy tale begin sir qd oswold reue pray ye greue answere somedele set houfe lefull force force shoufe dronken miller hath ytold v beguiled carpentere perauenture scorne one leaue shall quite anon right churles tearmes woll speke pray god necke mote breke well mine eye seene stalke cannot seene balke denyse simkin miller trompington deceiveth two clark schollars hall cambridge stealing corn use matter revenge wrong full argument tale taken bocchace novel pthe reues tale trompington far fro cambridge goth brook ouer bridge vpon brooke stant mell sooth tell miller dwelling many day peacocke proud gay pipen couth fishen net bete turne cup well wrastle shete aye belt bare long pauade sword full trenchaunt blade jolly popere bare pouch ther na man perill durst touch shefeld thwitel bare hose round face camised nose pilled ape skull market beater full dursten wight hond ledge ne swore sore abedge theefe forsooth corne mele slie vsaunt stele name hoten deynous simkyn wife comen noble kin parson toune father yafe full many panne bra simkyn blood allie yfostered nunnerie simkyn would wife said well ynourished maid saue estate yomanrie proud pert pie full faire sight see hem two holy day beforne would go tipet wounden heed came gite reed simkyn hosen durst wight clepen dame none hardy went way durst rage play would slaine simkyn pauade knife bodkin jealous folkes perilous euermo algates would wiues wenden eke somedele smoterliche digne water diche full hoker bismare though ladie spare kinred norterly learned nonnery doughter betwixt hem two twenty yeare withouten mo sauing child halfe yeare age cradle lay proper page wench thicke well ygrowne camised nose eyen gray glas buttockes broad brest round hie right faire haire woll nat lie parson toune faire purpose maken haire cattell mesuage straunge made mariage purpose bestowen hie worthy blood auncetrie holy church good mote dispended holy church blood descended therefore would holy blood honour though holy church deuour great soken hath miller dout wheat malt land namely great college men clepen schollers hall cambrege ther wheat eke malt iground day happed stound sicke lay manciple maladie men wenden wisely die miller stale wheat corn hundred time biforn stale courteously theefe outragiously warden chid made fare thereof set miller tare cracked bosted swore na yong poor schollers two dwelten hall say testife lustie play mirth reuely vpon warden busily cry yeue hem leaue little stound gone mill see corne yground hardely durst lay neck miller steale hem halfe peck corne sleight ne force hem reue last warden yaue hem leue iohan hight one alein hight town hight strother farre north tell alein maketh alredy gere horse sacke cast anon forth goeth alein clerke also iohn good sword buckeler side iohan knew way needeth guide mill dore sacke layth alein spake first haile simken fayth fare thy faire doughter thy wife alein welcome qd simken life iohn also ye god simond qd iohn need pere behoues serue himselfe swaine el foole clerkes saine manciple hope dead swa werkes aye wange head therefore come eke alein grind corne carry home agein pray speed v home ye may shall done qd simkin fay woll done hand god right hopper woll stand qd iohn seen howgates corn goth yet saw neuer father kin hopper waggs fra alein answerd iohan wilt thou sa woll stand beneath croune see meale falleth adoune troghe shall disport qd iohn say may sort ill miller ye miller smileth nicite thought done wile wene man may hem beguile thrift yet shall bleare eie sleight philosophie queint clerk make woll steale gin take insteed flour yet woll give hem brenne greatest clerk ben wisest menne wolfe spake mare art count tare doore goeth full priuily saw time subtilly looked doune till yfound clerkes horse stood ybound behind mill vnder lessell horse goth faire well strippeth bridle right anon horse loose gan gon toward fen wild mare rinne forth wehe thick thinne miller goeth againe word said doth note clerkes plaid till corne faire well yground meal sacked ybound iohn goth found horse away gan crie harrow welaway horse lost alein god benes step thy foot man come forth atenes ala warden paltrey lorne alein forgot meale corne mind husbandrie whilke way gone gan crie wife came leaping inward renne saied ala goeth fenne wild mare fast may go vnthank come hond bound better haue knit rein ala qd iohn alein christ pein lay doun thy sword shall mine alswa full swift god wete raa god fale shall scape v bathe ne hadst thou put capel lathe ill heste alein god thou fonne elie clerkes han full fast ironne toward fenne alein eke iohn miller saw wer gon halfe bushell flower take wife knede cake said trow clerk aferde yet miller make clerk berde art yet let hem gone way lo gone let child play get litely croune selie clerk nen vp doune kepe kepe iossa iossa warth go whistle thou shall keepe shortly till night couth tho might capell catch ran away fast till ditch caught last werie wet beastes rain cometh silly iohn cometh alein ala qd iohn day borne driven hethen skorne corne stole men woll u fooles call warden fellowes namely miller wallaway thus plaineth iohn goth way toward mill bayard hond miller sitting fire fond niyt ferther might nought love god besought borough ease peny miller said ayen yet shall ye haue part house strait ye haue learned art ye argument make place mile broad twenty foot space let see place may suffice make romer speech gise simond said ihon cutherd aye thou mery faire answerd haue heard say men shuld take two thing swilke find swilke brings specially pray thee host dere get u meat drink make v chere pay truly full empty hond men may haukes tull lo siluer ready spend miller toun doughter send ale bread rosted hem goo bound hors shuld go loo owne chamber made bed sheetes chalons faire yspred owne hed ten foot twelue doughter hed selue right chamber fast might ne bette cause roumer herbrough place soupen speaken mirth solace dronken euer strong ale best midnight went rest well hath miller vernished hed full pale dronken nothing red gaspeth speaketh nose quacke pose hed goeth wife iay light iolife iolly whistle well ywet cradle bed fe set roken yeue child suke dronken cruke bed went doughter right anon bed goeth alein also iohn uas hem needed dwale miller hath wisely bibbed ale hors snorteth steepe ne taile behind tooke keepe wife bare bordon well strong men might hem heare routen furlong wench routeth eke par company alein clerke heard melody poked iohan saied sleepest thou heardst thou euer swilke sang ere lo swilke coupling wixt hem wild fire vpon body fall heard euer swilke ferly thing ye shall haue floure euill ending lang night tide rest yet naforce shall best ihon saied euer mote thriue may yon wench woll swiue easement hath law yshapen v iohan law saieth thus man one point agreeued another shall releeued corne stolne soothly nay haue euill fit day since shall haue none amendement againe losse haue mine easement god sale shall none bee iohan answered alein auise thee miller perillous man saied sleepe abraied might doen v villanie alein answered count worth flie vp rest wench crept wench say vpright fast slept till nigh ere might espie late crie shortly say one play alein woll speake ihon ihon lay still furlong way two himselfe maketh routh wo ala qd wicked iape may say ape yet hath fellow somewhat harme hath miller doughter arme auntreth hath need ysped lie drafte sacke bed iape told another dey shall hold daffe cokeney woll arise auntre fay vnhardie vnsely thus men say vp rose softly went vnto cradle arme hent bare softly bed fete soone wife routing lete gan awake went pisse came againe gan cradle misse groped found none ala qd almost misgone almost gone clerkes bed eye benedicite foule ysped forth goeth till cradle fond gropeth alway hond found bed thought nat good cradle stood nist derke faire well crept clerke lieth full still wold haue caught slepe within ihon clerke vp lepe good wife laied full sore merry fit nought full yore priked hard deepe mad iolly life haue two clerkes lad till third cocke began sing alein waxe wearie dauning swonken long night saied farewell malin sweet wight day comen may longer bide euermo whereso goe ride thine owne clerke haue hele deare lemman qd go farwele thou go one thing woll thee tell thou wendest homeward mell right entre dore behind thou shalt cake halfe bushell find ymaked thine owne meale helpe fire steale good lemman god thee saue keepe word gan almost weepe alein vprist thought ere daw would goe creepe felaw found cradle hand anon god thought wrong haue gon head tottie swinke night maketh go aright wot well cradle haue misse go lieth miller wife also forth goeth twenty deuill way vnto bed miller lay wend haue cropen fellow ihon miller crept anon caught necke soft spake saied ihon thou swineshead awake christ soule heare noble game lord called saint iame haue thrise short night swiued miler doughter bolt upright whilest thou hast coward agast ye false harlot qd miller hast false traitour thou clerke qd thou shalt dead god dignite durst bold disparage doughter come linage throat boll caught alein hent dispitously nose smote fest doune ran blood stream vpon brest floore mouth nose ybroke wallowen doth pig poke vp gone doune ayen anone till miller spurned stone doune fell backward vpon wife wist nothing nice strife fall asleepe little wight ihon clerk waked night fall steepe braied helpe holy crosse bromholme saied manus tuas lord thee call awake simond fiend fall heart broken helpe dead lieth one wombe head helpe simkin false clerk fight ihon stert vp fast euer might graspeth wals fro find staffe stert vp also knew eftres bet ihon wall found staffe anon saw little shemering light hole shone moone bright light saw hem two sikerly nist sey white thing eie gan white thing espie wend clerke weard voluper staffe drow ner ner wend haue hit alein full smote miller pilled skull doun goth cried harrow die clerkes beat well let lie raieth hem tooke horse anon eke meale way gon mill dore tooke cake halfe bushell floure well ybake thus proud miller well ybete hath ylost grinding whete paid supper euery dele alein ihon beat wele wife swiued doughter al lo miller fals therefore prouerbe full sooth dare well weene euill dooth guilour shall himselfe beguiled god sit hie maieste saue company great smale thus haue quit miller tale pthe cooke prologue cooke london reue spake joy thought claude backe ha quoth hee christes passioun miller hath sharpe conclusioun vpon argument bigage well sayd salamon language ne bring euery man thine house herbouring night perillous well ought man auised whome brought priuite pray god yeue sorrow care euer sithen hight hodge ware heard miller bette isett awerke iape malice derke god forbid stinten therefore ye vouchsafe heare tale poore man woll tell well little yape fell citee host saied graunt thee tell rodger looke good many pastie hast thou letten blood many iacke douet hast thou sold hath twise hot twise cold many pilgrime hast thou christ curse thy persse yet fare worse haue eaten thy stoble goo thy shop many flie loo tell gentle rodger thy name yet pray thee wroth game man may say full sooth game play thou saiest full sooth qd roger fay soth play quade play fleming saith therefore henry bailly thy faith thou wroth departen though tale hostelere nethelesse woll tellen yet ere part ywis thou shalt quit therwithall lough made cheare saied tale ye shullen heare description unthriftie prentice given dice woman wine wasting thereby master good purchasing newgate tale lost else never finished author pthe cooke tale prentise whylome dwelt cite craft vitailers galiard goldfinch shawe broune berrie proper short felawe locke blacke kemt full fetously daunce couth full well jollily called perkin reuelour full loue paramour hiue full honey sweet well wench might meet euery bridal would sing hop loued bette tauernes shop riding cheape shoppe thither would leape till sight isein soothly would come agein gather meinie sort hop sing make disport set steuin meet plaien dice street city na prentise fairer couth casten paire dise perkin couth thereto fre dispence place priuite found maister well chafare oft time found boxe full bare sikerly prentise reuelour haunteth dise riot paramour maister shall shop abie haue part ministralcie theft riot conuertible play gettron rebible revel truth lowe degree ben full wroth day men may see iolly prentise maister abode till nigh prentishode snibbed earely late sometime led reuel newgate last maister bethought vpon day paper sought prouerbe saith word well bette rotten apple hord rot remnaunt fareth roiotous seruaunt much lesse harme let passe shend seruaunts place therefore master gaue quittaunce bad go sorow mischaunce thus iolly prentise leue let roiot night leue theefe without louke helpeth waste souke bribe borrow may anon sent bed array vnto compere owne sort loued dice reuel disport wife held countenance shop swiued sustenance pthe man lawes prologue host saw well bright sunne arke artificial day runne fourth part eke halfe houre though deepe expert lore wist well eighteene day april messenger may saw well shadow euery tre length quantite body erect caused therefore shadow tooke wit phebus shone clear bright degree fortie fiue clomben hight day latitude ten clocke gan conclude suddenly plight horse lordings qd warne al rout fourth part day agon loue god saint iohn leseth time ferfoorth ye may lordings time wasteth night day stealeth u priuely sleeping negligence waking doth streme turneth neuer descending fro mountain plain well seneke many philosophre bewailen time gold cofre losse cattell may recouered losse time shendeth u qd would come ayen withouten dread woll malkins maidenhead hath lost wantonnesse let u mowlen thus idlenesse sir man law qd haue blis tell u tale anon forward ye submitted free assent stonden case judgement acquiteth nowe behest haue done deuer lest host qd de pardeux ieo assent breake forward mine intent bihest debt woll holde faine behest better saine law man yeueth another himselfe vsen right thus woll text nathelesse certaine wight right thrifty tale saine chaucer though leaudly metre rinning craftily hath saied hem english old time knoweth many man haue sayd hem leue brother one booke hath said hem another hath told louers doun mo ouide made mentioun epistle full old tell hem sithen ben told youth made sixe alone sithen hath spoken euerichone noble wiues louers eke woll large volume seke cleaped saint liues cupide may see large wound wide lucresse babylon thisoe swerd dido false enee tree phillis demophoon plaint deianire hermion ariadna hypsiphilee barraine ile stonding see dreint liandre hero teares helein eke wo briseis laodomia crueltie queene medea little child honging hals iason loue fals hipermistra penelope alcest wifehood commendeth best certainely word ne writeth thilke wicke ensample canace loued owne brother sinfullie suche cursed story say fie el tyro appoloneus cursed kinge antiochus biraft doughter maidenhead horrible tale read drew upon pament therefore full auisement nold neuer write none setmons unkind abhominations ne woll none rehearse yef may tale shall done day loth likened doubtles mus men cleaped piriades methamorphoseos wote mene nathelesse retche bene though come haubake speake prose let rime make word sober chere began tale ye shullen lady custance emperours daughter rome marriage soudan surrey malice soudan mother suffereth great trouble misery young child mauris yet end restored comfort pthe man lawes tale hatefull harme condition pouert thirst cold hunger confounded asken helpe thee shameth thine hert thou non ask need thou art wounded nede vnwrappeth al thy wound hid maugrie thine head thou must indigence stele beg borow thy dispence thou blamest christ saiest ful bitterly misdeparteth richesse temporall thy neighbour thou witest sinfully saiest thou hast little hath parfay saiest thou sometime reken shall taile shall brenne glede nought helpeth needfull nede hearken sentence wise better dien haue indigence thine owne neighbour woll thee despise thou poore farwell thy reverence yet wise man take sentence dayes poore men wicke beware therefore thou come pricke thou poore thy brother hateth thee thy friend fleech fro thee ala rich merchaunts full wele yee noble prudent folke caas bag fild ambes aa cise sink reuneth chance christeninass mery may ye dance ye seeken lond see winning wise folke ye knowne state reignes ye father tidings tale many peace debate right tale desolate nere marchant gone many yeare taught tale ye shullen heare surrey whylome dwelt company chapman rich thereto sad true wide senten spicery clothes gold satten rich hew chafare thriftie new euery wight hath deintie chafare hem eke sellen hem ware fell maisters sort han shapen hem rome wend chapmanhood disport none messenger would send comen hemself rome end place thought hem auauntage intent taken herbigage soiourned han merchant toun certain time fell pleasance befell excellent renoun emperours doughter dame custance reported euery circumstance vnto surrein marchants wise fro day day shall deuise comen voice euery man emperour rome god se doughter hath sithen world began recken well goodnesse beaute na neuer another pray god honour susteine would europe quene high beautie without pride youth without grenhed follie work vertue guide humbles hath slaine tyrannie mirrour courtesie heart chamber holinesse hond minister freedome almes al voice soth god true purpose let v turne ayen marchants han fret ship new han blisfull maiden sein home surrey went agein doen need han doen yore liuen wealth say fell marchants stood grace soudan surrie came strange place would benigne courtesie maken hem good cheare busily espie tidings sundry realmes lere wonder might seen emong thing specially marchants haue told dame custance great noblesse earnest seriously soudan hath cauyt great plesance han figure remembrance lust busie cure loue life may dure parauenture like large booke cleaped heauen ywritten starres birth tooke loue han death ala starres clearer glas written god wot could read death euery man withouten dread starres many winter written death hector achilles pompey iulius bore strife thebe hercules sampson turnus socrates death men wit dust wight well read full soudan priuie counsel sent shortly matter pace hath hem declared intent said hem certain might haue grace haue custance within little space na dead charged hem hie shapen life remedie diuers men diuersly saiden argument casten vp doune many subtill reason forth laiden speaken magicke abusioun finally conclusioun cannot seene none auauntage ne none way saue mariage saw therein difficulty way reason speake plain diuersity law sain trow christen prince would fain wedden child vnder lawes swete v tauyt mahound prophet answerd rather lese custance would christen doubtles mote may none chese pray hold argument pee saueth life ye retcheles getten hath life cure woe may long endure needeth greater delatation say treatie embassadrie pope mediation church chiualrie destruction maumetrie encrease christ law deare accorded ye shall heare soudan baronage liege ychristened shall han custance marriage certaine gold quantite find sufficient surete accord sworne either side fair custance almighty god thee gide woulden men waiten gesse tellen purueiance emperour noblesse hath shapen doughter dame custance well may men know great ordinance may man tellen little clause araied high cause bishop shapen wend lord lady knight renoun folke ow end notified throughout toun euery wight great deuotioun pray christ mariage receiue gree speed voyage day come departing say wofull day naturall come may longer tarrying forward hem dresse custance sorrow ouercome full pale arist dressed wend well sey none end ala wonder though wept shall sent straunge nation fro friend tenderly kept bounden vnder subjection one knoweth condition husband good han yore know ne wiues dare say father said thy wretched child custance thy young daughter fostered vp loft ye mother soueraigne pleasaunce ouer thing take christ loft custance child commendeth oft vnto grace shall surrie ne shall neuer see eie ala vnto barberie nation must anon sithen christ starfe redemption yeue grace hestes fulfill wretched woman force though spill woman born thraldome penaunce vnder man gouernaunce trow troy thurus brake wall ilion ne brent thebe cite ne rome harme hanniball roman hath ivenqueshed time thre na heard tender weeping pite chamber parting forth mote wheder weepe sing first mouing cruel firmament thy diurnal swegh croudest aye hurriest fro east occident naturally would hold another way thy crouding set heauen array beginning fierce voyage cruell mar hath slaine mariage infortunat assendent tortuous lord helpelesse fall ala angle derkest house mar occisier caas feeble mone vnhappy thy paas thou knittest thou nart receiued ther thou wer wel fro thence art thou waiued imprudent emperour rome ala philosopher thy toun time bette ca voiage none electioun namely folke high conditioun nat rote birth yknow ala leaud slow ship brought wofull faire maid solemnely euery circumstance iesus christ said ni farwell fair custance paineth make good countenance forth let saile mannere turne woll againe mattere explicit prima par sequitur par secunda mother soudan well vice espied hath sonnes plaine intent woll lete old sacrifice right anon counsaile sent ben comen know ment assembled folke feare set doune said ye shall heare lord qd ye knowne euery chone sonne point lete holy lawes alkaron yeuen god messenger mahomete one auow great god hete life shall rather body start mahomet law goe hart v tiden new law thraldome body pennaunce afterward hell draw reneyed mahound creaunce lord woll ye make assuraunce shall say assenting lore shall make u fafe euermore sworen assenten euery man liue die stond euerich best wise strengthen shall friend fond hath emprise taken hond ye shall heare shall deuise hem spake wise shal v first faine christendom take cold water shall greeue u alite shall reuell feast make trow shall soudan quite tho wife christened neuer white shall haue need wash away rede though font ful water lede soudonnesse root iniquite virago thou symyram secound serpent vnder fememnete like serpent deepe hell ibound faigned woman may confound vertue innocence thy mallice bred thee neast euery vice sathan enuious since thilke day thou wert chased heritage well knewest thou woman old way thou madest eue bring u seruage thou wolt fordoen christen mariage instrument welaway make thou woman thou wolt begile soudonnesse blame werie let priuily counsaile gone way tale longer tarie rideth soudon day saied would reny lay christendome priest hondes fong repenting heathen long beseeching doen honour might haue christen folke fest pleasen hem woll doen labour soudon saith woll doen al hest kneeling thanked request glad nist say kist sonne home goth way arriued christen folke lond surrey great solemne rout hastily soudon sent sond first mother reigne saied wife comen dout praiden hem riden quene honour reigne sustene great presse rich ray surreyans romanes ymet yfere mother soudon rich gay receiueth manner glad chere mother might doughter dere vnto next city beside soft paas solemnly ride nought trow triumph iulius lucan maketh bost roialler curious thassembling blisfull host scorpion wicked ghost soudonnesse flattering cast vnder mortally sting soudon cometh soon rially wonder tell welcometh much ioy blis thus mirth ioie let hem dwell fruit euery tale tell whan time come men thought best reuel stint men gon rest time come old soudonnesse ordained hath feast told feast christen folke hem dresse general yong old may men feast rialte behold dainty moe deuise dere bought rise soudon wo euer thou art successour worldly blisse springed bitternesse end ioy worldly labour wo occupieth ende gladnesse herken counsaile thy sikernesse vpon thy glad day ha thou minde vnware wo harme cometh behinde shortly tellen word soudon christen euerichone hewe sticken boord onely dame custance alone old soudonnesse cursed crone hath friend doen cursed deed selfe would country lede surreien non yt conuerted counsaile soudon wot na heawe er asterted custance han taken anon fotehot ship sternelesse god wot han set bidden lerne saile surrey ayenward itale certain tresour thither ladde sooth sayne vitaile great plente han yeuen clothes eke forth saileth salt se custance full benignite emperours yong doughter dere lorde fortune thy stere blesseth full pitious voice vnto crosse christ tho said clere welful auter holy croice reed lambes blood full pite wesh world fro old iniquite fro fende fro clawe kepe day shall drenchen deepe victorious tree protection trewe onely worthy bere king heauen woundes new white lambe hurt spere flemere feendes thy limmes faithfully extenden kepe yeue might life menden yeres day fleeteth creature see grece vnto straite marocke auenture many sory meale may baite death full oft may waite wilde wave would driue vnto place ariue men mighten asken slayn eke feast might body saue answer demaund agayn saued daniel horrible caue euery wight master knaue lion frette asterte wight god bare hert god list shew wonderfull miracle seen mighty werkes christ euery harme triacle certain mean often knowen clerkes doth thing certaine end yt full derke man wit ignorance ne nat know prudent purueyance feast yslawe kepeth fro ye drenching see kept ionas fish mawe till spouted niniuee wel may men know wight kept people ebrak drenching dry foot see passing hath foure spirit tempest power anoy lond see north south also west east anoyeth neither see ne londe ne tree southly commaunder thereof fro tempest aye woman kept well whan woke whan slept wher might woman meat drink haue thre yere lasteth vitaile fed egyptian mary caue desert none christ sans faile fiue thousand folk great maruaile loaues fiue fish two feed god sent foyson great need driueth forth occian throughout wide see till last vnder holde nempne ne fer northumberlond waue cast sand ship sticked fast thence nolne tyde wil christ yt ther abide constable castle doun fare seene wrecke al ship sought found weary woman full care found also ye treasure brought language mercy besought life body twin deliuer wo manner latin corrupt speche algates thereby vnderstond constable list lenger seche wofull woman brought lond kneleth doun thanketh god sond would man sey foule ne faire though shoulden dey said mased see foryate mind trouth constable hath great pite eke wife yt weepen routh diligent withouten slouth serue please euerich place louen looken face constable dame hermegild wife painems countrey euery hermegild loued right life custance hath long soiourned orison many bitter tere till iesu hath conuerted grace dame hermegild constablesse yt place lond dursten christen rout christen folke fled countre painims conquered plague north lond see wale fled christianite old breton dwelling ile refute meane yet na neuer christen exiled na priuite honoured christ heathen beguiled nigh castle dwellen three one hem blind might see thilke eyen mind men seen blind bright sunne sommers day constable wife also custance han taken right way toward sea furlong way two plaien roman fro walke three blind men met crooked old eyen fast yshet name christ cried blind breton dame hermegild yeue sight lady waxe afraied soun least husbond shortly forto sain would iesus christ lore haue slain till custance made bold bad werch christ doughter cherch constable woxe abashed sight saied amounteth fare custance answered sir christ might helpeth folke fiend snare ferforth gan law declare constable ere eue conuerted christ made beleeue constable nothing lord place speake custance fond kept strongly many winter space vnder alla king northumberlond full wise worthy hond againe scot men may well tourne woll againe mattere sathan euer v waiteth beguile saw custance perfectioun cast anon might quite wile made yong knight yt dwelt toun loue hot foule affectioun verily thought spill might haue woeth auailed nought would doe manner sinne wey despight compassed thought maken shamefull death dey waiteth constable away priuily night crept hermgilds chamber slept werie forwaked orison sleepeth custance hermegilde also knight sathans temptation softly bed ygo cut throat hermegilde atwo laied bloody knife dame custance went way ther god yeue mischance soon cometh constable home eke alla king lond saw wife dispitously yslain wept wrong hond bed bloody knife fond dame custance ala might say wo wit away king alla told mischance eke ye time wise ship founden custance ye han heard deuise king heart pity gan agrise saw benigne creature fall disease misaduenture lamb toward deth brought stant innocent beforne king fals knight yt hath treson wrought bereth hond yt hath thing nathelesse great mourning emong people said cannot gesse done great wickednesse han seen euer vertuous louing hermegild right life bare witnesse euerich hous saue hermegild slow knife gentle king hath caught great motife witness thought would enquere deeper case trouth lere ala custance thou hast champion fight canst thou welaway starft redemption bond sathan yet lith lay thy strong champion day christ thee miracle kithe without gilt thou shalt slaine aswithe set doun knee thus said immortall god sauedest susanne fro fals blame thou mercifull maid marie meane doughter saint anne beforne whose child angel sing osanne guiltlesse felonie succour el shall die haue ye seene sometime pale face emong prees hem hath lad toward deth wheras hem get grace colour face hath men might know face yt bistad emongs face rout standeth custance loketh queenes liuing prosperity dutch ye lady euerichone haue routh aduersity emperor doughter stant alone hath wiyt make mone blood roiall stondeth drede fere thy friend thy greatest nede alla king hath suche compassioun gentle herte full pyte eyen ran water doun nowe hastely fette boke qd knight wol swere woman slowe yet wol u avyse wol shall ben iustyse breton booke written euangeles fet thereon swore anone guilty meane while hond smote vpon necke bone doune fell atones stone eyen brust face sight euery body place voice heard generall audience saied thou hast disclandred guiltles doughter holy chirch high presence thus hast thou doen yet hold pee marueile agast prees dismaide folke stonden euerichone dread wreche saue custance alone great dread eke repentance hem hadden wrought suspection vpon silly innocent custance miracle conclusion custances mediation king many another place conuerted thanked god grace fals knight slain vntroth judgement alla hastily yet custance death great roth iesus mercy made alla wedden full solemnely holy maid bright shene thus hath christ made custance quene wofull lie wedding donegild mo king mother full tyrannie thought cursed hart brast two would sonne doe thought despight take straunge creature vnto make list chaffe ne stre make long tale corne tell realte yt mariage course goth beforne bloweth trumpe horne fruit euery tale say eaten drinken daunce play gon bed skill right though wiues ful holy thing must take patience night manner necessary pleasing folke han wedded hem ring lay little holinesse aside time may none betide gat man child anone bishop constable eke tooke wife keepe gone scotland ward fomen seke fair custance yt humble meke long gone child till still halt chamber abiding christ time come man child bare mauricius fontstone call constable doth forth come messenger wrote king cleaped alla blisfull tiding befall tidings needfull say take letter forth goth way messenger doen auauntage vnto king mother rideth swithe salueth full faire language madame qd ye may glad blithe thanked god hundred thousand sith lady quaene hath child withouten dout joy blisse reigne lo letter sealed thing mote beare hast may yeue ye wol ought vnto sonne king seruaunt night day donegilde answered time nay woll night thou take thy rest morrow woll say thee lest messenger dronk sadly ale wine stollen lettets priuily boxe slept swine counterfeited full subtilly another letter wrought full sinfully vnto king direct mattere fro constable ye shall letter spake queene deliuered horrible fendlishe creature castle none hardy dursten therein endure mother elfe auenture come charmes sorcerie euery wight hateth companie wo king yt letter sein wight told sorrow sore owne hand wrote welcome sonde christ euermore new learned lore lord welcome thy lust thy pleasance lust put thy ordinance keepeth child foule faire eke may wife vnto mine home coming christ lest may send heire agreeable liking letter sealed priuily weeping messenger taken sone forth goth done messenger fulfilled dronkenesse strong thy breth thy limmes faltren aie thou wraiest secretnesse thy mind sorne thou ianglist iaie thy face tourned new array dronkennesse reigneth rout ni counsaile hid withouten dout donegild ne haue non english digne vnto thy malice thy tirannie therefore fende thee resigne let enditen thy traitrie fie mannish fie nay god lie fie fendishe spirit dare well tell though thou walke thy spirit hell messenger came fro king againe king mother house light messenger full faine pleased euer might dronke well girdle vnder pight sleepeth snoreth guise night till summe gan arise eft letter stollen euerichone counterfeited letter wise king commaundeth constable anone vpon paine hanging high iewise ne suffren wise custance within realme abide three day quarter tide ship fond young sonne gere crouden put fro lond charge neuer eft come custance well may thy ghost haue fere sleeping thy dreame pennance donegild cast ordinance messenger ye morrow woke vnto castle halt next way constable letter tooke pitous letter sey full oft saied ala welaway lord christ qd may world indure full sinne many creature mighty god thy sin thou art rightful iudge may thou wolt suffer innocence spill wicked folke reigne prosperite good custance ala woe mote thy turmentour el dey shame death ni none wey weepen yong old place king cursed letter sent custance deadly pale face fourth day toward ship went nathelesse taketh good intent christ kneeling strond saied lord aye welcome thy sond kept fro false blame while lond amongs keepe fro harme eke fro shame salt sea although see strong euer trust mother dere saile eke stere little child lay weeping arme kneeling pitously said peace little sonne woll thee none harm kercher head braid ouer little eyen laid arme lulleth full fast heauen eyen vp cast mother qd maiden bright marie sooth woman eggement mankind lore damned aye die thy child crosse yrent thy blisfull eyen saw turment comparison betwene thy wo wo man may sustene thou see thy child yslaine thine eien yet liueth little child parfay lady bright wofull crien thou glory womanhead thou faire may thou hauen refute bright sterre day rew child thy gentilnesse rewest euery rufull distresse little child ala thy guilt neuer wroughtest sinne yet parde woll thine hard father haue thee spilt mercy dear constable qd shee let little child dwell thee thou darst sauen fro blame kisse father name therwith looketh backward lond said farewell husband routhlesse vp rist walketh doune strond toward ship followeth prees aye praieth child hold pee taketh leaue holy entent blesseth ship went vitailed ship drede habundantly full long space necessary nede ynow hereid god grace wind weather almighty god purchace bring home better say see driueth forth way alla king cometh home soone vnto castle told asketh wife child constable gan heart wax cold plainely manner told ye han heard tell better shewed king seale letter said lord ye commaunded paine death haue done certain messenger turmented till must knowne tell plat plain fro night night place lain thus wittie subtill enquiring imagind harm gan spring hand knowen letter wrot venim cursed dede wise certainely effect alla drede mother slow may men plainly rede traitour allegeaunce thus endeth old donegild mischaunce sorrow alla night day maketh child wife also tongue tellen may woll custance go fleeteth sea paine wo fiue yeare liked christ sonde ship approched vnto londe vnder heathen castle last name text find custance eke child sea vp cast almighty god saueth mankind haue custance child mind fallen heathen hond eftsoone point spill shall tell soone doun fro castle cometh many wight gauren ship custance shortly fro castle night lord steward god yeue mischance theefe renied creaunce came ship alone said lemman whether would nold wo wretched woman tho begon child cried full pittously blisfull mary halpe anon strogling well mightily theefe fell ouer boord sodainly see drenched vengeance thus hath christ unwemmed kept custance foule lust luxure lo thine end nat onely thou faintest man mind verily thou wolt body shend end thy werke thy lust blind complaining many one may men find werke somtime thentent done sinne either slaine shent may weak woman haue ye strength defend renegate golias vnmeasurable length might dauid make thee mate young armure desolate durst looke thy dreadfull face well may men seene god grace yaue iudith courage hardinesse slean prince holofernes tent deliuer wretchednesse people god say intent right god spirit vigor sent hem saued hem mischance sent might vigor custance forth goth ship ye narow mouth subalter sept yfleeting aie somtime west somtime north south sometime east full many wearie daie till christ mother yblessed aie hath shapen endlesse goodnesse make end heauinesse explicit secunda par sequitur par tertia let v stint custance throw speake romane emperour surrey hath letter know slaughter christian dishonour doen doughter false traitour meane cursed wicked soudonnesse feast let stean lesse emperour hath sent anon senatour roiall ordinance lord god wote many one surreians done high vengeance brennen slean bring hem mischance full many day shortly end homeward rome shapen hem wend senatour repaireth victory rome ward sayling full roially met ship driuing saith story custance sat full pitously nothing knew ne array ne nold sey estate though shoulden dey bringeth rome wife yaue young sonne also senatour lad life thus lady bring wo wofull custance many another mo long time dwelled place holy werkes euer grace senatours wife aunt knew nere woll longer tarry caas king alla spake yore wife weepeth siketh sore woll retourne let woll custance vnder senatours gouernance king alla mother slain vpon day fell repentaunce shortly tell shall plain rome cometh receiue penaunce putten pope ordinaunce high low iesu christ besought foryeue wicked werks wrought fame anon rome town born alla king shall come pilgrimage herbegers wenten beforn senatour vsage rode againe many linage well shewen high magnificence done king reuerence great cheare doth noble senatour king alla also euerich hem doth great honour befell day two senatour king alla go feast shortly shall lie custances sonne went companie som men would sain ye request custance senatour lad child feast may tellen euery circumstance may least sooth right mother hest beforne alla meat space child stood looking king face alla king hath child gret wonder senatour said anon whose yt faire child stondeth yonder qd god saint iohn mother hath father hath non wote shortly stound told alla child yfound god wot qd senatour also vertuous liuer life ne saw neuer ne heard mo wordly woman maiden ne wife dare well say leuer knife brest ben woman wicke man couth bring ye prick child like custance possible creature alla hath face remembrance dame custance thereon mused yeue child mother aught wife priuily sight sped fro table might parfay thought yt fatome mine hed oughten deme skilfull judgement salt sea wife ded afterward made argument wot christ hath hither sent wife sea well sent country fro thence went anone home senatour goth alla see wonder chaunce senatour doth alla great honour hastily sent custance trusteth well lust dance wist wherfore sond vnneth vpon foot might stond alla saw wife faire gret wept ruth see first looke set knew well verely sorrow dombe stant tree heart shet distresse remembered vnkindnesse twice souned owne sight weepeth excuseth pitously god qd hallowes bright wisty soule haue mercy harme guiitlesse mauris sonne like face el fiend fetch place long sobbing bitter pain wofull heart mighten cease great pity heare hem complain throgh plaint gan wo encrese pray labour release may tell wo till morrow wearie speake sorrow finally sooth wist alla guiltlesse wo trow hundred time kist blisse betwixt hem two saue joy lasteth euermo like creature hath seen shall world may dure tho praied husbond meekely releasing pitous paine would pray father specially majestie would encline vouchsafe day dine praied eke way father word say men would say yt child maurice doth message vntill emperour gesse alla nice soueraigne honour christen folke flour send child bette deeme went himselfe may well seeme emperour graunted full gentilly come dinner besought ready came looked busily vpon child doughter thought alla goeth inne ought arraied feast euery wise ferforth cunning may suffice morow came alla gan dresse eke wife emperour mete forth ride ioy gladnesse saw father strete light doune falleth fete father qd young child custance full cleane remembrance doughter custance qd whilome ye han sent surrie father salt see put alone damned die good father mercy crie send heathennesse thanken lord kindnesse pitous joy tellen betwixt hem thre since thus imet tale make end shall day goeth fast woll longer let glad folke dinner ylet ioy blisse meat let hem dwell thousand fold well tell child mauris sithen emperour made pope liued christenly christ church great honour let storie passen custance tale specially old romane jestes men may find mauris life beare mind king alla time sey custance holy wife swete englond come right wey liue joy quiete little lasteth hete ioy world fer time woll abide fro day night chaungeth tide liued euer delite day ne meued either conscience ire talent kin affray enuie pride passion offence ne say end sentence little ioy pleasance lasteth blisse alla custance death taketh hie low rent passed yeare euen gesse world king alla gan hent custance hath full great heauines let v praien god soule blesse dame custance finally say toward toune rome goth way rome come holy creature findeth father whole sound scaped auenture father hath yfound doune knee goeth ground weeping tendernesse heart blithe herieth god hundred thousand sithe vertue holy almes dede liuen neuer asunder wend till death departen hem life lede fareth well tale end iesu christ might may send ioy wo gouerne v grace keepe v place pthe squire prologue host stirrops stoode anon said good men hearkeneth euerichon thriftie tale none sir parish priest qd god bone tell v tale thy forward yore see well ye learned men lore muckle good god dignite parson answerd benedicite eileth man sinfully swere host answerd ienkin ye good men qd host harkneth smell loller wind qd abideth god digne passion shall haue predication loller woll preachen v somewhat nay father soule shall nat saied squier shall nat preach shall gospell glose ne teach leueth great god qd would sowen difficulte spring cockle cleane corne therefore host warne thee beforne jolly body shall tale tell shall ringen merry bell shall waken companie shall philosophie ne physicke ne tearmes queint law little latine maw king arabie sendeth cambuscan king sarra horse sword rare qualitie daughter canace glass ring vertue whereof understandeth language fowl much tale either lost else never finished chaucer squire tale sarra lond tartarie dwelt king warred surrie ther died many doughtie man noble king called cambuscan time great renoun na regioun excellent lord thing lacked nought longeth king sect borne kept lay sworne thereto hardie wise riche pitous alway yliche true word benigne honourable corage centre stable young fresh strong armes desirous batcheler hous faire person fortunate kept alway roiall astate na another man noble king tartre cambuscan two sonnes eltheta wife eldest hight algarsife cleaped camballo doughter worthy king also youngest hight canace tell beaute lithe tong ne conning dare vndertake high thing mine english eke vnsufficient must rethor excellent couth colour longing art discriue every part none mote speake befell cambuscan hath twenty winter borne diademe wont fro yeare yeare denie let feast natiuity doen crien throughout sarra city last idus march yere phebus sunne full jolly clere nigh exaltation marces face mansion aries collerike hote signe full lustie weather benigne foules ayenst sunne shene season yong grene full louden song affection hem seemed han getten hem protection ayen swerd winter kene cold cambuscan haue told roiall vestements sit deis diademe full high paleis held feast roiall riche world na none liche shall tell array would occupie sommers day eke needeth deuise euery course order seruice wol tellen strange sewes ne swan ne heronsewes eke lond tellen knight old meat full dainty hold lond men retch small man may reporten tarie prime fruit losse time vnto first purpose woll haue recourse befell third course king sit thus noblay hearkening minstrals thing play beforne boord deliciously hall doore suddainely came knight steed brasse hond broad mirrour glasse vpon thombe gold ring side naked sword honging vp rideth high bord hall ne spoke word maruaile knight behold full busily waiten yong old straunge knight yt come thus sodenly armed saue head full roially salued king queene lord order sitten hall high reuerence obeisaunce well speech countenaunce gawaine old courtesie though come ayen fairie ne could amend word high bord manly voice saied message forme vsed language without vice sillable letter tale seeme better accordant word chere teacheth art speech hem lere cannot sowne stile ne cannot climben high stile yet say thus comen intent thus much amounteth yt euer ment haue mind saied king araby inde liege lord solemne day salueth best may sendeth honour feest readie heest steed brasse easily well space day naturell say foure twenty houres ye list drought shoures beren body euery place heart willeth pace without weine foule faire ye list fleen aire doth eagle list sore steed shall beare euermore withouten harm till lest though ye sleepen back rest turne writhing pin wrought could full many gin waited many constellation doen operation knew full many seale many bond mirror eke haue mine hond hath might men may see shall fallen aduersitee vnto reigne selfe also openly see friend fo ouer lady bright hath set heart manner wight false shall treason see new loue subteltee openly shall nothing hide wherefore againe lusty summer tide mirrour ring ye may se hath sent lady canace excellent doughter vertue ring ye woll list vpon thombe purse bere foule fleeth heuen ne shall vnderstond steuen know meaning openly plaine answere language againe euery grasse groweth vpon root shall wel know wol boot wound neuer deepe wide naked swerd hangeth side vertue hath yt man ye smite throughout armure woll kerue bite thicke braunched oke man yt wounded stroke shall neuer hole till list grace stroken ye platte thilke place hurt much saine ye mote plat swerd againe stroken ye wound woll close sooth withouten glose faileth while hold kniyt hath thus tale told rideth hall doun light steed shone sunne bright stant court still stone knight chamber sadde anone vnarmed meat ysette present full rich yfette sain swerd eke mirrour borne anon high tour certaine officer ordained therefore canace ring bore solemnely sat table sikerly without fable horse brasse may remeued stant ground yglewed may man place driue none engine windlas poliue cause cannot craft therefore place han laft till yt knight hath taught hem ye manere voiden ye shall great ye prees swarmed fro gauren hors stondeth high broad long well proportioned strong right steed lombardie therewith horsly quicke eie gentle courser poile certes fro tale ere nature ne art coud amend degree people wend euermore wonder couth gon bra fairie people semed diuers folke diuersly demed many head many wit murmure doth swarme maden skils fantasy rehearsing old poetry saied ylike pegase hors wing flee el greekes hors sinon brought troy destruction men old bookes rede mine heart qd one euermore drede trow men armes therein shapen hem citie win right good yt thing know rowned felaw low saied lied rather like apparence made magike iogglours plaien feast great sundry thought thus iangle treat leaud people deemeth commonly thing made subtilly leaudnesse comprehend demen gladly badder end hem wondren mirrour born vp maister tour men mighten thing see another answered certes might well bee naturally composition angel slie reflection saiden rome speaken alhazen vitellion aristotle writeth liues queint mirrours prospecttues knowen han bookes heard folk han wondred sweard would piercen euery thing fell speech telephus king achilles queint spere couth heale dere right wise men may ye swerd right ye haue selue herd speaken sundry harding mettall speaken medicine eke withall hardened vnknow algate tho speake canaces ring saiden wonder thing craft ring heard neuer non saue moses king salamon name cunning art thus sain people drawen hem apart nathelesse saiden wonder make ferne ashen glas yet glas like ashen ferne han knowen ferne therefore ceaseth iangling wonder sore wandren cause thunder ebbe floud gossomer mist thing till cause wist thus ianglen demen deuise till king gan fro boord arise phebus hath left angle meridionall yet ascending beest royall gentle lion aldrean tartre king cambuscan rose bord fat full hie beforne goth loud minstralcie till came chamber paraments sownen diuers instrument like heuen dauncen lusty venus child dere fish lady sat full hie looketh hem friendly eie noble king set vpon trone straunge knight fet full sone daunce goeth canace reuell iolite able dull man deuise must han know loue seruise feestliche man fresh may deuise array couth tellen ye forme daunces vncouth fresh countenaunces subtill looking dissimulings dread jealous men apperceiuings ne man launcelot dead therefore passe ouer lusty head say iollinesse lete hem till men supper dresse steward biddeth spice hie eke wine melodie vshers squire ygone spice wine comen anone eten dronken end vnto temple reason wend seruice done soupen day needeth rehearsen array man wot well king feast plenty least dainty mo knowing supper goeth noble king seen horse brasse rout lord lady wondring horse bra sithen great siege troy men wondred horse also ne wondring tho finally king asketh knight vertue horse night praied tell gouernaunce horse anon gan trip daunce yt knight laid hond raine said sir saine list riden ye mote trill pin stant ere shall tell betweene v two ye mote nempne place also country list ride ye come list abide bid discend trill another pin therein lieth effect gin woll downe discend done place woll abide still though al ye world contrary sworne shall thence ythrow ne yborne listen bid thence gone trill pin woll vanish anone sight euery manner wight come ayen day night list clepen againe guise shall saine betwixt full sone ride list ni done enfourmed ye king knight hath conceiued wit aright manner forme thing full glad full blith noble king repaireth reuell beforne bridie toure yborne kept among iewels lefe dere horse vanished mannere sight ye get thus lete lust iolite cambuscan lord feasting till well nigh day began spring explicit prima par sequitur par secunda noryce digestion sleepe gan hem winke bad hem take keepe mirth drink labour woll haue rest galping mouth hem kest said time lie adoun blood dominatioun cherisheth blood nature friend qd hee thanken galping two three euery wight gan drawen rest sleepe hem bade chey tooke best dreames shul ben ytold full heed fumosite causeth dreames charge sleepen soundly till prime large part canace full measurable woman father take leue gone rest soone eue list apalled morrow vnfestliche see slept first slepe awoke joy heart tooke queynt ring mirrour twenty time chaunged colour slepe right impression mirrour vision wherfore sunne vp gan glide cleped maistresses beside said lust arise old woman gladly wise maistresse answerd anon said madam whider woll ye gon thus early folke rest woll quoth arise lest lenger slepe walken maistresse cleped woman great rout vp risen wel ten twelue vp riseth fresh canace selue ioly bright yong sunne ram foure degree vp runne higher whan ready forth walked easie paas arrayed lusty season sote lightly playen walken foote nought fiue sixe meyne trenche fer parke goeth vapor fro earth glode maketh sunne seem ruddy brode nathelesse faire sight made heart light season morowning foules herde sing right anon wiste ment right song knew al entent knot euery tale tolde taried till lust colde hem han hearkened yore sauour passeth euer lenger fulsumnes prolixite reason thinketh vnto knot condiscende make walking sone ende amidde tre dry white chalke canace playing walke sat falcon ouer head full hie pitious voyce gan cry wood resouned cry beaten selfe pitously wing till reed blood ran endlong tre stood euer one cryed shright becke seluen pight na tygre ne cruell beast dwelleth wood neither forrest nolde han wept wepe coud sorrow shright alway loud neuer yet man liue couthe falcon well discriue herde another fayrenes wel plumage gentilnes shape might irekened falcon peregryn seemed fremd lond euermore stood swounded lacke blood til welny fallen fro tree faire king doughter canace finger bare queint ring vnderstood wel euery thing foule may leden saine coud answere leden againe hath vnderstand falcon seyd welny routhe almost deyd tree goeth full hastily falcon gan looke pitously held lap abroad well wist falcon must fallen twist whan yt swouned next lacke blood long waiten stood till last spake manere vnto hauke ye shallen cause tell ye ben furiall paine hell qd canace vnto hauke aboue sorow death losse loue trow ben cause two causen gentil heart wo harme nedeth speake ye selfe vpon selfe wreake proueth well either ire dread mote ben encheson cruel deed syn se none wight chace ye loue god doeth selfe grace may helpe west east ne saw neuer er bird ne beast farde himselue pitously ye slea sorrow verily haue great compassioun god loue come fro tree adowne king daughter trew verily cause knew disease lay might would amend certes night wisely help great god kind hearbes also shall right ynough find heale hurt hastily tho shright falcon yet pitously er fell ground anone lyeth swoune deed stone til canace lappe itake vnto time gan swoune awake swoune abreyd right haukes leden thus seyd pity renneth soone gentle hert feeling similitude paine smert proued day men may see well werke authorite gentle heart keepeth gentlenesse see well ye haue distresse compassion faire canace womanly benignite nature principle hath set none hope fare bet obey vnto heart free make beware mee whelpe chastised lion right cause conclusion haue leysure space mine harme woll confessen pace euer one sorrow told wept water wold till faucon bad still sike thus said till bred ala ilke day fostred roche marble gray tenderly nothing aileth ne wist aduersite till coud flie full high vnder skie dwelt tercelet fast seemed well gentlenesse full treason falsenesse wrapped vnder humble chere hew trouth manere vnder pleasaunce vnder busie pain wight coud haue wend coud fain deepe greyne died colour right serpent hideth vnder flour till may see time bite right god loues hypocrite doth ceremony obeysaunce dissimuling fair assemblaunce souneth vnto gentlenesse loue tombe faire aboue vnder corse ye wote hypocrite cold hote wise serued intent saue fiend non wist ment till long weeped complained many yeare seruice fained till mine hert pitous nice innocent cruell mallice ferd death thought vpon othes surete graunted loue vpon conditioun euermore mine honour renoun saued preuy apert say desert yaue mine hert thought god wote none wise nought tooke hert chaunge mine aye sooth said gone sithen many day true wight theefe thinketh one saw thing fer igone graunted fully loue guise haue said aboue yeuen true heart free swore yafe heart mee anon tigre full doublenesse fell knee deuout humblesse high reuerence eke chere like gentle louer manere rauished seemed joy neuer troylus ne paris troy iason certes ne none man since lamech alder first began louen two writen folke beforne ne neuer sithen adam borne ne couth man twenty thousand part counterfeit sophimes art ne worthy vnbocle galoche ther doublenesse faining approach ne couth thanke wight manner heauen see woman neuer wise painteth chere point deuise well word countenaunce loued obeysaunce trouth demed hert thing smert neuer lite wist thought felt death hart twist shortly ferforth thing went wils instrument say obeied thing farre reason fill keeping bound worship euer ne neuer thing lefe ne leuer god wot ne neuer shall mo lasteth lenger yeare two supposed nothing good finally thus last stood fortune would must twin place whereof wo question cannot make description thing dare tell boldely know paine death thereby harme felt ne might bleue day tooke leue sorrowfully eke wend verily felt much harme heard speak saw hew natheles thought trew eke repaire againe within little sooth saine reason would eke must go honour oft happeth made vertue necessite tooke well sith must need best might hid fro sorrow took hond iohn borow said thus lo beth haue ben shall answerd needeth reherse sain bet wers hath al wel isaid hath done therefore behoueth long spoone shal eaten fiend thus herd say last mote forth way forth fleeth till come lest come purpose rest trow thilke text mind thing repairing kind gladeth hemselue thus sain men gesse men louen kind newfanglenesse bird done men cage feed thogh thou night day take hem heed straw cage faire soft silke giue hem sugre hony bread milke yet right anon dore vp foot would sporne adoun cup wood would wormes eat newfangle ben meat louen nouelries proper kind gentlenesse blood may hem bind ferd tercelet ala day tho gentle borne fresh gay goodly see humble free saw vpon time kite flee suddainly loued kite loue cleane fro go hath trouth falsed wise thus hath kite loue seruice lorne without remedy yt word faucon gan cry swouned oft canaces barme great sorow hawkes harme canace woman made nist might faucon glade canace home heareth lap softly plaisters gan wrap beck hurt selue cannot canace herbes delue ground make salues new herbes precious fine hew helen hawke fro day night doeth businesse might bed head made mew couered veluets blew signe trouth woman seene without mew painted greene painted false foules ben tidefes tercelet owles right despight painted hem beside pyes fele hem cry chide thus leaue canace hauke keeping woll speake ring till come eft purpose sain faucon got loue againe repentaunt storie telleth v mediation camballus king sonne haue told henceforth woll processe hold speaken auentures battails yet neuer herd gret maruails first woll tell cambuscan time many city wan wan thedora wife woll speake algarsife full oft great perill ne ben holpen horse bra woll speake camballo fought list brother two canace ere might win left woll againe begin explicit secunda par apollo whirleth vp chare hie till god mercurius house flie pthere found foresaid tale hath sought diver place phere followeth word marchaunt squier word host marchaunt faith squier thou hast thee well yquit gentely praise well thy wit qd marchaunt considering thine youth feelingly thou speakest thee alouth doome none eloquence shall thy pere yt thou liue god giue ye right good chaunce vertue send thee perseuerance thy speaking haue great deinte haue sonne trinite leuer twenty poundsworth lond though fallen hond man discretion ye ben fie possession man vertuous withall haue sonne snibbed yet shall vertue listeth intend play dise spend lese hath vsage leuer talke page commune gentle wight might learne gentlenesse aright straw gentlenesse qd host marchant pardy full well thou wost ech mote tellen lest tale two breaken behest know well qd ye marchant certain pray haue disdain though man speake word two tell thy tale withouten word mo gladly sir host qd woll obey vnto hearkeneth sey woll contrary wise farre wit may suffice pray god may pleasen wot well good ynow marchants prologue weeping wailing care sorrow haue ynow euen eke morrow qd marchant haue mo wedded trow well wot fareth haue wife worst may though fiend coupled wold ouermatch dare well swere rehearse speciall high malice shrew long large difference betwixt grisilds great patience wife passing cruelte vnbound mote thee would neuer eft come snare wedded men liue sorrow care assay woll shall find say sooth saint thomas inde part say god sheild befall ah good sir host haue wedded moneths two parde yet trow life hath wedded though men rife heart ne couth mannere tell much sorrow coud tell wiues cursednesse qd host marchant god blesse since ye ben much know art full heartily pray tell v part gladly qd mine owne sore sorry heart tell may pthe marchants tale old january marrieth young may unequal match receiveth foul reward whylome dwelling lumbardie worthy knight born pauie liued great prosperite sixtie yere wife lesse man followed aye bodily delite woman appetite done fooles ben seculeres past sixtie yeres holinesse dotage cannot saine great corage knight ben wedded man day night doth espie wedded might praying lord graunten mighten knowen blisfull life betwixt husbond wife liuen vnder holy bond god first man woman bond none life said worth beane wedlocke easie cleane world paradise thus saith old knight wise certainely south god king take wife glorious thing namely man old hore wife fruit tresore take yong wife faire might engendren heire lead life joy sollace whereas batchelers singen ala finden aduersite loue ni child vanite truly sit well batchelers han oft paine wo brotell ground bilden brotelnesse find freelte wenen secrenesse liue liuen bird bestes liberty vnder nice arestes wedded man estate liueth life blisfully ordinate vnder yoke mariage ybound well may heart joy blisse abound buxome wife true eke tentise keep sicke hole make wele wo nill forsake ni weary loue serue though hee lie bedred till sterue yet clerkes sain theophrast one tho force though theophrast list lie ne take wife qd husbondrie spare houshold thy dispence true seruaunt doeth diligence thy good keep doth thine wife woll claime halfe part life thou sick god saue thy owne friend true knaue woll keepe thee better yt waiteth aye thy good hath done many day thou take thee wife vntrew full oftentime shall thee sore rew sentence hundred sithes worse writeth man god bone curse take keepe vanite defieth theophrast hearkeneth wife god yeft verely manner yefts hardely londs rent pasture commune mouables ben yefts fortune passen shaddow wall dread plainely speake shall wife woll last thine house endure well lenger thee list peraduenture mariage full great sacrament hath wife hold shent liueth helplesse desolate speake folke seculer estate herkneth say nought woman man helpe ywrought high god adam maked saw alone belly naked god great goodnesse said let v maken helpe man like himselfe made eue may ye see hereby may ye preue wife man helpe comfort paradice terrestre disport buxome vertuous must need liuen vnite one flesh ben two soules gesse nat one heart wele distresse wife ah saint mary benedicite might man haue aduersite hath wife certes cannot say blisse betwixt hem twey may tongue tellen heart thinke poore helpeth swinke keepeth good wasteth neuer dell husbond lust liketh well saith nay saith ye saith ready sir saith blisfull order wedloke precious thou art merry eke vertuous commended approued eke euery man halt worth leke vpon bare knee ought life thanken god hath sent wife pray god dayly send wife last vnto liues end life set sikernesse may deceiued gesse werch wiues rede may boldly bearen vp hede beene euer true also wise thou wilt werchen wise alway woman woll thee rede lo iacob clerkes rede good counsaile mother rebecke bounden kid skin necke father beneson wan lo iudith storie tell wise counsaile god people kept slue holofernes slept abigail counsaile saved husbond naball haue slain looke hester also good counsaile deliuered wo people god made mardochee assure enhaunsed ni nothing gree superlatife saith seneck aboue humble wife suffer thy wife tongue caton bit shall command thou shalt suffer yet woll obey courtesie wife keeper thine husbondrie well may sicke man still waile weep ni wife house keep warne thee wisely thou wilt werch loue thy wife christ loueth cherch thou loue thy selfe thou louest thy wife man hateth flesh life fostreth therefore bid thee cherish thy wife thou shalt neuer ythee husbond wife men yape play wordly folke hold seker way knit may none harm betide namely vpon wiues side ianuary told considred hath dayes old lusty life vertuous quiete mariage hony swete friend day sent tellen hem theffect intent face sad tale hath hem told saied good friend hore old almost god wot pit brinke vpon soule somewhat must thinke haue body folily dispended blessed god shall ben amended woll ben certain wedded man anon hast vnto maid faire tender age pray shapeth mariage suddainly woll abide woll fonden espie side may wedded hastily much ye ben ye shullen rather thing espien lust best alien one thing warn friend dere woll none old wife haue mannere shall passe fifteen yere certaine old fish young flesh woll haue faine better qd pike pikereell bet old beefe tender veell woll woman thirtie winter age ni beanstraw great forage eke old widdows god wote connen much craft wade bote much broken harm hem lest hem neuer liue rest sundry schooles maketh subtill clerkes woman many schooles halfe clerke certainely young thing may men gie right men may warm wax hand plie wherefore say plainly clause nill none old wife haue cause mischaunce couth haue pleasaunce lead life aduoutrie streight devill die ne child none geten yet leuer hound eaten mine heritage fall straunge honds thus tell dote wot cause men wedden furthermore wot speaketh many man mariage wot doth page cause man take wife may liue chast life take wife great deuotion lefull procreation child honour god aboue paramour loue shoulden letcherie eschue yeeld debt due man helpen mischeefe suster brother liuen chastity full heauenly sir leaue god thanked dare make auaunt feele lims hole sufficiaunt doen man belongeth wot selue best may though hore fare doth tree blossometh ere fruit ywox bee blossomd tree neither drie ne dead feele hore head mine heart lims greene laurell yeare seene sithen ye han heard mine intent pray ye woll assent diuers men diuersly hem told mariage many example old blameth praiseth certaine last shortly saine day falleth alteration betwixt friend disputation fell strife betwixt brother two one cleaped placebo iustinus soothly called placebo saied ianuarie brother full little need han ye lord dere counsaile aske ye full sapience ne liketh high prudence waiue fro word salomon word saieth vnto euerichone worke thing counsaile thus saied hee shalt thou repent thee tho salomon speake word mine owne deare brother lord wisely god soul bring ease rest hold owne counsaile best brother mine take motife haue court man life god wot though vnworthy bee haue stonden full great degree abouten lord full great estate yet neuer none hem debate neuer hem contraried truly wot well lord saith hold firme stable say el thing semblable full great foole counsailour serueth lord high honour dare presume thinke counsaile passe lord wit nay lord fooles sweare fay ye haue selfe spoken day high sentence holy well consent confirme euery dell word opinioun god ni man toun ne italie coud better haue saied christ holdeth full well apaied truly high courage man stopen age take yong wife father kin heart hongeth jolly pin doth matter right lest finally hold best iustinus aye still sat herd right wise placebo answerd brother mine patient pray sith ye haue said hearkneth say senecke among word wise saith man ought well auise yeueth lond cattell sithens ought auise right well giue good away fro well much ought auised giue bodie alway warne well child play take wife without auisement men must inquire mine assent wheder sober wise dronkelew proud way shrew chider waster thy good rich poore el man wood man find shall none world trotteth hole ne man ne beast men deuise natheles ought inough suffice wife mo good thewes vice bad asketh leisure enquere god wot haue wept many tere full priuily sith wife praise woll wedded man life certaine find cost care obseruaunces bliss bare yet god wot neighbour namely woman many rout saine stedfast wife eke meekest one beareth life wot best wringeth shoe ye may right list doe auise ye man age ye entren mariage namely yong wife faire made water earth aire yongest man rout busie ynow bring haue wife alone trusteth ye shall pleasen yeres thre sain doen pleasaunce wife asketh full much obseruaunce pray ye euill apaid well qd ianuary hast thou said straw thy seneck thy prouerbes count worth pannier herbes schoole termes wiser men thou thou hast heard assenteth right purpose placebo say ye say cursed man qd letteth matrimonie sekerly word risen suddainly ben assented fully wedded list would high fantasie curiousnesse fro day day gan soule empresse ianuary marriage many faire shap many faire visage ther passeth thrugh heart night night tooke mirrour polished bright set common market place see many figure pace mirrour wise gan ianuary within thought deuise maiden dwellen beside wist might best abide one beauty face another stont people grace sadnesse benignite people greatest voice rich bad name nathelesse betwixt earnest game last appointed one let heart gone chese owne authoritee loue blind day may see bed ybrought puttreid heart thought fresh beauty age tender middle small armes long slender wise gouernance gentlenesse womanly bearing sadnesse condiscended thouyt choise might ben amended concluded thought ech men wit bad impossible replie ayenst choice fantasie friend sent instaunce prayeth hem done yt pleasaunce hastily would come would bredgen labour needeth go ne ride appointed would abide placebo came eke friend soone alder first bad hem boone none hem none argument make ayenst purpose hath ytake purpose pleasant god said ground prosperite said maiden toune beautie hath great renoune small degre sufficeth youth beautie maid said would haue wife liuen ease holinesse life thanked god yt might hauen wight blisse parten shall praieth hem labour need shapeth faile speed saied spirit ease qd nothing may displease saue thing pricketh conscience woll rehearse presence haue qd heard say full yore ago may man haue perfite bliss two say yearth eke heauen though kept fro sinnes seuen eke euery braunch thilke tree yet perfit prosperitee great ease lust mariage euer agast mine age shall lead mery life delicate without wo strife shall haue mine heauen earth sithen heauen bought deere tribulation great penaunce liuing pleasaunce wedded men doen wiues come yt blisse ther christ eterne liue drede ye brother tweie assoileth question preie iustinus hated folly answerd anon right yaperie would long tale abrege would non authoritie allege saied sir non obstacle god hie miracle mercy may werch er ye han right holy cherch ye may repent wedded man life ye sain neither wo ne strife el god forbid sent wedded man grace repent well rather single man therefore sir best rede despeireth haue memory parauenture may purgatory may god meane god whip shall soule vp heauen skip swifter doth arrow bow hope god hereafter ye shall know ni none great felicite mariage ne neuer none shall shall let saluation ye vse skil reason lust wife attemperatly ye please nat amorously ye keep eke sin tale done wit thin beth agast hereof deare brother wade fro matter another wife bathe ye vnderstand mariage ye haue hand declareth full well litle space fareth well god haue grace word iustine brother han take leaue ech whan saw must need wrought wise slie treate faire maide may hight hastily euer might shall wedded ianuary trow long tary told euery escrite bond feossed lond herken rich aray finally icomen day cherch tway ben went receiue holy sacrament forth cometh priest stole necke bad like sara rebeck wisedome truth marriage saied orison vsage crouched hem bad god shuld hem bles made seker inow holines thus wedded solemnitie feast sitteth worthy folke vpon deies full joy blisse palaies full instrument vittaile deintiest itaile beforne stood instrument soun orpheus ne thebe amphion ne made neuer melodie euery course came loude ministralcie neuer ioab tromped neither theodomas yet halfe clere thebe whan city dout bacchus wine hem skinketh venus laugheth euery wight ianuarie become knight would assain corage liberte eke mariage firebrond hond daunceth bride rout certainly dare well say right emenius god wedding saw neuer mery wedded man hold thou thy peace thou poet marcian writest v ilke wedding mery philologie mercurie song mus song small thy pen eke thy tongue discriuen marriage whan tender youth hath wedded stooping age mirth may written assaieth self may ye witten lie non matere may sit benigne chere behold seemed feire queen hester looked neuer eie assuere meeke looke hath may deuise beautie thus much beautie tell may like bright morow may fulfilde beautie plesaunce ianuarie rauished traunce euery time looked face heart gan manace yt night arm would strein harder euer paris helein natheles yet great pittie thilke night offenden must thought ala tender creature would god ye might well endure corage sharpe kene agast ye shall nat sustene god forbid might would god waxen night night would last euer mo would people ago finally doth labour best might sauing honour hast hem fro meat subtill wise time came reason rise men dauncen drinke fast spice house cast full joy blisse euery man squire hight damian carfe knight many day rauisht lady may paine nie wood almost swelt swounded stood sore hath venus hurt wich brand fresh thereto licand bed went hastily time speake let weep inow plaine till fresh may woll rewen paine perilous fire bedsraw bredeth familiar foe seruice bedeth seruaunt traytour false homely hew like adder slie bosome vntrue ianuary drunken pleasaunce god shilde v iniquitaunce mariage see damian thine owne squire eke thy borne man entendeth doen thee villanie god graunt thee thine homely foe espie world ni wers pestilence homely foe day thy presence parformed hath sunne arke diurne lenger may body soiourne orisont latitude night mantill darke rude gan spred hemisperie aboue departed lustie rout fro ianuary thonke euery side home house lustely ride doen thing hem lest whan saw time go rest sone lustie ianuarie woll go bed would longer tary drinketh ipocras clarrie vernage spice hot encrease corage many lectuarie full fine cursed monke dan constantine hath written booke coitu eten hem al nolde nothing eschew thus priuie friend saied god loue sone may let voyd house curteis wise sone men drinken trauers drew anon hasted ianuarie must done bride brought bed stil ston whan bed priest iblessed chamber euery wight hem dressed ianuary hath fast armes take fresh may paradise make lulleth kisseth full oft thicke bristle beard vnsoft like skin houndfish sharp brere shaue new manere rubbeth vpon tender face sayed thus ala mote trespace spouse greatly offend time come woll doune discend
