nathelesse considreth quoth ni workeman whatsoeuer may wirch well hastely woll doen leiser perfectly force long play true wedlocke coupled tway blessed yoke act mow sin man may sin wife ne yet hurt knife haue leaue play v law thus laboureth till day gan daw taketh soppe fine clarre vpright bed sitteth singeth full loud clere kist wife maketh wanton chere coltish full ragerie full gergon flecked pie slacke skin necke shaketh yt sang chaunteth craketh god wot may thoght hert whan saw vp sitting shert night cap necke leane prayseth playing worth bean sayed thus rest woll take day come may lenger wake layed head slept till prime afterward saw time vp riseth ianuarie fresh may holdeth chamber fourth day vsage wiues best euery labour sometime mote haue rest el long may endure say liues creature fish beast brid man woll speake wofull damian langureth loue ye shall therefore speake manere say sely damian ala answer demaund caas shalt thou thy lady fresh may tell thy wo woll alway say nay eke thou speake woll thy wo bewray god thine help better say sicke damian venus fire brenneth dieth desire put life aduenture lenger might wise endure priuily penner gan borrow letter wrote sorrow manner complaint lay vnto faire fresh lady may purse silke honging shert hath put layed hert moone moonetide ilke day ianuarie iwedded fresh may taure cankre gleden long hath may chamber bidden custome vnto noble bride shall eaten hall till day foure three least passed let go feast fourth day complete fro noone noone whan high masse idoon hall sat ianuary may fresh bright somers day befell good man remembreth vpon damian saied saint mary may damian entendeth aie sicke may betide squire stoden beside excused sicknesse letted doen besinesse none cause might make tary forthinketh qd ianuary gentle squire trouth died harme routh wise discreet secree man wote degree thereto manly seruiceable thrifty man right able meat soone euer may woll selfe visit eke may doen comfort word blessed euery man bounty gentlenesse would comforten distresse squire gentle deed dame qd ianuary take good heed meat ye woman whan ye haue ben chamber hall ye gone see damian doeth disport gentleman tellen woll visite haue nothing rested alite speed fast woll abide till sleepen fast side word gan call squire marshall hall told certaine thing would fresh may hath streight way ihold woman vnto damian downe bed side sat comforting goodly may damian whan time say secret wise purse eke bill written hath put honde withouten saue sighed wonderous deep sore sothly right thus sayed mercie ye discouer nat dead thing kid purse hath bosome hid went way ye get vnto ianuary icome bed side sit full soft taketh kisseth full oft layed sleep anon fained must gon ther ye wote euery wight need whan bill hath taken heed rent clout last priuie sothly cast studieth faire fresh may downe ianuary lay slept till cough hath awaked anon prayed strip naked would said haue pleasance said clothes encombrance obeieth lefe loth lest yt precious folk wroth wrought dare nat tell wheder thought paradise hell let hem worch wise till euen song ring must arise destenie aduenture influence nature constellation estate heauen stood time fortunate put bill venus werkes thing hath time saien clerkes woman get loue cannot say great god aboue knoweth non act causeles deme woll hold pee soth fresh may hath take impression day pittie sicke damian fro heart driuen ne remembrance doen ease certain thouyt thing displease recke assure loue best creature though shert lo pittie renneth sone gentle hert may ye see excellent franchise woman whan hem narow auise tyraunt many one hath heart hard stone would haue letten sterue place well rather haue granted grace rejoyced cruel pride haue recked homicide gentle maie fulfilled pittie right hond letter made graunted grace lacked nought onely time place might lust suffice shall right woll deuise whan saw time vpon day visit damian goth faire maie subtilly letter downe thrust vnder pillow read lust taketh hond hard twist secretly wight wist bad whole forth went ianuary sent vp riseth damian next morow passed sicknesse sorowe kembeth proineth piketh doth lady lust liketh eke ianuary goeth low euer dog bow pleasaunt euery man craft euery wight fain speken good fully lady grace stood thus let damian need tale forth woll proceed clerkes holden felicite stont delite therefore certain hee noble ianuarie might honest wise longeth knight shope liue full deliciously housing array honestly degree made king among honest thing garden walled stone fayre garden neuer none doubt verily suppose wrote romant rose ne couth beautie well deuise ne priapus ne might suffise though god garden tell beautie garden well stont vnder laurer alway green full oft time king pluto queen proserpina fayrie disporten hem maken melodie well daunced men told noble knight ianuarie old deinte hath walke play woll suffer wight bear ye kay saue himselfe small wicket bare alway siluer clicket yt list ne would vnshet would pay wife det summer season thider would go maie wife wight two thing yt done bed garden perfourmed hem sped wise many mery day liued ianuarie fresh may worldly joy may alway endure ianuarie ne liuing creature sudden hap thou fortune vnstable like scorpion diceiuable flattrest thy head thou wolt sting thy tale deth thrugh thine enuenoming brotell joy sweet poyson queint monster suddenly canst peint thy gift vnder hew stedfastnesse thou deceiuest lesse hast thou ianuary thus deceiued haddest thy friend receiued thou hast beraft eyen sorow desireth dyen ala noble ianuarie free amidde lust prosperitie woxen blind suddenly death therefore desireth vtterly therewithall fire jelousie lest wife fall folly brent heart would full faine man slaine neuer death ne life ne would loue ne wife euer liue widdow clothes blacke sole turtle doth yt hath lost make last moneth tway sorow gan swage soth say whan wist might non paciently tooke aduersite saue doubt may nat forgone na ielous euer one jelousie outragious neither hall ne none house ne none place neuer mo nolde suffer neither ride ne go honde alway full often wepeth fresh may loued damian benignely mote either die sodainely mote haue lest waiteth whan heart brest vpon side damian become sorowfullest man euer neither night ne day ne might speake word fresh may purpose matere ianuary must hand vpon euermo natheles writing fro priuie signes wist ment knew signes entent ianuary might thee auaile tho thou mightest see far ship saile good blind man disceived disceiued may see lo argus hundred eien euer couth pore prien yet blent god wot ben mo wenen wisely passe ouer ease say fresh may spake yore warme waxe hath printed clicket ianuary bare small wicket vnto garden oft went damian knew intent clicket counterfeited priuily ni say hastily wonder clicket shall betide ye shall heren ye woll abide noble ouid sooth sayest thou god wote flight loue long hote nill find manere pyramus thisbe may men lere thogh kept ful long streit ouer ben accorded rowning wall ni wight couth find sleight purpose ere day eight passed ere month iuly befill ianuary hath caught great egging wife play garden wight tway morrow vnto may said hee rise vp wife loue lady free turtle voice heard lady swete winter gone raines wete come forth thine eyen columbine fairer thy brest wine garden enclosed come forth white spouse dout thou hast wounded hert wife spot thee na thy life come forth let v taken disport chese thee wife comfort old leaud word vsed vnto damian signe made go clicket damian hath opened wicket stert manere wight might see ne still sat vnder bush anone ianuary blind stone may hand wight mo fresh garden go clapt wicket suddainly wife qd ni thou art creature best loue lord sit v aboue leuer dien knife thee offend dere true wife god sake thinke thee chees couetise ne good doubtles loue thee though old may see true woll tell certes three thing shall ye win thereby first loue christ selfe honour mine heritage toune tour giue maketh charter ye list shall done morrow ere sunne rist wisely god soule bring blisse pray couenaunt ye kisse though jelous wite nought ye deepe imprinted thought consider beaute withall vnlikely elde may certes though die forbeare ben companie loue withouten dout kisse wife let v rome fresh may word herd benignely ianuarie answerd first forward began weepe haue qd soule keepe well ye also mine honour wifehood ilke tender flour haue ensured hond priest body bond wherefore woll answere manere leaue lord dere pray god neuer daw day ne sterue foule woman may euer kin shame el empaire name false lacke strip put sacke next riuer drench gentlewoman wench speke ye thus men ben euer vntrew woman haue reproofe aye new ye none communing leue speak v vntrust repreue yt word saw damian sat bush kneele began finger signes made damian climbe vpon tre charged fruite vp went verily knew intent euery signe couth make well bet ianuarie owne make letter told matter werch shall thus let sit pery ianuarie maie roming full mery bright day blew firmament phebus gold doun hath streames sent gladen every flour warmenesse time gemini gesse little fro declination causer ioues exaltation befell bright morow tide garden side pluto king fayrie many ladie companie following wife queene proserpine ech right line while gadred floures mead claudian ye may story read grisely cart fet king fayrie adoune set vpon bench turues fresh greene right anon thus said queene wife qd may nat say nay experience proveth euery day treason woman doth man ten hundred thousand story tell notable vntrouth brotelnesse salomon richest richesse fulfild sapience worldly glory full worthy ben thy word memory euery wight wit reason thus praiseth bounty man among thousand men yet found one woman found neuer none thus saith ye king yt knoweth wickednesse iesus filius sirach gesse ne speaketh selde reuerence wild fire corrupt pestilence fall upon body yet night ne see ye honourable knight ala blind old owne man shall maken cuckold lo sit letchour tree woll graunt maiestie vnto old blind worthy knight shall haue eye sight wife would done vilanie shall know harlotrie reprefe mo ye shall qd proserpine woll ye mother soule sir swere shall yeuen sufficient answere woman sake though gilt ytake face bolde shullen hemselue excuse bear hem would hem accuse lacke answere non hem shull dien see thing eyen yet woman visage hardely weepe swere chide subtilly ye shall leude gee recketh authoritees wote well iewe salomon found v woman fooles many one though ne found good woman yet hath found many man woman full true full good vertuous witnes hem dwell christes house martyrdom preued constance romain iests eke make remembrance many true wife also sir wroth thogh said found good woman pray take sentence man meant thus soueraign bounte none god sitteth trinite eye god ni one make ye much salomon though made temple god house though rich glorious made temple false godis might thing yt fore forbod parde faire ye name emplaster lechour idolaster elde god forsooke god nad saith booke yspared father sake haue lost reigne soner would iset nat villanie ye woman write butterflie woman need speake el swell till mine heart breake sithen said iangleresses euer mote hole broke tress shall spare curtesie speak hem harm would v villanie dame qd pluto lenger wroth giue vp sith swore mine oth would graunt sight ayen word shall stand yt warne certeine king set lie quoth queen fairie answere shall haue vndertake let v mo word hereof make forsoth longer contrary let v turne againe ianuarie garden faire maie singeth merier popingay loue best shall non long alleyes gon till commen ayenst thilke pery damian sitteth full mery high among fresh leues green fresh maie bright shene gan sike said ala side sir qd ought may betide must haue peer see mote die sore longeth eten small peer greene help hir loue heauens queen tell well woman plite may haue fruite great appetite may dyen haue ala qd ne knaue couth climbe ala ala qd blinde ye sir force qd would ye vouchsafe god sake pery armes take well wot ye mistrust would climbe well ynough qd foote might set vpon backe forsooth said shall lacke might helpe mine hart blood stoupeth back stood caught twist vp goth lady pray ye wroth nat glose rude man sodainely anon damian gan pullen vp smocke throng great tent thrifty long said meriest fit euer life yet lord tent serueth nothing thus foldeth twifold sweet iesus may swiue worth leke yet full gentill full meke leuer euensong pluto saw wrong ianuary gaue againe sight made see well euer might whan caught sight againe ne neuer man thing faine wife thought euer mo vp tree cast eyen two saw damian wife dressed mannere may expressed would speak vncurtesly vp yaf roring cry doth mother child shall die helpe ala harow gan cry sorrow almost gan die wife swiued pery strong lady whore doest thou answered sir ayleth haue patience reason minde haue holpen eyen blinde vp peril soule shall nat lien taught help eyen nothing bet make see strogle man vpon tree god wot full good entent strogle qd ye algate went stiffe round bell wonder though thy belly swell thy smocke breast lay thech stil thought pointed brech god giue shame death dien swiued thee saw mine eyen el honged halse qd medicine false certainely ye might see ye would say word vnto ye haue glimsing perfit sight see qd well euer might thanked god mine eyen two trouth thought ye mase ye mase good sir quoth thanke haue made see ala quoth euer kind dame qd let al passe mind come sefe haue missaid god helpe euill apaid father soule wende haue seyn damian thee lyen thy smocke lyen vpon brest ye sir qd ye may wene ye lest sir man waketh sleep may suddenly well taken kepe vpon thing ne se perfectly till adawed verily right man long hath blinde ne may suddainly well ysee first sight new comen hath day two ysain till sight istabled awhile may full many sight begile beware pray heauen king full many man weneth see thing another seemeth misconceiueth oft misdemeth word lept fro ye tree ianuarie glad kisseth cleppeth full oft wombe stroketh full oft paleis home hath lad good men pray beth ye glad thus endeth tale ianuarie god blesse v mother marie wife bathe prologue experience though none authoritie world right ynow speak wo mariage lordings sith twelue yeres age thanked god eterne liue husbonds chirche dore haue fiue often haue ywedded worthy men degree told long ago iwis sithen christ went neuer oni wedding cane galilee thilke ensample taught ne wedded one lo sharpe word none beside well iesu god man spake reprefe samaritan thou hast fiue husbonds quoth ilke man hath thee thyn husbond thus said certain meant hereby sain aske point fift man nat husbond samaritan many might haue marriage yet herd neuer tellen mine age vpon number true definitioun men may deuine glosen vp well wot expresse without lie god bad v wex multiplie gentle text well vnderstond eke wel wot said mine husbond leaue father mother take number mention made bigamie octogamie men speak villany lo wise king dan salomon trow wiues many mo would god lefull refreshed half oft gift god wyuis man hath world liue god wot noble king wit first night many mery fit hem well aliue blessed god haue wedded siue welcome sixth wheneuer shall forsoth woll keep chaste mine husbond fro world ygon christen man shall wed anon apostle saith fre wed godeshalfe liketh saith wedded sinne better wedded brinne recketh though folke say villany shreud lamech bigamy wot well abraham holy man iacob eke fer euer heare hem wiues mo two many another holy man also say manner age euer god defended mariage expresse word pray tell commaunded virginite wot well ye dread apostle spake maidenhead said thereof precept none men may counsaile woman one counsailing commaundement put wholly owne judgement god commaunded maidenhead damned wedding dread certes seed ysow virginity whereof grow poule ne durst commaund lest thing master yafe none hest dart set vp virginite catch may runneth best let see word taken euery wight god list yeue might wot well apostle maid natheles though wrote said would euery wight ni counsaile virginite ben wife yaue leue indulgence ni repreue v ed make die without exception bigamie good woman touch ment bed couch perill fire tow assemble ye know ensample may resemble held virginite perfit wedding freelte freelte clepe would lead life chastite graunt well haue none enuie though maidenhead preferre bigamie liketh hem clean body ghost mine estate woll make bost wel ye know lord houshold hath nat euery vessell gold tre lord seruice god clepeth folke sundry wise euerich hath god proper gift liketh shift virginitie great perfection continence eke deuocion christ perfection well bad euery wight go sell giue poore wise folow lore spake hem would liue parfectly lordings leaue nat wol bestow floure mynage act fruit marriage tell also conclusion member made generation perfit wise wight iwrought trusteth well nat made nouyt glose woll say vp made purgatioun vrine thing smale eke know female male none cause say ye experience wot well clerk wroth say maked saien office ease engendrure god displease men el bookes set man yeeld wife det wherwith pay payment ne vsed sely instrument made vpon creature purge vrine eke engendrure say euery wight hold hath harnesse told gon vsen hem engendrure men take chastitie cure christ maide shapen man many saint sithen world began yet liued euer perfit charitie nill enuy virginitie let hem bread pure wheat fed let v wiues eat barley bread yet barley bread marke tell lord iesu refreshed many man state god hath cleped v woll perseuer nam precious wifehood woll vse mine instrument frely maker hath sent dangerous god giue sorow mine husbond shal haue euin morow list come forth pay det husbond wol haue wol let shall debtour thrall haue tribulation withall vpon flesh wife haue power life vpon proper body nat right thus apostle told bad husbonds loue v well sentence liketh euery dell vp stert pardoner anon dame qd god saint iohn ye noble preacher caas wed wife ala bie flesh deare yet leuer wed wife yeare abide qd tale begon nay thou shalt drinke another ton er go shall sauer worse ale haue told forth tale tribulation marriage expert mine age say selfe hath whip maiest thou chese wheder thou wolt sip thilke ton shall set abroch beware er thou nere aproch shall tell ensamples mo ten woll beware men shall men corrected word writeth dan ptholome read almagest take dame woll pray said pardoner ye began tell forth tale spareth man teach v young men practike gladly qd may like pray company speake fantasy taketh griefe say mine entent play sir shall tell forth tale euer might drinke wine ale shall say sooth tho husbonds three hem good two bad three good men rich old vnnethes might stature hold bounden vnto ye wot well meane parde god helpe laugh thinke pitiously night made hem swinke fay tolde store yeue lond treasore neded lenger doe diligence win loue hem reuerence loued well god aboue ne tolde deinte loue wise woman woll besie euer one get loue hath none sithen hem holly mine hond giue londe take keep hem please profit mine ease set hem worke fay many might songen well away bacon fet hem trow men haue essex donmow gouerned hem well law ech hem full blisfull faw bring gay thing home fro fayre full fain spake hem faire god wot chid hem spitously herkeneth bere properly ye wise wiues vnderstond thus shul ye speak bere hem hond halfe boldly man swere lie woman say wiues wise misse auise wise wife shall good bere hem hond cow wood taken witnesse owne maid assent herkeneth said sir old keynard thine aray neighbour wife gay honoured ouer goth sit home haue thriftie cloth dost thou sirha neighbor house faire art thou amorous rownest thou maid benedicite sir old lechour let thy yapes haue gossip friend without gilt thou chidest fiend walke play vnto house thou comest home drunken mouse preachest thy bench euill prefe thou sayest great mischiefe wed poore woman costage rich high parage saiest thou tourmentrie suffer pride melancholy faire thou knaue thou saiest euery holour woll haue may chastitie abide assailed euery side thou saist folke desiren v richesse shape fairnesse either sing dance gentlenesse daliance honds armes smale thus goeth deuill thy tale thou saist men may keep castle wall may long assailed ouer foule thou saiest coueteth euery man may see spaniell woll lepe til find man wol chepe ne none gray gose goth lake saist thou yt woll without make saiest hard thing welde wight man woll thonke helde thus saist thou lorell whan thou goest bed wise man needeth wed ne man entendeth vnto heuin wild thunder dent fire leuin mote thy wicked necke broke thou saist dropping house eke smoke chiding wiues maken men flee owne house ah benedicite aileth old man chide thou saiest wiues woll vice hide till wedded wol hem shew well may prouerbe shrew thou saist ox horse ass hound ben assaied diuers stounds basin lauers men hem bie spones stooles husbondrie pot clothes araies folke wiues maken non assay till wedded old dotard shrew saiest woll vice shew thou sayest also displeaseth thou wilt praise beaute thou pore alway face clepe faire dame euery place thou maken feast ilke day borne make fresh gay thou doen norice honour chamber within bour father folke alies thus saiest thou old barell full lie againe prentise ienkin crispe heer shining gold fine squireth vp hast thou caught false suspection woll nat tho thou wer ded morow tell hidest thou sorow key thy chest away fro good well thine parde wenest thou make idiot dame lord called sainct iame thou shalt nat althogh thou wer wood maister body good one thou shalt forgon maugre thin iyen helpeth enquere spien trow thou wouldest locke thy chist thou shouldest say wife go thou list take disport woll leue tale know true wife dame ale loue man yt taketh keep charge go woll large men iblessed mote wise astrologien dan ptholome saieth prouerbe almagest men wisedome best recketh hath world hond prouerb thou shalt vnderstond haue thou inow need thee recke care merely folke fare certes old dotarde leue ye shallen haue queint inow eue great nigard woll werne man light candle lanterne shall haue neuer lesse light parde haue thou inow thou darst plain thee thou saiest also make v gaie clothes precious array perill chastitie yet sorow thou must enforcen thee say word apostle name habite made chastitie shame yee woman appareile qd nat tressed heere gay peere perle ne gold ne clothes rich text ne thy rubriche nill worche much gnat thou saiest also like cat would senge cat skin would cat dwellen inne cat skin sticke gay nill nat dwell house halfe day forth woll day dawed shew skin gon catrewawed thus thou saiest gaie sir shrew woll ren borell shew sir old foole helpeth thee spien though thou play argus c eyen wardcors best faith shall keepe lest yet couth make beard mote thee thou saiest eke yt thing three greatly troublen earth wight may endure ferth lefe sir shrew iesu short thy life yet preachest thou saiest hateful wife rekened one mischaunces non resemblaunces ye may liken parable sely wife one tho thou likenest eke woman loue hell barren lond water may dwell thou likenest also wild fire brenneth hath desire consume thing brent would thou saiest right wormes shenden tre right wife destroieth husbond known ben wiues bond lordings right thus ye haue vnderstond bare stiffely mine old husbond hond thus saiden drunkennesse false tooke witnesse ienken neece also lord paine hem wo full giltles god sweet pine horse couth bite whine couth plain though gilt el oftentime spilt first mill commeth first grint plained first war istint full glad excusen hem bliue thing gilt neuer life wench would beare hem hond yt sick vnneths might stond yet tickled heart wend great cheerte swore walking night espie wench dight vnder colour much mirth wit giuen v birth disceipt weeping spinning god haue giue woman kindly liue thus thing may auaunt mee thende best degree sleight force manner thing continuall murmure grudging namely bed muckle mischance would chide pleasance would lenger bed abide felt arme ouer side till made raunsom vnto would suffer doe nicete therefore euery man tale tell wiue may sell empty honds men may hauks lure winning would lust indure make fained appetite yet bacon neuer delite maked euer yt would hem chide though pope sitten hem beside would spare hem owne bord truth quit word word helpe god omnipotent tho right make testament ne owe hem word quit brought wit must giue vp best el neuer rest though looked wood lyon yet faile conclusion would say good lefe take keep meekly looketh wilken sheep com neer spouse let kisse cheek ye patient meek haue sweet spiced conscience sith ye preach iobs patience suffreth alway sith ye well preach ye shall teach faire haue wife pee one v two mote obeien doubtles sith man reasonable woman ye must sufferable aileth grutch thus grone ye would haue queint alone take lo haue euery del peter shrew ye loue wel would sell belchose couth walke fresh rose woll keep owne tooth ye blame god say sooth maner word often hond speake fourth husbond fourth husbond reuellour say paramour yong full ragarie stubburne strong ioly pie well coud daunce harpe smale sing iwis nightingale drunken draught sweet wine mettellus foul churle swine staffe bireft wife life drunk wine though wife ne haue daunted fro drinke wine venus must thinke seker cold engendreth haile licorus mouth must hane lecherous taile woman vinolent defence know lechours experience lord christ remembreth vpon youth iolite tickleth hart root vnto day doth hart boot haue world time age ala woll enuenime hath bireft beauty pith let go farewell deuill goe therewith flower gon ni tell bran best mote sell yet right mery woll fond forth tell fourth husbond say hert great dispite delite quit god saint ioce made wood troce body foule manere certainly made folke chere owne greace made frie anger jelousie god earth purgatorie hope soule bene glorie god wote sate full oft song shooe full bitterly wrong none saue god wist many wise sore twist died came fro hierusalem lyeth graue vnder rode beem ni tombe curious sepulture darius appelles wrought subtilly wast bury preciously let farewel god giue soul good rest graue chest fifth husbond woll tell god let neuer soule come hell yet shrew feele ribbes rew euer shall vnto mine ending day bed fresh gay therewithall couth well glose would haue belly chose though beat euery bone couth win ayen loue anone trow loued bet loue dangerous woman haue shall lie mattere queint fantasie waite thing may nat lightly haue thereafter woll day cry craue forbid v thing desiren prese v fast woll flee danger vttren chaffare great prees market maketh deere ware great cheap hold little prise knoweth euery woman wise fifth husbonde god soule blesse tooke loue richesse sometime clerke oxenford left schole went home borde gossip dwelling town god haue soule name alisoun knew heart eke priuite bet parish priest mote thee bewrayed counsell husbond pist againe wall done thing haue cost life another worthy wife nece loued well would haue told counsell euery dell full often god wote made face full oft red hote shame blamed himselfe told great priuite befell one lent oft time gossip went euer yet loued goe gaie walke march april maie fro house house hearken sundry tale ienkin clerk gossip dame ale selfe field went husbond london lent better leasure pleie see eke seie lustie folke wist grace shapen place therefore made visitation village procession preaching eke pilgrimage playes miracle marriage weared gaie skarlet gites worm moughts ne mite vpon parell fret hem neuer dell wost thou vsed well woll tell foorth happed say field walked till truely daliance clerke purueyance speake said widow wedden certainely say boastance yet neuer without purueyance marriage ne thing eke hold mouse wit worth leke hath one hole sterten faile idoe bare hand enchanted dame taught forsoth subtiltie eke saied met night would slaine lay vpright bed full blood yet hope truely doe good blood betokeneth gold taught al fals dremed hem right nauyt followed aye dame lore well thing sir let see shall sain ha god haue tale againe fourth husband wept algate made heauy chere wiues moten vsage kerchefe couered visage purueyed make wept small vndertake church husbond born morow neighbour yt maiden sorow ienken clerke one tho helpe god saw go bere thought paire leg foot cleane faire heart yaue vnto hold trow twentie winter old fortie shall say footh yet alway colt tooth gaptothed became wele print dame venus seale helpe god lustie one faire rich yong well bigone truly mine husbond told best queint might certes fully venerian feeling heart marcian venus yaue lust licorousnesse mar yaue sturdie hardinesse mine ascendent taure mar therin ala ala euer loue sin followed aye mine inclination vertue constellation made couth neuer withdraw chamber venus good fellaw yet haue martes marke vpon face also another priuie place god wisely saluation loued neuer discretion euer followed mine appetite short long blacke white tooke keepe liked mee poore ne eke degree say ye month end jolly clerke ienken hend hath wedded great solemnitee yaue lond fee euer yeuen afterward repented full sore nold suffer nothing list god smote fist rent booke lefe stroke eares wex defe stubborne lionesse tongue iangleresse walke would doen beforn fro hous hous although sworn full oftentime would preach old romane iests teach sulpitius gallus left wife forsooke tearme life open hede seie looking dore daie another romane told name wife summer game without weting forsooke eke would vpon bible seke ilke prouerbe ecclesiast commaundeth forbiddeth fast man shall suffer wife roile would say right thus dout buildeth house sallowes pricketh blind hors ouer fallowes suffereth wife seche hallowes worthy honged gallowes nought set haw prouerbes ne old saw ne would corrected hate vice telleth doe mo god wote made wood vtterly nold forbeare caas woll say sooth thomas rent booke lefe smote defe booke gladly night day disport would read alway cleped valerie theophrast booke lough alway full fast eke clerk somtime rome cardinall hight saint ierome made booke ayenst iouinian booke eke tertullian crisippus trotula helowis abbesse ferre fro paris eke parable salomon ouids art bookes many one bounden one volume euery night day custome leisure vacatioun worldly occupatioun readen booke wicked wiues knew hem mo legend liues good woman bible trusteth well impossible clerke would speak good wiues holy saint liues ne none woman nere mo painteth lion tell god woman written story clerkes han within oratory wold haue writ men wickedness marke adam may redresse child mercurie venus working full contrarious mercurie loueth wisdome science venus loueth riot dispence diuers disposition ech falleth others exaltation thus god wote mercurie desolate pisces venus exaltate venus falleth mercurie reised therefore woman clerke preised clerke old may nought venus werkes worth old sho sit downe writ dotage woman cannot keepe marriage purpose told thee beaten booke parde vpon night ienken sire red vpon booke sate fire eue first wickednesse mankind brought wretchednesse yt iesu christ himselfe slaine bought v hart blood againe lo expresse woman may ye find woman losse mankind tho rad sampson lost here sleping lemman cut hem sheres treason lost eyen tho rad shall lien hercules deianire caused set himselfe fire nothing forgot care wo socrates wiues two xantippe cast pisse head silly man sat still dead wiped head durst saine er thunder stint cometh raine pasiphae queene crete shreudnesse thought tale swete fie speake grisely thing horrible lust liking clitemnestra letcherie falsely made husbond die rad well good deuotion told eke occasion amphiaraus thebe lost life husbond legend life eriphilem ouche gold hath priuily vnto greekes told husbond hid place thebe sorry grace lima told lucie made husbonds die one loue hate lima husbond euin late empoysoned fo lucia erous loued husbond alway vpon thinke gaue loue manner drinke dead ere morrow thus algates husbonds han sorrow told one latumeus complained fellow arius garden growed tree said wiues three honged hemselfe hart dispitous lefe brother qd arius yeue plant blisful tree garden planted shall bee latter date wiues hath red han slain husband bed let letchour dight hem night while corse lay floore vpright driuen nailes brain while sleep thus haue hem slain haue yeue hem poyson drink spake harm hart may think therwithall knew mo prouerbes world groweth grasse herbes bet qd thine habitation lion foule dragon woman vsing chide bet qd high roofe abide angry wife doun hous ben wicked contrarious haten husbonds louen aie saied woman cast shame awaie cast smock farther mo faire woman chast also like gold ring sowes nose coud wen coud suppose wo miue hart pine saw would neuer fine reden cursed booke night suddainly three leaues haue plight booke right radde eke fist tooke cheke fire fell backward adoun vp stert doth wood lioun fist smote mine head floore lay dead seie still lay agast would haue fled away till last swoun braied oh hast thou slaine false theefe saied lond thus hast thou murdred mee et dead yet woll kisse thee neere came kneeled faire adoun saied deere suster sweet alisoun helpe god shall thee neuer smite haue doen thy selfe wite foryeue thee beseke yet eftsoones hit cheke saied theefe thus much bewreke woll die may longer speke last mokell care wo fell accorded within selues two yafe bridle mine hond haue gouernaunce hous lond tongue hond also made hem bren booke anon tho gotten vnto maistrie soueraignte saied mine owne true wife thou list tear thy life keepe thine honour eke mine estate day neuer debate god helpe kinde wife fro denmarke vnto inde also true pray god sit majestie blisse soule mercy deare woll say tale ye woll heare frere lough heard dame qd haue joy blis long preamble tale sompner herd frere gale lo qd sompner god armes two frere woll entermete euermo lo good men flie eke frere woll fall euery dish eke matere speakest thou preambulatioun amble trot either peace sit adoun thou lettest disport mattere ye wolt thou sit sompner qd ye frere fay shall ere go tell sompner tale two folke shull laugh place el frere beshrew thy face qd sompner beshrew mee tell tale two three freres ere come sitting burne shall make thine hart murne well wot thy patience gone host cried peace anone saied let woman tell tale ye faren folke dronken ale dame tell forth tale best ready sir qd right lest haue licence worthy frere yes dame tell forth tale woll batcheler king arthur court enjoined queen tell thing woman desire length taught old woman cause enforced marry pthe wife bathe tale old dayes king artour breton speaken great honour lond fulfilled fairie elfe queene hir iolly companie daunced full oft many greene mead old opinion read speake many hundred yeare ago man see none elfes mo great charity prayeres limitours holy freres fearchen euery land euery streame thicke mote sunne beame blissing hals chamber kitchen boures city boroughes castle hie toures thropes berne shepens dairy maketh fairy wont walke elfe walketh limitour himselfe vndermeles morning saieth mattins holy thing goeth limitatioun woman may go safely vp doun euery bush vnder euery tree ni none incubus hee ne doen hem dishonour fell king artour house lustie batcheler day came riding fro riuer happed alone borne saw maid walking beforne maid anon maugre head force beraft maidenhead oppression clamour pursute vnto king artour damned knight dead course law haue lost head perauenture statute tho queene lady mo sa long praiden king grace till life graunted place yaue queene chese yt would saue spill queen thanketh ye king al hir might thus spake knight sey time certaine day thou standeth yet qd array thy life yet hast thou surete graunt thee thy life thou canst tell thing woman desiren beware keepe thy necke bone yren thou canst tell anon yet woll yeue thee leaue gon tweluemonth day seeke lere answere sufficient matere suertie woll haue ere thou passe thy body yelde place wo knight sorrowfully liketh may done liketh last chese wend come ayen right yeares end answer god wold puruay taketh leue wendeth forth way seeketh euery house euery place hopeth find grace learne thing woman louen ne couth arriuen coost might find matere two creature according yfere said woman loued best richesse said honour said jollinesse said rich array said lust bed oft time widdow wed said heart yeased flatered ypraised goeth full sooth woll lie man shall win v best flatterie attendaunce businesse ben wee ylimed lesse men sain louen best free right v lest man repreue v vice say wise nothing nice truly ni none v wight woll claw v gall nill like saith v footh assay shall find dooth neuer vicious within woll holden wise cleane sin men sain great delite haue hold stable eke secre purpose stedfastly dwell bewray thing men v tell tale worth rake stele parde woman nothing hele witnesse midas woll ye tale ouid among thing smale said midas vnder long haires growing head two ass eares vice hid best might full subtilly euery man sight saue wife wist mo loued trusted also praied creature nold tellen disfigure swore world win nold villany ne sin maken husbond haue foule name nold tell owne shame natheles thought dide long counsaile hide thought swoll sore hert needely word must astert sith durst tellen man doun marri fast ran till came hert fire bittour bumbeth mite laid mouth vnto water adoun bewray thou water thy soun qd thee tell mo mine husbond hath long ass eares two mine heart hole might lenger keepe dout mow ye see though time abide yet mote counsaile hide remnaunt tale ye readeth ouid ye may lere knight tale specially saw might come therby say woman louen within heart sorrowfull ghost home goth might soiourne day come must home returne way happed ride care vnder forrest side whereas saw vpon daunce go lady foure twenty yet mo toward daunce drow full yerne hope wisdome lerne certainly ere came fully vanished daunce nist creature saw bare life saue greene sitting old wife fouler wight may man deuise againe knight old wife gan arise said sir knight forth lieth way tell ye seeken fay peraduenture may better old folke con much thing qd lefe mother qd knight certaine nam dead saine thing woman desire coud ye wisse wold quite wel hire plight thy troth hand qd next thing require thee thou shalt thy might woll tell night haue troth qd ye knight graunt qd may well auaunt thy life safe woll stond therby vpon life queene say let see proudest hem weareth kerchefe call dare say nay shall teach let v go forth without lenger speche tho rowned pistell eare glad haue feare ben comen ye court knight said hold day hight ready answere said full many noble wife many maid many widdow wise queen selfe sitting iustice assembled ben answere heare afterward knight bode apeare euery wight commanded silence knight tell audience thing worldly woman loued best knight ne stood still doth beast question anon answerd manly voice court herd liege lady generally qd woman desiren haue soueraignte well ouer husbonds loue ben maistrie hem desire though ye kill doth list court na wife ne maid ne widdow contraried said said worthy han life word vp stert old wife yt knight found sitting ye green mercy qd soueraigne lady queen ere court depart right taught answere vnto knight plight trouth first thing would requere would lay might court pray thee sir knight qd thou take vnto thy wife well thou wost haue kept thy life say false say nay vpon thy fay knight answerd ala welaway wot right well behest god loue chese new request take good let body go nay qd shrew v two though foule old pore nold mettall ne ore vnder yerth graue lithe aboue thy wife thy loue loue qd nay damnation ala nation euer foule disparaged nought end constrained need must wed taketh old wife goth bed woulden men say perauenture negligence cure tellen ioy array feast ilke day thing answer shortly shall say na ioy ne feast na heavinesse much sorrow priuily wedded morrow day hid oule wo wife looked foule gret ye sorow yt kniyt thought wife bed ybrought walloweth turneth fro old wife lay smiling euermo said deare husbond benedicite fareth euery knight thus ye law king artours hous euery knight loue daungerous owne loue eke wife saued hath life certes yet neuer vnright fare ye thus first night ye faren like man lost wit fie gilt god loue tell shall amended may amended qd knight ala nay nay woll amended neuer mo thou art loathly old also thereto comen low kind little wonder thogh iwallow wind would god qd mine hert would brest qd cause vnrest ye certainely qd wonder ni sir qd couth amend list ere dayes three well ye might beare vnto ye speake gentlenesse discended old richesse therefore shullen ye gentleman errogaunce worth hen lo vertuous alway preuy apert intendeth aye gentle deed take greatest gentleman christ wold claimed gentlenesse elder old richesse though yeue v heritage claimen ben high parage yet may bequeath nothing none v vertuous living made hem gentleman ycalled bad v followen hem degre full well wise poet florence hight dante speake sentence lo manner rime dante tale full selde vp riseth braunches smale prowesse man god goodnesse woll claime gentlenesse elder may nothing claime temporal thing yt men may hurt maime eke euery wight wot well gentlenesse planted naturally vnto certaine linage doun line preuy apert wold neuer fine done gentlenesse faire office might done villany ne vice take fire beare derkest hous betwixt mount caucasus let men shut dores go thenne yet woll fire faire lie brenne twenty thousand men might behold office naturall aye woll hold vpon perill life till die may ye see well gentrie annexed possession sithen folke operation alway doth fire lo kind god wot men may full often find lord sonne done shame villany woll haue prise gentry borne gentle hous elder noble vertuous nill himselfe gentle deedes follow gentle auncetre dead ni gentle duke erle fie villaines sinful deed maketh cherle gentlenesse ni renomie thine auncetres high bountie strong thing thy persone thy gentlenesse commeth fro god alone cometh gentlenesse grace nothing bequeath v place thinketh noble saith valerius thilke tullius hostilius pouerty rose high noblesse readeth seneck readeth eke boece shall ye seene expresse dread gentle doth gentle deedis therfore deare husbond thus conclude mine auncetors rude yet may high god hope graunt grace liue vertuously gentle begin liue vertuously leauen sin ye pouertie repreue high god beleue wilfull pouerte chese lead life certes euery man maid wife may vnderstond iesu heauen king ne would chese vicious liuing glad pouert honest thing certaine woll seneck clerkes saine wold hold paid pouert hold rich shert coueteth full poore wight would han might yt nought hath ne coueteth haue rich although ye hold knaue pouert sinne properly iuuenall saith pouert merrily poore man goeth way beforne theeues may sing play pouert hatefull good gesse full great bringer businesse great amender eke sapience taketh patience pouert although seeme elenge possession wight woll challenge pouerte full often man low maketh god eke himselfe know pouert spectacle thinketh one may friend see therfore since greue pouert repreue sir eke elde ye repreued certes sir though none authorite booke ye gentles honour sain men old wight honour cleape hem father gentlenesse author shall find gesse ye sain yt foule old drede cokewold filth elthe foule mote thee ben great wardeins vpon chastite natheles since know delite shall fulfill worldly appetite qd one thing twey haue foule old till dey true humble wife neuer displease life el woll haue yong faire take auenture repaire shall come house place may well chese selue whether yt liketh knight auiseth sore liketh last said manere lady loue wife dere put wise gouernaunce cheseth selfe may pleasaunce honour also force whether two liketh sufficeth haue got maistry qd since may chese gouerne lest ye certes wife qd hold best kisse qd lenger wroth truth woll say faire good pray god mote sterue wood also good trew euer wife sithen world new morrow faire seene lady empresse queene east eke west doth life right lest cast vp courtein looke knight saw verily faire young thereto ioy hent armes two hart bathed bath blisse thousand time row gan kisse obeyed euery thing mought done pleasure liking thus liued vnto liues end perfit joy iesu christ v send husbonds meeke yong fresh abed grace ouerliue hem wed pray god short liues gouerned wife old angry niggard dispence god send hem soone pestilence pthe frier prologue worthy limitour noble frere made alway maner louring chere vpon sompner honeste villaines word yet spake last said wife dame god yeue right good life ye haue touched mote schole matter full great difficulte ye haue said much thing right well say dame riden way v needeth speaken game let authority god name preaching schoole clargie like vnto companie woll sompner tell game parde ye may well know name sompner may good said pray none euill apaid sompner renner vp doun maundements fornicatioun ybeat euery tounes end tho spake host said sir ye ben hend curteis man estate company woll debate telleth tale let sompner nay qd sompner let say list cometh lote god shall quite euery grote shall tell great honour flattering limitour eke many another manner crime needeth rehearse time office shall tell ywis host answerd peace afterward said vnto frere tell forth tale mine owne maister dere pthe freres tale sompner devil meeting way conference become sworn brother hell go together covert invective bribery spiritual court dayes whylome dwelling countre archdeacon man high degre boldly execution punishing fornication witchcraft eke baudrie defamation aduoutrie church reues testament contract lacke sacrament vsurie simonie also certes letcherours much wo shoulden sing hent small tythers foule yshent person would vpon hem plaine might assert hem pecunial paine small tithe small offering made people pitously sing ere bishop caught hem hooke archdeacon booke jurdiction power done hem correction sompner ready hond ier boy none englond subtilly espiaile taught might auaile couth spare letchours one two teachen foure twenty mo thogh sompner wood hare tell harlottry woll spare ben correction v juridiction ne neuer shullen tearme liues peter ben woman stewes qd sompner yput cure peace mischance misauenture said host let tell tale telleth forth let sompner gale ne spareth mine owne maister dere false theef sompner qd frere alway baud ready hond hauke lure englond telleth secre knew acquaintance come anew approver priuely tooke himselfe great profit thereby maister knew alway wan without maundement leaud man coud summon paine christ curse glad fillen purse maden great feast nale right iudas purse smale theefe right theefe maister halfe dutie shall yeue laud theefe sompner eke baud eke wench retinue whether sir robert sir hue iohn rafe lay hem told eare thus wench one assent would fetch fained maundement summon hem chapiter two pill man let wench go would say friend shall thy sake striken thee letter blake thou dare case trauaile thy friend may thee auaile certaine knew bribries mo possible tell yeares two world ni dog hurt deere whole know bet sompner knew slie letchour auouter el paramour fruit rent therefore set intent befell day sompner waiting euer pray rode summon old widdow ribibe faining cause would haue bribe happed saw beforne ride gay yeoman vnder forrest side bow bare arrow bright shene vpon courtpie greene hat vpon head string blacke sir qd sompner haile well itake welcome qd euery good fellaw whider ridest thou vnder ye green wood shaw said yeoman wolt thou ferre day sompner answerd said nay fast qd mine intent riden reysen vp rent longeth vnto lord dutie art thou baylie yea qd durst filth shame say sompner name depardieur qd yeoman lefe brother thou art bayly another vnknowne countre thine acquaintance woll pray thee eke brotherhead thou lift haue gold siluer chist ye hap come shire shall thine right thou wolt desire grant mercy qd sompner faith euerich truth laith sworne brother till dey yt word riden forth wey sompner yt ful iangles full venome ben wariangles euer requiring vpon euery thing brother qd dwelling another day seech yeoman answerd soft speech brother qd ferre north countre whereas hope sometime shall thee see depart shall thee well wisse mine house thou shalt neuer misse brother qd sompner pray teach riden way sith ye ben bayly subteltie tell faithfully mine office may win spare conscience ne sin brother tell done ye trouth brother deare said shall tellen thee faithfull tale wage full strait full smale lord hard daungerous mine office full laborious therefore extortion leue forsooth men woll yeue algate sleight violence yeare yeare win dispence better tellen faithfully certes qd sompner fare spare taken god wote heauy hote may getten counsaile priuily manner conscience haue nere mine extortion might liuen yapes woll shriuen stomacke ne conscience know none shrew shrift father euerychone well met god sweet iame leue brother tell thy name qd sompner meane yeoman gan little smile brother qd wolt thou yt thee tell fiend dwelling hell ride purchasing wete may get thing purchasing theffect rent looke thou ridest intent win good thou reckest neuer right fare ride woll vnto world end pray ah qd sompner ye say wend ye yeoman truly ye haue man shape well haue ye figure determinate hell ye ben estate nay certainly qd haue none v liketh take v one el make seeme ben shape sometime like man like ape like angell ride go wonder thing though lousie iugler deceiue thee parde craft hee qd ye sompner ride ye gone sundry shape alway one qd woll v forme make able preyes take maketh haue al labour full many cause lefe sir sompnour said fiend thing hath time day short passed prime yet ne got nothing day woll entend winning may entend wit declare brother mine thy wit ben bare vnderstand though would tell thee thou askest labouren sometime god instrument meanes done commaundments lust creature diuers art diuers figure withouten haue might certaine list stonden againe sometime praier haue leue body soule greue witnesse iob deden wo sometime haue might two saine body soule eke sometime ben suffered seeke vpon man done soule vnrest body best withstandeth temptation cause saluation albeit intent safe wold hent sometime seruaunts vnto man archbishop saint dunstan apostle eke seruaunt yet tell qd sompner faithfully make ye new body thus alway element fiend answered nay sometime faine sometime arise dead body sundry wise speake renably faire well phitonesse samuell yet would men say force diuinite thing warne thee woll yape thou wolt algates wete shape thou shalt hereafterward brother dere come thee needeth lere thou shalt thine owne experience conne chare rede sentence bet virgill liue daunt also let v ride bliue woll hold company thee till thou forsake mee nay qd sompner yt shall betide yeoman knowen full wide trouth wol hold thee caas though thou deuill sathanas trouth woll hold brother sworne ech v true brother caas brother gone purchaas take thou thy part men woll ye yeue shal mine thus shall leue v haue let true part brother graunt qd deuill fay word riden forth way right ring tounes end ye sompner shope wend saw cart charged hay carter droue forth way deepe way cart stood carter smote striued wood heit scot heit brok wt spare ye ye stone fiend qd fetch body bone ferforth euer ye yfoled much wo haue tholed deuill haue hors cart hay qd sompner shal haue pray nere fiend drew nought ne full priuily rouned eare hearken brother hearken thy faith hearest thou carter saith hent anon hath yeue thee hay cart eke caples three nay qd deuill god wot neuer dele intent trust wele aske thy selfe thou trowest mee el stint thou shalt see carter thacked hors croupe begun draw stoupe heit qd yt iesus christ blesse hondy werke lesse well wight mine liard boy pray god saue thee saint loy cart slow parde lo brother qd fiend told thee may ye seene mine owne deare brother carle spake thing thought another let v goe forth voyage win nothing vpon cariage comen somwhat toun sompner brother gan roune brother qd wonneth old rebecke almost lefe lese necke yeue penny good woll haue xii tho wood woll sompne office yet god wot know vice thou canst countre win thy cost take ensample sompner clappeth ye widdows gate come saied thou old veritrate trow thou hast frere priest withthee clappeth said wife benedicite god saue sir sweet haue qd summons thee bill vp paine cursing looke thou bee morrow archdeacon knee answere court certaine thing lord qd iesu king king wisely helpe ne may haue ben sicke full many day may goe ferre qd ne ride dead pricketh side may aske libell sir sompnour answere proctour thing men would apposen yea qd sompner pay anon let see twelue penny thee acquite shall profit haue hereof lite maister hath profit come let ridden hastily giue xii penny may lenger tary twelue penny qd lady saint mary wisely helpe care sin wide world though win ne haue xii within ho ye know well poore old kith almesse poore wretch nay qd foule fiend fetch thee excuse thogh thou shouldest spilt ala qd god wot haue guilt pay qd sweet saint anne woll streight beare away new panne debt thou owest old thou madest thy husbond cokold paied home thy correction thou liest qd saluation ne neuer ere widdow ne wife sompned vnto court life ne neuer na body trew vnto deuill blacke rough hew yeue thy body panne also deuill heard curse vpon knee said manere mably mine owne mother dere earnest ye sey deuill qd fet ere dey panne woll repent nay old stotte mine intent qd sompner repent mee thing haue thee would thy smocke euery cloth brother qd deuill wroth thy body thy pan mine right thou shalt hell yet night thou shalt knowen priuitie maister diuinitie word ye foule fiend hent body soule deuill went yt sompners haue heritage god made image mankind saue guide v leaue ye sompner good man become lordings coud haue told qd frere leisure sompner text christ poule ihon doctours many one paine heart might agrise albeit tongue may deuise though might thousand winter tell paine cursed hous hell keepe v cursed place wake pray iesu grace keepe u temper sathanas hearkneth word beware caas lion sitteth await alway slea innocent may disposeth aye heart withstond fiend would make thral bond may tempt ouer might christ woll champion knight prayeth sompner repent misdeed ere fiend hent pthe sompners prologue sompner stirrops high stood vpon frere hert wood like aspen leafe quoke ire lordings qd one thing desire beseech courtesie sithens ye han heard false frere lie suffereth may tale tell frere boasteth knoweth hell god wot little wonder freres fiend ben little asunder parde ye han oft time heard tell frere rauished hell spirit visioun angell led vp doun shewen paine place saw frere folke saw ynow wo vnto angell spake frere tho sir qd han freres grace none hem shall come place yes qd angell many millioun vnto sathanas lad adoun hath sathanas taile broader caricke saile hold vp thy taile thou sathanas qd shew forth thine erse let frere see whereas neast freres place ere halfe furlong way space right bee swarmen hiue deuils erse gan driue twenty thousand freres rout throughout hell swarmed come ayen fast might gone erse crepten euerichone clapt taile ayen lay still frere looked fill vpon turments sorry place spirit god restored grace vnto body ayen awoke nathelesse yet feare quoke deuills erse aye mind heritage kind god saue saue cursed frere prologue woll end mannere pthe sompners tale begging fryar coming farmer house lay sick obtaineth certain legacy must equally divided among covent requital friar shewing cozenage loytering impudent begging hypocritical praying lordings yorkshire ghesse marish countrey called holdernesse went limitour preach eke beg doubt befell day frere preached church manere specially abouen euery thing excited people preaching trental yeuen god sake wherewith men mighten holy house make diuine seruice honoured wasted deuoured ne needeth yeuen possessioners mowen el leuen thonked god wele aboundance trental deliuereth qd fro pennance friend soules well old yong hastily ysong hold priest jolly gay singeth one messe day deliuereth qd anon soules full hard fleshhooke oules yclawed bren bake speedeth hastily christ sake frere said intent qui cum patre forth way went folk church yeue hem lest went way lenger would rest scrip tipped staffe ytucked hie euery hous gan pore prie begged meale cheese el corne fellow staffe tipped horne paire table iuory pointell ypolished fetously wrote alway name stood folke yaue hem good askaunce woulden hem prey yeue v bushell wheat malt rey god kichell trippe chese el ye list may chese god halfepenny masse peny yeue v brawne ye haue dagon blanket leue dame suster deare lo write name bacon beefe thing ye find sturdy harlot went aye behind hostes man bare sacke men yaue hem laied backe dore anone plained away name euerichone written table serued hem nifles fable nay thou liest sompner qd yt frere peace qd host christ mother dere tell forth thy tale spare thriue qd sompner shall long went fro hous hous till came hous wont refreshed hundred placis sicke lay good man whose place bedred vpon couch low lay deus hic qd thomas friend good day saied frere courteously soft thomas god yeeld full oft haue vpon bench faren full weale haue eaten many merry meale fro bench droue away cat laied adoune potent hat eke scrip set soft adoune fellow go walked toune forth knaue hostelrie shope like night lie deare maister qd sicke man haue ye faren sithen march began saw fourtenight god wot qd laboured haue full sore specially thy saluation haue saied many precious orison friend god hem blesse haue day ben church messe said sermon simple wit text holy writ hard suppose therfore woll teach glose glosing glorious thing certain letter slaeth clerkes sain haue hem taught ben charitable spend good reasonable saw dame ah yonder yard trow saied man woll come anon eye maister welcome ye saint ihon saied wife fare ye heartily frere ariseth vp full courteously imbraceth armes narrow kisseth sweet chirketh sparrow lip dame qd fare right wele seruaunt euery dele thanked god haue soul life yet saw day faire wife whole church god saue yea god amend fault sir qd algates welcome ye fay graunt mercy dame yt haue found alway great goodnesse leue woll pray ye greue woll thomas speake little throw curate ben full negligent slow gropen tenderly man conscience shrift preaching diligence studie peter word poules walke fishen christen men soules yeeld iesu christ proper rent spread word mine intent leaue deare maister qd chideth well saint charite aye angry pissemire though haue desire thogh wrie night make warm ouer lay leg mine arm groneth bore lieth stie disport right none haue may please manner caas thomas ie vous die thomas thomas maketh ye fiend must ben amended ire thing god highly defended thereof woll speake word two maister qd wife ere go woll ye dine woll go thereabout dame qd ie vous die sanz dout haue capon liuer white bread shiuer rosted pig head nold beast dead ynow suffisaunce man little sustenaunce spirit hath fostring bible body aye ready penible wake body destroied pray dame ye nought annoied though friendly counsaile shew god haue told sir qd one word ere go child dead within weekes two soone ye went toun death saw reuelatioun saied frere home dortour dare well saine ere halfe hour death saw borne blisse mine auision god wisse sexten fermerere han true freres fiftie yere may god thanked loue maken iubelie walken alone vp arose couent eke many teare trilling cheeke withouten noise clattering bel te deum song nothing el saue christ saied orison thanking reuelation sir dame trusteth right well orison effectuell seene christ secret thing borell folke although king liue pouerte abstinence borell folke richesse dispence meat drinke foule delite han worldly lust despite lazar diues liueden diuersely diuers guerdon thereby woll pray must fast cleane fat soule make body leane fare saieth apostle cloth food sufficeth v though full good cleanenesse fasting v freres maketh christ accepteth prayeres lo moises fortie day fortie night fasted ere high god might spake mount sinay empty wombe fasting many day receiued law written god finger hely well witten mount oreb ere speech high god soules leech fasted long contemplaunce aaron temple gouernaunce eke priest euerichone temple gone praien people doen seruice nold drinke manner wise drinke dronke might hem make abstinence pray wake least deiden take heed say sober people pray ware say sufficeth lord iesu holy writ deuiseth yaue v ensample fasting prayeres therefore mendicantes silly freres ben wedded pouert continence charity humblenesse abstinence persecution rightwisnesse weeping misericorde cleanenesse therefore may ye see prayeres speake v mendicant freres ben high god acceptable feast table fro paradice first shall lie man chased gluttonie chast man paradice certain herken thomas shall sain haue text thereof suppose find manner glose specially sweet lord iesus spake freres saied thus blessed poore spirit forth gospell may ye seen whether liker perfection swimmen possession fie pompe gluttonie leaudnesse hem defie thinketh ben like iouinian fat whale walking swan vinolent bottle spence prayer full little reuerence soul say psalme dauid lo bouffe sain cor meum eructauit followeth christ gospell lore humble chast poore worker god word auditours therefore right hauke sour vp springeth aire prayeres charitable cahst busie freres maken sour vp god eares two thomas thomas mote ride go lord cleaped saint yue ne thou broder wer thou shouldst thriue chapiter pray day night christ thee send health might thy body welden hastily god wot qd nothing therof feele help christ within year haue spended vpon diuers maner freres well many pound yet fare neuer bet certain good haue almost beset farewell good almost ago frere answerd thomas dost thou needeth thee diuers freres sech needeth hath perfit lech sechen lech town inconstance confusion hold ye el couent prayen insufficient thomas iape ni worth mite maladie haue lite yeue couent halfe quarter otes yeue couent four twenty gortes yeue frere penny let go nay nay thomas may nothing farthing worth parted twelue lo ech thing oned himselue strong scattered thomas thou shalt iflattered thou wolst haue labour nought hie god yt world hath wrought saith ye workman worthy hire thomas naught treasure desire self couent pray aie diligent holy builden christ owne chirch thomas ye woll learne wirch building vp chirches may ye sinde good thomas life inde ye liggen full anger ire deuil set heart fire chiden holy innocent wife good patient therfore trow thomas ye lest ne chide thy wife best beare word away thy faith touching thing lo wise saith within thy house thou lion thy subject thou none oppression ne make thine acquaintance flee yet thomas eftsones charge thee beware thy bosom sleepeth ware serpent slily creepeth vnder grasse stingeth full subtilly beware sonne hearken patiently twenty thousand men han lost liues striuing lemmans wiues since haue holy meek wife nedeth thomas make strife ni iwis serpent cruell men treden taile ne halfe fel woman hath caught ire vengeance desire ire sinne one greatest seuen abhominable unto high god heven destruction every lewd vicar parson say ire engendreth homecide ire sooth executour pride could ire say much sorrow tale last till morrow therfore pray god day night irous man send little might great harme eke great pitee see irous man high degree whiledom ther irous potestate saith seneck estate vpon day riden knight two fortune would one hem came home yt nought anon knight judge brought said thus thou hast thy fellow slain deme thee death certain another knight commanded go lead death charge thee hapned went wey toward place ther dey knight came men wend ded thought best reed lede hem iudge saiden lord knight hath slain fellow stant hole aliue ye shullen dead qd mot thriue say one two three first knight right thus spake damned thee thou must algate dead thou must also leese need thyn head thou art cause thy fellow dieth ye third knight right thus sayeth thou hast yt commanded thee thus lete fle hem three irous cambises eke drunkelew aie delighted shrew befell lord meine loued well vertuous moralite said day betwixt hem two right thus lord lost aught vicious dronkennesse eke foule record man namely lord many ey many ear waiting lord whear god loue drinketh temperatly wine maketh man lese wretchedly mind limbes euerichone reuers shalt thou see qd anon preue thyn experience wine ne doth folke offence ni wine bereaueth might hond foote ne mine eyesight despight dronke mochell hundred time right ay cursed irous wretch let knight son beforne fetch commanding shuld beforn stond suddenly took hond vp string plucked eare arrow slough child thear wither haue siker hond none qd might minde agon hath wine bereuen mine iyen sight shuld tel answer knight sonne slain ther say beware therefore lord ye play sing placebo shall vnto poore man poore man one vice tell lord though go hell lo irous cirus thilke percien destroyed riuer gisen horse dreint therein went babilon win made riuer small men might ride waden ouer lo said well teach ne fellow none irous man ne wood man walke way lest thou repent woll say thomas leue brother leaue thyn ire thou shalt find iust squire hold deuils knife aie thine heart thine anger doth thee sore smart shew thy confession nay qd sicke man saint simon shriue day curate told wholy mine estate needeth speake saieth list mine humilite yeue thy gold tomake cloister qd many muskle many oister men haue full well ease hath food cloister rease yet god wot vnneath foundament parformed ne pauement tile yet within wones god owen fourty pound stone help thomas yt harrowed hell el mote need al book sell lacke predication goeth world destruction woll fro world v bereue god saue thomas leue would bereaue world son techen worchen con little time qd sith helie helise han freres find record charitie ithonked lord thomas help saint charitie anon sitteth kne sicke man waxeth nie wood ire would frere fire false dissimulation thing possession qd may giue none ye sain thus yt brother ye certes qd frere trusteth wele tooke dame letter sele qd wel somwhat shall yeue vnto holy couent liue thine hond thou shalt haue anone condition none depart leue brother euery frere haue much another shalt thou sweare thy profession without fraud cauilation swere qd frere faith therwithall hond layth lo faith shall lacke put thine hond adowne backe said man grope well behind beneath buttock thou shalt find thing haue hid priuitie ah thought frere shall goe adown shofth hond clift hope find good gift sicke man felt frere tewell groping amid hond let frere fart ni capell drawing cart might haue let fart soun frere vp start doth wood lioun false churle qd frere god bone hast thou dispite doe none thou shalt abie fart may meinie heard affray came leaping chased frere forth goeth full angry chere fet fellow lay store looked wilde bore grinted teeth wroth sturdie pace court goth whereas wonned man great honour alway confessour worthy man lord village freer came rage lord sat eating bord vnnethes might frere speake word till last said god see lord gan looke said benedicite frere ihon maner world see well something amis ye look though ye wood wer full theuis sit downe tell griefe shall amended may haue qd dispite day god yeeld adown village world none poore page nolde haue abhominatioun haue receiued town yet grieueth nothing sore old churle lock hore blasphemed hath holy couent eke maister qd lord beseke maister sir qd seruitour though haue schoole honour god liketh men v rabie call neither market ne large hall force qd tell griefe sir qd frere odious mischiefe day betide mine order per consequens degree holy church god amend sone sir qd lord ye wot done distemper confessour ye salt earth savour god loue pacience hold telleth griefe anon told ye han heard ye wot well ladie house aie still sat till heard fully frere said eye god mother qd blisful maid nought el tell faithfully madame qd thinketh ye therby thinketh god speed say churle hath done churles deed say god let neuer sick head full vanite hold manner frensie madam qd god shall lye wise may awreke shall slaunder ouer speke false blasphemour charged part might departed euery man iliche mischance lord sat still trance heart roled vp churle imaginatioun shew probleme frere neuer erst heard matere trow deuill put mind arsmetricke shall man find beforne day question make demonstration euery man haue ilike part sowne fauour farte nice proud churle beshrew thy face lo sir qd lord hard grace euer heard thing euery man ilike tell impossible may eye nice churle god let hem neuer rombling fart euery soun ny eyre reverberatioun euer wasteth little little away man demen fay departed equally lo churle lo shreudly vnto confessour day spake hold certain demoniake eteth meat let churle go play let go hongen himselfe deuil way stood lord squire bord carf meat heard word word thing haue sayd lord qd ye euill apaid couth tell gowne cloth sir frere ye wroth fart euen idealed amonges couent liketh thee tel qd ye lord thou shalt haue anon gown cloth god saint iohn lord qd weder faire withouten winde perturbing ayre let bring cart wheele hall looke well haue spoke twelue spoke hath cart whele commonly bring xii freres wot ye thirteene couent gesse confessour worthnesse shall performe vp number couent shullen knelen adoun one assent euery spoke end manere full sadly lay nose shall frere noble confessour god saue shall hold nose vpright vnder naue shal churle bely stiffe tought tabour hither ibrought set whele right cart vpon naue make let fart ye shullen see vp perill life good prefe demonstratife equally sowne wend eke stinke vnto spoke end saue worthy man confessour man great honour shall haue first fruit reason noble vsage freres yet worthest man hem shul first serued certainly hath well deserued hath day taught v much good preaching pulpet stood may vouchsafe say mee first smell fart three would brother hardely bereth faire holyly lord ye lady man saue frere said ienkin spake matere well euclide ptholome touching churles sayd subtiltie hie wit made speake spake ni foole ne demoniake ienkin hath iwonne new gowne tale done almost towne pthe clerke oxenfords prologue sir clerke oxenford host said ye ride still coy doth maid new spoused sitting bord day ne heard mouth word trow ye studie sophime salomon saith thing hath time god sake beth better chere time studie tell v merry tale fay man entred play need mot vnto play assent preacheth freres done lent make v old sinnes weep thy tale make v sleep tell v merry thing auentures termes figure colour keep hem store till ye endite hie stile men king write speake plaine time pray may vnderstond ye say worthy clerke beningly answerd host qd vnder yerde ye haue v gouernance therefore obeysance farre reason asketh hardely woll tell tale learned padow worthy clerke preued word werke dead nailed chest pray god send soule good rest fraunces petrarke laureat poet hight ilke clerke whose rethorike sweet enlumined itaile poetrie liuian philosophy law art perticulere death wol suffer v dwellen twinkling eye hem hath slaine shall dye tellen worthy man taught tale first began say first hie stile enditeth body tale writeth proheme discriueth piemont saluce countre speaketh apenniny hilles hye bound west lumbardie mount vesulus speciall poo well small taketh first springing sour eastward euer increaseth cours emelle ward ferare venise long time deuise truly judgement thinketh thing impartinent saue list conueyen matere tale ye shullen pthe clerke oxenfords tale walter marquesse saluce proveth patience wife grisill three sharp trial west side itaile downe ro e vesulus cold lustie plaine habundaunt vitaile wher many town tower thou maist behold founded time father old many another delectable sight saluce noble countre hight marque whilom lond worthy elder obeysant aye redy hond liege lesse thus delite liued hath done yore beloued drad favour fortune lord commune therwith speak linage gentilest iborne lombardy faire person strong yong age full honour curtesie discreet inow countre gye saue thing blame walter yong lord name blame thus yt considered nought time comming might betide lust present thought hauke hunt euery side welny cure let slide eke ne would worst wed wife ought might befall onely point people bare sore flockmele day went one hem wisest lore el lord would best assent tel wt people ment el coud well shew matere marque said ye shullen noble marque humanite assureth v yeueth v hardinesse oft time necessite may tell heuinesse accepteth lord gentilnesse pitous hert plaine let eares nat voice disdaine haue done matere another hath place yet much ye lord dere haue alway shewed fauour grace dare better aske space audience shewen request ye lord done right lest certes lord well u liketh werkes euer haue ne could owne selfe deuisen might liuen felicite saue one thing lord wedded man lest people souerain herts rest boweth necke vnder blisful yoke souerainte seruise men clepen spousaile wedlocke thinketh lord among thouyts wise though sleepe wake ronne ride aye fleeth time wol man abide though grene youth floure yet crepeth age alway still stone death manaseth euery age smite ech estate escapeth none also certaine knowne echone shul die vncertaine ben day death shall v fall accepteth v true intent neuer yet refused hest wol lord ye wol assent chese wife short time lest borne gentillest best lond ought seme honour god nere deme deliuer v busie dred take wife hie god sake befell god forbed thorogh death linage slake strange successour take heritage wo v liue wherefore pray hastely wiue meeke prayer pitious chere made marque haue pite wol ye qd mine owne people dere never erst thought constraine rejoyced libertie selden time found marriage free mote ben seruage natheles see true entent trust vpon wit haue done aye wherfore free woll assent wedden sone euer may ye haue profred day chese wife release choice pray profer cease god wot child oft vnlike worthy eldes hem bounte commeth god streen engendred ibore trust god bounte therefore marriage mine estate rest take may lest let alone chesing wife charge vpon backe woll endure pray charge vpon life wife take ye ensure worship while life may dure word werke elswhere emperours doughter furthermore thus shul ye swere ye choice shall neuer grutch nestriue sith shall forgo liberte request euer mote thriue mine hert set wol wiue ye woll assent manere pray speake matere hearty sworne assent thing said wight nay beseeching grace ere went would hem graunt certaine day spousaile soone euer may yet alway people somwhat dred lest marque would wife wed graunted hem day lest wold wedded sekerly said request humble entent full buxumely kneeling vpon knee full reuerently thonked thus han end entent home ayen wend hereupon took officer commaunding feast purvay privie knight squire charge yaue list hem lay commandement obey ech hem doth diligence done feast reverence explicit prima par sequitur par secunda nought ferre fro thilke place honorable marque shope marriage stood thrope sight full delectable poore folke village hadden beast herbigage labour tooke sustenance earth yaue hem haboundance among poore folke dwell man holden poorest hem high god somtime senden grace unto little oxe stall ianicola men thrope call doughter faire ynough sight grisilde young maiden hight speak vertuous beaute one fairest sonne full poorely ifostered licorous lust heart yronne well ofter well tonne dronke would vertue plese knew well labour idle ease though maid tender age yet brest virginite enclosed sad ripe corage great reverence charite old pore father fostred sheep spinning field kept would ben idle till slept homeward came wold bring wortes herbes time full oft shrad sethe living made bed full hard nothing soft aye kept father life loft every obeisance diligence child might father reuerence vpon grisilde poore creature well oft hath marque set eye hunting went peradventure fell might espie wanton looking follie eyen cast upon sad wise vpon chere would oft auise commending hert womanhede eke vertue passing every wight yong age well chere dede though people great insight vertue considered full right bounte disposed would wed ever wedden day wedding come wight tell maner woman meruaile wondred many man saiden priuite woll lord leaue vanite woll wed ala ala woll thus u begile natheles marque hath make iemmes set gold asure broches ring grisildes sake clothing tooke measure maiden like stature eke ornament unto wedding fall time vndren day approched wedding paleis put array hall chamber ech degre house office stuffed great plente maiest thou see dainteous vitaile may found ferre lasteth itaile royall marque richly araide lord lady companie feast praide retinue bachelerie many sown sondrie melodie vnto village told aray right way hath hold grisilde god wot full innocent shape aray fetch water well went cometh home sone ever may well heard say full ilke day marque wed might would fain seen sight thouyt wil maide stond fellowes dore see marque thereto wol fond done home soone may labour longeth may leisure behold way castle hold wold ouer dreshold gon marque came gan call set downe water pot anon beside threshold oxe stall downe vpon knee gan fall sad countenance kneeled still till herd lord thouytful marque spake yt maid wel soberly said manere father grisiilde said reuerence meek chere answerd lord ready goeth without lenger lette marque father fette hond tooke old man said thus aside ianicola neither may ne lenger plesance mine hert hide thou vouchsafe whatsoeuer betide thy doughter woll take wend wife vnto liues end thou louest wot well certaine art faithfull liegeman ibore liketh dare well saine liketh thee specially therefore tell point haue said thou wolt purpose draw take thy sonne law sudden case man astoned red wext abashed quaking stood ne vnneth said word mo thus qd lord willing ye woll ne ayenst liking woll nothing ye lord dere right list gouerne matere wol thus qd marque sothly thy chamber haue collation wotest thou woll aske wife rule shall done thy presence woll speke thine audience chamber treties ye shall heare people came house without wondred hem honest manere tentifly kept father dere vtterly grisild wonder might neuer erst saw sight wonder though astoned see great gest come place neuer gestes woned looked full pale face shortly fro matter pace word yt marque said benigne faithfull maid grisilde said ye shall well vnderstond liketh vnto father wed eke may stond suppose ye woll demaunds aske first qd sithen shall done hastie wise woll ye thereto assent el auise say thus ye redy good hert lust freely may best liketh though ye laugh smert neuer ye grutch night ne day say yea ye say one nay neither word ne frowning countenance swere swere aliance wondring vpon word quaking dred said lord indigne vnworthy thilke honour ye bede right woll even woll swere neuer willingly word werke ne thought nill disobie deed though loth die inough grisilde mine qd forth goeth sober chere doore came people said manere wife qd stondeth honoureth loueth pray loueth ni say nothing old gere bring house bad woman dispoilen lady nothing glad handle cloth clad natheles maiden bright hew fro foot head clothed han new heer han kembe lay vntressed full rudely finger small crowne head han idressed set full ouches great small arraie make tale vnneath people knew fairnes transformed rich marque hath spoused ring bought cause set vpon horse snow white well ambling palais lenger let joyfull people lad met conueyed thus day spende reuell till sunne
