gan discende shortly forth tale chace say new marquesse god hath isent fauour grace seemed likelinesse borne fed rudenesse cote oxe stall nourished emperours hall euery wight woxen dere worshipful ye folke bore fro birth knew yere yere vnneth trowed durst haue swore ianicola spake doughter na coniecture hem thought another creature though euer vertuous encreased excellence thewes good set high bounte discrete faire eloquence benigne digne reuerence coude people heart enbrace eche loued looked face onely saluce towne published bounte name eke beside many regioun one said well another said sprad hie bountie fame men woman yong old gone saluces behold thus walter lowly full royally wedded hath fortunate honestie god peace liueth full easily home outward grace inough saw vnder low degree honest vertue hid people held prudent man seene well seld grisilde wit couth feate wifely humblenesse eke cause required commen profit could redresse na discord rancor ne heauinesse lond ne couth apese bring hem wisely rest ese though husbond absent none gentleman countre wroth would bring hem one wise counsaile ripe word judgement great equitie heuen sent men wend people saue euery wrong mend long time faire grisilde wedded doughter ibore leuer haue borne man childe glad marque folke therfore though maide childe came may man child attaine likelyhood sithens baraine explicit secunda par incipit par tertia fell befalleth oft time mo childe sucked throwe marque heart longed tempt wife sadnesse know ne might heart throw maruellous desire wife assay needlesse god wot thought affray assaied ynough found euer good needeth tempt alway though man praise subtill wit say full euill sit assay wife nede put anguish drede marque wrouyt manere came alone night lay full sterne face right vgly chere saied thus grisilde qd day tooke thee thy poore aray put thee estate high noblesse thou hast forgotten gesse say grisilde present dignite haue put thee trow maketh thee foryetfull thee tooke poore estate full low wele thou must thy selfe know take heed euery word say wight hereth tway thou wotest thy self yt thou came house long ago though thou lefe dere vnto gentile thou art nothing say hem great shame wo subiect seruage thee borne art small village namely sith thy doughter ybore word often haue spoken doutles desire haue doen lead life hem rest pee may case recheles mote doen thy doughter best wold gentils lest yet god wote full loth natheles without thy witting woll nought woll qd thou assent thing shew thy pacience werking thou hight swore village day maked marriage heard ameued neither word chere ne countenance seemed agreeued saied lord lyeth pleasance child heartely obeisance ye may saue spill therfore worketh owne may nothing god soule saue liken may displease ne desire nothing haue ne drede lese saue onely ye heart aye shall length time death may deface neither change corage another place glad marque answering yet fained drery chere looking chamber go sone furlong way two priuily told intent vnto man wife sent maner sergeant priuy man faithfull often found thing great eke folke well doen execution thing bad lord knew well loued drad sergeant wist lord chamber stalked full still madame saied ye mote foryeue though thing constrained ye full wise full well know ye great lord hestes may fained may well wailed complained men must need unto lust obey woll ni say child commanded take spake vp child hent dispitously gan chere make though would haue slain went grisilde must suffer consent lambe sitteth meeke still let cruell sergeant doe suspect fame ilke man suspect face suspect word also suspect time began ala doughter loued wende would haue slain right tho natheles neither wept ne liked confirming marque liked last speake began full meekely sergeant praid worthy gentell man might kisse child ere deid arme little child leid full sad face gan child blisse lulled gan kisse thus saied benigne voyce farwell child shall thee neuer see sithen haue marked thee ye croice th lke father iblessed mote thou v died vpon roode tree thy soule little child betake night shalt thou dien sake trow norice caas hard routh see well might mother cry ala natheles sad stedfast endured aduersite sergeant meekely shee said haue ayen little yong maid goth qd doth lord hest thing would pray grace lord forbid lest burieth little bodie place beast ne bird race word purpose would saie tooke childe went anon waie sergeant came lord againe grisilds word chere told word word short plaine presented daughter dere somwhat lord routh maner natheles purpose held still lord doen woll haue bad sergeant full priuily child wel soft wind wrap circumstance tenderly carry cofer lap paine hed swap man know entent ne whens came ne whither went boleine suster dere thilke time pauie countesse take shew matere beseeching doen businesse child fostre gentlenesse whose child bad hide euery wight ought yt might betide sergeant goth hath fulfilde thing marque returne goeth full oft imagining wiues chere might ought see el word peceiue changed neuer could finde euer one ilike sad kinde glad humble busie seruice eke loue wont every manner wise ne doughter one word spake none accedent none adversite seen ne never doughters name nempned ernest ne game explicit tertia par incipit par quarta estate passed ben four yere er child god would man child bare waltere well gracious faire behold folke father told onely countrey mery child god thonke hery two yere old brest departed norice day marque cought yet another lest tempten wife eftsones may needle tempted dare say wedded men ne conne measure find patient creature wife qd marque ye heard people heauily bereth mariage namely sithen sonne borne worse ever age murmure slaieth heart corage eares commeth voice smart well nie destroyed hath hart say thus walter agon shall blood ianicola succede ben lord non word say people drede well ought murmure take hede certainly dread sentence though plainly speke myne audience would live peace might wherefore disposed vtterly suster served night right think serve priuily thus warn ye sodainly self wo outraie beth patient thereof pray qd saied ever shall woll ne nill nothing certain list nought greueth though doughter son slain commandement sain part child twain first sickenesse wo pain ye ben lord doth thing right list taketh reed left home clothing came first right qd left liberty toke clothing wherfore pray doe woll obey certes prescience know ere ye lust told would doen without negligence wote lust ye would pleasance firm stable hold wist death would doen ese gladly would suffer plese death may make comparisoun vnto loue marque seie constance wife cast adown iyen two wondred may patience suffer arraie foorth goth drery countenaunce hert full great pleasaunce eiger sergeant wise doughter caught right worse coud wers deuise hath hent sonne full beaute euer one patient chere made heauinesse kisseth child gan blesse saue praied yt might little sonne would earth graue tender limmes delicate sight fro foules fro noysom beast saue none answer might haue went way nothing rought boleine tenderly brought marque wondred euer lenger vpon pacience soothly knowen perfectly child loued would haue wend subtilte malice cruell corage suffered sad visage knew wel next certain loued child best euery wise woman would aske fain assay mighten suffise coud sturdie husbond deuise preue wifehood stedfastnesse continuing ever sturdinesse folke condition han certain purpose take couth stint entention bounden stake woll purpose stake right marque hath fully purposed tempt wife first disposed waiteth word countenance changed corage never could find variance aie one heart visage euer age truer possible love penible semeth thus hem two na one walter lest lust pleasance also god thonked fell best shewed well worldly vnrest wife selfe nothing willen effect husbond would sclander walter wonder wide spread cruel heart full wretchedly poore woman wedded hath murdred child privily murmure emong hem comonly wonder people ere ther came word murdred whereas people ther loved well slander fame made hem hated therefore murtherer hateful name natheles earnest ne game cruel purpose would ent tempt wife entent whan doughter twelve yere age court rome subtil wise enformed sent message comanding hem billes devise cruel purpose may suffise pope people rest bad wed another lest say bad counterfete pope bull making mention hath leave first wife lete pope dispensacion stint rancor discencion betwixt people thus spake bull han published full rude people wonder ni wenden full fell right tidings come grisildis deeme heart full wo still lech sad evermo disposed humble creature adversite fortune endure abiding ever list pleasaunce yeuen heart worldly suffisaunce certainly storie tell shall marque iwritten hath speciall letter shewed intent prively boloine hath sent erle pauie tho wedden suffer prayed specially bringen ayen child two honourable estate openly one thing prayed vtterly wiyt thouy men wold enquere tell whose child say maiden wedded vnto marque saluce anon earle prayed day set way gon toward saluce lord many one rich araie maiden gide yong brother riding side arayed toward hyr marriage maiden fresh full gemmes clere brother seuen yeer age arayed eke freshly manere thus great noble glad chere toward saluce shapen iournay fro day day riding forth way explicit quarta par sequitur par quinta among wicked vsage marque wife yet tempted vtterest proof corage fully experience sore stedfast day open audience full boistrously hath said sentence certes grisilde inough pleasance han wife goodness trouth obeysance linage ne rich know soothfastnesse great lordship well auise great seruitude sondry wise may done every ploughman may people constraineth take another wife cryen day day eke pope rancor ake consenteth dare vndertake truely thus much woll say new wife comming way strong hert void anon place thilke dowery ye brought take ayen grant grace returneth father house qd man may alway prosperite euen heart read endure stroke fortune aventure ayen answerd patience lord qd wote wist alway betwixt magnificence pouert man ne may maken comparison nay held never digne manere wife ne yet chamberere house ye lady made hie god take witnesse wisely soule glad held neither lady ne maistresse humble servant worthinesse ever shall life may endure abouen euery worldly creature ye long benignite hold honour nobley worthy thonke god prey yeld sey vnto father gladly wol wende dwell life ende fostred childe full small till deed life woll lead widow cleane heart body sithen yave maidenhead true wife dread god shilde lord wife take another man husbond make new wife god grace graunt wealth high prosperite woll gladly yeue place blisful wont sithen liketh lord qd whilome heart rest shall gone shall goe lest ye profred dowaire first brought well mind wretched clothes nothing faire full hard find oh good god gentle kind ye seemed speech visage day maked mariage sooth said algate find trew effect proved love old new certes lord none adversite dien case shall never ever word worke shall repent yave mine heart good intent lord ye wote father place ye strip poore wede richely ye clad grace brought nought el drede faith nakednesse maidenhede ayen clothing restore eke wedding ring evermore remnaunt iewels ready within chamber dare safely saine naked father house qd came naked mote turne againe pleasaunce would follow faine yet hope entent smockelesse paleis went ye could doe dishonest thing ilke wombe child lay people walking seene bare wherefore pray let like worme goe way remembreth mine owne lord dere wife though vnworthy wherefore reward maidenhede brought ayen bere vouchsafe yeue mede smock wont therewith may wrie ye wombe wife take leue mine owne lord least greue smock qd yt thou hast thy bake let still beare forth thee well vnneth word spake went way routh pitee folke selfe strippeth smock foot head bare toward father house forth fare folke followed weeping wey fortune euer cursed gone fro weeping kept eyen drey ne time word spake none father tidings heard anone cursed day time nature shope liues creature doubt poore old man euer suspect marriage euer deemed sithen began lord filled corage would thinke disparage estate low alight voiden soone euer might ayenst doughter hastily goeth ye noise folk knew comming old coat might couered full sore weeping body might bring rude cloth age day fele marriage thus father certaine space dwelleth floure wifely patience never word face folke ne eke absence ne shewed done offence ne high estate remembraunce ne coutenaunce wonder great estate ghost euer plaine humilitie tender mouth ne heart delicate ne pompe ne semblance roialtie full patience benignite discreet pridelesse aye honorable husband euer meek stable men speak iob humblesse clerkes hem list well endite namely men soothfastnesse though clerkes praisen woman lite man humblesse hem acquite woman ne halfe trew woman befall new explicit quinta par sequitur par sexta fro boloine earle pauie come fame sprong lesse people eares couth eke new marquesesse brought pomp richesse neuer seene man eie noble aray west lumbardie marque shope knew er erle come sent message thilke poore silly grisildis humble heart glad visage swelling heart corage came hest knee set reuerently wisely gret grisilde qd vtterly maid wedded shall vnto receiued morrow royally possible house bee eke euery wight degree haue estate sitting seruice also pleasaunt ye best deuise haue woman sufficient certaine chamber array ordinaunce lust therefore woll faine thine gouernaunce thou knowest eke old pleasaunce though thine array bad euill besey doe thou thy deuer least wey onely lord glad qd doen lust desire also please serue degree withouten faining shall euermo ne neuer weale ne wo ne shall ghost within heart stent loue best true entent yt word gan ye hous dight table set bed make pained doen might praying chamberers god sake hasten hem fast sweepe shake seruiceable hem hath euery chamber arraied hall abouten vndren gan earle alight yt brought noble child twey people ran see sight array richely besey erst amongs hem sey walter foole though lest chaunge wife best fairer deemen grisild tender age fairer fruit hem shall fall pleasant high linage brother eke fair age seen ye people cauyt plesance commending marque governance sterne people unsad untrue aye undiscreet changing fane delighting ever rumer new like moone ever waxe ye wane full clapping deare ynough iane dome fals constance ill preveth full great foole leveth thus saiden sad folke citie people gased vp glad right noueltie haue new lady toun make mentioun grisilde ayen woll dresse tellen constance businesse well busie grisilde euery thing feast appertinent right nauyt abashed clothing though wer rude somwhat rent glad cheare yate went folke greet marquesesse doth forth businesse right glad chere ye gests receiueth buxomely eueriche degree man defaut perceiueth euer wondren might bee poore array see coud honour reuerence worthyly praisen prudence meane neuer stent maiden eke brother commend heart benigne intent well man coud prise amend last lord wend sitten doune meat gan call grisilde busie hall grisilde qd play liketh thee wife beaute right well lord qd good fay fairer saw neuer none pray god yeue prosperite hope woll send pleasaunce ynough vnto liues end one thing beseech warne also ye pricke turmenting tender maiden ye han mo fostered nourishing tenderly supposing could aduersitie endure could poore fostred creature walter saw patience glad cheare mallice oft hath done offence aye constant stable wall continuing euer innocence ouer sturdie marque gan heart dresse rue vpon wifely stedfastnesse ynough grisilde mine qd gast ne euill apaid haue thy faith thy benignite well euer woman assaid great estate poorely araid know deare wife thy stedfastnesse armes tooke gan kesse wonder tooke thereof keepe heard thing said fared stert sleepe till masednesse abraid grisilde qd god v deid thou art wife none haue ne neuer god soule saue thy doughter thou supposed wife none faithfully shall mine heir haue disposed thou bare hem thy body truly boloine haue kept hem sikerly take hem ayen maist thou say thou hast lorn thy child tway folke otherwise han said warne hem wel haue done dede malice ne cruelte assay thee thy womanhede sley child god forbede keepen hem priuely still till thy purpose knew thy herd swoune doun falleth pitous joy swouning yong child calleth armes pitously weeping embraced hem tenderly kissing full like mother salt teares bathed visage haires pitous thing see swouning pitous voice heare graunt mercy lord god thonk qd ye haue saued child deare recke neuer dead right sithen stond loue grace force death ne spirit pace tender deare yong child mine wofull mother wend stedfastly cruell hound foule vermine eaten god mercy benigne father tenderly hath done keep yt stound suddainly swapt doune ground swouning sadly held child two gan hem embrace great sleight difficulte child hir arm gan race many teare many pitous face doune ran hem tht stooden beside vnneth might man abide walter gladdeth sorow slaketh riseth abashed traunce every wight ioy feast maketh till hath caught ayen countenance walter doth faithfully pleasaunce deintie seene chere betwixt hem two met ifere lady time sey han taken chamber gone strippen rude arrey cloth gold bright shone croune many rich stone vpon head hall brought honoured ought thus hath pitous day blisful end every man woman doth might day mirth revel dispend till welkin shone sterres bright solemne every man sight feast greater co age revell mariage well many year high prosperite liven two concord rest richly doughter maried vnto lord one worthiest itaile peace rest wiues father court kept till soule body crept sonne succeedeth heritage rest peace father day fortunate eke mariage put wife great assay world strong nay hath old time yore kneth autour saith therfore story said wiues followen grisild humilite importable tho would every wight degre constant adversite grisild wherefore petrarke writeth story high stile enditeth sith woman patient vnto mortal man well ought receive gree god u sent great skill preueth wrought ne tempteth man bought saith saint iame ye pistell read preueth folke assay dread suffereth v exercise sharpe scourge adversite well oft beaten sondry wise know certes borne knew freelte best governaunce let u live vertuous suffraunce one word herkeneth lordings ye go full hard find adayes countrey grisilds three two put assay gold hem hath bad alayes brasse though faire eie rather brast two plie wiues loue bath whose life sect mighty god maintene high maistry else skath iustie hert fresh greene say song glad wene let u stint earnest mattere herkneth song saith manere lenuoye de chaucer le mariz de nostre temp grisilde dead eke hir patience buried itaile cry open audience wedded wan hardy assaile wiues patience trust find grisildes certaine shall faile noble wiues full high prudence let humility tongue naile ne let clerke cause ne diligence write storie maruaile grisild patient kinde lest chechiface swallow entraile followeth ecco holdeth silence euer answereth contretaile beth addassed innocence sharpely taketh gouernaile enprinteth well lesson minde common profit sith may auaile ne dredeth hem doth hem reverence though thine husbond armed maile arrow thy crabbed eloquence shal perce brest eke adventaile iealousie eke looke thou binde yt shall make couch doth quaile thou faire folke ben presence shew thou thy visage thine apparaile thou foule free thy dispence get thee friend aye thy travaile aye cheare light lefe linde let care weepen wring waile ye arch wiues stondeth aye defence sith ye strong great camaile ne suffreth men offence ye sclendre wife feeble battaile beth eygre tygre inde aye clappeth mill counsail phere endeth clerk oxenfords tale phere follow word host worthy clerke ended tale host said sworen cockes bone leuer barrel af ale wife home heard legend one gentle tale none purpose wist ye thing woll let still pthe frankeleins prologue old gentle briton dayes diver auentures maden layes rimed first mother tong layes instrument song else readen hem pleasaunce one hem remembraunce shall say willing sir borell man beginning first beseech haue excused rude speech learned never rhetoricke certaine thing speke mote bare plaine slept neuer mount pernaso ne learned marcus tullius cicero colour ne know none withouten dread colour growen mead el men dien paint colour rhetoricke quaint ny spirit feeleth mattere tale ye woll pthe frankeleins tale aurelius much labour cost bestowed win love dorigen another man wife content end good dealing husband lose labour cost scope tale seemeth contention courtesie armorike called britaine knight loved paine serven lady best wise many labour many great emprise lady wrought ere one fairest vnder son eke thereto commen high kinrede well vnneth durst knight drede tell wo pain distresse last worthinesse namely meek obeysaunce hath pity caught pennaunce prively fell accord take husbond lord lordship men wife lead blisse life free swore knight never life day ne night ne take upon maistry ne kithe iealousie obey follow louer lady shall save name soveraignete would shame degree thonked full great humbless said sir sith gentleness ye profred large raine ne would god never betwixt v twaine gilt either werre strife sir woll true humble wife haue trouth till hert brest thus ben quiet rest one thing sir safely dare seine friend everich must obeine woll long holden company love woll constrained maistry maistry come god loue anone beateth wing farewell gone loue thing spirit free woman kind desiren libertee constrained thrass done men sooth say shall looke pacient loue auantage aboue patience high vertue certain venquisheth clerkes sain thing rigour shall never attain every word men may chide plain learneth suffer else mote gone ye shall learne whether ye woll none world certain wight ne doth saieth sometime amis ire sickness constellation wine wo chaunging complexion causeth full oft done amisse speaken every wrong man may wreken time must temperaunce every wight governaunce therefore hath worthy wise knight liven ease suffraunce hight full wisely gan swere never default may men see humble wise accord thus hath take servant lord servaunt loue lord marriage lordship seruage servage nay lordship aboue sithen hath lady loue lady certes wife also law lond accordeth prosperity home wife goth country fer fro denmarke dwelling liueth ioy solas coud tell wedded ioy ease prosperity betwixt husbond wife evermore lasted blisful life till knight speake thus caere iuda cleped aruiragus shope dwellen yeare twaine englond cleped britaine seeken armes worship honour lust set labour dwelt two year ye booke faith thus woll stint aruiragus speake woll dorigen wife loueth husbond heart life absence weepeth siketh done noble wiues hem liketh mourneth waileth fasteth plaineth desire presence constraineth wide world set nought friend knew heauy thought comforten euer may preachen hir tellen night day causelesse slew selfe ala euery comfort possible caas done businesse maken leaue heauinesse processe ye knowen euerychone men mowen long grauen stone till figure therein printed long han comforted till receiued hath hope reason enprinting constellation gret sorrow gan assuage may alway enduren rage eke aruiragus care hath sent letter home welfare woll come hastily againe el sorrow heart slaine friend saw sorrow gan slake praiden knee god sake come roman companie away driuen derke fantasie finally graunted request well saw best stood castle fast see often friend walked shee disporten bankes hie may ship barge sie sailing course list go yet parcell wo felfe full oft ala said shee ship many see wol bring home lord hert warished bitter paine smert another time would sit thinke cast eyen downward fro brinke saw grisly rockes blake feare would hert quake foot might sustene would sit adoune vpon grene pitously sea behold say right thus sorrowfull sikes cold eterne god yt thy purueiaunce eadest world certaine gouernaunce idle men sain dost thou nothing make lord grisly fiendly rockes blake seemen rather foule confusion werke faire creation perfit god wise stable haue ye wrouyt werk vnresonable werke north south west ne east ni fostred ne man bird ne beast doth good annoyeth see ye lord mankind destroyeth hundred thousand body mankind haue rockes islaine mind sin mankind faire part thy werke thou madest like thy owne werke seemed ye great cherte toward mankind may ye meanes maken distroyen mean good euer anoyen wote well clerkes woll saine hem lest argument best though ne cannot cause well know thilke god made wind blow keepe lord conclusion clerkes lete disputation would god rockes blake sonken hell sake rockes doe slee mine heart feare thus would say many pitous tear friend saw disport roman sea discomfort shapen hem plaine el leaden riuers wels eke place delectables dauncen plaien table day right morrow tide vnto garden beside yt made ordinaunce vitailes purueyaunce gone plaien hem long day sixt morrow may may hath painted soft shours garden full leaues flour craft man hond curiously arrayed garden truly neuer na garden prise paradise odour flour fresh sight would made living hert light ever great sicknesse great sorrow held distresse full beauty pleasaunce dinner gone daunce sing also save dorigene alone yet unto selfe made mone ne seie daunce go husbond love also nathelesse must time abide good hope let sorrow slide vpon daunce among men daunced squier dorigen fresher iollier array dome month may singeth daunceth passing euery man sithen world began therewith men discriue one best faring men liue yong strong vertuous rich wise well beloued holden great prise shortly sooth tell shall vnwitting dorigen lusty squier seruaunt venus ycleaped aurelius loved best creature two yeare auenture never durst tell greuance withouten cup dronke pennance dispaired nothing durst say saue song somewhat would wray wo generall complaining said loued beloued nothing mattere made many layes song complaint roundel verilayes durst sorrow tell languish doth furie hell die must said ecco narcissus durst tell wo manner ye heard say ne durst wo bewray saue perauenture sometime daunces young folke keepen obseruaunces may well looked face wise men asken grace nothing wist entent nathelesse happed ere thence went yt neere neighbour man worship honour yknowne time yore fell speech forth vnto purpose drow aurelius saw time said thus madame qd god yt world made yt wist might hert glade would day aruyragus went ouer sea aurelius went yt neuer come well wot seruice vain guerdon ni bresting mine hert madam rueth vpon paine smert one word ye may slee saue foot god would yt graue haue leisure sey haue mercy sweet ye woll doe dey gan looke vpon aurelius qd say ye thus neuer erst qd ne wist ye ment know aurelius entent thilke god yaue soule life ne shall neuer vntrew wife word ne werke far haue wit woll ben knit take final answere play thus said aurelius qd god aboue yet woll graunt loue sithen see pitously complaine looke day endlong britaine ye remeue rock stone stone ne let ship ne boat gone say ye haue made coast clene rockes ni stone yseen woll loue best man haue trouth euer none grace qd lord qd maked well wote shall never betide let follie heart glide deintie man haue life goe loue another man wife hath body liketh aurelius full often sore siketh wo aurely herd sorowfull chere thus answerd madame qd impossible mote die suddaine death horrible word turned anone tho come friend everichone aleyes romeden doun nothing wist conclusioun suddainely began revell new till bright sonne lost hew orizont hath reft sunne light much say night home gone ioy solas save onely wretched aurelius ala house gone sorrowfull hert said might death astert seemed felt heart cold heaven honds gan hold knee bare set adoun raving said orisoun wo wit braied ne wist spake thus said pitous heart hath complaint begon vnto goddes first unto son said god apollo governour every plant hearbe tree flour yeuest thy declination ilke hem time season thine herberow chaungeth low hie lord phebus cast thy merciable eie wretched aurelius lorne lo lord lady hath death ysworne without guilt thy benignity vpon deadly heart haue pity well wot lord phebus ye lest ye may helpe saue lady best vouch ye saue deuise yt may holpen wise blisfull suster lucina shene sea goddesse queene though neptunus hath deitie see yet empresse abouen ye knowen well lord right desire quickened lighted sire followeth full besily right sea desireth naturally followen goddesse sea riuers lesse wherefore lord phebus request doe miracle doe mine heart brest next oppsition signe shall lion prayeth great flood bring fiue fadome least ouerspring highiest rocke armorike britaine let floud duren yeares twaine certes lady may say holdeth hest rockes away thing may ye lightly done pray gone faster course ye say thus prayeth suster go faster course ye yeares two shall full alway spring flood lasting night day vouchsafe manere graunt soveraigne lady dere pray sinken every rocke adoun owne derke regioun vnder ground pluto dwelleth nevermore shall lady win thy temple delphos wol barefoot seek lord phebus see teares cheek paine haue compassioun yt word swoune fell adoun long time lay traunce brother yt knew pennaunce vp caught bed brought dispaired turnment thought let wofull creature lie chese whether woll liue die aruiragus heale great honour chiualrie flour comen home worthy men blisfull art thou dorigen hast thy lusty husbond thine armes fresh knight worthy man arm loueth thee heart life nothing list imaginatife wight spoken loue thereof dout entendeth matere danceth justeth maketh good chere thus joy bliss let hem dwell wofull aurelius woll tell langour turment despitous two yeare lay wretched aurelius ere foot earth might gone ne comfort time none saue brother clerke knew wo werke none creature certaine mattere durst word saine vnder breast bare secre euer pamphilus galathe breast whole without seene heart aye arrow keene well ye knowen sursanure surgerie per ous cure men might touch arrow come thereby brother weepeth waileth prively till last fell remembraunce orleaunce fraunce clerkes yong likerous readen art curious seeken euery halke euery herne particular science lerne remembred upon deie orleaunce studie booke seie magicke naturall felaw time batcheler law learne another craft prively upon dexe ylaft booke spake mochell operation touching eight twentie mansion longen moone follie dayes worth flie holy church saieth beleeue ne suffereth none illusion u greeue book remembrance anon ioy heart gan dance himselfe saied prively brother shall warished sikerly siker science men maken diuers apparences subtill tregetores play oft east haue well heard say tragetors within hall large haue made come water barge hall rowen doun sometime hath seemed grim lioun sometime floures spring mede sometime vine grape white rede sometime castle lime stone hem liked voiden hem anone thus seemed every man sight conclude thus yt might orleaunce old felaw find moones mansion mind magicke natural aboue wel make brother haue loue apparaunce clerke may make man sight rockes blake britaine yuoided euerichone ship brinke comen gone forme enduren yeare two brother warished wo must need holden behest el shall shame lest make lenger tale vnto brother bed commen comfort yaue gone orleaunce stert anone way forth yfare hope lessed care comen almost citee two furlong three yong clerke roming himselfe met latine thriftily hem gret afterward saied wonder thing know whole cause comming ere farther foot went told hem intent briton clerke asked fellowes knowen old day answerd dead wept oft full many tere doune horse aurelius light anon magician forth gon home house made well ese hem lacked vitaile hem might plese well araied house one aurelius life saw neuer none shewed went suppere forrests parkes full wild dere saw hart horne hie greatest euer seene eie see hem hundred slaine hound arows bled bitter wound saw voided wild dere fauconers upon faire riuere haukes han heron slaine tho saw knight iusting plaine pleasaunce shewed lady daunce daunced thought master yt magike wrouyt saw time clapped honds farewell revel ago remeued neuer hous saw sight maruellous studie bookes bee saten still wight three maister called squier saied thus ready supper almost hour vndertake sithen bad supper ready make worthy men went studie bookes sir qd squier liketh ready though ye woll right goe sup qd best amorous folk somtime mote haue rest supper fell treate sum maisters guerdon remeue rockes britaine eke girond mouth saine made strange swore god saue lesse thousand pound would haue ne gladly yt sum nold done aurelius blisfull heart anone answerd thus fie thousand pound wide world men say round would yeue lord bargaine full driue knit ye shall paied truely trouth looke negligence slouth ne tarien v lenger morow nay qd clerk trouth borow bed gone aurelius lest well nigh night rest labour hope blisse wofull heart pennaunce lisse vpon morrow day home britaine tooke right way aurelius magicine beside discended would abide booke doth remember cold frostie season december phebus waxed old hewed like laton afore hot declination shone brenning gold streames bright capricorne adoune light whereas shone full pale dare well saine bitter frost slidder raine destroyed hath greene euery yerd ianus sit fire double berd drinketh bugle horne wine beforn stout brawne ye tusked swine nowell crieth euery lustie man aurelius euer doeth maister chere reuerence praieth doen deligence bringen paine smart swerd would slit hart clerke routh hath man night day speedeth wt wait time conclusion say make illusion apparence iogglerie ne termes astrologie every wight wene say britaine rockes away el sonken vnder ground till last hath time yfound make yapes wretchednesse superstitious cursednesse tollitan table forth brought full well corrected lacked nought neither collect ne expans yeres ne root ne yet geres centris argumentes proportionell conuenientes equation euery thing eight speres werking knew full well far alnath shoue fro head thilke fixt aries aboue ninth spere considered full subtilly calked found first mansion knew remnaunt proportion knew rising moone wele face terme euery dele knew also obseruaunces illusion mischaunces heathen folke vsed thilke day ne maked lenger delay magick weeke tway seemed rockes away aurelius dispaired whether shall haue loue fare amis awaiteth night day miracle knew none obstacle yt voided rock euerichone doune maisters foot fell anone saied wofull wretch aurelius thanke lord lady mine venus hath holpen fro care cold ye temple way forth hath hold whereas knew lady see saw time anon right hee dreadfull hart humble chere salued hath soueraigne lady dere rightfull lady qd wofull man serue loue best lothest world displease nere haue disease must die foot anon nought would tell wo begon certes either must die plaine ye slea guiltlesse paine death though ye haue routh auisen ere ye breake trouth repenteth like god aboue ye slea loue madame well ye wot ye haue hight nut chalenge thing right soueraigne lady grace garden yonde place ye wote right well ye behight hond trouth plight ye loue best god wote ye saied albeit vnworthy thereto madame speake honour saue heart life haue doen right ye commaunded mee ye vouchsafe ye may goe see doeth list haueth hest mind quick dead right ye shall find lieth doe liue dey well wote rockes awey tooke leaue astonied stood face na drop blood wend neuer han come trap ala qd euer hap wend neuer possibilite mister maruaile might processe nature home goeth sorrowfull creature feare vnneths may go weepeth waileth day two swouneth routh see wight told toune gone aruiragus selfe spake saied thus complaint ye shall heare face pale sorrowfull cheare ala qd thee fortune plain vnware hast wrapped thy chain fro escape wot succour saue onely death el dishonour one two behoueth chese natheles yet leuer lese life body haue shame know selfe false lese name death may quit ywis hath full many wife ere many maid yslaine selfe ala rather body doen trespas certes lo story witnesse thirtie tyrant full cursednesse slain phidon athens feast commaunded doughters arrest bringen hem beforne hem dispite naked fulfill foule delite father blood hem dance vpon ye pauement god yeue mischance wofull maiden ful dread rather would lesen maidenhead priuily stert well drenched hemselfe bookes tell messene let enquire seeke lacedemony fiftie maiden eke would haue doen lechery none company na slaine glad intent chese rather dien assent oppressed maidenhead die dread lo eke tyrant aristoclides loued maid hight simphalides father slaine night vnto dianes temple goth non right hent image armes two fro image would neuer go wight might fro honds race till slaine right selfe place sithens maiden despight defouled man foule delight well ought wife rather selfe sle defouled thinketh shall say hasdrubal wife carthage beraft selfe life saw roman wan toun tooke child lept adoun fire chese rather die romane villanie hath lucrece yslaine selfe ala rome oppressed tarquine thought shame liue lost name eight maiden melesie also han slaine hemselue dread wo rather folk gaule hem oppresse thousand story gesse couth tell touching matere abradas slain wife dere selfe slow let blood glide abradas wound broad wide saied body least way shall wight defoule may mo ensamples hereof sain sithens many han hem slain well rather would defouled woll conclude best well rather slea selfe manere demotius doughter dere nolde defouled sedasus full great pite readen thy doughters diden ala slowen hemselfe maner caas great pity well theban maid nichanore one macedony oppressed death maidenhead redressed shall saine nicerates wife case beraft selfe life true eke alcibades loue dien rather chees suffren body vnburied lo wife alceste qd saieth homere good penelope greece knoweth chastite parde laodomia written thus troy slain protheselaus lenger nolde liue day noble portia tell may withouten brutus couth liue heart ygiue perfit wifehood artemisie honoured throughout barbarie oh thenta queene thy wifely chastite wiues liuing may mirrour thing say bilia rodogone eke valeria thus plained dorigene day twey purposing euer would dey natheles vpon third night home came aruiragus worthy knight asked wept sore gan weepen euer lenger ala qd euer borne thus haue said qd thus haue sworn told ye haue heard needeth rehearse husbond glad chere sundry wise answerd saied shall deuise ought el dorigene nay nay qd god helpe wi much god yea wife qd let sleepe may still may well yet parauenture day ye shall trouth hold fay god wi haue mercy well leuer sticked loue haue ye trouth keepe saue trouth ye hiest thing men may kepe word brast anone weepe saied forbid paine death never while lasteth life breath wight tell misauenture best woll wo endure ne make countenance heavinesse folk may deeme harme ne gesse forth cleped squier maid goth forth anone dorigene said bringeth place anone took leue wey gone ne wist thider went nolde wight tellen intent squier hight aurelius dorigene amorous auenture happed meet amid toune right high street would haue gone way forthright toward garden hight went gardenward also well spied would go house manner place thus met auenture grace salueth glad intent assked whi er went answerd halfe mad vnto garden husbond bad trouth hold ala ala aurelius gan wondren caas heart great compassion chere lamentation aruiragus worthy knight bad hold hight loth yt breke trouth heart caught great routh considering hest euery side fro lust better abide doe high churlish wretchednesse ayenst fraunchise gentlenesse word saied thus madame saieth lord aruiragus sithen see great gentlenesse eke see well distresse ye shoulden hold trouth certes thinketh great routh haue well leuer euer suffer wo depart loue betwixt two release madame hond quite every surement every bond ye haue made beforne sithens thilk time ye born trouth plight shall neuer repreve behest take leve truest best wife euer yet knew life euery wight beware behest dorigene remembreth least thus squier doen gentle dede well knight withouten drede thonked vpon knee bare home vnto husbond fare told ye han heard saied ye siker well apaied vnpossible write lenger case endite aruiragus dorigene wife soueraigne blisse leaden forth life neuer anger hem betweene cherished hir though queene true euermore two folkes ye get aurelius cost hath forlorne cursed time euer borne ala qd ala euer beheight pured gold thousand pound weight vnto philosopher shall doe see fordoe mine heritage mote need goe sell bin begger may lenger dwell shame kinrede place may get better grace nathelesse woll assay certaine day yeare yeare pay thonke great courtesie trouth woll keepe woll lie heart sore goth vnto cofer brought gold vnto philosopher value fiue hundred pound gesse beseecheth gentlenesse graunt day remnaunt said maister dare mell make auaunt failed never trouth yet sikerly debt shall quit towards ever fare gone begging kirtle bare would ye vouchsafe upon suerte two yeare three respite well el mote sell mine heritage tell philosopher soberly answerd saied thus word herd hold covenaunt unto thee yes certes well truly qd hast thou thy lady thee liketh qd sorily siketh cause tell thou aurelius anon tale began told ye han heard needeth rehearce saied aruiragus gentlenesse leuer die sorow distresse wife trouth fals sorrow dorigene told al loth wicked wife leuer lost life yt trouth swore innocence erst heard speake apparence made great pite right freely sent freely sent ni sain philosopher answerd leue brother everych gently thou art squier knight god forbid blisful might clerke could doen gentle deed well dreed sir release thee thy thousand pound thou crope ground ne never ere haddest thou knowen mee sir woll taken penny thee craft ne nought trauaile thou hast ypaied right well vitaile ynough farwell haue good day tooke horse rode forth way lordings question would aske free thinketh telleth ere wend tale end pthe second nonnes prologue minister norice vnto vice yt men clepen english idlenesse porter ye gate delices eschue contrary oppresse saine lefull businesse well ought doen intent least ye fiend idlenesse v hent thousand cord slie continually v waiteth clap may man idlenesse espie lightly catch trap till man hent right lap ni ware fiend hath hond well ought v werch idlenesse withstond though men dreaden neuer die yet see men well reason doubtles idlenesse root sluggardie commeth neuer good encrees soothly sloth holdeth hem lee onely sleepe eat drinke deuouren swinke put v idlenesse cause great confusion haue doen faithfull businesse legend translation right thy glorious life passion thou thy garlond wrought rose lilly thee meane maid martir saint cecily thou art floure virgin bernard list well write thee beginning first call thou comfort v wretch doe endite thy maiden death yt wan hir merite eterne life fiend victory men may read story thou maiden mother doughter thy son thou well mercy sinfull soules cure god bounty chese thou humble high ouer euery creature thou noblest farre ouer nature disdaine maker kind son bloud flesh cloth wind within cloyster thy blisfull sidis tooke man shape eterne loue pee true compas lord guide heauen earth sea withouten le aye herien thou virgine wemles bare thy body dwellest maiden pure creator euery creature assembled magnificence mercy goodnesse pitee thou art sonne excellence onely helpest praien thee oftentime thy benignitee full freely men thine helpe beseech thou goest beforne art liues leech helpe thou blisfull meekefaire maid flemed wretch desert gall thinke woman canane said whelpes eaten ye crums small lord table yfall though yt vnworthy doughter eue sinfull yet accepteth beleeue faith ded withouten werkis werch yeue witte space quit place yt derkis thou art faire full grace mine aduocate hie place without ende song osanna thou christes mother doughter anna thy light soule prison light troubled contagion body also wight earthly lust false affection heauen refute saluation hem sorow distresse help werke woll dresse yet pray reden write foryeueth doe diligence ilke storie subtilly endite hoth haue word sentence saint reuerence storie wrote followen legende pray ye woll werke amende first woll name saint cecily expoune men may storie see say english heauens lilly pure chastnesse virginitie witnes honestie greene conscience good sote sauoured lilly name cecily say way blinde ensample good teaching else cecily written finde joyned manner conioining heauen lia figuring heauen set thought holinesse lia lasting besinesse cecily may eke saied manere wanting blindnesse great light sapience thewes clere el lo maiden name bright heuen leo cometh right men might heauen people call ensample good wise werkes leo people english say right men may heauen see sunne moon sterres euery way right men ghostly maiden free sawen faith great magnanimitie eke clerenesse hole sapience sundrie werkes bright excellence right philosopher write heauen swift round eke brenning right faire cecily white full swift busie euery good working round whole good perseuering brenning euer charitie full bright haue declared hight pthe second nonnes tale life death saint cecily maiden bright cecile life saith comen romanes noble kind foorth fostered vp faith christ bare gospell mind neuer ceased written find prayer god loue dread beseeching keepe maidenhead maid vnto man wedded full yong age ycleped valerian day come mariage full deuout humble corage vnder robe gold sat full faire next flesh yclad haire while organ made melodie god alone thus hert song lord soule eke bodie gie vnwemmed lest confounded loue died vpon tree euery second third day fast aye biding orison full fast night came bed must gone husbond manere priuily said vnto anone sweet well beloued spouse dere counsaile ye woll right faine would saine ye ensure bewraine valerian gan fast vnto swere case ne thing might neuer none bewraien erst thus said haue angell loueth great loue wake sleepe ready aye body keepe may felen drede ye touch loue vilonie right anon slee dede youth thus shall ye die ye clene loue gie woll loue cleanesse shew joy brightnesse valerian corrected god wold answerd ayen shall trust thee let angell see behold angell woll done thou hast prayed thou loue another man forsoth right sword woll slee cecile answerd anon wise ye lust angel shul see ye trow christ baptise goth forth via apia qd toun ne stant mile three poore folke doe dwell say hem right thus shall tell tell hem cecile hem sent shewen good vrban old secret need good entent ye saint vrban han behold tell word told hath purged sin shall ye see angell ere ye twinne valerian place igon right taught lerning found holy vrban anon among saint burial louting anon without tareing message tolde vrban joy gan honds vp hold teres eyen let fall almightie god iesu christ qd sower chaste counsell hierde v fruit thilke seed chastite thou hast sow cecile take thee lo like besy bee withouten gile thee serueth aye thine owne thrall cecile thilke spouse tooke newe full like fierce lion sendeth meeke lambe ewe word anon ther gan apere old man iclad white clothes clere book letter gold hond gan biforne valerian stond valerian deed fell downe drede old man saw standing forthwith anon herd rede lord faith god withouten mo christendome father also abouen ouer euery word gold iwritten rad said old man leuest thou thing none say ye nay leue thing qd valerian vnder heauen ight ne thinke may sother thing dare well say tho vanished old man nist pope vrban christned right valerian goeth home findeth cecile within chamber angell stonde angell rose lillye crownes two bare honde first cecile vnderstonde yaue one gan take valerian make body clean vnwemmed thought keepeth aye well crownes two qd paradise haue hem brought ne neuer shullen rotten ne lese sweet sauour trusteth ne neuer wight shall seene hem eye chaste hate vilonie thou valerian thou sonne assentedest good counsell also say thou list thou shalt thy boone haue brother qd valerian tho world loue man pray brother may haue grace know trouth place angel answerd god liketh request palme martirdome shall ye come vnto blisfull feast yt word tiburce brother come sauour idernome rose lillie cast within hert gan wonder fast said wonder time yere whence sote sauour commeth rose lillie smell though hem mine hand two sauour might deeper goe sweet smell mine hert find hath changed another kind valerian said two crownes snow white rose red shineth clere thine eyen han might see thou smellest hem praier shalt thou seen hem leue brother dere thou wilt without slouth beleeue aright know trouth tiburce answerd saiest thou soothnesse dreme herken dremes qd valerian han vnto time brother mine iwis erst dwelling trouth wost qd tiburce wise qd valerian yt shall thee deuise angell god hath trouth taught thou shalt seene thou wilt reney idol cleane el naught miracle crownes twey saint ambrose preface lust sey solemnely noble doctour dere commendeth saith manere palme martirdome receiue saint cecile fulfilled god ye world eke chamber gan weiue witnesse tiburces ceciles shrift god bounty would shift crownes two floures well smelling made ye angell hem tho crownes bring maid hath brought hem blisse aboue world hath wist worth certain deuotion chastity well loue tho shewed cecile open plaine idol ben thing vaine ben dumbe therto ben defe charged idol lefe troweth beast qd tiburce shall lie kissed breast heard full glad couth trouth espie day take thee mine allie said blisfull maiden faire deare said ye may heare lo right loue christ qd made thy brother wife right yt wise anon mine allie take thee sithens thou wolt thine idol despise goth thy brother thee baptise make thee clean yt thou maist behold angel face thy brother told tiburce answerd said brother deare first tell whither shal wt man said come forth good chere woll thee lead vnto pope vrban vrban brother mine valerian qd tiburce wilt thou thider lede thinketh wonder dede ne meanest thou vrban qd tho oft damned dead wonneth hal e fro dare putten forth head men bren fire red found men might spie also beare companie seeken thilke diuinitie yh heauen priuely algate ybrent world cecile answerd boldely men might dread well skilfully life le e mine dere brother liuing onely none better liuing place neuer shall lost ne drede thee nought god son v told throgh grace father son hath al thing wroght iwrought skilfull thought ghost father gan procede hath souled withouten drede word miracle lo god son world declared life men may answerd tiburce su ter dere ne saidest thou right manere na one god soothfattnesse three may thou bere witnesse shall tell qd go right man hath sapience three memory engine intellect also diuinitie three person may full right well tho gan full busily preach christ sonne paine teach many point passion god son world withhold doe mankind plaine remission b und sinnes care cold thing vnto tiburce told tiburce good intent valerian pope vrban went thonked god glad hert light christened made yt place perfite learning god knight tiburce got grace euery day saw time space angell god euery boone god asked sped full soone full hard order saine many wonder iesu wrought last tell short plaine sergeaunt e hem sought hem almache ye prouost brought hem aposed knew intent image iupiter hem sent said woll doe sacrifice swap head sentence anon martyr deuise one maximus officere prefectes councelere hem hent forth saint lad himselfe wept pity maximus herd saint lore gote hem turmentours leue hem house withouten preaching ere yt eue gan turmentour reue maximus folke echone false faith trowen god alone cecile came woxen night priest hem christened fere afterward day woxen light cecile hem said sober chere christ knight leue dere casteth away werkes derkenesse armeth armour brightnesse ye han forsooth idone great bataile course done faith hath conserued goth croune life may faile rightfull iudge ye han serued shall yeue ye deserued thing said deuise men led hem forth done sacrifice unto place ibrought tell shortly conclusioun old ensence ne sacrifice right nought knee saten hem adoun humble heart sad deuotioun l ssen head place e wenten king grace maximus saw thing betide teares told anone right soules saw heauen glide angel full clearenesse light word conuerted many wight almachius bete wh lead till life gan lete cecile tooke buried anone tiburce valerian soothly within durying place vnder stone almachius hastily bad minister fetchen openly cecile yt might presence doe sacrfide iupiter encence conuerted wi e lore weptenfull sore yaue full credence vnto word criden christ god sonne withouten difference god sentence hath se aunt good serue thus voice trow though sterue almachius heard bad fetch cecile might see alderfirst asking manner woman art thou qd gentlewoman borne qd aske thee qd thought thee greeue thy religion thy beleeue ye haue begun question fondly qd would two answer conclude one demaund ye asken leaudly almachius answerd similitude whence commeth thine answere rude whence qd yt frained conscience good faith vnfained almachius said ne takest thou none hede power answerd might qd full little drede euery mortall man power ni ylike bladder full wind ywis needle point yblow may boast laid full low full wrongfully beganst thou qd yet wrong thy perseueraunce wost thou mighty prince free haue thus commanded made ordinance euery christen wight shal haue penance christendome withsey gone quite woll reney prince erren noble dooth qd tho cecile wood sentence ye make u guilty sooth ye knowen well innocence forasmuch done reverence christ heare christen name ye put u crime eke blame well knowen thi ke name vertuous may withsey almachius answerd chese one two doe sacrifice christendome reney thou mow esca en word holy blisful maid gan laugh iudge said iudge confused wolt thou reney innocene make wicked wight qd lo dissimuleth audience stareth woddeth adv ence almachius said silly wretch thou wost far might may stretch hath mighty prince power eke authorite make folke dien liuen speakest thou proudly ne speake stedfastly qd proudely say side hate deadly thilke vice pride thou drede sooth hear woll shewen openly right thou hast made full great lesing thou saist thy prince han yeven thee might slee eke quite wight thou ne maist life bereve thou hast none power ne leve thou maist say thy prince han thee maked minister death thou speake mo thou liest thy power full naked way thy boldness said almachius tho doe sacrifice god ere thou go recke wrong thou proffer suffer philosopher thilke wrong may endure thou speakest god qd cecile answerd nice creature thou saidst word sithens thou spakest ne knew therewith thy nicete thou every manner wise leaud officer vaine iustice thee lacketh nothing thine utter eien thou nart blind thing yt seen stone men well may aspien ilke stone god thou wolt call rede thee let thine hond upon fall tast well stone thou shalt find sen yt thou seest thine eyen blind shame people shall scorne thee laugh thy follie commonly men wot well mighty god heaven hie image well maist thou espie thee ne hemselfe may profite effect worth mite word saiden woxe wroth bad lede home house house qd br n bathe flame rede bad right done dede bathe gan fast sheten night day great fire beten long night eke day also fire eke bathe hete sat cold felt wo made drop swete hath life mote lete almachie full wicked intent sleen bathe sonde sent three stroke necke smote tho turmentour manner chaunce might smite necke atwo yt time ordinaunce man doe person pennaunce fourth stroke smiten soft sore turmentour durst smite halfe dead necke ycorven left lie way went christen folke shetes home full faire hent three dayes lived turment never ceased faith teach fostred hem gan preach hem yave moveables thing pope vrban betook hem tho said asked heaven king respite three dayes mo recommaund ere go soules might werch mine house perpetuelliche cherch saint vrban deacon priuely body fette buried night among saint honestly house church saint cecile hight saint vrban hallowed well might vnto day noble wise men done christ saint servise pthe chanons yeoman prologue ended life saint cecile ere fully ridden five mile boughten vnder blee v gan take man clothed clothes blake vnder white surplice hackney pomely grise sweat wonder see seemed pricked mile three horse eke yeoman rode vpon sweateth vnneth might gone paytrell stood fome full hie fome flecked pie male twifolde croper lay semed carried little aray light sommer rode worthy man heart wondren began till understood cloke sewed hood long auised demed chanon hat hing back lace ridden trot pace rode aye pricking wode clote lefe laid hode swette keep head fro ioy see swete forehead dropped stillutory full plantaine peritory come gan cry god save qd ioly company fast pricked qd sake would overtake riden mery company yoman eke full curtesie said sir morow tide hostrie saw ride warned lord soveraine ridden full faine disport loveth daliance friend thy warning god yeue thee good chance said host certaine would seeme thy lord wise may well deme full ioconde also dare say ought tell mery tale twaie glad may companie sir lord ye without lye mirth eke iolite inough also sir trusteth ye knew well doe ye would wonder well thriftely couth werke sondry wise hath taken many great emprise full harde bring lere homely rideth among ye knew wold prowe ye would forgon acquaintaunce mochell good dare lay balaunce haue possession man high discression warne well passing wise man well qd hoste pray thee tell clerke non tell clerke nay greater clerke iwis said yoman word hoste craft somwhat woll shew say lord subtelte craft ye may wete somewhat help yet werching ground riding till come canterbury towne could clene turnen vp downe paue siluer gold yoman thus itolde vnto hoste said benedicite thing wonder meruailous sen thy lord hie prudence men shuld reuerence worship wreketh lite ouerest sloppe worthy mite effect mote go baudy tore also thy lord slothliche thee prey power better clothes bey deed acorde thy speech tell thee beseech qd yeman wherto aske ye god helpe shall neuer ythe woll auowe say therefore keep secret pray wise fay beleeue ouerdone nill preue right clerkes saine vice wherfore hold leude nice man hath ouergreat wit full oft happeth misusen doth lord greeueth sore god amend say thereof force good yeman qd host sen conning thy lord thou wost tell doth pray thee heartily sen crafty sly dwellen ye tell subbarbs towne qd lurking hernes lane blind whereas robber theues kind holden priuy fearefull residence dare shewen presence fare shall say othe yet qd host let talke thee art thou discoloured thy face peter qd god yeue harde grace vsed hote fire blow hath chaunged colour trow wont mirrour prie swinke sore lerne multiplie blondren euer poren fire failen desire euer lacken conclusion much folke illusion borow gold pound two ten twelue many summes mo make hem wenen least way pound could maken tway yet false aye han good hope done grope science ferre v beforne mowe although sworne ouertake slyt away fast wol v make beggers last while yeman thus taking chanon drew neere herd thing yeman spake suspection mennes spech euer chanon cato saieth gilty demeth thing spoken iwis gan nigh draw yeman herken sawe thus said vnto yeman tho hold thy peace speake word mo thou thou shalt sore abie thou slaundrest companie eke discouerest thou shouldest hide ye qd host tell whatsoeuer betide threting recke thee mite faith qd lite chanon saw would yeman would tell priuite fled away sorow shame qd yemon shall rise game anon woll tell sen gon foule tende quell neuer hereafter woll mete peny ne pound behete brought first unto game er die sorow haue shame ernest faith fele well man saith yet smert greue sorow labour mischiefe couth neuer leaue wise would god wit might suffice tellen longeth art nathelesse yet woll tell part sen lord gon woll spare thing know woll declare pthe thanons yeoman tale priest london covetous wise deceived chanon professing art alchimy chanon dwelt seuen yere science neuer nere haue lost thereby god wot hath many mo wont right fresh gay clothing eke good aray may weare hose vpon mine hedde colour fresh redde wanne leaden hew vseth sore shall rue swinke yet blered mine eye lo auantage multiplie sliding science hath made bare haue good yt euer fare yet amendetted thereby gold haue borowed truly liue shall quite neuer let euery man beware euer maner man casteth thereto continue hold thrift ido help god thereby shall neuer win empte purse make wit thin madnesse folie hath lost good ieopardie exiteth men thereto lese good himselfe hath vnto shrewes ioy ese haue felawes pain disese thus lerned clerke yt charge woll speak werke shall exercise eluish craft semen wonder wise termes clergiall quaint blow fire till hert faint tell eche proportion thing werchen vpon fiue sixe ounce may well siluer quantite besie tellen name orpiment brent bone yron squames pouder grounden full small earthen pot put salt iput also papere pouders speake wel icouered lampe glas much thing pottes glas engluting aire might passe nothing elle fire smart also made care wo matter subliming amalgaming calsening quicke siluer icleped mercurie crude flight cannot conclude orpiment sublimed mercurie ground litarge eke porphirie ounce certaine helpeth u labour vaine ne eke spirites assentioun ne matter lien fire adoun mowe werking nothing auaile lost labour trauaile cost twentie deuil way lost also vpon lay also full many another thing craft appertaining though order hem ne rehearce leude man yet wol tellen hem come minde though ne set hem kinde bole armoniake verdegrece borace sundry vessel made earth glas vrinals discensories viol crossettes sublimatories concurbites alembekes eke deare inough leke nedeth rehearce hem water ubisiyng bole gall arsneke sal armoniake brimstone herbes cold tell eke many one egremonie valerian lunarie list tarie lamp eke brenning night day bring abo craft may fournice eke calcination water albification vns eked lime chalke gleire eye pounder diuers ash doung pisse cleie sered pokettes salt peter vitriole diuers fire made wood cole sal tartre alcaly sal preparate combust matter coagulate cley made horse dung man oile tartre alim glas berme wort argoile resagor matter enbibing eke matter encorporing siluer citrination sementing eke fermentation yngottes testis many thing mo woll tell taught also foure spirit body seuen order oft heard lord nemen first spirit quickesiluer cleped second orpiment third iwis sal armoniake fourth brimstone body seuen eke lo hem anone sol gold luna siluer threpe mar yron mercurie quicke siluer clepe saturnus leade iupiter tinne venus coper father kinne cursed craft woll exercise shall good haue may suffice good spendeth thereabout lese shall thereof haue doubt listen vtter foly let come forth learne multiplie euery man hath ought cofer let appere wex philosopher askaunce craft light lere nay nay god wot monke frere priest chanon wight though sit booke day night learning eluish nice lore vaine parde much lere leude man subtilte fie speke thereof woll could lettcure could none effect shall finde one two saluation concluden multiplication iliche well haue ido saine failen two yet forgate much rehearsaile water corosife limaile body mollification also induration oiles ablusions mettall fusible tellen would passe bible wherefore best name would rest trow haue told ynow reise fiende looke neuer row naie let philosopher stone elixer cleped siken fast echone siker inow vnto god heauen make auow craft han ido sleight woll come v hath made v spenden much good sorow almost waxen wood good hope creepeth hart supposing euer though sore smart relieued afterward supposing hope sharpe hard warne well siken euer future temp hath made men disceuer trust thereof euer yet arte could waxe sad vnto hem bitter sweet seemeth ne sheet yt might wrappen hem night bratte towalken day light would hem sell spend craft conne stint till nothing ilaft euermore euer gone men may hem ken smell brimstone world stinken gote sauour rammish hote though man mile hem sauour woll infect trusteth lo thus smelling thredbare array men list folke know may man woll aske priuely clothed unthriftily right anon woll rowne ere saien aspied men woll hem slea science lo thus folke betraien innocence passe ouer go tale unto er potte fire ido mettals certaine quantite lord hem tempereth man gon dare say boldly men sain doen craftly algate wote well hath name yet full oft renneth blame wote ye full oft happeth pot breaketh farewell go mettales beene great violence walles may make hem resistence wrought lime stone percen throgh wall gone hem sinken ground thus lost time many pound scattered flore lepen roofe withouten doubt tho yt fende sight shew trow u like shrew hell lord fire ne wo ne angre ne ire yt pot broke saied euery man chite holte evill apuied saied long fire making saied naie blowing ferde mine office straw qd third ye leude nice tempred ought nay qd fourth stint herken fire made bech cause none theche tell whereon along well wot great strife v among qd lord ni doen peril woll beware eftsone right siker pot crased may ye amased usage let swepe floore swithe plucke vp heart glad blithe mullocke heape iswept floore yeast canuas mullocke siue ithrow sifted plucked many throwe parde qd one somewhat metall yet though tho thing mishapped hath another time may well inow mote put good auenture marchant parde may aie endure trusteth well prosperitee sometime good drowned see sometime cometh safe unto lond peace qd lord ye next time woll fond bring craft another plite doe sir let wite default somewhat wel wote another said fire ouer hote hote cold dare say concluden euer amis failen would haue madnesse evermore raue together everychone every man seemeth wise salomon thing yt shineth gold gold haue heard told ne euery apple faire eie ni good men clap crie right lo fareth emong v seemeth wisest iesus foole commeth ye prefe seemeth truest thefe shal ye know er yt ye wende tale haue made ende chanon religioun emongs v would enfect town though great niniue rome alisaundre troie three sleight infinite falsenesse couth man written gesse though might liue thousand yere world falsenesse ni pere termes woll wind speake word slie kind comune shall wight woll make dote anon right fiende himselfe full many man hath begiled er mo woll may liue yet men riden gone full many mile seeke haue acquaintance knowing false gouernance ye lust giue audience woll tellen presence worshipfull chanons religious ne demeth slander house although tale chanon euery order shrew parde god forbid company rue singular man folly slander mine entent correct amisse ment tale onely told eke mo ye wote well emong christes apostle twelue traitour iudas himselue ye remnant haue blame guiltlesse say saue onely ye woll hearken iudas couent remeueth betime rede shame losse may causen drede nothing displeased pray case herketh say london priest annuellere therein dwelt many yere pleasant seruisable vnto wife table would suffer nothing pay borde ne clothing went never gay spending siluer right ynow thereof force woll proceed tell forth tale chanon brought priest confusion false chanon came vpon day vnto priest chamber lay beseeching lene certain gold would quite ayen leneth marke qd dayes three day woll quite thee thou finde false another day hang halse priest took marke swith chanon oft thanked sith took leue went foorth wey third day brought money priest took gold ayen whereof priest full glad fain certes qd nothing anoieth lene man noble two three thing possession true condition wise break woll day man never say nay qd chanon vntrue nay thing fallen new trouth thing woll euer kepe vnto day shall crepe graue else god forbede beleueth siker crede god thanke good time saied na neuer man yet euill apayed gold ne siluer lent ne neuer falshede mine hert ment sir qd priuite sen ye goodliche haue kith great gentlenesse somwhat quite kindnesse woll shew ye woll lere shall shew anon right werche philosophy take good heed ye shall see eye woll maistrie go ye sir qd priest woll ye mary thereof pray heartily commaundement sir truly qd chanon else god forbede lo theefe couth seruice bede full soth profered service stinketh witnesseth old wise full soone woll verefie chanon root trecherie evermore delight hath gladnesse fendly thought hert empresse christ people may mischief bring god keep u false dissimuling wist priest yt delt ne harme comming nothing felt sely priest sely innocent couetise anon thou shalt blent gracelesse full blind thy conceite nothing art thou ware disceite foxe hath shapen thee wily wrench thou maiest flee wherfore go conclusion referreth thy confusion vnhappy man anon woll hie tyll thine unwitte thy folie eke falsenesse wretch ferforth conning woll stretch chanon lord ye wold wene sir host faith heaven queene another chanon hundred fold subtilte hath betraied folke many time falsenesse doleth rime ever speke falshede shame cheekes waxen rede algates beginnen glow rednesse none right well know visage fume diuerce mettals ye haue heard reherce consumed washed hath rednesse take hede chanons cursednesse sir qd priest let man gone quicksiluer anone let bring ounce two three commeth fast shul see wonder thing ye saw neuer er sir qd priest shall done iwis seruant fetch thing ready bidding went forth came anon quicksiluer shortly sain took vnces three chanoun hem laid well faire adown add seruant cole bring anon might go werking cole right anon ifet chanon tooke crosselet bosome shewed priest instrument qd yt thou seest take thy hond put thy selfe therein quicksilver vnce begin name christ wex philosopher full would profer shew hem much science shul ye see experience quicksiluer woll mortifie right sight anon withouten lie make good siluer fine purse mine el make malliable el hold false vnstable emonges folke euer appeare haue pouder cost deare shall make good cause cunning shew shall voideth man let thereout shet doore while priuitie man v espie while werken philosophie fulfilled dede like seruant anon yede maister shet doore anon labour spedily gon priest cursed chanons bidding vpon fire anon set thing blew fire busied full fast chanon croslet cast pouder whereof made either chalke earth glasse somewhat el worth flie blind priest bad hie cole couchen aboue crosselet token thee loue qd chanon thine owne honds two shall werke thing shall grant mercy qd ye priest full glad couched cole chanon bad busie fiendly wretch false chanon ye foule fende fetch bosome take bechen cole full subtily made hole therein put siluer limaile vnce stopped without faile hole waxe keep limaile understandeth false gin made made thing shall tell hereafter brought er came begile thought went twin till nere vndon could blin dulleth speke falshede faine would wreke wist variaunt bideth taketh hede sir god loue toke cole spake aboue honde bare prively while priest couched besily cole together told er chanon saied friend ye doen amis couched ought sone shall amend qd let meddle therewith pitty st gile ye right hot see well ye swete haue cloth wipe away wete priest wiped hace chanon took cole shrew face laied abouen vpon midward croslet blew well afterward till cole began fast bren yeue u drink qd chanon swithe shall well undertake sit let v mery make chanons bechen cole brent limaile hole croslet anon fell adown must need reasoun sen euen aboue couched wist priest nothing ala demed cole iliche good slight nothing understood alkamister saw time reiseth sir priest qd stondeth wote well ingot none goth walketh forth bring chalke stone woll make shappe ingot may happe bring eke bolle pan full water ye shall see besines shall hap preue yet ye shall haue misbeleue ne wrong conceit absence woll presence go come chamber doore shortly sain opened shet went forth weie forth hem caried keie comen ayen withouten delay tary long day toke chalke shope wise yngot shall deuise say tooke sleue teine siluer iuell mote cheue iust vnce weight taketh heed cursed sleight shop yngot length brede teine withouten drede slily priest espide sleue gan hide fire tooke vp matere yngnot put mery chere water vessel cast list bad priest fast loke wt put thine hond grope thou shalt finde siluer hope diuel hell el shauing siluer siluer parde put hond tooke vp teine siluer fine glad euery vaine priest saw god blessing mother also hallowes haue ye sir chanon saied priest malison ye vouchsafe teachen noble craft subtilte woll euer may qd chanon yet woll make assaie second time ye mow take hede expert nede another day assay mine absence discipline craftie science let take another ounce qd tho quicke siluer withouten word mo doen therewith haue doen er siluer priest besieth doen chanon cursed man commanded fast blewe fire come effect desire chanon right meane ready priest eft begile countenance hond bare hollow sticke take kepe beware thende ounce siluer limaile put cole stopped waxe wele keepen limaile euery dele while priest businesse chanon sticke gan dresse anon pouder cast erst deuill skin torne pray god falshede euer false word dede sticke aboue crosselet ordained false iet stirreth cole till relent gan waxe fire euery man foole wote well mote nede hole yede crosselet hastily fell priest supposed nothing well busied fast wonder fain supposing nought trouth soth sain glad cannot expresse maner mirth gladnesse chanon profered eft sone body good ye qd chanon anon tho pore craftie thou shalt find warne thee yet behinde coper within saied ye sir qd priest trow el go buie swithe good sir go forth thy way hithe went way coper came chanon hond name coper wayed ounce simple tonge pronounce minister wit doublenesse chanon root cursednesse semde frendly hem yt knew nought fendly werke thought werieth tell falsenesse natheles yet woll expresse intent men may beware thereby none cause truely put ounce coper crosselet fire swithe hath set cast pouder made ye priest blow working stoupe low erst na yape right list priest made ape afterward ingot cast pan put last water put hond sleue ye hond heard tell siluer teine slily tooke cursed heine vnwitting priest false craft pannes botome hath laft water rombleth fro wonder priuily tooke vp also coper teine knowing priest hid hent brest spake thus said game stoupeth adown god ye blame helpeth whilere put hond loketh priest tooke vp siluer teine anon said chanon let u gon three teines han wrouyt goldsmith wete ought faith nold hood siluer fine good swithe well proued shall vnto goldsmith teines three went put assaie fire hammer might man saie nay ought sotted priest gladder neuer birde gladder ayenst day ne nightingale ayenst ceason may neuer none list better sing ne lady lustier carolling speake loue womanhede ne knight armes doen hardy dede stonden grace lady dere priest craft lere chanon thus spake said loue god u deid may deserue vnto shall receit cost telleth lady qd chanon dere warne well saue frere england man make force qd sir god sake shall pay tell pray wi qd full deare say sir one worde ye list haue ye shall pay fourtie pound god saue nere friendship ye er ye shoulden pay iwis priest sum fortie pound anon noble fet told hem euerichon chanon ilke receit worching fraud deceit sir priest said keep haue loo craft would kept cloos loue keepeth secre men know subtilte god men would haue great enuie philosophie dead none way god forbid qd priest ye say yet leuer spend good haue el waxe wood ye fallen mischefe good haue ye right good prefe qd ye chanon farewell graunt mercie went way ye priest neuer seie yt day priest maken assay time would receit farewell nold lo thus beyaped beguiled thus maketh introduction bring folke destruction considereth sir estate betwixt men gold debate ferforth vnneths none multiplying blindeth many one good faith trow greatest cause scarsite philosopher speaken mistily craft yt men cannot come thereby wit men haue adaies may wel chattre iangle ye iaies tearmes set lust paine purpose shull neuer attaine man may lightly learne haue ought multiplie bring good nought lo lucre lusty game man mirth woll turne grame emptien also great heauy purse maken folke purchase curse hem han also good ylent fie shame yt han brent ala cannot flie fire hete ye vsen rede ye lete least ye lesen bet neuer late neuer thriue long date though yt ye prolle aye ye shall neuer find ye ben bold bayard blind blondereth forth perill casteth none bold renne ayenst stone goe beside way faren ye multiplien say eyen cannot seene aright looketh yt mind lacke sight though ye looke neuer broad stare ye shall win mite chaffare wast yt ye may repe renne withdraw fire least fast brenne medleth art meane ye done thrift gone full cleane right swithe woll tellen yt ye philosopher sain matere lo thus saith arnolde new toun rosarie maketh mentioun saith right thus withouten lie may man mercurie mortifie brother knowledging lo first said thing philosopher father hermes saith dragon doutles ne dieth slaine brother saine dragon mercury none vnderstood yt brimstone brother sol luna ydraw therefore said take heed saw let man busie art seech entention speech philosopher vnderstond doe leaud man science cunning qd secre secres parde also disciple plato time said maister booke senior woll beare witnesse demaund soothfastnesse tell name priuy stone plato answerd vnto anone take stone titanos men name qd magnetia ye said plato ye sir thus ignotum per ignotius magnetia good sir pray water made say element foure qd plato tell roche good sir qd tho water nay nay qd plato certaine nill philosopher ysworne eachone discouer vnto none ne booke write manere vnto christ lefe dere woll discouered liketh deitie man enspire eke defend liketh lo end conclude thus sen yt god heuen ne philosopher nemen man shall come unto stone rede best let gone maketh god aduersary werch thing contrary vnto certes neuer shall thriue though yt multiply tearme liue point ended tale god send euery true man bote bale pthe doctor physicks prologue yeoman tale ended false chanon bad host gan say truly certaine priest beguiled sooth saine wened philosopher till right gold left cofer soothly priest yape cursed chanon put hood ape passe ouer sir doctor physicke yet pray tell v tale honest matere shall done ye woll said doctor tale began anone good men qd herkeneth euerichone pthe doctor physicks tale virginius slayeth onely daughter rather shall defiled letcherous judge appius telleth v titus liuius knight cleaped virginius fulfilled honour worthinesse strong friend great richesse daughter wife neuer mo life faire maid excellent beautee abouen euery wight man may see nature hath soueraigne dilligence formed great excellence though would say lo nature thus forme paint creature list counterfete pigmalion though alway forge bete graue paint dare well saine apelles xeuxsis werch vaine graue paint forge bete presumed counterfete fourmer principall hath made vicar generall fourme paint earthly creature right list thing cure vnder moone yt may wane waxe werke nothing woll axe lord fully accord made worship lord mine creature colour figure thus seemeth nature would say maid age xii yere tway nature hath delite right paint lilly white rody rose right painture painted hath noble creature ere borne vpon lims free al bright colour bee phebus died tress grete like streames burned hete excellent beaute thousand fold vertuous ne lacketh condition praise discretion well body ghost chast floured virginite humility abstinence attemperaunce patience measure eke bering aray discreet answering alway tho wise pallas dare saine facond eke full womanly plaine counterfeited termes seeme wise degree spake word lesse sowning vertue
