man sayth ye iudge correcteth sinner commaundeth biddeth doe sinne iudges soueraines might lond much suffer shrew misdoers suffraunce processe time power might put iudges soueraignes place last make hem lese lordship let v suppose ye haue leue venge say yee might power venge ye woll make comparison vnto might aduersaries yee find many thinges haue shewed er yt condition better therefore say good ye suffer patient furthermore ye know well common saw woodnesse manne striue stronger mightie man hee himselfe striue man euen strength say strong man hee perill striue weaker man folly therfore man flie striuing mikell might salomon sayeth great worship man keepe fro noise strife befall hap yt man greater might strength thou art doe thee greeuaunce studie busie yt rather still greeuaunce venge thee seneke sayth putteth great perill striueth greater man himselfe caton sayth man higher estate degre mightie thou thee annoy greuaunce suffer yt hath greeued thee may another time releeue thee helpe thee yet set case ye haue licence venge say full many thing yt shall restrain vengeance taking make encline suffer haue patience wrong haue doen first formost ye woll consider fault owne person fault god hath suffered haue tribulation haue saied poet sayeth ought patiently take ye tribulation come v wee thinke consider wee haue deserued haue saint gregorie sayth manne considereth well number default sinnes paine tribulatious suffereth seeme lesse vnto much thinketh sinnes heauie greeuous much seemeth paine lighter easier vnto also yee owne encline bow heart take patience lord iesu christ sayeth saint peter epistle iesu christ saith hath suffred v yeuen ensample euery man follow sue neuer sinne ne neuer came villainous word mouth men cursed cursed hem men bete manaced hem also great patience saint paradice haue tribulation haue suffered without desert guilt ought much stirre patience furthermore ye shull enforce haue patience considering tribulation world little endure soone passen gone joy yt man seeketh haue patience tribulation perdurable apostle say epistle joy god sayeth perdurable say euerlasting also troweth beleeueth stedfastly well norished well taught cannot haue patience woll receiue patience salomon sayth ye doctrine wit man knowne patience another place sayeth hee patient gouerneth great prudence salomon saith angrie wrothfull man maketh noise patient man attempreth stilleth hem saith also worth patient right strong yt may haue ye lordship heart praise force strength taketh great city therefore saieth saint iames epistle patience great vertue perfection certes qd melibee graunt dame prudence yt patience great vertue perfection euery man may haue ye perfection yee seeke ne ye number right perfit men mine heart may never peace unto time bee avenged albeit yt great perill mine enemy doe mee villanie taking vengeaunce upon yet tooke heed ye perill fulfilled wicked courage therefore thinketh men ought repreve though put little perill avenge though great excesse yt say venge one outrage another ah qd dame prudence ye say liketh case ye world man outrage ne excesse venge cassiodore saith evill doth yt vengeth outrage doth outrage therefore ye shall venge order right say law excesse ne outrage also woll venge ye outrage aduersaries maner right commandeth ye sinne therefore sayth senek man shall never venge shreudnesse shreudnesse ye say right asketh defend violence violence fighting fighting certes ye say sooth defence doen without intervall without tarrying delay defend venge behooveth man put attemperaunce defence men cause ne matter repreve defendeth outrage excesse el againe reason parde yee know well yt yee make defence defend venge sheweth ye doe deed attemperately therefore thinketh patiente good salomon saieth patient shall great harme certes saied melibe graunt yt man impatient wrothe toucheth appertaineth unto though harme wonder ye law saith hee culpable entermetleth medleth thing appertaineth unto salomon saith entremetleth noise strife another manne like taketh straunge hound ye eares right hee taketh straunge hound eeres otherwhile bitten hond right wise reason harme impatience medleth noise another man whereas appertaineth unto ye know well deed say greefe disease toucheth right nigh therefore though bee wroth impatient mervaile saving grace cannot see might greatly harme though took vengeaunce richer mightie mine enemy bee well know ye money great possession beene thing world governed salomon sayth thing obey money prudence heard husbond avaunt richesse money dispraising power adversary shee spake saied wise certes deare sir graunt yee bee rich mightie ye richesse good hem well gotten hem well use right body manne may live without soule may live without temporall goodes richesse may manne get great friend therefore sayeth pamphillus nerthes doughter sayeth rich may chese thousand menne shee woll take husbond thousand one woll forsake ne refuse pamphillus saith also thou right happie say thou rich thou shalt find great number fellowes friendes thy fortune chaunge farewell friendship fellowship thou shalt alone withouten companie companie poore folke yet sayeth pamphillus moreover bond thrall linage shall made worthy noble riches right riches come many goodness right povertie come many harmes evil great povertie constraineth manne doe many evil therefore calleth cassiodor povertie mother ruine say mother overthrowing falling therefore sayth peter alfonce one ye greatest adversity world free man kinde birth constrained povertie eate ye almose enemie sayeth innocente one bookes sayth sorrowfull mishap condition poore begger aske meat hee dieth hunger aske dieth shame algates necessity constraineth aske therefore sayeth salomon better die povertie saloman sayth better die bitter death live wise reason said unto many reason could say graunt riches good hem hem well getten hem well usen tho riches therfore woll shew ye shall behave gathering rich manner shullen use hem first yee shall get hem withouten great desire good leisure sokingly hastily manne desiring get richesse habandoneth first theft evil therefore sayeth salomon yt hasteth busily wexe rich shall none innocent sayeth also richesse yt hastily commeth manne soone lightly goeth passeth man richesse commeth little little wexeth alway multiplieth sir ye shall get richesse wit trauaile vnto profite without wrong harme person law sayeth maketh manne himselfe rich hee doe harme another wight say nature defendeth forbiddeth right manne maketh himselfe rich vnto ye harme another person tullius sayth sorow ne dread death ne nothing may fall vnto man much ayenst nature man encrease owne profite harme another manne though great mightie menne get riches lightly thou yet shalt thou bee idle ne slowe doe thy profite thou shalt wise flie idlenesse salomon sayth idlenesse teacheth man doe many evil salomon sayeth trauaileth busieth tilthe lond shall eat bread idle casteth businesse ne occupation shall fall pouertie die hunger idle slow neuer find couenable time doe profite verifier sayeth ye idle manne excuseth winter ye great cold sommer ye heat cause sayth caton waketh encline ouer much sleepe ouer much rest nourisheth causeth many vice therefore sayeth saint hierome good deed yt diuel enemie ne find vnoccupied deuill ne taketh lightly vnto werking hee findeth occupied good werkes thus getting riches ye must flie idlenesse afterward yee shull vse riches yee haue got wit trauaile manner men hold scarce ne sparing ne foole large yt say ouer large spender right men blame auaricious man scarcitie chincherie wise blame spendeth ouer largely therfore saith caton vse sayth riches thou hast gotten manner men may haue matter ne cause call thee nother wretch ne chinche great shame man haue poore heart rich purse hee sayth also good thou hast gote vse measure say spend measurably foolishly wast dispend good haue haue proper owne shape hem take good another manne say ye shall flie auarice vsing richesse manner men say riches buried yee haue hem might welding wise man repreueth auaricious man sayth thus verse two whereto burieth manne good great avarice knoweth well need must die death end every man present life cause encheson joineth knitteth fast unto good yt al wit mow discever ne depart fro good knoweth well ought know dead shall nothing bear world therefore saith saint augustine avaricious manne likened unto hell swalloweth desire hath swallow devour well yee would eschew called avaricious man chinche well yee keepe governe wise menne call foole large therefore saith tullius good thine house ne hid ne kept close might opened pity debonairte say yeue hem part great need ne thy good open every mannes good afterward getting riches using hem ye shall alway three thing heart say lord god conscience good name first ye shall god heart richesse yee doe thing may manner displease god creatour maker ye word salomon better little good love god much good treasure lese love lord god prophet saith better good manne little good treasure holden shrewe great richesse yet say furthermore yee alway doe businesse get richesse yee get hem good conscience ye apostle sayeth ni thing world wee great joy conscience beareth u good witnesse wise man saith substaunce man full good sinne mannes conscience afterward getting riches using hem yee must great bnsinesse great dilligence good name bee alway kept conserved salomon saith better availeth man good name many riches therefore sayeth another place great diligence saith salomon keeping thy friend thy good name shall lenger abide thee treasure never precious certes called great gentleman god good conscience thing left ne dooth dilligence businesse keepe good name cassiodor sayth signe gentle heart manne loveth desireth good name therefore sayeth saint augustine ben two thing right necessarie also needfull good conscience good lose say good conscience thine owne person inward good lose thy neighbour outward hee trusteth much good conscience hee despiseth setteth nought good name lose recketh though keepe good name ni cruell churle sir haue shewed ye shuld doe getting riches yee vse hem see well trust ye haue riches ye woll moue warre battaile counsaile ye begin warre trust riches ne suffice warres maintaine therefore sayeth philosopher man yt desireth would algates haue warre shall neuer haue suffisaunce richer yt greater dispences must make woll haue worship victorie salomon saith greater rich yt man hath dispendours hath therfore sir albeit yt riches ye may haue much folke yet behooueth ne good begin warre whereas ye may manner haue peace vnto worship profit victorie battailes yt world lieth great number multitude people ne ye vertue man lieth hond lord god almightie therfore iudas machabeus god knight hee fight aduersarie greater number greater multitude folk stronget people machabe yet recomforted little companie saied right wise also lightly saied may lord god almightie yeue victorie fewe folke many folke victorie battaile commeth ye great number people commeth lorde god heeuen deare sir much manne certaine worthie god yeue victorie salomon sayeth therefore euery man greatly dreade warres begin yt battels fall many peril happeth soone great man slaine little man written ye second booke king deed battailes ben adventurous nothing certaine lightly one hurt speare another great perill warre therefore man flie eschew warre much man may goodly salomon sayeth hee loueth perill shall fall perill dame prudence spoken manner melibe answerd said see well dame prudence fair word reason ye haue shewed mee ye warre liketh nothing haue yet heard counsaile shall doe need certes said shee counsaile ye accorde aduersaries yee haue peace hem saint iames sayth epistle concorde peace small rich wexe great debate discorde rich decay yee know well one greatest moste soueraigne thing world vnity peace therefore sayeth lord iesu christ apostle wise well happy beene loue purchase peace called child god ah saied melibe see well ye loue mine honour ne worship ye know well mine aduersaries haue begun debate brige outrage yee see well yt ne require ne pray peace ne aske reconciled woll ye yt goe meeke obey hem crie hem mercie forsoth yt worship right men say ouer great humblenes engendreth dispraising fareth great humilitie meekenesse began dame prudence make semblaunt wrathe sayed certes sir saue grace loue honour profite doe mine owne euer haue doe ye ne none neuer see ye contrary yet saied yee haue purchased peace reconciliation ne much mistake mee ne saied amisse ye wise man sayeth discention beginneth another man reconciling beginneth thy selfe ye prophet saith flie shreudnesse doe goodnesse seeke peace follow much thee yet say yee rather pursue aduersaries peace know well ye ben hard hearted ye woll doe nothing salomon sayth hath ouer hard heart last shall mishap misbetide melibe heard dame prudence make semblaunt wrath hee saied wise dame pray yee displeased thing say yee know well angry wroth wonder wroth wote well doe ne say therefore ye prophet sayth troubled eyen haue cleare sight say counsaile liketh ready doe right ye woll desire ye repreue folly holden loue praise salomon saith yt repreueth yt doth follie shall find greater grace deceiueth sweete word saied dame prudence make semblaunt wrath ne anger great profit salomon saith wroth repreueth chideth foole follie shewing semblaunt wrath hee supporteth praiseth misdoing laugheth folly salomon saith afterward sorrowfull visage man yt say sorie heauie countenance man foole correcteth amendeth himselfe said melibe shall conne aunswere vnto many faire reason ye put shew say shortly counsaile ready performe fulfill dame prudence discouered vnto said counsaile said shee aboue thing yt ye make peace betweene god bee reconciled vnto grace haue saied god hath suffred haue tribulation disease sinnes yee say god woll send aduersaries vnto make hem fall foot ready doe commaundement salomon sayeth condition man pleasaunt liking god chaungeth heart man aduersaries constraineth hem beseech peace grace pray let speake aduersaries priuely shall know assent know entent may counsaile surely dame said melibeus doth liking put wholly disposition ordinaunce dame prudence saw good husbond delibered tooke aduise selfe thinking shee might bring need vnto good conclusion good end shee saw time shee sent aduersaries come vnto priuie place shewed wisely vnto hem great good come peace great harmes peril warre said hem goodly manner hem ought haue great repentaunce iniurie wrong done melibeus lord vnto doughter heard goodly word dame prudence surprised rauished great joy hir yt wonder tell ah lady said yee haue shewed vnto v blessing sweetnesse ye saying dauid prophet reconsiling worthy haue mannere ought require great contrition humility ye goodnesse haue presented vnto v see wel yt science cunning salomon full true saith sweet word multiply encrease friend maketh shrewes debonaire meeke certes said wee put deed matter cause wholly good ready obey ye commaundement lord melibeus therefore deere benigne lady wee pray beseech meekely may like vnto great goodnesse fulfill indeed goodly wordes wee consider know wee haue offended greeued lord melibeus measure ferforth wee power make amends therefore wee oblige bind v friend commaundement peraduenture hath heauinesse wrath v ward offence woll enjoyne v paine wee mowe beare ne sustaine therefore noble ladie wee beseech womanly pitty take aduisement neede wee ne friend disherited ne destroied folly certes said prudence hard thing right perilious man put vtterly arbitration iudgement might power enemie salomon sayth leueth yeueth credence yt shal say ne yeueth neuer ye power ne gouernaunce thy good thy sonne thy wife thy friend ne thy brother ne yeue thou neuer might ne mastry ouer thy body thou liuest sith defendeth man yeue brother ne friend might body stronger reason defendeth forbiddeth man yeue enemy nathelesse counsaile yee mistrust lord wot well know verely debonaire meeke large courteous nothing desirous ne couetous good ne rich nothing world desireth saue onely worship honour furthermore know right sure yt shall nothing doe need without counsaile shall werke case yt grace lord god ye shall reconciled vnto v said one voice worshipfull lady put v good al fully disposition ready come day liketh vnto noblesse limit v assigne v make obligation bond strong liketh vnto goodnesse mow fulfill ye lord melibe dame prudence herd ye answer men bad hem goe ayen priuely returned lord melibe told found aduersaries full repentaunt knowledging full lowly sinnes trespas ready suffer paine requiring praying mercy pitie said melibe well worthy haue pardon foryeuenesse sinne excuseth sinne knowledgeth repenteth asking indulgence seneke saith remission foryeuenesse ye confession confessionis neighbour innocence therfore assent confirme haue peace good nought without ye assent friend prudence right glad ioyfull said certes sir ye haue well goodly answerd right ye counsell assent help friend yee haue bee steered venge make war right without counsaile shall ye accord ne haue peace aduersaries law saith nothing good way kind thing vnbound yt ibound dame prudence without delay tarying sent anone messenger kinsfolke olde friendes true wise told hem order ye presence melibe matter aboue expressed declared praised hem would say aduise counsaile best doe need melibeus friend taken aduise deliberation foresaid matter examined great businesse dilligence yaue full counsaile haue peace rest melibe receiue good hert aduersaries foryeuenes mercy dame prudence herd ye assent lord melibe counsaile friend accord entention wondrously glad hart saied old prouerbe saied goodnesse thou maist day doe abide ne delay till next day therefore counsayle yee send messenger discreet wise vnto aduersaries telling hem behalfe yt woll treate peace accord shape hem without delay tarrying come vnto v thing perfourmed indeed trespassours repenting folke folly say aduersaries melibeus heard messenger saied vnto hem right gladde joyfull answered full meekely benignely yeelding grace thankes lord melibeus companie shope hem without delay goe messenger obeyed ye commaundement lord melibeus right anone tooke way court melibe tooke hem true friendes make faith hem borowes comen presence melibe said hem word stondeth thus said melibe sooth causelesse without skill reason ye haue done great iniuries wrong wife prudence doughter also ye haue entred house violence haue done outrage men know well ye haue deserued death therefore woll know e whether ye wol put ye punishing ye chastising vengeaunce outrage wife ye woll wisest hem three answerd hem said sir said know wel unworthy come court great lorde worthy ye haue greatly mistaken v haue offended agilted wise againe high lordship truely haue deserued death yet great goodnesse debonairte worlde witnesseth person wee submit v excellence benignite gracious lordship ready obey commandements beseeching yt mercifull pite ye woll consider great repentaunce lowe submision graunt v forgiuenesse outragious trespasse offence well know liberall grace mercie stretcheth goodnes doen outragious gilt trespass wickednesse bee cursedly damnably haue agilted hie lordship melibe tooke hem vp fro ye ground full benignly receiued obligation bondes others vpon pledge borowes assigned hem certain day returne vnto court receiue accept sentence judgement melibeus would command done hem cause aforesayd thing ordained euery man returned house dame prudence saw time fained asked lorde belibe vengeance hee thought good aduersaries melibe answerd said certes said hee think purpose mee fully disherite hem euer haue put exile euer certes said dame prudence cruell sentence much ayenst reason ye rich inough haue neede men rich ye might lightly wise get couetous name vicious thing ought eschewed euery good man saying apostle couetise root harmes therfore better lese much good owne take good maner better lese good worship winne good villanie shame euery man ought diligence businesse get good name yet shall hee onely busie keeping good name shall also enforce alway doe thing may renew good name written ye olde good lose man good name soone gone past renued touching yt yee say yee woll exile aduersaries thinketh much ayenst reason measure considering power haue yaue vpon selfe written worthy lose priuiledge misuseth might power giuen set case ye might enjoyne hem paine right law trowe ye may say yee might put execution peraduenture like turne warre therefore yee woll men doe obeisaunce ye must demeane cuteously yt say ye must yeue easie sentence iudgement written yt courteously commandeth men must obey therefore pray necessitie need ye cast ye ouercome heart senek saith hee yt ouercommeth heart ouercommeth twise tullie saith nothing commendable great lord debonaire meek appeaseth lightly pray ye woll forbeare vengeaunce manner yt good name may kept conserued men may haue cause matter praise pite mercy yt ye haue cause repent thing done seneke saieth ouercommeth euill maner yt repenteth victory wherefore pray let mercy hert effect entent god almightie haue mercy vpon last iudgment saint iames saith epistle iudgement without mercy shall doe yt hath mercy another wight melibe heard great skilles reason dame prudence wise information teaching heart gan encline ye wife considering true entent confirmed anon assented fully worke counsaile thanked god proceedeth goodnesse vertue sent wife great discretion day came aduersaries appeare presence hee spake hem goodly said wise pride high presumption follie negligence vnconning yee haue misborne trespassed vnto mee yet mikell see behold great humilitie ye sory repentant giltes constraineth mee doe grace mercy wherefore receiue grace foryeue holy offence iniuries wronges yee haue doen ayenst mee mine theffect ende god endles mercie woll time dying foryeue v giltes haue trespassed wretched world doubtlesse sory repentant sinnes giltes haue trespassed sight lorde god hee free merciable woll foryeue v giltes bring v blisse neuer shall haue end amen pthe monkes prologue ended tale melibee prudence benignite host saide faithfull man precious corp madrian leuer barell ale goodlefe wife heard tale nothing patience melibeus wife prudence god bone bete knaues bringeth great clubbed staues cryeth slee dog euerichone break backe bone neighbour mine woll church wife incline bee hardie trespace cometh home rampeth face cryeth false coward wreke thy wife corpus domini woll haue thy knife thou shalt haue distaffe go spin fro day till night woll thus begin ala saith euer shape wed milkesop coward ape woll ouerleide euery wight thou darest stond thy wiues right life woll fight doore anone mote dight el lost like wilde lion foole hardy wote well woll doe slee day neighbour go way perillous knife honde dare withstonde bigge armes faith shall finde misdoth saith let v passe away mattere lord said sir monk mery chere ye shall tell v tale truely lo rochester stondeth fast ride forth mine lord breke game troth know name wheder shall call lord dan iohn dan thomas dan robert dan albon house ye father kin vow god thou hast full faire chin gentle pasture thou gost thou art like pinaunt ghost vpon faith thou art officere worthy sexten celerere father soule dome thou art maister thou art home poore cloisterer ne poore nouice gouernour ware wise therewithall brawne bone well faring person none pray god yeue confusion first thee brought religion thou woldest trede foule aright hadst thou great leaue thou hast might performe thy lust ingendrure thou haddest begotten many creature ala wearest thou wide cope god yeue sorow pope onely thou euery mightie man though shore high vpon pan haue wife world lorn religion hath take vp corn treding borell men ben shrimp feble tree ther commeth wretched imp maketh heires slender feeble yt may well engender make wiues woll assay religious folke may pay venus payment better mow god wote lussheburghs payen ye wroth lord though play full oft game sooth haue heard say worthy monke took al patience said woll diligence ferre souneth honestie tell tale ye two three ye list herken hitherward woll saine life saint edward el tragidies first woll tell haue hundred cell tragedie tell certaine story old bookes v maken memorie hem stood great prosperitie fallen hie degree miserie ended wretchedly ben versified commonly six foot men call exemetron prose eke ben endighted many mitre many sundry wise lo ought inough suffice herkeneth list first beseech matere though order tell thing pope emperours king age men written finde tell hem behinde commeth remembrance haue excused mine ignorance pthe monkes tale tragical discourse haue fallen high estate extream misery bewaile manner tragedie harme hem yt stode high degree fell na remedie bring hem aduersitie certaine fortune list flie ther may man ye course witholde let man trust blinde prosperitie beth ware ensample yong olde lucifer lucifer though angell man begin though fortune may nat angell dere high degree yet fell sinne hell yet inne lucifer brightest angel art thou sathanas thou maist twin miserie thou art fall adam lo adam field damascene god owne finger iwrought begotten man sperm vncleane welt paradise sauing tree neuer worldly man high degree adam till misgouernance driuen high prosperitie labour hell mischance sampson lo sampson annunciat angell long natiuitie god almightie consecrat stode noble might see neuer another speake strength thereto hardinesse wiues told secree slough wretchednesse sampson noble mighty champion withouten weapon saue hand twey slough rent lion toward wedding walking wey false wife coulde please pray till counsaile knewe vntrew vnto foe counsaile gan bewray forsoke tooke another new hundred fox tooke sampson yre tailes hee together bond set fox tailes fire euery taile hath put brond brent corne lond oliues vine eke thousand men eke slough hond weapen asse cheke slaine thristed yt well lorne gan prey god wold paine haue pite send drinke el mote dey asse cheke drey wang toth sprang anon well drunke inough shortly sey thus halp god iudicum tell force gasa night maugre philistins cite gate town hath vp plight backe icaried hem hath high hill men might hem se noble mightie sampson lefe dere thou told woman thy secre world ne thy pere sampson neither sider drank ne wine ne head came rasour none ne shere precept messenger diuine strength haires fully twenty winter yere yere israel gouernance soon shall weep many tere woman shall bring mischance vnto lemman dalida told haires strength lay falsely foe sold sleeping barme vpon day made clip shere haires away made fomen craft espien found aray bound fast put eyen er haires clipped ishaue ther na bond men might bind prison caue whereas made ye querne grinde noble sampson strongest mankind whildom iudge glory rich nowe mayest thou weepen thine eyen blind sith thou art wele fall wretchednesse end caitife shall sey fomen made feast vpon day made foole hem play temple great aray last made foule afray two pillers shoke made hem fall fell temple lay slough himselfe eke fomen say prince euerichone eke three thousand body ther slain falling great temple stone sampson woll sain beth ware example old plain men tell counsaile wiues thing would haue secret fain touch limmes liues hercules hercules soueraigne conquerour singen werkes laud high renown time strength bare ye flower slough raft skinne lion centaur laid boste adowne harpia slew cruell bird fell golden apple raft fro dragon drew cerberus hound hell slew cruell tirant busirus made horse fret flesh bone slough serpent venemous achelous two horne brake one slew cacus caue stone slough gyant antacus strong slough grisely bore anon bare head vpon speare long neuet wight sith world began slough many monster throughout wide world name ran strength wt bounte euery realme went see strong yt man might let world end trophe stede bound brasse pillour set lemman noble champion hight deianire fresh maie clerkes maken mention hath sent shert fresh gaie ala shert ala well awaie envenomed subtilly withall er weared halfe day made flesh fro bone fall nathelesse clerkes excusen one hight nessus maked may woll accusen body shert al naked till flesh venim slaked saw non remedie hote cole hath himselfe iraked venim dained die thus sterfe worthy mighty hercules lo may trust fortune throw foloweth world pres beware oft laid full lowe full wise himselfe know beware fortune list glose waiteth man downe throwe way would least suppose nabuchodonosor mightie trone precious tresore glorious scepter royall maiestie hath king nabuchodonosore tonge vnneth may discriued twise wan hierusalem cite vessell temple lad babilon soueraigne see glorie delight hierusalem gelde anon fayrest child blood royall make hem thrall among daniel one wisest euerichone dremes king expouned whereas caldee clerkes none wist fine dreme sounded proude king let make statu gold sixty cubites long seuen brede image young old commanded lout haue drede forneis ful flame rede deed would obey neuer would assent dede daniel ne yong felowes twey king king proud elate weend god sitteth maiestie ne might nat berefe estate sodainly lost dignitie like beast seemed ete hey oxe lay therout raine wilde beast walked till certaine time come like egles fethers heeres neiles also like bird clawes god releeued certaine yeeres yaue wit many tere thonked god life fere doe amisse trespace ere layed bere knew god ful might grace balthaser sonne high balthasare held ye reign faders day fader could beware proude heart array eke ydolaster aie high estate assured pride fortune cast downe lay suddainly reigne gan deuide feast made vnto lord vpon time made hem blith officer gan call goth bring forth vessel qd father prosperitie temple hierusalem beraft god thonkes yelden honour elder v laft wife lord concubine aie drunken while appetite last noble vessel foundrie wine wall king eyen cast saw hond armelesse wrote fast feare quoke sighed sore hond balthaser made sore agast wrote mane techel phares al londe magicien ther non could expoune letter ment daniel expouned anon said king god thy father sent glory honour reign tresour rent proud nothing god drad therfore great wrath god vpon sent beraft reigne cast man company ass habitation eate haie beast wete drie till knew wit reason god heauen hath domination ouer euery reigne euery creature god compassion restored reigne figure eke thou yt art sonne art proud also knowest thing priuely art rebell god fo thou dranke eke vessel boldly thy wife eke thy wench sinfully dronke vessel sundry winis heried false god cursedly therefore thee shapen great pine hond sent fro god yt wal wrote mane techel phares trust thy reigne doen thou wotest diuided thy realme shall medes perciens giuen qd night king slaw darius occupied dignitie though thereto neither right ne law lordings ensample mowe ye take lordship sikernesse fortune woll man forsake beareth away reigne richesse friend lesse man hath friend throgh fortune mishap woll make hem enemy gesse prouerbe full soth full commune zenobia zenobia palmerie queene writeth perciens noblesse worthy armes kene wight passed hardinesse ne linage ne gentilnesse king blood perce discended say fairenesse shape shee might amended childhood find fled office woman wood went many wilde harte blood shed arrowes broad hem sent swift hem hent elder would kill lion libards beeres rent armes weld hem durst wild beast dennes seeke renne mountaines night sleepe vnder bush could eke wrastell force might yong man neuer wight might nothing armes stond kept maidenhead euery wight man dained bound last friendes hath maried odenat prince countrie hem long taried ye shall vnderstond fantasy like natheles knit fere liued joy felicite ech hem lefe dere saue one thing shee nolde neuer assent way lie one plaine entent haue childe world multiply also sone might espie child deed would suffer fantasie eftsones one dreed child cast play game till fully fourtie dayes past would one suffer odenat wild tame gate thus saied wiues letcherie shame case men hem plaied two sonnes odenat kept vertue lettrure vnto tale againe turne say worshipfull creature wise therewith large measure penible warre curteis eke ne labour might war endure non though world men wold seek rich aray ne might told well vessell clothing clad pierrie gold eke left none hunting haue sundry tongue full knowing leisure entend learne bookes liking vertue life might dispend shortly storie treat doughtie husbond conquered many reignes great orient many faire cite appertainaunt vnto maiestie rome strength held mfull fast ne neuer might foeman doe fle odinates dayes last battailes list hem rede againe sapor king mo proces fill dede conquered title therto mischiefe wo besieged itake let maister petrarke go writeth ynough vndertake odenat dead mightily realmes held owne honde ayenst foe fought truely ther na prince ne king ye lond full glad grace fond ne vpon londe warrey made aliaunce bond peace let hem ride pley emperour rome claudius ne beforne romain galien ne durst neuer coragious ne non armen ne non egipcien ne surrien ne none arabien within field durst fight lest yt would hem hondes sleen maine put hem flight king habite wenten sonnes two lawfull heires realmes hermanno titamallo name perciens hem call aie fortune hath honie gall mightie queene may endure fortune reigne made fall wretchednesse misauenture aurelian gouernance rome came honds twey shope vpon queene vengeance legion tooke way toward zenobia shortly say made flie last hent fettered eke child tway wan land home rome went emongest thing wan chair gold wrought pierre great romaine aurelian hath lad men see beforne triumph walked golden chaines necke honging crowned degre full pierre charged clothing ala fortune whilom dredefull king emperours gaureth people ala helmed stark stoures wan force townes strong toures shall head weare autremite bare septer full floures shall beare distafe cost quite nero although nero vicious fende lieth full low adown yet telleth v suetonius world subiectioun east west septentrioun ruby saphires perles white clothes broudred vp gemmes greatly gan delite delicate pompous aray proude neuer emperour like cloth weared day time nold neuer see nettes golde threde great plente fish tiber list play lust law degre fortune friend would obay rome brent dilicacie senatours slue vpon day heare wiues would weepe crie slow brother sister lay mother made pitous aray wombe let slit behold conceiued welaway little mother told teares eyen sight came saied faire woman great wonder coud might domisman dead beaute wine bring commaunded dranke anon none wo made might joined vnto cruelte ala deepe venume wade youth maister emperour teach lettrure courtesie moralite flour time bookes lie while maister maistrie made cunning souple long time tyrannie vice durst encouple senek maister deuise nero drede vice would chastise discreetly word dede sir would say emperour mote nede vertuous hate tyrannie made bathe blede armes till must die nero eke customaunce youth ayenst maister rise afterward thought great grevaunce often would chastise therefore made die wise chose bathe die manere rather another turmentise thus hath nero slaine maister dere fell fortune list longer high pride nero cherishe tho strong yet stronger thought thus god nice set man fulfilled vice high degree emperour call god seat woll trice least weneth soonest shall fall people rose upon night defaut aspied dores anon hath dight alone wend allied knocked fast aye cried faster shet dores tho wist well himselfe beguiled went way lenger durst call people cried rombled ear heard saied false tyrant neroun feare full neere wit braied god right pitously praied succour might betide drede thought deid ran garden hide garden found chorles twey sitting fire great red chorles two gan prey slea gird hed body ded despite done defame himselfe slough could better red fortune lough game holofernes neuer capitaine vnder king reignes mo put subjectioun ne stronger field thing time ne greater renoun ne pompous high presumptioun holoferne fortune aye kist licourous lad doun till dead ere wist onely yt world awe lesing richesse liberte made euery man renie lawe nabuchodonosor lord saied none god honoured ayenst hest dare wight trespace saue bethulia strong cite eliachem priest place take keepe death holoferue amid host dronke lay night within tent large berue yet pompe might iudith woman lay vpright sleeping head smote fro tent full priuely stole euery wight head vnto toun went antiochus needeth king antiochus tell high roiall maieste great pride worke venemus soch another man na neuer redeth machabe redeth proud wordes seid fill prosperite hill wretchedly deid fortune enchaunsed pride verily wend might attain vnto sterres vpon euerie side balaunce wey mountain floudes sea restrain god people hate hem would slea torment pain wening god ne might pride abate nichanore timothe iews venquished mightily vnto iewes soch hate greithe chare full ely swore saied full dispitously vnto hierusalem would eftsone wrecke yre full cruelly purpose let full sone god manace sore smote inuisible wound aie incurable guttes carfe bote paine importable certainly wreche reasonable many man guttes paine purpose cursed damnable smert nolde restrain bade anon aparaile host sodainly ware god daunted pride bost sore fell chare limmes skinne tare might go ne ride chaire men bare forbruised backe side wreche god smote cruelly bodie wicked wormes crept therewithall stanke horribly none meine kept whether woke el slept ne might stinke endure mischief wayled wept knew god lord euerie creature host himselfe also full lothsome stinke caraine man might beare ne fro stinke horrible paine sterfe full wretchedly mountaine thus hath robber homicide many man made wepe plaine soch guerdon belongeth pride alexander storie alexander commune every wight hath discretioun hath heard somwhat fortune wide world conclusioun wan strength renoun glad peace unto send pride man bost layed adown came vnto world end comparison might yet never maked betwixt another conquerour al world dread hath quaked knighthood freedome floure fortune made heir high honour saue wine woman nothing might assuage high intent armes labour full loving courage price wer though told darius hundred thousand mo prince earles knight bold conquered brought wo say ferre man may ride go world wt shuld devise though wrote told evermo knighthood might suffice twelve yere raigned rede machabe phillips sonne macedone first king grece countre worthy gentle alexander ala ever thee fall soch case empoisoned thy folke thou thy sice fortune hath turned ace yet thee ne wept never tere shall yeve men teres complaine death gentlenesse fraunchise world welded demaine yet thought might suffice full courage high emprise ala shall helpe endite false fortune poyson despise woe wite iulius cesar wisedome manhood high labour humble bed royal majeste vp rose iulius conquerour occident lond see wan strength honde else trete unto rome made tributarie sith rome emperour till fortune wexe adversarie mighty cesar thessaly ayenst pompey father thine law orient chivalry ferre day beginneth daw knighthood hast take islaw saue folke pompeius fled thou put orient aw thanke fortune well thee ysped little woll bewaile pompey noble governour rome fled battaile say one men false traitour head smote win favour iulius head brought ala pompey orient conquerour fortune vnto fine thee wrought rome againe repaireth iulius triumph lauriate full hie time brutus cassius ever high estate envie full prively made conspiracie ayenst iulius subtil wise cast place die bodkin shall deuise iulius unto capitoll went vpon day wont gone capitoll anon hent fals brutus sone sticked bodkin anone many wound thus let lie never grutched stroke one else two storie lie manly iulius hart well loved stately honeste tho deadly wound sore smart mantle hip yet cast man see privite lay dying traunce wist verily die honestie yet remembraunce lucan thee storie recommend sueton valerie also storie writen word end great conquerours two fortune first friend sith fo man trust upon favour long await euermo witnesse conquerours strong cresus rich cresus whilom king lide cresus cirus sore drad yet caught amid pride brenne men fire lad rain fro firmament shad queint fire made scape beware yet grace till fortune gallows made gape escaped could stint begin new aray wend well fortune sent hap escaped rain foe might slain eke sweven upon night met proud eke fain vengeaunce heart set vpon tree thought iupiter wisshe back side phebus eke faire towell brought dry therwith wexe pride doughter stood beside yt knew hie sentence habound bad tell signified dreame right thus expound tree qd yt gallows meane iupiter betokeneth snow rain phebus towell cleane betokeneth sun beames sooth sain thou shalt honged father certain raine shall thee wash sun shall thee drie thus warned full plat full plain doughter called phanie honged cresus proud king roiall throne might auaile tragedie none ne manner thing singing crie ne bewaile fortune day woll assaile unware stroke ye reignes yt proud men trusteth wol faile couer bright face cloud peter spaine noble worthy petro glory spain fortune held high majestie well ought men thy pitous death complain thy lond thy brother made thee flee siege subteltee thou betraied lad unto tent owne hond slue thee succeeding thy reigne thy rent field snow thegle black therin caught ye limrod coloured ye glede brewed cursednesse sinne wicked neste werker dede charles ne oliver yt tooke aye hede trouth honour armorike genillion oliver corrupt mede brought worthy king brike petro king cipre worthy petro king cipre also alexandrie wan high maistrie full many heathen wroughtest thou wo thine liege enuie thing thy chiualrie thy bed han slain thee morow thus fortune whele governe gie joy bringen men sorow barnabo vicount millaine great barnabo vicounte god delite scourge lumbardie thine infortune account sen estate thou clomben high thy brother sonne yt thy double alie thy nevew sonne lawe within prison made thee die ne yt thou slawe hugeline pise erle hugeline pise ye langoure may tongue tell pite little pise stont toure toure prison put bene little child three eldest scarsely five yere age ala fortune great cruelte bird put cage damned die prison roger bishop pise made false suggestion ye people gan upon rise put prison wise ye heard meat drinke small unneth may suffice therewithall full poore bad day befell houre whan yt meat wont brought geilour shette doores toure heard well spake right nought heart anon fill thought hunger would doe dien ala qd ala wrought therewithall teares fill fro eyen yong sonne thre yere age vnto said father doe ye wepe geilour bring potage morsell bread ye kepe hungrie may sleepe would god might sleepe ever hunger wombe crepe ni nothing bread yt lever thus day day childe began cry till father arme adowne lay said farewell father mote die kist father deide day wofull father sey wo armes two gan bite said ala fortune well away thy false whele wo may wite child wend hunger armes gnewe wo saied father doe ala rather eat flesh upon u two flesh yaue u take flesh u fro eate inough right thus seid within day two laid hem lap adoun deid thus ended mighty earle pise himselfe dispeired eke hunger starfe tragedie ought inough suffice high estate fortune away carfe woll heare longer wise readeth great poete itaile hight dante deuise fro point point word woll faile phere stinteth knight monke tale followeth prologue nonnes priest ho qd ye knight good sir ye said right ynough iwis mokell little heavinesse right ynough much folke gesse say great disease men wealth ease heare suddaine fall ala contrary joy solas man hath poore estate climbeth wexeth fortunate abideth prosperite thing gladsome thinketh thing good tell ye qd host saint poules bell ye say right soth monke clappeth loud spake fortune covered cloud wote also tragedie right heard perde remedie bewailen ne complaine done al paine ye said heare heavinesse sir monke god blesse tale anoyeth companie talking worth butterflie therein disport ne game therefore sir monk dan pier name pray heartily tell u somewhat el sikerly nere clinking bel bridle honge every side heaven king u dide ere han fall slepe although flough never depe tale tolde vaine certainely clerkes saine man may none audience nought helpeth tell sentence well wote substaunce thing shall well reported sir say somwhat hunting pray ne qd monke lust play let another tell told spake host rude speech bold saied unto nonnes priest anon com nere priest com hither thou sir iohn tell u thing may herts glad blithe though thou ride upon jade though thy horse foule lene woll serve thee recke bene looke thy heart mery evermo yes sir qd yes host mote go mery iwis woll blamed right anon tale hath attained thus said unto u everichon sweet priest goodly man sir iohn pthe nonnes priest tale cock hen moral whereof embrace true friend beware flatterer poore widdowe somdele istept age whilom dwelling poor cotage beside grove stonding dale widowe tell tale sen day last wife patience led full simple life little cattell rent husbandry god sent found self eke doughters two three large sowes mo three kine eke sheep hight mall well sooty boure eke hall ete many slender mele poinant sauce ne knew never adele ne deinty morsell passed throte diet accordaunt cote repletion ne made never sicke temperate diet physicke exercise heart suffisaunce gout let nothing daunce ne apoplexie shent hed wine dranke white ne red bord served white black milk broun breed found lack seinde bacon sometime eye twey manner dey yerd enclosed stickes drie diched without cock hight chaunteclere land crowing na pere voice merrier ye merry orgon masse day church gon well sikerer crowing loge clocke abbey orloge nature knew ech assentioun equinoctiall toun degree xv ascended crew might amended combe redder fine corall battelled castle wall bill blacke jet shone like leg tone nailes whiter lilly flour like burned gold colour gentle cocke governaunce seven hen done pleasaunce susters paramour wonder like colour fairest hewed throte called faire damosell pertelote fethered hundred time day pleaseth ever may curteis discreet debonaire compenable bare self faire sen time sevennight old truliche hath hert hold chaunteclere looking every lith loveth yt wel therwith joy heare sing bright sunne gan spring sweet accord lefe ferre lond time understond beast bird coulden speake sing fell dawning chaunteclere among wife sat perch hall next sat faire pertelote chanteclere gan grone throte man yt dreme drenched sore yt pertelot thus herd rore agast said heart dere aileth grone manere ye sleper fie shame answered thus god madame pray ye take griefe god mette mischiefe right yt yet mine hert sore afright god qd sweven hede right keepe body foule prisoun mette romed within yerde wher saw beest like hound would made areest vpon body would deed colour betwixt yellow reed tipped taile eeres black unlike ye remnant heeres snout small glowing eyen twey yet looke almost feare dey causeth groning doubtles away qd fie shame heartlesse ala qd god ye lost heart love cannot love cowarde faith certes woman saith desire might husbonds hardy wise free discrete ne niggard ne foole ne agast every toole ne none avauntour god durst ye say shame unto love sweven might make aferde ye man heart berde ala con ye aferd swevenis nothing bnt vanitie god wotte sweven swevens ben engendred replecions oft fume complecions humour ben habundant wight certes dreme wch ye met night commeth great superfluitie red color parde causen folke dred dreames arrowes fire red lemes red beast wollen hem bite conteke wasp great lite right humour melancholie causeth many man sleepe cry feare great bulles beres blake el black devills woll hem take humour could tell also werke man slepe much wo woll passe lightly lo caton yt wise man said thus force dreames sir qd flie fro bemes god love taketh laxative vp pexill soule life counsell best woll lie collor melancholie ye purge ye shull tarie though town none apotecarie shall selfe two herbes techen shall heale prow yerde tho hearbs shall finde propertie kinde purge bineth eke forgetteth god owne love ye right colericke complection ware sunne ascention ne finde ye repleate humour hote dare wel lay grote ye shall fever terciane el ague may bane day two ye shall digestive wormes ye take axatives laurel centorie femetere el elder berry grow catapuce gaitres bereis yvie growing yard merry plucke hem grow eat hem merry husbond father kin dredeth dreme say madame qd gramercy lore nathelesse touching dan caton wisedome hath great renoun though dreames drede god men may old bookes rede many man authoritie ever caton mote thee revers saith sentence well found experience dreames signification well joy tribulation folke endure life present nedeth make non argument prefe sheweth indeed one greatest authours yt men rede saith thus yt whilome two fellowes went pilgrimage full good intent happed came town congregatioun people eke strait herbigage ne found much cottage might ylodged wherefore mote necessite night depart company hem goeth hostelry tooke lodging would fall one hem lodged stall farre yerd ox plough man lodged well ynough aventure fortune u governeth commune befell long day man met bed lay fellow gan upon call said ala ox stall night shall murdered lie helpe dere brother die hast come said man sleep fear abraid waked sleeye turned tooke keepe thought dreame vanite thus twise sleepe dreamed third time yet felaw came thought said slaw behold bloudy wound deepe wide arise earely morrow tide west gate toun qd hee cart full dung shalt thou see body hid full prively doe thou cart arresten boldely gold caused death sooth saine told every point slaine full pitous face pale hew trust wel dreme found right trew morrow soone day fellowes inne tooke way came ox stall fellow began call hosteler answerd anone said sir fellow igone soone day went toun man gan fall suspectioun remembring dreames mette forth goeth lenger would lette vnto west gate toune fond dung cart dung lond araied wise ye haue heard dead man deuise hardy heart gan crie vengeaunce iustice fellonie fellow murdred night cart lieth gaping vpright crie minister qd shoulden keepe rule cite harow ala lieth fellow slaine tale saine people start cast ye cart ground middle dung found dead man murdred new blisfull god art good trew lo thou bewrayest murder alway murder woll see day day murder waltsome abhominable god reasonable ne woll suffer hylled bee though abide yeare two three murder woll conclusioun right anon minister toun haue hent carter sore pined eke hosteler sore engined knew wickednesse anone honged vp necke bone may ye see dremes ben drede certes lefe rede right next chapter gabbe haue joy blis two men would haue passed ouer see certaine cause ferre countree wind ne contrarie made hem city tarie stood full merry vpon hauen side day ayenst euen tide wind gan chaunge blew hem lest iolly glad wenten rest cast hem full early saile herken one man fell great meruaile one hem sleeping lay mette wonder dreme day thought man stood bed side commaunded abide said thus thou morrow wend thou shal dreint tale end woke told fellow wt met praied voyage let day prayed abide fellow lay bed side gan laugh scorned full fast dreme qd may hart agast woll let doe thing set straw thy dreaming sweuens vanity yapes men meten day oules ape eke many mase therewithall dremen thing neuer ne shall sith see thou wolt abide thus slouthen wilfully thy tide god wot rueth haue good day thus tooke leue went way ere halfe course ysailed ne mischaunce ailed casuelly ship bottome rent ship men vnder water went sight ship beside hem sailed tide therefore faire pertelot dere ensamples old maist thou lere man rechelesse dremes say thee doubtlesse many dreme full sore drede lo life saint kenelme rede kenelphus sonne noble king mercenryke kenelm mette thing little ere murdred deie murder vision seie norice expouned euery dele sweuen bad keepe wele fro treason seuen yere old therefore little tale thereof told dreame holy hert god rather shert ye haue herd legend haue dame pertelot say truly macrobius writeth auision affrick worthy scipion affirmeth dremes sayeth warning thing seen furthermore pray looketh well old testament daniel held dreames vanitee reade eke ioseph shall ye see whether dremes ben sometime say warning thing shall fall looke egipt king yt hight pharao baker butteler also wheder felt none effect dremes woll seeke act sundry remes may rede dreames many wonder thing lo cresus lide king mette sat vpon tree signified honged bee lo andromacha hector wife day hector lese life dreamed night beforne life hector lorne day went vnto battaile warned might auaile went fight neuerthelesse slaine anone achilles tale long tell eke nigh day may dwell shortely say conclusion shall haue auision aduersity say furthermore ne tell laratiues store ben venomous wot wele hem defie loue hem neuer adele let v speke mirth stint madame perrelot haue blis one thing god hath sent large grace see beautie face ye ben scarlet red eyen maketh dread dien siker principio mulier est hominis confusio madame sentence latine woman man joy blis fele night soft side albeit may ride perch made narrow ala full joy solas defie sweuen dreme yt word flew doun fro beme day eke hennes chucke gan hem call found corne lay yerd royall aferd feddred pertelot twenty time trode eke oft ere prime looketh grim lioun toe romed vp doun deigned set foot ground chucked corne yfound ran wiues royall prince hall leaue chaunteclere posture woll tell aduenture month world began yt hight march god first made man complete passed also sith march began thirtie dayes two befell chaunteclere pride seven wiues walking beside cast vp eyen bright sunne signe taurus irunne twenty degree one somewhat knew kind none lore yt prime crew blisfull steuen sunne said clombe vp heuen forty degree one somewhat iwis madame pertelot world blis herken blisfull bird sing see fresh floures gan spring full mine heart reueli sollas suddainely fell sorrowfull caas euer latter end joy wo god wote worldly joy soone ago rethore coud faire endite chronicle might safely write soueraine notabilite euery wise man herken story true vndertake booke launcelot du lake woman holden full great reuerence woll turne ayen sentence col foxe full sleight iniquitee groue wonned yeares three high imagination aforne cast night hedge brast yerd chaunteclere faire wont eke wiues repaire bed wortes still lay till passed vndren day waiting time chaunteclere fall gladly done homicide await lie murder men false murder rucking thy den new scariot new gauilion false dissimuler greeke sinon broughtest troy vtterly sorrow chaunteclere accursed morrow thou thy yerd flew bemes thou full well warned thy dremes ilke day perillous thee yt god afore wote must need bee opinion certaine clerkis witnesse clerk schole great altercation matter great disputation hath hundred thousand men ne cannot boult bren holy doctour saint austin boece bishop bradwardin whether god worthy foreweting straineth needly doe thing needly clepe simple necessite free choice graunted thing nought though god forewot wrought weting streineth neuer dele necessitie condicionele woll haue done matere tale cocke ye shall took counsaile wife sorrow walke yerd vpon morrow met dreme told woman counsailes often full cold woman counsaile brought v first wo made adam fro paradice go full merry well ease might displease counsaile woman would blame passe ouer said game redeth author trete mattere say woman ye mow ben cockes word mine woman harme deuine faire sond bath merely lieth pertelot susters ayenst sunne chaunteclere free sung merrier mermaid see phisiologus sayeth vtterly singen well merely befell cast eie among wortes butterflie ware foxe lay full low nothing list crow cried cocke cocke vp stert one affraid hert naturally beast desireth flee fro contrarie may see tho neuer erst seene eie chaunteclere gan espie would haue fled foxe anone said gentle sir ala woll ye done ye afraid friend certes worse fiend would harme villanie come counsaile espie truly cause comming heren ye sing soothly ye haue merry steuen angel hath heuen therewith ye haue musicke feeling boece sing lord father god soule blesse eke mother gentlenesse haue house ben great ease certes sir full faine would please men speaken singing woll sey mote broken well mine eyen twey save ne herd neuer man sing father morning certes heart song make voice strong would paine eyen must winke loud must crien stonden tiptoe therewithall stretchen forth neck long small eke discretion man region song wisdome might passe haue well red dan burnel asse among verse cocke priest sonne yaue knocke vpon leg yong nice made lese benefice certain comparison betwixt wisdome discretion father subtilty singeth sir saint charity let see ye father counterfete chaunteclere wing gan bete man could treason espie rauished flatterie ala ye lord many false flatterour court many false lesingour pleaseth well faith soothfastnesse vnto saith readeth ecclesiast flatterie beware ye lord trecherie chaunteclere stood high vpon toos stretching necke held eyen cloos gan crowen loud none dan russell foxe start vp one gorget hent chaunteclere backe toward wood bere yet man sued destinie maist eschued ala chaunteclere flew fro beames ala wife rought dreames friday fell mischaunce venus art goddesse pleasaunce sithens yt thy seruant chaunteclere thy seruice powere delite world multiplie woldst thou suffer thy day die gaulfride deere maister soueraigne worthy king richard slaine shot complainedest death sore ne thy science thy lore friday chide ye friday shortly slaine wold shew coud plaine chauntecleres drede paine certes crie ne lamentation na neuer lady made whan ilion pirrus bright swerd hent king priam beard slough saieth eneidos made hen cloos lost chaunteclere sight souerainly dame pertelot shright well louder hasdruballes wife husbond lost life romanes brent cartage full torment rage willfully fire stert brent selfe stedfast hert wofull hennes right cried ye nero brent cite rome cryed senatours wiues husbonds lese liues withouten gilt nero hath hem slaine woll turne tale againe sely widow doughters two heard hennes crien make wo dore stert anon saw foxe toward wood gon bare vpon backe cocke away cryed harow well away ha foxe hem ran eke staues many another man ran coll dogge talbot eke garlond malkin distaffe hond ran cow calfe eke hogges sore aferd dogges shouting men woman eke ran yt thought herts shuld breke yellen loud fendes hell duckes cried men would hem quell goose feare flew ouer tree hiues came swarme bee hidous noise benedicite certes iacke straw ne meine ne made neuer shoutes halfe shrill would flemming kill day made vpon foxe brasse blew trompes boxe horne bone blew pouped therewith shriked shouted semed though heauen fall good men pray herken lo fortune tourneth sodainly hope pride enemy cocke lay vpon fox backe drede vnto foxe spake saied good sir ye yet say wise god helpe tourneth ayen ye proud churles pestilence upon fall come unto wood side maugre hed cocke shall abide woll eat faith anon foxe answerd faith shall spake word sodainly cock brake mouth deliuerly high upon tree flew anon foxe saw gon ala qd chaunteclere ala haue qd done trespasse much made aferd whan hent brought yerd sir wicked entent come downe shall tell wt ment shall say sothe god helpe nay qd shrew v two first shrew selfe blood bone thou begile ter one thou shalt thy flatterie doe sing winking eye winketh see wilfully god let neuer thee nay qd fox god yeue mischance discrete gouernance iangleth whan shold haue pee lo soch recheles negligent trust flatterie ye hold tale lie foxe cocke hen taketh moralite good men saint poule sayeth written doctrine written iwis taketh frute let chaffe still good god thy saieth lord make v good men bring v high blisse amen pthe manciples prologue sir nonnes priest host saied anone blessed thy brech euerie stone merrie tale chaunteclere troth thou seculere thou wouldest tredfoule aright thou haue corage thou hast might thee nede hen wene ye seuen time seuentene se braunes hath gentle priest great necke large breest loketh like sparhauke eyen needeth colour dien brasill ne gram portingale sir yet faire fall tale full merrie chere saied another man ye shall wote ye stondeth little towne called bob vp downe vnder blee canterbury way gan host yape play saied sir dunne mire man praier ne hire woll awake fellow behind theefe might full lightly rob bind see nappeth see cockes bone woll fall hors atones cook london mischaunce doe comfort knoweth penaunce shall tell tale fey although worth bottle hey awake thou cook qd god yeue thee sorow eileth thee sleepe morow hast thou fleen al night art thou dronk hast thou al night quean iswonk thou maiest hold vp thy hed cooke full pale nothing red saied sir hoste god soule yblesse fallen great heuinesse leuer slepe best gallon wine chepe well qd mancipie may doe ease thee sir cooke wight displease ride companie hoste courtesie woll excuse thee thy tale good faith thy visage full pale thine eyen dase soothly thinketh well wot thy breath full soure stinketh sheweth wel thou art wel disposed certaine shalt glosed see galpeth lo dronken wight though would v swallow anon right hold close thy mouth thy father kin deuill hell set foot therein thy cursed breath infect v fie stinking swine fie foule mote thee befall taketh heed sir lustie man sweet sir woll ye iust van thereto thinketh ye well shape trow ye haue dronken wine ape men play straw speech cooke waxed wraw manciple gan nod fast lacke speech doun hors cast lay till men vp tooke faire cheuesaunce cooke ala ne hold ladill ere ayen sadill great shouing fro lift vp much care wo vnweldy sely palled gost manciple spake host drinke hath domination vpon man saluation trow leudly woll tell tale wine old moistie ale hath dronk speketh nose sniueleth fast eke hath pose also hath done ynough keepe caple slough fall caple eftsone shall haue ynough doen lifting vp againe dronken corce tell thy tale make force yet manciple faith thou art nice thus openly repreue vice another day woll perauenture recleime thee bring thee lure meane speake smale thing pinch thy rekenings honest came prefe qd manciple great mischefe might bring snare yet leuer pay mare rideth striue woll wrath mote thriue spake saied bourd wote ye haue gourd draught wine ye ripe grape right anon ye shall see good yape cooke shall drinke thereof may vp paine life woll say nay certainly tellen vessell cooke dranke fast ala needeth dranke ynough beforne pouped horne manciple tooke gourd drinke cooke full fain thonked wise coud gan host laugh wonder loud saied see well necessary yt gon good drinke v cary turne rancour disease accord loue many word pea bacchus yblessed thy holy name canst turne earnest game worship thonke thy deite matter ye get tell thy tale thou manciple thee pray well sir qd herkeneth say pthe manciples tale phoebus keepeth white crow speak jay crow accuseth wife jelous played false absence hereupon arrow slayeth wife repenting rashness taketh revenge crow phebus dwelled earth adoun old book v make mentioun lustie batcheler world eke ye best archer slough pheton serpent lay sleeping ayenst sunne vpon day many another noble worthy dede bow wrought men mow rede play could euery minstralcie sing melodie heren clere voice soun certes king thebe amphioun song walled cite could neuer sing halfe well thereto seemelist man sith world began needeth feture discriue world na none faire aliue therewith fulfilled gentlenesse honour perfite worthinesse phebus yt floure bachelerie well freedome chiualrie disport signe eke victorie pheton telleth v storie wont beare hond bow phebus hous crow within cage yfostred many day taught speech men teach iay white crow white swan counterfete speech euery man could tell tale world nightingale ne could hundred thousand dele sing wonderly merry wele phebus hous wife loued life night day euer dilligence please doe reuerence saue onely sooth shall sain ielous wold haue kept fain loth yaped bee euery wight degree nought auaileth nought good wife yt clene werke thought kept none await certaine truly labour vaine keepe shrew woll hold nicete spill labour keepe wiues thus writeth old clerkes liues purpose first began worthy phebus doth please wening plesaunce manhood gouernaunce man put grace god wote may man embrace distraine thing nature hath naturally set creature take bird put cage doe thine entent thy corage foster tenderly meat drinke dainty thou canst bethinke keepe also cleanely thou may although cage gold neuer gay yet bird twentie thousand fold leuer forrest wide cold goe eaten wormes wretchednesse euer bird doe businesse escape cage may libertie bird desireth aye let take cat foster milke tender flesh make couch silke let see mouse go wall anon weiueth flesh couch euery deintie hous appetite hath eat mous lo hath lust domination appetite flemeth discretion shee wolfe hath also villanous kind leudest wolfe euer may find least reputation woll take time lust haue make ensamples speake men vntrue nothing woman men haue euer licorous appetite lower thing performe delite wiues neuer faire ne neuer true ne debonaire flesh newfangle mischaunce ne con nothing haue pleasaunce souneth vnto vertue phebus thought gile disceiued iolite vnder another man little reputation nought worth phebus comparison harme happeth oft commeth much harme wo befell phebus absent wife anon hath lemman sent lemman certes knauish speech foryeue beseech wise plato saieth ye mow rede word must need accord ye dede men tell properly thing word must cousin working boistous man right thus say little difference truely betwixt wife high degree body dishonest poore wench werke amis gentill estate aboue shal called lady love tother poore woman shal called wench lemman god wote mine owne dere brother men lay low one right betwixt titlelesse tiraunt outlaw theefe erraunt say difference alexander told sentence tyrant greater might force meine slea doune right bren house home make plain lo therfore called captain outlaw hath smale meine maie doe great harme ne bring countrey great mischiefe men callen outlawe thiefe man textuele woll tell textes neuer dele woll goe tale began phebus wife sent lemman anon wrought lust volage white crowe yt hing aie cage beheld werke saied neuer word home come phebus lord crowe song cuckow cuckow cuckow bird qd phebus wt singest thou thou wont merily sing hart reioysing heare thy voice ala song god qd sing amis phebus qd thy worthinesse thy beaute thy gentilnesse thy song thy minstralcie thy waiting blered thine iye one little reputation worth thee comparison mountenance gnat mote thriue bedde thy wife saw swiue wol ye crow anon told full sad token word bold wife doen lecherie great shame great villanie told eft sawe iyen phebus gan awayward wryen thought wofull hart brast two bowe bent set therein flo ire hath wife slain effect sain sorrow whereof brake minstralsie harp lute getern sautrie eke brake arrowes bowe thus spake crowe traitour qd tong scorpion thou hast brought confusion ala wrought nere dedde dere wife gemme lustie hedde sad eke true lyest thou dedde face pale hewe full giltlesse durst sweare iwis rakell hond foule amis troubled wit yre retchelesse vnauised smitest guiltlesse wantrust full false suspection thy wit thy discretion oh euerie man beware rekilnesse ne trowe nothing without strong witnesse smite sone er thou wete auised well sikerly ye doe execution vpon yre suspection ala thousand folke hath rekell ire fully fordoen brought hem mire ala sorowe woll selfe sle crowe false thefe said woll thee quite anon thy false tale thou song whilom nitingale shalt thou false thefe thy song forgone eke thy white fethers euerychone ne neuer thy life shalt thou speake thus shull men traitour wreake thou thine ofspring euer shall blake ne neuer sweet noise shall ye make euer crie ayenst tempest raine token thee wife slaine crow stert anon pulled white fethers euerychon made black reft song eke speech doore slong vnto deuill betake cause crowes blake lordings ensample wol pray beware take kepe say ne telleth neuer man life another man hath dight wife woll hate mortally certain dan salomon wise clerkes sain teacheth man keepe tong well saied textuell nathelesse thus taught dame sonne thinke crowe god name sonne kepe wel thy tong kepe thy frend wicked tong worse fend sonne fende men may hem blesse sonne god endlesse goodnesse walled tong teeth lippes eke man auise speke sonne full oft mikell speach hath many man spilt clerkes teach little speech spoken auisedly man shent speake generally sonne thy tong shouldest thou restrain time thou doest thy pain speake god honour prayere first vertue sonne thou wolt lere restrain kepe well thy tong thus learne child yong sonne mikell speaking vnauised lesse speaking inough suffised cometh mikell harme thus taught much speech sinne wanteth naught woste thou wherefore rakell tong serueth right sword forcutteth forkerueth arme two dere sonne right tongue cutteth friendship atwo iangler god abhominable rede salomon wise honourable rede david psalmes rede seneck sonne speake ne thy head beck dissimule thou deafe yt thou janglour speaketh perlous mattere flemming saieth learn thou lest little jangling causeth much rest sonne thou wicked word hast said thee dare drede bewraid hath missaied dare well saine may way clepe word againe thing saied sayed forth goth though repent never loth thrall hath saied tale evill apaied sonne beware none authour new tidings whether fals trew thou come among high low keepe well thy tong thinke crow pthe plowman prologue plowman plucked plowe midsummer moone comen sayed beastes eat ynowe lieg grasse chin feeble oxe cowe hem ni left bone skin shoke shere coulter drowe honged harneis pin tooke tabard staffe eke head set hat saied would saint thomas seeke pilgrimage goth forth plat scrippe bare bread leekes forswonke forswat men might seene chekes euery wang tooth sat hoste beheld well saw man sonne ybrent knew well senged snout clothes rent man wont walke alway cloyster ypent could religiousliche lout therefore fully shent hoste asked man art thou sir quoth hine wont goe plow earne meat ere dine swette swinke make auow wife child therewith find serve god wist leaud men full blind clerkes say shullen faine livelod swette swinke right nought v giue againe neither eat ne yet drinke mowe law saine v curse damne hell brinke thus putten u paine candle queint bell clinke make u thrals lust saine mow el saued haue corne dust speaks thereagaine say raued man qd host canst thou preach come neere tell u holy thing sir quoth heard one teach priest pulpit good preaching say quoth host thee beseech sir ready bidding pray man reproch tale telling pthe plowman tale complaint pride covetousness clergy made doubt chaucer rest tale seen written hand john stowe library book antiquity seemeth written near chaucer time asterne strife stirred newe many steedes stound sundry seed sewe seemeth unsound great growne ground soukle simple small whether hem falser found falser foule mote befall one side tell pope cardinal prelate parson monkes freres fell priours abbot great estate heauen hell keep yates peter successours deemed old date falshed foule mote befall side ben poore pale people put prease seeme caitiues sore cale euer one without encrease icleped lollers londlese toteth hem ben vntall ben araied peace falshed foule mote befall many countrey sought know falser two euer travaile nought ferre go wandred wro wood beside wall two foules saw sitten tho falser foule mote befall one plete pope side griffon grimme stature pellicane withouten pride lollers laied lure mused matter measure counsaile christ ever gan call griffon shewed sharpe fuyre falshed foule mote befall pellicane began preach mercie meekenesse saied christ gan u teach meeke merciable gan blesse euangely beareth witnesse lambe likeneth christ ouer tokening meekest sith pride heauen fall euery christened priestes peter successours beth lowliche low degree vsen none earthly honour neither croune ne curious couetours ne pillour ne proud pall ne nought cofren vp great treasours falshed foule mote befall priestes cattell plede chasten hem charite ne battaile men lede inhaunsing owne degree nat wilne firting high see ne soueraignty hous ne hall wordly worship defie flee willeth highnes foule shal fall ala may saint call wilneth welde earthly honour low lucifere shal fall balefull blacknesse builden boure eggeth people errour maketh hem thrall christ hold one traitour low lucifer one shall fall willeth king peeres higher emperour poore freres wollen waxe warriour god gouernour holdeth man permagall couetise counsailour falshed mote need fall high horse willeth ride glitterande gold great array ipainted portred pride common knight may go gay chaunge clothing euery day golden girdle great small boistous beare bay falshed mote need fall pride punisheth poore sustaine sale holy church make hore filleth wombe wine ale money fill many male chaffren church fall telleth people leaud tale false faitours foule hem befall chaunge many manner meates song solas sitting long filleth wombe fast fretes meat gong meat harpe song ech man mote hem lord call hote spice euer among false faitours foule hem fall miter mo one two ipearled queenes head staffe gold perrie lo heauie made lead cloth gold new redde glitterande gold greene gall dome damne men dedde faitours foule hem fall christ people proudly curse broad boke braying bell put penny purse wol fell heauen hell sentence thou wilt dwell willen gesse gay hall thou sooth hem tell great cursing shalt thou fall blessed blesse cursed curse woll thus people oppresse haue lordship full many marchaunts wull purse penny woll come thrall poore people pull false faitours foule hem fall lord also mote hem loute obeysaunt brode blessing riden royall route courser king saddle gold glittering curious harness quaintly crall stirrops gay gold mastling falshed foule befall christes minister clepen beene rulen robberie antichrist seruen clene attired tyrannie witnesse iohns prophecie antichrist admirall tiffelers attired trecherie faitours foule hem fall saith hem may sinne shall dome ded hem woll gladly winne ayenst god forbed holiest clepen head rule regall ala euer eaten bread falshed wol foule fall head loueth honour worshiped word dede king mote hem kneele coure apostle christ forbede pope hestes taketh hede keepe christ commaundement gold silver mote wede holdeth hole omnipotent ordaineth ordinaunce parish priestes powere another greater auaunce greater point mistere highest earth reserve many point christ hath pere reserve neither pin ne point seemeth christ nothing sitteth stall damneth saveth thinke pride tofore god doth stinke angel iohn kneele onely god doe bowing willers worship must need evil feele ne clepen christ sanctus deus clepen head sanctissimus sect sewis trowe taken hem amisse earth blisse high maister beliall christes people hem wisse false foule fall mowe binde lose holy life save damne mow chose betweene hem great strife many man killed knife wete hem haue lordship shall christ suffred wound five falshed foule fall christ said qui gladio percutit swerd surely shall die priest peace grith bad hem drede die bad simple slie carke cattell trusteth god sitteth hie false shall full foule fall wollen make men swere ayenst christes commaundement christes member tere roode new yrent lawes maken common assent one throweth ball thus poore fully shent euer falshed foule befall vsen simonie sellen church priory ne usen enuie cursen hem contrary hireth men day yeares strength hold hem stall culleth adversary therefore falshed foule thou fall purse purchase personage purse paynen hem plede men warre woll wage bring enemy dede lord liues woll lede much take giue small get shall shede make false right foule fall halow nothing hire church ne font ne vestement make order every shire priestes pay parchment riotours taken rent therewith smere shepes skall many church ben oft suspent falshed foule fall liueth lecherie haunt wench widowes wiues punisheth poore putree selfe vseth liues man shrives heuen come neuer shall shall cursed caitiues hell saine shall fall mercy maximien nero neuer good hath furred hood follow christ shed blood heauen buckette wall wretch ben worse wood faitours foule hem fall give almes riche mainteynours men lawe lord well liche harlot sonne worth hawe sothfastnesse han slawe kembe crokettes christall drede god haue doun drawe faitours foule hem fall maken parson penny canon cardinal vnnethes amonges hem ne hath glosed gospell fals christ made never cathedral ne cardinall redde hatte vsen minstrals falshede foule mote befall tithing offering clemeth possession thereof nill none forgo robben men raunsome tithing turpe lucrum maisters vrniall tithing brybry larson make falshood full foule fall taken ferme sompnours harme people may pardoner false faitours sell seales dare well say holden great aray multiply hem metall drede full little dome day falshed shall foule fall harlottes shul men disclaunder shullen maken hem gree ben proude alexander saine poore woe ye yere eche priest shal pay fee encrease lemmans call heerdes shul wel iuel thee al false shul foule fall man falsely famed wol make purgatioun woll officer agramed assigne fro toune toun need must pay raunsome though clene christall absolution al false shull foule fall though giltie dede may money paie al purse wol blede may vse fro day day bishop officer gone ful gay game vsen ouer poore pill pray al false shull foule fall ala god ordained never lawe ne craft couetise forbad sawe gouernours mowen god agrise al rule right wise new point ben papall god law dispise faitours shull foule fall saine peter key heuen hel haue hold trowe peter tooke money sinnes sold successours ben bold winning al wit wral conscience waxen cold al faitours foule hem fal peter never great fole leaue key lorell take cursed tole advised nothing well trowe key hell maister place marshall dressen hem dwell false lucifer fall proud lucifarre angry enuious good faith ben ful farre couetise ben curious catch cattle couetous hound hunger woll yall vngodly vngracious needly falshed shall foule fall pope peter heire thinke erreth case chose bishop despaire chosen hem diuers place lord shall write grace clerke anone pray shall shall speed purchase false foule hem fall though good lord prayer shall sped though wild wood understanding men han red leud boster god forbed good bishop horse ball pope foule bested last woll foule fall maketh bishop earthly thanke nothing christ sake full fat ranke soule heale none heed take well done whateuer make shall answere one world thanke worch wake false shall foule fall cannot say crede prayer shall made prelate nother gospell rede shull weld high estate high god friendship hem make toteth summe totall bere keyes hell yates false shall foule fall forsake christes loue travaile hunger thirst cold ben ordred ouer aboue youth till ben old dore go fold helpe sheepe nought trauall hired men hold false foule hem fall christ king woll forsake know nought pouerte christ loue woll wake drinke piement ale aparte god seeme nothing aferd lusty liueth lamual driuen sheepe desert faitours shul foule fal christ hath xii apostle say may one may erre manere leueth ben lost echone peter erred ihon cleped principal christ cleped peter himselfe stone false faitours foule hem fall cursen croisery christ christen creature betweene hem enuy enhaunsed honour christen liuers labour leuin man mortal death
