dishonour al false foule hem fal knoweth tillour plow pope name hate crede suffiseth inow knoweth cardinall hatte thus poore vnrightly latte knoweth christ god royal matter worth gnatte false faitours foule hem fal king shall kneele kisse show christ suffered sinful kisse fete thinketh holdeth high ynow lucifer high set one thinketh himselfe foryet either trouth cal christ suffered wound wete shal make falshed foule fal laieth large nettes take siluer gold fillen coffer sackes fettes soules catch shold seruants vnhold doublin rentall bigge hem castle bigge hem hold false foule hem fall phere endeth first part tale second part followeth accorde worde fall english finde shewe another shall haue much say behinde priest han people pinde curteis christ hath kende put matter minde make manner men amend shortly shend hem shew wrongfully werch walke high god nothing tell ne god word tilleth many balke hernes hold hem halke prechen tithe offrend vntruly gospel talke mercy god amend antichrist say euen christ aduersarie hath ben many day christ bidding ful contrarie truth cleane vary way ben wend christ people vntruly carry god pitie amend liuen contrary christ life high pride meekenesse suffraunce vsen strife anger ayenst sobernesse wisdome wilfulnesse christ tale little tend measure outrageousnesse god wol may amend lordly life ayenst lowlinesse demin al without mercie couetise ayenst largesse treweth trecherie almesse enuie christ comprehend chastitie maintaine lecherie god grace amend pennaunce vse delight suffraunce strong defence ayenst god vsen euil right ayenst pitie punishment open euil ayenst continence wicked winning worse dispend sobernesse sette dispence god goodnesse amend claimen wholly powere wranglen ayenst al hests liuing folow nothing liuen worse witlesse beests fish flesh louen feests lord ben brode ykend god poore haten gests god mercy amend diues shal haue dome saine christes friendes nothing done falser ben fiend people ley bendes god earth han offend succour fro christ send v mercy amend token antichrist careckes ben wide iknow receiued preach shall man without token trow ech christen priest preachen owe god aboue ben send god word al folke show sinful man amend christ sent poore preach royall rich dare poore people teach antichrist ouer foe among people mote go hath bidden suspend hath hent thinketh yet mo al god may wel amend han world forsake liuen lowly god bad prison shullen take betin bounden forth lad hereof rede man drad christ said shend ech man ought hereof glad god ful wel woll amend take hem royall powere say haue swerds two one curse hel one slee men taking christ mo yet peter one tho christ peter smite gan defend sheath bad put tho mischeues god amend christ bad peter keepe sheepe sword forbade smite swerd toole sheepe keepe shepheards sheepe woll bite thinketh shepheards ben wite ayen sheepe swerde contend driue sheepe great despite god may well amend successours peter noght christ made cheefe pasture swerd shepheard vsen ought would flea butchoure peter successoure bere shepe til back bend shaddow hem euery shoure al god may wel amend successours peter ben peter christ forsooke leuer loue god lese shepheard lese hooke culleth sheepe doth cooke hem seeken woll rend falsely glose gospell booke god mercy amend christ take peter kay christ said must die man peter christ gan withsay christ bad go behind sathan counsailours many men han world wele god offend peter successours ben al god may wele amend sathan say contrary christ learne peter lore sewen misse follow peter forsooth christ would peter reprehend longeth heuen blisse god mercy hem amend apostle sewen case ought vnderstond betrayed christ iudas bare purse euery lond al might set hond hidde stale mispend rule traitours han hond almightie god hem amend last lord gan tray cursedly false couetise would traine money wisten wise seker selfe ensise soothnesse ben friend couetise chaungen queintise almighty god amend christ earth eftsoone would damne die hestes han fordone saine sawes ben heresie ayenst commaundements crie damne brend liketh hem losengerie god almighty hem amend han might england hath king lawe han purchased hem powere taken hem list knawe say heresie sawe prison wol hem send elder dawe god mercy amend king law wol man deme angerliche without answere man misqueme shall baighteth bere yet wel worse wol tere prison woll pende giues gere god woll may amend king taxeth men assent comminalte ech yeare woll raunsome hem maisterfully doth seales yeare better king extend officer han greater fee mischeefe god amend woll pruve testament worth tenne pound shall pay parchement third money round thus people raunsound say part hem apend gripen goeth ground god mercy amend simple fornication twenty shilling shall pay haue absolution al yere vsen forth may thus letten hem go astray recke though soule brend keepen euill peter kay shepheards god amend wonder parliament lord lond taken little entent helpe people hond ben harder bond worse beat bitter brend king vnderstond god helpe amend bishop religion lordshippes possession lordes semeth maketh hem lese charite mowe god attende earth haue high degre god mercie amende emperour yafe pope somtime high lordeship last silly kime proude pope put realme dout lordes beware defende folkes wonder stout king lordes amende thus endeth second part tale hereafter followeth third moyses lawe forbode tho priestes lordship welde christes gospell biddeth also lordshippes held ne christes apostle neuer bold lordshippes hem enbrace smeren shepe kepe fold god amend hem grace ne ben conterfete men may know hem fruite greatnesse maketh hem god foryete take mekenesse dispite wer pore lite nold demen face nourish shepe hem bite god amend grace griffon canst thou preach ayenst chanons men clepen seculere peli ben curate many tounes earth haue great powere haue great prebendes dere two three mo personage ben playing fere yet serue king also let ferme fare woll giue therefore woll spend woll spare woll lay vp store cure soule care fore mowe much money take whether soules wonne lore profites woll forsake gadering procuratour poore people enplede robben hem rauinour lord money lede catch quicke eke dede richen lord eke robbe giue good rede olde yonge hole sicke therewith purchase hem lay fee londe hem liketh best builde also brode cite east eke west purchase thus ben full prest poore woll nought spende ne good giue goddes gest ne sende hath sende seruice woll liue trusse treasure though parish die vnshriue woll nat giue rose floure life mirrour lered leude also teach people lele labour soche mister men misgo hard nigges hem proude gaie spende goodes vpon gigges finden hem great araie ala thinke men saie thus dispenden goddes good dreadfull dome daie soche wreches shull worse wood church neuer ne sie ne neuer pennie thider ne send though poore parishens hunger die pennie hem woll spend haue receiuing rent recke neuer remenaunt ala deuill hath cleane hem blent soche one sathanas soiournaunt vsen horedome harlottrie couetise pompe pride slothe wrath eke enuie sewen sinne euerie side ala thinke tabide woll accomptes yelde high god mowe hem hide soche willers witte worth nelde ben rooted riches christes pouert foryet serued many mess hem thinketh munna mea good mowen geat wene liue euermore god dome seat tresure feble store vnneth mote matins saie counting courtholding yet iangleth iaie vnderstont himselfe nothing woll serve erle king finding fee hide tithing offring feble charite proude couetous hard hungrie ben liberall lecherous el medlers marchandry mainteiners men mastry stewardes countours pleadours serue god ypocrisie soch priest christes false traitours false vengeable begilen men christ name vnstedfast vnstable traie lord hem thinketh shame serue god full lame god theeues falsely steale falsely god worde defame winning worldes weale antichrist serue praie thee may say naie antichrist soch shull fall followen deede faie seruen rich arraie serue christ falsely fain dreadfull dome day shull folowe paine knowen hem selfe doen ill ayenst christes commaundement amend hem neuer ne serue sathan one assent saieth sothe shall shent speaketh ayenst false liuing well liueth shall brent soch greater king pope bishop cardinal chanons parson vicare goddes seruice trowe fals sacrament sellen proude lucifere eche man looke whether lie speketh ayenst powere shall holden heresie loke many order take onely christ seruice worldes goodes forsake taketh order otherwise trow shall sore agrise glose conne sewen euill time thus begonne loke many emong hem holden hie waie antichrist shullen fall wullen god betraie god amende best maie many men maken shende weten well sothe say deuill hath foule hem blende church dwell apparailled poorely proude port seuen sacrament doen sell cattell catching comfort ech matter wollen mell doen hem wrong disport afraie people fell hold hem lower doeth lord tithing ducke apple aie make men swere vpon boke thus foulen christes faie soche bearen euill heauen kaie mowen assoile mowe shriue mennes wiues strongly plaie true tiller sturte striue wrastling wake chiefe chauntours nale market beater medling make hoppen houten heue hale faire fresh wine stale dine drinke make debate seuen sacrament set saile kepe soche kaies heauen gate mennes wiues wollen hold though right sorye speake shull bold sompning consistorye make hem saie mouth lie though sawe iye lemman holden openly man hardy aske woll haue tithing offring maugre whosoeuer grutch twise day woll sing goddes priestes nere none soche mote hunting dogge bitch blowen horne crien hey sorcerie vsen witch soche kepen euill peter key yet mote haue stocke stone gaily painted proudly dight maken men leuen vpon saie full might men set vp great light soche stockes shull stande thereby darke midnight e make mastrie leud people see mow thou mary thou worchest wonder thing men offren hongen broches ouches ring priest purchaseth offering nill offer none image woe soule sings preacheth soche pilgrimage men woman poore christes owne likenesse men shullen offer doore suffer hunger distresse soche image offer lesse mow feele thurst ne cold poore spirite gan christ blesse therefore offreth feble old buckler brode sweardes long baudrike baselardes kene soche tole necke hong antichrist soche priestes vpon deedes well seen whome serven honouren antichristes clene goddes goodes falsely devouren scarlet grene gaie gounes mote shape newe clippen kissen counten tounes damoseles daunce sewe cutted clothes shewe hewe long pike shone goddes gospell true either serven devill none priestes poke wide men must enlarge vestiment holy gospell doen hide contrarien raiment soche priestes lucifer sent like conquerours araied proude pendaunts ar ipent falsely truth han betraied shrift silver soche wollen aske woll men crepe crouche none sacrament save aske without mede shall man touch bishop warant vouch lawe decre mede money thus mouch sain charite middes masse nill man hire full shortly let forth passe shull men find shire personage profite desire live liking lust dare saine sans ose ie dire antichrist priest yef bishop mote service holden forth harlottry prelate feeble emprise god graine men agrise matter taken mede excuse hem wise thinketh ought greatly drede ine man longeth reprove though erre falsely goddes goodes fongeth therewith meintein wo warre deedes bright sterre living leud mannes ight say pope may erre nede must passe mannes might though priest lye lemman night tellen felowe goth masse anon right saieth singeth sinne birde abideth inne dighteth diner meane singeth masse would winne weneth god begile hem thinketh long till met usen forth yere emong folke whan set holdeth man halfe pere bishop hath powere soile men el lore absolution may skere wo soule singeth griffon began threte saied monkes canst thou ought pellican said full grete world much wo hath wrought saint benet order brought ne made hem neuer mannere trowe came never thought use great powere man monke lord call ne serve knee king proud prince pall meat drinke thing wearen mitre ring double worsted well ydight royall meat rich drinke rideth courser knight hauke hound eke brooch ouches hood say masse weeke deinties food lordship bondman royall religion saint benet made never none hem lordship man ne toun ben queint curious fine cloth clad served cleane proud angrie envious mallice much meane catching craftie covetous lordly liven great liking living religious according benet living ben clerkes court oversee poore tenaunce fully slite higher man amerced gladlier woll write farre christes poverty covetise endite poore pity ne never hem cherish ever hem bite commonly comen poore people hem begete perfection han inomen father riden fete travailen sore eate povert liveth yong old father suffreth drought weate many hungrie meales thurst cold monkes han forsake christes love saint benete pride ease hem take religion evill beseate religion must hanged plowe threshing diking fro toune toune sorrie meat half ynowe therefore han forsake taken rich pride ease full god woll monkes hem make little order praise saint benet ordained bad hem churchliche churchliche manner live go boistous earth lordliche disclaunder saint benet therefore holy curse saint benet hem never met thought robbe purse hereof tell ben like tho cleane serve devill hell ben treasure store counterfaitours chanons canon disguised god enemy traitours true religion han foule despised freres told making crede yet could tell worse men would werien rede god goodnesse man tell might write ne speake ne thinke thought falshed unright may man tell ever god wrought griffon saied thou canst good thou came never gentle kind trowe thou waxest wood el thou hast lost thy mind holy church hedde governaile rule redde forthren availe ech man shall live travaile best doeth shall mede strength men church assaile strength men must defend nede pope purely poore needie nothing ne driven doore doore wicked nolde drad head men would sad sinfully liven hem lust strength amend made wepen wolf sheep wust pope prelate would begge bid bow borrow holy church stand full cold servaunts sit soupe sorrow noughtie foule horow worship god men would wlate even morow harlottrie men would hate therefore men holy church honest thing worshipfully god workes werch seemeth serve christ king honest cleane clothing vessel gold clothes rich god honestly make offring lordship none liche pellican cast huge crie saied ala saiest thou christ head sitteth hie head ne ought mo ben member also father taught u call al maisters called defended tho maisters ben wicked fals taketh maisterie name ghostly earthly good king lord lordship rule people mild mood christ u shed blood bad priest maistership ne carke cloth ne food every mischeefe hem save rich clothing shall rightwisnesse treasure true life shall charity shall richesse lordship shall unite hope god honeste vessel cleane conscience poore spirit humilite shall holy church defence saied griffon may thee greve folkes faren wele hast thou doen live thy falshed ech man may fele thou canst cattle gete livest lond lorell glosing gettest thou thy mete fareth devill wonneth hell would ech man dwell liveth cleane envie tale thou doest tell thou wouldest people destrie glose heresie ye live better life cleane hypocrisie bringest thee woe strife therewith doen ye ne cure ye serve devill neither god ne man shall pay hire ye woll fare well feastes warme clothed cold therefore ye glose goddes heestes begile people yong old seaven sacrament ye speake ayenst ye slie ayenst tithinges offringes entents lordes bodie falsely lie ye doen live ease saieth ne soche sain pope worth pea make people ayen groche commeth fendes bring christen distaunce would man frendes leave thy chattring mischaunce thou live well wilt thou let men live hem list spende good keepe store men conscience never thou nist ye han cure answere fore meddle ye han doen let men live han doen yore thou shalt answere man pellican sayd sir naie dispised pope ne sacrament soth saie speake charite good hope dispise hye pride richesse poore spirite wickednesse known wide serve god false habite tournen mekenesse pride lowlinesse high degree goddes wordes tourne hide moved charite let men live cunning might warne men wo tellen hem trouth right sacrament soule heale used good use ayenst speake never deale nothing wise usen hem misse manere set hem sale trow shall abie hem dere reason tale taketh hem unrightfulliche ayenst ten commaundements glose wrechedliche selleth sacrament trow doe devill homage weten doe wrong thereto dare well wage serven sathan song tithen offren holesome life done due manere man houselin shrive wedding fere nother sold ne bought ne take ne give covertise taken nought selleth hem may sore agrise lord body doe lie say sooth true rede flesh blood misterie forme brede needeth strive whether sunget accident christ live verament pope cardinal live good live christ commaunded gospell ayenst woll strive methinketh live well pope lived god bedde pride highnesse dispise richesse covetise croune hedde meeknesse poverte use griffon saied abie thou shalt brent balefull fire thy sect shall destrie ye shall hanged swire ye shullen hanged draw giveth leave preach speake god law people thus falsely teach thou shalt cursed booke bell discevered holy church cleane ydamned hell otherwise ye woll worch pellican saied ne drede cursing little value god hope mede falshed ye sewe ye charite wilneth vengeaunce nero suffren woll ready drede thou canst christ bad one suffer love taught servaunts thou amend sake drede thy maintenaunce drede world hate thinketh little praise drede nothing high estate ne drede disease woll ye tourne leave pride high port richesse cursing go wide god bring rightwisenesse drede tyrannie nothing ye done suffer readie siker recke never soone griffon grinned wood loked lovely owle swore cock heart blood would teare every doule holy church thou disclaundrest foule thy reason woll thee race make thy flesh rot moule losell thou shalt hard grace griffon fiew forth way pellican sit weepe himselfe gan say god would christ sheepe heard ytaken keepe word saied would write well keepe god would grace plowman answerd saied would travaile man would pey pelli saied yes god han sold han store money plowman saied tell thou may tellest thou men trespas pellican said amend hem good fay god woll give grace christ himselfe likned people died rood fare right fareth feedeth bird blood doen evill ayenst good ben foen friend face told hem living stood god amend hem grace plowman aileth griffon tell holdeth side pelli two likely kind roven wide foule betokeneth pride lucifer high flew sith evill hide agilted god grace bird flieth aire liveth bird meke flow despaire shenden silly foules eke soules sinnes seke culieth hem kneele therefore ala briberie god forbode breke god amend grace hinder part lioun robber ravinere robbeth people earth doun earth holdeth none pere fareth foule ferre nere temporell strength ye people chase lion proud earth god amend grace pellican flew forth wing twaine droping dased dull soone griffon came againe foules earth full pellican cast pull great number never seene manner foules tellen woll god woll give grace griffon comen foules fele ravins rokes crowes pie gray foules agadred wele gurde would hie gledes buzzard hem white mole puttockes token place lapwing well conneth lie fellowship han forgard grace long pellican last commeth againe brought phenix stout griffon would flow full faine foules flewen thicke raine phenix tho began hem chace flie vaine vengeaunce grace slew hem downe without mercie start neither free ne thrall cast rufull crie griffon fall beat hem slew hem whither hem drove man may trace vnder earth thought yall ala feeble grace pellican asked right writing blame woll fight flight shall sheld shame maid dame lambe slaine shall sheld ghostly blame earthly harme god grace therefore pray every man writting excused writing writeth pellican thus people hath dispised fresh fully advised nill maintaine manace devill often disguised bring man evill grace witeth pellican hereof nill avow high ne low ne degree fable take ye mowe holy church bow ech man amend christ send space writing allow almighty grace pthe parson prologue plowman tale ended sunne fro ye south side descended low sight degree five twenty hight two clocke gesse eleven foot lite lesse shadow time foot length parted sixe foot equall proportion therewith moones exaltation meane taurus alway gan ascend entring thropes end hoste wont gie aye case jolly companie said wise lordings everichone lacketh u tale one fullfilled sentence decree woll tell u tale let see almost fulfilled ordinance pray god yeve right good chance telleth tale u lustely sir priest qd art thou vicary art thou parson say sooth thy fay thou breke thou play every man save thou hath told tale vnbokell shew u thy male truly thinketh thy chere thou shouldest knit well great matere tell u fable anon cockes bone parson answerd one thou gettest fable none told poule writeth timothe repreveth hem waiven soothfastnesse teachen fable wretchednesse sow draffe fist may sow wheat list say ye list morality vertuous matere ye wol yeve audience would full faine christ reverence done pleasaunce lefull trusteth well sotherne man cannot jeast rum ram ruf letter god wote rime hold little better therefore ye list woll glose woll tell little tale prose knit feast make end iesu grace wit send shew way voyage thilke perfite glorious pilgrimage hight hierusalem celestial vouchsafe anon shall begin upon tale pray tell advise cannot better say nathelesse meditation put aye correction clerkes textuell take sentence trusteth well therefore make protestation woll stand correction vpon word assented sone seemed done end vertuous sentence yeve space audience bad host say tell tale pray host word u sir priest qd faire mote befall say ye list shall gladly word said manere telleth qd meditatioun hasteth sunne woll adoun beth fructuous little space well god send grace pthe parson tale sermon diver grievous sin remedy persuading men penitence ieremie vi state super vias videte interrogate de semitis antiquis quae sit via bona ambulate ea invenietis refrigerium animabus vestris ovr sweet lord god heaven man woll perish woll turne knoweledge blisfull life perdurable admonisheth u prophet ieremie sayeth wise stondeth upon wayes seeth asketh old pathes saie olde sentence good way walketh way yee shall finde refreshing soules c many wayes espirituels leade folke lord iesu christ reigne glory wayes full noble way full covenable may faile man ne woman sinne hath misgone fro right way hierusalem celestiall way called penitence manne gladly hearken enquire hert wete penitence called penitence many manner action werkinges penitence manie speces penitence thinges appertain behoove penitence thinges distourbe penitence saint ambrose saith penitence plaining man guilt hath done thing ought playne doctours sayth penitence waymenting man sorroweth sume paineth self hath misdone penitence certain circumstaunces repentance man holt sorrow paine guiltes shall penitent shall first bewaile sinnes hee hath done stedfastly purpose heart shrift mouth satisfaction never doe thing ought bewayle complaine continue good work el repentaunce may availe saint isiodor saith yaper lyer repentaunt yt e tsoone doth thing ought repent weeping stint doe sinne may auaile nathelesse men shall hope euery time man falleth bee neuer oft hee may arise pennaunce haue grace certaine great doubt saith saint gregorie vnnethes ariseth sin yt charged charge euill vsage therefore repentaunt folke stint sinne leue sinne sinne leaue holy church holdeth siker saluation sinneth verely repenteth last end holy church yet hopeth saluation great mercy lord iesus christ repentaunce take siker way sith haue declared thing penitence ye shall vnderstond beene three action penitence first manne baptised hath sinned saint augustine sayth penitent old sinnefull life hee may biginne new cleane life certes baptised without penitence old guilt retaineth ye marke baptisme ye grace ne ye remission sin till hee haue repentaunce another default yt men doe deadly sinne haue receiued baptisme third default yt men fall veniall sinnes baptisme fro day day thereof sayeth saint augustine penitence good humble folk penitence euery day speces penitence ben three one hem solemne another commune third priuie pennaunce yt solemne two manner put holy church lent slaughter child manner thing another man hath sinned openly sinne fame openly spoken country holy church judgement distrayneth open pennaunce common pennaunce yt priest enioyn men certaine case go perauenture naked pilgrimage bare foot priuie pennaunce yt men doe day priuie sin shriue v priuily receiue priuie pennaunce shalt thou vnderstond behoueful necessary perfit penitence stont three thing contrition hart confession mouth satisfaction sayth saint iohn chrisostome penitence disstraineth man accept benignely every paine enioined contrition hert shrift mouth satisfaction werking manner humility fruitfull penitence ayenst three thing wee wrath lord iesus christ say delite thinking retchlesse speaking wicked sinfull werking ayenst wicked guilt penitence may likened vnto tree root tree contrition hideth heart repentaunt right root tree hideth earth roote contrition springeth stalke bereth braunches leaues confession fruit satisfaction christ sayth gospell doth digne fruite penitence fruite men may knowe tree root hid heart manne ne braunches ne leaues confession therefore lord iesu christ saith thus fruit hem shall ye knowe hem root also springeth seede grace seed mother sikernesse seed eager hote grace seed springeth god remembraunce day doome paine hell matter saith salomon ye drede god man forletteth sinne heat seed ye loue god desiring joy perdurable heat draweth heart man god doth hate sinne soothly nothing sauoureth wel child ye milke nurce ne nothing abhominable milke meddled meate right sinfull man loueth sinne seemeth sweete thing fro yt time hee loueth sadly lord iesu christ desireth ye life perdurable nothing abhominable soothly law god ye loue god dauid prophet sayth haue loued thy law hated wickednesse loueth god keepeth lawe word tree saw prophet daniel spirit ye vision nabuchodonosor counsayled doe penitence pennaunce tree life hem receyue holdeth penitence blessed sentence salomon penitence contrition man shall vnderstond foure thing say contrition beene ye cause moove man contrition hee contrite contrition auayleth soule thus contrition sorrow yt man receiueth heart sinnes sad purpose shriue doe pennaunce neuer doe sinne sorrow shal manner sayeth saint bernard shall heauie greeuous full sharpe poinant heart first man hath agilted lord creator sharpe poinaunt hath agilted father celestiall yet sharpe poynaunt hee hath wrathed agilted boughte precious bloud hath deliuered v fro bondes sinne fro ye cruelte deuill paine hell cause yt ought moue man contricion bene fixe first man shall remembre sinnes loke remembraunce ne bee delite waye greate shame sorowe sinnes iob sayth sinfull men done werkes worthie confession therefore sayeth ezechiell woll remember ye yeres life bitternesse herte god saieth apocalipse remember ye whence ye fall time ye sinned ye child god limmes reigne god sinne ye ben waren thral foule membres ye fende hate angel slaunder holye churche foode false serpent perpetuall matter fire hell yet foule abhominable ye trespasse oft time doeth hounde returneth ayen eate owne spewing yet ye fouler long continuing sinne sinfull vsage ye bee roted sinne beeste donge suche manner thoughtes make manne shame sinne delite god saith ye prophet ezechiel ye shall remembre way shull displese sothly sinnes ben way lede folke hell second cause ought make man disdaine sinne saith saint peter doth sinne thrall sinne sinne putteth manne great thraldome therefore saieth prophet ezechiell went sorrowfull disdaine selfe certes well ought man disdaine sinne withdrawe fro thraldome villany lo wt saieth seneke matter saith thus though wist neither god ne manne neuer know yet would disdaine doe sinne seneke also sayeth borne greater thinge thrall body make body thrall ne fouler thrall may man ne woman make bodie yeue body sinne foulest churle foulest woman liueth least value yet foule seruitude euer fro higher degree yt man falleth thrall god world vile abhominable good god well ought man great disdaine sinne sith yt sinne hee free made bond therefore saieth saint augustine thou hast disdaine thy seruaunt hee offend sinne thou disdaine thou thy selfe shouldest sinne take regard thine value thou ne bee foule thy selfe ala well ought disdaine bee seruaunts thralles sinne sore ashamed themself god endlesse goodnesse hath sette high estate yeue hem witte strength bodye heale beautie prosperitie bought hem fro death hert blood vnkindly ayenst gentlenesse quite villanously slaughter owne soules oh good god ye woman great beautie remembreth prouerbe salomon saieth likeneth faire woman foole bodie ring gold worne groine sow right sowe wroteth euery ordure wroteth beautie stinking ordure sinne third cause ought meue man contrition dread day doome horrible pain hell saint ierome sayeth euery time remembreth day doome quake eate drinke euer seemeth trompe sowneth mine eare riseth ye vp ded cometh judgement good god muche ought manne drede judgment shall saint poule sayeth seat oure lorde iesu christ whereas shal make generall congregation whereas man may bee absent certes auaileth none essoyne ne excusation onely default shall judged also werkes shall openly knowne sayeth saint bernard ne shall pleading auaile ne sleight shall yeue reckoning euerie idle word shall haue judge may bee deceiued ne corrupt certes thought discouered ne prayer ne mede shall corrupt therefore saith salomon wrath god ne woll spare wight prayer ne yeft therefore day doome hope escape wherfore saith saint anselme full great anguish shall ye sinnefull folke haue yt time shall ye fiers wroth iudge sitte aboue vnder horrible pitte hell open destroy yt must knowe sinnes sinnes openly beene shewed god euery creature left side mo diuels anie heart may thinke hale drawe sinfull soules paine hell within heart folke shall biting conscience without forth shall bee world brenning whither shall wretched sinful man flie hide certes may hide must come forth shewe certes saith ierom earth shall cast see also ayre shall ful thonder clappes lightning sothly well remembreth thinges gesse sinne shall turne delite great sorrowe drede paine hell therefore saith iob god suffer lord yt may bewaile wepe er goe without returning darke londe couered derkenesse death londe misese derkenesse whereas shadowe death none order ordinaunce fearfull drede ever shall last lo may see iob prayed respite bewepe waile trespasse sothely one day respite better treasure world much man may acquite himselfe god penitence world treasure therefore pray god yeue respite bewepe waile trespasse certes sorow man might make fro beginning world ni little thing regarde sorrow hell cause iob calleth hell londe derkenesse understondeth calleth londe earth stable never shall faile derke hell hath defaute light materiall certes derke light shall come fire ever shall brenne shall turn pain ye hell sheweth horrible diuels turmenteth covered ye derkenesse death say hee hell shall defaut ye sight god certes sight god ye life perdurable derknes death sin ye wretched man hath disturb see ye face god right derke cloud betwixt u sunne londe misese yt three maner defautes ayenst three thing folke world present life say honour delices richesse ayenst honour hell shame confusion well ye wote men call honour ye reverence man doth man hell none honour ne reverence certes reverence shal king knave god sayth prophet ieremie folke dispise shal dispite honour also called great lordeship shall wight serve harme turment honour also called great dignitie highnesse hell shall fortroden divels god saith horrible devil shall goe come upon heddes damned folke much higher present life shall abated defoiled hell ayenste richesse world shall misese poverte shall four thinges defaut treasure david saith rich folk embrace knit hert treasour world shall sleep sleeping death nothing ne shull find hondes tresour moreover ye misease hell shall defaut meat drinke god sayeth thus moyses shall bee wasted hunger byrdes hell shall devour hem bitter death ye gall dragon shall drinke venum dragon morsel also misease shall defaut clothing shall naked bodie clothing saue fire brenne filthes naked shall soule manner vertues ye clothing soule gay robe ye soft shetes ye small sherts lo sayth god hem prophet esaie hem shall bee strewed moughtes covertures shall bee worm hell also misease shall defaut friend poor ye hath good frends ther frend neither god ne creature shall frend hem ech hem shall hate deadly hate sonnes doughters shall rebell ayenst father mother kinred ayenst kinred chide dispise day night god sayeth prophet micheas loving child whilom loved fleshly ech would ech hem eat might love together paine hell hated eche prosperity life trust well fleshly love deedly hate saith prophet david whoso loveth wickednesse hateth soul hateth soul certes may love none wight maner therefore hel solace ne frendship ever ye kinredes ben hell cursinges chidinges ye deadly hate among hem also shall defaut manner delices certes delices ben appetite ye five wittes sight hearing smelling favouring touching hell sight shall full derkenesse smoke therefore full teares hearing full wailing grinting teeth saith iesu christ nosthrilles shall bee full stinking saith esay ye prophet savouring shall full bitter gall touching body icovered fire never shall quench wormes never shall die god sayth mouth esay much shall wene may die pain death flye fro pain may understond wordes iob saieth shadow death certes shadow hath likenesse thing shadowed shadow thing shadowed right fareth pain hell like death ye horrible anguish paineth hem ever though shold die anon certes shall die saith saint greg wretched caitiffes shall death without death end without end defaut without fayling death shall alway live end shall ever begin defaut shall faile therefore sayth saint iohn evangelist shall follow death shall find shall desire die death shall flie hem also iob saith hell order rule god hath create thing right order nothing without order thing ordred numbred yet nathelesse dampned nothing order ne hold none order ye earth ne shall bere hem fruit prophet david sayth god shall destroy ye fruit earth hem ne water ne shall yeve hem moisture ne ayre refreshing ne fire light saith saint basilie brenning fire world shall god yeve hell hem dampned ye light clearnesse shall yeve heaven child right good men yeve flesh child bone hound shall none hope escape sayeth sainct iob last shall terrour gresly drede dwell without end horrour alway drede come drede shall alway dwell heart hem bee dampned therfore lost hope seven cause first god judge shall without mercy hem may please ne none saint ne may yeve nothing raunsome ne shall voice speake ne may fly fro pain ne goodnesse hem yt may shew deliver hem fro pain therefore saith salomon wicked man dyeth dead shall hope escape fro paine would well understond paine bethinke well hee hath deserved paine sinnes certes talent sighe weepe singe playe saith salomon ye science know paine ben ordained sinne would make sorowe science saith saint austin maketh man weiment heart fourth pointe oughte make man contrition sorowfull remembraunce good hee hath left doe heare earthe also good hath lost sothly good werkes hee hath lefte either good werkes hee wrought er hee fell deadly sinne else good werkes hee wrought hee laie sinne sothly good werkes fell sinne mortified astoned dull oft sinning werkes hee hee lay sin dead ye life perdurable heaven good werkes mortified oft sinning charite may quick ayen without penitence sayth god mouth ezechiel ye rightfull man retourn ayen fro rightwisenesse wickednes shall live nay good werkes hee hath ne shall neuer remembrance shall die sinne upon chapter sayth saint gregory thus wee shall understond principally done deadly sinne nought rehearse draw memory good werkes wee wrought certes werking deadly sinne trust ta good werke yt doen say thereby life perdurable heaven nathelesse ye good werks quicken come againe helpe availe life perdurable heaven contricion soothly good werkes men deedly sinne much doen deedly sinne may never quicke certes thing never life may never quick nathelesse albeit avail life perdurable yet availe abredge pain hell el get temporall riches el god woll rather enlumine light heart sinfull man repentaunce eke availe use manne good werkes feende lesse power soul thus curteis lord iesu christ ne woll good work bee loste somewhat shall availe much good werkes menne doen good life amortised sinne following also sithe ye good werkes men doon bee dedly sinne utterly dead life perdurable well may manne good werke ne doeth sing new fresh song lay tout pardu mon temp et mon labure certes sinne bereaveth man goodnesse nature also goodnesse grace soothly grace holy ghost fareth like fire may idle fire faileth anon foreletteth werking right grace fayleth anon foreletteth werking leseth sinfull man goodnesse glory beheight good men labour werk well may sory oweth life god long hath lived also long shall live goodnesse ne hath paie debt god oweth life trust well shall yeve accompts sayth saint bernard goodes yeve present life hath hem dispended much shall perishe heere hedde ne moment houre ne shall perishe time hee ne shall yeve reckoning fifthe thinge ought moove man contricion remembraunce passion lorde iesu christ suffered sinnes saieth saint bernarde live shall remembraunce travailes lord iesu christ suffered preaching wearinesse travailing temptation fasted long waking praied veares wept pite good people woe ye shame filthe men said foule spitting menne spitte face buffettes men yave foule mowes reproves men said nailes hee nailed crosse ye remnaunt passion suffred sinnes nothing gilte ye shall understond yt man sinne every manner order ordinance tourned doune soth yt god reason sensualite bodie man ordained eche four thing lordship thus god lordship reason reason sensualite sensualite body man sothly man sinneth order ordinance turned doun therefore moche reason man ne woll subject ne obeysaunt god lord right therefore leseth worship sensualite also bodie manne sensualite rebelleth ayenst reason way leeseth reason lordship sensualite body right reason rebell god right sensualite rebell reason body also certes disordinaunce rebellion lord iesu christ bought upon precious body full deere herkeneth wise much reason rebell god therefore man worthy sorow dede suffred lord iesu christ manne betraied disciple distrained bound blood brast every naile hondes saith augustin ferthermore much reason manne woll daunt sensualite may therefore manne worthy shame suffered lord iesu christ man spit visage ferthermore muche caitiffe body man rebell reason sensualite therefore worthy death suffered lord iesu christ upon ye crosse whereas part body free without great paine bitter passion suffred lord iesu christ never forfaited therefore reasonably may said iesu maner much pained thing never deserved much defouled shame man worthy therefore may sinfull man well say sayth saint bernard accursed bitternesse sinne whiche must bee suffered much bitternesse certes diver discordance wickednesse passion iesu christ ordained diver thing thus certes sinfull mannes soul betraied divell covetise temporall prosperite scorned deceit cheseth fleshly delices yet turmented impatience adversity bespet servage subjection sinne last slain finally disordinaunce sinfull man iesus christ first betraid hee bound came unbind u sinne paine bescorned bee honoured thing visage ought desired bee seen mankind visage angel desire look villainously bespet scourged nothing trespassed finally crucified slain accomplished word esaie wounded misdeed defoiled felony sith iesu christ took pain wickedness moche ought sinfull man wepe bewaile sinnes god sonne heaven pain endure sixt thing meve man contricion hope thre thing say forye venesse sinne gift grace doe well glory heaven whiche god shall rewarde manne good deed much iesu christ yeveth u gift largenesse sovereigne bountie therefore hee called iesus nazarenus rex iudeorum iesus say saviour salvation men shal hope foryevenesse sinnes properly salvation sinnes therefore sayd angell ioseph thou shalt call name iesus shall save people sinnes hereof saith saint peter none name heaven yeve man man may saved onely iesus nazarenus much say flourishing man shall hope hee yeveth remission sinnes shall yeve also grace well doe doore thine herte sayth iesus called enter openeth shall foryevenesse sinne woll enter grace sup good werkes hee shall doe werkes food soule shall suppe great joye shall yeve thus shall man hope werkes penaunce god shall yeve reign behight gospell shall man understonde manner shall contricion say shall universall totall say man shall repentant sinnes hee hath dooen delite thought right perillous two manner consentings one hem called consenting affection man moved sin deliteth longe think sinne reason apperceiveth wel sinne ayenst law god yet reason refraineth foule delite talent though see well apertly yt ayenst reverence god although reason consent yt sinne indeed yet say doctours soche delite dwelleth longe full perillous albeit never little also man sorrow namely ever hath desired ayenst law god perfite consenting reason thereof doubte deadly sinne consenting certes deadly sinne first man thought delite forth consenting deed wherfore say many men ne repent hem never thought delices ne never shrive hem deed great sinnes outward wherefore say soche wicked delites subtill begilers hem shall dampned moreover man ought sorowe wicked word well wicked deed certes repentance singuler sinne repentant sin else repent sinnes singuler sinne may availe certes god almighty good therefore either foryeveth else right nought therefore saith saint augustin wote certainly god enemy every sinner hee observeth one sinne shall hee foryevenesse sinnes nay moreover contricion bee wonder sorowfull anguishous therefore yeveth god plainly mercy therefore soul anguished sorowful within remembrance god yt prayer might come ferthermore contricion must continuall manne stedfast purpose shrive amend life sothly contricion lasteth man may ever hope foryevenes cometh hate sinne destroyeth sinne also folke power saith david love god hate wickednesse love god love loveth hate hateth last thing yt men shall understand wherefore availeth contrition say yt contricion sometime delivereth man fro sinne david saith say said david purposed firmely shrive thou lord releasedest sin right contricion availeth without sad purpose shrift man oppertunity right little worth shrift satisfaction without contrition moreover contricion destroyeth prison hell maketh weak feeble strength devil restoreth yeftes holy ghost good vertues cleanseth soule sinne delivereth fro paine hell fro company devill fro servage sinne restoreth good spiritual company communion holy church ferthermore maketh whilome sonne yre sonne grace thing prooved holy writ therefore would set entent thing full wise truly ne life courage sinne yeve heart body serve christ thereof doe homage truly lord hath spared u meekly foilies ne pity man soule sorry song might sing explicit prima par poenitentiae incipit par secunda second part penitence confession signe contricion shull yee understond confession ought need bee doen thinges covenable confession first shalt thou understonde confession shewing sinnes priest say hee must confesse condition belong sin ferforthe hee must bee sayed nothing excused ne hid avaunt thee thy good werkes also necessarie understonde whence sinnes springe howe entere beene spring sin saith saint poule wise right one man sinne entred first world sin death right death entreth men sinne man adam sin entred world broke commandment god therfore first mighty hee ne shuld died became must need die whether would progenie world sayed man sinned look estate innocency adam eve naked paradise shamed hereof serpent wilyest beasis god made said woman commanded god ye eate every tree paradise woman answered fruit said tree paradise feed u fruit middle tree paradise god forbode u eate touch least wee die serpent sayd woman nay nay ye shall die death sooth god wotte day ye eate thereof eyen shall open ye shall god knowing good harme woman saw tree good feeding fair eyen delectable sight took fruit tree eat yave husbond eat anon eyen hem opened knewe naked sowed figg leaf manner breches hide member may ye see deadly sin hath first suggestion sende sheweth adder afterward delight flesh sheweth eve consenting reason sheweth adam trust well though fende tempted eve say flesh flesh delight beauty fruit defended yet certes till reason say adam consented eating fruit yet stoode hee state innocency sayd adam tooke wee sayd originall sinne fleshly discended bee wee engendred vile corrupt matter soule put body right anon contract originall sinne erst onely pain concupiscence afterward paine sinne therefore wee borne sonnes wrath dampnation perdurable nere baptisme wee receive benimmeth u coulpe forsoth pine dwelleth u temptation pine hight concupiscence concupiscence wrongfully disposed ordained man maketh covet covetise flesh fleshly sin sight eyen yerthly thinges also covetise highnesse pride heart speake first covetise concupiscence law member lawfully made rightfull judgment god say much man obeisant god lorde therefore flesh disobeisaunt concupiscence whiche called nourishing sinne occasion sinne therefore manne hath within pine concupiscence impossible bee tempted sometime moved flesh sin thing may faile long liveth may well wax feeble vertue baptisme grace god penitence fully ne shall never quench hee ne shall sometime mooved refrained sicknesse malice sorcery cold drink lo saith poule flesh coveteth ayenst spirite spirite ayenst flesh contrary striven manne may alway would poule great pennance water lond water night day great peril great paine londe famine thurst cold clothlesse one stoned almost death yet said ala caitiffe manne shall deliver fro prison caitiffe body saint ierom hee long time dwelled desert whereas hee company wilde beastes hee meate herbes water drinke ne bed naked earth wherefore flesh blacke ethyopian heat nie destroyed cold yet said brenning lechery boyled body wherefore wot well bee deceived say tempted body witnes iames saith every wight tempted owne conscience say ech u hath matter occasion tempted norishing sinne body therfore saith saint iohn evangelist wee say without sinne wee deceive selfe truth u shall ye understond sin waxeth increaseth man first thing nourishing sinne spake fleshly concupiscence commeth suggestion devill say ye devil belous bloweth man fire concupisence man bethinketh whether hee woll doe thing tempted man withstond weive first intising flesh fiend sinne doe feeleth anon flame delight good beware keep well el woll fall anone consenting sinne woll hee may time place matter sayth moyses devill manner fiend sayth woll chace pursue man wicked suggestion woll take mooving irring sinne woll depart prise preie deliberation lust shall accomplished delight woll draw swerd consenting certes right swerde departeth thing two peeces right consenting departeth god fro manne woll slea honde deede sinne thus sayth fiend certes man dead soule thus sinne accomplished temptation delite consenting sin actuall forsooth sinne two maners either veniall deadly sin sothly man loveth creature iesu christ creatour deadly sin veniall sin man love iesu christ lesse ought forsooth deed veniall sin full perillous minisheth love man god therefore man charge himselfe many veniall sin certes yt sometime discharge hem shrift may full lightly minish love hath iesu christ wise skippeth veniall sinne deadly sinne certes man chargeth soule veniall sinnes hee enclined fall deadly sin therefore let u negligent charge u veniall sinnes proverb saith many small make great hearken ensample great wave sea commeth sometime great violence yt drouneth shippe harme dooth sometime small drop water entereth little creveis timber bottom ship men negligent discharge hem time therefore although difference betwixt two cause drowning algates ship drouned right fareth sometime deadly sin annoious veniall sinnes multiplie man greatly worldly thinges hee loueth hee sinneth venially great heart ye loue god therefore loue euery thing yt beset god ne done principally god sake although man loue lesse god yet veniall sinne deadly sin loue thing weigheth heart man much ye loue god deadly sinne saith saint augustine man turneth heart fro god whiche soueraigne bounty may chaunge yeueth heart thing may chaunge flit certes euerie thing saue god heauen sooth yt man yeue loue oweth god heart vnto creature certes much loue yeueth creature muche bireaueth fro god therefore doth sinne debitour god ne yeldeth god debt yt say loue heart nowe sith man vnderstondeth generallye veniall sinne couenable tell specially sin many man peraduenture deemeth hem sinnes shriueth thing yet nathelesse sin soothly clerkes write say euery tyme manne eateth drinketh sufficeth sustenance body certain doth sinne also speaketh needeth sinne also hearkeneth benignely complainte poore also hee heale bodie woll fast folk fast without cause reasonable also sleepeth needeth cometh perchance late church werkes charitie also vseth wife without soueraigne desire engendrure honour god entent yeeld wife debte bodie also woll visite sicke prisoner may also loue wife child worldly thing reason requireth also flatter blandise ought necessitie also minish withdrawe almose poore also apparaile meat deliciously need eat hastily lickorousnes also talke vanity church god seruice talker idle word folly villanie shall yeeld accompts day doome also hee behighteth assureth doe thinges hee maie perfourme also hee lightnesse folly missayeth scorneth neighbour also hath wicked suspection thing hee ne wote sothfastnesse thing mo without number sinnes sayth augustine nowe shall men vnderstonde none earthly manne may eschewe veniall sin yet may refrain hem brenning loue hath lord iesu christ prayer confession good workes shall little grief saith augustine man loue god manner euer doth loue god loue god verily brenneth loue god looke much one droppe water doth fall great furnace full fire annoieth greueth brenning fire like manner annoieth greueth venial sin vnto man stedfast perfite loue sauiour iesu christ ferthermore men may also refraine put awaie veniall sinne commening receiuing worthely ye body sauiour iesu christ also taking holy water almosedeed generall confession confite masse complin blessing bishop priest good workes de septem peccatis mortalibus de eorum dependentiis circumstantiis speciebus expedient tell whiche seauen deadly sinnes say chiefetaines sinnes ren lee diuers manner called seauen sinnes much bee chiefe springe sinnes roote seauen sin pride generall root harm roote springeth certaine braunches ire enuie accidie slouth auarice couetise common vnderstonding gluttonie lecherie chief sinnes haue braunches twig shall bee declared chapiter following though bee manne vtterly tell number twigges harmes come pride yet woll shew part hem ye shall vnderstond inobedience auaunting ipocrisie dispite errogance impudence swelling hert insolence elation impatience strife contumacie presumption irreuerence pertinacie vaineglorie many twig cannot declare inobedience disobeyeth dispite commaundements god soueraignes ghostly father auaunter boasteth harme bounty hath done ipocrite hideth shew sheweth seme dispitous hath disdain neibour saie euin christen hath dispite ought errogance hee thinketh hee hath bounty hee hath weneth hee shoulde haue hem desert else deemeth impudent pride hath shame pride ne sinne swelling heart man rejoyceth harme hath done insolence dispiseth judgement folke regarde value cunning speaking bering elation hee ne may neither suffer haue maister ne fellowe impatience woll taught ne rebuked vice strife denyeth truth wittingly defendeth folly contumacie indignation ayenst euerie aucthoritie power hem soueraines presumption manne vndertaketh emprise ought el may doe called surquidie irreuerence man doth honour ought looke reuerenced pertinacie men defende folly trust much wit vaineglorie haue pomp delight temporall highnesse glorye worldly estate iangling men speak muche folke clappeth mill take keepe say yet priuie spece pride waiteth first bee salewed woll salew lesse worthye also waiteth desireth sit else go aboue way kisse paxe encenced go offring neighbour suche semblable thinges ayenst duetie peraduenture hee hath heart entent suche proude desire magnified honoured people ben two maner pride one hem within heart man without whiche foresayd thing soothly mo haue sayd appertaine pride heart man speces pride without nathelesse one speces pride signe right gaye leuesell tauerne signe wine seller many thinges speeche countenaunce outragious arraye clothing certes ben sinne clothing christ would sone haue noted spoken clothing rich menne gospell greg saith precious cloathing culpable dearth softnesse straungenesse disguising superfluitie inordinate scantnes ala may man see day sinnefull costlewe arraie clothing namely much superfluitie else disordinate scantnesse firste sin superfluity cloathinge suche maketh deare harme people onely coste enbroudering disguised endenting barring ounding paling winding bending semblable wast cloth vanitie also costlewe furring gounes much pounsing chesell make hole muche dagging sheres superfluitie length foresaide gounes trayling ye dong ye myre horse also foot well manne woman trayling verely effect wasted consumed thredbare rotten doung rather yeue poore great dammage foresaid pore folke sundrie wise say cloth wasted must cost poore people scarcenesse moreouer would yeue suche pounsed dagged clothing poore people conuenient estate ne sufficient necessitie keepe hem fro distemperaunce firmament vpon side speake horrible disordinate scantnesse clothing cutted sloppes hanselines shortenesse couer shameful member man wicked entent ala hem shew bosse shape horrible swole member semeth like maladie hernia wrapping hosen also buttock hem fare hinder parte ape full moone moreouer wretched swoln member shew throughe disguising departing hosen white redde seemeth half shamefull priuy member flaine departe hosen colour white blewe white blacke blacke redde forth seemeth variaunce colour halfe part priue member ben corrupt fire saint anthonie canker suche mischaunce hinder parte buttockes full horrible see certes partie bodie purge stinking ordure foul partie shew people proudly dispite honestie honestie iesu christe freends obserued shew life outragious arraie woman god wot yt though visage hem seem full chast debonaire yet notifie aray attire licorousnes pride say honestie clothing man woman vncouenable certes superfluitie disordinate quantitie clothing reprouable also sinne ornament apparaile thing appertaine riding companie delicate horse ben holden delight faire fatte costlewe also many nice knaue sustained hem curious harneis saddle cropers peitrels bridle couered precious clothing rich barres plate gould siluer god saith zacharie prophet woll confounde rider suche horse folke take little regarde ye riding goddes sonne heauen harneis rode vpon asse none harneis poore clothes disciple ne read euer hee rode beest speak ye sinne superfluitie reasonable honeste reason requireth moreouer certes pride greatly notified holding great meine little profite right profite namely meine felonous dammageous people hardinesse high lordship way office certes lordes sell lordshippe deuil hell sustain wickednesse meine else folke low degree keep hostleries susteine thefte hosteller many manner deceit maner folk ye flyes follow honie else hound follow certes great folly like falleth ditch woll arise vice commeth false hope thinketh shall liue long hope fayleth full oft commeth lochesse beginneth good work anone woll leaue stint done haue person gouern ne take heed anon find contrary annoy ben new sheepheards let sheepe wittingly goe ren wolfe breres force gouernaunce commeth pouerte destruction spirituel temporel thing commeth manner coldnesse freeseth hart man commeth undeuotion man blont sayeth bernard hath langour soul may neyther read ne sing holy church ne hear ne think deuotion ne trauail honds good work ni unsauory apalled wexeth slow slombry soon woll wroth soon enclined hate enuy commeth sinne worldly sorrow called tristitia staeth man sayth saint poule certes sorrow worketh death soul body also thereof commeth man annoyed life wherefore sorrow shorteth full oft life man ere time come way kind remedium contra peccatum accidiae ayenst horrible sinne accidie braunches vertue yt called fortitudo strength man despiseth annoyous thing vertue mightie rigorous dare withstond mightily wisely keep himselfe fro peril wicked wrastle ayenst assault deuill enchaunceth enforceth soule right accidie abateth maketh feeble fortitude may endure long sufferaunce trauails ben couenable vertue hath many speces first called magnanimitie say great courage certes behoueth great courage ayenst accidie least ne swallow soule sin sorrow destroy wanhope certes vertue maketh folke undertake hard greeuous thinges wisely reasonably much deuill fighteth ayenst manne subtilty sleight strength therefore shall man withstand wit reason discretion vertues fayth hope god saint follow accomplish good workes purposeth fermely continue commeth suretie sikernesse manne ne doubteth trauail time comming good workes hath begun commeth magnificence say man doeth performeth great work goodnesse hath begun end menne doe good workes accomplishing good workes lyeth great guerdon constaunce stablenes courage heart stedfast faith mouth bearing chere deed mo speciall remedy ayenst accidie diuers work consideration paine hell ioyes heauen trust grace holy ghost yeue might performe good entent pde avaricia accidie woll speak manner outragious thing auarice couetise couetise couet thing thou hast auarice withhold keep thing thou hast without right soothly auarice sin full dampnable holy writ curseth speaketh ayenst yt vice another also lenger tarrieth farther fro christ abide last day scarcely may shriue remember sin repent greeuous maladie death much ne hath life hearkened iesu christ hath spoken shall crie iesus christ last daie scarcely woll hearken understonde condition muste haue foure thinges thy shrift must prouided aduised wicked hast doth profit man shrive sin pride enuye forth speces circumstaunces sin hee haue comprehended minde number greatnesse sin long hath lyen sinne also hath contrite sin stedfast purpose grace god neuer ayen fall sin also dread counterfaite fly occasion sinne whiche inclined also thou shalt shriue thee thy sinnes manne part manne part another vnderstond entent depart thy confession shame dread strangling thy soul certes iesus christ entierly good none imperfection therefore either foryeueth perfectly el neuer deal say assigned thy penitencer certain sin thou art bounde shewe remenaunt thy sinnes thou haste shriuen thy curat like thee thy humility part thy shrift ne say speak division confession thou haue licence shriue thee liketh licence thy curate thou ne maist well shriue thee thy sin let sin vntold ferre thou hast remembraunce thou shalt shriuen thy curat tell thy sinnes thou hast sith thou last shriuen wicked entent diuision shrift also shrift asketh certaine condition first thou shriue thee thy free constrained shame folke sicknesse ne thing reason trespasseth free free confesse trespasse none man tell sin ne shall nay ne deny sin ne wrath ayenst priest admonishing leaue sin second condition thy shrift lawfull say thou shriuest thee also priest heareth thy confession verely fayth holy church man ne dispeired mercie iesu christ cain iudas also man must accuse trespasse another shall blame wite himselfe owne malice sinne none nathelesse another man occasion enticer sinne estate person sin agredged else may plainly shriue tell person hath sined may tell entent ne backbite person onely declare confession thou ne shalt also make leasinges thy confession humilitie peraduenture say thou hast committed done sinnes thou ne neuer giltie saint augustine saith thou thine humilitie makest lesings thy self though thou sin yet art thou sinne thy leasing thou must also shew thy sinne thine proper mouth thou dombe letter sor thou hast done sinne shalt haue shame therefore thou shalt eke paint thy confession fayr subtill wordes couer thy sinne begilest thou thy self priest thou must tell plain neuer foul ne horrible thou shalt also shriue thee priest discreet counsail thee also thou shalt shriue thee vaine glorie ne ypocrisie ne cause loue fear iesus christ heal thy soul thou shalt also ren priest sodainly tell lightly thy sin saith tell yape tale auisedly good deuotion generally shriue thee oft thou oft fall oft arise confession though thou shriue ofter one sin thou hast shriuen merite saith saint augustine thou shalt haue lightly foryeuenesse grace god sinne pain certes one yere least lawfull houseled surely thing generally hath need food clothing herborow hath need charitable counsail visiting prison sicknesse sepulture body thou maist visit needfull prison thy person visit hem thy message yefts ben generally almose workes charitie hem haue temporell rich discretion counsailing workes shalt thou hear day dome almose shalt thou thine proper thing hastely priuely thou maist nathelesse thou maist priuily thou shalt forbear almose though men see doe thank world thank iesu christ witnesseth faint mathew capi v citie may hid set mountain ne men light lantern put vnder bushell set vpon candlestick yeue light menne house right shull light light menne may see good work glorifie father heauen speak bodyly pain stont praiers waking fasting vertuous teaching orison ye shall understond orison prayer say pitous heart setteth god expresseth word outward remeeue harm haue thing spirituel perdurable sometime temporel thing orison certes orison paternoster hath iesus christ enclosed thing certes priuiledged three thing dignity digne prayer iesu christ himselfe made short shold learned lightly hold easie heart help himselfe ofter orison man lesse weary say excuse learn short easie comprehendeth selfe good prayer exposition holie prayer excellent digne referre maister theologie saue thus much woll say thou prayest god foryeue thee thine offence thou foryeuest hem haue offended thee well ware thou charitie holy orison aminisheth also venial sin therefore apperteineth specially penitence prayer must truely sayed perfect fayth men pray god ordinately discreetly deuoutly alway manne shall put subiect god orison must also sayd great humblenesse ful pure honestly annoyaunce man woman must also continued work charitie auaileth also ayenst vice soul sayth irom fasting saued vice flesh prayer vice soule thou shalt understond bodyly prayer stont waking iesu christ sayeth wake ye pray ye ne enter wicked temptaion ye shull understond also fasting stont three thing forbearing bodyly meat drink forbearing worldly iollitye forbearing deadly sinne saye man shall keep fro deadly sinne might thou shalt understond also god ordayned fasting fasting partayneth foure thinges largenesse poore folke gladnesse heart spirituel angrie ne annoyed ne grutch fasteth also reasonable hour eate measure saye man shall eat untime ne sit longer table fasteth shalt thou understond bodyly pain stont discipline teaching word writing ensample also wearing heer stamin harbergeons naked flesh christes sake maner penaunces ne make thine heart bitter angrie ne annoyed thy selfe better cast away thine heer cast away sweetnesse iesus christ therefore sayeth saint poule clothe chosen god heart misericorde debonairte suffraunce manner clothing whiche iesu christ pleased heers herbergeons discipline also knocking thy breast scourging roddes kneeling tribulation suffring patiently wrong doen thee also patient suffring sicknesse lesing worldly goodes cattel wife child frends shalt thou nnderstond thing disturbe pennaunce foure manner drrade shame hope wanhope desperation speak first dreade weneth may suffer penaunce ayenst remedie think bodyly penaunce short little regard pain hell cruel long lasteth without end ayenst shame man hath shriue namely ipocrites would hold perfect haue need shriue hem ayenst shame would man think way reason hath ashamed foul thing certes ought ashamed doe faire thinges confession man also think god seeth knoweth al thought werks maie nothing hid ne couered men also remember hem shame come daye dome hem penitent shriuen present life creature yearth hell shall see apertly hidde world speak hope hem negligent slowe shriue hem stondeth two manner one hopeth liue long purchase much rich delight woll shriue sayeth semeth timely ynough come shrift another surquidrie hath christes mercie ayenst first vice shall thenk life sikernesse also rich worlde aduenture passe shadow wall sayeth saint gregorie appartayneth great righteousnes god neuer shall paine stinte hem neuer would withdrewe hem sinne thankes euer continued sinne perpetual sinne shall haue perpetual pain wanhope two manner first wanhope mercie god think ne might long perseuer goodnes first wanhope commeth demeth hath sinned greatly oft long lyen sinne shall saued certes ayenst cursed wanhope thinke passion iesu christ stronge unbinde sinne strong binde ayenst second wanhope shall thinke often falleth may rise againe penitence though neuer longe hath lyen sinne mercie christ alway ready receiue mercie ayenst wanhope deemeth longe perseuer goodnesse shall think feeblenesse deuil maye nothing doe men woll suffer also shall haue strength help iesu christ holy church protection angel list shall men understonde fruite penaunce wordes iesu christ endlesse blisse heauen ioye hath neuer ende contrarie woe ne greuaunce harm ben passed present life sikernesse fro pain hell blisful companie rejoyce hem euermo euerich others ioye body man sometime foule darke clere sunne body sometime sicke freile feble mortal immortall strong hole ne may nothing appeire neither hunger thurste ne colde euery soule replenished sight perfite knowing god blisfull raigne may men purchase pouertie espirituel glorie lowlines plentie ioy hunger thurst rest trauaile life death mortification sinne life u bring bought u precious blood amen phere endeth parson tale pthus endeth booke canterbury tale romaunt rose book begun french verse william de lorris finished forty year john clopinell alias john moone born mewen upon river loyer far paris appeareth molinet french author morality upon romaunt afterward translated part english metre geffrey chaucer finished entituled romaunt rose art love wherein shewed help furtherance also let impediment lover suit book authour hath many glaunces hypocrisie clergy whereby got hatred amongst gerson chancellour paris writeth thus saith one called johannes meldinensis wrote book called romaunt rose book world might five hundred pound would rather burn take money sayeth thought authour thereof repent book dyed would vouchsafe pray would juda betrayed christ many men sain sweueninges ni fable lesinges men may sweuen seene hardely false ne afterward ben apparaunt may draw warraunt authour hight macrobes halt dreames false ne lee undoth u auisioun whilom mette king cipioun sayth weneth yape else nicete wene dreames fall let liste foole call trow say dreames signifiaunce good harme many wightes dreamen sleep nightes full many thinges couertly fallen openly within twentie yeere age loue taketh courage young folke went soone bed wont doone fast slept sleeping mette sweuening liked wondrous wele sweuen neuer dele ni afterward befall right dreame woll tell u dreame woll rime right make heart gay light loue prayeth also commaundeth aske whether booke shall hight rede romaunt rose art loue close matter faire make god graunt gree take begonnen hath iwis mokel prise thereto worthie beloued well ought prise right cleped rose euerie wight mey thought tho fiue yere ago mey thus dreamed time loue iolitie thing ginneth waxen gay neither buske hay mey nill shrouded bene new leues wrene woodes eke recoueren grene drie winter ben sene earth waxeth proud withall swote dewes fall poore estate forget winter set become ground proude woll haue newe shroude maketh queint robe faire hewes hundred paire grasse floures inde pers many hewes full diuers robe mean iwis ground praisen birdes han left song han suffred cold full strong wether grille derke sight ben mey sunne bright glad shew singing heart liking mote singen ben light doth nightingale might maken noyse singen blith blisfull many sith chelaundre popingaye young folke entenden aye ben gay amorous time sauorous hard heart loueth nought mey mirth wrought may braunches small birdes singen clere blisfull sweete song piteous season delitous loue affirmeth thing thought one night sleeping right bed full readyly morrow early rose gan cloth anone wish mine hondes siluer needle forth drow aguiler queint inow gan needle thread anone toune list gone sound birdes heare buskes singen cleare sweete season lefe thred basting sleuis alone went playing small foules song hearkening payned hem full many paire sing bowes blossomed faire iolife gay full gladnesse toward riuer gan dresse heard ren fast fairer playen none saw playen riuere hill stood nere come doune stream full stiffe bold clere water cold well sooth saine somedele lasse saine straiter weleaway neuer saw er day water wele liked wonder glad se lusty place riuere water ran clere face wish tho saw wele bottome ypaued eueridele grauel full stone shene meadowes soft sote grene beet right water side full clere morowe tide full attempre drede tho gan walken thorow mede dounward aye playing riuers side coasting igone saw garden right anone full long broad eueridele enclosed walled wele high walles enbatailed portrayed without well entayled many rich portraiture yet image peintures gan beholde besely woll tell readyly thilke image semblaunce farre haue remembraunce amidde saw hate stonde wrath yre onde seemed mynoresse angry wight childeresse full gile fell courage semblaunt like image nothing wele araide like wode woman afraide ifrounced foule visage grinning dispitous rage nose snorted tene full hidous sene full foule rustie head iwrithen iwis full grimly great towaile image another entaile lifte halfe fast name aboue head saw called felony another image villany icleped saw fonde vpon wall right honde villany like somedele image trusteth wele seemed wicked creature countenaunce portreiture seemed full despitous eke full proude outragious well coud paint undertake image coud make full foule churlish seemed eke villainous little coulde nurture worship creature next painted couetise eggeth folke many gise take yeue right nought againe great treasours laine usure leneth many creature lasse winning couetous brenning penny fele teacheth robbe stele theeues smale harlotes routh throtes full many one hongeth last maketh folke compasse cast taken folkes thing robberie miscoueting maketh treachours maketh false pleadours termes dome done maiden child eke gromes heritage forgo full crooked honds two couetise euer wood gripen folkes good couetise winning full lefe hath mennes thing another image set saw next couetise fast cleped auarice full foule painting vice full sad caitife eke also grene leke euil hewed colour seemed haue liued langour like thing hunger dead lad life onely bread kneden eisell strong egre thereto lene megre clad full poorely old torne courtpy dogges torne behind eke beforne clouted beggerly mantle honge faste vpon bench weake small burnette cote hong withall furred mineuere furre rough heere lambe skinnes heauy blacke old vndertake auarice cloath wele ne hasteth neuer dele certainly loth wearen ilke cloth forweared would haue full great nicete clothing er bought newe bad woll hewe auarice held hand purse hong band hid bond strong men must abide wonder long purse er come ought ne commeth thought certaine entent fro purse peny went image nigh inough painted enuie neuer lough neuer well heart feard either saw heard great mischaunce great disease nothing may much please mischeife misauenture seeth discomfiture vpon worthy man fall liketh well withall full glad courage see great linage brought naught shamefull wife man honour rise wit prowesse hath great heauinesse trusteth well goeth nie wood chaunce happeth good enuy cruelte fayth ne trouth holdeth friend ne fellow bad good ne hath kinne none blood ni full enemie nolde dare saine hardely owne father fared wele sore abieth euerie dele malice male talent great turment hate folke doth good nye melteth pure wood heart kerueth breaketh god people well awreaketh enuy iwis shall neuer let blame vpon folke set trow enuie iwis knew best man side beyond see yet somewhat lacken would hende wise ne might abate prise yet would blame worthinesse wordes make lesse saw envy painting wonderfull looking ne looked awrie overwhart baggingly foule usage might looke visage man ne woman forth right plaine shette one eye disdaine envie brenned shee might man see faire worthy wise else stood folkes prise sorow painted next envie vpon wall masonrie well seene colour lived languour seemed jaundice halfe pale avarice ne nothing like leannesse sorowe thought great distresse suffred daie night made yellow nothing bright full sad pale megre also never wight yet halfe wo seemed fulfilled yre trow wight might please doe thing might ease ne would sorow stake comfort none unto take depe wo begonne eke heart anger ronne sorowfull thing well seemed nothing slow scratchen face rent many place clothes teare swire fulfilled yre torne lay eke heere shoulder rent anger male talent eke tell certainly wept full tenderly world ni wight hard heart seene sorowes smart nolde pite wo begon thing dasht selfe wo smote togider hand two sorrow full ententife wofull retchelesse caitife wrought little playing clipping kissing sorrowfull heart lust play ne start dauncen ne sing ne may heart temper bring make joy even morrow joy contrarie unto sorrow elde painted shorter foot iwis wont yonghede nneth selfe might fede feeble eke old faded beaute full salow waxen colour head hore white flour iwis great qua ne none ne sinne although life gone woxen body vnwelde drie dwined elde foule forw lked thing whilom round soft heeres shoken fast withall head would fall face frounced forpined honds lorne fordwined old ne went foot potent time passed night daye restlesse trauayleth aye stealeth v priuyly v seemeth sikerly one point dwelleth euer certes ne resteth neuer goeth fast passeth aye ni man thinke maye time present asketh cleres men thinke readily three time passed time may soiourne goth may neuer retourne water doun runneth aye neuer droppe returne may may nothing time endure metall yearthly creature thing frette shall time eke chaungeth doth waxe fostred thing destroyeth time eldeth auncestours eldeth kinges emperours v shall ouercommen er death v shall haue nommen time hath welde elden folke made elde inly weting might helpe selfe nothing tourned ayen vnto childhede nothing selfe lede ne wit ne pith hold childe two yere old nathelesse trow faire sometime fresh se rightfull age past passage doted thing becommen furred cappe nommen well clad selfe warme cold might el doen harme old folke haue alway cold kind old another thing doen write seemed like ipocrite cleped pope holy ilke priuily ne spared never wr ked deed men taken none heed maketh outward precious pale visage piteous seemeth simple creature ni misaduenture ne thinketh courage full like thilke image maked like semblaunce full simple countenaunce clothed eke shod loue god yolden religion soch seemed deuotion psalter held fast hond busily gan fond make many faint prayere god saint dere ne gay fresh ne iolife seemed full ententife good work faire thereto haire ne certes fatte nothing seemed wearie fasting colour pale dead gate aie warned paradise blisfull place folke maken leane grace christ sayth euangile get hem prise toune little glorie vaine lesen god eke raigne alderlast euerichone painted pouert alone peny hold although clothes sold though honged naked worme weather stormie cold haue died ne straite old sacke many cloute stacke cote mantele neuer dele cloath vndertake great leaser quake put talke ferre fro vp halke lurked coured poore thing shamefast dispised aie accursed may well daie poore man conceiued god wote seld iwis poore man well ifed well arrayed icled well beloued wise honour may arise thing well auised haue er deuised gold azure ouer depainted vpon wall square wall high somde e enclosed ibarred wele stead hedge gardin come neuer shepheard therein gardin well wrought coud haue brought ladder else degree would well haue liked mee solace joy pleie trow neuer man ne seie place delicious gardin daungerous herborow birdes many one rich yere neuer none birdes song braunches grene therein birdes mo wene realme fraunce full blisfull accordaunce sweet pitous song made world ought glade selfe merry feard blisfull songes heard hundred pound would passage openly vnto free nolde entren see thassemble god keepe fro care birdes therein ware songen merry throtes daunces loue merry note thus heard foules sing fell fast waymenting art engin might come gardin way couth finde none gardin gone ne nought wist either hole place might haue entre ne none teach alone iwis woe anguish till last bethought mee way ne might bee na ladder ne way pace hole faire place tho gan go full great paas enuiron euen compas closing square wall till found wicket small shette ne might gone entre none vpon doore gan smite fetis lite waye coud seke full longe shote knocked eke stode full long herkening heard wight comming till doore thilke entre maiden curteis opened haire yellowe hewe bason scoured newe flesh tender chicke bent browes smooth slicke measure large opening eyen clere nose good proportion eyen graie faucon sweete breath well fauoured face white well coloured little mouth round see cloue chinne eke necke good fashion length greatnesse reason without bleine scabbe roine fro ierusalem vnto burgoine ni fairer necke iwis fele smooth soft throte also white hewe snowe braunce snowed newe bodie full well wrought men neden countre fairer bodie seke fine orfrais eke chapelet semely ne neuer wered maide vpon faire aboue chapelet rose garlond set gay mirrour rich gold treasour head tressed queintly sleeues sewed fetously keepe hondes faire gloues white paire coate grene cloth gaunt withouten wene well seemed apparaile wont great trauaile shee kempt feteously well araied richly doen iournee merrye well begon led lustie life may thought night ne day nothing onely grayeth well vncouthly dore opened may seemely see thonked best might asked hight asked eke nought vnmeke ne answeare daungerous faire answerde sayed thus lo sir name idlenesse clepe men lesse full mightie full rich one thinge namely entende nothing joye playing kembe tresse acquainted priue mirthe lord gardin fro londe alexandrin made tree hither fet gardin iset tree woxen hight wall stant thy sight mirth enclosen image without hem entaile paint neither jolife ne quaint full sorowe wo thou hast see ne ago oft time solace sir mirth commeth place eke commeth meine liuen lust iolite mirth therein birdes singen clere maui nightingale jolly birdes smale thus walked solace folke sweeter place playen may finde
