although sought one till inde alther fairest folke see world may found bee hath mirth rout followen alwaies idlenesse told herkened well ywis saied dame idlenesse also wisely god blesse sith mirth faire fre yerd meine fro thilke assemble may shall man werne day night ne mote see well wene bee faire jolly companie fulfilled courtesie forth word mo wicked went tho idlenesse opened mee garden faire see ywis mine heart full glad well wend full sikerly haue paradice earthly faire trusteth well seemed place espirituell certes deuise place paradice good dwell garden thought many bird singing throughout yerde thringing many place nightingale alpes finch wodwales sweet song delighten thilke place habiten might men see many flockes turtle lauerockes chalaundres fele saw nigh forsongen thrustles terins mauise songen win hem prise eke sermount song bird hem emong note made faire seruise birdes deuise song song faire well angel done espirituell trusteth hem heard full lustie well feard neuer yet melodie heard man might die sweet song hem emong thought bird song wonder like bee song meremaidens see singing clere though meremaidens clepe hem english vsaunce men clepe hem sereins fraunce ententiue sing bird vnkonning craft prentise song subtill wise certes heard song saw green place emong heart wext wonder gay neuer erst ere day iolife well bigo ne merry heart tho wist saw full well idlenesse serued well put iolite friend well ought sith dore gardin opened let henceforth wrought shall tell thought first whereof mirth serued eke folke without fable woll discriue garden eke bliue woll tellen faire fashion ywis well wrought none may tell atones may shall order tellen full faire seruice eke full swete bird maden sete lay loue ful well souning songen iargoning high eke low song vpon braunches greene isprong sweetnesse melodie made mine heart reuelrie heard trowe bird singing rowe might withhold mee ne went see sir mirth desiring seene ouer thing countenaunce manere sight full dere tho went forth right hond downe little path fond mint full fennell greene fast without wene sir mirth found right anone vnto sir mirth gan gone solace lustie place faire folke fresh saw wondred fro whence folke might come faire like sight angel ben fethered bright folke tell vpon karole wenten tho ladie karoled hem hight gladnesse blisfull light well could sing lustely none halfe well seemely coth make song refraining sate wonder well sing voice full clere full swete rude ne unmete couth ynough longeth unto karolling wont every place singen first folke sol ace singing gave craft lefe tho mightest thou karols seene folke daunce merry beene made many faire tourning vpon greene grasse springing mightest thou see flutours minstrals eke joglours well sing paine song song loraine loraine note full sweeter countre many timbestere saliours dare well swere couth craft full perfitly timbre full subtelly cast hent full oft vpon finger faire soft failed never mo full fetis damosel two right yong full semelyhede kirtle none wede faire tressed every tresse mirth doen noblesse amid carole daunce hereof lieth remembraunce daunced queintly one would come prively ayen togither almost threw ifere mouthes play seemed kist alway dauncen well couth guise devise ne bode never thence go while saw hem daunce vpon caroll wonder fast gan behold till last ladie gan espie cleped courtesie worshipfull debonaire pray god ever fall faire full courtessy called doe ye beau sire qd come like daunce daunceth u without tarrying went carolling abashed never adele liked right wele courtesie cleped bade daunce go durst certaine would carolled right faine man daunce right blithe gan looken oft sithe shape body cheres countenaunce maneres folke daunced shall tell full faire mirth full long high fairer man never sigh round apple face full roddie white every place fetis well besey meetly mouth eyen gray nose measure wrought full right crispe haire eke full bright shoulder large brede smallish girdle stede seemed like purtreiture noble stature faire jolly fetise lims wrought point devise deliver smert great might ne saw thou never man light berd unneth nothing first spring full yong merry thought samette bird wrought gold beaten full fetous bodie clad full richely wrought robe straunge egise slittered queintise many place low hie shode great maistrie shoone decoped lace drurie solace leefe rosen chapelet made head set wete ye lefe dame gladnesse lefe singeth well glad courage twelve yeare age love graunt made sir mirth finger hade dauncing also great love atwixt hem two faire bright hew seemed like rose new colour flesh tender brere small tender men might cleve dare well say forhead frounceles play bent browes two eyen gray glad also laughden aye semblaunt first mouth covenaunt wot nose shall discrive faire hath woman alive haire yellow clere shining wote lady liking orfraies fresh garland seene thousand saw never ywis garland yet well wrought silke gilt samite clad great delite leefe robe werde merrier heart ferde next went side god love divide love liketh cherles daunten many folkes pride fallen well lord thrallen lady put low degree may hem proud see god love fashion like knave ne quistron beautie greatly prise robe devise dreade encombred yelad silke floures flourettes painted amorettes losenges scochons bird liberdes lion beast wrought full wele garment every dele purtraied ywrought flour diver medling colour floures ther many gise iset compasse sise lacked floure dome ne much floure brome ne violet ne eke peruinke ne floure none men thinke many rose lefe full long entermedled emong also head set rose redde chapelet nightingale full great rout flien head leaf felden flien bird wrien popinjay nightingale chalaundre wodewale finch larke archangell seemed angell comen fro heaven clere love bachelere made alwayes sweet looking cleped batcheler stood beholding daunce hond holding turke bow two full well devised hee one hem tree beareth fruit savour wicke full crooked foule sticke knottie also blacke berrie slo bow plant without wemme dare warrant full even proportion trectes long full good fashion painted well thwitten diapred written lady bacheleres full lightsome glad cheres bowes two held sweet looking seemed like gadling ten brode arrowes held sive hond shaven well dight nocked feathered aright gold begon strong pointed everichon sharpe kerven wele yron none ne stele gold men might see take feather tree swiftest arrowes five bow drive best feathered flie fairest eke cleped beautie arrow hurteth lesse cleped trow simplesse third cleped fraunchise feathered noble wise valour courtesie fourth cleped companie heavie shooten shooteth right ywis may therewith doen great harme wo fift last also faire semblaunt men arrow call least greevous hem yet make full great wound may hope sore sound hurt arrowe ywis wo bette bestowed may sooner gladnesse langour ought lesse five arrowes gise full foule devise shaft end sooth tell also blacke fiend hell first hem called pride arrow next beside cleped villanie arrow fellonie envenimed spitous blame third hem cleped shame fourth wanhope cleped fift new thought ywis arrowes speake five one mannere resemblable hem well sitting able foule crooked bow hidous knottie roinous bow seemed well shete arrowes five unmete contrary five though tell blive power ne might hereafter shall tellen right sooth eke signifiaunce ferre remembraunce shall saied undertake ere booke end make come tale againe aldersirst woll saine fashion countenaunces folke daunce god love jolife light led hond ladie bright high prise great degre ladie called beaute arrow told full well thewed hold ne derke ne browne bright cleare moone light againe starres semen small candle demen flesh tender dewe floure cheare simple bird boure white lilly rose rise face gentle treatise fetis small see wintred browes shee ne popped needed nought winder paint ought tress yellow long straughten vnto heeles downe raughten nose mouth eye cheke well wrought remnaunt eke full great sauour swote thought mine heart rote helpe god remember fashion euery member world none faire wight young hewed bright sore pleasant fetis gent middle small beside beauty yede richesse high ladie great noblesse great price euery place durst trespace till folke werke dede full hardie drede helpe hinder may yesterday rich folke haue full great might helpe eke greue wight best greatest valour didden richesse full great honour busie serue would loue deserue cleped ladie great small wide world dredeth world daungere court hath many losengere many traitour enuious ben full busie curious dispraise blame best deseruen loue name forne folke hem begilen losenge hem preise smilen thus world word annointen afterward prill pointen folke right bare bone behind backe ben gone foule abaten folkes prise full many worthy man wise han hindred idoen die losengeours flatterie maketh folke full straunge hem ought ben priue well euill mote thriue thee euill ariued mote bee losengeours full enuie good man loueth companie richesse robe purple ne trow lie mad world none liche ne thousand deale riche ne none faire full wele orfreis laied euery dele purtraid ribanings duke story king bend gold tassiled knops fine gold amiled necke gentle entaile shet rich cheuesaile full great plente stone clere faire se richesse girdle vpon bokell ston vertue great mokell might bare stone bright venim durst nothing doubt stone stone greatly loue till rich man behoue worth gold rome frise mourdant wrought noble gise stone full precious fine vertuous whole man couth make palsie toothake yet stone grace seker euery place thilke day blind beene fasting might stone seene barres gold full fine vpon tissue sattine full heauie great nothing light eueriche besaunt wight vpon tress richesse set circle noblesse brend gold full light shone faire trow neuer none cunning none could deuise stone circle shewen clere wonder thing man could preise gesse hem value richesse ruby saphirs ragounces emeraudes two vnces full subtilly fine carbuncle set saw stone cleare bright soone night men might seene go nede mile two length brede light sprang stone richesse wonder bright shone head face eke place dame richesse hond gan lede yong man full semely hede best loued thing lust much housholding clothing full fetise loued well haue hors prise wend haue reproued theft murder stable hacknay therefore desired aye acquainted richesse purpose gesse make great dispence withouten warning defence richesse might well sustaine dispences wele maintaine alway plentie send gold siluer spend without lacking daungere pourde garnere daunce went largesse set entent ben honorable free alexander kinne shee joy ywis yafe saied haue auarice foule caitife halfe gripe ententife largesse yeue spend god alway ynowe send yaue away iwis alway great loo hath largesse great prise wise folke vnwise wholly bandon brought well yefts hath wrought enemy trowe couth craftely make full soone friend large yefts wise therefore stood loue grace rich poore euery place full great foole ywis rich poore niggard lord may haue manner vice greeueth auarice niggard neuer strength hand may win great lordship land friend hath doen performed woll friend may hold treasure dere ensample tell right adamant ywis drawen subtelly yron laied thereby draweth folkes heart ywis siluer gold yeuen largesse robe fresh rich purpure sarlinish well formed face clere opened colere right present vnto lady made present gold brooch full well wrought certes missate nought smocke wrought silke flesh seene white milke largesse worthy wise held hond knight prise sibbe arthour breteigne bare enseigne worship gousfaucoun yet renoun men say faire thing baron earles ring knight commen newly fro tourneying fast done great chiualrie vertue maisirie loue lemman cast doune many doughty man next daunced dame fraunchise arrayed full noble gise broune ne dunne hew white snow ifallen new nose wrought point deuise gentle tretise eyen glad browes bent haire downe heel went simple doue tree full debonaire hert shee durst neither say ne longeth man distresse loue heauinesse heart would full great pitee amiable free man bestad would ben right sore adrad ouergreat outrage holpe harme taswage thought villany suckeny hempe herdes faire none arras lord riddled fetisly na point truly na right assise full well yclothed fraunchise ni cloth sitteth bette damosell doth rokette woman well fetise rokette cote ywis white rokette riddeled faire betokeneth full debonaire sweet bere daunced bachelere cannot tellen hight faire good height ben say lord sonne windsore next daunced courtesie preised low hie neither proud ne foole daunce called pray god giue good grace came first place na nice ne outrageous wise ware vertuous faire speech faire answer neuer wight missaid bare rancour wight clere broune thereto bright face body auenaunt wote lady pleasaunt worthy bene empresse crowned quene went knight dauncing worthy well speaking full well coud done honour knight faire stiffe stour armure seemely man well beloued lemman faire idlenesse saw alway fast haue without faile cold shape apparaile said lo great bounte gate gardin vndid let passen daunced gesse fulfilled lustinesse na yet xii yeare age heart wild thought volage nice ne ment none harme ne sleight entent onely lust iolite yong folke well weten ye haue little thought play lemman beside alway gise kist time list daunce might see make force priuetee spake hem euill wele ashamed neuer adele men might seene hem kisse two yong doues yong thilke bachelere beauty wot non pere right age youth lefe courage lusty folke daunced also meinee full hend folke wise free folke faire port truly comenly seene countenaunces hem ladden thus daunces goe see garden liked mee looken faire laureres pine tree cedrres olmeres daunces ended many hem daunced loues went away vnder tree haue play lord liued lustely great foole sikerly nold thankes life lede dare saine drede might well fare better life durst care ni good paradise haue loue deuise place went tho garden gan go playing along full merely god loue full hastely vnto sweet looking clept lenger would kept gold shone bright bent anon right full soone set end braide gan bend tooke arrowes fiue full sharpe ready driue god sitteth maieste fro deadly wound keepe shete arrow mete greeued sore ywis nothing wist went vp downe full many way followed fast alway would rest till garden garden measuring right euen square compassing long large fruit euery tree charge hidous tree two three wote full wele pomgranettes full great dele fruit full well like namely folke ben sike tree great foison baren nut season men nutmeg call swote savour withall almandres great plentee figges many date tree men nede gardin length brede eke wexing many spice clowe gilofre licorice gingere grein de paris canell setewale pris many spice delitable eaten men rise fro table many homely tree peach coines apple bere medlers plommes peeres thesteinis cherise many one faine nut aleis bola seene solas many high laurer pine renged clene gardine cipres oliueris nigh plenty elmes great strong maple ashe oke alpes plane long fine ewe popler lindes faire tree full many paire tell many tree yet encombred bee cre reckoned euery tree tree set deuise one another assise fiue fadome sixe trow high great also keepe well sunne croppes thicke irunne euery braunch knitte full greene leaues sitte sunne might none descend least tender grass shend might men roe isee squirrel full great plentee bough bough alway leping connis also playing comen clapers sundry colour maners maden many tourneying vpon fresh grasie springing place saw wels frog faire shaddow euery well ne number tell stremis small deuise mirth done come condise water renning gan make noise full liking brinkes wels streames ouer el sprang vp grasse thicke iset soft veluet men might lemman ley featherbed pley earth full soft swete moisture well wete sprong vp sote greene gras faire thicke mister much amended place therth grace floures hath plente summer winter sprang violet new fresh peruinke rich hew floures yellow white rede plenty grew neuer mede full gay ground queint poudred men peint many fresh sundry flour casten vp full good sauour woll long hold fable garden dilectable mote tongue stinten nede ne may withouten drede naught tellen beautie ne halfe bountie therewithall went right hond left place left till garden beene ester men might seene thus went playe god loue followed aye right hunter abide beast till seeth tide shooten goodnesse deere needeth go neere befell rested mee besides well vnder tree tree fraunce men call pine sith time king pepine ne grew tree man sight faire ne well woxe hight yard high none springing marble stone nature set sooth tell vnder pine tree well border without written stone letter small saiden thus starfe faire narcissus narcissus bachelere loue caught daungere nette gan straine weepe plaine need must life forgo faire lady hight echo loued ouer creature gan paine endure time tolde louen nolde behoued need die lay none remedie nathelesse beaute fierce daungerous nolde graunten asking weeping ne faire praying heard werne heart great wo tooke great despite without respite dead anon ere deide full pitously god preide proud hearted narcissus loue daungerous might day ben hampered loue ben hote wo neuer might joy attaine fele vaine sorrow true louers maken ben villainously forsaken prayer reasonable therefore god held ferme stable narcissus shortly tell auenture came well rest shaddowing day came hunting narcissus suffred paine renning day plaines thurst great distresse heart wearinesse breath almost benomen well icomen shaddowed braunches grene thought thilke water shene drinke fresh wele withall downe knee gan fall forth necke head outstraught drinke well draught water anon sene nose mouth even shene thereof abashed owne shaddow betrashed well wend forme see child great beautee well couth loue wreke tho daungere pride also narcissus sometime bere quite well guerdon mused well shortly sooth tell loued owne shaddow last starfe wo saw might manner way fulfill fast caught couth comfort naught lost wit right place deid within little space thus warison tooke lady forsooke lady praye ensample taketh ye ayenst loue mistaketh death wite god full well wile quite letter tell taught well narcissus beaute gan anon withdraw fell remembraunce betide mischaunce last thought scathlesse full sikerly might vnto well go whereof shull abashen vnto well went mee downe louted see clere water stone eke grauell shone downe bottome siluer fine well fine world none clere hew water euer fresh new welmeth vp waues bright mountenaunce two finger hight grasse springing moist thicke well liking ne may winter die may see drie downe bottome set saw two christall stone craftely thilke fresh faire well thing soothly dare tell ye woll hold great meruaile told withouten faile sunne clere sight cast well beames bright heat descended taketh christall stone iwis againe sunne hundred hewis blew yellow red fresh new yet hath meruailous christall strength place ouer foule tree leaues greene yerd see ne done vnderstond make ensample woll fond right mirrour openly sheweth thing stondeth thereby well colour figure withouten couerture right christall stone shining withouten deceiuing entree yerd accuseth water museth euer halfe ye bee ye may well halfe garden see turne may right wele seene remnaunt euery dele none little thing hid ne closed shitting ne seene though painted christall mirrour perillus proud narcissus sey faire face bright made sith lie vpright looke mirrour may nothing ben succour ne shall see something shall lede laughing full many worthy man hath yblent folke greatest wit ben soone caught waited withouten respite ben baited commeth folke new rage chaungeth many wight courage lithe rede ne thereto venus sonne dan cupido hath sowen loue sede helpe ne lithe none ne rede cercleth well ginnes hath set without right catch panters damosel bachelers loue none bird catch though set either nette latch seed sowen well cleped well knowen well loue right hath full many wight spoken bookes diuersly shull neuer verily description well ne eke sooth matere ye shull haue vndo craft belongeth alway liked dwell seene christall well shewed full openly thousand thing fast may say sorry houre stode looken poure sithen sore sighed mirrour hath entriked first knowen wit vertue strengthes nolde haue mused bette ben elswhere snare fell anone bitreshed many one thilke mirrour saw tho among thousand thing mo roser charged full rosis hedge enclosis tho lust enuie paris ne pauie nolde haue left gone see greatest heape rose bee rage hent caught hath many man shent toward roser gan go ferre therefro sauer rose swote mote right heart rote enbaumed ne endouted haue ben hated assailed thankes woll failed pull rose rout beare mine hond smellen went ever drede repent least greved forthought lord thilke gardin wrought rose great wone faire never rone knops close saw well better woxen moison drowe nigh season sped hem fast spred love well rose red brode rose open also ben passed day two knoppes fresh bee two dayes least el three knoppes greatly liked mee fairer may man see might one ought full lefe withall might garlond hem getten richesse would letten amongs knoppes chese one faire remnaunt none ne preise halfe well avise wit well enlumined colour red well fined nature couth make faire hath leaf well foure paire kind hath set knowing red rose springing stalke rishe right thereon stood knoppe upright ne bowed upon side swore smell sprung wide died place smelled savour swote fro thence yet go somedele nere went tho take mine hond drede ne durst rose bede thistle sharpe many manner nettle thornes hooked brier much distourbled sore drad harmed god love bow bent day set talent pursue spien mee stonding figge tree saw chosen ententisely bothum unto pey sey tooke arrow full sharpely whet bowe set streight eare drough strong bowe tough shot wonder smert mine eye unto mine hert takell sinote deepe went therewithall cold hent clothes warme soft sithen day chivered oft hurt thus stound fell plat unto ground mine heart failed fainted aye long time swoune lay came swouning wit feeling mate wend full wele blood lorne full great dele certes arrow stood ne drew drop blood found wound drey tooke mine honds twey arrow full fast plight pulling sore sight last shaft tree drough feather three yet hooked head ywis beauty called gan deepe mine heart pace might arace mine heart still stood bled drop blood anguishous trouble perill saw double nist say ne get leach wound neither grasse ne rote ne helpe hope ne bote bothum evermo mine hert drew wo thought none thing keeping would brought life againe certes evenly dare well sight savour alegged much langour gan draw mee toward bothum faire see love gette throwe another arrowe bowe shoot gan dresse arrowes name simplesse love gan nigh nere drowe withouten shot might arrow anon right throughout eigh found mine heart hath made wound anon craft drawen shaft therewithall sighed eft mine heart head left aye increased desire vnto bothum drow nere evermo wo desire go vnto roser grew fresh bothum bright hew better letten behoved need doen right mine heart bad ever body must lad heart wele wo force together must go never archer would fine shoot pine make mete third arrow gan shete best time might espie named courtesie mine heart avale swoune fell dead pale long time lay stirred nought till abraied thought fast avised mee draw shaft tree ever head lest behind ought couth pull wind sore sticked hit craft might flit anguishous full thought felt wo wound aye wrought summoned alway go toward rose pleased ne durst manere archer nere evermore gladly rede brent child fire hath much drede certes yet pein though sigh yet arrowes rein ground quarels sharpe stele ne paine might fele yet might selfe withhold faire roser behold love yave hardement fulfill commaundement vpon foot rose feeble forwounded man forth gone might set archer nold let toward roser fast drow thornes sharpe mo ynow also thistle thicke breres brimme pricke ne might get grace rough thornes pace seene rose fresh hew must abide though rew hedge thicke closed rose compas thing liked right wele nigh might fele bothum swote odour also see fresh colour right greatly liked mee nere might see joy anon thereof forgat malady seene delite sorrow anger quite wound thore nothing liken might dwellen roser aye thence never passe awaye thare god love share mine heart arrowes kene casteth yeve wound grene shot full hastely arrow named company takell full able make lady merciable anone gan chaungen hew greevaunce wound new againe fell swouning sighed sore complaining sore complained sore gan greven none hope allegiaunce nigh drow disperaunce rought death ne life whether love would drife martir would make might power forsake anger thus woke god love arrow toke full sharpe pugnaunt called faire semblaunt wise would consent lover repent serve love heart perill may befall thought arrow kene ground rasour found cut kerve point god love annoint precious oyntment somedele yeve allegement vpon wound hade body heart made helpe sore cure may bette endure yet arrow without made mine heart large sore full greate paine abode aye ointment went abrode throughout wound large wide sprede every side whose vertue whose might mine heart joyfull light ben dead shent precious ointment shaft drow arrow looking wo right wonder narrow head made smart left behind mine heart fower dare well say never woll take away ointment halpe wele yet sorrow fele day chaunged hew wound fresh new men might see visage arrowes full rage variaunt diversitee men everiche might see great annoy eke sweetnesse joy meint bitternesse easie wood hem felt harme good sore without alleggement softing ointment softened pricked thus ease anger together god love deliverly come lepande hastely saied great yape yeeld thee thou may escape may defence availe thee therefore rede make daungere thou wolt yeeld thee hastely thou shalt rather mercy foole sikernesse daunger stoutnesse rebelleth please folly little ease meeke thou must need bowe strive ayen thy prowe come one ido woll yeeld thee debonairly answered full humbly gladly sit bidding woll yeeld thing service woll take god defend make ayen bidding resistence woll doen great offence skill ye may doe ye save spill also slo fro wise may go life death hond may last bond plaine list yeeld hoping heart sometime ye comfort ease shull send el shortly end withouten health mote aye dure ye take cure comfort health sithe ye hurt ye save health love mote found whereas tooken first wound ye list make prisoner woll take heart fully gree holy plaine yeeld mee without feining feintise governed emprise heare much prise woll whole devise fulfill liking repent nothing hoping yet tide mercy abide covenaunt yeeld mee anon downe kneeling upon knee profering kisse fete nothing would lete said love thee preise sen thine answere doth ese thou answered curtesly wote well utterly thou art gentle thy speech thou man ferre would seech finden certaine answere villaine word ne might nought issue villaines thought thou shalt lesen thy speche thy helping woll eche eke encreasen may first woll thou obay fully thine avauntage anone doe homage sithe kisse thou shalt mouth villaine never couth approch ne touch saufe cherles ne vouch shall never neigh nere curteis faire manere well taught full gentlenesse must shall kisse also full high fraunchise shall attaine emprise first thing warne thee paine great adversitee mote endure eke travaile shall serve without faile thee comfort thy service disport thou maiest full glad joyfull bee good maister mee lord high renoune beare love gonfenoune curtesie banere selfe manere gentle courteous meeke free ever ententive bee honour dout serve also observe fro trespasse fro villanie governe courtesie entention first prison caught must utterly fro thenceforth full busily cast gentle desire helpe anon without delay withouten daunger affray become man anone gave thankes many one kneled doune honds joint made port full queint joy went heart rote kissed mouth swote mixth liking cured languishing asked hostage sayd taken fele homage one bene distreined oft withouten wene felon full falsite many sithes beguiled falshed lust atchieved whereof repent agreeved hem get daungere falshed shall bie full dere love thee say thee plaine woll thee certaine thee sore woll binde thou away ne shalt winde denien thy covenaunt done avenaunt thou false great ruth sith thou seemest full truth sir thee list understand marvaile thee asking demaund wherefore ye hostage borowes aske sikernesse sith ye wote sothfastnesse ye surprised hole mine heart taken fro woll doe nothing bidding mine heart mine right nought behoveth deede thought ready worke whether tourne good ill sore lusteth please man thereof may disease ye thereon set justice werried many wise ye doubt nolde obaie ye may thereof doe make kaie hold hostage certes none outrage quoth love fully accord bodie full lord hath heart treasore outrage asken aumener drough little keie fetise inough gold polished clere sayed keye thine heart woll shet joyfull looke knet binde little kay wight may carie away keye full great poste anone touched vnder side full softely mine heart sodainely without speered yet right nought hath deered doen put doubt sir sayd right great lust pleasure fulfill looke ye service take gree thilke fayth ye owe say nought recreaundise nought doubt service servaunt travaileth vaine serven doeth paine vnto lord wise conne thanke service love sayd dismay thee nought sith thou succour hast sought thanke thy service woll take high degree woll thee make wickednesse ne hinder thee hope shall nouht bee worship wight aventure may come paine endure abide suffer thy distresse hurteth shall lesse wote selfe may thee save medicine thou wouldest thy truth thou keepe shall unto thine helping eke cure thy woundes make hem clene old grene thou shalt holpen wordes certainly thou shalt well shew thou servest good accomplishen fulfill commaundements day night lover yeve right ah sir god love sayd er ye passe hence enterntifely commaundements ye say shall keepe hem may hem keepen thought wote hem nought may unwittingly wherefore pray entierly mine heart lere trespace manere god love charged anon ye shall see word word right emprise romaunt shall devise maister leseth time lere disciple woll vaine swinke learning woll thinke lust love let entend romance beginneth amend good heare fay say point reason set gate iwis shall nat well thing brought good understanding reader pointeth ill good sentence may oft spill booke good ending made newe lustie thing woll ending craft love shall lere woll long abide till romance maie unhide undoe signifiaunce dreame romaunce soothfastnesse hid without coverture shall kid undoen haue dreaming wherein word leasing villanie beginning woll say love thing thou leave thou wolt false trespace ayenst curse blame generally loven villany villanie maketh villeine deed chorle seine villaines ar ne without pitie friendship love bountie nill receive unto servise hem villaines emprise understond thine entent mine entendement clepe wight age onely gentle linage vertuous port outrageous one thou seest thee beforne though gentle borne thou maiest well seine sooth gentle doth longeth gentleman hem none deme certainly withouten dreede churle demed deede hye lowe ye may see kinred bee ne say nought none euill thing holden still worship missaie thou mayest ensample take kaie sometime missayeng hated old yeng ferre gawein worthie praysed courtesie kaie hated fell word dispitous cruell wherefore wise acqueintable goodly word reasonable lesse eke mare thou commest men looke thou haue custome ay first salue hem thou may fall hem somme salue first domme quite courtesly anone without abiding ere gone nothing eke thy tongue applie speake word ribauldrie villaine speech degree let neuer thy lippe unbounden bee nought hold good faith curteis foule word saith woman serue preise thy power honour reise missayere despise woman thou maist blame bid hold still set thy might thy woman lady please doe thing may hem ease euer speake good thee thou maiest best praised bee looke fro pride thou keepe thee wele thou maiest perceiue feele pride folly sin pride hath within ne may heart wise meken ne souplen seruice pride found euerie part contrarie vnto loues art loueth truely conteine iollily without pride sundrie wise disguisen queintise queint array without drede nothing proude taketh hede fresh array men may see without pride may oft bee maintaine thy selfe thy rent robe eke garment many sith faire clothing man amendeth much thing looke alway shape garment thou shalt make best partaineth thereto pointes sleeues well sittand right streight hand shone bootes new faire looke least haue paire sit fetously rude may vtterly maruaile sith sit plaine come againe weare streight gloues aumere silke alway good chere thou yeue thou haue richesse thou haue nought spend lesse alway merry thou may wast thy good alway haue hatte floures fresh may chapelet rose witsunday arrie ne costneth lite thine hondes wash thy teeth make white let filth upon thee bee thy nayles blacke thou maiest see voide awaie deliuerly kembe thine head right iollily farce thy visage wise loue nat themprise loue doth haten finde beautie commeth kinde alway heart read thee glad merry ioyfull thou loue hath ioy sorrowfull man euill full curtesie knoweth maladie euer loue sicknesse meint sweete bitternesse sore loue maruailous louer ioyous plaine grone singen maken mone day plaineth heauinesse morow plaineth iolynesse life loue full contrarie stoundemeale oft varie thou canst mirthes make men gre woll gladly take doe goodly command thee men wheresoeuer doe thing hem fitting thereof commeth good loo pris whereof thou vertuous ne nat straunge ne daungerous thou good rider pricke gladly men may see armes also thou conne pursue till thou name hast wonne thy voice faire clere thou shalt maken great daungere sing goodly pray thy worship obay also longeth aye harpe gitterne daunce playe well foot daunce may greatly doe auaunce emong eke thy lady sake songes complaintes thou make woll meuen hart readen thy smart looke man scarce thee hold may greeue thee manifold reason woll louer yeftes large free churles louing thereof thing shall lefe aie yeue londes lore woll leue sodain sight kissing anon right yaue hole heart thought himselfe keepeth right nought swift good reason yeue good abandon woll shortly reherse haue sayd verse sentence wordes fewe compendiously thou better mayest hem thinke whether thou wake winke wordes little greeue man keepe breeue loue woll gone ride mote courteous voide pride merry full jollite largesse losed first joyne thee penaunce euer without repentaunce thou set thy thought thy louing last without repenting thinke vpon thy mirthes sweet shall follow ye meet thou true love shalt commaund thee one place thou set hole thine heart without halfen dole trecherie sikernesse loued neuer doublenesse many heart woll depart euerich shall haue little part hem drede right nought one place setteth thought therefore place set let neuer thence flet thou yeuest lening hold wretched thing therefore yeue whole quite thou shalt haue merite lent sone bountie thankes done love free yeuen thing requireth great guerdoning yeue yeft quite fully make thy gift devonairly men yeft hold dere yeuen gladsome chere gift nought praysen man yeueth maugre thou hast yeuen thine heart haue sayd thee openly aduentures shull thee fall hard heauie withall oft thou bethinkest thee thy louing thou fro folke thou must depart hie none perceiue thy maladie hide thine harme thou must alone go forth sole make thy mone thou shalt state whilom cold whilom hate redde rose yellow fade sorow trow thou neuer hade cotidien ne quarteine full peine often time shall fall loue among thy paine thou thy selfe holy yetten shalt vtterly many time thou shalt bee still image tree domme stone without stirring foote honde without speaking soone thy paine memorie shalt thou come againe man abashed wonder sore sighen wit thou wele withouten wene state full oft haue bene haue euill loue assaide thou art dismaide thought shall take thee thy loue ferre fro thou shalt say god may ne may ladie see mine heart alone goe abide sole woe departed fro mine owne thought mine eien se right nought ala mine eyen sene ne may carefull heart conuay mine heart guide praise nothing euer se shull abide nay gone visiten without delay mine heart desireth certainly go foole selfe may well hold ne se mine hart wold wherefore woll gone sene eased shall neuer bene tokenning goest thou forth without dwelling oft thou faylest thy desire er thou mayest come nere wastest vaine thy passage fallest thou new rage want sight thou ginnest murne homeward pensiue thou doest returne great mischiefe shalt thou bee againe shall come thee sighes plaintes new wo itching pricketh wote nought may goe lere hem buyen loue dere nothing thine heart appeasen may oft thou wolt gone assay thou maiest seene adventure thy life joy thine heart cure grace thou might attaine sight shalt thou done none deed sight thine eyen feed faire fresh thou mayst see thine heart shall ravished bee never thou wouldest thy thankes lete ne remove see swete thou seest sooth fastnesse thou covetest sweetnesse thine heart brenneth fire thine heart desire considreth euerie dele may likened wonder wele paine love unto fere evermore thou neighest nere thought verie sooth tell thee hotter ever shalt thou brenne experience shall thee kenne commest cost next fire brenneth yet forsooth thine heat though thou love swelt sweat ne thing thou felen may thou shalt willen passe away though thou goe yet must thou nede thinke day faire hede whome thou held good hold thy selfe beguiled ill thou ne hadst ne hardiment shew ought thine entent thine heart full sore thou wolt dispise eke repreue cowardise thou dull every thing domme drede without speaking thou shalt eke thinke thou didst folly thou fast durst aventure thee say thing er thou came away thou hadst wonne speake thou begonne yet would thy sake armes goodly thee haue take haue worth thee treasour great plente thus shalt thou mourne eke complain yet encheson gone vnto thy walke thy place thou beheld fleshly face never false suspection thou wouldest finde occasion gone unto house art thou desirouse sight thou thine honour mightest save errand mightest make thider thy love sake full faine thou woulde dreede thou goest least men take heede wherefore read thy going also thine againe comming thou well ware men ne wit feine thee cause goe way fast bie heale well follie happe thee thou thy love mayst see siker wise thou salewe wherewith thy colour woll transmewe eke thy bloud shall quake thy hewe eke chaungen sake word wit chere full pale shull want tell thy tale thou mayest ferre forth winne thou reason durst beginne wouldest saine three thing mo thou shalt full scarcely saine two though thou bethinke thee never wele thou shalt foryete yet somedele bvt thou deale trechery false lover mowe fouly sain hem lust withouten dred double falshed heart thinke thing saine another speaking thy speech ended right thus thee shall befall word come minde thou say hast left behinde thou shalt brenne great martire thou shalt brenne fire strife eke affraie battaile lasteth aie bargaine end may never take thy peace make night commen anon thousand angres shall come upon bed fast thou wolt thee dight thou shalt small delight thou wenest sleepe full paine shalt thou creepe stert thy bed full wide turne full oft everie side downeward groffe upright wallow woe long night thine armes shalt thou sprede brede man warre forwerede shall thee come remembraunce shape semblaunce none may pere wete thou well without thee shall see sometime night thou hast bright naked betweene thine armes sooth fastnesse though thou shalt make castle spaine dreame joy vaine thee delighten right nought thou siumbrest thought sweete delitable sooth ni fable ne shall last shalt thou sigh weepe fast say deere god thing dreame turned amis full sweet apparent wake shent yede merry thought away twentie time upon day would thought would come againe alleggeth well paine maketh full joyfull thought sleeth lasteth nought ah lord nill ye succour joy trow langour death would sio lye armes two mine harme hard withouten wene great unease full oft mene bvt would love might fully joy bright paine quit richly ala great thing aske folly wrong wening aske outragious thing asketh follily mote warned hastely ne wote may say ferre way would full great liking full great joy lasse thing would gentlenesse withouten one kesse great guerdon release passion hard come thereto folly high mine heart set may comfort get wote say well nought wote well thought bette alone slint woe mone looke cast goodly utterly another hole play ah lord shall bide day ever shall ladie full cured may see god shall dauning spring leggen thus angrie thing joy thus ly love man lyen hath great disease may sleepe ne rest ease would dawed day night went away day would rise ah slow sunne shew thine enprise speede thee spread thy beames bright chase darknesse night put away stoundes strong lasten long night shalt thou continue without rest paine wo ever thou knew love distresse thou shalt mowe learne sicknesse thus enduring shalt thou lye rise morow earlye thy bed harneis thee er ever dawning thou maiest see privily shalt thou gone whider thy selfe alone raine haile snow slete theder dwelleth swete may fall sleepe bee thinketh little upon thee shalt thou goe full foule aferde looke gate unsperde waite without woe paine full evill cold wind raine shalt thou goe dore thou mayest finde shore hole reft ever shalt thou stoupe lay eare within sleepe meane save thy ladie free waking thou mayest aspie goe put thy selfe jeopardie aske grace thee bimene may wete without wene thou night rest hast sore thou bestad woman well ought pitie take hem sorrowen sake looke love relike thou thinke none like thou hast great anney shall kisse thee er thou goe awey hold full great deinte man shall thee see house ne way looke thou gon againe er day comming going heavinesse walking maketh lover withouten wene vnder clothes pale lene love leaveth colour ne clearnesse loveth trew hath fatnesse thou shalt well thy selfe see thou must need assaied bee men shape hem way falsely lady betray wonder though fatte false othes love gatte oft see loengeours fatter abbot priours yet thing thee charge say thou large vnto maid doth serve best thanke thou shalt deserve yeue giftes get grace thou may thanke purchace thee worthy hold free thy ladie may thee see also servaunts worship aie please much thou maie great good hem may come thee prive shall tell thee fand curteous wise well shall preise well thee looke lond thou fore cause thou thee behoveth gone countree leave hole thine heart hostage till thou againe make thy passage thinke long see sweet thing hath thine heart keeping told thee wise lover shall doe servise thou wolt haue mede thou craue loue boden said sir may louers may manere endure paine ye haue sayd maruaile wonder fast man may liue last paine brenning sorrow thought sighing aie vnreleased woe make whether sleepe wake annoy continually helpe god maruaile man made steele might liue moneth pain feele god loue sayd friend bye faith owe thee may man haue good buy man loueth tenderly thing hath bought dere thou well without thanke thing taken man hath suffred sore certes woe ne may attaine vnto sore loues paine none euill thereto ne may amount man count drop water bee drie well great see thou mightest harmes tell hem loue dwell seruice paine hem sleeth would flee death trow neuer escape nere hope couth hem make glad man prison sete may getten ete barly bread water pure lyeth vermin ordure yet liue good hope comfort hath yeue maketh wene shall deliuered come libertie fortune full trust though lye straw dust hope sustaining faire louers wening loue hath set prison good hope saluation good hope sore smart yeueth hem hart profer body martire hope sore doth hem desire suffer harme men deuise joy afterward shall arise hope desire catch victorie hope loue glorie hope loue may yeue nere hope lenger liue blessed hope desire auaunceth louers manire good hope curteis please keepe louers disease hope keepeth lond woll abide perill may betide hope louers chiefe doth hem endure mischiefe hope helpe mister shall yeue thee eke iwis three thinges great sollace doth hem lace first good may found hem lace bound sweet thought record thing wherewith thou canst accord best thine heart thinking absence good thee louer doth complaine liueth distresse paine sweet thought shall come bliue away anger driue maketh louers haue remembraunce comfort high pleasaunce hope hath hight winne thought anone shall beginne farre god wote finde make mirrour minde behold woll let person shall afore set laughing eyen persaunt clere shape form goodly chere mouth gracious sweete eke sauourous feiters shall take heed eyen limmes feed thus sweet thinking shall aswage paine louers rage thy joy shall double without gesse thou thinkest seemelinesse laughing chere thee made thy lady dere comfort woll thou take next thou wolt forsake lesse sauerous thou shouldest ben daungerous second shall sweet speech hath many one leech bring hem woe helpe many bachelere many ladie sent succour haue loued paramour speaking might heare louers hem deare voideth smart closed hart heart maketh hem glad light speech mowe sight therefore commeth mind old dawes find clerkes written knew ladie fresh hew love made song remember among sayd heare speaken deare voideth smart iwis sitteth nere mine hart speake eve morrow cureth sorrow none high pleasaunce person daliaunce wist full well sweet speaking comforteth full much thing full well assaide full well apaide speake joy set therefore read thee thou get fellow well counsele keepe thy counsaile welhele goe shew wholly thine hart well woe joy smart get comfort thou go priuely two ye shall speake goodly thing hath thine heart keeping beaute semblaunce goodly countenaunce thy state thou shalt say aske counsaile thou may thing may please thee shall doe great ease may wete thou trust thy wele thy wo heart loue set companie much bet reason woll shew thee vtterly priuite loueth thee plainly shall vndo without drede shame tell renome name shall farre nere namely thy ladie dere siker wise ye euery shall helpen owne brother trouth without doublenesse keepen close sikernesse noble thing fay haue man thou darst say thy priuie counsaile euerie dele woll comfort thee right wele thou shalt hold thee well apaide friend thou hast assaide third good great comfort yeueth louers disport commeth sight beholding cleped sweet looking may none ease thou art ferre thy ladie fro wherefore thou prese alway place thou mayest see thing amerous delectable fauerous asswage mannes sorrow seen ladie morrow full noble thing thine eyen meeting relike precious whereof desirous day sooth drede faren amis dreden neither winde ne raine ne none manner paine thine eyen thus blisse yet courtesie iwisse alone cannot haue joy heart conuoy part blisse thou send harme make end eye good messenger heart manner tidings send hath sene voide paine clene whereof heart rejoyseth great partie wo voided put away flight right darkenesse night chased clerenesse moone right woe full soone deuoided cleane sight beholden may fresh wight heart desireth darknesse ago heart ease seen may hem please haue declared thee thou dread dout haue told thee faithfully thee may curen vtterly louers woll faithfull full stabilite good hope alway keepe thy side sweet thought make eke abide sweet looking sweet spech thine harmes shall lech euerie thou shalt haue great pleasaunce thou canst bide suffraunce serue well without fantise thou shalt quite thine emprise guerdoun thou liue time thee yeue god loue day taught ye haue heard say enformed compendously vanished away sodainly alone left soole full complaint doole saw man woundes greeued wondersly curen nothing knewe saue bothum bright hewe whereon sette holly thought comfort knew nought god loue knew nat else behoue might ease comfort gette would entermette roser withouten dout closed hedge without ye toforne haue heard saine fast besied would faine haue passed haie might haue getten sleight vnto bothum faire see euer dradde blamed bee men would haue suspection would entention haue stole rose therefore enter fere last bethought whether passe nought sawe come glad chere lustly bachelere good slature good height bialacoil forsooth height sonne curtesie graunted full gladly passage vtter hay sayd sir may passe bee fresh roser see ye sweet savour fele warrans may right wele thou thee keepe fro folly shall man doe thee villany may helpe ought shall faine dredeth nought bound seruise fully deuoid feintise vnto bialacoil sayd thanke sir full hartely behest take gree ye goodly profer mee commeth great fraunchise ye profer seruise full deliuerly breres anon went whereof encombred haie well pleased soth saie se bothum faire swote fresh sprong rote bialacoil serued wele nigh might fele bothum sweet odour lusty hewed colour churle foule betide beside rose gan hide keepe rose rosere name daungere churle hid greues couered grasse leues spie take fond vnto roser put hond soole mo two wicked manner euill fame one cleped name wicked tongue god yeve sorrow neither eue ne morrow man good speake many iust man doth wreake woman eke hight shame reckon right trespasse father name mother reason thus shame brought like two yet trespasse neuer ado reason ne neuer leie hidous vgly meane trespasse hight reason conceiueth sight shame spake aforne shame thus borne ordained chastite roser ladie bothums la sundrie folkes assailed ne wist venus assaileth night day stall bothoms rose reason prayeth chastite venus hath flemed ouer see daughter would lene keepe roser fresh grene anon reason chastite fully assented graunted request shame honest shall keeper roser thus keepe three none hardy ne bold young old againe away bere bothoms ne rose well sped awaited three seen bialacoil faire gracious debonaire quitte full courteously please bad draw bothom nere prease touch rosere bare rose yave leue graunt ne might little greue saw liked right nigh bothom pulled leafe grene yaue full nigh bothom sat ade leafe full queint felt acqueint bialacoil priue wende wext hardy tell bialacoil befell loue tooke wounded sayd sir mote thee may joy haue wise vpon side arise sith shall faine heart haue great paine great annoy affraie ne wotte shall saie drede wroth deserue leuer kniues kerue bodie peces small wise fall ye wrothed say boldly thy quoth nill wroth may nought thou shalt say sayd sir displease knowen great unease loue hath brought paine great disease thought fro day day doth drie supposeth sir lie fiue woundes make sore shall neuer slake ye bothom graunt passaunt beaute life death martire treasour desire bialacoil affraied sayd sir may fall ye desire may arise would ye shend wise mokell foole suffred away beare fresh bothom faire sight neither skill ne right roser ye broke rinde take rose aforne kinde ye courteous aske let still roser sit let grow till amended perfectly come beaute nolde pulled fro roser bere lefe dere anon start daungere place hidde malice chere kidde full great blacke hewe sturdy hidous knewe like sharpe vrchons haire grow eye red sparkling fire glow nose frounced full kirked stood come criand wood sayd bialacoil tell thou bringest hider boldly nigh rosere thou worchest wrong manere thinketh dishonour thee thou art well worthy haue maugre let rosere witte serueth felon euill quitte thou wouldest haue done great bounte shame would quite thee flye hence fellow rede thee go wanteth little woll thee slo bialacoil ne knew thee nought thee serue set thought thou wolt shame thou might againe reason right woll thee affie commest slightly tespie prooueth wonder wele thy sleight treason euerie dele durst make abode churle wode gan threat manace throught haie chace feare trembled quoke churlish head shoke sayd eft might take hand scape bialacoil fled mate soole disconsolate left alone paine thought fro shame death nigh brought thought high folly bodie vtterly yeue paine martire thereto great desire ne durst hay passe hope grace trow neuer man wist paine laced loues chaine ne man sooth loue anger loue holdeth hest right wele paine sayd fele heart may thinke tongue saine quarter woe paine might anger last mine heart point brast thought rose daunger cast fro long stoode state till sawe madde mate ladie high ward tower looked thiderward reason men clepe lady tower deliuerly come downe without neither young ne hore ne high ne low ne fat ne leane best meane eyen two clere light candle brenneth bright head croune see mede well high persoune round enuiron crounet full rich stone fret goodly semblaunt deuise trow made paradise nature neuer grace forge worke compace certain letter lye god himselfe hye made image yafe sith auantage hath might seignory keepe men folly woll trowe lore ne may offenden neuermore stoode darke pale reason began tale saied alhaile sweete frend folly childhood woll thee shend thee haue put great affraie thou hast bought dere time maie made thine heart merrie euill time thou wentest see gardin whereof idlenesse bare key maistresse thou yedest daunce acquaintaunce acquaintance perillous first soft noyous hath thee trashed without wene god loue thee sene ne idlenesse thee conuaid verge mirth pleid folly haue surprised thee recouered well ware take counsaile greeueth sore wise woll himselfe chastise though young man wise trespasse emong follie let tarie hastelie let amend mi eke counsaile thee iwis god love holly foryete hath thee paine sete thee heart tormenteth cannot seen thou maist go way thee garisoun daunger feloun fellie purposeth thee werreie full cruell sooth seie yet daunger cometh blame reward daughter shame hath rose ward may musard wicked tongue two suffreth man thider goe er thing doe shall commeth fortie place sought saie thing never done ne wrought much treason male falsenesse faine tale thou dealest angrie folke iwis wherefore thee better folke away fare woll make thee live care evill love call wherein folly love folly everie dell loveth wise may well ne set thought good werke schoole leseth clerke craft eke shall thrive therein love shall passioun monke hermite chanoun paine heard measure joy may eke endure possession much tribulation joy short lasting hap getting see many travaile last foule faile nothing thy counsailer thou made homager god love hastely wisedome folly thine heart jolly sage thou brought rage yeeld thee readyly love great maistrie rede thee love away drive maketh retch thy live folly fro day day shall growe thou put away take thy teeth bridle fast daunt thy heart eke cast thou mayest get defence redresse thy first offence heart alway woll leve shall finde emong shall greve heard thus chastise answeard full angrie wife prayed cesse speach either chastise teach bidde thought refrein love hath caught demein wene ye love woll consent assaieth bowe bent draw mine heart hond quickly bond ye counsaile may never bee first arested mee tooke mine heart sore till nothing tought obey sparred key pray let still ye may well ye wordes wast idlenesse utterly withouten gesse ye saine vaine lever die paine love ward arette falshed treason sette woll get pris blame love true save name chastiseth hate word reason went gate saw sermoning might fro folly bring dismayed left soole forwearie forwandred foole ne knew ne cherisaunce fell remembraunce love bad purvey fellow whome might sey counsaile privite much auaile bethought fellow fast true siker courteous hend called name frend true fellow none hast went anone woe told fro right nought would withhold told without made complaint daungere sey hidous ward contrarious cruelte point meimed bialacoil sey within gardin walke pley fro made goe left alone woe durst longer speake daunger sayd would wreake saw went fresh bothum hent hardie come nere betweene haie rosere friend wist thought discomforted right nought saied fellow nat madde ne abashed bestadde selfe know full well daungere fierce chere prime temp love manace full oft beene case felon first though thou shalt souple see long passed knew wele vngodly first though men fele woll meeke bearing seruice obeissing shall thee tell thou shalt meekely rede thou go heart pray specially thy trespace haue mercy hote well please thou shalt neuer displease best serue flattery shall please daunger vtterly friend hath saied wele easeli hath somedele eke allegged tourment hardement againe daunger go preue might meeke daunger came ashamed aforne blamed desiring pea wo ouer hedge durst go forbode passage found cruell rage hond great bourdoun kneeled low adoun full meeke port simple chere saied sir comen onely aske mercy greeueth full greatly euer life wrathed amend come might loud still doen right owne loue made haue trespassed hiderto fro ne may withdraw mine hart yet shall neuer ioy ne smart befall good ill offend againe leuer haue endure disease doe displease iyou require pray ye haue mercy pite stint ire greueth woll sweare euermo redressed liking trespace thing saue pray thee graunt thing may nat warned may loue onely none thing aske shall doen ywis grace ye graunt ye may letten mee well wote ye loue free shall louen euer like well ill yet ne would fraunce doe thing doe displeasaunce daunger fell entent foryeue male talent wrath yet last hath released praide fast shortly saied thy request mockell dishonest ne woll werne thee yet nothing engreeueth mee though thou loue thus euermore neither soft ne sore loue thee list retcheth ferre fro rose trust none assaie time passe haie thus hath graunted prayere went forth withouten vnto friend told right ioyfull tale saied goeth well thine affaire shall thee debonaire though aforne dispitous shall hereafter gracious touched good veine yet rewen thy peine suffer rede boast make till thou good me maist take suffraunce word soft man may ouercome oft aforne drede bookes soothly rede thus hath friend great comfort auaunced high disport would good much anon full sodainely tooke leave streight went vnto hay great talent seene fresh bothom wherein lay saluation daunger tooke keepe keepe couenaunt truely sore drede manasing durst breake bidding least shent brake commaundement purchase good come till mercy ferre behind kept ne might find complained sighed sore languished euermore durst nat ouergo vnto rose loued throughout deming vtterly knowledge certainly loue ladde wise feintise falshood ne trecherie yet full villanie disdaine crueltie ne would haue pitie cruell refraine tho wept alway complaine turment come grace god sent fraunchise pity fulfilde bothum bounty go daunger anon right ferther might helpe word deed well saw need first grace dame fraunchise hath taken emprise saied daunger great wrong ye worche man much wo pinen angerly great villauy cannot see ne hath trespassed againe saue loveth wherefore ye shold charitie hold force love maketh would blame amis leueth may paine hard ye may see lo love wise would consent ye power repent though quicke ye would slo fro love heart may nat go sweet sir ease anger disease ala may auaunce doen great greauaunce worship againe take man werre make sith lowly euery wise ready ye lust deuise love caught laas beie euery caas subject ye therefore willen ill ye spare proud stout courtesie would ye succoure hem meeke vnder cure hart hard woll meeke men meekenesse beseeke certaine saied pitie see oft humilitie ire also felonie venquisheth also malanchollie stond forth duresse crueltie wickednesse wherefore pray sir daungere maintaine lenger cruell warre againe man wholly euer ye worchen wo vpon caitife languisheth woll trespace put wholly grace offence ne lite god love wite thrall greatly ye harme ye doen amis hath full hard pennaunce sith ye reft thaquaintaunce bialacoil joy paine might acoy annoyed sore ye doubled well blisse hath full bare sith bialacoil fro fare love hath great distresse hath need duresse voided ire rede ye may winnen dede maketh bialacoil repaire againe haveth pitie vpon paine fraunchise woll pite mercifull ye sith accorde vpon misericorde pray eke moneste nought refusen requeste hard fell thought v two woll doe right nought daunger ne might endure meeked vnto measure woll wise saieth daungere denie ye asked great vncourtesie woll ye companie bialacoil ye deuise woll let wise bialacoil went hie fraunchise saied full curteslie ye long deignous vnto lover daungerous withdraw presence hath great offence ye would vpon see wherefore sorrowfull man hee shape ye pay please love ye woll ease fulfill sith ye know daunger daunted brought low helpe pite dare afterde shall doe right ye saieth bialacoil skill sith daunger woll fraunchise hath sent bialacoil beginning salued comming straungenesse seene ne wrathed faire semblaunt shewed goodly aforne hond without dout within haie right lad right good chere enuiron vergere daungere chased fro leave ouer go raised deuise fro hell vnto paradise thus bialacoil gentlenesse paine businesse hath shewed onely grace efters swote place saw rose nigh greater woxen high fresh roddy faire hew colour euer iliche new long seene saw leaues greene rose spread spannishing seene goodly thing ne sprede brede men within might know sede couert close leaf rose stalke euen grene vpright thereon goodly sight well better without wene seed sene full faire sprad god blesse another gesse aforne ne ne vermaile abawed maruaile euer fairer bounden loues laas long abode sooth say till bialacoil gan pray saw wise warnen seruise would graunt thing remember well sitting saine grace would yeue leisure space desirous haue kissing precious goodly fresh rose sweetly smelleth nose displeased nought woll gladly haue sought haue kisse thereof freely yeft certainely woll none haue leue loth greue saied friend god spede chastitie haue drede thou shouldest warned dare chastite againe dare mi alway biddeth yeue louer leaue kisse thereto may winnen iwisse surplus praie may liue hope get day kissing may attaine loues paine hath sooth saine best auenaunt earnest remenaunt answere sighed sore durst assay tho drede greve aye man much assaye chafe friend measure put life auenture man first stroke ne may fell downe oke reisins haue wine till grape ripe well fine empressed ensure drawen pressure forpeined wonder strong though abode right long kisse paine wo sith kisse desired till renning distresse come venus goddesse aye werrieth chastite came grace succour whose might know ferre wide mother cupide god loue blind stone helpeth louers many one lady brought right hond brenning fire blasing brond whereof flame hote fire hath many lady desire loue brought sore hette seruice heart sette lady good entaile right wonderfull apparaile attire bright shene men might perceiue well sene religioun nill make mentioun robe treasour broche neither rich attour ne girdle side nill long abide knoweth well certainely arraied richely deuoid pride certaine bialacoil went apaas shortely clause said sir cause ye ben port daungerous vnto louer dainous graunt nothing kisse warne ye done amisse sith well ye wot hee loues seruaunt ye may see hath beautie worthy loue haue blis seemely behold see faire free swote debonaire age young lusty faire lady hautaine duchesse countesse ne chastelaine nolde hold vngodly refuse vtterly breath also good swete eke lip roddy mete onely plaine kisse graunt kisse gentlenisse teeth arne also white clene thinketh wrong withouten wene ye warne trusteth graunt kisse haue lasse ye helpe ye hast time shull ye wast flame brond venus brought right hond bialacoil hete smete anone withouten lete graunt rose kisse paine gan lisse rose anon went kissed full faithfully need man aske blith sauour soft lith stroke mine heart without allegged sore full joy blisse faire floure kisse swote sauerous might anguishous mote glad jolly remembre yet euer among soothly saine suffer noie much paine see may neuer still little wind ouer whelme tourne also wood wawes go calme trouble soone mote follow chaunge moone right fareth love selde one holdeth anker right anone ease wene best live ben tempest fordriue serueth loue tell wo stoundmele joy mote ouergo hurteth cureth selde point love endureth right proceed shame gan meddle take heed fell anger hade strong wall made castle brede length god love wan strength romance set thing ne let liking floure beaute may best labour quite love shall endite wicked tongue couine euery lover deuine worst addeth somdele wicked tongue saith neuer wele ward bare right great hate espying early late till hath seene great chere bialacoil ifere might tongue withstond worse report fond full cursed rage sat wele linage irous woman bare tongue filed sharpe square poiguaunt right keruing wonder bitter speaking gan espy swore affirming sikerly betweene bialacoil euill acquaintaunce priue spake thereof folilie awaked ielousie afraied rising heard iangling ran anon wood bialacoil stood leuer caas haue ben reines amia fote hote fellonie thus said ielousie hast thou ben negligent keepen absent verger left thy ward thou haddest regard trust thy confusion thus suspection haue right great nede well shewed dede great fault thee found god anon thou shalt bound fast locken toure without refuite succoure shame long hath thee fro ouersoone ago thou hast lost drede fere seemed well busie wise keepe thee chastise helpen chastite keepe roser thinketh boy knaue boldly ne hardy verge game turneth great shame bialacoil nist say full faine would fled away feare hid nere suddainly tooke saw ielousie take v two astonied knew rede fied away drede shame came forth full simply wend trespaced full greatly humble port made simple wearing vaile stede wimple nonnes done abbey heart affray gan speake within throw ielousie right wonder low first grace besought said sir ne leueth nought wicked tongue false espie glad faine lie hath made flattering bialacoil false leasing falsenesse anew long knew first daie wicked tongue hath custome aie young folkes bewrie false lesings hem lie yet neuerthelesse see among soigne long bialacoil heart lure love seruice endure drawing folke hath nothing foothnesse trow nought bialacoil euer thought trespace villanie mother curtesie hath taught euer good acquaintaunce priue loveth none heauinesse mirth play gladnesse hateth trechous soleine folke enuious ye weten woll euer glad joyfull honestly folke pley negligent good fey chastise therefore heart crie mercy haue ben recheles tamen withouten lee folly repent woll hole set mine entent keepe low still bialacoil shame shame said ielousy bitrashed great drede haue lecherie hath clombe hie almost bleared mine eie wonder drede haue ouer reigneth lechery whose might groweth night dey cloyster abbey chastitie werried ouer therefore woll siker wall close rose rosere long manere left hem vnclosed wilfully wherefore right inwardly sorrowfull repent shall lenger vnclosed yet drede sore shall repent ferthermore game goeth amis counsaile must new ywis haue long trusted thee shall lenger bee may best euery cost deceiue men tresten see well nigh shent set full entent remedy puruey wherefore close shall wey hem woll rose espie come wait villonie good faith trouth woll let slouth liue sikernesse make anon fortresse close rose good sauour middes shall make tour put bialacoil prison forever drede treason trow shall keepe shall might go make companie hem thinke villanie ne hath ben aforne found good chere han assailed shend trowandise blend foole eith beguile may liue little shall forthinke faire semblaunt word came drede auaunt abashed great fere wist ielousie drede affray word durst say quaking stood full still alone till ielousie way gone saue shame forsoke drede full sore quoke last drede abraide cousin shame saide shame said soothfastnesse great heauinesse noise ferre go slaunder v two sith befall may againe call sprung fame many yeare withouten blame haue ben many day many aprill many may han passed ashamed till ielousie hath v blamed mistrust suspection causelesse without encheson go daunger hastely let v shew openly hath aright wrought set thought keepe better purprise wise hath v great wrong hath suffred long bialacoil lustes fulfill must amend vtterly el shall villanously exiled lond warre may withstond ielousie greefe sith bialacoil mischeefe daunger shame drede anon right way ben gon chorle found hem aforne ligging vnder hawthorne vnder head pillow stede trusse gras slombred nappe toke till shame pitously shoke great manace gan make sleepest thou thou wake qd shame thou dost v villanie trusteth thee doth follie keepe rose bothums faire season thou art woxe familiere thou straunge chere stout thy port ready greue thou doest great folly leue bialacoil call yonger man shenden v though thou sleepe may ielousie great noise art thou late rise vp hye stop soone deliuerlye gap hay fauour thee pray falleth nothing thy name make fair semblant thou maist blame bialacoil sweet free dogged fell thou shouldest bee froward outragious iwis chorle chaungeth curteis haue heard oft saying man may daunting make sperhauke bosarde men hold thee musarde debonaire haue founden thee sitteth thee nought curteis bee doe men pleasaunce seruise thee recreaundise let thy werkes ferre nere like thy name daungere akashed shewing anon spake drede right thus saying said daunger drede thou ne wolt besie keepe thou hast keepe thou shouldest wake thou art asleepe thou shalt greeued certainely thee aspie ielousy find thee blame hath assailed shame chased away great manace bialacoil place sweareth shortly shall enclose sturdy wall thy wickednesse thee faileth straungenesse thine heart trow failed thou shalt repent speciall ielousie sooth knew thou shalt forthinke sore rew chorle clubbe gan shake frouning eyen gan make hidous chere man rage ire brent visage heard blamed said witte go discomfite haue great wrong certes haue liued long sith may closer keepe quicke would doluen deepe man shall repaire garden foule faire mine heart ire gothe afere let entre haue doe folly see shall amended setteth foot truly shall repent sore man place enter shall haue grace lever swerds twaine throughout mine heart every vaine perced many wound slouth sound henceforth night day shall defend may withouten exception manner condition man graunt holdeth recreaunt daunger foot gan stond hent burdon hond wroth ire ne left nought verger hath sought might find hole trace mote forth pace gappe close man might touch rose roser shetteth euery man without thus day day daunger wers wonderfull diuers feller eke euer full oft sing ala ne may nought ire recouer desire mine heart ala woil brest two bialacoil wrathed certainly euery member quake remember bothum would full oft day seene behold thinke vpon kisse much ioy blisse sauour swete want grone grete thinketh fele yet nose sweet sauour rose wote mote go ferre fresh floures fro full welcome death absence thereof ala sleath whylome rose ala touched nose mouth face death must abide loue consent another tide one touch may kisse trow paine shall neuer lisse thereon couetise brent heart many wise shall repaire againe sighing long watch night sleeping thought wishing turment wo many turning fro halfe paine cannot tell fallen hell paradise wealth turment greueth annoyeth bitternesse toforne haue felt sweetnesse wicked tongue falshede causeth wo drede lieth pitous charge tongue large time shortly tell something ielousie great suspection left mason stone could lay ne querrour hired hem make tour first rose keepe hem made ditch deepe right wonder large also brode vpon also stode squared stone sturdy wall cragge founded right great thicknesse eke bare founded square hundred fadome euery side liche long wide least time assailed full well battailed round enuiron eke set full many rich faire tournet euery corner wall set tour full principall eueriche without fable portcullise defensable keepe enemy greue force would preue eke amidde purprise made tour great maistrise fairer saugh man sight large wide great might dradde none assaut ginne gonne skaffaut temprure mortere made liquour wonder dere quicke lime persaunt egre tempred vinegre stone hard adamaunt whereof made foundemaunt toure round made compas world richer ne better ordained therewithall tour made wall betwixt tour rose set sweet sauour many rose bere eke within castle springolds gonne bowes archer eke corner men seine ouer wall stond great engins nere hond kernel arblasters great plentie none armour might stroke withstond folly prease hond without ditch listes made wall battaited large brade men horse attaine nigh ditche ouer plaine thus ielousie hath enuiron sette garnison wals round diche deepe onely roser keepe daunger early late keyes kept vtter gate opened toward east least thirtie seruaunts echone name gate kept shame opened couth toward part south sergeaunts assigned full many drede baillie keeping constablerie toward north vnderstond opened vpon left hond nothing may sure doe busie cure early morrow also late strongly shette barre gate euery thing may see drede aferde bee puffe little wind drede astonied mind therefore stealing rose rede nat yate vnclose foules flight would make flee eke shaddow see wicked tongue full enuie souldiers normandie causeth debate keeper fourth gate also tother three went full oft see lotte walke night instrument would dight blow make soune ofter hath enchesoune walken oft vpon wall corner wickettes ouer full narrow searchen espie though nought fond yet would lie discordaunt euer fro armonie dissoned melodie controue would foule faile hornepipes cornewaile floites made discordaunce musicke mischaunce would seine note new fond woman trew ne saw neuer life vnto husbond trew wife ne none full honeste nill laugh merry heareth may espie man speaken lecherie eueriche hem hath vice one dishonest another nice one full villanie another hath licorous eie one full wantonnesse another chideresse thus wicked tong god yeue shame put hem euerichone blame without desert causelesse lieth though ben guiltlesse pity seene sorrow waketh euen morrow innocent doth greuaunce pray god yeue euill chaunce euer busie woman seine amis eke ielousie god confound hath made toure round made garison sette bialacoil prison shette tour full long hold soiour liue pennaunce greuaunce hath ordained ielousie old vecke spie manner gouernaunce deuill enfaunce learned loues art plais tooke part except seruise knew wrenche euery gise loue euery wile hard beguile bialacoil tooke aye hede euer liueth wo drede kept coy eke priue least see folly countenance knew old daunce ielousie bialacoil baillie shette vp free sure would bee trusteth sore castell strong werke liketh well dradde nat glotons steale rose bothoms rose assured defenced strong wall iealousie full well may drede deuoid liberte whether sleepe wake rose may none take bvt ala mourne shall without wall full much dole mone made wist wo hade trow would haue pite loue deare sold good loue went queintly doubling paine see woll sell againe new bargaine lere dere sollace haue lorne neuer aforne certaine full like indeed cast earth seed hath ioy new springing greeneth ginning also faire fresh flour lustie seene swote odour ere sheues shere may fall weather shall dere make fade fall stalke greine floures tiller fordone hope soone drede certaine fare hope trauaile sikerly ben beraft storme floure nill seden corne loue hath auaunced began priuite bialacoil tell ne found froward ne fell tooke agree whole play loue hard assay one reued weent best abouen haue loue fortune chaungeth oft nill contune whylome woll folke smile glombe hem another friend foe shalt feele twinckling tourneth wheele writhe head away concourse play areise doeth mourne whirle adoune ouertourne sitteth highest lust foole woll trust come doun charge reuolutioun sith bialacoil mote fro twin shette prison yonde within absence mine heart fele ioy mine hele rose doeth close open may see loue woll cured bee paine endure cruell auenture ah bialacoil mine owne dere though thou prisonere keepe least thine heart suffer daunted ne let iealousie rage putten thine heart seruage although chastice thee without make thy bodie vnto lout haue heart hard diamaunt stedfast naught pliaunt prison though thy bodie bee large keepe thine heart free true heart plie mannace may drie ielousie doeth thee paine quite thus againe venge thee least thought way thou maiest nought wise subtelly worch winne maistrie yet great affray least thou doe nat say drede thou canst great maugre thou emprisoned art nat trespas neuer discouered yet thing ought secre well annoy thee mischaunce endure hard pennaunce saine thinke sorrow almost sinke remember wo full nigh witte go inward mine heart feele blede comfortlesse death drede owe nat well haue distresse false wickednesse traitours arne enviours noien coragious ah bialacoil full well see hem shape deceiue thee make thee buxum law cord thee draw hem lust right drede haue thee brought theretill without comfort thought sleath game would bring death good lese mote dead may chese thou foryete mine heart shall neuer liking elswhere find sollace put grace shall neuer ben hope fall wanhope ala wanhope nay parde woll neuer dispaired hope faile vngracious vnworthy hope woll comforted loue betaught saied hope go aye relees wo bale bete curteis swete nothing full certaine louers put full great paine maketh hem wo dele faire beheste deceiueth fele woll behote sikerly failen vtterly ah full noyous thing many louer louing hangeth upon trusteth fast lese trauaile last thing commen wot right nought therefore wisely sought counsaile follie take many time woll make full good sillogisme drede afterward shall indede follow euill conclusion put confusion many time haue seene many haue beguiled beene trust haue set hope fell hem afterward slope bvt nathelesse yet gladly would woll hold time purpose clere without deceit desireth sikerly blamed folly auaileth good ne may staunch stound ill helpeth little may take behest vnto wo heste certaine wise without ifete preise heste deed asunder vary doen great contrary thus posted vp doun dole thought confusioun disease number daunger shame encumber drede also ielousie wicked tongue full enuie sharpe cruell ire full oft put great martire haue ioy fully let sith bialacoil haue beshet fro prison wickedly loue entierly woll bane bee sooner may see yet moreouer worst set keepe foule befall rimpled vecke ferre ronne rage frouning yellow visage await lieth day night none may haue sight mote sorrow enforced full sooth loue yafe three wonder yefts grace haue lorne place sith ne may without drede helpen little taketh hede auaileth sweet thought sweet speech helpeth right nought third called sweet looking lorne without lesing yefts faire nat thy helpe simply bialacoil loosed bee gone large free life lieth dout come rather ala trow woll nat beene euermore seene may nat wrong toure strong whose prowesse strong forteresse certaine nill god wote haue thereto well wote rage loue homage cause soothfastnesse selfe dame idlenesse conueide faire praiers enter faire vergere blame leue doeth sore greue fooles word nought trow ne worth apple low men hem snibbe bitterly prime temp folly foole leued right nought releued accomplished greueth wonder ill reason saied fall foole selfe may well call loue aside laied trowed dame reason saied reason skill right blamed might meddle loue hath shent certaine woll repent repent nay parde false traitour deuils engins would take love would forsake bialacoil falsly betray mischeefe hate nay sith courtesie
