prison ielousie courtesie certaine much may yolden haie passen lete kisse rose faire swete therefore conne maugre nay certainely shall nat love shall neuer yeue god word offence complaint lesse neither hope idlenesse certes wrong hated hem courtesie el suffer thinke waken winke abide hope till loue chaunce send succour allegeaunce expectaunt aye till may mete getten mercie swete whilome thinke love mee saied would take gree seruice vnpatience caused doen offence saied thanke shall take high maister eke thee make wickednesse ne reue thee soone trow shall nat bee word seemed loved truely serue wele thinke thanke fele good mine harme lithe hole love may defaut true love ne failed neuer man soothly faute mote need god forbide found commeth cannot see let gone may go whether love woll succour slo may hole sore bound till seruice may flene life death withouten wene hand may nat chese may doe winne lese sith sore doth greue yet lust would acheue bialacoil goodly yeue force fell though die mote nede pray love goodlyhede bialacoil doe gentlenesse liue distresse mote dien penaunce first without repentaunce woll confesse good entent make hast testament louers doen feelen smart bialacoil leaue mine heart hole without departing doublenesse repenting pcoment raison vient lamant thus made passage complaint cruell rage finde leche couth vnto mine helping eche suddainely againe comen doun toure saw reasoun discreet wise full pleasaunt port full auenaunt right way tooke stood great perplexite poshed euery side nist might abide till demurely sad chere saied came nere mine owne friend art thou greued quarrell yet atcheued love side anone tell hast thou yet love thy fill art thou nat wearie thy seruice thee hath wise joy hast thou thy louing sweet bitter thing canst thou yet chese let see best thy succour might bee thou seruest full noble lord maketh thee thrall thy reward aye reneweth thy tourment folly hath thee blent thou fell mischeefe thilke day thou diddest sooth say obeisaunce eke homage thou wroughtest nothing sage thou became liege man thou diddest great follie thou wistest nat fell thereto lord thou haddest thou haddest well know thou haddest nought brought low thou wist thou noldest serue halfe yere nat weeke halfe day ne yet houre without delay ne neuer iloved paramour lordship full shours knowest ought lamaunt ye dame parde raisoun nay nay lamaunt yes raisoun wherefore let see lamaunt saied glad haue lord maister seignorie raisoun knowest lamaunt nay certes saue yafe rule went way nist abode bound ballaunce lo noble cognisaunce praisoun bvt woll thou know ginning end sith thou art anguishous mate disfigured astate may wreche haue wo ne caitife none enduren euery man sitting lord haue knowledging thou knew dout lightly thou shouldest scapen thy prison marreth thee plamaunt yea dame sith lord hee man made mine hond would right faine vnderstond know kind would enforme praisoun would saied reason thee lere sith thou learne hast desire shew thee withouten fable thing demonstrable thou shalt withouten science know withouten experience thing may knowen bee ne wist ne shewed degree thou maiest sooth witten though thee written thou shalt know thereof thou art ruled lore vnto loue woll flie knotte may vnlosed hath thee found long knitte unbound set well thine entention heare loue description loue hatefull pee free acquitaunce without relees fret full falshede sikernesse set drede heart despairing hope full hope wanhope wise woodnesse void reasoun sweet perill droun heauie burthen light beare wicked wawe away weare caribdes perillous disagreeable gracious discordaunce accord accordaunce discord conning without science wisedome without sapience witte without discretion hauoire without possession like heale hole sickenesse trust drowned dronkennesse health full maladie charitie full enuie anger full aboundance greedie suffisaunce delight right full heauinesse dreried full gladnesse bitter sweetnesse sweet errour right euill sauoured good sauour sin pardon hath within pardon spotted without sin palne also ioyous fellonie right pitous also play selde stable stedfast right meuable strength weiked stond vpright feeblenesse full might witte unauised sage follie ioy full tourmentrie laughter weeping aie rest trauaileth night daie also sweete hell sorrowfull paradis pleasaunt gaile easie prisoun full frost summer seasoun prime temp full frostes white maie deuoid delite seer braunches blossom vngrene new fruit filled winter tene slowe may nat forbeare ragges ribaned gold weare also well woll loue sette vnder ragges rich rotchette eke well amorettes mourning blacke bright burnettes none mokell prise ne man founden wise ne none high parage ne manne found witte sage man hardie ne wight ne man mokell might none fulfilled bounte loue may daunted world holdeth way loue maketh gone misway euill life genius cursed man wife wrongly werke againe nature none loue ne haue cure loues seruaunts beene woll nat counsaile fleene ne preise louing wherethrough man last ending shall call hem wretch full wo loue greueth hem shendeth thou wolt well loue eschew escape mew make whole sorrow slake better counsaile maiest thou take thinke fleen well iwis may nought helpe el wit thou thou flye shall flye thee follow followen shall thee plamaunt heard reason sain spilt speech vain dame sayd dare well say auaunt well may schoole deuiaunt neuer auaunt right nought doctrine dull vnder discipline wote wist euer contrarie fer euerie thing ye lere yet partuere mine heart foyeteth thereof right nought writen thought deepe grauen tender heart render rede ouer communely selfe lewdest bvt sith ye love discriuen lacke preise two defineth letter may thinke better heard neuer defined wilfully would lere love searched well sought sickenesse thought annexed knedde betwixt tweine male female cheine freely bindeth nill twinne wheder thereof lese winne roote springeth hot brenning disordinate desiring kissen embrace lust solace thing love retcheth nought setteth heart thought delectatioun procreatioun fruit engendrure love god pleasure body fruit get yeue force set vpon delight play fere also manere fainen hem love seke love preise leke paramour doe faine love truely disdaine falsen lady traitorously swerne hem othes vtterly many leasing many fable finden deceiuable han lust getten hote erne foryetten woman harme buyen full sore men thus thinke euermore lasse harme mote thee deceiue deceiued namely ne may find none meane way wote well soothfastnesse doeth businesse woman dele lust may fele engendru e doth trespasse ensure setten getten likely thing till sustaine might keepe forth kindes right owne likenesse semblable corrumpable faile succession ne generation sectes sterne saue father mother arne graue child dead full diligent stead vse worke wise one may another rise therefore set kinde therein delight men therein hem delight deed erke oft sithes haunt werke none would draw thereof draught ne delight hath hem caught subtill dame nature none goeth right thee ensure ne hath entent hoole ne perfite desire delite fortened crease eke play love oft seeke thrall hem selfe nice vnto prince euerie vice sinne roote vnlefull lust though soote euill racine tullius determine time full sage booke made age praiseth elde though crooked vnwelde commendatioun youth discriptioun youth set man wife perill soule life perill men grace perill youth pace without death distresse full wildnesse oft doeth shame domage linage leadeth man vp doun mokell dissolutioun maketh love euill companie lead life disrulilie halt payd none estate within himselfe debate chaungeth purpose entent yalt couent liuen emprise leeseth freedome fraunchise nature set againe may get make mansion abide profession though time heart absent may faile shall repent eke abide thilke day leaue abite gone way leaseth worship name dare come againe shame life doth mourne dare home retourne freedome kinde lost hath neuer may recured god graunt grace may er hence pace conteine vnder obedience vertue patience youth set man follie vnthrift ribaudrie lecherie outrage oft chaungeth courage youth ginneth oft bargaine may end without paine great perill set youth hede delight doeth bridell lede delight hangeth drede thee nought mannes bodie thought onely youthes chambere doen evill customere naught else taketh hede onely folly lede disport wildenesse froward sadnesse elde draweth hem therefro wote may well go mo arne old whilom youth hold yet remembreth tender age brought many rage many follie therein wrought elde hath sought repent hem follie youth hem put jeopardie perill much woe made hem oft amisse doe sewen evill companie riot advoutrie bvt elde gan againe restraine follie refraine set men ordinaunce good rule governaunce evil spendeth servise man woll love neither preise hated wote wele acquaintance would man fele ne han elde companie men hate alie man would becommen old ne die young bold elde maruaileth right greatly remember hem inwardly many perillous emprise wrought sundry wise however might without blame escape away without shame youth without domage reprefe linage losse member shedding blood perill death losse good wost thou nat youth abit men preisen wit delight halt sojour dwellen tour long youth season dwellen one mansion delight youth woll servise doe woll devise youth readie evermore obey smert sore vnto delight yeve servise may live elde abitte woll thee tell shortly dwell thider behoveth thee go death youth thee slo journey thou mayst faile labour trauaile lodged keen sorrow wo never court go paine distresse sickenesse ire melancholly angrie sire ben pale senatours groning grutching herbegeours day night tourment cruell death present tellen erltch late death stondeth armed gate bring remembraunce folly deedes enfaunce causen mourne wo youth hath beguiled sodainly away ha ted weeped time hath wasted complaining preteritte present nat abitte old vanitee aforne may see future succour leggen dolour graunt time repentaunce sinnes doe penaunce last gouerne winne joy eterne fro goe backeward youth made vanitie drowne wade present time abideth nought swift thought little doth endure ni compt ne measure ever game go list love joy mirth also love hie low fruite hem delite part may else quite save hem selfe honeste yet full many one see woman soothly saine desire would faine play love wilde covet go childe childe perchaunce woll hold great mischaunce whatsoever woe fele woll plaine concele foole nice whome shame hath justice delight eachone draw haunt worke hie law save arne worth right nought money woll bought love preise wise given covetise praise woman though wood yeveth selfe good little man tell bodie sell maid wife quicke woll sell life faire chere ever make wretch undertake loved one sweete soure though called paramoure laugheth maketh feast certainly beast loved worthy beare name drury none please wer wood woll dispoile good yet nathelesse woll say solace play may iewell thing take love free yeving aske wise drede shame covetise may certaine without slaunder yeven againe joyne heart togither love take yeve also trow hem twinne love sinne woll together go done han ado curtes debonaire love beren hem faire without vice alway honeste fro folly love keepe hem clere brenneth herts fere love wise devoide covetise good love engendred true heart secree set thought lust else nought caught love lace truly bodily solace fleshly delight present thee set thine entent without glose get rose maketh thee mate wood thou desirest none good thou art inch nerre ever abidest sorrow werre thy face seene maketh thee pale leene thy might thy vertue goeth away sorry guest good fay thou harbourest thine inne god love thou let inne wherefore read thou shette shall greve thee dout thy profite woll tourne thee sojourne great mischiefe sorrow sonken ben heart love arne dronken thou peraventure knowen shall thou hast lost time spent thy thought idlenesse wast wofull lustinesse thou maiest live time see love delivered bee thy time thou shalt beweepe sore never thou mayest restore time lost men may see nothing may recovered bee thou scape yet last fro love hath thee fast knitte bounden lace certaine hold grace many one seine lost spent also veine servise without succour bodie soule good treasour wit strength eke richesse never redresse plamant thus taught preached hath reason love spilt sermon imped thought doctrine set nought yet ne sayd never dele ne understood wele word word matter unto love thrall calleth praie chaseth thought aie holdeth mine heart sele trustie true stele devotion ne sermon dame reason ne rede tooke soiour mine hede yede one ere lere fully lost lore speech greeved wonder sore unto ire said anger abraid dame algate love hate men ye teach doe speach sith seine love good must need say mood leve hatred aie liven void love awaie sinfull wretch hated tetch may go none gate either must love hate hate men new love woll rew preching seemeth mee love nothing ne praiseth thee ye yeve good counsaile sikerly precheth day loues lore alowe foole woulde trowe speech also ye han taught another love knowne naught heard repreve love leve ye would diffine mee would gladly see least may lere sundrie love manere praison certes friend foole art thou thou nothing wilt allow thy profite say yet woll say thee fay readie leest accomplish thy request woll auaile vaine perauenture shall trauaile loue sundrie wise shall thee deuise loue lefull good meane maketh thee wood bringeth thee many fitte rauisheth fro thee thy witte maruailous queint loue aquaint pcomment raison diffinist aunsete loue frendship also maketh man done amis knitte betwixt two woll breake wele ne wo long likely continue good commune grounded god ordinaunce hoole without discordaunce hem holding commaunce good charite none exceptioun chaunging ententioun helpe need wisely hele word dede true meaning deuoide slouth wit nought without trouth tone dare thought saine friend spare nought himselfe without dreding discouered wreiyng glad coniunction none suspection would proue true perfite loue man may amiable firme stable fortune change ne blinde friend alway finde poore rich state friend gate w complaine pouerte bide long till helping require good deed done praiere sold bought deere iwis heart great valour heart fulfilled gentlenesse euill demeane distresse man worthy name asken often hath great shame good man brenneth thought shame asketh ought hath great thought dredeth aie disease shall praie friend least warned till preue stabilitie hath founden one trustie true stone assayed found stedfast wall frendship certaine shall shew ioy paine dare thinke say without shame may ashamed one told thee wote secret thought third shall know thereof right nought twey number et three euerie counsaile secree repreue dredeth neuer dele beset wordes wele euerie wise man drede keepe tongue till see nede fooles cannot hold tongue fooles bell soone ronge yet shall true friend doe helpe fellow sore succour hath need may done indeed gladder pleaseth fellow easeth doe request shall much molest fellow maie fulfill volunte fully hath required heart loue hath fired ioy woe shall depart take euenly part halfe annoy shall haue aie comfort may blisse part shall loue woll departed whilom vnitie spake tullius ditie maken request vnto friend honest goodly fulfill skill otherwise graunt thereto except onely cause two men friend death would driue let busie saue liue also men wollen hem assaile worship make faile hindren renoun let full ententioun deuer done degree friend ne shamed two case might taking keepe skill right farre loue may excuse ought man refuse loue haue told thee nothing contrarie mee woll thou follow wele leaue euerie dele loue vertue attendeth tother fooles blent shendeth another love also contrarie vnto desire constrained fained away fro trouth doth varie good love contrarie maymeth wise sicke heart couetise winning profite love setteth delite love hangeth balaunce lese hope perchaunce lucre set vpon woll falle quench anon man may amorous ne liuing vertuous love mood men hem selfe good loue profite doth abide false bideth tide love commeth dame fortune little woll contune shall chaungen wonder soone take eclips moone v let earth betwixt set sunne may fall partie shadow maketh beames merke horne shew derke part hath lost light phebus fully sight till shadow ouerpast enlumined againe fast brightnesse sun beames yeueth hem againe leames love right nature faire obscure bright clipsy manere whilom dimme whilom clere assoone pouerte ginneth take mantell weedes blake hideth love light away night tourneth day may see richesse shine till blacke shadowes fine richesse shineth bright love recouereth ayen light faileth woll flit greeueth greeueth love heare saie rich men loved aie namely tho sparand beene woll wash heart cleene filth ice greedy brenning auarice rich man full fond iwis weneth loved heart vnderstood good may well weten thought good loved right nought niggard eke men would set leke haten sooth lo profite cattell dooth euerie man may see getteth nought enmitee amend himselfe vice know himselfe wise certes aye friendly get love also free else wise ne sage gote ramage loueth deede proueth richesse well loueth woll hide aie spare poore friend seene forfare keepen aie purpose till drede eyen close till wicked death take leuer asunder shake let limmes asunder riue leaue richesse liue thinketh part man certaine love love heart pite trespasseth well wate man knoweth estate well ought reproued loveth nought ne loved sith arne fortune comen hath sermon nomen wonder tell thee thou hardest neuer one trow thou leuen shall though soothfastnesse written sooth vnto men profite dooth froward fortune contraire swote debonaire thinke doutable argument prouable debonaire soft falseth beguileth oft lich mother cherish milken doth norice good deles yeueth part iweles great rich dignitie hem hoteth stabilitie state stable changing aie variable feedeth glorie vaine worldly blisse none certaine setteth whele wene right wele stable state withall neuer wene fall set high wene certainte heartly friend great numbre nothing might state encombre trust hem euerie side wening hem would abide euerie perill mischaunce without chaunge variaunce cattell good also spend blood member spill onely fulfill maken whole many wise hoten hem full servise sore doe hem smert naked shert heart also hole yeve time may live flatterie maken fooles glorifie wordes speaking han rejoysing trow hem evangile falshede gile shall afterward see arne full poverte ben good cattell bare seene friend ware hundred certainly thousand full scarcely ne shall finde unnethes one povertie commen upon thus fortune tell men lust dwell maketh hem lese conisaunce nourisheth hem ignoraunce froward fortune perverse high estate doth reverse maketh hem tumble doune whele sodaine tourne richesse doth hem flie plungeth hem povertie stepmother envious layeth plaister dolorous vnto heart wounded egre tempered vinegre povertie indigence shew experience fortune verilie whome man affie yeftes fiaunce full variaunce thus maken hye lowe richesse arne throwe fully knowen without friend effect friend chere love true stable also variable fortune goddesse povertie either richesse yeveth drede vnhappe beareth indeede infortune let one friend fortune gone meane tho friend woll fle anone entreth poverte yet woll leave hem place go call hem wretch scorne blame mishappe hem diffame namely richesse pretendeth stablenesse saw set loft hem succoured oft iholpe need take maner heed saine voice flatterie appeareth follie fare sing go farewell felde fare friend beshrew true soothfast friend betide every fortune wollen abide han heart blesse nill love richesse fortune may hem send wollen hem succour defend chaunge soft ne sore friend loveth evermore though men draw sword slo may hew love two case shall say pride ire lese may reproove nicete discovering privite tongue wounding felon venemous detraction friend case gone way nothing grieve ne may nought else woll fle love stabilitie certaine well begone among thousand findeth one may richesse ayenst friendship worthinesse ne may high attaine may valour sooth saine loveth true well friendship cattell friend court aie better penny purse certis fortune mishaping upon men fabling misturning chaunce cast hem balaunce maketh adversite men full clerely see friend existence appearence infortune maketh anone know thy friend fro thy fone experience right praise iwis much richesse treasour deepe profite valour povertie adversitie doth prosperitie one yeveth conisaunce tother ignoraunce thus povertie indeed trouth declared fro falshede faint friend woll declare true also way fare richesse friend full doublenesse offred many wise heart body service wold bought knowen openly thought hath clerely seen lasse beguiled perceived richesse nolde let wit well avauntage doeth sith maketh wise man great mischiefe perceiveth doeth richesse deceiveth richesse rich ne maketh nought treasour set thought richesse stont suffisaunce nothing aboundaunce suffisaunce onely maketh men live richly hath mitches tweine ne value demeine liveth ease rich doeth chich barne hath sooth saine hundred mavis wheat graine though chapman marchaunt gold many besaunt getting hath wo keeping drede also set evermore businesse encrease lesse augment multiply though heapes lye yet never shall make richesse asseth unto greedinesse poore retcheth nought save livelode thought getteth travaile dredeth nought shall faile though little worldes good meate drinke easie food vpon travaile living also suffisaunt clothing sickenesse fall loath meat drinke withall though meat buy shall bethinke hastely put daungere meat hath mistere may little eke founden seke men shull berne hast live till sickenesse past maisondewe beside cast nought shall betide thinketh nought ever shall sickenesse fall though fall may time spare shall mokell shall suffice sicke wise doeth woll content poverte without neede man much little apaide fortune nill importune vnto wight ne onerous goodnesse covetous therefore spareth may well poore estate susteen lust spare suffereth forth yet last happeneth may right unto last day take world would ever heart thinketh sooner death slo paradise sooner go shall live blisse shall good misse thider hopeth god shall send wretched liues end pythagoras himselfe rehearses booke gold verse cleped nobilite honourable dite thou goest thy body fro free ayre thou shalt go leaven humanitie purely live deitie foole withouten troweth countrey yearth countrey may clarkes seine sey boece consolation maked mention countrey plaine eie teaching philosophie lewd men might lere wit would translaten well live rent may yeve desireth may fro povertie save wise man saied may seen man wretched ween king knight ribaude many ribaud merrie baude swinketh beareth day night many burthen great might doeth lasse offence suffreth patience laugh daunce trippe sing lay nought living taverne dispendeth winning god hem sendeth goeth fardel beare good chere eare swinke travaile faineth robben disdaineth right anon swinke goeth taverne drinke rich aboundance thus suffisance well usurere god well knoweth without usurer god see shall never richesse rich hee evermore poore indigent scarce greedy entent sooth displease may marchaunt live ease heart set quicke brenneth get ne never shall though hath getten though gould garner yeten needy dredeth sore wherefore getten set heart desire hote brenneth fire covetise maketh wood purchase men good vnderfongeth great paine vndertaketh drinke vp saine drinketh aie leaveth sooth say thus thurst false getting last ever coveting anguish distresse fire greedinesse fighteth aie striveth heart asunder riveth greedinesse assaileth hath faileth phisitions advocate gone right yates sell science winning haunt craft great getting winning sweetnesse man fall sicknesse full glad encrease without lease everich man beseeke though die set leeke gould take full little care hem make would fortie sicke one yea two hundred flesh bone yet two thousand gesse encreasen richesse woll worchen wise lucre couetise phisicke ginneth first phi phisition also soothly sithen goeth fro fie fie trust hem follie nill manner gree doe right nought charitee eke sect set tho preachen get worship honour richesse heart arne great distresse folke live holyly aboven specially preachen vaine glorie toward god memorie forth ipocrites trace soules death purchace outward shewing holynesse though full cursednesse lich apostle twelve deceiue hem selve beguilded guiler preaching cursed man though may profite availeth mite oft good predicatioun commeth evil ententioun vaileth preaching helpe teaching good example take vaine glory shake let u leaven preachours speake hem tour heape vp gould fast shet sore thereon heart set neither love god ne drede keepe nede bagges sore bind sunne wind put vp need ware seen poore folke forfare hunger die cold quake god wel vengeance therof take great mischiefes hem assaileth thus gadering ay travaileth much paine winne richesse drede hem holdeth distresse keepe gather fast sorrow leave last sorrow die live unto richesse heart yeve defaute love sheweth full well iwis greedy sooth saine loveden loved againe good love raigned wickednesse ne fall yeve good hem neede bestad live without false vsure charitie full cleane pure hem yeve goodnesse defending hem idlenesse world poore none finde trow one chaunged world vnstable love vendable see man loveth winning prow love thralled servage sold advantage yet woman woll body sell soules goeth divell hell love told hem entent baronage counsaile went many sentence fill diversly said discord accorded accord love recorded sir sayden one even accord everichone take richesse onely sworne hath full hauteinly castle nill assaile ne smite stroke battaile dart ne mace speare ne knife man speaketh beareth life blameth emprise iwis host departed least waie plite hath man dispite sayth ne loved never therefore woll hate ever woll gather treasore hath wrathe evermore agilte never caas lo holly trespas sayeth well day asked leave gone way cleped much yeving spake full faire praying prayed poore therefore warned entre ne yet thriven thar hath getten pennie two quietly owne hold thus hath richesse u ali told richesse u recorded withouten accorded finde accordaunce false semblaunt abstinaunce folke battaile shull hinder gate assaile wicked tongue hath keeping norman full jangling hem courtesie largesse shull shew hardynesse old wife kept hard faire welcomming within ward shall delight well heling fond shame adoune bring host early late shull assaylen like gate drede shall hardynesse assaile also sikernesse folke leading never wist staying fraunchise shall fight eke pite daunger full cruelte thus host ordained weale downe shall castle every le everiche doe entent venus present mother full vesselage inough usage withouten may wight speed worke neither word ne deed therefore good ye send may worke amend lordinges mother gooddes ladie mistres ni nat willing ne doth desiring yet sometime doen labour lust succour neede atchieve thinke grieve mother childhede worship eke drede dredeth sire ne dame shall abie bodie name nathelesse yet send need nigh commen would trow nothing might hold mother great prowesse hath tane many forteresse cost hath many pound er na present iwis yet men sayd deede come never steede ne ne liketh mote thee tower take mee thinketh wise may cleped marchaundise go courser blacke white pay therefore art thou quite marchaunt oweth thee right nought ne thou thou bought woll selling clepe yeving selling asketh guerdoning lithe thanke ne merite one goeth quite selling semblable horse stable may sell againe parde winnen happe may may manne lese iwis least skinne else betide woll keepe horse ride yet lord aie horse thilke chafare well worse venus entermeteth ought chaffare hath bought shall worchen wisely ne shall lese utterly monney chaffare seller ware prise profite shall certaine buyer shall lese ne dere buy lordship full maistry ne power make letting neither yeft ne preaching chaffare maugre another shall much iwis woll yeve much countrey right nought happe may flatter pay marchaunts wise fooles everie wise buy thing wilfully lese good follily nathelesse dare say mother wont pay neither foole ne nice entremete vice trust well shall pay repent bargaine shall poverte put distresse schooller richesse great yerning vvhen assenteth willing bvt mother saint venus father saturnus engendred life nat upon wedded wife yet woll unto swere make thing surere faith beautee owe brother free ni wight hevin father name nevin diver many mother prive yet woll sweare sikernesse pole hell witnesse drinke yeare clarre lye forsworne goddes usage forsweareth amis shall yeere drinke clarre sworne inough parde forsweare lorne woll never forsworne sith richesse hath failed shall abie trespasse full dere least way harme sweard sparth gisarme certes sith loveth fro thilke time may see castle tower shake sorrie time shall awake may gripe rich man shall pull shall fewe stoundes lese markes poundes shall make penny sting garner spring maiden shall eke plucke shall needen feather mo make sell lond spend bet defend poore men han made lord although mightie may feede delite woll dispite good man hateth hem gesse chinch feloun richesse chase hem dispise hem defoule sundrie wise loven full bette god spede doeth rich chinchy grede good faith stable truer serviable therefore suffiseth good heart beaute han set thought therefore foryete hem nought woll hem bring great noblesse god richesse god love soothly ruth upon plaint therefore must succour paineth serven dyed love seemeth love sir sayd sooth everie dele ye rehearse wote wele thilke oath hold reasonable good covenable ye rich men han sworne sir wote well beforne rich men doen homage fooles doen outrage ye shull forsworne ne let therefore drinke clarre piment maked fresh new lady shull hem pepir brew fall laas woe mow saine ala lady shullen ever courteous shall quite oath free ne seeketh never vicaire shall speake faire ye shall hold payd full well though ye meddle never deale let lady worch thinges shall hem tell fele tidinges moove hem eke many requestes flatterie honest thereto yeve hem thankinges kissing talkinges certes trowed shall never leave hem lond ne fee nill moeble fare first delivered may tell u hestes shall fulfill bvt false semblaunt dare drede sir meddle dede sayth ye foe ye worch woe wherefore pray beau sire ye foryeve ire may dwell man abstinence deere lemman accord parfey sayd love graunt woll well hold man let come forth ran false semblant qd love wise take thee service thou friend helpe alwaie hindreth hem neither night ne daie doe thy might hem relieve eke enemy thou grieve thine might graunt thee king harlotes shalt thou bee woll thou honour certaine thou art false traitour eke theefe sith thou borne thousand time thou art forsworne nathelesse hearing put folke doubting bidde thee teach hem wost thou generall signe place thou shalt founden men mister thee men shall thee best espie thee know great maistrie tell place thine haunting sir full diver wonning keepe rehearsed ye would respiten tell sooth may harme shame fellowes wisten tale shoulden quit certaine would hate ever knew cruelte would hold hem still troth againe tale keepen might eftsoone buy full dere saied hem thing ought displeaseth hearing word hem pricketh biteth word none hem deliteth gospell euangile would reproue hem guile cruell hautain thing wote well certain speake ought paire loo court shall well cloos ne shall wite last good men nought agast woll taken hem nothing know meaning woll take woll himselfe suspecious make life let couertly guile hypocrisie engendred yave fostring made full good engendring qd love soothly tell engendred diuell hell needely howsoeuer bee qd love charge thee tell anon thy wonning placis hearing wight place life thou livest also hide lenger whereto thou must discouer thy worching thou seruest thing though thou shouldest thy sothsaw ben beaten draw yet art thou wont parde nathelesse though thou beaten thou shalt first hath soothsaw suffred wo sir sith may liken though slaine right shall doen commaundement thereto great talent withouten word mo right false semblaunt sermon began saied hem thus audience baron take heed sentence wight list knowing false semblant full flattering must worldly folke seke certes cloysters eke hem tway like euen sooth say shortly woll herborow hope best hulstred certainely sikerest hiding vnderneath humblest clothing religious folke ben full couert seculer folke ben apert nathelesse woll blame religious folke ne hem diffame habite euer go religion humble true also woll blame ne dispise nill love wise meane false religious dout malicious wollen habite go setten heart thereto religious folke pitous thou shalt seene one dispitous loven pride ne strife humbly woll lede life folke woll neuer dwell faine may well habite go leuer necke atwo let purpose take couenaunt euer make dwell hem proud full wile subtelte worship world coueiten great nede connen expleiten gone gadren great pitaunces purchase hem acquaintaunces men mightie life may leden faine hem poore himselfe feden good morsel delicious drinken good wine precious preach v pouert distresse fishen hemselfe great richesse wily nettes cast woll come foule last ben fro cleane religion went make world argument hath foule conclusion robe religion religious argument roignous worth crooked brere habite ne maketh neither monke ne frere cleane life deuotion maketh men good religion nathelesse none answere high euer head rasour whetted neuer kene guile braunches cutte thurtene wight distinct dare say word thereto herborow euer take semblaunt euer make meane guile follow right gibbe cat awaiteth mouse rattes killen ne entend beguilen ne wight may clothing wete folke dwelling ne word yet parde soft pleasaunt behold deed thou blind thou oughtest varie word fro deed thinke guile withouten dreed manner clothing estate euer bere lered leud lord ladie knight squire burgeis bailie right thus fals semblant sermoneth eftsoones love aresoneth brake tale speaking though told leasing saied deuill heare folke hast thou v nempned may men find religioun worldly habitatioun yea sir followeth nat lead wicked life parfey ne therefore soules lese hem worldly clothes chese certes great pitee men may secular clothes see florishen holy religiouns full many saint field toun many virgine glorious deuout full religious han died common cloth aye beren yet saintes neuerthelesse could recken may ten yea welnigh holy woman men church herry seke maiden wiues eke baren full many faire child weared alway clothes seculere diden saint ben alway ix thousand maiden dere beren heauen cierges clere men rede church sing take secular clothing receiued martirdome wonnen heauen vnto home good heart maketh good thought clothing yeueth ne reueth nought good thought worching maketh religion flouring lieth good religioun right ententioun tooke weather skin wrapped greedy wolfe therein go lambes white wenest thou would hem bite yes neuerthelesse wood would hem wirry drinke blood well rather hem deceiue sith coud nat perceiue tregette crueltie would follow altho flie wolues hew amongs apostle new thou holy church thou maist wailed sith thy citie assailed knight thine owne table god wot thy lordship doutable enforce win defend fro within might defence ayenst hem make without stroke mote take trepeget mangonell without displaying pensell god nill done succour let renne colour thou must thy hestes letten bee nought yeeld thee yeue tribute doutles hold hem pee greater harme betide thee maister bee well con scorne thee withall day stuffen wall night minen nay thou planten must el thine impes thou wolt fruit abide thy selfe save bvt peace turne againe woll thing faine might maken weary woll heten alway helpe friend may wollen company shent vtterly fall oft hem eke lemman mote serue shull love deserue forsooth false traitour god iudged theefe trechour forsworne well nigh none wote guile till done hath many one deth receiued treget neuer aperceiued yet receiueth shall receiue falsenesse shall neuer apperceiue doth wise right good beware sligh aperceiuing late commeth knowing protheus coud chaunge euery shape homely straunge coud neuer guile ne treasoun come neuer toun might knowen though men might see full well clothes chaunge take one make another straunge knight chastelaine prelate chaplaine priest clerke fostere maister schollere monke chanon baily euer mister man prince page heart euery language sometime hoore old young stout bold robert robin frere minor iacobin followeth loteby done sollace company hight dame abstinence raigned many queint array faigned right commeth liking fulfill desiring sometime woman cloth take maid lady sometime religious like anker hous sometime prioresse nonne abbesse go regiouns seeking religiouns order sworne take straw beat corne jolly folke enhabite aske habite woll ye every wise right list disguise well beare wede vnlike word dede thus make trappes fall people priviledges ben christendome alive may assoile may shrive prelate may let folke ever found prelate may done pope mo made thilke establishing proper thing sleight apperceiued wont woll thou hem tregetry yeue little tale siluer male preached eke shriuen take yeuen folly husbond wife lede right jolly life simplesse prelacie know tregettrie bvt much man wife shew parish priest life one yeare sayth booke ere wight housel tooke priviledges large may much thing discharge may say right thus pardee sir priest shrift tell thee shriven hath assoyled yeven pennaunce soothly sin found guilty ne ne haue never entencion make double confession ne rehearse eft shrift thee shrift right ynough mee ought thee suffice wele ne rebell never adele certes though thou haddest sworne wote priest ne prelate borne may shrift eft constraine done woll plaine wote plaine wele thou shalt strein adele ne enforce ne trouble make confession double ne none affection double absolution first right ynough mee latter assoyling quite thee unbound maist thou find sinnes unbind might hath hond sinnes unbond thou wolt thus constraine mote need thee plaine shall judge imperiall ne bishop ne officiall done judgment shall gone plaine openly vnto shriftfather new hight frere wolfe untrew shall chuse mee trow hamper thee lord would wroth withall men would frere wolfe call would patience done cruell vengience would might done leest nothing spare god heest god wise succour thou yeve saviour easter liketh mee without preasing thee woll forth gone shall housell anone thy grutching keepe deale thee nothing thus may shrive forsaketh parish priest taketh priest woll refuse full ready accuse punish hamper church shall forgo hath feeling consequence shriving shall seene yt priest may never might know conscience aright cure ayenst holy scripture biddeth every herde honest knowing beest poore folke gone strete gold ne sum grete hem would let prelate let priest know state right nought yeve ne may ben bare take keepe woll fat sheepe let parish priest lene yeve harme bene prelate grutch oughten wroth wit lese fat beast shall yeve hem stroke two shall lesen force yea mitre croce thus yape hem long priviledges ben strong false semblant would inted love ne made chere weary saw make glad faw said tell specially thou servest untruly tell forth shame thee never adele thine habit sheweth wele thou servest holy hermite sooth hypocrite thou goest preachest poverte yea sir richesse hath poste thou preachest abstinence also sir woll fillen mote go paunch good meat wine maister divine poore faine yet poore folke disdaine love better acquaintaunce ten time king fraunce poore man mild mood though soule also good see beggers quaking naked mixins stinking hunger crie eke care entremet fare ben poore full pine might one yeve dine nothing life yeve yt licketh knife folly entremete te seeke hound nest fat mete let beare spittle anone comfort get none rich sicke usurere would visite draw nere would comfort rehete hope gold gete wicked death woll go grave reprove let poore wost thou ascape say sweare full rape rich men han tetches sinne han poore wretch han counsaile mistere therefore would draw hem nere great hurt may hath soule right great poverte soule great richesse forsooth albeit hurten richesse mendicity ben cleped two extreamities meane cleped suffisaunce lieth vertue aboundaunce salomon full well wote parable u wrote knowen many wight thirteene chapiter right god thou keepe thy poste fro richesse mendicite rich man dresse thinke much richesse heart ferre sette creator doth foryette beggeth woll aye greve word leve vnneth ni micher forsworne el god lier thus sayth salomon sawes ne find written lawes namely christen lay saith ye dare say nay christ ne apostle dere walked earth never seene herbred begging nolden beggen nothing right thus men wont teach wise would preach maisters divinitie sometime paris citie men would gaine appose naked text let glose might soone assoiled bee men may well sooth see parde might aske thing plainely forth without begging god heerdes dere cure soules hadden nolde nothing begge food christ done rood proper honds wrought travaile el nought wonnen sustenaunce liueden forth pennaunce remenaunt yafe away poore folkes alway neither builden toure ne halle house small alle mighty man may hond body alway winne food labouring ne rent thing although religious god serven curious thus mote done trespaas certaine caas rehearse mister bee right well time see seeke booke saint augustine paper perchemene writte worchings thou shalt seene none excusings perfit man ne seeke word ne deed eke although religious god serven curious ne shall mote go proper honds body also get food labouring ne properte thing yet sell substaunce swinke sustenaunce perfite bounte thus han bookes told woll gone idelly useth aye busily haunten men table trechour full fable ne ne may good reason excuse orison men behoveth gise ben sometime god service gone purchasen nede men mote eaten drede sleepe eke thing long may leave praying may eke prayer blinne werke meat winne saint austine woll thereto accord thilke booke record iustinian eke made lawes hath thus forboden old sawes man vp paine dead mighty body beg bread may swinke gete men rather maine bete done aperte iustice suffren mallice done well mote go taken almesse priviledge paine hem woll alledge see prince deceived bee ne ne wene sikerly may rightfully woll determine prince power ne define ne word comprehend ywis ferre may stretch woll entremete dele trow booke sayth wele taketh almesses bee dew folke men may see lame feeble weary bare poore manner care con winne hem nevermo power thereto eateth owne dampning lie made thing ye truant find chastise well ye kind would hate parcaas ye fillen laas would eftsoones scathe might late rathe full patient han world thus foule blent weteth well god bad good man sell follow poore yeve would therefore live serven mendience never sentence bad werken need follow good deedis saint poule loved holy church bade apostle wurch winnen live lode wise hem defended truandise said werketh honden thus thing vnderstonden nolde iwis bid hem begging ne sellen gospell ne preaching least beraft asking folke cattell thing world many man yeveth good ne werne shame el would asker delivered encombreth yeveth good let go nothing profite lese yest merite good folke poule preached profred oft hem teached good charite thereof right nothing tooke hond would gette clothes wrine mete tell man may liven good poore hath yeven woll onely bidde bede never honds labour nedes may yea sir sir woll gladly tell saint austen faith man may house han properte templers hospitelers chanons regulers white monkes blake woll mo ensamples make take thereof susteining therein lithe begging otherwaies iwis yet austen gabbeth yet full many monke laboureth god holy church honoureth swinking agone rede sing church anone hath ben great discord many wight may beare record vpon estate mendicience woll shortely presence tell man may begge need hath wherewith feed maugre fellowes ianglings soothfastnesse woll none hiding yet percase may abey soothly thus sey lo case especiall man bestiall craft hath science nought desireth ignorence may go begging yerne till craft lerne without truanding may trouth living may done labour elde sicknesse langour tender age also may yet begging go peraventure vsage noriture lived deliciously oughten good folke comenly han mischeefe pite suffren also may gone begge bread honger dead craft conning strength also desiring worchen find neither ne may begge till getten necessite winning lite labour woll aquite sufficiauntly living yet may go brede begging fro dore dore may go trace till remnaunt may purchase man would vndertake emprise make rescous lay defenden may armes lettrure convenable cure poore may begge till may find trouth swinke get cloth meat drinke swinke honds corporell hondes espirituell case semblables ben mo reasonables may begge tell el manere william saint amour would preach oft would dispute teach matter openly paris full solemnely also god soule blesse stedfastnesse accord vniversite people seemeth good man ought refuse ne ought thereof excuse wrothe blithe woll speake tell thee die put doun saint poule derke prisoun exiled caas wrong maister william mother hypocrisie banished great envie mother flemed saint amour noble labour sustaine ever loyalte hee much agilte made booke let write wherein life write would eche remed begging live travelling ne rent ne good weneth wood labour might never please ben ease well lever sooth say people patter pray wrie foxerie vnder cope papelardie qd love divell word tellest thou sir falsenesse apert dredest thou god certes selde great thing shall spede world god woll drede folke hem vertue yeven truely owne liven hem goodnesse aye content hem little thrift isent folke drinken great misease life may never please see gold han vserers silver eke garner tailagiers moniours bailiffes beadle provost countours liven well nigh ravine small people hem mote encline aud wolf woll hem eten vpon poore folke geten full much spend kepe ni none hem nill strepe wrine hem selfe well full without scalding hem pull strong feeble overgothe weare simple clothe robbe robbed robbours guile guiling guilours treget gather threste great treasour cheste lieth fast bound mine high paleis doe found delight fulfill wine feastes table full entremees woll life ease pee winne gold spend also great bagge go commeth right yapes make well tomble mine ape winnen alway mine entent purchase better rent though beaten entremete without may wight dure walke soules cure world cure brede length boldly woll preach eke counsailen honds woll travailen pope bull ne hold wittes dull woll stinten live emperours shrive king duke lord grete poore folke quite lete love shriving parde cause recke poore men estate worth ben findest thou swinker labour confessour empress duchess queenes eke countess abbess eke bigins great lady palasins iolly knight bailives nonnes burgeis wife rich eke pleasing maiden welfaring clad naked vncounsailed goeth none fro soules safete lord lady meine aske hem shrive propertie live make hem trow least parish priest beast ayenst company shrewes great woll hide hold privete told word signe iwis ne woll make hem know wollen also tellen hele fro privite make hem perceiven vsen folke thus deceiven woll saine withouten drede men may gospell rede saint mathew gospellere saieth shall say vpon chaire moses thus glosed doubtles old testament thereby chaire ment sitte scribe pharisen saine cursed men ipocrites call doeth preach rede doeth doen adele weary say wele doe well would bind folke alway beguiled able burdons importable folkes shoulder thing couchen nill finger touchen woll touch hem ne list nat sikerly sadde burdons men taken make folkes shoulder aken ought good bee folke see burdons larger maken maken hemmes wide alwey loven seates table first honourable han first chairis synagogue hem full dere willen folke hem lout grete passen strete wollen cleped maister also ne willen gospell ayenst gesse sheweth well wickednesse another custome vse hem woll ayenst v hate hem deadly everychone woll werrey one one hateth hate coniect doen fall seene winne honour richesse preise valour provende rent dignite full fast iwis compassen ladder clomben maken downe go treason woll defame doen lese good name thus ladder take thus frends foe make word ne wete shall none till friendes fone openly might blame readily wist mallice kept nice another fall one among v doeth good tourne drede saine alder dede yea sikerly though fained list dained man avaunced thereof parteners tellen folke go man v sprongen men praising purchase flattering rich men great poste letter witnesse bounte man weeneth may v see vertue v bee alway poore v faine begge plaine ben folke without leasing thing without thus dradde people iwis gladly purpose deale wight gold treasour great plente acquaintaunce well love much desire shortly entremete brocages make peace mariages gladly executour many time procuratour sometime messangere falleth mistere many time make enquest office nat honest deale men thing great liking ye ought place repaire shall speden wit soone ye told ye serve pay service shall alway woll chastice anone love lost hath love man gise woll reprove chastise woll folke vndertake wight teaching take folke chastie woll taught fro follie love none hermitage desert holtes hoore great wood everychon let hem baptist iohn queth quite relesse egipt wildernesse ferre mansiouns fro city good touns paleis mine house make men may renne openly say world forsake amidde build make house swim play therein bette fish doeth sinne antichristes men christ sayeth openly habite holinesse liven wickednesse copie talent tooke evangelistes booke might see great traisoun full many false comparisoun much great might heat light sunne surmounteth moone troubler chaungeth soone nutte kernell shell scorne nat tell right withouten gile surmounteth noble evangile word evangelist title tooken christ many comparisoun make mentioun might men booke find could hem mind vniversitie tho asleepe gan braied taken keepe noise head vp cast ne never sithen slept fast vp stert armes tooke ayenst false horrible booke ready battaile make iudge booke take broughten booke hent anone away feare nolde shew adele kept keepen wele till time may see strong woxen bee wight may hem well withstond booke durst stond away gonne ne durst answere exposition glose clerkes woll appose ayenst cursednesse iwis booke written wote nat ne nat see manner end shall bee hide yet algate shall abide till may bette defend trow best woll end thus antechrist abiden meine man woll right soone shall life forgo outward lamben seemen full goodnesse pite inward withouten fable greedy wolf ravisable enviroun lond see world werrien wee woll ordaine thing folkes good living castell cite within bougerons although millaine thereof blamed wight measure would lene gold take vsure covetous lecherous haunten simonie provost full trecherie prelate living iollily priest halt quein old hoores hostillers baudes bordellers el blamed vice men shoulden doen iustice saint prey defend lamprey luce elis samons tender goose capon tartes cheffes fat daintie flaunes brode flat caleweis pullaile coninges fine vitaile vnder clothes wide maken gollet glide woll doe come hast rae venison bake past whether loure groine shall corde loigne men shall bind lede brenne sinfull dede men shull heare crie rore mile way el shall prison die woll friendship buy smerten hath guilt amounteth couth sleight doe maken vp toure height nought rought whether stone tree yearth turf though though vounde stone wrought squier scantilone toure stuffed well rich temporell would vp dresse engine lesse cast v every side beare good name wide sleight shall yeven barrel wine sixe seven gold sackes great plente soone delivered pitences let studie equipolences let lie fallaces would deserve grace shall beare witnesse sinne wretchednesse doen lose wide renne quicke brenne el yeve soch pennaunce well worse pitaunce thou shalt never nothing con knowen aright clothing traitours full trecherie thou werkes espie ne good keeping whylome vniversite keepeth key christendome tourmented stinking prophetis ni none hem good prophet wicked entention yeare incarnation thousand two hundred yere five fiftie ferther ne nere broughten booke sorrie grace yeven ensample common place saied thus though fable gospell perdurable fro holy ghost sent well worth brent entitled manere booke tell na wight paris beforne ladie parvis ne might booke sentence pleased hem well truely woll stint matere wonder long ilke booke endured better estate ensured friend yet pardee han set great degree world emperour guile father trechour empresse mother maugre holy ghost iwis mightie linage rout reigneth every reigne well worthy minister world governe folke well deceive none guile perceive though doen dare say sooth dare wight bewray christes wrath leadeth christ brother dredeth ni full good champion dreadeth similation paine woll refusen v correct accusen woll entremete right ne god eyesight therefore god shall punice ne recketh vice sithen men v loven communably holden v worthy may folke repreve echone nill reprefe none shoulden folke worshippen v stinten never mo patren folke may v see though behind hem wood follie enhaunce chivalrie love noble men gay iolly clothes wearen alway folke seemen cleane men clothes demen wordes follow dede great pitie drede woll none hypocritis hem thinketh great spight cannot love hem side beggers hood wide sleigh pale face leane gray clothes nat full cleane fretted full tatarwagges high shoe knopped dagges frouncen like quale pipe bootes riveling gipe folke devise prince lord wise take land thing warre peace governing folke prince yeve would life honour live nat seme serven thus world queme would dwell deceive folke shall nat perceive ne speake wise men humble habite dispise pride vnder man hate thinketh poore man clothing god ne preiseth nothing saieth hath world forsake hath worldly glory take woll delices vse may begger well excuse papelarde yeeldeth woll worldly ease go saieth world hath left greedily gripeth eft hound shame saine casting goeth againe bvt vnto dare lie might feelen espie ye perceived nothing ye starke leasing right hond thus beginne nolde let sinne god lough wonder tho every wight gan lough also saied lo man right trustie every wight false semblant qd love say mee sith thus avaunced thee court thy dwelling ribaudes shalt king wolt thou well holden forwardes yea sir hence forwardes woll people vpon areise guile doen ceise sharpe speares riue way bring fro liue woll follow ywis booke written thus much woll booke signifie peter maistrie may never iohn shew well might declared right meaning barke rinde maketh entencions blinde erst woll begin expoune pith within seculers comprehend christ law woll defend kepen maintainen ayenst hem sustenen falsly people teachen iohn betokeneth hem preachen ni law couenable thilke gospell perdurable fro holy ghost sent turne folke ben miswent strength iohn vnderstond grace say stond doeth sinfull folke conuert hem iesu christ reuert full many another horriblee may men booke see commaunded doubtlesse ayenst law rome expresse antichrist holden men may booke beholden commaunden sleen tho peter shall never might god toforne strife fight ne shall ynough find peter law shall mind euer hold mainteen last shall seen shall come thereto aught speake thilke law shall stond iohn vnderstond maugre hem shall adoun brought confusioun never father beforne seruaunt true sith borne ayenst nature sir put auenture though ye borowes take sikerer shall ye never hostage ne sikernesse chartres beare witnesse take selfe record men ne may manere tearen wolfe hide till slaine backe side though men beat defile wene ye woll beguile clothed meekely vnder trechery mine heart chaungeth never mo none habite go though chere simplenesse wearie shreudnesse lemman strained abstenaunce hath mister purueiaunce full long ago ded nere counsaile red let alone mee love answerd trust thee without borow woll none false semblant theefe anone right ilke place treason face right blacke within white without thanking gan knee lout nought euery man assaute sailen qd love full hardely armed hem comenly armour hem fell armed fiers fell went hem forth rout set castle away dread till ben dead till castle take foure battels gan make patted hem foure anone tooke way forth gone foure gate assaile keeper woll faile ben neither sicke ne dede hardie folke strong dede woll saine countenaunce false semblant abstinaunce ben wicked tongue went first held parliament whether doen maken hem knowen el walken forth disguised last deuised would gone tapinage pilgrimage like good holy folke vnfeined dame abstinence streined tooke robe cameline gan gratche bigine large couerchief thread wrapped head forgate psaltere paire bead eke bere vpon lace white thread bead bede ne bought hem never adele given wote wele god wote full holy frere saied father dere went frere couent visited also many sermon saied nolde let men liue ne would oft shriue great deuotion made confession oft none two head one hood one faire shape deuised thee pale face sometime shee false tratouresse vntrew like sallow horse hew apocalips shewed signifieth tho folke beshrewed full trecherie pale hypocrisie horse colour onely dead pale iwis colour enlangoured abstinence iwis coloured estate repented visage represented burdoune theft guile yeue yeft scrippe faint distresse full elengenesse forth walked soberlie false semblant saint ievous die mistere doen cope frere cheare simple full pitous looking disdeinous ne proud meeke full peasible necke bare bible squierly gan gon rest limmes vpon treason potent feeble way went sleue gan thring rasour sharpe well biting forged forge men clepen coupe gorge long forth way nomen till wicked tongue comen gate sitting saw folke way passing pilgrimes saw fast bearen hem full meekely humbly hem mette dame abstinence first grette sith false semblant salued hem remeued ne drede adele saw face wele alway heart thought know hem two well knew dame abstinaunce ne knew constrainaunce knew nat constrained ne theeues life fained wend come free come another degree good began failed false semblant seine alse knew nat faise yet false falsenesse ne coud espie gesse semblant slie wrought falsenesse ne espyed nought haddest thou knowen beforne thou wouldest booke sworne thou saw thilke arraie whilom gaie daunce iolly robin tho become iacobin soothly men call frere preachours good men order wickedly bearen minstrel wearen augustins cordileers carmes eke sacked freers freers shode bare though hem ben great square full holy men hem deme everich hem would good man seme shalt thou neuer apparence seene conclude good consequence none argument iwis existence failed men may finde alway sopheme consequence enueneme hath sobtiltee double sentence see pilgrimes commen wicked tongue dwelled harneis nigh hem algate wicked tongue adoune sate hem nere come tidinges tell sayd hem case maketh come place sir sayd strained abstinance drie penance heart pitous deuout commen pilgrimes gone well nigh foote alway go full doughtie heeles two thus sent throughout world miswent yeve ensample preach also fishen sinfull men go fishing ne fish sir charite wont herborow craue life amenne christ saue displease woulden ease short sermon vnto sain wicked tongue answered house qd ye see shall warned saie list woll heare graunt mercie sweet sir deare qd alderfirst dame abstinence thus began sentence sir first vertue certaine greatest soueraigne may found man wit tongue refraine thereto ought euerie wight paine better still speaken harme parde hearkeneth gladly good man sikerly sir abouen sinne art thou guiltie ninne thou speake yape long agoe sir right euill doe young man repaired never yet place repaired thou saidest awaited nothing deceiue faire welcomming ye sayd nothing sooth sir ye lye tell ye plat ne commeth ne goeth parde trow ye shall never see faire welcomming prison oft hath played er fairest game coude without filth still loude dare selfe solace ye han also man doe chase dare neither come ne go mooveth hate properly wicked thought many false lesing hath thought mooveth foule eloquence iangleth ever audience folke ariseth blame doth hem dishonour shame thing may preuing likelinesse contriuing dare saine reason deemeth sooth thing seemeth sinne controue thing reproue wote ye wele sir therefore ye arne blame nathelesse recketh lite yeueth thereof mite thought harme parfaie would come gone daie coud himselfe absteine commeth sene ne taketh cure aventure lasse folke algate thou watchest gate speare thine arest alwaie muse musard daie thou wakest night day thought iwis thy trauaile nought iealousie withouten faile shall never quite thee thy trauaile skath faire welcoming without trespassing shall wrongfully prison weepeth languisheth though thou never yet iwis giltest man take greefe worthy put thee baily afterward prison lie fettred thee till thou die thou shalt sinne dwell right diuels arse hell thou repent thee maifaie thou lyest falsely qd welcome mischaunce therefore herboured say shame eke reproue sorrie happe behoue day herbegere go herber elsewhere han lyer called two tregetours art thou mine house doe shame soothsaw ye blame sermon ye make diuels take else god thou confound er men didden castle found passeth ten dayes twelue told right selue sayd right told kist rose priuily thus sayd sayd yore men say thing gabbing right saide woll say yet trow lyed bemes woll blow neighbour arrow hath commen gone tho spake false semblant right anone gospell dout men saine towne lay defe eare speaking swere sir gabbing trow wote well certainly man loveth tenderly sayth harme wote never poore wit sooth also sikerly know ye sir well lover gladly woll visiten place love habiten man loveth eke honoureth man serve laboureth clepeth freind deere man maketh good cheere euerie man meeteth saleweth greeteth preseth oft ye ought comming encombred presen folke full ofter doeth heart strained vnto rose go ye seene oft need ye take deed coud comming forbeare though ye thrilled speare nere trusteth well sweare cleane thought sir certes ne thinketh nought ne doth faire welcomming sore abieth thing one assent full soone rose hent maugre would sir thing hearkeneth sith ye man loveth han sayd harme shame witteth well gessed ye may well demen wit nolde nothing love ne callen friend also night day woll wake castle destroy take sooth ye de vise man manner wise might warne everidele himselfe perceive wele sith might come gone whilom wont done might soone wite see otherwise wote hee sir vtterly deserved hell iollyly death hell doubtlesse thrallen folke guiltlesse false semblant prooveth thing none answering seeth alwaie apparaunce nigh fell repentaunce sayd sir may well semblant good man seemen ye abstinence full wise ye seeme talent deeme counsaile woll ye yeven right anon thou shalt shriven say thy sinne without shalt thou repent sore priest poste shrive folke dignite ben wide world may dure world cure yet never persoun ne vicarie manner toun god wote thee thousand time pitee hath thy priest parochiall though thy friend speciall avauntage wife priest wise ne halfe lettred licensed boldly divinitie read confessen dread ye woll confesse leave sinnes lesse without abode kneele doune anon shall absolution phere followeth booke troilus creseide excellent book shewed fervent love troylus creiseid enjoyed time great untruth giving diomedes end cast came great misery discourse chaucer liberally treateth divine purveyance double sorrow troilus tellen kinge priamus sonne troy loving aventures fellen woe wele ioy purpose er part froy thou thesiphone thou helpe tendite wofull verse wepen write thee clepe thou goddesse tourment thou cruell furie sorrowing ever paine helpe sorrowfull instrument helpeth lover complaine well sit sooth saine wofull wight drery feare sorrowfull tale sorie cheare god love servaunts serve ne dare love mine vnlikelynesse prayen speed therefore sterve farre fro helpe derkenesse nathelesse may done gladnesse lover cause availe thanke mine travaile ye lover bathen gladnesse droppe pite remembreth passed heavinesse ye felt adversite folke thinketh ye han felt love durst displease else ye han great ease prayeth hem case troilus ye may heare hem bring heaven solace eke prayeth god deare might shew manere paine woe love folke endure troilus vnsely aventure biddeth eke hem ben dispeired love never recovered eke hem falsely ben apeired wicked tongue thus biddeth god benignite grant hem sone world pace ben dispaired love grace biddeth eke hem ben ease god hem graunt aie good perseverance send hem grace love please love worship pleasance hope selfe best avance pray hem love servaunts write woe live charite hem compassioun though owne brother dere hearkeneth good ententioun woll go straight matere ye may double sorrowes troilus loving creseide forsoke er deide well wist greekes strong armes thousand ship went troie wardes citie long besiegeden nigh ten yeres ere stent diver wise one entent ravishing wreake queene heleine paris wroughten peine fell toune dwelling lord great authorite great divine cleped calcas science expert knew well troie destroyed answeare god hight thus dan phebus apollo delphicus calcus knew calculing eke answeare god apollo greekes people bring thorow troy must fordo cast anone toune goe well wist sort troie sholde destroyed ye would nolde wherefore departen softly tooke purpose full forknowing wise greekes host full prively stale anone courteous wise worship servise trust hath cunning hem rede every perill dread great rumour rose first espied toune openly spoken calcus traitour fled alied hem grece cast wroken falsely hath faith broken sayd kinne atones worthy brent fell bone calcas left mischaunce vnwist false wicked dede daughter great penaunce life full sore drede wist never best rede widdow alone nist whome might make mone creseide lady name aright dome troy citie fairest ladie far passing every wight angellike shone native beaute mortall thing seemed therewith perfect creature made scorning nature ladie day heard eare father shame falshede treasoun full nigh wit sorrow feare widdowes habite large samite broun hector knee fell adoun mercy bad selfe excusing pitous voice tenderly weeping hector pitous nature saw sorrowfull begone faire creature goodnesse gladed anone said let father traison gone forth mischance ye selfe joy dwelleth u list troy honour men may ye ferforth though father dwelt ye shull haue body shull men save ferre may ought enquire thanked full good chere ofter would took leve went home held still house abode meine till honour need hold dwelling cite kept estate yong old full well beloved men well told whether child none rede nat therefore let gone thing fellen werre betwixen hem troy greekes oft sometime boughten troy derre este greekes founden nothing soft folke troy thus fortune aloft efte gan hem whelmen course aie yt wroth toune came destruction ne falleth purpose tell long digression fro matter long dwell troyan iestes fell omer dare dite yt may reden hem write thogh greekes hem troy shetten citie besieged old usage nolde letten honouren god full devout aldermost honour dout relike hight palladion trust aboven everychon befell comen time aprill clothed mede new grene lustie veer prime sweet smelling floures white rede sundrie wise shewed rede folke troie observance old palladions feast went hold vnto temple best wise generally went many wight hearken palladions servise namely many lustie knight many lady fresh maiden bright full well arraied least season high feast among folke creseida widdowes habite blacke natheles right first letter beautie first stood makeles goodly looking gladed prees na neuer seene thing praised derre n r cloude blacke bright sterre creseide sayden everichone behelden blacke wede yet stood full lowe still alone behinde folke little bread nie dore shame dread simple attire debonaire chere full assured looking manere troilus wont guide yong knight lad hem doune thilke large temple every side beholding aie lady toune devotioune none reven rest gan praise lacke whome lest walk full fast gan waiten knight squier companie gan sike let eyen baiten woman coud espie would smile hold follie say hem thus lord sleepeth soft love thee thou turnest full oft heard tell pardieux living ye lover eke lewd observaunces labour folke winning love keeping doutaunces pray lost wo penaunces fooles blinde nice ye one ware another word gan cast brow ascaunces lo well ispoken god love gan looken low right dispite shope wroken kidde anone bow broken sodainly hitte full yet proude peacocke gan pull blinde world blind entention often falleth effect contraire sequedrie foule presumption caught proud caught debonaire troilus clomben staire little weneth mote descenden day faileth fooles wenden proud bayard beginneth skippe way pricketh corne till lash long whippe thinketh tho praunce beforn first traise full fat new ishorne yet horse horse law must endure feeres draw fared fiers proud knight though worthy kinges sonne wend nothing might ayenst heart stere yet looke heart woxe fire pride woxe sodainly subject unto love thy ensample taketh man ye wise proud worthy folkes scornen love soone freedome heart thrast ever ever shall love thing may bind man may fordo law kind sooth hath preved doth yet trow ye know men reden folke han greater wit han ben love inome strengest folk therewith overcome worthyest greatest degree yet man shall see trueliche sitte well alderwisest han therewith ben pleased han ben aldermost wo love han ben comforted eased oft hath cruell heart appeased worthy folke made worthier name causeth dreden vice shame sith may nat goodly withstond thing vertuous kind refuseth nought love ne ben bond sith selven list may bind yerde bette bowen woll wind brest therefore rede followeth yt well lede tellen forth speciall king sonne told leven thing collaterall thinke tale forth hold joy care cold werke touching matere gan woll thereto refere within ye temple went forth playing trouilus every wight lady looking toune without upon case befell rout eye peirced deepe went till creseide smote stent sodainly wonder wext astoned gan bet behold thrifty wise god thouyt wher hast thou woned art faire goodly devise therewith heart gan spread rise soft sighed least men might caught ayen first playing chere na nat stature limmes well answearing womanhood creature never lasse mannish seeming eke pure wise meaning shewed well men might gesse honour estate womanly noblesse tho troilus right wonder well withall gan like meaning chere somdele deignous let fall looke little aside manere ascaunces may stonden looking gan light never thought seen good sight looke gan quicken great desire affection heart bottome gan sticken sixe deepe impression though earst pored vp doun glad horne shrinke vnnethes wist looke winke lo lete selven cunning scorned hem love paine drien full vnware love dwelling within subtill streames eyen sodainely thought felt dyen right looke spirite heart blessed love thus folke convert thus blacke liking troilus thing stood behold desire ne wherefore stood thus neither chere made ne word thereof told ferre manner hold thing sometime looke cast eft service last nat fullish awhaped temple eselich went repenting ever iaped love folke least fully discent scorne fill himselfe ment least wist manner side woe gan dissimulen hide fro yt temple thus departed straight anone unto pallaice turneth right loke shotten darted faineth lust soiourneth chere speech also burneth aie love servaunts every selfe wrie hem gan smile sayd lord live lust ye lover cunningest servest ententifelich best tite often harme thereof prow hire quit ayen ye god wote well well scorne good servise faith order ruled good wise certaine observaunces onely sely point ne nothing asketh great attendaunces doth laie know ye worst mote thee told worst point leve sayd sooth ye woulden greve take ye lover oft eschew else done good entention full oft thy ladie woll misse constrew deeme harme opinion yet encheson wroth shalt thou groin anon lord well may one yt seeth time held peace none bote gained love began feather lime well vnneth vnto folke fained busie need distrained woe done nist folke gon hem list chamber alone doune vpon bed foot set first gan sike eft grone thought aie withouten let sate woke spirit met saw temple wise right looke gan new avise thus gan make mirrour mind saw wholy figure well coud heart find right good aventure love one cure serven yet might fall grace else one servant pace imagining travaile grame ne might goodly one lorne ne desire shame wist prise vp borne lover well beforne thus argumented ginning full vnavised wo comming thus took purpose love craft sewe thought would worken privily first hide desire mewe everie wight iborne overly might ought recovered thereby remembring love wide iblowe yelt bitter fruite though sweet seed sowe full mokell thought speake holden inne arten er love sought song anone right beginne gan loude sorrow winne good hope gan fully assent creseide love nought repent song onely sentence write mine authour called lolius plainely save tongue difference dare well say troilus sayed song lo every word right thus shall saine list heare lo next verse may finde pthe song troilus love god feele love thing love good whence cometh wo wicke wonder thinketh every torment adversite cometh may savery think foraie thurst iche drinke mine owne lust brenne whence cometh wailing plaint harme agree whereto plaine thenne ne unwery feint quicke death sweet harme queint may thee quantite consent consent wrongfully comylaine iwis thus possed fro sterelesse within bote amidde sea atwixen windes two contrary stonden ever mo ala wonder maladie heat cold cold heat die god love thus sayd pitous voice lord spirite oughten thank lord yt han brought whether goddesse woman iwis ye serve man woll aie live sterve ye stonden eyen mightily place vertue digne wherefore lord servise may liken beth benigne mine estate royall resigne honde full humble chere become man lady dere ne deigned sparen blood royall fire love wherefro god blesse ne forbare degree vertue excellent prowesse held thrall lowe distresse brend sundry wise aie newe sixty time day lost hewe muchell day fro day thought lust gan quicken encrease everiche charge set nought thy full oft hot fire cease seen goodly looke gan prease thereby ben eased well wend aie nere brend aie nere fire hotter trow knoweth companie ferre nere dare say night day wisedome follie heart brestes eie aie fairer seene ever helein polixene eke day passed hour himselfe thousand time sayd god goodly whome serve labour best would god creseide ye woulden rue er deide dere heart ala mine hele hew life lost ye woll rew dredes fled thassiege salvation ne desire none founes bred argument conclusion would compassion ben man may dure lo life death cure sharpe shower fell armes preve hector brother didden ne made onely therefore one meve yet men went ridden found one best lengest time abiden perill eke travaile armes thinke marvaile none hate greekes ne also rescous toun ne made thus armes mad onely lo conclusioun liken bet renoun fro day day armes sped greekes death dred fro forth tho rest love slepe made meate foe eke sorrow gan multiply tooke keepe shewed hew even morow therefore title gan borow sickenesse least men wend hot fire love brend sayd fever fared amis certaine cannot sey lady understood fained nist one twey well rede manner wey ne seemed rought paine ever thought felt troilus wo welnigh wood aie drede wight loved never would han take heed thought felt hart bleed ne woe ne durst nought begin tellen world win space left care thus himselfe full oft gan plaine sayd foole art thou snare whilom yapedest lover pain art thou hent gnaw thine chain thou wert aie woned ech lover reprehend thing fro wch thou canst thee defend woll every lover saine thee wist ever thine absence laughen scorn saine lo goeth man great sapience held u lover least reverence thanked god may gon daunce hem love lift feebly avaunce thou wofull troilus god would sith thou must loven thy destine thou beset wer soch one know thy wo lacked pitee cold love towards thee thy ladie frost winter moone thou fordo snow fire soone god would arrived port death sorow woll lede ah lord great comfort quite languishing drede hidde sorow iblowe brede shall beiaped thousand time foole whose folly men rime help god ye sweet plaine icought ye never wight fast mercie deare hart helpe death life may last selfe woll love last frendly look gladeth swete though nevermore thing ye behete word full many another mo spake called ever compleint name tellen wo till nigh salt teares dreint nought heard nat pleint bethought follie thousand fold woe gan multiplie bewailing chamber thus alone friend called pandare came one vnware heard grone saw friend distresse care ala qd causeth fare mercy god vnhappe may mene han thus sone greek made lene hast thou remorse conscience art fall devotion wailest thy sinne thine offence hast ferde cought contrition god save hem besieged han toun laie iollitie presse bring lustie folke holynesse word said none thing might angry maken anger done sorrow fall time courage awaken well wist far tongue speaken na man greater hardinesse ne desired worthinesse ca qd troilus aventure hath guided thee seen languishing refuse everie creature love god praying goe hence away certes dying woll thee disease mote need deie therefore goe way ni seie thou wene thus sick drede therefore scorne nought thing take hede wel ought grekes han yet wrouyt cause deth sorow thouyt though tell thee ne lest thou wroth hide best pandare yt nigh malt wo routh full often sayed ala may friend qd ever love trouth hath er betwiren thee ne doe thou never cruelte hiden fro thy friend great care wost thou well pandare woll parten thee thy paine doe thee comfort friend right sooth saine enterparten woe glad disport shall true false report wrong right loved thee live hide thy woe fro tell blive gan sorrowfull troilus sike layd thus god leve best tellen thee sith may thee like yet woll tell though heart brest well wote thou maiest rest least thou deeme trust thee heark friend thus stant love ayenst defendeth selven alder lest availeth dispaire sorrowfully offendeth straight vnto yt death hart faileth thereto desire b enningly assaileth slaine greater ioy king grece troy suffiseth full friend pandare said wotest thou wo love god cold care hide well told never mo harmes mighten followen mo two wist thou gladnesse let sterve unknowne distresse hast thou thus vnkindly long hid fro thou fool qd pandarus peraventure thou maist one long mine vise anone may helpen v wonder thing qd troilus thou couldest never love thy selfen wisse divell maiest thou bringen blisse ye troilus hearken qd pandare though nice happeth often one are doeth full evil fare good counsail keep frend therfro selfe seen blinde man go fell could looken wide foole may eke wise man oft guide whetstone carving instrument yet maketh sharpe kerving tolis thou wost yt aught miswent eschue thou thing schole thus often wise men bewaren foolis thou doe thy wit well bewared contrarie everie thing declared might ever sweetnesse know never tasted bitternesse man wot gladnesse trow never sorrow distresse eke white blacke shame eke worthines set seemeth men may seen wise deemeth sith thus two contrary lore love oft assayed greuaunces ought connen well counsailen thee thou art dismayed eke ne ought euill apaied though desire thee beare thine heauie charge
