shall thee lasse deare wote well fared thus thy brother paris hierdesse icleped oenone wrote complaint heauinesse ye saw letter wrote gesse nay never yet iwis qd troilus qd pandare hearkeneth thus phebus first found art medicine qd coud euerie wightes care remedie rede herbes knew fine yet himselfe cunning full bare love bounden snare daughter king admete craft ne coud sorrow bete right fare vnhappie love one best smerteth sore yet peraventure reden thee nat selfe repreue cause wote well sore doeth hauke listeth play thine helpe yet somewhat say thing right siker mayest thou certaine dyen paine shall never mo discover thee ne trouth keepe nat restraine thee fro thy love although helleine thy brother wife iche wist love thee list therefore friendfullich assure tell platte thine encheson finall cause woe ye endure doubteth nothing mine entention na reprehension speake wight may bereue man love till list leue weteth well two vicis mistrusten else beleue well wote meane vice trusten wight preue trouth thy would faine remeue thy wrong conceit wight trust thy woe tell tell thou lust wise eke sayth woe alone fall hath one helpe rise sith thou hast fellow tell thy mone ni nought certaine next wise winnen love teachen v wise wallow weep niobe ye queene whose teares yet marble iseene let thy weeping thy drerinesse let v lesen woe speech may thy wofull time seeme lesse delight nought woe thy woe seech doen fooles sorrowes eche sorrowe han misaventure lusten nought sechen cure men saine wretch consolation another fellow paine ought well opinion thou love doe plaine full sorrow sooth saine certainly hard grace may sit space god woll thou art nought agast least would thy ladie thee beguile thou wost thy selfe love parde best gone sithen long sithen thou wost doe wile sith thou trusteth tell somwhat since woe thou wost yet troilus word said long lay still dead siking abraid pandarus voice lent eare vp eyen cast feare pandarus least frenseye either fall else soone deye sayd awake full wonderlich sharpe slumbrest thou litergie art thou like asse harpe heareth sound men string ply mind melodie may sinke gladen dull beastialite pandare word stent troilus nothing answerde tell nought entent never man whome yt ferde sayd men maken oft yerde maker himselfe ibeten sundrie manner wise men treten nameliche counsaile telling toucheth love ought secre himselfe woll inough spring bet gouerned eke sometime craft seeme flee fro thing effect men hunten fast gan troilus heart cast natheles heard crie awake gan sike wonder sore sayd friend though still lie deefe peace crie heard thy wordes thy lore suffer fortune bewailen thy proverb may nought availen cure canst thou none eke nill cured woll die know queene niobe let thine old ensamples thee prey friend qd pandarus therfore sey delight fooles beweepe woe seeken bote ne keepe know reason thee faileth tell wist whome thee misaventure aileth durst thou told eare thy woe sith thou darst thy self fear besought thee han routh nay qd god trouth busily qd pandarus though mine owne life lay need parde sir qd troilus thou shouldest never speed wost thou well ye dreed qd troilus ever ye conne woll wretch wonne qd pandarus ala may thou dispaired art thus causelesse liveth nat thy ladie benedicite wost thou thou art gracelesse evill alway botelesse put impossible thus thy cure sith thing come oft aventure graunt well thou endurest wo sharpe doth tesiphus hell whose stomacke foules tiren evermo highten vulture bookes tell may endure thou dwell unskilfull opinion thy woe ni curation one nill thou thy coward heart thine yre foolish wilfulnesse wantrust tellen thy sorrowes smert ne thine owne helpe businesse much speake word yea lesse lyest life nothing retch woman living coud love wretch may demen thy death thou thus die feare yolden vp thy breath greekes han besieged v iwis lord thank shalt thou thus woll saine toun atones wretch deed divel bone thou mayest alone weep cry knele love woman yt wote nought quite thou shalt feel vnknow vnkist lost vnsought many man hath love full dere ibouyt twentie winter ladie ne wist never yet lady mouth kist therfore fallen dispair receaunt owne tene slaine himselfe ladie faire nay nay ever one fresh green serve love dere heart queen thinke guerdone serve thousand part deserve word tooke heede troilus thought anon folly sooth sayd pandarus toslaien himselfe might win doen vnmanhood sinne death ladie nought wite woe god wote knew full lite thought gan full sore sike sayd ala best doe whome pandare sayed thee like best thou tell thy woe trouth thou finde thy boote full long peeces doe drawe sithen hong yea sayest thou qd troilus ala god wote nought rather full hard helpen caas well finde fortune fo ne men ride con go may cruell whele harme withstond list playeth free bond qd pandarus blamest thou fortune thou art wroth ye earst see wost thou well fortune commune everie manner wight degree yet thou hast comfort lo parde ioyes moten overgone mote sorrowes passen everichone whele stint thing tourne cesseth fortune anone sith whele way may soiourn wost thou mutabilitie whether thy self lust woll thee nought ferre fro thine helping peraventure thou hast cause sing therfore wost thou thee beseech let thy woe tourning ground list healing leech behooveth first vnwrie wound cerberus hell aie bound wer suster thy sorrow thine morrow looke vp say tell anone may gone thy need know ich aught love tell would hope rather speed tho gan veine troilus bleed hit woxe redde shame aha qd pandara beginneth game word gan shake sayd thus thou shalt name tell tho gan sely troilus quake though men han hell sayed ala woe well sweet foe called creseide well nigh word feare deide pandare herd name neven lord glad saied friend deere fare right ioves name heaven love hath beset thee well good cheere good name wisdome manere hath inough eke gentlenesse faire thou wost thy selfe gesse ne never seie bounteous estate ne gladder ne speech friendlyer ne gracious doe well ne lasse ned seech doen bet ech honour farre may stretch kinges heart seemeth wretch thy look good comfort thou certainely first point noble courage well ordaine man peace within himselfe iwis oughtest thou nought good loven well worthy place thee ought clepe happe grace also thinke therewith glad thee sith ladie vertuous followeth pitee amonges generall see thou speciall require nought ayen name vertue stretcheth shame well ever born thou beset art good place trouth love durst sworn thee never tidde fair grace wost thou thou wont chace love scorne dispite call saint idiote lord fooles often hast thou made thy nice yapes saied love servaunts overichone nicete ben verie goddes ape would monche meat alone ligging bed make hem grone thou saidest blaunch fevere praidest god never kevere hem took hem cold inough saydest thou full oft han fained oft time told waken sleepe soft thus would set hem self loft nathelesse vnder last thus saydest thou yapedest full fast yet saydest thou part lover would speake generall thoughten siker art sailing assayen may yape thee shall nathelesse though deie thou art none tho dare well seie bete thy brest say god love thy grace lord repent misspake selfe love thus say thine heart good entent qd troilus ah lord consent pray thee yapes thou foryeve shall never live thou sayst wel qd pandare hope thou goddes wrath hast appeased sith thou hast wepten many drop said thing wherwith thy god plesed would never god thou eased think well rest thy wo may thy comfort also thilk ground beareth wedes wick beareth eke holsome herb full oft next foule nettle rough thick rose wexeth soote smooth soft next valey hill loft next derke night glad morowe also ioy next fine sorrow looke attempre thy bridell best aie suffer tide else labour idell hasteth well wisely abide diligent true aie well hide lustie free persever thy servise well thou worke wise departed everie place hole writen clerkes wise wonder one grace eke wost thou fareth service plant tree herbe sondrie wise morrow pull vp blive wonder though may never thrive sith god love hath thee bestowed place digne vnto thy worthinesse stond fast good port hast thou rowed thy selfe heavinesse hope alwaie well drerinesse hast labour shend hope maken good end wost thou lasse afered matter nece trete heard say wise lered never man woman yet beyete vnapt suffer love hete celestiall el love kind thy grace hope find speake speciall beautie bethinken youth sit nought celestiall yet though list kouth truely sit well right nouth worthy knight loven cherice doe hold vice wherefore woll aye ready paine doe service please hope ye wise con counsaile keepe wise man shall wiser bee may ben gladded three trouth right thee good conceit wit gesse woll thou see thinke sith love goodnesse hath thee conuerted wickednesse thou shalt best post leue lay foe greue ensample see great clerkes erren aldermost ayen law ben conuerted wicked werkes throgh grace god lest hem withdraw arne folke han god aw strengest faithed vnderstond con errour alder best withstond troilus herd pandare assented ben helpe loving creseide wext wo saith vnturmented hotter wext love said sober chere though hart plaid blisfull venus helpe ere sterue thee pandare mow thank deserue dere friend shall wo lesse till done good eke tell wilt thou saine distresse least wroth drede iwis woll heren drede eke manere thee eme nill thing qd pandarus thou hast full great care lest chorle may fall moone lord hate thee nice fare entremete thou hast doone god love bid thee boone let alone shall thy best frend qd done right thee lest herke pandare word nolde thou wendest great follie lady desiren toucheth harme villanie dredelesse leuer die ought el vnderstood might sownen good tho lough pandarus anon answerd thy borow fie wight doth raught though stood herd thou saiest farwell woll go adieu glad god speed v two yeue labour businesse speed thine sweetnesse tho troilus gan doune knee fall pandare armes hent fast said fie greekes yet parde god shall helpen last dredelesse life may last god toforne lo hem shall smerte yet thinketh yt auaunt masterte pandare say thou wise thou wost thou maist thou art life death hole thine hond say help qd yes trouth shal god yeeld thee friend speciall qd troilus thou recommaund may death commaund pandarus tho desirous serve full friend said manere farwell think wol thy thanke deserve trouth thou shalt went way thinking matere best might beseechen grace find time thereto place every wight yt hath house found renneth nat werke begin rakel hond woll biden stound send heart line fro within alder first purpose win thus pandare heart thought cast werke full wisely ere wrought troilus lay tho lenger doun anone gat vpon stede baie field played lioun wo ye greek met daye toune manner tho forth aye goodly gat grace eche loved looked face became friendliest wight gentilest eke free thriftiest one best knight time el might dead yapes cruelte high port manner straunge hem gan vertue chaunge let v stint troilus stound fareth like man hurt sore dele king wound ylessed well healed dele easie patient lore abite goeth cure thus driueth forth aventure explicit liber primus ovt black wawes let v sail wind weather ginneth clere sea boate hath trauaile conning vnneth stere sea clepe tempestous matere deepe dispaire troilus hope kalends begin lady mine called art cleo thou spede fro forth muse rime well booke till needeth none art vse every lover excuse sentement endite latine tongue write wherefore nil neither thank ne blame worke pray mekely disblameth word lame mine authour said say eke though speake love vnfeelingly wonder nothing new blind man cannot judgen well hewis know forme speech change within thousand yere word tho hadden prise wonder nice strange thinketh hem yet spake hem spedde well love men eke winnen love sundry age sundry londs sundry ben vsages thy happe wise lover place herkeneth story woll devise troilus came lady grace thinketh nolde love purchase wondreth speech wondring every wight rome went halt nat pathe ne alway manere eke lond gamen shent men farde love men done thus open chere visiting forme said saw thy men sain ech country hath law eke scarsely ben place three love said like done purpose may liken thee thee right nought yet done shall eke men graue intre som stone wall betide sith begonne mine authour shall follow konne explicit prohemium may mother moneths glade fresh floures blew white rede ben quick ayen winter dead made full baume fleting every mede phebus doth bright beam spred right white bole betidde shall sing may day thridde pandarus wise speach felt eke part love shottes kene coud never well loving preach made hew day full oft grene shope fill day tene love wo bed went made ere day full many went swallow progne sorowfull lay morow come gan make hir waimenting forshapen ever lay pandare bed halfe slombering till nigh made waimenting tereus gan forth suster take noise gan awake call dresse vp rise remembring arrand done troilus eke great emprise cast knew good plite moone done voiage tooke way full soone vnto neces paleis beside ianus god entre thou guide come vnto neces place lady folke qd told forth gan pace found two lady sit shee within paued parlour three herden maiden hem reden geste siege thebe hem leste qd pandarus madame god see booke companie eigh vncle mine welcome iwis qd shee vp rose hond hie tooke fast said night thrie good mote turne met ye word downe bench set yea nece ye shull faren well bet god woll yeare qd pandarus sorry let hearken booke ye praisen thus god love saith tell v love good ye lere vncle qd maistresse nat yt gonnen laugh tho seide romaunce thebe rede heard king laius deide edippus sonne al dede stinten letter rede bishop booke tell amphiorax fell ground hell qd pandarus know selue thassiege thebe care hereof ben maked bookes twelue let tell ye fare way barbe shew face bare way book rise vp let v daunce let v done may obseruaunce eighe god forbid qd ye mad widdowes life god save god ye maken right sore adrad ye ben wild seemeth ye raue sat well bet aye caue bide rede holy saint liues let maiden gon daunce yong wiues ever thriue qd pandarus yet could tell thing done play vncle dere qd tell v god love thassiege awey greekes ferde dey nay nay qd ever mote thriue thing well bet fiue ye holy god qd thing bet five eighe nay iwis world ne reden ben iape trow selven tell u wit arede leane helpe god ye meane borow ne never shall qd thing told mote thrive uncle mine qd god qd woll tell blive prouder woman none live ye wist toune troy iape nat ever joy tho gan wondren thousand fold downe eyen cast never sith time bore knowen thing desired fast sike said last uncle mine nill displease asken may disease many word glade friendly tale merry chere speake gonnen wade many unkouth glad deepe matere friend done bethe ifere till gan asken hector ferde tounes wall greekes yerde full wel thanke god said pandarus save arme hath little wound eke fresh brother troilus wise worthy hector secound every vertue list habound first trouth gentlenesse wisedom honour freedom worthinesse good faith eme qd liketh faren well god save hem two trewliche hold great deintie kinges sonne armes well good condition thereto great power morall vertue selde iseene one persone ifere good faith sooth qd pandarus trouth ye king hath sonnes twey meane hector troilus certainly though dey ben void vice dare sey men liven sunne might wide iknow conne hector needeth tell world ni better knight worthinesse well well vertue hath might knoweth many wise worthy knight prise troilus sey god helpe know twey god qd hector sooth troilus thing trow dredelesse men telleth dooth armes day day worthely beareth home gently every wight prise hath hem levest praised ye say right sooth iwis qd pandarus yesterday mighten wondred upon troilus never yet thicke swarme ne flew greekes gan fleen field every wight eare crie troilus hunted hem fast na greekes blood troilus hurt doun cast aye went arraied thus death shield life u yt day ther durst none withstond yt held bloody swerd hond thereto friendliest man great estate ever saw live list best fellowship thinketh able thrive word tho pandarus blive tooke leave said woll gon hen nay blame uncle qd eileth weary thus soone nameliche woman woll ye nay sitteth doune god haue done speake wisedom er ye go every wight hem tho heard gan ferre away stond two yt hem list hond yt tale brought end estate governaunce qd pandarus time wend yet say ariseth let u daunce cast widdows habit mischaunce list thus selfe disfigure sith tidde glad aventure well bethought love god qd shal weten ye meane thing asketh leaser tho qd eke would full much greve iwis told ye tooke amis yet bette tongue hold still say sooth ayenst nece mine goddesse minerve iupiter maketh thunderring blisfull venus serve ye ben woman world living withouten paramour weting best love lothest greve ye weten well selfe leve iwis mine uncle qd graunt mercy friendship founden ever yet man beholden truely much little quit grace god emforth wit guilt shall never offend ere woll amend love god beseech ye love trist let fremed manner speech say nece list word uncle anon kist said gladly leve nece dere take good shall say gan eien doune cast pandarus cough gan lite said nece alway lo last men hem delite subtle art tale tendite yet entention tale conclusion sith end every tale strength matter behovely paint drawen length ben friend faithfully word gan right inwardly beholden looken face said mirrour much good grace thought thus tale endite ought hard make processe shall savour therein lite trow would beguile tender wittes wenen wile whereas con nat plainliche understond thy wit serven woll fond looked busie wise ware beheld ah lord qd fast ye avise saw ye never ere say ye yes yes qd bet woll ere go trouth thought ye fortunate men shall see every wight goodly aventure sometime shape receiven nill take cure cometh wilfully weiven lo neither case fortune deceiven right slouth wretchednesse wight blame gesse good aventure belie nece ye full lightly founden ye conne take love god eke catch anone least aventure slake lenger processe make yeve hond world non list wight well begon sith speake good ententioun told well beforne love well honour renoun creature world iborne othes sworne ye wroth therefore wene lie ne shall never seene eft eie beth nat agast ne quaketh nat whereto ne chaunge nat fere hew hardely worst though tale new yet trust alway ye shall find true thing thought unfitting would tale bring good eme god love prey qd come tell agast ye woll say eke longeth wit iwis whether well amis say let feare dwell woll done hearkeneth shall tell nece mine ye king dere sonne good wise worthy fresh free alway done well wonne noble troilus loveth thee ye helpe woll bane lo sey doth list make live dey ye let die woll sterven trouth nece nill lien knife throte kerven teares burst eien said ye done u dien thus guiltlesse ye fished faire mend ye though yt apaire ala lord dere trew man noble gentle knight nought desireth frendly chere see dien goeth upright hasteth full might ben slaine fortune assent ala god beautie sent ye cruell death listeth nought retch trew worthy see yaper wretch ye beaute may nat stretch make amends cruell dede avisement good nede wo worth faire gemme vertulesse wo worth hearbe also yt doth bote wo worth beauty routhlesse wo worth wight trede ech fote ye ben beautie croppe rote therewithall ne routh harme ye liven trouth also thinke well gaud lever thou honged ben baud high men might u isee thine eme shame mee well thee assent mine abet yt thine honour shent understond nought requere bind behest save onely ye make better chere ye han done ere feast life saved least plainly entent god help never ment lo request nought skill iwis ne doubt reason parde none set worst ye dreden men would wonder seen come gone ayenst answere thus anone every wight foole kind woll deeme love frendship mind woll demen tho see man temple gone image eateth thinke eke well wisely govern himselfe nothing foryetteth wher cometh pris thonk geteth eke thereto shal come seld force thogh toun beheld love frends reigneth thorow al toun wrie mantle ever mo god wi salvatioun sayd best good nece alway stint wo let daunger sugred ben alite death ye wite creseide herd wise thought shall felen wt meaneth iwis eme qd would ye devise rede done well said qd certaine best ye love ayen loving love love skilfull guerdoning thinke eke elde wasteth every hour part beaute therefore ere age thee devour go love old woll wight thee let proverbe lore unto bee late iware qd beaute past elde daunteth daunger last king foole wont cry aloud yt thinketh woman bereth hie long mote ye liven proud till crowes foot growen eie send mirrour prie ye may see face morow nece bid wish sorow stint cast head began brest wepe anone said ala wo nere dead world faith agone ala shoulden straunge unto done best friend wend rate love defend ala would trusted doubtles disaventure loved either achilles hector creature ye nolde mercy ne measure alway repreve false world ala may leve joy feast rede blisfull caas mede behest painted processe said ala right fine lady mine pallas thou dredefull case purvey astonied dey gan full sorrowfully sike ne may bet qd pandarus god shall come weke god toforne yt mistrusted thus see well ye setten light u death ala wofull wretch might yet live nought retch cruell god dispitous marte fury three hell crie let never house depart meant harme villanie sith see lord mote need die shrive sey wickedly ye done u dey sith liketh dead neptunus god see fro forth shall never eaten bread till mine owne heart blood may see certaine woll die soone hee stert way raught till againe lappe caught creseide well nigh starf feare fearfullest wight might heard eke eare saw sorowfull earnest knight praier saw eke none unright harme eke might fall gan rew dread wonder sore thought thus unhaps fallen thicke alday love manner caas men ben cruell hemselfe wicke man slee himselfe ala presence nill sollas men would deme nat say needeth full slighly play sorowfull sigh said thrie ah lord tidde sorry chaunce mine estate lieth jeopardie eke mine emes life lieth ballaunce nathelesse god governaunce shall done mine honour shall keepe eke life stint weepe harmes two lesse chese yet lever maken good chere honour emes life lese ye saine ye nothing el requere wi qd mine owne nece dere well qd woll done paine shall mine heart ayen lust constraine nill nat holden hond ne love man naught ne may ayenst el woll fonde mine honour save plesen fro day day thereto nolde one said nay dredde fantasie cesse cause aie cesseth maladie make protestacion processe ye deper go certainly salvacion though ye sterven two though world day fo ne shall never routhe graunt wel qd pandare trouthe may trust well qd thing yt ye han hight ye woll holde truely unto ye doubtlesse qd mine uncle dere ne shall cause matere qd plain ofter preach parde nedeth speach tho fill tale glade till last good eme qd tho love god u made tell first ye wisten wo wot none ye said well speake love qd preie tell bet shall purveie tho pandarus litel gan smile saied trouth shall tell daie nat gon full long within paleis gardin well gan well halfe day dwell right speaken ordinaunce grekes mighten disavaunce sone gone lepe casten dartes fro till last saied would slepe grasse adoune laied tho gan roman fro till heard walked alone began full wofully grone tho gan stalke softly behind sikerly sothe saine clepe ayen mind right thus love gan plain saied lorde routh vpon pain rebell mine entent mea culpa lord repent god thy disposicion ledest ine purveiaunce every wight lowe confession accept gree sende soche penaunce liketh thee put disperaunce may ghost departe alway fro thou shilde thy benignite certes lord sore hath wounded stode blacke loking iyen mine harte botome ifounded wot yt must nedes dien worst dare nouyt bewrien well hoter beene gledes rede men wrien ashen pale dede smote hede adoune anone gan muttre nat truely gan still waie gone lete thereof nothing wist come anon stode saied awake ye slepen long semeth nought yt love doth wrong stepen yt man may wake seie ever er dull man ye frende qd doe ye heddes ake love let liven lorde wo pale wan yet made tho freshe countenaunce though led ye newe daunce passed forth till daie fell come roming alone chambre found laie vpon bedde man sore grone ne heard never mone ne wist nought comming sodainly left complaining toke somwhat suspection nere come found wepe sore god wise saluacion never thing routh neither engine ne lore vnnethes might fro death kepe yet fele mine harte wepe god wote never sith borne busie man preach ne never wight depe sworne er told might leach rehearsen speach wofull wordes sowne ne bid nought ye woll se swone save life el nought non harme thus driven love god v hath wrouyt soche chere doth may liven plat mine hart shriven sith ye wote mine entent cleane take heede thereof none evill meane right good thrift pray god ye han soch one icaught withouten net ye wise ye faire se well ring rubie set never two well imet whan ye hole mighty god yet grant v se hour nay thereof spake ha qd helpe god ye shenden every dele mercy dere nece anon qd spake ment nought wele mar god helmed stele beth wroth blood nece dere well qd foryeven toke leave home went ye lord glad well bigon creseide arose lenger ne stent streight closet went anon set doune still stone every worde gan vp doune wind saied came mind woxe somdele astonied thought right new case whan full avised tho found right nought perill ought aferde man may love possibilite woman harte may brest nat love ayen lest sat alone thought thus thascrie arose skarmoch without men cried strete se troilus hath right put flight grekes rout gonne meine shout go se cast vp gate wide throuy strete mote paleis ride waie fro yates none dardanus open cheine come folke anone easie pace riding route tweine right happy day sothe seine men saith may distourbed shall betiden necessite troilus sat baie stede armed save hedde full richely wounded horse gan blede rode pace full softly soch knightly sight truely nat withouten faile loke mar god battaile like man armes knight seen fulfilled high prowesse body might doen thing well hardinesse eke seen geare dresse freshe yong weldy semed heaven vpon se helme hewen twenty place tissue hong backe behind shelde dashed swerds mace men might many arowe find thirled horn nerf rind aie people cried cometh ioie next brother holder vp troie wext little redde shame heard ye people vpon crien behold noble game soberliche cast adoune iyen creseide anon gan chere espien let soft hart sinke self said yave drinke thought woxe redde remembring right thus lo mine vncle swereth mote dedde mercy pite thought pure ashamed gan hedde pull fast people forth past gan cast rollen vp doun within thought excellent prowesse estate also renoun witte shape eke gentilnesse favour distresse thought routh slaen soch one ment trouth might envious iangle thus sodain love might lightly loved troilous right first sight ye parde whoso saied mote never thee every thing ginning hath nede er wrought withouten drede saie nat sodainly yafe love gan encline liken tho told manhode pine made love within gan mine processe good service wanne love sodain wise blisfull venus wele araied satte seventh house heven tho disposed wele aspectes payed helpe sely troilus wo sothe sayne na nat foe troilus nativite god wote wele sooner sped let v stente troilus throw rideth forth let v tourne fast vnto creseide heng hedde full low satte alone gan cast whereon would appoint last eme ne would cesse troilus vpon presse lorde gan thought argue matter told doen best eschue plited full oft many fold hart warme cold thought somwhat shall write mine authour listeth tendite thought first troilus person knewe sight eke gentelnesse thus said nought doen graunt love yet worthinesse honor plaie gladnesse honeste soch lorde deale mine estate also heale eke well wote kinges sonne sith hath see soch delite would vtterliche sight flie paraventure might dispite might stond wors plite wise hate purchase without nede may stande grace every thing wot lieth measure though man forbid dronkennesse nought forbiddeth every creature drinkelesse alway gesse eke sithe wot distresse ne ought thing dispise sith meaneth good wise eke know long time agone thewes good ni nice vauntour saine men certain none wise doen great vice ne al nill never cherice shall make avaunt iust cause shall never binde soche clause set case hardest iwis men might demen loveth dishonour vnto maie iche let naie parde know also alway heare se men loven woman toune wers naie withouten dout thinke eke worthie noble toune thriftiest woman honour save worthiest save onely hector best yet life lieth cure soche love eke mine aventure ne love wonder nought well wote self god spede woll man wist thought one fairest drede goodliest taketh hede men saine toune troie wonder though ioie mine owne woman well ease thanke god mine estate right yong stond vntied lustie lease withouten ielousie debate shall husbonde saine checke mate either full ielousie maisterfull loven novelrie shal doen fine live thus shall love case lest pardieux religious though mine harte set rest vpon knight worthiest kepe alway mine honor name right may doe shame right whan sun shineth brigh march chaungeth oft time face cloud put winde flight oversprat sunne space cloudy thought gan soul pace overspradde bright thought feare almost gan fall thouyt ala sith free love put ieopardie sikernesse thrallen libertie ala durst thinken folie may well folke aspie dredfull ioie constreint pain ther loveth none yt ne hath plain love yet moste stormie life right ever begonne ever mistrust nice strife love cloud sunne thereto wretched woman nothing conne whan v wo wepe sit thinke wretch wo drinke also wicked tongue ay prest speake v harme eke men ben vntrue right anon cessed lest cesseth love forth love newe harm idoe doen rue thouy men love hem first rende full sharp beginning breaketh oft ende oft time maie men rede seen treason woman hath doe fine soche love seen becometh whan go wight wote trowe wher becometh lo wight sporneth erst nothing naught turneth busie love eke must pleasen hem iangle love demen coyen hem thei saie harm though cause yet hem semen al harm folk frendes quemen maie stoppen every wicked tong soune belle rong thought gan clere saied nothing vndertaketh nothing acheveth loth dere thought hart quaketh slepeth hope drede awaketh hote cold thus bitwixen twey rist vp went pley adoune staire anon right tho went gardine neces three vp doun maden many went flexippe tarbe antigone plaien ioie see woman great rout folowed gardine yerde large railed al alies shadowed wel blosomy bow grene benched newe sonded way walketh arme arme betwene till last antigone shene gan troian song singen clere heven voier saied love shall humble subiect true mine entent best lorde yeve iche euermore mine harte lust rent never yet thy grace wight sent blisfull cause life lede ioie suretie drede blisfull god hath well beset love iwis beareth life imaginen ne could bet lorde withouten jelousie strife love one moste ententife serven well vnwerily vnfained ever lest harme distained well worthinesse trouth ground mirrour goodlihedde wit apollo stone sikernesse vertue roote lustie finder hedde whiche sorrowe fro dedde iwis love best doeth good thrift ever ithanken god love blisse bath ginne thanked ye lorde love right life inne flemen maner vice sinne doeth vertue entende daie daie amende yt saieth love vice thraldome though fele distresse either enuious right nice vnmightie shreudnesse loven soch maner folke gesse diffamen love nothing know speaken bent never bowe ye sunne worse kind right though man feblenesse iyen maie endure se bright love worst wretch crien wele worth yt may sorowe drien thy hath hedde verre fro cast stone ware werre mine harte might saied woll love vnto last owne dere harte mine owne knight whiche mine harte growen fast shall ever last dredde first love begin wote well perill song right word stent therewithall nece qd creseide made song good entent antigone answerde anon saide madame iwis goodliest maide great estate toune troie led life moste honour ioie forsothe semeth song qd tho creseide gan therewith sike saied lorde soche blisse emong lover faire endite ye wisse qd freshe antigone white folke live ne con well blisse love discrive wene ye every wretche wote parfite blisse love naie iwis wenen love one hote waie waie wote nothing men mote asken sainctes ought faire heven tell aske fendes foule hell creseide vnto purpose naught answerde saied iwis woll night fast every worde yt herde gan printen harte fast aie gan love lasse agast erst sinken harte waxe somewhat able conuarte day honour heaven iye night foe clepe thee sonne gan westren fast dounward wrie day course ironne white thing woxen al dimme donne lacke light sterres apere folke went ifere liked gon rest voided voiden ought saied slepen well leste woman sone till hedde brought whan al hust lay still thought thing maner wise rehearce needeth ye wise nightingale vpon cedre grene vnder chamber wall laie full loude song ayen mone shene paraventure birdes wise laie love made harte freshe gaie herkened long good entent till last dedde sleepe hent slept anon right tho met egle fethered white bone vnder brest long clawes iset harte rent anon harte brest gon nouyt agrose ne nothing smart forth flieth hart left hart let slepe tale holde troilus paleis ridden fro scarmishe tolde chamber sate hath abidden till two thre messenger yeden pandarus soughten full fast til found brought ye last pandarus came leaping one saied thus hath well ibete day swerdes slong stone troilus hath caught hete gan yape saied lord ye swete rise let v soupe go reste answerde thee leste hast goodly might sped hem fro souper bedde every wight doore dight whider list vpon waie sped troilus thought harte bledde wo till heard tiding saied frende shall wepe sing qd pandarus still let slepe doe thy hoode thine nedes spedde chose thou wolt sing daunce lepe short wordes thou shalt trowe sir nece woll doen well thee love thee best god trothe lacke pursute marre thy slothe thus ferforth thy werk begon fro daie daie till daie morow love frendship thee therfore hath laid faith borow algate foote hameled thy sorow lenger sermon holde ye heard tolde right flour ye cold night iclosed stoupen stalkes lowe redressen hem ayen sunne bright spreden kinde course rowe right gan tho iyen vp throwe troilus said venus dere thy might thy grace iheried pandarus held vp honds said lorde thine hole broken bond thousande troy yave eche god wi save ne might gladen lo mine harte spredeth ioye woll starte lord shal doen shal liven shall next dere harte se shall long time away driven till thou ayen fro thou maiest answere abide abide hangeth necke sothe saine great disease abideth paine easily love marte qd pandarus every thing hath time long abide till night departe also siker thou liest god toforne woll prime thy werke somewhat shall say wight charge lay parde god wot ever yet ben ready thee serve night fained emforthe wit doen thy lust shal al might doe shall saine fare aright thou nilte wite thy selfe care nought along thine evill fare wote well thou wiser art thousand fold thou god helpe would vtterly right mine owne hond write letter would tellen farde amisse beseech routh help thy self leave slouth selfe shall therewith gone thou wost worthe thou vpon courser right anone ye hardely right thy best gere ride forth place naught ne thou shalt find v may sitting window street looking thee list mayest thou v salve vpon make thou thy countenaunce thy life beware fast eschue tarien ought god shild v fro mischaunce ride forth thy way hold thy governaunce shall speake thee somewhat trow thou art gone doe thine ear glow touching thy letter thou art wise inough wot thou nilte deigneliche endite make argument tough ne scriveinishe craftely thou write beblotte thy teares eke alite thou write goodly word soft though good rehearse oft though best harpour vpon live would best souned iolly harpe ever finger five touch aye strong aye warble harpe nailes pointed never sharpe make every wight dull heare glee stroke full ne iombre eke discordaunt thing ifere thus vsen tearmes phisicke love tearmes hold thy matere forme alway doe like painter would paint pike ass foot headed ape cordeth yape counsaile liked well vnto troilus dredefull lover saied ala dere brother pandarus ashamed write amis least mine innocence saied amis nolde dispite receive dead might nothing weive pandare answerde thee lest say let therewith gone lord formed east west hope bring answere anone right hond thou nilte none let sorrie mote live ayenst thy lust helpeth thee thrive qd troilus depardieux iche assent sith thee list woll arise write blisfull god pray iche good entent voiage letter shall endite speed thou minerva white yeve thou witte letter devise set doun wrote right wise first gan right ladie call heart life lust sorowes leche blisse eche tearmes case ye lover seche full humble wise speche gan recommaund vnto grace tell asketh mokell space full lowly praied nought wroth though follie hardie write saied love made el must die pitously gan mercie crie saied lied full loud himselfe little worth lasse coud yt would conning excused little eke dradde vnworthinesse aye accused gan tell wo endlesse withouten ho said would trouth alway hold redde gan letter fold salt teares gan bathe rubie signet sette vpon wexe deliverliche rathe therewith thousand time er lette kist tho letter shette sayd letter blisfull destine thee shapen ladie shall thee see pandare tooke letter betime morrow neecis pallaice stert fast swore passed prime gan yape sayd iwis hert fresh although sore smert may sleepe never mayes morrow iollie woe lustie sorrow creseide vncle heard dreadfull heart desirous heare cause comming thus answeard faith mine vncle qd deare manner wind guideth tell v iolly woe penaunce farre forth ye put love daunce god qd hop alway behinde laugh thought heart brest qd pandarus looke alway ye finde game mine hood herkeneth lest right come toun gest greeke spie telleth new thinges come tell new tidinges garden go ye shall heare privily long sermoun wenten arm arm ifere gardin fro chamber doun farre soun spake man heren might sayd thus letter plight lo holly free recommaundeth lowly grace sent letter aviseth ye han space goodly answeare purchace helpe god plainely saine may long liven paine full dredefully tho gan stonde still tooke humble chere gan chaunge sayd scripe bill love god toucheth matere ne bring none also vncle dere mine estate regard pray lust say looketh reasonable letteth favour ne slouth sain sooth covenable mine estate god trouth take routh harming selfe repreve beare ayen ye leve pandarus gan stare sayd greatest wonder ever saw let nice fare death mote smiten thunder citie stondeth yonder would letter vnto bring take harm list thus make thus ye faren well nigh desireth serve ye retch least become whether live else sterve ever may deserve refuse qd hent fast bosome letter doune thrast said cast away anon folk may seen gauren v twey qd abide till gon gan smile said eme pray answere list selfe purvey truely woll letter write woll qd ye endite therewith lough said go dine gan himselfe yapen fast sayd nece great pine love everich day fast gan best yapes forth cast made laugh follie laughter weent die comen hall eme qd woll go dine anon gan woman call streight chamber gan gone businesse one amongs thing drede full prively letter rede avised word word every line found lacke thoght coud good vp put went dine pandarus studie stood ere ware tooke hood said ye caught ere ye wist vouchsafe qd list tho weshen set doun ete noone fall slighly pandarus gan draw window nye strete said nece hath araied thus yonder house stant aforeyene v house qd gan behold knew well whose told fellen forth speech thing smale saten window twey pandarus saw time vnto tale saw well folke awey nece mine tell qd prey liketh letter ye wot thereon trouth therewith rosy hewed tho woxe gan hum said trow aquite well god love qd selfe medes woll letter sow held honds vp sat know good nece never lite yeue labour sow plite ye writen qd tho eke say nay nece qd pandare say yet least thonketh pray good doth dey love nece dere refuseth time praiere depardieux qd god leve wele god helpe first letter ever wrote ye dele closet avise better went alone gan heart vnfetter disdaines prison lite set doune gan letter write tell short mine entent theffect ferre vnderstond thonked well ment towards holden hond nolde ne make seluen bond love suster please would aye faine done hart ease shette pandare gone sat looked strete doune set stone iasper vpon quisshen gold ibete said wisely helpe god grete never thing paine write ye restraine tooke thonked seide god wot thing full often lothe begonne commeth end good nece mine creseide ye hard ben iwonne ought glad god yonder sonne men saith impression light full lightly ben aye readie flight ye han plaied tiraunt long hard hart grave stint ye lenger hong woulden ye forme daunger save hasteth done joy trusteth well long idone hardnesse causeth dispite full often distresse right declared matere lo troilus right stretes end came riding tenth somme ifere softely thiderward gan bend sate way wend paleis ward pandare aspide said nece isee commeth ride flie seeth v suppose least may thinken ye eschue nay nay qd woxe red rose gan humbly salue dredefull chere oft hewes mue vp looke debonairely cast becked pandare forth past god wot sat horse aright goodly beseene like day god wot like manly knight dretche tell array creseide thing sey tell short liked ifere person aray looke chere goodly manner gentillesse well never sith borne ne routh distresse hath hard ben beforne god hope hath caught thorn shall nat pull next wike god send mo thornes pike pandare stood fast felt iron hot began smite said nece pray heartely tell shall asken alite woman death wite withouten gilt lack routh well done qd nay trouth god helpe qd ye say sooth ye feelen well selfe nought lie lo yonde rideth qd ye dooth well qd pandare told thrie let nice shame follie speake easing hert let nicete nat smert theron heauen done considering thing may nat shame eke soone graunten great liberte plainly entent said love vnwist might guerdon himwith nothing sight pandare thought shall nat may nice opinion shall nat ben holden fully yeares two make long sermon must assent conclusion time eve well rose tooke leve way fast homeward spedde right ioy felt heart daunce troilus found alone abedde lay done lover traunce betwixen hope derke desperaunce pandare right comming song saith lo somewhat bring said bedde soone yburied thus friend qd troilus nay help moone q pandarus thou shalt vp rise see charme sent right thee healen thee thine accesse thou forthwith thy businesse ye might god qd troilus pandarus gan letter take said parde god hath holpen v light look blake often gan heart glad quake troilus gan rede word yave hope drede finally tooke best wrote somewhat beheld thought might heart rest covered word vnder sheld thus worthy part held hope pandarus behest great wo foryede lest may day selven see wood cole kindleth fire right encrease hope therewith full oft encreaseth eke desire oke commeth little spire letter sent encreasen gan desire brent wherfore say alway day night troilus gan desiren erst hope might presen pandarus lore writen sorowes sore fro day day let nought refreide pandare somewhat wrot seide also observaunces till lover longeth caas dice turned chaunces either glad said ala held gestes aye paas answer day sorry either glad pandare alway recours pitously gan aye plaine besought rede socours pandarus saw wood paine wext well nigh dead routh sooth saine busily heart cast wo sleen fast said lord friend brother dere god wot thy disease doth wo wolt thou stinten wofull chere trouth ere day two god toforne yet shall shape thou shalt come certaine place thou maist thy self praien grace certainly thou wost ben expert love say one thing forthereth man le ser pray siker place wo bewray good heart mote routh impresse heare see guiltlesse distresse peraventure thinkest thou though kind would done begin manner routh vpon wo saith daunger nay thou shalt never win ruleth heart ghost within though bend yet stont rote effect vnto hote think ayen sturdy oke men hacketh oft none received hath happy falling stroke great sweight doth come one done great rock miln stone swifter course cometh thing wight discendeth done thing light rede boweth doun every blast full lightly cesse wind woll arise nill oke cast needeth nought long thee forvise men shall reioysen great emprise atchieved well stant withouten dout men ben lenger thereabout troilus tell thee lest thing shall asken thee thy brother thou lovest best thy heart privite iwis brother deiphebus tho qd qd pandare ere houres twise twelve shall ease vnwist himselve let alone worken may qd deiphebus went tho lord great friend ben aye save troilus man loved tell sort withouten word mo qd pandarus pray ye friend cause toucheth yes parde qd deiphebus welthou wotest ever may god tofore nere man love brother troilus say wherefore sith day bore na ne never mo ben thinke ayenst thing might thee forthinke pandare gan thank seide lo sir lady toun nece called creseide men would done oppressioun wrongfully possessioun wherefore lordship beseech ben friend withouten speech deiphebus answerd nat thou speakest thus straungly creseide friend said yes needeth qd deiphebus hardely speke trusteth well woll champion spore yerde ne raught nat though foe herde tel thou wost matere might best availen lette see qd pandarus ye lord dere woulden honour praien morrow lo came unto plaint devise adversary would agrise durst praien chargen great travaile brother mighten cause bet availe wore well might never faile ben holpen instaunce friend governaunce deiphebus comen kind honour bounty consent answerd shall done find yet greater helpe mine entent woldest thou saine heleine sent speake trow best may leden paris lest hector lord brother needeth nat praien friend heard time eke speaken creseide honour may saine bet hap hath needeth nat helpes crave shall right woll speake thou thy selfe also troilus behalfe pray u dine sit shall done qd pandarus tooke leave never gan fine neces house streight line came found fro meat arise set doun spake right wise said god ronne lo nece mine see ye nat swete whete ye thanke conne ye ware false poliphete eftsoones plete bring advocacy new qd chaunged hew dretche done wrong shall done ala yet himselfe nothing would retche nere antenor eneas ben friend manner caas love god mine uncle dere force let ifere withouten ynough u nay qd pandare shall nothing ben right deiphebus hector mine lord mo shortly maked hem fo thrift shall never win aught begin casten best done deiphebus owne courtesie came pray proper persone hold morrow companie dinner nolde denie goodly gan prayer obey thonked went upon wey done pandare anone tell short forth gan wend troilus still stone thing told word end deiphebus gan blend said time ye conne bere thee well morow wonne speke pray pitously complain let nat nice shame drede slouth sometime man mote tell owne pain beleeve woll thee routh thou shalt ben saved thy faith trouth well wot thou art drede lay arede thou thinkest cheres mosten folke espie love fare amis yet lever unwist sorrow die thinke nat thou dost great follie right founden manere sleight coveren thy chere thou shalt gone overnight blive vnto deiphebus house thee play thy maladie away bet drive thou seemeth sicke sooth say soone thy bed thee lay say thou maist lenger endure lie right bide thine aventure say thy fever wont thee take time last till morow let see well thou canst make parde sicke sorrow go farwell venus borow hope thou purpose hold ferme thy grace shall fully conferme qd troilus iwis thou needlesse counsailest sickeliche faine sicke earnest doubtlesse well nigh sterve paine qd pandarus thou shalt better plaine hast lesse need counterfete demeth men hot yt seeth swete lo hold thee thy triste close shall well deere vnto bow drive therewith tooke leave softly troilus paleis went blive glad ne never live pandarus rede gan assent deiphebus house night went nedeth tellen chere deiphebus vnto brother made axis sickeliche manere men gone clothes lade laid men would glade nought held forth aye wise ye han heard pandare ere devise certaine ere troilus leide deiphebus praied night ben friend helping creseide god wot graunted anon right ben full friend might need praien thenne bidden wood man renne morow came nighen gan time mealtide faire queene heleine shope ben houre prime deiphebus nolde faine suster homely sooth saine came dinner plaine entent god pandare wist ment came eke creseide innocent antigone nece tarbe also flie prolixitie best love god let v fast go right theffect withouten tale mo folke assembled place let v salvings pace great honour hem deiphebus certaine fedde hem well might like evermo ala refraine good brother troilus sike lithe yet therewithall gan sike pained glade hem might chere good made complained eke heleine sicknesse faithfully pitie every wight gan wexen ax leche anon said manere men curen folke charme wol thee lere sate one list nat teche thought yet best could ben leche complaint gonnen preise folk yet wight hath begon preise man preise reise thousand fold yet higher sonne lord conne pandarus would afferme nought forgate praising conferme herd thing fair creseid well inough every word gan notifie sober chere heart lough ne would glorifie mowen knight done live die passe least ye long idwell fine ever tell time came fro dinner rise hem ought arisen everychone gane devise pandarus brake speech anone said deiphebus woll ye gone erst preide speaken nedes creseide heleine hond held tooke first tale said go blive goodly creseide beheld said ioves let never thrive doth harm reve sone live yeve sorrow shall rue may folke true tell thou thy nice case qd deiphebus pandarus thou canst best tell lord lady stant thus lenger qd dwell rong hem proces like bell vpon foe hight poliphete hainous men might spete answerd ech worse hem poliphete gonnen thus warien honged one brother shall ne may nought varien lenger tale tarien plaineliche one highten ben frend yt ever mighten spake heleine said pandarus wot aught lord brother mater meane hector wote troilus said ye woll ye thinketh thus sith troilus good ye would assent told selfe ere went wol grefe hart lo lady woll right start wete anone iwis sleepe woll aught lept said ere god thy soul brought thy bere smilen gan tho troilus pandarus without reckoning went anon heleine deiphebus said hem tarying ne prease woll well ye bring creseide lady may enduren woll well ye wote chamber lite folke may lightly make warme looketh ye woll wite bring prease might done harme diseasen better arme yet bette bid till oft soonis looke ye knowen donis say best know wight ne wend ye twey cannot throw rehearse case vnlike sey may one prey ben good lord short take leve may mokell ease reve eke straunge woll forbere ease dare nat eke thing toucheth nat woll tell wote well right secret townes prow knew nothing entent without croilus went heleine goodly soft wise gan salve womanly play saied iwis ye mote algate arise faire brother hole pray gan arme right shoulder lay wit recomfort best could gan disport qd beseke dere brother deiphebus love god doeth pandare eke good lord friend right hartely vnto creseide certainly received wrong wot well pandare case well bet declare pandarus gan new tong affile case rehearse anone saied soone qd troilus soone may gone wol right faint might ben one god trouth cause sustene good thrift ye qd helein ye quene qd pandarus may take leave ere go el god forbid tho qd vouchsafe word qd troilus ye two deiphebus suster lefe dere speake matere avised rede better found hap bed hedde copie treatise letter hector sent asken rede man worthy ben dede wote naught grisly wise praied hem anone avise deiphebus gan letter vnfold earnest great heleine queene roming outward fast gonne behold dounward steire herbor greene ilke thing redden hem betwene largely mountenaunce houre goone reden poure let hem rede tourne anone pandarus gan full soft prie well gan gone great chamber hie saied god save companie come nece mine lady queene heleine abideth eke lord tweine rise take nece antigone list force hardely lasse prease bet come forth looke ye thonken humbly hem three ye may goodly time isee taketh hem leave least long restes bireave innocent pandarus entent qd tho creseide go vncle dere arme arme inward went avising well word chere pandarus earnestfull manere saied folke god love pray stinteth right softly play aviseth folke ben within plite one god amend inward thus full softely begin nece coniure highly defend halfe soule v send vertue corounes twaine slea nat man yt hath paine fie deuill thinke plite lieth come anone think taried tide lost ni woll ye saine ye one secondly yet deuineth none vpon two come ye conne folke blent lo time wonne titering pursute delay folke devine wegging stre though ye would han merry day dare ye nat spake word thus looked least time lost dare nat deale come therfore bringeth heale ye lover ben troilus nat cankedort lay might wispring hem thoght lord right renneth sort fully die anone comforte first time pray love mightie god shall say explicit liber secundus blisfull light bemes clere adorneth third heaven faire sonnes lefe ioues doughter dere pleasaunce love goodly debonaire gentle heart aye ready repaire cause heale gladnesse iheried thy might thy goodnesse heaven hell earth salt see felt thy might well discerne man beast fish herbe grene tree fele time vapour eterne god loveth love woll naught werne world life creature withouten love worth may endure ye ioues first thilke affect glade thing liven commenden amorous hem made mortall thing list aye ye yeve hem love ease aduersite thousand formes doune hem sent love yearth list hent ye fiers mar appeasen ire list ye maken heart digne algates hem ye woll set fire dreden shame vice resigne ye doen curteis fresh benigne high low wight entendeth ioies yt hath might sendeth ye holden reigne house vnitie ye soothfast cause friendship ben also ye knowen thilke couered qualitie thing folke wondren nat construe may go loveth loveth fish nat commeth ye folke law set vniuerse know hem lover striveth hath werse ladie bright thy benignite reuerence hem serven thee whose clerke teacheth devise joy felt thy servise yea naked heart sentement hilde shew thy sweetnesse caliope thy voice present need seest thou nat distresse mote tell anon right gladnesse troilus venus herying nede hath god bring incipit liber tertius lay meane troilus recording lesson manere mafey thought thus woll say thus thus woll plaine vnto lady dere word good shall chere nill nat foryetten wise god leve werken devise lord hart gan quappe hearing come short sike pandarus ledde lappe came nere gan curtein pike saied god doe bote sike see comen visite lo death wite therewith seemed wept almost qd troilus routhfully whether wo mighty god thou wost see nat truely sir qd creseide pandare ye sweet hart ala may nat rise kneele honour wise dressed vpward right tho gan honds soft vpon ley love god doe ye qd eye sey sir comen cause twey first thonke lordship eke continuaunce would beseke troilus heard ladie pray lordship wox neither quick ne dedde ne might word shame say although men shoulden smiten hedde lord wox sodaineliche redde sir lesson wende conne praien wit ironne creseide aspied well ynough wise loved never ye lasse nere apert made tough bold sing foole masse shame gan somwhat passe reason may rime hold woll tell teachen bookes old chaunged voice right drede voice eke quoke thereto manere goodly abasht hewes rede pale vnto creseide ladie dere looke doun cast humble iyolden chere lo alder first word astart twice mercy mercy sweet hart stint might bring next word god wote faithfully konning ben god soule save shall till wofull wight grave though dare ne vnto plaine wi suffer lasse paine thus much ah womanliche wife may bring displease shall wreke vpon mine owne life right soone trow hart ease death heart may appease sen ye han heard somewhat sey retch never soone dey therewith manly sorrow behold might made hart stone rew pandare wept water would poked ever nece new new saied wo begon heart true love god make thing end slea u one ere ye wend qd god trouth nat ye wilne sey eye qd yt ye routh god love doeth nat dey thus qd woll prey tell fine entent yet wist never well ment mean sweet hart dere qd troilus goodly fresh free streames eyen clere ye shoulden sometime friendly see agreen may ben hee withouten braunch vice wise trouth alway servise lady right cheefe resort witte diligence right list comfort vnder yerde egall mine offence death breake defence ye digne much honour commaunden aught hour ben humble true secret paine patient ever desiren freshly new serven ben aye like diligent good heart holly talent receiven well sore smart lo meane mine owne sweet hart qd pandarus lo hard request reasonable lady werne nece mine natall ioves feest god ye sterve yerne heren wel man wol nothing yerne honour seene almost sterve ben loth suffer serve gan eyen cast full easily full debonairely avising hied fast never word saied softely mine honour safe woll well truely forme devise receiven fully servise beseeching god love would honour trouth gentillesse well meane eke meanen well mine honour wit businesse aye kepe may doen gladnesse henceforth iwis nill faine beth hole lenger ye ne plaine nathelesse warne qd king sonne although ye iwis ye shall soverainte love right case ne nill forbeare ye doen amis wrath ye serve cherishen right ye deserve shortly dere hart knight beth glad draweth lustinesse shall truely withall full might bitter tournen sweetnesse may doe gladnesse every wo ye shall recover blisse armes tooke gan kisse fell pandarus knee eyen heaven threw held honds hie immortall god qd maiest dien cupide meane maiest glorifie venus thou maiest maken melodie withouten hond seemeth yt toune miracle iche eche bell soune ho mattere folke woll comen anone letter redde lo hem conjure thee creseide one two thou troilus thou maist gone mine house ye ben warning full well shall shapen comming easeth hart right ynough let see shall beare bell speak love aright therwith lough leiser tell qd troilus long shall dwell ere doen qd thou maiest rise thing shall right list devise heleine also deiphebus tho comen upward right staires end lord tho gan gronen troilus brother suffer blend qd pandarus time wend take nece mine leave hem three let hem speak commeth forth tooke leave hem full thriftely well could reverence vnto full didden hartely wonder well speaken absence praising excellence governaunce wit manere commendeden joy let wend unto owne place tourne unto troilus againe gan full lightly letter pace deiphebus garden seine heleine would feine delivered ben saied lest slepe tale rest heleine kist tooke leave blive deiphebus eke home went every wight pandarus fast may drive troilus tho came line right paillet glad night troilus lay merry chere tale well hem ifere every wight voided two dores fast ishet tell short withouten word mo pandarus without let vp rose beddes side set gan speaken sober wise troilus shall devise mine alderlevest lord brother dere god wot thou sate sore thee saw languishing love thy wo woxe alway might lore ever sithen doen businesse bring thee joy distresse brought plite thou wost thou stondest way faren well say bost wost thou shame say thee begon gamen play never doen shall eft tho thousand fold brother say thee becomen betwixen game earnest meane maken woman unto men comen say nat thou wost well meane thee nece vice cleane fully made thy gentillesse trist shall ben right thy selfe list god woteth take witnesse never covetise wrought abredge distresse wch welnie thou didest thought good brother thee ought god love kepe blame sin thou art wise save alway name well thou wost name yet emongs people saith halowed man unbore dare well swere ever wist amis wo cause may thinken nece dere eme traitour eke ifere wer wist yt mine engine mine nece iput fantasie doen thy lust holly thine world would upon crie say worst trecherie case ever begon fordone thou right nought iwon wherfore ere woll gone paas yet eft thee beseech fully say privete go u caas saine thou u never wray wroth though thee oft pray holden secre high mattere skilfull thou wost well praiere thinke wt wo hath betid ere making avauntes men rede mischaunce world yet fro day day right wicked dede wise clerkes ben dede ever proverbed u young first vertue kepe toung nere wilne abredge diffusion speech could almost thousand old story thee alledge woman lost false fooles bost proverbes canst thy selfe inow wost ayenst vice blabbe saied men sooth often gabbe tongue ala often beforne hast thou made many lady bright hew saied welaway day borne many maiden sorrow new part untrew men yelpe brought preve kind none avauntour leve avauntour lier one thus pose woman graunt love saieth woll none sworne holden secree tell two three iwis vauntour lest lier eke breake behest looke blame maner folk wt shall clepe hem hem avaunt woman name yet behight hem never ne ne know hem mine old hat wonder god send hele though woman dreden u men dele say mistrust ne wise men fooles nice harme world well follie oft mallice well wote wise folke vice woman dredeth well avised wise fooles harme chastised purpose leve brother dere thing saied mind keep thee close good chere thy day thou shalt true find shall thy processe set kind god toforne shall thee suffise shall right thou wolt devise well wote thou meanest well parde therefore dare fully undertake thou wost eke thy lady graunted thee day set charter make good night may lenger wake bid sith thou art blisse god send death lisse might tellen halfe joy feste soule troilus tho felt hearing theffect pandarus beheste old wo made heart swelt gan tho joy wasten melt richesse sighes sore one fled felt hem right holts hayis han winter dead ben dry revesten hem grene may every lusty listeth pley right selfe wise sooth sey woxe suddainly heart full joy gladder never man troy gan looke pandarus cast full soberly friendly see saied friend aprill last well thou wost remember thee nigh death wo thou found thou diddest thy businesse know cause distresse thou wost long forbare say thee art man best trist perill none thee bewray wist well tell thee list sith loth thy selfe wist durst mo tellen matere quake wight may u nathelesse god thee swere list may world governe lye achilles spere mine heart cleave life eterne mortall late yerne would bewray durst conne good god made sonne rather die would determine thinketh stocked prison wretchednesse filth vermine captive cruell king agamenmon temple toun vpon god woll thee swere morow day thee liketh thou hast much idoen ne may nevermore deserve know well might thee thousand time morow sterve woll thee serve right thy slave whether thou wend evermore unto life end mine hart thee beseech never thou deme folly shall saine thought thy speech thou dost companie wenen baudrie wood leud wote well parde goeth gold richesse message call ye list thou dost call gentlenesse compassion fellowship trist depart wide wist diversitie required betwixen thing like lered thou know thinke ne wene service shame iape faire sister polexene cassandre helein frape never faire well ishape tell thou wilt everychone thine let alone sith yt thou hast done service life save none hope mede love god great emprise performe nede high low withouten drede woll alway thine hestes kepe good night let u slepe thus held hem ech well apaied world ne might bet amend morrow araied ech owne need gan entend troilus though fire brend sharpe desire hope pleasaunce forgate good governaunce manhood gan restrain ech rakell deed ech unbridled chere liven sooth saine ne wist word manere yt ment touching matere every wight ferre cloud wise well dissimulen coud devise life full might day martes high servise saine armes knight part long night lay thought might serve lady best thanke deserve nill sweare although lay soft thought na somwhat diseased ne tourned pillowes oft would missed ben eased case men nat alway pleased naught wote deeme possibilite certaine purpose go written geste saw lady sometime also spake yt durst leste avise best appointeden full warely need durst would proceed spoken short wise awaite alway feare least wight divinen devise would hem two lay eare world lefe hem ne cupide would hem grace send maken speech right end thilke little yt spake wrought wise ghost tooke aye hede seemed wist thought withouten word nede bid aught doen aught forbede thought yt love come late joy opened yate shortly processe pace well werke word beset full stood lady grace twenty thousand time ere let thonked god ever met could governe servise world ne might bet devise found discreet secret obeisaunce well felt wall steel shield every displeasaunce good governaunce wise afered meane ferre aught ben requered pandarus quicke alway fire ever ilike prest diligent ease friend set desire shone aye fro sent letter bare troilus absent never man friendes nede ne bare bet withouten drede peraventure man waiten would every word sond looke chere troilus rehearcen unto lady dere trow long thing wight stant disjoint word every looke point forsooth herd done ere story none ne man wene though would could iwis epistle hem betwene would saith mine autor wel contene ny half boke list write line endite great effect say thus stonden concord quiete ilke two creseide troilus told time swete save onely often might mete ne leisure speech fulfell befell right shall tell pandarus ever might right fine shall speake bringen house night faire nece troilus ifere leiser high matere touching love full bound doubt time found great deliberation every thing thereto might availe forne cast put execution nether left cost ne travaile come hem list hem nothing faile ben aught aspied wist well impossible dredelesse clere wind every pie every let game well world blind matter fremed tame timber ready frame v lacketh naught yt weten wouldd certaine houre comen shoul troilus purveyaunce knew full waited aye hereupon eke made great ordinaunce found cause therwith arraye missed night day thought servise gone done sacrifice must soch temple alone wake answered apollo first sene holy laurer quake er apollo spake tree tellen next whan greek flie thy let man god forbede pray apollo helpe nede litell done pandare shortly saine right sone upon chaunging ye mone whan lightlesse ye world night twaine welken shope raine streight morow unto nece went ye well herde fine entent comen gan anon play wont himselfe yape finally swore gan say escape lenger done gape certainly must leve come soupen house eve lough gan first excuse said raineth lo gone let qd ne stonde thus muse mote ye shal come anone last hereof fell one el fast swore eere nolde never comen sone gan rowne asked troilus swore nay towne said nece suppose durst never thereof fere rather men might aspie lever thousand folde die naught list mine auctour fully declare thought whan said troilus towne ifare said thereof soth withouten awaite go graunted sith besought nece obeyed ought nathelesse yet gan besech although gone fere beware gofisshe people spech dremen thing never wel avise brought said eme sen must trist loke al wel list swore stockes stone goddes heven dwell el leaver soule bone pluto king depe ben hell tantalus tell whan al wel rose toke leve souper came whan eve certaine number men faire nece antigone woman nine ten glad trowe yee troilus stode might see throughout litel window stewe ther beshet sith midnight mewe vnwist every wight pandare point yt come al ioy al frendes fare eme anon armes hath nome souper al whan time full softe hem set god wot deinte ferre fet souper gonnen rise ease well hart full fresh glade wel coude best devise liken laughen made songe plaide told tale wade last every thing hath end toke leave neds would thence wend fortune executrice wierdes influence hevens hie soth vnder god ben hierdes though v beestes ben cause wrie mene gan homward hie execute beside leve goddes wil must bleve bente mone horne pale saturnus iove cancro ioyned raine heven gan availe every maner woman smoky raine feere pandare tho lough said thenne time lady go henne good nece might ever please thing pray qd mine hart great ease dwell al night owne house parde trouth say nat game wende shame creseide yt could much good halfe world toke hede praire sen rained al flode thouyt good chepe may dwel graunt gladly frendes chere thonk grutch abide home go may nat well betide wol qd mine vncle liefe dere sen list skill right glad dwellen said againe would go iwis graunt mercy nece qd tho agame sothe tell glad sen list dwel thus al wel tho began aright new ioy al fest againe pandarus goodly might would hied bedde full faine said lord huge raine wether sleepen rede v soone begin nece wote ye woll lay shul liggen ferre sonder ye neither shullen dare say noise raine ne yet thonder god right closet yonder wol vtter house alone ben wardain woman everichone middle chambre ye se shal woman slepen wel soft said shal selven ye liggen wel night come oft careth wether aloft wine anone lest go slepe trowe best ni hereafter sone voide dronke travers draw anone gan every wight hath nought done place chambre gone ever stereliche rone blewe therwith wonderliche loude wel nigh man heren coude tho pandarus eme right ought woman ful glad vnto beddes side brought toke leave gan ful lowe lout said closet dore without right overtwhart woman liggen ye list hem ye may sone call lo closet laid al woman forth ordinaunce bedde said na skippen praunce boden go bedde mischaunce wight stering let hem slepen abedde pandarus yt wel couth eche adele old daunce every point therin saw thing wele thought wold vpon werke begin gan stewe dore al soft vnpin still stone without lenger let troilus adoun right set shortly point right gone al werke told worde end said make thee redy right anone thou shalt heven blisse wend blisfull venus thou grace send qd troilus never yet dede er ne halfendele drede qd pandarus ne drede thee never dele shal right thou wolt desire thriue night shall make e casten gruel fire yet blisful venus night thou enspire qd troilus wi serve ever bet bet shall till sterve venus ful mirth aspectes badde mar saturne thou combuste let birth thy father pray al thilke harme disturne grace glad ayen may turne love thou lovedst shawe mean adon bore slawe iove eke love faire europe forme bulle away thou fet help mar thou thy blody cope love cipria thou naught ne let phebus think daphne herselven shet vnder ye barke laurer woxe drede yet love help nede mercurie love eke pallas aglauros wroth helpe eke diane beseke viage nat loth fatall sustren cloth shapen destine sponne helpeth werke begonne qd pandarus thou wretched mouces hert art thou agast bite furred cloke thy sherte folow wol wite bide let gon alite gan vndone trappe troilus brought lappe sterne winde loude gan rout wight noise might laien dore without ful sikerly slepten al ifere pandarus ful sobre chere goth dore anon withouten lette lay softly shette came ayen prively nece awoke asketh goeth owne dere nece qd ne wondreth ne fere nere came said eere worde love god besech let wight arise spech way ye comen benedicite qd vnwiste hem secrete trap dore qd qd tho creseide let wight call eigh god forbid fall qd pandarus ye foly wrought might dementhing never erthoust nat good sleping hound wake ne yeve wight cause devine woman slepen al vndertake hem house men might mine slepen wollen till sunne shine tale brought end vnwist right came wol wende nece mine ye shul well vnderstonde qd ye woman demen hold love man honde lefe dere hart call maken howne call mene love mene doth selfe shame gile wherby tel al ye wote selfe wel wight love al fully graunted troilus worthiest wight one world thereto trouth iplight alone ye nold never falsen ye liven stonte thus yt sith fro went troilus right platly seine gutter privy went chambre come al reine vnwist every maner wight certaine save selfe wisely joy faith owe priam troy come paine distresse al fully wood sodainly mote fal woodnesse god helpe cause saith tolde frende yt ye loven one hight horast sorow night shal last creseide al wonder herde gan sodainly hart cold sighe sorowfully answerd ala wende ever tale told dere hart woulden nat hold lightly faulse ala conceites wrong harm done live long horaste ala falsen troilus know god helpe qd ala wicked spirite told thus certes eme morow se shal therof full excusen ever woman like word gan ful sore sike god qd worldy selinesse clerkes callen false felicite ymedled many bitternesse ful anguishous god wote qd condicion veine prosperite either joyes comen nat ifere el wight hath hem alway brotil wele mannes joy vnstable wt wight thou thou play either wote thou joy art mutable wote nat mote ben one tway wot nat may say hath joy silinesse ignorance aie derkenesse wote ioy transitory every joy worldly thing mote flee every time hath memory drede lesing maketh may parfite sikernesse lese joy set mite semeth joy worth ful lite wherefore wol define matere truely aught espie wele world thou wicked serpent ialousie thou misbeleved enuious folie hast thou troilus made vntrist never yet agilte wist qd pandarus thus fallen caas vncle mine qd told doth dere herte thus ala ye wote ye nece mine qd hope al shal wel amis ye may quenche al lest doeth right hold best shal morow iwis qd god toforne shall suffice morow ala faire qd nay nay may nat stonden wise nece mine writen clerkes wise peril dretching drawe nay soche abode ben nat worth hawe nece thing hath time dare avow chambre fire hall well nede sodainly rescow disputen aske amongs candle strawe fall ah benedicite al among fare harme done farwel feldefare nece mine ne take nat grefe ye suffre al night wo god helpe ye never lefe date sain two wel wote ye wol nat ye ben wise done great folie put life al night jeopardie never lefe god wene ye never thing lefe qd thrifte qd shall sene sith ye make ensample iche al night would sorow se al treasour tonne troie bidde god never mote joie loke ye ben love put life al night jeopardie thing nought god nat onely delay cometh folie malice nat lie platly ye suffre distresse ye neither bounte done ne gentilnesse qd tho creseide wol ye done thing ye therwith shal stinte al disease bere blew ring nothing might better plese save selfe ne hart apese say dere harte sorow causelesse shal sene morow ring qd ye hasel wodes shaken ye nece mine ring must stone might deed men live maken ring trowe yee none discrecion heed gone fele qd routh time ilost wel maist thou cursen slouth wote ye wel noble hie corage ne soroweth nat ne stinteth eke lite foole jalous rage nolde setten sorow mite fesse fewe wordes white another day might find thing stant al another kind gentle tender hart death wol sorows wreke trust well sore smart woll jealous wordes speke thy nece er hart breke speke selfe matere worde ye may hart stere told peril coming vnwist every wight ne parde harme may none ne sin wol self night ye know eke owne knight right ye must vpon triste al prest fetch liste accident pitous eke like sothe prime face troilus knight dere priue comming liker place though grace considred thing stood wonder sen al good creseide answerde wisely god rest soule bring wo eme iwis faine would best grace whether ye dwell go till god better minde send dulcarnon right wittes end qd pandarus ye nece wol ye dulcarnon called fleming wretch semeth herd wretch wol nought lere slouth wilfull etches said hem worth two fetch ye ben wise ye han hond ni neither harde ne skilfull withstond eme qd doeth list ere come wol vp first arise love god sen trist two ye beth bothe wise werketh discrete wise honour may plesaunce al gouernaunce wel said qd nece dere good thrifte wise gentill hart liggeth still taketh right nedeth nat ferther start eche easeth sorowes smart love god venus herie sone hope shall ben merie troilus full sone knee sette ful sobrely right beddes heed beste wise lady grette lord woxe sodainliche reed ne though men smiten heed could word right bring sodainly sodaine coming pandarus wel could fele every thing play anon began said nece se lord gan knele trouth se gentil man worde quishen ran saied kneleth thou lest god hart bring sone rest naught sain forshe bad nat rise sorow put remembraunce el toke wise duetie observaunce well find pleasaunce kist although siked sore bad sit adoun withouten qd pandarus wol ye well begin doth sitte downe good nece dere vpon beddes side al within ech bet may worde drew ye fiere toke light founde countenaunce loke vpon olde romaunce creseide troilus lady right clere stode ground sikernesse thought seruaunt knight ne none vntrouth gesse nathelesse considred distresse love cause folie thus spake jalousie lo hert mine would excellence love ayenst man may ne ought eke goodly maken resistence eke bicause felte wel say great trouth service every day yt hart al mine soth saine droue rewe vpon paine goodnes founden alway yet may dere hert al knight thanke ferre wit al nat much right emforth conning might aie shal sore ye smert ben trew hole mine hert dredelesse yt shal founden preue hert mine al sain shall well told yt nouyt greue though right self complain meane finally pain halte harte mine heauinesse fully slaine every wrong redresse good mine ne jelousie ala wicked wivere thus causelesse cropen harme would faine delivere ala hole slivere refute digne place iove sone hart race thou auctour nature honour thy dignite folke vngilty suffren iniure gilty al quite goeth lefull plaine vndeserved sufferest jalousie would vpon thee plaine crie eke al wo folke vsen saine right thus ye jalousie love would bushel venim al excusen grane love shove wote high iove sit liker love hate grame ought beare name certaine maner jalousie excusable iwis whan cause fantasie pite well expressed vnneth doeth saith amis goodly drinketh vp al distresse excuse gentilnesse full fury despite surmounteth repression hart mine ye plite thonke god passion nat call illusion haboundance love beste cure doth hart disease endure sory wrothe deuoir hart rest list ordal othe sorte wise lest love god set preue best gilty die ala might done seie bright teeres new eien fel thus seid god thou wost thought ne dede untrew troilus never yet creseid heed doun bed leid shete wrigh sighed sore held pece nat word spake help god quench al sorow hope shall best may sene ful misty morow folowen ful oft mery somers day winter foloweth grene may men sene day reden eke story sharpe shoures ben victory troilus wordes herde ye care list nat slepe thought stroke yerde see creseide lady wepe well felt harte crepe every teare creseide astert crampe death straine ye hert minde gan time accurse came borne wicke tourned worse labour hath doen beforne wendeit lost thought na lorne pandarus thought ala thy wile serveth nought welaway therwithall hing adoun hedde fell knee sorowfully sight might sain felt na dedde wroth yt sorows light nathelesse speaken might said thus god wote yt game wist blame therwith sorow hart shet iyen fell nat tere every spirite vigour knet astonied oppressed feling sorow fere aught el fledde toune doune fell sodainly swoune little sorow se husht pandare fast nece peace lost qd bethe nat agast certain last bedde cast saied thefe man herte rent bare sherte saied nece ye helpe u ala owne troilus forlorne iwis would wist full fain qd ala borne ye nece woll ye pullen thorne sticketh hart qd pandare say foryeve stint fare ye qd full lever good sunne goeth therwithall swore eare iwis dere hart
