wrothe trouth many othe speake creseide naught yet might nat abreide therwith poulce paums hondes gan frote wete temple twain deliver fro bitter bondes oft kist shortly sain rewaken pain last gan breath drawe swough sone adawe gan bet minde reason take wonder sore abashed iwis sigh gan bet awake said mercy god thing ye selven thus amis qd tho creseide man game troilus woll ye thus shame therwithal arm laied foryave oftime kest thonked spake saied fill purpose harte rest answerde lest goodly wordes disport gan oft sorowes comfort qd pandarus ought aspies light ne se ven naught light nat good sike folkes iyes love god sen ye brought good plite let none hevy thought hanged harte twey bare candle chimney soone though nede soche othes list devise hem take thought tho fere ne cause eke none bid then rise yet lesse thing othes may suffice many case every wight gesse loveth well meaneth gentilnesse effect would wete anon man eke also jalous sen cause non eke signe toke bade tell busily el certain bare honde doen malice fonde withouten shortly sain must obey unto lady hest ye lasse harme must somwhat fain saied whan soche fest might loked lest nat dere inough rishe nedes must cause fish answerde swete harme yt sen non evill meane god bought u two maner thing mine entent cleane soch argument ne nat worth beane woll ye childish ialous counterfete worthy ye ibete tho troilus gan sorowfully sike lest wroth thouyt hart deide saied ala upon sorowes sike mercy swete hart mine creseide tho wordes seide wrong woll trespace doeth list grace answerde gilt misericorde saine foryeve evermore night recorde bethe well ware ye amis nay dere harte mine qd iwis qd smart foryeve mine owne swete hart troilus blisse surprised put goddes hand ment nothing well sodainly avised armes fast hent pandarus full good entent laied slepe saied ye wise sweveneth lest folke arise might may sely larke say yt sparhauke hath fote ilke tway tale sugre sote though tary yeere sometime mote mine aucthour tellen gladnesse well tolde hevinesse creseide felt thus itake writen clerkes bokes old right aspen lefe gan quake whan felt armes fold troilus hole care cold gan thanken tho blisfull goddes seven sondry pain bring folk heven troilus armes gan straine saied swete ever mote gone ye caught twaine yeldeth boote none creseide answerde thus anone ne er swete harte dere yolde iwis soth saied healed fever great sicknesse men must drinken often se full bitter drinke gladnesse men drinken oft pain great distresse meane aventure pain hath founden al cure swetnesse semeth far swete bitternesse assaied biforne wo blisse flete non soch felten seus borne bet bothe two lorne love god take every woman hede werken thus come nede creseide quite every drede tene cause trist made soche feast joy sene trouth cleane entent wist tree many twist bitrent writhe swete wodbinde eche hem armes winde newe abashed nightingale stinteth first whan beginneth sing heareth heerdes tale hedge wight stearing siker doeth voice ring right creseide whan drede stent opened hart told entent right yt seeth death ishapen dien mote aught may gesse sodainly rescous doeth hem escapen death brought sikernesse world soche present gladnesse troilus hath lady swete worse hap god let u never mete armes smal streight backe soft side long fleshy smooth white gan stroke good thrift bad full oft snowisse throte brest round lite thus heaven gan delite therwithall thousand time kist doen ioy unneth wist saied thus love charite thy mother eke citheria swete thy selfe next heried venus meane well willy planete next imeneus thee grete never man goddes hold ye brought fro care cold benigne love thou holy bond thingen woll grace list thee honouren lo desire woll fly withouten wingen noldest thou bounte hem socouren serven best alway labouren yet lost dare well sain certes thy grace passed desertes thou lest thonke coud deserve nombred unto thy grace hast holpen likely sterve bestowed high place thilke bound may blisse surpace la de reverence thy bounte thine excellence therwithall creseide anon kist certain felt disease thus saied would god wist mine hart swete best might please man qd ever thus ease fairest best ever sey deineth rest may men seen mercy passeth right experience felt unworthy swete wight harte mine benignite thinke though unworthy yet mote nede amenden wise right vertue hie service love god lady dere sith hath wrouyt shal serve thus meane woll ye fere doe live list sterve teacheth may deserve thonk mine ignoraunce ne doe nothing displeasaunce certes freshe womanliche wife dare say trouth diligence shall ye finden life ne woll certain breaken defence doe present absence love god let slea dede like unto womanhede iwis qd mine owne harte lust ground ease al mine harte dere graunt mercy trust let u fall away fro matere suffiseth said worde without repentaunce welcome kniyt peace suffisaunce delite ioies one least impossible wit say judgeth ye feast soche gladnesse list play thus ilke tway night betwixen drede sikernesse felten love great worthinesse blisfull night hem long isought blithe unto hem bothe two thou ne soch feast soule ibouyt ye least joy away thou foule daunger thou fere let heaven blisse dwell high ne tell sothe though tellen mine aucthour excellence yet saied god toforne shall every thing holly sentence love reverence worde eched best doeth therwithall right selven lest word every part speake hem correction feling love art put discrecion encrease make diminicion language beseech purpose rather speech ilke two armes laft lothe hem sonder gon eche wenden biraft el lo fere thing nice dreames ful oft ech hem said swete clippe thus el doe mete lord gan goodly se never loke ne blent face saied dere harte may soth ye beene place ye harte mine god thanke grace qd tho creseide therwithall kist spirite joy nist troilus full often iyen two gan kisse saied iyen clere ye wrought soche wo ye humble nettes lady dere tho mercy written chere god wote text full harde find coud ye withouten bonde bind therwith gan fast armes take well hundred time gan sike sorrowfull sighes men make wo el folke sike easie sighes soche like shewed affection within soche maner sighes could blin sone spake sondry thing fill purpose aventure plaiyng enterchaungeden ring tellen scripture well wot broche gold azure rubbie set like herte creseide yave stacke sherte lord trowe ye coveitous wretch blameth love halte dispite tho pen muckre ketch ever yet yave soche delite love poinct plite nay doubtelesse al god save parfite joy may nigard woll say yes lord lie tho busie wretch full wo drede callen love woodnesse follie shall fall hem shall rede shal forgon white eke rede live wo ther god yeve hem mischaunce every lover trouth avaunce would god tho wretch dispise service love eares also long mida full covetise thereto dronken hotte strong cresus affectes wrong teachen hem vice lover although hold hem nice ilke two say whan harte well assured tho gonnen speake play eke rehearcen knew first every wo fere passed heavinesse thonke god tourned gladnesse evermore yt hem fell speake thing soche time agone kissing tale breake fallen new ioy anone didden might sen one recoveren blisse ease paised wo ioyes counterpaise reason woll speake slepe accordeth mattere god wote toke full little kepe lest night hem dere ne vaine escape manere biset ioy businesse al souneth vnto gentilnesse cock commune astrologer gan brest heate crowe lucifer day messanger gan rise beames throwe estward rose could know fortuna maior anone creseide harte sore troilus thus seide mine hart life trust pleasaunce borne ala wo day v mote make disceveraunce time rise hence go el lost ever mo night ala nilt thou v hove long alcmena lay iove blacke night folke boke rede shapen art god world hide certain time thy derke wede vnder men might rest abide wel oughten beast plain folk chide day labor would v brest thou thus fliest deinest v rest thou doest ala shortly thine office tho rakle night god maker kinde thee thine hast thine vnkind vice fast e hemisperie binde nevermore vnder ye ground thou wind thou highest troie forgone thus hastely ioie troilus tho wordes felt thought tho pitous distresse bloodie teares harte melt yet never soche hevinesse assaied great gladnesse gan therewithall creseide lady dere armes strain hold lovely manere cruell day accuser ioy night love stole fast iwrien accursed thy comming troie every bowre hath one thy bright iyen envious day list thee spien hast thou lost seekest thou place god thy light quench grace ala lover thee agilt dispitous day thine paine hell many lover hast thou slain wilt thy poring woll let hem dwell profrest thou thy light sell go sell hem smale seales grave woll thee v nedeth day eke sonne titan gan chide said foole well may men thee dispise hast night dauning thy side suffrest sone vp fro thee rise disease v lover wise hold bed thou thy morow god yeve sorow therwith ful sore sighed thus seide lady right weale wo well roote goodly mine creseide shall rise ala shall fele mine harte mote two life houre save sen life shall doen certes ne ala shall time see plite may eft life god wote shall sen desire right biteth dedde anon retourne long ala fro soiourne nathelesse mine owne lady bright wist vtterly humble servaunt knight harte iset fermely ye mine truely leaver world twaine yet bet enduren paine creseide answerde right anon sigh saied harte dere game iwis ferforth gon first shall phebus fallen sphere everiche egle douues fere every rocke place sterte er troilus go creseides herte ye depe within mine hart grave tho would turn thought wisely god soule save dien pain could nought love god v hath wrought let brain none fantasie crepen cause die ye mewould fast mind would beseche wist forhly find god nught apoint ioies ech harte mine withouten spech bethe true el routh thine god trouth bethe glad thy live sikernesse thus saied never er ne shall mo great gladnesse tourne ayen sone ye ga faine would ye wisely god mine harte bring reste armes toke oft keste ayenst sithe mote nedes bee troilus vp rose fast cled armes toke ladie free hundred time way sped soche wordes harte bled saied fare well dere harte swece god v graunt sound sone mete word sorow answerd sore gan parting distrain troilus vnto paleis ferd wo bigon sothe sain hard wrong sharp desire pain efte pleasaunce may never remembraunce retourned roiall paleis sone soft vnto bedde gan sinke slepe long wont doen nauyt may well ligge winke slepe may none harte sinke thinking desire brend folde worth wend thought gan vp doun wind wordes every countenaunce fermely impressen mind lest pointe pleasaunce verely thilke remembraunce desire al newe brende lust brede gan erst yet toke non hede creseide also right wise troilus gan harte shet worthinesse lust dedes wise gentilnesse met thonking love well beset desiring oft harte dere soche place durst make chere pandare morow commen vnto nece gan faire grete saied night rained ala drede ye nece swete little leiser slepe mete al night qd hath rain wake v trowe heddes ake nere came said stant merie morow nece ye fare creseide answerde never bet foxe ye god yeve hart care god helpe ye caused fare trowe qd wordes white seeth knoweth full lite gan face wrie shete woxe shame redde pandarus gan vnder prie saied nece shall dedde sword smiteth hedde arme sodainly thrist vnder necke last kist passe yt chargeth naught say god foryave death also foryave vncle gan play cause none thing right theffect go time home house went pandarus hath fully entent tourne ayen troilus restlesse full long bedde lay prively sent pandarus come may come anon one saied nay troilus full soberly grete doune vpon beddes side sete troilus thaffectioun friendly love harte may devise pandarus knee fill adoun er would place arise gan thanken best wise hundred time gan time blesse born bring fro distresse said frend frendes alderbest ever sothe tell thou hast heaven brought soul rest fro phlegeton firie flood hell though might thousand time sell vpon day life thy service might mote suffice sonne world may se sawe never yet life dare lete ioily faire goodly whose shall till deie thus dare seie thanked high worthinesse love eke thy kinde businesse thus hast thou little thing iyeve thee obliged aie life thine help live el dedde ago many day worde doun bed lay pandarus full soberly herde till said answerde dere frende doen thee case god wote lefe glad man may god helpe take agrife shall saine beware mischiefe ther thou broght art thy blis thou thy selfe ne cause mi fortune sharpe adversite worst kind infortune man hath prosperite remember passed thou art wise inough thy doe amis rakell though thou sit warme thou certain woll thee harme thou art ease hold thee well therin al sure redde every fire great crafte kepe well win bridle alway well thy speach thy desire worldly ioy holdeth wire preveth well brest alday ofte thy neede werken softe qd troilus hope god forne dere frende shall bere gilt ther shall nothing lorne ne nill rakle greven nedeth matter often tere wistest thou mine harte wel pandare god wote thou wouldest lite care tho gan tell glad night whereof first hart dradde saied frende true knight faith owe god never halfe hote aie desire biteth love best deliteth selfe wisely feele newe qualite ye another er pandare answerd saied thus one may heaven blisse feeleth way dare lay thilke time first heard say worde troilus never ful speke matere praisen vnto pandarus bounte right lady dere pandarus thanke maken chere tale aie span newe begin til night departed hem twinne soone fortune would icomen blisfull time swete troilus warned erst creseide lady mete felt herte ioy flete faithfully gan goddes hery let see mery holden forme al gise comming also erst nedeth nought devise plainly theffect right go ioy surete pandarus hem two abedde brought hem lest thus ben quiet rest naught nedeth sith ben met aske blithe erst well tho bet thousand folde nedeth enquere go every sorow every fere iwis wend much ioy harte may comprehend ni litel thing sey passeth every wit devise eche hem gan others lust obey felicite clerkes wise commenden ne may suffise ioy ne may iwritten inke passeth al hart may bethinke cruel day welaway stound gan aproche signes knew hem thought felen dethes wound wo hem chaungen gan hew day gonnen dispise al new calling traitour envious worse bitterly day light corse qd troilus ala ware pirous tho swifte stedes thre drawen forth sunnes chare han gon pathe dispite maketh sone day sunne hasten thus rise ne shall never sacrifice nedes day departe hem must fone whan speech done chere twin anon wont done setten time meting eft ifere many niyt wroght manere thus fortune time ladde ioie creseide eke kinges son troie suffisaunce blisse singing troilus gan life lede spendeth justeth maketh feestings geveth frely oft chaungeth wede helde alway drede world folke come well kind freshest best coulde find voice steven throughout world honour largesse vp ronge vnto yate heven love gladnesse hart demed gesse ni lover world ease wel thus gan love please goodlihede beaute kind lady isette mountenaunce gnat vnbind hert al creseides nette narowe imasked iknette vndon maner side nil nat ben aught may betide honde ful ofte would take pandarus gardin lede feest processe make creseide womanhede beaute withouten drede heven wordes would sing manere love erth sea hath governaunce love heestes hath heven hie love holsome aliaunce halte people ioyned list hem gie love knitteth lawe companie couple doth vertue dwell binde accord told tell world faith yt stable diverseth stoundes according element discordable holden bonde perpetually phebus mote rosy day forth bring mone hath lordship night al doeth love aie heried might sea yt greedy flowen constraineth certaine ende flood fiercely ne growen drenchen earth evermo love aught let bridle go loveth asunder lepe lost love halt hepe would god authour kind bond love vertue list searchen heart fast bind bond wight wey wist heart cold hem would hem twist maken hem love list hem aie rew heart sore keep hem ben trew need townes werre aye first armes dight certainely bookes erre save hector idradde wight encrease hardinesse might come love lady thanke win altered spirit within time truce hauking would ride el hunt bore beare lioun small beast let gon beside come riding toun full oft lady window doun fresh faucon comen mue full redely goodly salue love vertue speech dispite wretchednesse doubtlesse need beseech honouren hem worthinesse easen hem distresse glad wight well ferde lover wist herde sooth saine lost held every wight love high servise meane folke aught ben right well could devise sentement vncouth wise array every lover thought al wel said wrought though come blood roiall list pride wight chace benigne ech generall gate thank every place thus wolde love iheried grace pride ire envie avarice gan flie every vice thou lady bright doughter diane thy blind winged son eke dan cupide ye sustren nine eke helicone hill pernaso listen abide ye thus ferre han deined gide sen ye woll wend ye heried ben aye withouten end said fully song theffect ioy troilus servise disease among mine authour listeth devise third booke end wise trolius lust quiete creseide owne heart swete explicit liber tertius bvt little welaway lasteth ioy ithonked bee fortune seemeth truest woll begile fooles song entune hem hent blent traitor commune wight whele ithrow laugheth maketh mowe troilus gan bright face away writhe tooke none hede cast clene lady grace whele set vp diomede wch mine hert right ginneth blede pen ala write quaketh drede must endite creseide troilus forsooke least vnkind mote henceforth ben matter booke writen folk mind ala ever cause find speake harme lie iwis hemselfe villanie ye herines nightes doughters three endlesse complaine ever paine megera alecto eke tesiphonee thou cruell mar eke father quirine ilke fourth booke helpe fine loo love life ifere troilus fully shewed incipit liber quartus ligging host said ere greekes strong troy toun befell phebus shining vpon breast hercules lion hector many bold baron cast day greekes fight wont greve hem miyt long short bitwene purpose day fighten ment day well armed bright shene hector many worthy knight went speare hond big bowes bent berde withouten lenger lette fomen field anone hem mette long day speares sharpe iground arrow dart swerds mace fell fight bringen horse man ground ax braines quell last shoure sooth tell folke troy hem selven misleden worse night home fleden day taken anthenor maugre polimidas monesteo xantippe sarpedon palestinor polite eke troyan dan rupheo lasse folke phebuseo harm day folk troy dreden lese great part ioy priamus yeve grekes request time truce tho gonnen trete prisoner chaungen lest surplus yeven somme grete thing anon couth every strete thassiege toune every first came calcas ere calcas knew tretise hold consistorie among greekes soone gan thringe forth lord old set wont done chaunged face hem bade boone love god done reverence stinten noise yeve audience said thus lo lord mine troyan knowen drede remember calcas alderfirst yave comfort nede told well spede dredelesse shall stound ben troy ibrent beaten doun ground forme wt manner wise toun shend lust atcheve ye ere well herde devise know ye lordes leve greekes leve came selfe proper persone reach best done vnto treasour ne rent right regard respect ease thus good left went wening lordes please losse ne doth disease vouchsafe wisely ioy lese troy save doughter left ala sleeping home troy stert sterne cruell father might hard hert ala ne brought shert sorow wol nat live morow ye lordes rew vpon sorow saw time ere deliver iche holden pee never like may right doubtlees helpe grace among prees rew old caitife distresse sith hevinesse ye caught fettred prison troyans inow willes child one may redemption love god bounte one fele ala yefe need praier werne sith ye shull folk toun yerne perill life shall nat lie apollo hath told full faithfully eke found astronomie sort augurie truely dare well say time fast fire flambe toun shall sprede thus shall troy turne ashen dede certaine phebus neptunus makeden walles toun ben folke troy alway wroth woll bring confusioun right despite king laomedoun nolde paien hem hire toune troy shall ben set fire telling tale alway old grey humble speech looking eke salt teares eyen twey full fast ronnen doune either cheke long gan succour hem beseke heale sorowes sore gave antenor withouten glad inough calcas tho thing full soone nedes leide hem shoulden treatise go hem antenor full ofte preide bringen home king thoas creseide priam safegard sent thembassadours troy streight went cause ytold comming old priam king full soone generall let vpon parliment hold theffect rehearsen shall thembassadours ben answerde finall eschaunge prisoner nede hem liketh well forth procede troilus present place asked antenor creseide full sone chaungen gan face tho wordes well nigh deide nathelesse word seide lest men affection espie mannes hert gan sorowes drie full anguish gresly drede abode lord would sey would graunt god forbede theschange thought thing twey first save honour wt wey might best theschaunge stond full fast cast might stond love made prest done bide rather dien go reason said side withouten assent nat lest thy werke would thy saine thy medling yblow brother love noterst know gan deliberen best though lord would went would let hem graunt hem lest tell lady first ment said entent thereafter would worken also blive tho world ayen wolde strive hector well greekes herd antenor would creseide gan withstond soberly answerd sir ni prisoner seide charge leide part ye may estsoones hem tell useli woman sell noise people siert ne brimme blase straw iset fire infortune would none shoulden confusion desire hector qd wt ghost may enspire woman thus shild done u ese dan antenore wrong way ye chese wise eke bold baroun need folke men may see one greatest toun hector lette thy fantasy bee king priam qd thus segge wee voice forgone creseide delive antenor preide iuvenall lord true thy sentence little wenen folke yerue ne finden desire offence cloud errour ne lette hem discerne best lo ensample yerne folke desiren deliverance antenor brought hem mischaunce traitour toun troy ala quitte rathe nice world lo thy discretioun creseide never hem scathe shall lenger blisse bathe antenor shall come home toun shall thus said heere houn delibered parliment antenor yeelden creseide pronounced president though hector nay full oft praid finally wight withsaid naught must ben substaunce parliment would departed parliment echone troilus without word mo vnto chamber spedde fast alone man two bad faste go would slepen said hastely upon bedde laid winter leaf ben birast ech till tree hare ni barke branch ilast lithe troilus biraft ech welfare ibounden blacke barke care disposed wode witte breide sore sate chaunging creseide rist every dore shette window eke tho sorowfull man vpon beddes side doune sette full like dead image pale wan breast heaped wo began brust worken wise woodnesse shall devise right wild bull beginneth spring idarted hert death roreth complaining right gan chamber stert smiring breast aye fistes smert head wall body ground foll oft swapt himselven confound eyen two pity hert stremeden swift welles twey high sob sorrowes smert speech reft unnethes might sey death ala nilt thou dey accursed day nature shope ben life creature fury rage heart twist fast threst length time somewhat gan assuage vpon bed laid doun rest tho begon teares brest wonder body may suffise halfe wo devise said thus fortune ala done thee agilt mightest thou routhe begile grace shall thus spilt shall thus creseide away thou wilt ala mightest thou thine hart find ben thus cruell unkind thee nat honoured live thou well wotest god wilt thou fro ioy thus deprive troilus may men thee call wretch wretch honour fall misery woll bewaile creseide ala till breath faile ala fortune life joy displeased unto thy foule envie ne haddest thou father king troy biraft life done brother die slaine selfe thus complaine crie combre world may nothing serve ever dye never fully sterve creseide alone laft naughtrauyt whider thou woldst stere ala hast thou byraft evermore lo thy manere reve wight dere preve thy gierfull violence thus lost helpeth defence lord love god ala knowest best mine hert al thought shal sorowfull life done caas go dere bought sen ye creseide fully brought grace heart sealed may ye suffer ala repealed may done shal may dure live turment cruell paine infortune disaventure alone borne woll complaine ne never woll seene shine raine end woll edippe derkenesse sorrowfull life dien distresse wery ghost errest fro thou flien wofullest body ever might ground go soule lurking wofull neste fly forthout mine hart let breste follow alway creseide thy lady dere thy right place lenger wofull eien two sen disport seene creseides eyen bright shall ye done discomfort stoden naught wepen sight sen queint wont light veine forth eyen twey formed sen vertue awey creseide lady soveraine wofull soule thus crieth shall yeven comfort thy paine ala wight mine hert dieth spirit unto hieth recei e gree shall aye serve thy force though body sterve ye lover high upon whele ben sette fortune good aventure god lene ye finden aye love stele long life joy endure ye comen sepulture remembreth fellow resteth loved eke though unworthy old unholsome mislived man calcas meane ala eiled thee greek sen thou art borne trojan calcas wolt bane cursed time thou borne would blisfull iove joy thee would troy thousand sighes hotter glede breast went medled plaint new wo fede wofull teares never stent shortly sorowes rent wore mate joy pennaunce feeleth none heth traunce panoare parliment heatd wt every lord burgeis seid full graunted one assent antenor yelden creseid gan well nigh wood wit breid wo niste ment went certaine knight chamber dore undid anone pandare full tenderly wept derke chamber still stone toward bedde gan softly goue confuse st say wo wit nigh away chere leeking torne sorow armes folden stood wofull troilus beforne pitous face gan beholden oft gan heart colden seeing friend wo whose heavinesse heart slough thought distresse wofull wight troilus felt friend pandare icomen see gan snow ayenst sunne melt wofull pandare pite gan weepe tenderly speechlesse thus ben ilke twey neither might sorow word sey last wofull troilus nigh dead smert gan bresten rore sorowfull noise said thus among sob sighes sore lo pandare dead withouten hast thou nat heard parliment seide antenor lost creseide pandare full dead pale hew full pitously answerde said yes wisely false trew heard wote mercy god would trowed would wend little throw fortune joy would overthrow world creature dome ever saw ruine stranger case aventure may eschue devine world thy thus define ne trust wight find fortune aye property yeftes ben commune tell thou art mad sorrowen thus list thou wise sen thy desire holly hast thou right ought inough suffise never felt servise friendly chere looking eie let thus wepe wailen till die al thou wel wost thy selve toune full lady dome falcer twelve ever shal finden rout ye one twey withouten dout thy glade mine owne dere brother lost shall recover another god forbid alway ech pleasaunce thing none wight one sing another well daunce goodly glad light faire good aright ech vertue holden dere herones faucon rivere eke writ zansis full wise new love chaseth oft old vpon new case lieth new avise thinke eke thy selfe saven art thou hold fire processe shall kind cold sen casuell pleasaunce case shall put remembraunce also sure day commeth night new love labour wo el selde seeing wight done old affection overgo thy part thou shalt haue one tho abredgs thy bitter pain smart absence shall driue hart word saied none helpe friend least sorow deide doubtlesse doen wo fall raught nat vnthrift seide troilus nigh sorow deide tooke little hede ever ment one eare heard went last answerd said friend lechcraft dealed thus well fitting fiend traien wight true vnto pray god let counsaile never ithee doe rather sterue anon right ere thus doen thou wouldest lere serue iwis thou sey mine hart enhabite right shall holly till dey pandarus sen trouth hight woll nat ben vntrue wight man woll aye live sterve never none creature serve thou saiest thou shalt fair find let make comparison creature iformed kind leve pandare conclusion woll nat thine opinion touching thee beseech hold thy peace thou slaest thy speech thou biddest love another freshly new let creseide go lithe nat power leve brother though might yet would nat canst thou plaien raket fro nettle dock pandare foule fall thy wo care thou farest eke pandarus wight wo bigon commeth apace saith right thus thinke smart thou shalt feele none thou maiest first transmewen stone reve passion thou lightly doe wo fall death may well brest depart life long may sorow mine fro soule shall creseides dart nevermore doune proserpine dead woll pine woll eternally complain wo twinned twain thou hast made argument full fine lasse paine creseide forgone mine lived ease felicite gabbest thou saidest vnto wors fro wele ithrow erst none wele know tel sen thee thinketh light chaungen love aye fro hast thou nat doen busily thy might chaungen doth thee thy wo nilt thou let fro thine heart go nilt thou love another lady swete may thine heart setten quiete thou hast love aye yet mischance canst thine hart drive lived lust pleasance much creature live would foryet blive hast thou ben hid long mew thou canst well formeliche agrew nay god wot naught worth al thy rede ever may befall withouten word mo woll ben dede death ender art sorrowes come sen oft thee call sely death sooth sor saine oft icleped commeth endeth paine well wote life quiete ere thou slue would yeven hire thy comming swete world nothing desire death sen sorow fire thou either anon teares drench thy cold stroke mine heart quench sen thou slaest fele sundry wise ayenst vnpraied day night doe request servise deliver world doest thou right wofullest wight ever time sterve sen world right nauyt serve troilus teares gan distill licour allambike full fast pandarus gan hold tongue still ground eyen downe cast nathelesse thus thought last parde rather fellow dey yet shall somewhat vnto sey said friend sen thou hast distresse sen thee list mine argumentes blame nilt thy selven helpe doen redresse thy manhood letten game rauish ne caust thou shame either let toune fare hold still leave thy nice fare art thou troy hast non hardiment take wight loveth thee would selven thine assent nat nice vanite rise vp anon let weeping sith thou art man hour woll dead shall ben answerde troilus full soft saied iwis leve brother dere selfe yet thought full oft thing thou devisest thing laft thou shalt wel thou hast yeven audience thereafter mayst thou tell thy sentence first sin thou wost toun hath al werre ravishing woman might suffced erre stont ne done great vnright also blame every wight father graunt withstood sen chaunged tounes good eke thought assent aske father grace thinke accusement sen well wot may nat purchace sen father high place parliment hath eschaunge ensealed nill letter repealed yet drede heart perturbe violence doe game would openly disturbe must disclaunder name lever die diffame nolde god honour lever life save thus lost aught see certaine knight must honour lever every case lover ought right thus desire reason twight desire disturben redeth reason nill mine heart dredeth thus weeping could never cease said ala shall wretche fare well fele alway love encrease hope lasse lasse pandare encreasen eke cause care welaway nill mine hart brest love little rest pandare answerde friend thou mayst done thee list hote thine estate go tho toun cried thing note nolde set noise grote men cried wol roun eke wonder last ix deies never toun devine reason aye deepe ne curtesly helpe thy selfe anone bet thy selven wepe namely sen ye two ben al one rise vp mine head shall gone rather ben blame little ifound sterve gnat withouten wound shame vnto ne vice withholden ye loveth peraventure might hold thee nice letten go thus vnto grekes hoste think eke fortune well thy selven woste helpeth hardie man vnto emprise weiueth wretch cowardise though thy lady would alite greve thou shalt thy self thy peace hereafter make certaine cannot leve would evill take feare thine hart quake thinke paris hath thy brother love shal thou another troilus thing dare thee swere creseide thy lefe loveth thee well thou dost god helpe nill take grefe though thou bote anon mischefe wilneth fro thee passe false love well lasse thy take hart think right knight love broken alday every law kith somwhat thy courage thy might mercie thy selfe awe let wretched wo thine hart gnawe manly set world sixe seven thou die martir go heaven woll selfe ben thee dede though kin vpon stound strete dog liggen dede girt many bloodie wound every case woll friend found thee listeth sterven wretch adieu devill speede retch troilus gan word quicken saied friend graunt mercie assent certainly thou mayst nat pricken ne paine none ne may torment case mine entent shorte wordes though dien ravishen selfe would mean qd pandarus al day tell hast thou well assaid sorowest thus answerde nay wherofart thou qd pandare dismaid noste woll ben evill apaid ravishen sen thou hast ben iove told thine eare thy rise vp naught ne anone wash thy face king thou wend may wondren whider thou art gone thou must wisdome blend vpon case may thee send thou beware shortly brother dere glad let werke mattere shall shape sikerly thou shalt niyt somtime manere come speaken thy ladie prively wordes eke chere thou shalt full soone aperceive well entent case best fare well point rest swifte fame fals thing equall reporteth like thing true throghout troy ifled prest wing fro man man made tale new calcas doughter bright hew parliment without word graunted chaunge antenore tale anon right creseide heard father rought case right naught ne deide full busily iupiter besought yeve mischance tretis brought shortly least tale sooth durst wight asken fere hart mind troylus yset wonder fast al world ne might love vnbind ne troylus heart cast would life may last thus brenneth love drede nist best rede men seene toune woman vsen friend visite creseide woman came rout pitous ioy wenden delite tale dere ynough mite woman citie dwell set hem doune sayd shall tell qd first one glad truely shall father see another sayd iwis little hath v qd tho third hope iwis shall bringen v peace every side goth almighty god gide tho wordes tho womannish thinges herd hem right thogh thencewere god wote hart thing although body sat emong hem advertence alway el troilus full fast soule sought withouten word alway thought woman thus wenden please naught gan tale spend vanitie ne done none ease meane brend passion wend felt almost heart die wo werie companie might lenger restraine teares gan vp well gave signes bitter paine spirit must dwell remembering heaven vnto hell fallen sen forgo sight troilus sorrowfully sight thilke fooles sitting wende wept sighed sore rout departen never play hem knowen yore see wepe thought kindnesse ech hem wept eke distresse bustly gonnen comforten thing god wot little thought tale wenden disporten glad ofte besought ease therwith wrought right man eased fele ache head clawen hele nice vanitie took leve home wenten creseide full sorrowfull pitie chamber vp went hall bedde gan dead fall purpose never thence rise thus wrought shall devise ownded hair sonnish hew rent eke finger long smale wrong full oft bad god rew death bote bale hewe whylom bright tho pale bare witnesse wo constreint thus spake sobbing compleint ala qd religioun wofull wretch infortuned wight borne cursed constellatioun mote gon thus departen fro knight wo worth ala ilke day light saw first eyen twaine causeth paine therewith teares eyen two doune fell shoure aprill swithe white breast bet wo death cried thousand sithe sen wont wo lithe mote forgone disaventure held selfe forlost creature said shall done also live twin dere heart eke love shall sorow slaen ye ben calcas father thine sin mother mine cleped wert argive wo worth day yt thou bare live wt fine live sorowen thus fish withouten water dure creseide worth troilus plant life creatur live withouten kind noriture full oft word sey rootlesse mote greene soone dey shal done thus sen neither sword ne dart dare none handle cruelte like day fro depart sorow nill nat bane shall meat ne drinke come till soule brest vnsheath thus selven woll done death troilus clothes everychone shull blacke ben tokening hart swete world agone wont set quiete mine order aye till death mete observaunce ever absence shall sorrow ben complaint abstinence mine hart eke woful ghost therein bequeath spirit complaine eternally shall never twin though yearth twinned twaine yet field pitie paine hight elisos shall ben ifere orpheus erudice fere thus heart mine antenor ala soone shall chaunged wene shull ye done sorowfull caas shall tender hart sustene hart mine foryet sorow tene also soothly sey ye well fare retche dey might ever redde ben isong plaint made distresse little tong discriven would heavinesse make sorrow seeme lesse childishly deface high complaint therefore pace pandare sent troilus vnto creseide ye heard devise best recorded thus full glad done servise vnto creseide full secret wise lay tourment rage came tell holly message fond selven gan grete full pitously salte teres breast face ibathed full wete mightie tress sonnish here vnbroiden hangen eares yave signe mattire death hart gan desire saw gan sorrow anon tearie face atwixt armes hide pandare wo bigon hous might vnneth abide felt sorrow every side creseide erst complained sore tho gan plaine thousand time aspre plaint thus seide pandare first joy two cause causing vnto creseide transmued ben cruell wo whether shall say welcome alderfirst brought vnto servise love ala endeth wise endeth love wo ye men lieth worldly blisse thinketh end blisse aye sorrow occupieth troweth let vpon wofull wretche see selfe hate aye birth curse feeling alway fro wicke go worse seeth seeth sorow atonis paine tourment plaint wo distresse wofull body harme none langour anguish cruell bitternesse annoy smart drede furie eke sicknesse trow iwis heaven teares raine pitie aspre cruell paine thou suster full discomfort qd pandarus thinkest thou ne hast thou thy selven resport wilt thou thus thy selfe ala fordo leave werke take heed shall saine herken good entent message troilus sent tourned tho creseide wo making great death see ala qd wordes may ye bring woll dere hert saine mee drede nevermore see woll plaint teares ere wend ynough thereafter send right seene visage wight men beare bind face like paradis image ichaunged another kind play laughter men wont find eke joyes everichone ben fled thus lieth creseide alone eyen two purpre ring bitrent soothfast tokening paine behold deadly thing pandare might nat restraine teares eyen raine nathelesse best might seide troilus wordes creseide lo nece trow ye han heard king lordes best hath made eschaunge antenor cause sorow vnrest case doth troilus molest may none yearthly man tongue say wo wit away sorowed little v slaw counsaile day finally somewhat fro weeping withdraw seemeth desireth faw ben might devise remedie wise short plain theffect message ferforth wit comprehend ye ben tourment rage may long prologue entend herevpon ye may answere send love god nece dere leave wo troilus great wo qd sighed sore feeleth deadly sharpe distresse yet sorrow mokell love bet himselfe gesse ala hath hevinesse pitously complaine iwis sorow doubleth paine greuous god wot twin qd yet harder seene sorrow well wot woll bane die woll certaine tho qd bid come er deth thus threteth drive ghost mine hart beteth wordes said armes two fill gruffe gan weepen pitously qd pandarus ala doe ye sen ye well wote time fast shall come arise vp hastely nat biwopen thus ne find ye woll wode mind wist ye farde manere would himselfe slea wend fare come good priam may dispend fine would anon pretend know well thy yet sey leave sorow plainly woll dey shapeth sorow abredge nat encrease lefe nece swete bethrather cause plat edge wisdome ye sorrowes bete helpeth weepen full strete though ye salt teares dreint bet time cure aye pleint meane thus hither bring sen ye wise one assent shapeth distour going come ayen soone ye went woman wise short avisement let seene wit shall availe may helpe shall nat faile go qd creseide vncle truely shall done might restraine weeping sight busily fo glad shall done paine herte seeken every vaine sore may ben founden salve shall nat lacke certaine mine halve goth pandarus troilus sought till temple found alone life lenger rought pitous goddes everichone full tenderly praid made mone done soone world pace wel thought none grace shortly soothe sey fallen dispaire day vtterly shope dey right thus argument alway saied na lorne welaway yt commeth commeth necessitie thus ben lorne destinie certainly wote well said foresight devine purveiaunce seen alway forgone creseide sen god see thing doutance hem disposeth ordinance merites soothly shull comen predestine nathelesse ala shall leve ben great clerkes many one destinie argumentes preve saine nedely none free choice yeven v everychone welaway sigh arne clerkes old whose opinion may hold men sain yt god seeth biforne ne god may nat deceived ben parde mote fallen though men sworn purveiaunce hath seene beforne wherefore say eterne hath wist beforn thought eke dede free choice clerk rede thought deed also might never purueyaunce may nat deceived never mo hath feled biforne withouten ignoraunce might ben variaunce writhen fro god purveying nere prescience thing comming rather opinion vncertaine stedfast foreseeing certes abusion god perfite clere weting men yt doutous wening errour vpon god gesse false foule wicked cursednesse eke opinion top ful high smooth ishore saine right thus yt thing nat come prescience hath seene shall come sain yt therfore shall come therefore ye purveyaunce wote beforne withouten ignoraunce manner necessite retourneth part contrary againe needfully behoueth nat thilke thing fallen certaine ben purveied needfully saine behoueth thinges fall certaine ben purveyed meane though laboured inquire wch thing cause wch thing whether prescience god certaine cause necessite thing comen parde necessitie thing comming certaine purveying ne enforce shewing ye order ye cause stant well wot behoueth befalling thing wist certainly necessarie seeme thereby prescience put falling necessaire thing come fall foule faire sit man yond see necessitie behoueth certes thine opinion sooth wenest conjectest sit ayenward yet lo right part contrarie thus hearken woll nat tarie say opinion thee sooth sit say mote sitten necessitee thus necessitie either nede sitting iwis nede sooth thus forsoth mote necessitie ben thou maist saine yt man sit nat therfore thine opinion sitting sooth rather man sate therefore thine opinion sooth iwis say though cause sooth commeth sitting yet necessitee enterchaunged thee thus wise doutaunce may well maken seemeth reasoning goddes purveyaunce thinges comen whiche reason men may well isee thilke thinges earth yfall necessitie comen although forthing shall come iwis therefore purveyed certainely nat comnieth purveyed yet nathelesse behoueth needfully thing come purveyed truly el thing purveyed betiden necessite suffiseth right ynough certaine destroy free choise everydell abusion saine falling thinges temporell cause god prescience eternell truely false sentence thing com shuld cause prescience might wene thought god purveieth thing yt come come el nought might wene thing whylome ben befall overcome ben cause thilke soveraine purveyaunce forwote withouten ignoraunce yet say thereto right wote thing iwis thing mote needfully eke right wot thing comming mote come thus befalling thing ben wist tide mowe ben eschewed side said thus almighty iove trone wotest thing ye soothfastnesse rew sorrow dien sone bring creseide fro distresse heavinesse disputing himselfe matere came pandare said ye may mighty god qd pandarus trone eigh saw ever wise man faren troilus thinkest thou done hast thou lust ben thine owne fo parde yet nat creseide ago list thee thy selfe fordone drede thine head thine eyen semen dede hast thou nat lived many yere beforne withouten farde full well ease art thou none borne hath kind thee wrought al please let thinke right thus thy disease dice right ther fallen chaunces right love come gon plesaunces yet wonder thou thus sorowest sith thou wost nat yet touching going shall fall ne selfe distourben thou hast nat yet assaied wit man may betime necke bede shall sorowen nede thy take hede shall say ispoke long ibe accorded betwixe v twey evermore thinketh thus hath somewhat heart privite wherewith shall aright rede disturbe thou art drede counsell night thou go make end blisfull iuno great might shall hope grace vnto v send mine hart seith certaine shall nat wend thy put thine heart rest hold thy purpose best troilus answerde sighed sore thou saist right well right list said vnto time go full prively himselfe withouten mo vnto came wont done wrought shall tell soone sooth gon first mete gan paine heart twist neither hem might grete hem armes tooke kist lasse wofull hem nist ne might word outbring said erst wo sobbing wofull teares leten fall bitter teares kind paine ligne aloe gall bitter teares wept find wofull mirra barke rind world ni hard hart nolde rewed paine smart wofull wery ghost twaine returned ben hem ought dwell somewhat weken gan paine length plaint ebben gan well teares heart vnswell broken voice al horse shright creseid troilus ilke word seid iove die mercy thee besech helpe troilus therewithal face vpon brest laid lost speech wofull spirite proper place right worde away point pace thus lith hewes pale grene whilom fresh fairest sene troilus gan behold cleping name lay deed withouten answere felt simmes cold eien throwen vpward heed sorowful man non rede oft time colde mouth kist wo god wist riseth vp long straite leide signe life aught may none finde nothing creseide song full oft welaway saw spechlesse lay sorowful voice hart blisse al bare said fro world ifare long complained hondes wrong said sey teeres salt brest berained gan tho teeres wipen full drey pitously gan soule prey said lord set art thy trone rewe eke shall folow sone cold without sentement ought wote brethe felt none preignant argument forth world agone saw non wonne gan limmes dresse manere men hem shall ben laide bere sterne cruel hart swerde anon sheth twight selfe sleen sore smart soule soule folowen might dome minos would dight sith love cruel fortune ne would world lenger liven said thus fulfilde high disdaine cruel iove thou fortune adverse falsly ye slaine creseide sith ye may ne werse fie might werkes diverse thus cowardly ye shull never winne shall deth fro lady twinne world sith ye slain thus woll let folow spirite low hie shal never lover saine troilus dare nat feare lady die certaine woll beare companie sithe ye wol nat suffre v liven yet suffreth soules ben ifere thou citie live wo thou priam brother al ifere thou mother farewell go attropose make redy thou bere thou creseide swete hart dere receive spirite would sey swerde hart redy dey god would swough abraide gan sighe troilus cride answerde lady mine creseide live ye yet let swerde doun glide ye hart mine thanked cupide qd therewithal sore sight began glade might toke armes two kist oft glad al entent gost flikered aie loft wofull hart ayen went last eye glent aside anon gan sworde aspie lay bare gan feare crie asked draw troilus anon cause told therwith wold slaw creseide vpon gan behold gan armes fast fold said mercy god lo dede ala nigh dede nadde spoken grace ye would slain selfe anon qd ye doutlesse answerde ala ilke lorde made nolde forlong way live deth ben crouned quene al londe sunne shineth shene selve sword yt selfe would slain qd tho ho right inough let v rise straite bedde go let v speken wo morter see brenne know ful well day nat farre henne wer bed armes fold naught like tho night beforne petously ech gan behold hadden al blisse ilorne bewailing aie day borne til last sorowful wight creseide troilus ilke word seide lo hart mine wel wote ye qd wight alway wo complaine seketh nat holpen ni folie encreace paine sen assembled twaine find bote wo ben time al sone begin woman ful wel ye wotte avised sodainly wol tel hotte thinketh thus neyther ye ought halfe wo maken skilfully art inough redresse yet misse sleen hevinesse soth wo ben inne aught wote nothing el cause twinne considred al ni amis remedy vnto shape v sone mete al dere hart swete shall wel bringen comen ayen sone go thereof maner thing dout dredelesse within weke two shal ben may right word shal wel heape way shew woll nat maken long sermon time ilost may recovered go conclusion best aught see love god foryeve speake aught ayenst hart rest trewly speake best making alway protestacion word shal say ni shew mocion find vnto helpe best way take otherwise pray effect ye commaund wol done demaund herkeneth ye wel vnderstond going graunted parliment ferforth may ben withstond al world judgement sithe helpeth none avisement letten lette passe mind let v shape better way find sothe twinning v twaine wol v disease cruelly anoie behoveth sometime paine serveth love woll joie sith shall farther troie may ride ayen halfe morow ought lasse causen v sorow shal nat ben hid mew day day mine owne hart dere sen well ye wote trew ye shal ful wel al mine estate aud er truce done shal ben ye antenor iwonne also bethe glad ye conne think right thus creseid agon shal come hastely ayen ala god lo right anon er day ten dare safely saine erst shal faine shal togithers ever dwell al world ne might blisse tell see oft time ben best counsaile hide ye speke nat fourtenight ne see go ne ride may ye nat ten day abide mine honour aventure iwis ye mowe el lite endure ye know eke kin onely father eke mine thinges al ifere namely dere herte ye nolde leaven see al world wide hath space el see never ioves face trowe ye father wise coveiteth see drede lest toune folkes dispise bicause vnhappy dede wote father life lede wist troie wel fare v neded wending nat care ye every day eke men treate peace supposed men quene heleine shall restore grekes v restore mi though nere comfort none men purposen peace every side ye may better ease hart abide peace mine hart dere nature peace mote nedes drive men must entrecomune ifere fro eke ride gone blive al day thicke flien hive every wight liberty bleve list bet withouten leve tho yt peace ther may bene none yet hither though ther never peace ne must come whider gone mischaunce dwell among tho men armes ever fere wisely god soule rede nat sene wherof ye drede another way al thing ne may suffice father ye knowen well parde olde eke full covetise right founden al gise withouten nette wherwith shal hent herkeneth ye woll assent lo troilus men saine ful hard wolfe ful wedder hole saine men full oft iwis mote spenden parte remnant save aie gold men may harte grave set vpon covetise meane shal devise moveable yt toun vnto father shal take say right trust salvatioun sent frende tway frendes fervently pray sende hie toun stant thus ieopardie shal gold huge quantite thus shal sain lest folke aspide may sent wight shal eke shewen peace betide frends every side toward court wrath pace priamus stonde grace thing swete shal enchaunten sawes right heven soule shal mete apollo clerkes lawes calculing availeth three hawes desire gold shall soule blend list shall wel make end would aught sort preve lie certaine shall fond disturben plucke sleve making sort bearen hond hath nat well goddes vnderstond goddes speke amphibology sothe tellen twenty lie eke drede fond first goddes suppose thus shall saine coward hert made amis goddes text glose ferde delphos stert make sone convert done rede within day twey wol oblige dey trewly written wel find al thing said good entent hart trewe kind towardes spake right ment starfe wo nigh went purpose ever trewe thus writen werkes knew troilus hart eeres sprad herde al thing devised fro verily seemed selve witte yet let go hart misyave evermo finally gan herte wrest trusten toke best great fury penaunce queint hope therewith hem betwene began joy amorous daunce birdes sunne shene deliten songe leves greene right wordes spake ifere deliten hem made hertes chere nathelesse wending creseide al world may nat mind ful oft pitously preide heste might trewe find said certes ye kind ye come day set troie ne shal never heale honor ne joie also sothe sunne vprist morow god wisely thou woful wretch rest bring cruel sorow wol selven slee ye dretch death though little retch yet er ye causen smart dwel rather owne swete hart trewly mine owne lady dere sleight yet herd stere ful shapely ben fallen ifere thus men saith yt one thinketh bere al another thinketh ledere sire wise said drede men may wise renne rede full harde halten vnespied crepil craft father sleight argus eied al movable biraft old sleight yet laft ye shal nat blende womanhede ne faine aright drede peace shal evermo betide peace ernest ne game wote sith calcas grekes side hath one ben lost foule name dare come ayen shame ought espie trusten ni fantasie ye shal eke seen father shall glose ben wife well prech shal greke preise wel alose ravishen shal spech done force shall tech troilus ye nil routh shall causelesse sterven trouth al father shall dispise v al saine cite lorne thassege never shall arise grekes al sworne til ben slaine doun walles torne thus shal word fere aie drede ye wol bleven ye shall eke sene many lusty knight among grekes ful worthinesse ech hem hart wit might pleasen done al businesse ye shull dullen rudenesse lely troians routhe remorde vertue trouthe grevouse thinke fro brest wol soule rende ne dredelesse may nat sinke good opinion ye wende father sleight woll v shende ye gone tolde yore thinke nam deed withouten humble true pitous hart thousand time mercy pray reweth mine aspre paine smart doth somwhat shall say let v steale away betwixt v tway thinke yt foly man may chese accident substaunce lese meane thus sen mowe day wel steale away ben togither wit putten assay case ye shoulden father go ye mighten come ayen thus meane great follie put sikernesse jeopardie vulgarly speken substaunce treasour may v lede ynough live honour pleasaunce til vnto time shall ben dede thus may eschewen drede every waie ye record mine hart iwis may therewith nat acord hardely ne dredeth poverte kin frendes el though comen bare sherte v never lacke golde ne geere ben honoured dwelten go anone mine entent best ye woll assent creseide sigh right wise answerde iwis dere hart trew may well steale away ye devise finden vnthrifty way new afterward full sore woll v rew helpe god nede causelesse ye suffren al drede thilke day cherishing drede father wight estate delite wedding false troilus knight saturnus doughter iuno miyt wood achamante dwell eternally stix pit hell every god celestiall swere eke eche goddesse every nimphe deite infernall satiry fauny lesse halve goddes ben wildernesse attropos threde life brest false trowe lest thou simois arowe clere throgh troy rennest aie dounward see witnesse word said thilke day vntrewe troilus mine owne hart fre thou return backwarde thy well body soule sinke hell ye speake away thus go letten frendes god forbede woman ye shoulden namely sen troy hath nede helpe eke thing taketh hede wist life lay ballaunce honor god shild v fro mischaunce peace hereafter take day happeth anger game lord sorow wo ye wolden make ye ne durst come ayen shame ere ye ieoparden name beth nat hasty hotte fare hasty man ne wanteth never care trowe ye people eke would say full light arede woulden say swere dout love ne drave nat done dede lust voluptuous coward drede thus lost iwis mine herte dere honour whiche shineth clere also thinketh mine honeste floureth yet foul shend filth spotted shulde forme wend ne though lived unto world end name never ayenward win thus lost routh sin thy slee reason hete men sain suffraunt overcommeth parde eke whoso woll lefe lefe mote lete thus maketh vertue necessite patience thinke lord fortune aye naught woll retch ne daunteth wight wretch trusteth certes herte swete phebus suster lucina shene lion passe arite woll withouten wene meane help iuno heaven quene tenth day death assaile woll seene withouten faile sooth qd troilus shall well suffer unto tenth day sen see nede mote ben thus love god may let u stealen prively away ever one live rest mine hert saieth woll best mercy god life qd ala ye slea thus tene see well ye mistrusten wordes well isene love scinthia shene mistrust nat thus causelesse routh sen true plight trouth thinketh well sometime wit spend time time win ne parde lorne nat fro yet though ben day two atwin drive tho fantasy within trusteth leaveth eke sorow trouth wol nat live til morow ye wist sore doth smart ye would cesse god thou wost pure spirit weepeth mine hart seen weepen love mote gone unto greekes host ye nere wist remedy come ayen right wolde dy certes nice wight ne imaginen way come ayen day hight may holden thing woll away father naught queint play thrift wending troy another day shall tourne u joy thy mine heart beseke list done aught prayere love love eke ere departe fro good comfort chere may seen ye may bring rest hart point brest pray qd tho herts soothfast suffisaunce sith thine hole withouten mo absent pleasaunce fro remembraunce ever agast men rede love thing aye full busie drede world liveth lady none ye vntrue god defend betrayed wo begon trouth entend doubtlesse iche wend nere dead ere ye cause find goddes love beth ye nat unkind answered troilus seide god ni cause iwrie glad wi never unto creseide sith thilke day saw first eye false ne never shall till die short wordes well ye may leue shall found preue graunt mercy good hert mine iwis qd blisful venus let never sterve er may stonde pleasaunce degre quite well well deserve god wit conserve shall done true found aie honour ward shall rebound trusteth well estate royall ne vaine delite onely worthinesse werre turnay marciall ne pompe array nobley eke richesse ne made rue distresse moral vertue grounded upon trouth cause first routh eke gentle hart manhood ye ye thought dispite every thing sowned bad rudenesse peoplish appetite reason bridled delite made aboven every creature shall may dure may length yeres itat fordoe ne remuablest fortune deface iupiter might may doe sorowfull glad yeve v grace er night tenne meten place may harte mine suffise fareth well time ye rise long yplained oft ikist straite armes fold day gan rise troilus clad rufully lady gan behold felt death care cold grace gan recommaund wo hold demaund man hedde imaginen ne ne entendement consider ne tongue tell cruell paine sorowfull man passen every torment doune hell saw ne might dwell soule hart rent withouten ye chamber went incipit liber quintus prochen gan fatall destine ioves hath disposicioun angry parcas sustren thre committeth done execucioun creseide must toun troilus shall dwell forth pine till lachesis threde lenger twine golden tressed phebus high loft thrise beames clere snowes molte zephirus oft brought ayen tender leaf grene sen sonne eccuba quene began love first sorow depart morow full redy prime diomede creseide vnto grekes hoste lede sorow felt hart blede nist best rede truely men bokes rede men wist never woman care ne lothe toune fare troilus withouten rede lore man hath joy eke forlore waiting lady evermore sothfast croppe lust joyes tofore troilus farwell thy joie shalt thou never seen eft troie soth bode manere gan wofull manly hide well vnneth seen chere yate ride certain folke hoved abide wo bigon would plain horse vnneth sate pain ire quoke gan hart gnaw diomede horse gan dight sayd vnto himselfe ilke saw ala qd thus foule wretchednesse suffre nill redresse nat bet one die evermore langour thus crie nill make one rich poore inough done er go nill bring troie vpon roore nill slaen diomede also nill rather man two steale away woll endure nill helpen mine owne cure nolde done fell deede shall sain list spare hart alway maner drede lest creseide rumour fare ben slain lo al care el certain sayd yore done withouten wordes creseide redy ride full sorowfully sighed sayd ala forth mote aught may betide forth rideth full sorowfully apaas remedy caas wonder though sore smart forgoeth owne swete hart troilus gise curtesie hauke hond huge rout knight rode companie passing valey ferre without ferther would ridden doubt full faine wo gone sone tourne must eke done right antenor icome grekes hoste every wight glad sayd welcome troilus al nere harte light pained full might hold weping least antenor kist made feast therewithal must leave take cast iye upon pitously nere rode cause make take honde al soberly lorde gan wepen tenderly full soft slighly gan sele hold day doe deie courser tourned face pale vnto diomede worde spake ne none rout sonne tideus toke hede kouthe crede soche craft rain hent troilus troie homewards went diomede lad ye bridell whan saw folke troy away thought labor shall idell may somewhat shall say worst short may way heard say eke time twise twelve foole woll foryete selve nathelesse thought well inough certainly naught speake love make tought doubtlesse thought gesse may ibrought sone away shall find meane nat yet wete shall meane diomede could good done gan fallen forth spech aske stood soth disease gan eke besech encreasen might ech thing ease commaunde said done would truely swore knight ther na thing wch might plese nolde done pain al might done done hart ease prayed would sorow appease sayd iwis greekes joy honouren well folke troy said eke thus wot thinketh strange wonder new thacquaintance trojan change folke grece ye never knew would never god true greeke ye emong u find trojan eke kind bicause swore right ben frende helply might acquaintaunce eke straunger wight fro forth pray day night commaundeth sore smart done may like unto hart ye wold brother treat taketh frendship dispite thouy sorowes thing gret nat respite mine hart hath amend great delite may harmes nat redresse right sory heavinesse though ye trojan u geeekes wroth many day alway yet parde god love sothe serven bothe love god lady free ye hate beth wroth truely wight serve half loth wrath would deserve nere nere tent calcas seen u may would tell mine entent ensealed till day yeve honde shall aie god helpe life may dure owne aboven every creature thus said never e woman borne god mine hert wisely glad loved never woman beforne paramour ne never shall mo love god lady dere complain right yet lere wondreth nought mine owne lady bright though speake love thus blive heard many wight hath loved thing never saw live eke power strive ayenst god love obay woll alway mercy pray beeth worthy knight place ye faire everiche hem woll pain stonden grace might faire grace fall ye servant would call lowly ne truely serve nill none hem shall till sterve creseide unto purpose lite answerde sorow oppressed effect naught tale herde word two thought sorowfull hart brest two gan father ferre espie well nigh doune hors gan sle nathelesse thonketh diomede travaile good chere list frendship bede accepteth good manere woll fain lefe dere trusten would well might saied hors alight father hath armes nome twenty time kist doughter swete saied dere doughter mine welcome said eke fain mete stode forth muet milde mansuete leave father dwell forth woll troilus tell troy come wofull troilus sorow sorowes smert felon loke face dispitous tho sodainly doune hors stert paleis swolne hert chamber went nothing toke bede ne none dare speke worde drede sorowes spared yave issue large death cride throwes frenetike mad curseth iuno apollo eke cupide curseth bachus cere cipride birth himselfe fate eke nature save ladie every creature bed goth welleth turneth furie doeth ixion hell wise nigh till day sojourneth tho began hart alite vnswell teares gonnen vp wel pitiously cried vpon creseide self right thus spake seide mine owne lady lefe dere white brest armes iyen clere yesterday time may wepe alone many teare graspe may place save pilow find naught embrace shal doen shal come ala let go would god tho slain hart mine creseide swete fo lady mine love mo ever mine hart vowe see die ye nill rescowe seeth right lodesterre sitteth right presence comforten harte werre gon yeve ye audience speaketh riyt absence ala wight care well wote evill ye fare thus ten day full endure whan first night tene shall eke sorowfull creature tendernesse shall sustene soche wo pitous pale grene shall freshe womanly face langour er ye tourne vnto place whan fill slombrings anon begin grone dreamen dreadfullest thing might mete alone place horrible making aie mone meten emonges enemy hondes fall therewithall body start start sodainly awake soche tremour fele hart feare body quake therwithall noise make seme though fall depe high alofe would wepe rewen himselfe pitously wonder fantasie time mightely comfort himselfe sain folie causelesse soche drede drie eft begin aspre sorowes new every man might paine rew could tell fully discrive wo plaint langour pine nat men han live thou reader mayst thy self full well devine soche wo wit define vnidell write swinke wit werie thinke heaven yet sterres seen although full pale iwoxen mone whiten gan orisont shene eastward wont done phebus rosie carte sone gan dresse vp fare troilus sent pandare pandare day beforne ne might comen troilus se although hedde sworne king priam alday lay nat liberte gon morow went troilus sent hart could well devine troilus al night sorow woke would tell pine knew well inough without boke chamber streight ye way toke troilus tho soberly grette bedde full sone gan sette pandarus qd troilus sorow drie may long endure trowe shall liven till morow would alwaies aventure thee devisen sepoulture forme movable thou dispoen right thee semeth best doen fire flambe funerall body brennen shall glede feast play palestrall vigile pray thee take good hede well offer mar stede sword mine helme leve brother dere shelde pallas yeve shineth clere poudre wch min hart ibrend shal turn pray thee thou take conserve vessell men clepeth vrne gold lady serve love thus pitously sterve yeve doe pleasaunce praien kepe remembraunce well fele maladie dreames yore ago certainly mote nedes die oule eke hight ascaphilo hath shright night two god mercurie wofull wretch soule guide thee list fetch pandare answerde saied troilus dere frende told thee yore follie sorowen thus causelesse woll trowen rede ne lore seen remedie let worchen fantasie troilus pray thee tell thou trowe er wight hath loved paramour well thou ye god wot fro many worthy knight hath ladie gon fourtenight nat yet made halvendele fare nede maken care sen day day thou maist thy selven see love el wife man mote twinnen necessitie ye though love owne life yet nill thus maken strife well thou wost leve brother dere alway frendes may ifere done folke yt seen love wedded frendes might betideth full oft seen hem spouse bedde ibedded god wote take wisely faire soft good hope halt vp hert aloft time sorow endure time hem hurteth time doth hem cure shouldest thou endure letten slide time fonde glad light ten dayes ni long abide sen comen thee hath behight nill hest breaken wight drede thee nill finde way come ayen life durst lay thy sweuenes eke soch fantasie drive let hem faren mischaunce procede thy melancolie doth thee fele slepe penaunce straw sweuenes signifiaunce god helpe caunt hem bean wot man aright wt dremes mean priestes temple tellen dreames reuelacions goddes al well tel iwis infernalles illusion lech saine complections proceden fast glotonie wot sothe thus signifie eke saine impression wight hath fast thing mind thereof cometh soche avisions sain bokes find time yere kind men dreme theffect goth ye mone leve dreme nat done wel worth dream aie old wife truly eke augurie foules feare men wenen lese life raven qualm schriching oules trowen bothe false foule ala ala noble creature man drede ordure al mine hart thee beseche vnto thy self thou foryeve rise vp withouten speche let v cast forth may best driven time eke freshly may liven cometh ye shall right sone god helpe best thus done rise let v speake lustie life troy lad forth time drive eke time coming v rejoy bringen shall blisse blive langour twise day five shall therewith foryet oppresse well vnneth done shall v duresse toune full lordes al truce lasten meane go plaien v lustie rout sarpedon hen mile thus thou shalt time well beguile drive forth vnto blisfull morow thou see cause thy sorow rise dere brother troilus certes non honour thee wepe thy bedde rouken thus truely thing trust thou thus ligge day two three folke woll wene yt thou cowardise thee fainest sick thou darst rise troilus answerde brother dere folke know isuffred pain though wepe make sorowful chere feeleth harme smart every vain wonder though ever plain alway wepe nothing blame sen yt lost ye cause game sen fine force mote arise shall arise sone ever may god mine hert sacrifice send v hastely tenthe day never foule faine may shall ben yt cometh troie cause tourment joie whider thy rede qd troilus may play v best toun god counsaile qd pandarus ride play v king sarpedoun long speaken vp doun till troilus gan last assent rise forth sarpedon went sarpedon honourable ever live full hie prowesse might iserved table deintie coste great richesse fedde hem day day noblesse saiden eke least never er day wiste feast world none instrument delicious winde touche corde ferre wight hath ever iwent tonge tell harte may recorde yt feast well heard recorde ne lady eke faire companie daunce er tho never iseen eye availeth troilus sorrow nothing rought ever one hert pitous full busily creseide lady sought ever al hert thought fast imagining glad iwis feasting lady eke feast sen saw lady away sorow upon hem seen heare instrumentes play hert hath kay absent lo fantasie wight shulde maken melodie na houre al day night ther man might ne sayd lovesome lady bright ye faren sin ye welcome iwis mine owne lady dere welaway na mase fortune hove entended bet glase letter eke olde time isent would alone rede hundred sith atwixt noone prime refiguring shape womanhede within hert every worde dede passed thus drove end fourth day saied wol wend said leve brother pandarus intendest thou shall bleve til sarpedon woll forth conveyen u yet fairer toke leve goddes love let u sone eve leave take homeward let u turne trewely nill nat thus sojourne pandare answerde comen hither fetchen fire rennen home againe god helpe nat tellen whither might gone shall sothly saine wight u faine sarpedon hence hie thus sodainly hold vilanie saiden would bleve weke thus sodainly fourth day take leve would wondren trewly let u holden forth purpose fermely sen ye behighten abide hold forward let u ride pandarus pine wo made dwell wekes end sarpedon toke leave tho way speden hem wend qd troilus lorde grace send may find mine home comming creseide comen therwith gan sing ye haselwode thought pandare himselfe ful softly seide god wotte refroiden may hotte fare er calcas sende troilus creseide nathelesse yaped thus seide swore iwis hert wel behight wolde come sone ever might unto paleis ycomen troilus doun horse alight ye chambre way nomen unto time gan night speken creseide lady bright hem lest spede hem fro supper unto rest morow sone day began clere troilus gan slepe abreide pandarus brother dere loue god full pitously seide go seene paleis creseide sen yet may feest let u seine paleis leest therewithall meine blende cause fonde toune go creseides house gan wende lorde sely troilus wo thought sorowful hart brast atwo saw doores sparred well nigh sorow adoun gan fall therwith ware gan behold shet every window place frost thought hert gan cold chaunged deedly pale face withouten worde forth gan pace god would gan faste ride wight countenance aspide said thus paleis desolate house house whilom best ihight paleis empty disconsolate thou lanterne queint light paleis whilom day art night wel oughtest thou fall die sen went wont u gie paleis whilom crowne house enlumined sunne blisse ring rubie fall cause wo cause hast ben blisse yet sen may bet fain would kisse thy colde doores durst rout farewel shrine saint therwith cast pandarus eie changed face pitous behold might time aright aspie aie rode pandarus told new sorow eke joyes old petously deed hew every wight might sorow rew fro thence forth rideth vp doune every thing came remembraunce rode forth place toune whilom pleasaunce lo yonder saw mine owne lady daunce temple eien clere caught first right lady dere yonder herde full lustely dere hart laugh yonder play saw one eke ful blisfully yonder one gan say good sweete love well pray yonde goodly gan behold death mine hart hold corner yonder house herde mine alderlevest lady dere womanly voice melodiouse singen wel goodly clere soule yet thinketh blisfull sowne yonder place lady first toke vnto grace thouyt thus blisful lord cupide processe memory thou hast weried every side men might booke make like story nede thee seeke victory sen thine holly thy joy hast thou thine owne folke spill wel hast thou lord iwroke thine ire thou mighty god dredful greve mercy lord thou wost wel desire thy grace lustes leve live die wol thy beleve ne aske guerdon bone thou creseide ayen send sone distraine hart fast returne thou doest mine longen see wote wel nil nat sojourne blisful lord cruel thou ne vnto blood troy pray thee iuno vnto blode thebane ye folke thebe cauyt bane yates went creseide rode full good paas vp doun made many went selfe ful oft said ala fro hence rode blisse solas would blisful god joie might sene ayen come troie yonder hil gan guide ala toke leve yonde saw father ride sorow mine hart shal cleve hither home come eve dwell cast joie shal til may sene eft troie selfe imagined oft ben defaited pale woxen lesse wont men saiden soft may sothe gesse troilus hath al hevinesse al na melancolie selfe fantasie another time imaginen would every wight went wey routh saine right sory troilus wol dey thus drove day yet forth twey ye herde life gan lede stode betwixen hope drede liked songes shewe thencheson wo best might made songe wordes fewe somwhat wofull hart light every man sight softe voice lady dere absent gan sing ye may sterre lost light hart sore wel ought bewaile ever derke turment night night toward deth winde stere saile tenth night faile guiding thy bemes bright houre ship caribdes woll devoure song thus songen sone fel ayen sighes old every night wont done stode bright moone behold al sorow moone told said iwis whan thou art horned new shal glad al world trew saw thine horne old eke morow whan hence rode right lady dere cause turment sorow bright lucina clere love god ren fast thy sphere whan thine horne new ginnen spring shall come may blisse bring day lenger every night ben wont thought tho sunne went course vnright lenger way wont go said iwis drede evermo sunnes sonne pheton live father cart amisse drive vpon wals fast eke would walke greekes host would see himselfe right thus would talke lo yonder mine owne lady free else yonder tent bee thence commeth aire soote soule fele doth boote hardly wind thus stoundmeale encreaseth face lady deepe sighes sore preve thus none space toune save place feele wind souneth like paine saith ala twined twaine long time driveth forth right thus till fully passed ninth night aye beside pandarus busily full might comfort make hart light yeving hope alway tenth morow shal comen stinten sorow vpon side eke creseide woman among grekes strong full oft day ala seide borne well may mine hart long death live long ala ne may amend worse ever yet wend father nill nothing doe grace gone ayen aught queme terme pace troilus shall heart deme false may well seme thus shall vnthonke every side borne welaway tide put jeopardie steale away night befall caught shall hold aspie el lo drede honds wretch fall nam lost mine heart trew mightie god thou sorow rew full pale iwoxen bright face limmes leane day stode durst loked place borne dwelt aye night weeping ala lay thus dispeired cure lad life wofull creature full oft day sighed eke distresse selfe wene aye purtraying troilus great worthinesse goodly word recording sen first day love began spring thus set wofull hart afire remembrance gan desire world ni cruell hart heard complainen sorow nold wepten pain smart tenderly wept eve morow needed teares borow yet worst paine ther wight durst plain full rewfully looked vpon troy beheld toures high eke hallis ala qd pleasaunce joy turned gall oft within yonder wallis troilus doest thou ide lord whether thou yet thinke vpon creseide ala ne itrowed lore went ye redde ere sighed halfe sore might said done amis steale away one late commeth lectuarie men corse vnto graue carie late speke matere prudence ala one thine eyen three lacked alway ere came time passed well remembred mee present time eke would well see future time ere snare could seene causeth care nathelesse betide betide shal morow night east west hoast steale side gone troilus lest purpose woll hold ye best force wicked tongue onglerie ever love wretch endie woll every word take hede rule hem every wight wit ne shall never thriven drede men blamen ever yet lo manner folke commenden variaunce felicitie clepe suff aunce withouten word mo troy woll conclusioun god wote ere fully moneths two full ferre fro ententioun troilus troy toun shall knotlesse throughout hart slide woll take purpose abide diomede tell gan goth within himselfe aye arguing sleight ever may best shortest tarying nerre creseides heart bring entent couth never fine fishen laid booke line nathelesse well hart thought na nat without love troy never sithen thence brought ne couth seene laugh maken joy nist best hart taco e tassey said nought ne greveth naught assaieth naught atcheveth yet said himselfe vpon night nat foole wote well wo love another wight hereupon gone assay may well wete nill nat ben prow wise folke bookes expresse men shall nat wo wight hevinesse might winnen floure fro mourneth night day page duplicate page duplicate might saine conquerour right anone bold aye thought hart hap hap may dye woll heart seech shall lesen speech diomede bookes u declare nedes prest courageous stern voice mighty limmes square hardy testife strong chevalrous deedes like father tideus men saine tonge large heire calcidony arge creseide meane stature thereto shape face eke chere might ben fairer creature oft time manere gone itressed haires clere downe colere backe behind thred gold would bind save browes joyneden ifere na lacke aught espien speaken eyen clere lo truly written seien paradis stood formed eien rich beauty evermore strove love aie wch hem sobre eke simple wise withall best inorished eke might bee goodly speech generall charitable estately lusty free ne nevermore ne lacked pitee tender hearted sliding corage truly cannat tell age troilus well woxen hight complete formed proportioun well kind naught amenden might young fresh strong hardy lioun trew steele ech conditioun one best entetched creature shall yt world may dure certainely story fond troilus never unto wight time degree second daring longeth knight might giaunt passen might hart aye ye first best stood peregall dare done lest tellen forth diomede fill tenthe day sen creseide city yede diomede fresh braunch may came tent calcas lay fained calcas done ment shall tellen sone creseide short wordes tell welcommed downe sette ethe ynough maken dwell withouten long lette spice wine men forth hem fette forth speke ifere friend done shall ye
