gan first fallen warre speech betwixen hem folke troy toun thassiege gan eke beseech tellen opinioun fro demaund discendeth doun asken straunge thought greek gise werkes yt wrought father tarieth long wedden unto worthy wight creseide paine strong love troilus owne knight ferforth cunning might answerde tho entent seemed nat wiste ment nathelesse ilke diomede gan himselfe assure thus seide aright taken hede methinketh thus lady mine creseide sen first hond bridle leide came troy morrow ne might never seene sorrow nat saine may cause love trojan right sore would thinken ye wight dwelleth shoulden spill quarter tere pitously selven begile dredelesse nat worth folke troy saith prison ben ye selven see fro thence shall nat one live come gold wixen sunne see trusteth well understondeth mee shall nat one mercy gone live lord worldes twise five wrech hem fetching heleine shall take ere hence wend maunes yt goddes ben peine shall ben agast grekes wol hem shend men shall drede unto world end henceforth ravishen queene cruell shall wreche hem seene calcas lede u ambage saine double wordes slie men clepen word two visage ye shall well knowen nat ne lie thing right sene eie anon ye nill nat trow soone taketh hede doone wene ye wise father would yeven antenor anone ne wist city destroied ben nay mote gone knew full well shall nat scapen one troian great fere durst nat ye dwelt lenger woll ye lovesome lady dere let troy troians fro heart passe drive bitter hope make good chere clepe ayen beautie face ye salt teares deface troy brought ieopardie save remedie thinketh well ye shall grekes find perfite love ere night troian kind bet serven woll done might ye vouchsafe lady bright woll ben serven selve ye lever lord greces twelve word gan waxen reed speech little quoke cast aside little heed stint afterward woke soberly threw loke said albeit joy gentill man wight troy father tideus seide lived ere calcidonie arge king creseide hope shall iwis slaine ala harme vnhappily thebe rathe polimite many man scathe hart mine sithe man ben first feche grace serve heartely ever shall live space ere depart place ye woll graunte may morow better laiser tell sorow shuld tell wordes seide spake ynough day mest preveth well spake creseide graunted morrow request speake least nolde speake matere thus said ye mowe hart troilus fast may none arace straungely spake saied thus diomede love ilke place borne ioves thy grace deliver soone doth care god thy might leve well fare grekes wold wrath troy wreke might know well iwis shall naught befallen ye speke god toforne farther wote father wise ready hath bought ye told dere vnto hold grekes ben high conditioun wote eke well certaine men shall find worthie folke within troy toun conning persite kinde ben betwixte orcades inde ye could well lady serve trow eke well thonke deserve speake loue iwis seide lord wedded whole mine hart till deide love helpe pallas mine hart ni ne never ye ben noble high kinrede well herde tellen drede doth great wonder ye woll scornen woman eke god wote love ben fer asonder disposed bet mote go vnto death plaine make wo shall done say truely yet list nat play mine hart tribulatioun ye armes busie day day hereafter ye wonnen toun paraventure happen may see never ere sey woll werke yt never ere wrought word ynough suffisen ought morow eke wol speken faine ye touchen naught matere list ye may come againe ere ye gone thus much say helpe pallas haires clere greeke routh shulde selven trouth say nat therefore woll love ne say nat nay conclusioun meane well god sit therewithall cast eien doun gan sigh said troilus troy toun yet bidde god quiet rest may seene mine hart brest effect shortly say diomede freshly new againe gan preasen fast mercy pray soothe saine gloue toke full faine finally woxen eve well rose tooke leve bright venus folowed aie taught way brode phebus doune alight cithera chare horse taught whirle lion might signifer candle sheweth bright creseide vnto bed went within father faire bright tent retourning soule aye vp doun wordes suddaine diomede great estate perill toun alone nede friendes help thus began brede cause soothe tell tooke fully purpose dwell morow came ghostly speke diomede come vnto creseide shortly least ye tale breke well himselfe spake seide sighes sore doune leide finally soothe saine rest great paine story telleth v yave faire bay stede one wan troilus eke brooch little nede troilus yave diomede eke bet sorow releve made weare pencell sleve find eke story elsewhere body hurt diomede troilus tho wept many tere saw wide wound blede tooke kepen good hede healen smart men saine yave hart truely storie telleth v made never woman wo falsed troilus said ala clene ago name trouth love evermo falsed one gentillest ever one worthiest ala vnto worldes end shall neither ben iwritten isong good word bokes woll shend irolled shall many ong throughout world bell shall rong woman woll hate ala caas fall woll saine much hem done dishonour welaway first amis helpeth done blame away sen see better way late rue diomede woll algate true troilus sen better may sen thus departen ye yet pray god yeve right good day gentillest knight truely ever saw serven faithfully best aye lady honour kepe word brast anon wepe certes ne haten shall never friendes love shall ye good word liven ever truly would right sorrie seene adversite guiltlesse wot well leave shall passe thus take leave truly long bitwene forsoke diomede none authour telleth wene take every man bookes hede shall terme finden drede though began woe sone ere wan yet done ne ne list sillie woman chide ferther storie woll de vise name ala published wide gilt ought ynough suffise might excuse wise sorrie vntrouth iwis would excuse yet routh troilus told thus driveth forth wel hath might oft heart hote cold namely ilke ninth night morrow behight come ayen god wote full little rest night nothing slepe lest laurer crowned phebus heat gan course aie vpward went warmen east sea wave wete circe doughter song fresh entent troilus pandare sent wals towne pleide looke seene aught creseide till noone stooden see came every maner wight came fro ferre saiden shee till coulden knowen aright heart dull light thus beyaped stooden stare naught troilus pandare pandarus troilus tho seide aught wot noone sikerly toune ne cometh creseide hath ynough done hardely winnen father trow old father woll yet make dine ere go god yeve hart pine pandarus answerd may well certain thy let v dine thee beseech noone maist thou come home go without speech comen ayen long may seech ere find gape fortune hem thinketh yape qd troilus see well taried old father ere come woll nigh even come forth woll vnto yate go porter ben vnkonning vermo woll done hem holden vp yate naught ne although come late day goth fast came eve yet came nat troilus creseide looketh forth hedge tree greve ferre head wall leide last tourned seide god wote meaning pandare almost iwis new care doubtlesse lady good wote commeth riding prively commend wisedome mine hood woll nat maken people nicely gaure commeth softely night toune thinketh ride dere brother thinke nat long abide naught el done iwis pandarus wilt thou trowen trouth see yond heave thine eyen man mayst thou nat see pandare answerde nay mote thee al wrong god wt saist thou man wher art see yonde afarre ni cart ala thou sayst right sooth qd troilus hardely nought mine hart rejoyce thus ayenst good thought nat sen yt wrought ne felt comfort dare say cometh night life yt durst lay pandarus answerde may well inough held ever saied hart thought soft lough himselfe full soberly saied hasell wood jolly robin plaied shall come thou abidest ye farwell snow ferne yere wardein yates gan call folk yt without yates bad hem driven beast night must bleven ferre within night many tere troilus gan homeward ride well seeth helpeth nat abide nathelesse gladded thought misacompted day saied understand amis thilke night last creseide sey sayd shall ben may ere moone dere hart swete lion passe ariete may yet hold behest morrow unto yate went doune west eke east vpon wall made many went naught hope alway blent night sorow sighes sore went home withouten hope cleane hart fled ne hath whereon lenger hong paine thought hart bled throw sharp wonder strong saw abode long nist judgen might sen hath broken yt behight third fourth fift sixt day tho dayes tenne told betwixen hope drede hart say yet somewhat trusting hestes old saw nolde terme hold seene none remedie shape soone die therwith wicked spirit god u blesse men clepen wood jealousie gan crepe hevinesse would soone die ne eat ne dronke melancholie eke every company fled life time led defaite manner man vnneth might knowen went leane thereto pale wan feeble walketh potent ire thus himselfe shent asked whereof smart sayd harme hart priam full oft eke mother dere bretherne sustren gan frain sorrowfull chere thing ye cause pain naught nolde cause plain sayd felt grievous maladie hart faine would die day laid slepe befell slepe thought forrest fast walked wepe love ye paine wrought doune forrest sought met saw bore tuskes great slept ayenst bright sunnes heat bore fast armes fold lay kissing aye lady bright creseide sorrow gan behold dispite slepe breide loude cried pandarus seide pandarus know crop root nam dead ni none boot lady bright creseide hath betraied trusted wight elsewhere hath hart apaied blisfull god great might dreame ishewed full right thus dreame creseide behold thing pandarus told creseide ala subtelte new lust beauty science wrath cause ye guilt fell experience hath rafte ala thine advertence trust faith depe assuraunce hath raft creseide pieasaunce ala let hence go well nigh wit breide shall trow othes mo god wote wend lady bright creseide every word gospell ye seide may bet beguile list men wenen best trist shall done pandarus ala fele sharpe new paine sen remedy caas bet mine honds twaine selven slow alway thus plaine ye death wo shuld end every day life self shend pandare answerde said ala borne nat saied er dreames many manner man beguile folke expounden hem amis darst thou saine false thy lady dreame right thine drede let thought thou canst dream rede peraventure thou dremest bore may may signifie father old eke hore ayen sunne lieth point die sorow ginneth wepe crie kisseth lieth ground thus shuldest thou thy dreme aright expound might doen qd troilus know yea neuer lite sayst thou wisely qd pandarus rede sen thou canst well endite hastily letter thou write wch thou shalt well bringen know sooth thou art dout see dare well sain untrue cannot trowen woll write write thou shalt full sone isee whether hath liberte come ayen el clause let woll assigne cause thou hast written sen went thee durst lay may cause ben entent hardely thou wolt thy selven say abode best tway write thou shalt fele sone sooth done accorded ben conclusioun anon like lord two hastely sate troilus adoun rolleth hart fro may best descriven wo creseide owne lady dere wrote right thus said ye may pthe copy letter right fresh flour whose ben shall withouten part elsewhere servise hart body life lust thought wofull wight every humble wise tong tell hart may devise oft matter occupieth place recommaund unto noble grace liketh weten sweete hart ye well know long time agon ye left aspre paine smart ye went yet bote non non ever worse bigon fro day day mote dwell list wele wo well dredefull hart trew write sorow driveth write wo every houre encreaseth new complaining dare endite defaced may ye wite teares wch mine eyen rain wulden speke durst plain first beseech eyen clere looke defouled nat hold ye lady dere woll vouchsafe letter behold cause eke care cold slaeth wit aught amis start foryeve mine owne sweet hart seruaunt durst ought right vpon lady pitously complaine wene ought wight considred ye moneths twaine raried ye saiden sooth saine tenne day ye nolde hoste soiourne two moneths yet ye retourne much mote nedes like list dare nat plaine humbly sorowfull sighes sike right mine vnrestie sorowes sore fro day day desiring evermore knowen fully ye fared ye whose welfare heale eke god encrease honour vpward degree grow alway never cease right hart aye lady free devise pray god mote graunt soone vpon rew wisely inall trew liketh knowen fare whose wo ther may wight discrive chest every care writing letter live redy wofull ghost drive delay hold yet hond vpon sight matter sond mine eyen two vaine see sorowfull teres salt arne woxen wellis song plaint mine adversite good harm mine ease eke woxen hell joy wo sey nought elli tourned life warie every joy ease contrarie wch coming home ayen troy ye may redresse thousand sithe ever encreasen joy never hart yet blithe save life shall ben swithe see though manner routh meuen yet thinketh trouth gilt hath death deserved list vpon see guerdon yet served beseeeh mine owne lady free herevpon ye woulden write love god right lodesterre death may make end al werre cause aught doth dwell letter ye may recomfort though absence hell patience woll wo comfort letter hope woll disport writeth swete let thus nat plaine hope death delivereth fro paine iwis mine owne dere hert trew wote ye next vpon see lost mine heale eke mine hew creseide shall conne knowen iwis mine herts day lady free thursteth aye mine hert behold beautie vnneth life hold say sey well tell may whether ye live dey yet pray god yeve right good day fareth well goodly faire fresh may ye life death may commaund trouth aye recomaund heale ye yeven heale shall none heale lieth list day clothen shall grave life might save fro disease paine smart fare well mine owne sweet hart la vostre letter forth sent vnto creseide answere effect full pitously wrote ayen seide soone might iwis would come amend amis finally wrote saied would come ye nist letter made feast wonder swore loved best found bottomlesse bihests troilus thou mayst east west pipe iuie leafe yt thee lest thus goth world god shild v fro mischaunce every wight yt meaneth trouth avaunce encreasen gan wo fro day night troilus tarying creseide lessen gan hope eke might doun bedde leide ne eat dronke ne slept ne word seide imagining aye vnkind wel nigh wext mind dreme wch told eke beforne may never come remembraunce thought aye well lady lorne ioves purveyaunce shewed sleepe signifiaunce vntrouth disaventure bore shewed figure sibille suffer sent called cassandre eke dreame told ere stent sought assoilen dout strong bore tuskes stout finally within little stound cassandre gan thus dreme expound gan first smile said brother dere thou sooth desirest know thou must old story purpose fortune overthrow hath lord old within throw thou shalt bore know kind comen men bookes find diane wroth ire greekes nolde done sacrifice ne incens vpon alter set fire greekes gon dispise wrake wonder cruell wise bore great oxe stall made vp frete corne vine slea yt bore country raised emong came bore maid one world best ipraised meleager lord countre loved fresh maiden free manhood ere would stent bore slough hed sent old bookes tellen v rose conteke great envie lord discended tideus line el old bookes lie meleager gan die mother woll tell long dwell told eke tideus ere stent vnto strong citie thebe claimen kingdome citie went fellawe dan polimites brother dan ethiocles full wrongfully thebe held yt strength told proesse length told eke hemonides affart tideus stough fiftie knightes stout told eke prophesies hart seven king rout besiegeden citie holy serpent well fury gan tell associat profugus tideus primo polynicem tidea ligatum docet insidiasque secundo tertius harmoniam canit vatem latitantem quartus habet reges ineuntes praelia septem lemniadum furiae quinto narrantur anguis archemori bustum sexto ludique seguuntur dat thebis vatem graiorum septimus umbris octavo cecidit tideus spes vita pelasgum hippomedon nono moritur cum parthenopeo fulmine percussus decimo capaneus superatur undecimo perimunt sese per vulnera fratres argivum flentem narrat duodenus ignem archinories burying play amphiorax fill ground tideus slaine lord argeis hippomedon little stound dreint dead parthenope wound also campaneus proud thunder dint slaine cried loud gan eke tell either brother ethiocles polimites also scarmishe eche hem slough argiues weeping mo toun brent told eke tho tho discended doun lestes old diomede thus spake told like bore betokeneth diomede tideus son doun descended fro meleager made bore blede thy lady iwis diomede hert hath weep thou wolt leave dout diomede thou art thou sayst sooth qd thou sorceresse thy false ghost prophecie thou wenest great devineresse seest thou nat foole fantasie painen lady lie away qd ioves yeve sorow shalt fals peraventure yet morow well thou mightest lien good alceste creature men lie ever kindest best husbond ieopardie die himselfe would die chese die hell starfe anon v bookes tell cassandre goeth cruell hart foryate wo anger speech fro bedde suddainly start though hole made seech day day gan require seech sooth full cure thus driveth forth aventure fortune permutation thing hath committed purveyaunce disposition high iove reignes shall ben flitted fro folk folk shal ben smitted gan pull away feather bright troy fro day day till ben bare joy emong fine ieopardie hector gan approchen wonder blive fate would soule vnbodie shapen meane drive ayenst fate helpeth strive day fighten gan wend ala caught life end wch thinketh every manner wight haunteth armes ought bewaile death yt noble knight drough king thauentaile vnware achilles maile bodie gan rive thus worthy knight reft live old bookes tellen u made wo yt tong may nat tell namely sorow troilus next worthinesse ye well wo gan troilus dwell sorow love unrest full oft day heart brest nathelesse tho gon dispaire drede aye lady untrue yet aye hart gan repaire lover done sought aye new get ayen creseide bright hew hart went excusing calcas caused tarying oft time purpose great himselven like pilgrime disguise seene may counterfeat ben unknowen folke wise find excuse aright may suffise among grekes knowen wept full oft many tere wrote yet oft time new full pitously left nat slouth beseeching sen true wol come ayen shold trouth creseide upon day routh take touching matere wrote ayen said ye may cupides sonne ensample goodlihede swerde knighthood sour gentilnesse might wight turment drede healelesse send yet gladnesse heartlesse sicke distresse sen ye may deale neither send hart may heale letter full paper iplainted conceived hath mine heart pite eke seene teares depainted letter ye requiren come ayen yet ne may least yt letter founden mention ne make fere grevous god wote unrest hast goddes ordinaunce seemeth nat ye take best thing ni remembraunce thinketh pleasaunce beth wroth beseech tary wicked speech heard well wend touching u two thinges istond shall dissimusing amend beth nat wroth eke understond yene holden hond force nat gesse trouth gentilnesse come woll yet disjoint stond wt yere day shall nat appoint effect pray may good word friendship aye truly life may dure friend ye may assure yet pray evill ye ne take short write dare nat well letter make ne never yet ne could well endite eke great effect men write place lite thentent nat letter space fareth well god grace la vostre c troilus thought letter straunge saw sorowfully sight thought like kalends eschaunge finally full ne trowen might ne would holden yt hight ful evell list leve loveth well case though greve nathelesse men saine last thing men shall soothe see case betide fast troilus well understood na nat kind ought finally wote dout lost hath ben stood day melancholy troilus suspectioun wend dye befell throughout troy toun yt guise iborne doun manner cote armoure saith story beforne deiphebe insigne victory cote telleth lollius deiphebe rent fro diomede dayand troilus saw gan taken hede vising length brede werke gan behold full sodainly heart gan cold coler found within brooch creseide yave morow troy must nedes twin remembraunce sorow laid ayen faith borow keepe aye full well wist lady na longer trift goth home gan full soone send pandarus newe chaunce broch told word end complaining harte variaunce long love trouth pennaunce death without word full fast cried rest restore spake thus lady mine creseide faith behest love trouth seide diomede ye fest ala would trowed least sen ye nolde trouthe stond ye thus nolde holden hond shall trowen othes mo ala never would wend ere ye creseide could chaunged ne agilt done amis cruell wend nat hart iwis slea thus ala name trouth fordone routh none broche list lete feast new love qd thilke broche teres wete yave remembraunce none cause ala ne ye dispite eke ye ment utterly shewen entent wch see clene mind ye cast ne may world within mine hart find unloven quarter day cursed time borne welaway done wo endure yet love best creature god qd send yet grace may meten diomede truely might space yet shall make hope side blede god qd aughtest taken hede forthren trouth wronges punice nilt thou vengeance vice pandarus dremes trift blamed hast wont art oft upbreide mayst thou seen thy self yt thee list trew thy niece bright creseide sundry formes god wote seide god shewen joy tene slepe dreme sene certainely withouten speech henceforth ferforth may mine owne death armes woll seech retch nat soone day truly creseide sweet maie might iserved ye thus done nat deserved pandarus thing herd wist well said sooth nat word ayen answerd sorrie friend sorrow shamed nece hath done amis stant astonied cause twey still stone word ne could sey last thus spake seide brother dere may thee saine hate iwis creseide god wote woll hate evermore thou besoughtest done yore vnto mine honour ne rest right regard thee lest aught might liken thee lefe treason god wote sorrow dredelesse heart ease right faine would amend wist fro world almighty god pray deliver soone say great sorow plaint troilus forth course fortune aye gan hold creseide loveth sonne tideus troilus mote wepe care cold world behold eche estate little hart rest god leve v take best many cruell battaile drede troilus ilke noble knight men may old bookes rede seen knighthood great might dredelesse ire day night full cruelly grekes aye abought alway diomede sought oft time find mette bloody stroke word great assaying speares whette god wote many cruell heat gan troilus vpon helme beat nathelesse fortune naught ne would others hond either dien itaken write armes ilke worthy man would battailes endite writen first began love said worthy deed list hem rede dare tell hem ifere beseeching every lady bright hew every gentill woman albeit creseide vntrew gilt ye nat wroth ye may gilt bookes see gladder would write lest penelope trouth good alceste ne say nat onely men woman betraied throgh fals folk god yeve hem sorow amen great wit subtilte betraien meveth speake effect pray beth ware men herkeneth say go little booke go little tregedie god maker yet ere die send might make comedie little booke make thou none envie subject ben vnto poesie kisse step whereas thou seest pace vergil ovid homer lucan stace great diversite english writing tong pray god none miswrite thee ne thee misse metre defaut tong redde thou el song thou vnderstond god beseech yet purpose rather speech wrath began sey troilus greekes boughten dere thousand honds maden dey withouten pere save time hector welaway save onely goddes dispitously slough fierce achill slain manere light ghost full blisfully went vp hollownesse seventh sphere place leting everiche element saw full avisement erratike sterres herkening armonie sownes full heaven melodie doun thence fast gan avise little spot earth see enbraced fully gan despise wretched world held vanite respect plaine felicite heaven last slaine looking doun cast himselfe lough right wo hem wepten death fast damned werkes followeth blind lust may nat last shoulden hart heaven cast forth went shortly tell mercurie sorted dwell fine hath lo troilus love fine hath great worthinesse fine hath estate royall fine lust fine hath noblesse fine hath false worldes brotelnesse thus began loving creseide told wise deide young fresh folkes yt love vp groweth age repaireth home worldly vanite herts vp casteth visage thilke god image made thinketh ni faire world passeth sone floures faire loveth right love vpon crosse soules bey first starfe rose sit heven nill falsen wight dare sey woll hert wholly ley sen best love meeke needeth fained love seeke lo painems cursed old rite lo goddes may availe lo wretched worldes appetite lo fine guerdon travaile iove apollo mar raskaile lo forme old clerkes speech poetrie ye bookes seech morall gower booke direct thee philosophicall strode vouchsafe need correct benignity zeales good soothfast christ starfe rood mine heart mercy ever pray lord aright thus speake say thou one two three eterne live raignest aie thre two one vncircumscript maist circumscrive v visible invisible fone defend thy mercy everichone make v iesus thy mercy digne love maide mother thine benigne pthus endeth fifth last booke troilus testament creseide doly season till carefull dite corespond equivolent right began write tragedy weder right fervent aries middes lent showres haile fro north discend scantly fro cold might defend yet neverthelesse within mine orature stode titan beames bright withdrawen doun scyled vnder cure faire venus beaute night vpraise sette vnto weste ful right golden face oppositioun god phebus directe discending doun throughout glasse beames brast faire might see every side northren winde purified aire shedde misty cloudes fro skie froste fresed blastes bitterly fro pole artike come whisking loud shrill caused remove ayenst trusted venus love quene somtime hight obedience faded hert love would make grene ther vpon humble reverence thought pray high magnificence great colde letted chambre fire pa though love hote yet man age kindleth nat soone youtheed blood flowing rage old corage dull deed fire outward best remeed help phisike nature failed expert assailed made fire beaked aboute tooke drinke spirites comfort armed wel fro colde theroute cutte winter night make short toke queare left sport writen worthy chaucer glorious faire creseide lusty troilus found dioniede received lady bright hewe troilus nere witte abrede wepte sore visage pale hewe wanhope teares gan renewe esperus rejoysed againe thus joy lived paine behest great comforting trusting troy wold make retour desired al earthly thing onely paramour saw passed day hour gainecome sorow oppresse wofull hart care hevinesse distresse needeth nat reherse worthy chaucer booke goodly termes joly verse compiled hath care wil looke breke sleepe another queare tooke founde fatal desteny faire creseide ended wretchedly wote al chaucer wrate trew wote nat narracion authorised forged newe poete invencion made report lamentacion wofull end lusty creseide distresse deide diomede al appetite fulfilled faire lady vpon another sette delite send libel repudy excluded fro company desolate walked downe men saine court commune fair creseide floure per se troy grece thou fortunate chaunge filth thy feminite fleshly lust maculate go among grekes early late giglotlike taking thy foul pleasaunce pite thee fall mischaunce yet neverthelesse wt ever men deme say scornfull language thy brutelnesse shal excuse ferforth may thy womanhed thy wisedome fairnesse fortune hath put distresse pleased nothing gilt thee wicked langage spilt faire lady wise destitute al comfort consolatioun right prively without felowship refute disheuelde passed toun mile two vnto mansioun bilded full gaie wher father calcas among grekes dwelling saw cause gan enquire comming said sighing full sore fro diomede gotten desire woxe wery would qd calcas doughter weep thou nat therfore paraventure al cometh best welcome thou art full dere gest old calcas law tho keper temple preest venus sonne cupido honoured chambre nest creseide bale enewed brest vsed passe praiers say last vpon solemne day custome people ferre nere noone vnto temple went sacrifice devout manere still creseide heuie entent church would nat selfe present giving people deeming expulse fro diomede king passed secrete oratore might wepe wofull destinie behind backe closed fast dore knee bare fel doune hie vpon venus cupide angerly cried saied wise ala ever made sacrifice ye gave one divine responsaile floure love troy made vnworthy outwaile al care translated joy shal gide shal conuoie sith fro diomede noble troilus clene excluded abiect odious false cupide none wite thou mother love blind goddace ye caused vnderstand alway trow seede love sowen face aie grew grene sople grace ala seede frost slaine fro lover left forlaine said doun extasie rauished spirite dreame fell apparaunce herde lie cupide king tinging siluer bell men might fro heven hell whose sound cupide aperes seven planet discending fro speres hath power al thing generable rule stere great influence weder winde course variable first saturne gave sentence gave cupide litel reverence boistous chorle manere came crabbedly austrine loke chere face frounsed lere like ye lede teeth chattered sheuered chin eien drouped hole sonken heed nose mildrop fast gan rin lippes blo chekes leane thin iseickeles fro heer doun hong wonder great speare long attour belte liart locke laie feltred vnfaire fret frostes hoore garment gate ful gay graie widdred wede fro wind wore boistous bowe within honde bore vnder girdle fashe felone flains feddred ise heeded holstains iupiter right faire amiable god sterres firmament norice thing generable fro father saturne farre different burly face browes bright brent vpon heed garlond wonder gaie flour faire maie voice clere cristal eien golden wier glittering heare garment gite ful gaie grene golden listes gilte every geare burly brande middle beare right hand grounden spere father wrothe fro v bere next came mar god ofrei strife debate discensioun chide fight fierse fire harde harnesse hewmonde habergioun haunch rusty fel fauchoun hand rusty sword writhing face many angry word shaking brande cupide come reed visage grisly glowing eien mouth blubber stode fome like bore whetting tuskes kene right tulsure like temperaunce tene horne blewe many boustous bragge al world war hath made wagge fair phebus lanterne lampe light man beast fruit florishing tender norice banisher night world causing moving influence life al earthly thing without comfort force nought must go die yt worlde hath wrought king royall rode vpon chare phiton somtime gided vnright brightnesse face bare non might behold persing sight golden carte firy beames bright foure yoked stedes full different hewe bout bait tiring sphere drewe first sord mane reed rose called eoye orient second stede name hight ethiose whitely pale somdele ascendent third perose right hote eke fervent fourth blacke called phlegone rolleth phebus doun see venus present goddes gay sonnes quarrel defend make owne complaint cladde nice aray one half greene thother half sable blake white heer gold kembet shede abake face seemed great variaunce parfite truth while inconstaunce vnder smiling dissimulate provocative blinkes amorous sodainly chaunged alterate angry ferpent venomous right pungitive wordes odious thus variaunt liste take kepe one eie laugh wepe tokening fleshly paramour venus hath rule governaunce somtime swete somtime bitter sour right vnstable ful variaunce minged careful joy false pleasaunce hote cold blith ful wo grene lefe widred ago boke hand come mercurious right eloquent ful rethorie polite termes delicious penne inke report al redie setting songes singing merely hode reed hecled attour croun like til poete old fasioun box bare fine electuares sugred siropes digestion spice belonging potiquares many holsome swete confection doctor phisike cledde scarlet goun furred well one ought honest good nat worde couth lie next come lady sinthia last swiftest sphere colour blake busked horne twa night listeth best tapere hawe leed colour nothing clere al light boroweth brother titan self hath none gite gray ful spottes blake brest chorle painted full even bearing bushe thornes bake theft miyt clime ner heven thus gadred goddes seven mercurius chosed one assent forespeker parliment ben liking faconde tonge termes exquisite rethorike practike might lere brefe sermon preignant sentence write cupide valing cappe lite sper cause vocacioun anon shewde entencioun lo qd cupide wol blaspheme name owne god either word dede goddes doeth losse shame bitter paine mede say yonder wretch creseide somtime flour love mother stately reprove saying great infelicite cause mother venus called blinde goddes might nat se sclaunder defame injurious thus living vncleane lecherous would retorte mother shewde grace al sithe ye al seven deficate perticipant divine sapience great injury hie estate think pain make recompence never goddes done violence wel selfe say therfore go helpe revenge pray mercurius cupide gave answere said sir king counsaile ye referre hiest planet take lowest degree paine creseide modifie god saturne take sinthia content qd take twa thus proceded saturne mone mater ripely degest dispite cupide done venus open manifest lyfe payne oprest turment sore sickenesse incurable lover abhominable doleful sentence saturn toke hand passed doun careful creseide lay heed laide frosty wande lawfully wise gan say thy great fairenesse al thy beauty gay thy wanton blood eke thy golden heere exclude fro thee evermeere chaunge thy mirthe melancoly mother pensivenesse thy moyster thy hete colde dry thine insolence thy play thy wantonnesse great disease thy pompe thy richesse mortall nede great penurie thou suffre shalt begger die cruel saturne froward angry harde thy dome malicious faire creseide hast thou mercy swete gentill amorous withdraw thy sentence gracious thou never sheweth thy dede wrekeful sentence given creseide sinthia saturne past away seate discended doun blive reed bill creseide lay containing sentence diffinitive fro heale body thee deprive thy sicknesse shal recure dolour thy dayes endure thy christal iyen menged blood make thy voice clere vnpleasant heer hace thy lusty lere overspred spot blake lump hawe appering thy face thou comest eche man shall flie place thus shalt thou go begging fro hous hous cuppe clapper like lazarous doolie dreame vgly visioun brought till end creseide fro awoke court convocatioun vanished away rose vp toke polished glasse shadow couth loke saw visage deformate hart wo ne wite god wate weping full sore lo qd froward langage move stere crabbed goddes seen blaspheming bought ful dere yearthly joy mirthe set arere ala day ala wofull tide began goddes chide sayd child came fro hall warne creseide supper redie first knocked doore eft couth cal madame father biddeth cum hie hath marveile long grofe ye lie saith beades bethe long somdele goddes wote entent full wele qd faire child go father dere pray come speake anon sayd daughter chere ala qd father mirth gon qd expon told vengeaunce wrake trespas cupide couth take looked vgly leper face white lely floure wringing hand oft time sayd alace lived see wofull houre knew well socour sicknesse doubled pain thus ther care inow betwixt hem twain togider mourned ful lang qd creseide father would nat kend therfore secrete wise ye let gang yon hospitall tounes end thider meate charite send live vpon mirthe yearth fro gone wicked wearth mantill bever hat cuppe clapper wonder prively opened secrete gate thereat conveied man espie village halfe mile thereby delivered spittell hous daily sent part almous sum knew well sum knowlege bicause deformate bile blake overspred visage fayre colour faded alterate yet presumed hie regrate stil mourning noble kin bitter tooke day passed phebus went rest cloudes blake overwheled skie god wote creseide sorowfull gest seing vncouth fare herborie meate drinke dressed lie darke corner hous alone wise weping made mone complaint creseide soppe sorowe sonken care caitife creseide evermare gon thy joy thy mirth yearth blithnesse art thou blake bare salve may helpe thy sare fell thy fortune wicked thy werth thy blisse vanished thy bale vnberde vnder great god graven ware men grece ne yet troie miyt herd thy chamber wantonly beseen burly bedde banker brouded spice wine thy colatioun cuppes gold silver shene thy swete meates served plate clene savery sauce good fashioun thy gay garment many goodly goun thy plesaunt saune pinned golden pene arere thy great royall renoun thy gardien thy greces gay freshe floures quene floray painted pleasauntly every way thou wont full merily may walke take dewe day heare merle mavile many one lady faire carrolling gone see royall renkes ray leper loge take thy goodly boure thy bed take bounche stro wailed wine meates thou tho take mouled bread pirate sider soure cuppe clapper ago clere voice courtly carrolling ranke roke full hidous heer hace deformed figure face loke people hath liking sped sight say sore sighing lying emong leper folke ala lady faire troy grece attend freile fortune mine infelicite great mischief man amend mind mirrour make paraventure ye might may come end else worse worse may beware therefore approches nere end nought fairnesse fading floure nought famous laude hie honour winde inflate men eares rosing redde rotting shall retoure exemple make memore thing wofull witnes beares al welth yearth wind away weares beware therfore approches nere hour thus chiding drery disteny weping woke night fro end end vaine dole carefull cry might remedy ne yet mourning mend leper lady rose wend sayd spurnes thou wall slea thy self mende nothing sith thy weping doubleth thy wo counsaile thee make vertue nede go learne clappe thy clapper fro learne ye lawe leper lede bote forthwith yede fro place place cold hunger sore compelled ranke beggore time troy garnisoun chieftain worthy troilus throuy jeopardy warre striken doun knight grece nomber marveilous great triumph laude victorious troy right royally rode way creseide leper stode seing company come al stevin gave cry shoke cupps good spede worthy lordes goddes love hevin u seper part almose dede cry noble troilus toke hede pite nere place gan pa wher creseide sat nat weting wt vpon kest vp iyen blinke come til thought sometime face sein soch plite knew nought yet loke minde brought swete visage amorous blenking offaire creseid sometime owne derling wonder suppose mind toke figure sone lo idoll thing case may depe enprinted fantasie deludeth wittes outwardly apereth forme like estate within minde figurate sparke love til hartcouth spring kindeled body fire hote feuer swette trembling tooke readie exspire heare shield brest began tire within chaunged many hewe nevertheles nat one knew knightly pite memoriell faire creseide girdel gan take purse gold many gaie iewell skirt creseide doun gan shake rode away nat word spake pensife hart came toune great care oft sith almost fell doune lepre folke creseide couth draw see equall distributioun almose gold saw ech one priuely roun saied yon lord hath affectioun ever vnto yon lazarous v al know almous lord yon qd ye fele doeth v great humanite yes qd lepre man know wele sir troilus knight gentle free creseide vnderstood hee stiffer stele sterte bitter stound throughout hert fill doun ground come sighing sore sad many carefull crie cold atone brest stormy stoundes stad wrapped wo wretchfull one fell swoun ful oft would fone ever swouning cried thus false creseide true knight troilus thy love thy laude thy gentlenesse counted small prosperite effated wantonnesse clambe vpon fickell whele hie faith love promitted thee thy selfe fekell furious false creseide true knight troilus love thou kept countenaunce honest chast conuersacion woman protectour defence thou helped opinion minde fleshly foule affection enclined lustes lecherous fie false creseide true knight troilus lover beware take good hede ye love ye suffre pain let wit right throughout ye may trust true love proue ye woll labour vain therefore rede ye take ye find sad wedercocke wind bicause know great vnstablenesse brittle glasse vnto self say trusting great brutelnesse inconstaunt vntrue fay though true wot riyt ar findeth truth let lady ruse none self woll accuse said paper sat doun maner made testament bequethe corse carioun wormes toodes rent cuppe clapper mine ornament gold lepre folke shall dedde bury grave roiall ring set rubie redde troilus dowrie send leaue dedde make careful death vnto kend thus conclude shortly make end spirit leave diane dwels walke wast wodes welles diomede thou hast broche belt troilus gaue tokening true love worde swelt soone leaper man toke ring buried withouten tarying troilus forthwith ring bare creseide death gan declare heard great infirmite legacie lamentacioun ended poverte swelt wo fell doune swoun sorow hart brast boun sighing full sadly sayd vntrue wo therefore saith made tombe marble gray wrote name superscripcioun layd graue whereas lay golden letter conteining reasoun lo faire fadies creseide troie toun somtime counted floure womanhed vnder stone late leper lieth dedde worthy woman balade short made worship instruction charite monish exhort minge nat love false discepcion beare mind sore conclusion faire creseide sayd sith dedde speake legend good woman lady court took offence chaucer large speech untruth woman queen enjoyned compile book commendation sundry maiden wife shewed faithful faithless men thousand time heard men tell joy heaven pain hell accord wele nathelesse yet wote wele also ni non dwelling countre either hath heaven hell ibe ne may none way witten heard sayd found written assay may man preve god forbede men leve wel thing seen iye men shall nat en every thing lie seeth el dooth god wote thing never lesse soth though every wight ne may isee bernarde monke ne saugh parde mote bookes find old thing ben mind doctrine old wise yeve credence every skilful wise tellen old appreued story holines reignes victory love hate sundry thing may make rehearsings old bookes away ilorne remembraunce kay well ought v honouren beleve bookes han none preve though lite bookes rede delite hem yeve faith full credence mine herte hem reverence hertely game none fro bookes maketh gone seldome holy daie save certainly yt month may comen heare foules sing floures ginnen spring farwell booke deuocion eke condicion floures mede love floures white rede soch men callen daisy toun hem great affectioun sayd erst comen maie bedde daweth daie nam vp walking mede seen floure ayenst sunne sprede vp riseth early morrow blisfull sight softeneth sorow glad presence done reverence flour floure fulfilled vertue honoure every ilike faire fresh hewe ever love ever ilike newe ever shall till mine harte die sweare woll lie loved wight hotter life eve renne blithe sone ever sunne ginneth west seen floure woll go rest feare night hateth derkenesse chere plainly spred brightnesse sunne woll vnclose ala ne english rime prose suffisaunt floure praise aright helpeth ye han conning might ye lover make sentement case ought ye diligent forthren somewhat labour whether ye ye lefe ye flour well wote ye han beforne making ropen alway corne come glening full glad may find eare goodly worde ye han left though happen rehearsen eft ye han freshe songes sayd forbeareth beth euill apayd sith ye se doe honour love eke service flour serve wit might clerenesse light derke world wint ledeth hart within sorowfull brest dredeth loveth sore ye ben verily maistres wit nothing word workes knit bonde harpe obeieth honde make soune fingering right mowe ye mine hart bring soch voice right list laugh pain ye guide lady souerain mine yearthly god call werke sorowes wherefore spake yeve credence old story done hem reverence men musten thing bileve men may seen iye el preve shall sein see time may nat atones speake rime busie ghost thursteth alway new seen flour yong fresh hew constrained gredy desire harte fele yet fire made rise ere day first morow maie dreadfull harte glad deuocion resurrection floure vnclose sunne rose redde rose brest beast day angenores doughter ladde away doune knee anon right sette could fresh floure grette kneeling alway till vnclosed vpon small soft swete gras floures swete embrouded swetenesse soch odour speake gomme herbe tree comparison may imaked surmounteth plainly odoures riche beaute floures forgotten yearth poore estate winter naked made mate sword cloud sore greved hath attempre sunne al releved naked clad new small foules season fain panter net scaped vpon fouler hem made awhaped winter destroied brood dispite hem thought hem good sing song dispise foule chorle couetise betraied sophistrie song fouler defie craft songen clere lay love joy worshipping praysing make new blisfull somers sake vpon braunches full blosmes soft dilite tourned hem ful oft songen blissed sainct valentine day chese mine withouten repenting mine harte swete therewithall bekes gonnen mete yelding honour humble obeisaunce love didden observaunce longeth vnto love vnto nature constre list cure tho done vnkindnesse doeth tidife new fanglenesse besought mercy trespasing humbly song repenting sworen blosmes true make would vpon hem rue last maden acorde found daunger time lord yet pite strong gentill might foryave made mercy passen right innocence ruled curtesie ne cleape nat innocence folie ne false pite vertue meane eticke sayth soch maner meane thus foule voide malice acordeden love laften vice hate song one acorde welcome sommer governour lorde zephirus flora gentelly yave floures soft tenderly swote breth made hem sprede god goddesse flourie mede thoughte might day daie dwellen alway joly month maie withouten slepe withouten meat drinke adowne full softly gan sinke leaning elbow side long day shope abide nothing el shall nat lie looke vpon daisie well reason men call may daisie el iye day emprise floure floures pray god faire mote fall loven floures sake nathelesse ne wene nat make praising floure againe lefe corne againe shefe ni lever none ne nam withholden yet never nother ne serveth lefe ne floure well brouken service laboure thing another tonne old storie er soch thing begonne yt sunne south gan west floure gan close gan rest derknes night dred home mine house full swiftly sped gone rest earely rise seene floure sprede devise little herber benched turf fresh igrave bad men shoulde couche make deintie newe sommers sake bad hem strawen floures bedde laid mine iyen hedde fell slepe slept houre two met lay medow tho seen floure love drede ferre came walking mede god love hand quene clad royall habite grene fret golde next heere vpon white croune beare flourouns small shall lie world right daisie icrouned white leaf lite florouns croune white perle fine orientall white croune imaked white croune grene made like daisie seme considred eke fret gold iclothed mighty god love silke embroided full grene greves fret redde rose leves freshest sen world first begon gilt heere crouned son stede gold hevinesse weight therwith thouyt face shone bright well vnnethes might behold hand thought saw hold two firie dartes gledes rede angelike winges saw sprede men sain blind algate thought might se sternely gan behold loking doeth mine hart cold hand held noble queene crouned white clothed al greene womanly benigne meke worlde though yt men wold seke halfe beaute finde creature formed kinde therfore may sain thinketh song praising lady fre hide absolon thy gilte tress clere hester lay thou thy mekenesse adoun hide ionathas thy frendly manere penelopee marcia catoun make wifehode comparisoun hide beauty isoude helein lady cometh may distain thy faire body let appere lavine thou lucrece rome toun polixene boughten love dere cleopatra thy passioun hide trouthe love renoun thou tisbe hast love soch pain lady cometh may distain hero dido laodomia al ifere phillis hanging demophoun canace espied thy chere hipsiphile betrayed iasoun maketh trouth neither boste ne soun hipermistre ariadne ye twain lady cometh may distain balade may full well isongen sayd erst lady fre certainly mowe suffice apperen lady wise sunne woll fire distain passeth lady soverain good faire debonaire pray god ever fall faire nad comforte ben presence ben dead withouten defence drede love wordes chere time hereafter ye shall behind god love vpon grene saw coming lady ninetene roiall habit full easie pace hem came woman soch trace sen god adam made yerth third part mankinde ferth ne wende nat possibilite ever wide world ibe true love woman echon whether yt wonder thing non right anon gonne espie floure clepe daisie full sodainly stinten one kneled doune none songen voice heale honour trouth womanhede flour beareth alderprise figuring white croune beareth witnessing word compas enviroun sitten hem ful softely adoun first sat god love sith quene white croune clad grene sithen al remnaunt estate full curtesly ne nat worde spoken place mountenance furlong way space kneling floure good entent abode knowen people ment still stone till last god love iyen cast said kneleth answerde vnto asking herde sayd sir come nere salued qd doest thou nigh mine owne floure boldly better worthy truely worme nighen nere floure thou sir qd like thou qd art therto nothing able relike digne delitable thou fo folke werriest mine old servaunts thou missaiest hindrest hem thy translacion lettest folke devocion serve holdest folie serve love thou mayst nat denie plain text withouten nede glose thou hast translated romaunt rose heresie ayenst law makest wise folke fro withdraw creseide thou hast said list maketh men woman lesse trist ben trewe ever stele thine answere avise thee right wele though thou renied hast lay wretch done many day seint venus mother thou live thou shalt repenten cruelly shall well sene tho spake lady clothed greene saied god right curtesie ye mote herken replie ayenst ye meved god ne shulde nat thus agreved deite shal stable thereto gracious merciable ye nere god knowen might tellen shall man may falsely ben accused right ought ben excused court many losengeour many queinte totoler accusour tabouren eares many soun right imaginacioun daliaunce envie ben cause shall nat lie envie lavender court alway ne parteth neither night ne day house cesar thus saith dant goeth algate wol nat want eke peraunter man nice might done gessing malice vseth thinges make recketh nought mater take boden make thilke twey persone durst nat withsey repenteth vtterly ne hath nat done grevously amis translaten old clerkes writen though malice would enditen dispite love himselfe wrought shold riytwise lord thouyt nat like tiraunts lombardie han reward tyrannie king lorde naturell ought nat tiraunt ne cruell fermour done harme must thinke liege man tresour gold cofer sentence philosopher king kepe liege iustice withouten doute office woll kepe lordes degree right skil bee enhaunsed honoured dere ben halfe goddes world yet mote done right poore riche estate nat iliche poore folke compassion lo gentill kinde lion flie offendeth biteth taile away flie smiteth al easily gentrie deineth nat wreke flie doeth curre el another beest noble corage ought ben areest waien every thing equite ever regard vnto owne degre sir maistrie lord dampne man without answere word lorde full foule vse may nat excuse asketh mercy dreadfull hert profereth right bare sherte ben right owne judgement ought god short avisement consider owne honour trespace sith cause death lieth case ought ben lightlier merciable letteth ire bethe somewhat tretable man hath served conninges forthred well law makinges nat well endite yet hath made leude folke delite serve preising name made boke yt hight house fame eke death blaunche duchesse parliament foules gesse al love palamon arcite thebe though storie knowen li e many himpne holy day highten balades rondel virelaies speake holinesse hath prose translated boece made life also saint cecile made also gone great origenes vpon maudelaine ought lesse paine hath made many ley many thing ye god eke king alceste whilom quene trace aske man right grace ye never hurt al live shal swearen blive shal never agilten wise shal maken ye woll devise woman trewe loving al life ye woll maiden wife forthren much misseide rose el creseide god love answerde thus anon madame qd long agon knew charitable trewe never yet sen world newe ne found better none ye woll save degree may woll nat werne request al lieth doth lest al foryeve withouten lenger space yeveth yefte doth grace betime thanke shall demeth ye ye shal therfore go thanke lady qd rose doun set knee said thus madame god yelde god love maked wrath foryeve grace long live may know sothely ye holpen put degre trewly wende caas nought gilte ne done love trespas trewe man withouten drede hath nat parten theves dede ne trewe lover ought nat blame though speke false lover shame ought rather hold creseide wrote told rose mine author ment algate god wotte mine entent forthren trouth love cherice ben ware fro falsenesse fro vice ensample mening answerde let thine arguing love ne wol counterpleted right ne wrong lerne thou hast thy grace hold right thereto woll saine wt penance thou shalt thy trespace vnderstand thou shalt yt thou livest yere yere partie thy time spende making glorious legende good woman maiden wife trewe loving life tell false men hem betraien al life ne nat assaien many woman may done shame world hold game though thee like nat lover speke wel love penance yeve thee god love shal pray shal charge servant way forthren thee wel thy labour quite go thy waie penaunce lite boke made yeve quene behalfe eltham shene god love gan smile said wost thou qd wife maid queene countesse degree hath littell penaunce yeven thee hast deserved sore smart pite renneth soone gentle hart maist thou sene kitheth answerde naie sir blis see well good trewe tale mine hood qd love thou knowest wel parde thou avise hast thou nat booke thy cheste great goodnesse quene alceste turned daiesie husband chese die eke gone hell rather hercules rescued parde brought hel againe blis answerde againe said yes know good alceste daiesie mine owne herts reste fele well goodnesse wife death life great bounte doubleth renoun wel hath quit mine affectioun floure daiesie wonder though iove stellifie telleth agaton great goodnesse white corowne beareth witnesse many vertues smal florounes corowne remembraunce honour cibilla made daiesie floure crowned al white men may se mar yave corowne reed parde stede ruby set among white therewith quene woxe reed shame alite praysed presence said love full great negligence thee ilke time thou made hide absolon thy tress balade thou forget thy songe sette sith thou art greatly dette wost well kalender woman woll lover taught craft trewe loving namely wifehode living bondes ought keepe thy litel witte thilke time sleepe charge thee vpon thy life thy legende make wife thou hast smale imade fare well charge thee er go thus much tell ne shal trewe lover come hell lady sitting rowe ben balade thou const hem know thy bokes al thou shalt hem find hem thy legende al mind meane hem ben thy knowing ben twenty thousand mo sitting thou knowest good woman trewe love ought may befall make metre hem lest mote gone home sunne draweth west paradis companie serve alway fresh daiesie cleopatra woll thou begin forth love shalt thou win let see man lover wol done strong paine love wote well thou maist nat rime suche lover time long reden suffiseth thou make manere thou reherce al life great old authours listen treat shall many story tell sey shortly shall long dwell worde bookes gan take right thus legende gan make pthus endeth prologue phere beginneth legende cleopatra queene egipt ye death ptholome king egipt governing reigned queene cleopatra till time bifel caas rome sent senatour conqueren realmes honour vnto toune rome vsaunce world obeisaunce soth say antonius name fil fortune ought shame fallen prosperite rebel vnto toune rome al suster cesare left falsely er ware would algates han another wife toke rome cesar strife nathelesse forsoth ilke senatour full worthy gentill werriour deth ful great damage love brought man rage narow bounden laas love cleopatra al world set value thouyt nothing due cleopatra love serve thought armes sterve defence right noble quene eke loved knight desert chevalrie certainly bokes lie person gentilnesse discretion hardinesse worthy wight liven may faire rose maie maken shorte best woxe wife lest wedding feast devise itake emprise many storie make long lest slake thing beareth effect charge men may overlade ship barge thy effect woll skippe al remnaunt woll let slippe octavian wood dede shope hooste antony lede al vtterly distruction stoute romaine cruell lion ship went thus let hem faile antonius ware woll nat faile meten romaine may toke eke rede vpon day wife host forth went ship anone lenger ne stent see happed hem mete vp goeth trumpe shoute shete painen hem set sunne grisly sown goeth great gunne hertely hurtlen one fro top doune cometh great stone goeth grapenel full crokes among rope ran shering hokes polaxe preaseth behind maste beginneth flee againe driveth borde sticketh vpon speares orde rent saile hooke like sith bringeth cup biddeth hem blith poureth peesen vpon hatch slider pot full lime gone togider thus long day fight spend till last every thing hath end antony shent put flight folke go best go might fleeth eke quene purple saile stroke went thicke haile wonder might nat endure antony saw aventure ala qd day borne worship day thus lorne dispaire wit start rofe himselfe anon throughout hart ere ferther went place wife could cesar grace egipt fled drede distresse herkeneth ye speken kindnesse ye men falsely swearen many oth ye woll die love wroth may ye seene woman trouth woful cleopatra made routh ni tong none may tell morow woll lenger dwell made subtill werkmen make shrine ruby stone fine egipt could espie put full shrine spicerie let corse enbaume forth fette dead corse shrine shette next shrine pit doth grave serpentes might put hem grave thus seid love sorowfull hert obeid ferforthly fro blisfull hour swore ben freely meane antonius knight never waking day night ye nere mine herts remembraunce wele wo carole daunce selfe covenaunt made tho right ye felten wele wo ferforth power lay vnreprovable vnto wifehood aye would felen life death thilke covenaunt lasteth breath woll fulfill shall well seene never vnto love truer queene word naked full good hart among serpent pit start chese burying anone neders gonne sting death receiueth good chere love antony dere storiall sooth fable ere find man thus true stable woll love death freely take pray god let hedes never ake pthe legend tisbe babilon babiloine whylome fill thus toun queen simiramus let dichen wals make full hie harde tile well ibake dwelling noble toun two lord great renoun woneden nigh vpon grene ther na stone wal hem oft great tounes wonne sothe saine one man sonne lond one lustiest doughter fairest estward world tho dwelling name everiche gan spring woman neighbour aboute countre yet withouten doute maiden ben ikept ielousie ful straite lest didden folie yong man cleped piramus thisbe hight maide naso saith thus thus report name ishove woxe age woxe love certaine reason age ther might ben betwixt hem mariage father olde nat assent bothe love ilike sore brent none friendes might lette prively sometime yet mette sleight spaken desire wrie glede hotter fire forbid love ten time wode wal bitwixt hem stode cloven atwo right fro top adoun old time foundatioun yet clift narrow lite nat seene dere inough mite love cannot espie ye lover two shall lie ye founden first little narrow clift sound soft shrift let word clift pace tolden stoden place complaint love wo every time durst one side wall stood side stood tisbe sweet soune receive thus wardeins would disceive every day wall would threte wish god doun ibete thus wold sain ala thou wicked wall thine enuie thou v lettest nilt thou cleave fallen atwo least thou wouldest yet wouldest thou one let v mete one might kissen swete cured care cold nathelesse yet thee hold much thou suffrest gone word thy lime eke thy stone yet ought thee ben well apaid idle wordes said cold wall woulden kisse stone take leave forth wolden gone gladly eventide wonder erly least men espide long time wrought manere till day phebus gan clere aurora stremes hete dried vp dew herbes wete vnto clift wont come piramus come tisbe plighten trouthe fully faie ilke night steale awaie beguile wardeins everychone forth citie gone fieldes ben brode wide mete place tide set markes meeting king ninus grauen vnder tree old painems idolles heried vseden tho field ben buried fast grave well shortely tale tell couenaunt affirmed wonder fast long hem thought sunne last nere gone vnder see adoun tisbe hath great affectioun great liking piramus see saw time might night stale away full prively face iwimpled subtelly friend save trouth hath forsake ala routh ever woman woulde trew trusten man bet knew tree goeth full good pace love made hardy case well adoun gan dresse ala commeth wild lionesse wood withouten arrest bloody mouth strangling beast drinken well sat tisbe espied rist vp full drery hart caue dreadfull foot start moone saw well withall ran wimple let fall toke none hede sore whaped eke glad escaped thus sat lurketh wonder still lionesse hath dronke fill well gan wind right anon wimple gan find bloody mouth rent done lenger ne stent wood way hath nome last piramus come long ala home hee moone shone men might well isee way come full fast eyen ground adoun cast sonde beheld adoun saw steppe brode lioun hart suddainly agrose pale wext therwith hart arose came found wimple torne ala qd day borne night woll v lover slee asken mercy tisbee slaine ala bidding hath slaine caas ala bidde woman gone night place thereas perill fallen might slow ala ne place furlong way ere ye lion forest body mote rente beast wild gnawen mote mine hart word wimple start kist oft wept full sore said wimple ala ni thou shalt feele well blood thou hast felt bleeding tisbe word smote hart blood wound broad start water conduit broken tisbe wist nat sitting drede thought thus fall piramus comen hither may nat ifind may holden false eke vnkind commeth gan espien hart eien thought woll tellen drede lionesse dede last love hath found beating heeles ground bloody therewithall abacke start like wawes quappe gan hart pale boxe woxe throw avised gan well know piramus hart dere could write whiche deadly chere hath tisbe haire rent gan selfe turment lieth swouneth ground wept teares full wound medleth blood complaint blood selven gan paint clippeth red corse ala doth wofull tisbe caas kisseth frosty mouth cold hath hath ben bold sleen lefe speake piramus thy tisbe thee calleth thus therwithall lifteth vp head wofull man nat fully dead herd name tisbe crien cast heavy deadly eyen doun againe yeeldeth vp ghost tisbe rist vp without noise bost saw wimple empty sheath eke swerd yt hath done death spake thus thy woful hand qd strong ynough werke love shall yeve strength hardinesse make wound large ynough gesse woll thee followen dead woll felaw cause eke thy death qd though nothing save death might thee fro depart trewly thou shalt departe fro fro death woll go thee ye wretched jelous father whylome child praien withouten enuie grave moten lie sen love hath brought v pitous end right wise god every lover send loveth trewly prosperite ever piramus tisbe let gentill woman assure putten aventure god forbid woman ben true loving man part shall anon kithe word swerde tooke switche warme love blood hote hart selven smote thus tisbe piramus ago true men find mo bookes save piramus therefore spoken thus deintie v men find man love true kind may ye seene lover woman dare well pthe legend dido queene cartage glory honour virgile mantuan thy name shall follow thy lanterne thou goest beforne eneas dido forsworne thine eneide naso woll take tenour great effect make troy brought destruction grekes sleight namely sinon faining horse offred vnto minerue thrugh yt many troian must sterve hector death apered fire wood might nat ben stered noble toure ilion citie cheefe dungeon country low ybrought priamus king fordone nought eneas charged venus flien away tooke ascanius son right hand fled backe bare led old father cleped anchises way wife creusa lee mokell sorrow mind ere coulde fellawship find last hem found made redy certaine stound sea full fast gan hie saileth forth companie towards itaile would destinee aventures see ni nat purpose speke accordeth nat matere said dido shall tale till long sailed salt see till libie vnneth arriued tempest shake itake knight called achatees fellowship chees gone country tespie tooke companie forth gon left ship ride feere withouten guide long walketh wildernesse till last met hunteresse bow hond arrowes clothes cutted vnto knee yet fairest creature ever iformed nature eneas achates gret thus hem spake hem met saw ye qd ye han walked wide sustren walke beside wild bore beast hunted forrest tucked vp arrowes caas nay sothly lady qd eneas thy beautie thinketh thou mightest never yearthly woman phebus suster art thou gesse thou goddesse mercy labour wo nam goddesse soothly qd tho maiden walken country arrow bow manere realme libie ye sf dido lady queen shortly told occasion dido came region lifteth nat rime nedeth nat nere losse time venus owne mother spake thus cartage bade dight vanished anon sight could follow word word vergile would lasten long noble queen cleped dido whylom wife sicheo fairer bright sunne noble toun carthage hath begunne reigneth great honour hold quenes flour gentillesse freedome beaute well might one se king lordes desired world beautie ifired stood well every wight grace eneas come vnto place vnto maister temple toun dido deuotioun full priuely way hath nome large temple come cannot saine possible venus maked invisible thus sayth booke withouten lee eneas achates hadden temple ben found depainted wall troy land destroyed ala borne qd eneas world shame kid wide painted vpon every side prosperite ben disclaundred degre lenger liven ne kepe word brast wepe tenderly routh seene fresh lady citie queen stood temple estate roiall richely eke faire withall yong lustie eyen glade god yt heaven yearth made would love beauty goodnesse womanhede trouth semelinesse loven lady swete ni woman halfe mete fortune hath world governaunce hath sodainly brought new chaunce never yet frened caas company eneas wend lorne see arrived nought ferre fro citee greatest lord aventure ben citie come vnto temple seke queene socour beseke renome ther sprong goodnes tolde distresse tempest hard caas vnto queene appeared eneas openly beknew joy meine hadden found lord governour quene saw honour heard eneas ere tho hart routh wo ever noble man shall ben disherited degre saw man like knight suffisaunt person might like ben gentilman well word beset noble visage none formed well brawne bone venus fairenesse man might halfe faire gesse well lord semed straunger somewhat liked bet god doe bote folke often new thing sote anon hart hath pitee wo pitie love came also thus pitie gentilnesse refreshed must ben distresse said certes sorry hath perill caas friendly speech manere spake sayd ye may ye nat venus sonne anchises good faith worship encrees may goodly done ye shall ship meine shall save many gentle word spake commaunded messenger go day withouten faile ship seeke hem vitaile full many beast ship sent wine gan hem present roiall paleis sped eneas alway led nedeth feastes discrive never better ease live full feast deinties richesse instrument song gladnesse many amorous looking devise eneas come paradise swolowe hell thus joy remembreth estate troy dauncing chamber full paraments rich bed pavement eneas ledde meat queene seat spice parted wine agon vnto chamber lad anon take ease rest folke done lest na courser well ibridled none ne stede iusting well gone ne large palfrey easie none ne iewell fret full rich stone ne sackes full gold large wight ne rubie none shineth night ne gentill hauten faukon hereonere ne hound hart wild bore dere ne cup gold floreins new ibette lond libie may ben gette dido ne hath eneas isent payed hath spent thus honorable quene gests call freedome passen eneas soothly eke without lee hath sent shippe achates sonne rich thing scepter clothes broches eke ring weare present noble thing sent bad sonne make presenting quene take repaired achates againe eneas full blisfull faine seene yong sonne ascanius reported thus cupido god love prayer mother high likenesse child itake noble queene enamoured make eneas scripture may make cure soth queen hath made chere vnto child wonder present father sent thanked oft good entent thus queen pleasaunce joy new lustie folke troy deed hath enquired eneas story lered troy long day tway entendeden speake play gan breden fire silly dido hath desire eneas new guest deale lost hew eke heale theffect fruit told story tellen shall thus begin fell vpon night mone vpreised light noble queene vnto rest went sighed sore gon felfe tourment walketh waloweth made many brayd done lover heard sayd last vnto suster anne made mone riyt thus spake dere suster mine may agasteth dreme qd ilke new troian thought thinketh weil iwrought eke likely ben man therwith mikell good love life lieth cure ye nat heard tell aventure certes anne ye rede woll faine iwedded effect seine lieth live deine suster anne yt coud good said thought somdele withstood hereof long sermoning long make rehearsing finally may withstonde love woll love wight woll wonde dawning vp rist see amorous quene chargeth meine nettes dresse speres brode kene hunting woll lustie fresh quene pricketh new jolly wo horse lustie folke igo vnto court houndes ben ibrought vp courser swift thought yong knight heven woman eke huge rout vpon thicke palfray paper white saddle redde enbrouded delite gold barres vp enbossed high sate dido gold perrey wrigh faire bright morrow healeth sicke folkes night sorrow vpon courser startling fire men might tourne little wire eneas like phebus devise fresh arrayed wise fomie bridle bitte gold governeth right himselfe hath would forth noble queene lady ride hunting troian side herd harte founden anon hey gobet pricke thou let gon let gon nill lion comen beare imiyt one meten spear thus saine yong folke vp kill wild harte hem emong romblen gan heven thunder rored grisly steven doune come ye rain haile sleet fast heaven fire made sore agast noble queene also meine ech hem glad away flie shortly fro tempest save fled selfe little cave went eneas also hem went mo authour maketh mention began deepe affection betwixt hem two ye first morrow gladnesse ginning sorrow hath eneas ikneled told hurt wo sworne deepe true wele wo chaunge new false lover well plaine silly dido rewed paine toke husbond became wife evermore hem last life tempest stent mirth came home went wicked fame vp rose anon eneas hath queene igon cave demed hem list king yarbas hight wist loved ever life woed wife sorrow hath maked chere routh pitie love alday happeth one shall laughen anothers wo laugheth eneas joy richesse ever troy silly woman full innocence full pitie truth continence maked men trusten ye routh vpon fained wo old ensamples beforne see ye nat ben forsworne see ye one ne hath laft lefe ben vnkind done mischefe pilled bosted dede ye may well seene ye may rede take hede great gentilman troian well please faineth true obeising gentill privie well done obeysaunce feast daunce goeth temple home fasten till hath lady sein bearen devise sake nat song would make iusten done armes many thing send letter token brooch ring herkneth shal lady serve perill sterve hunger mischefe see desolate fled fro countree folke tempest driven hath body eke realme yeven hond might land cartage queen lived joy inough wt would ye eneas hath thus deepe iswore wearie craft within throw hote earnest overblow prively doeth ship dight shapeth steale away night dido hath suspection thought well al amis bed lieth night siketh asketh anon misliketh dere hart love certes qd night father ghost hath slepe sore tourmented eke mercury message hath presented needes conquest itaile destinie soone saile thinketh brosten mine hart therwith false teares start taketh within armes two earnest qd woll ye ye nat sworne wife take ala woman woll ye make gentlewoman queen ye woll fro wife thus foule fleen borne ala shall tellen short noble queen dido seeketh hallowes doth sacrifise kneeleth crieth routh devise coniureth profereth thrall servaunt best degre falleth foot sowneth discheuile bright gilt heere sayth mercy let ride lordes wonnen beside woll destroyen sake ye woll wife take ye sworne woll yeve leve slaen swerd sone eve yet shall dien wife child yeve child life mercy lord pitie thought thing vaileth right nought traitour forthe gan saile toward large countrey itaile thus hath laft dido wo pine wedded ladie hight lavine cloth laft eke sword standing fro dido stale sleeping right bed head gan hie stale away nauie cloth sillie dido gan awake hath kist full oft sake said sweet cloth iupiter lest take soule vnbind vnrest fulfilled fortune course thus ala withouten socourse twentie time iswouned hath vnto suster anne complained may write great routh endite bad norice sustren gone fetchen fire thing anone sayd would sacrifie might time well aspie vpon fire sacrifice start sword rofe hart mine authour saith yet seide hurt beforne deide wrote letter anon thus began right qd white swan ayenst death beginneth sing right make complaining trow getten againe well wote vaine sen god ben contrarious sin name lost qd may well lese word letter albeit shall never better thilke wind blew ship away wind hath blow away fay woll letter mind rede ovide shall find pthe legend hipsiphile medea thou root false lover duke iason thou sleer devourer confusion gentlewoman gentle creature thou madest thy reclaiming thy lure lady thy scathliche apparaunce thy word farsed pleasaunce thy fained trouth thy manere thine obeisaunce humble chere thine counterfeited paine wo fallen one thou falsed two oft swore thou thou wouldest die love thou ne feltest maladie save foule delite thou callest love live thy name shall shove english thy deceit shall know thee iason thine honor blow certes routh wo love false lover werketh shall well better love chere hath bought love full dere armes many bloodie boxe ever tender capon eateth ye foxe though fals hath foule betraied shall good man therefore paied although capon skill right false foxe woll part night iason ensample well iseene hipsiphile medea queene thessalie ovide telleth v knight hight peleus brother hight eson age might vnnethes gon yave peleus governing al reign made lord king eson iason getten time land na nat famous knight gentillesse freedome strength lustinesse father death bare na none list ben fo honour companie peleus hath great envie imagining iason might enhaunsed put degre love lordes regioun reigne may put adoun wit night compassed iason might best destroyed withouten slaunder compasment last tooke avisement send ferre countre iason may destroyed wit made iason great chere looke affection drede least lord espide fell fame ronneth wide tiding loo isle called colcos beyond troy eastward see ram men might see flees gold shone bright another sight kept alway dragoun many marvailes vp doun two buls maked bra spitten fire much thing eke tale nathelees would winnen thilke flees must winnen might buls dragon fight king otes lord ile peleus bethought vpon nephew iason would exhort sailen lond disport sayd nephew might bee worship might fall thee thou famous treasure might win bring region within great pleasaunce honour hold quite thy labour thy costes woll selfe make chose wt folke thou wolt thee take let see darste thou taken voyage iason yong lustie corage vndertooke done like emprise anon argus ship gan devise iason went strong hercules many another ches asketh gon let rede argonauticon woll tell tale long ynough philoctetes anon saile vp drough wind good gan hie countrey called thessalie long sayled salt see till isle lemnon arrived hee nat rehearsed guido yet saieth ovide epistle isle lady quene faire yong hipsiphile shene whylom thoas doughter king hipsiphile gone playing roming clevis see vnder banke anone esped lay ship iason gan arrive goodnesse adoune sendeth blive weten straunge wight tempest thider iblow anight done succour vsaunce en every wight done pleasaunc bountie courtesie messenger adoune gan hie found iason hercules also cogge lond igo hem refreshen take aire morning attempre faire way messenger hem mette full cunningly lordes two grette message asking hem anon broken ought wo begon need lodesmen vitaile succour nothing faile vtterly queenes iason answerde meekely still lady qd thanke hartely goodnesse v needeth truly nothing weary come play see till wind better way lady rometh cliffe play meine endlong strond findeth iason stond speaking thing told hercules iason gan behold queen faire grete anone right lady mete tooke heed knew manere array wordes chere gentill men great degree castle leadeth strange folk doth hem great honour asketh hem travaile labour suffred salt see within day two three knew folke ship iason full renomee hercules great loo soughten aventures colcos hem honour hem dealed ever longer ben worthy folke withouten lee namely spake hercules hart bare sadde wise true word avisee withouten affection love imagination hercules hath iason praised sunne hath vp raised halfe true man na love vnder cope heaven wise hardie secret riche iii point na none liche freedome passed lustie head tho liven ben dead thereto great gentill man thessalie likely king na lacke agast love speake shamefast lever himselfe murder die men lover espie would god iyeve blood flesh might live bone aught wife estate lustie life shoulden lede lustie knight compassed night betwixt iason hercules two shreud lee come house vpon innocent bedote queene entent iason coy maid looketh pitously naught sayd freely yave counsailers yefts great officer would god leaser time processe wrong rime house false lover right himselfe doth right faining every subtill dede ye get ye woll rede thoriginall telleth caas sooth iason wedded vnto queene tooke substaunce list vnto purveyaunce vpon begate child two drough faile saw never mo letter sent certaine long writen saine reproveth great vntrouth praieth routh child two sayd like thing iwis iason save couth nat beguile prayd god long hart ireft fro must nden vntrue also must child spill tho suffreth true iason life ever kept chast wife ne never joy hart died love sorrowes smart colcos come duke iason love devourer dragon matire appeteth forme alway forme forme passen may well bottomles right iason pee desiren appetite done gentlewoman delite lust felicite iason romed forth citie whylome cleped iasonicos master toune colcos hath itold cause comming vnto otes countrey king praying must done assay get fleece gold may king assenteth boone doth honour doone ferforth doughter heire medea wise faire fairer saw never man eie made done iason companie meat sitte hall iason seemely man withall like lord great renoun looke royall lioun godly speech famil lere coud love craft art plenere withouten booke everiche observaunce fortune ought foule mischaunce woxe enamoured vpon man iason qd ought see thing ye ben ye selfe ye put much dout woll aventure atcheve may nat wele asterten leve withouten death helpe nathelesse qd forthren ye shall nat die turnen sound home thessalie right lady qd iason tho ye death wo regard done honour wot well might ne labour may nat deserve life day god thanke ne ne may man lowely beseech ben helpe withouten speech certes death shall spare tho gan medea declare perill case fro point point batayle desioint mote stonde creature save ne might life assure shortly right point go ben accorded fully
