cruel went house hell tempered blandishing song resouning string spekest song weeping yt euer receiued laued ye noble well mother caliope goddes sang much might weeping much loue doubled sorow might yeuen teach commoued hell required besought sweet praier lord soul hell releasing say yeelden wife cerberus porter hell three head caught abashed new song three goddess fury vengeresses fellonies tormenten agasten soul annoy woxen sorrowfull sorry teares wepten pity tho head ixion tourmented ouerthrowing wheele tantalus yt destroyed woodnesse long thurst dispised flood drink foul hight vultor eateth stomack gisern tytius fulfilled song nill eaten ne tyren last lord judg soul moued misericordies cried ouercommen qd yeue orpheus wife beare companie hath well ybought song dities putten law couenant yeft sain till hell look behind wife shall come vnto v may yeue law louers loue greater law stronger law men may yeuen ala orpheus wife almost term night sain last bound hell orpheus looked backward euridice wife lost dead fable appertaineth whosoeuer desireth seeketh lead thought souerain day say clearnesse soueraign good whosoeuer ouercommen fixe eyen pit hell saine euer set thought earthly thinges euer hath drawen noble good celestiall leseth looketh hell sain low thing earth pthus endeth third book boece followeth fourth haec cum philosophia dignitate vultus oris gravitate servata leviter suaviterque cecinisset tum ego nondum penitus insiti maeroris oblitus c philosophy songen softly delectably foresaid thynges keeping dignitie chere weight wordes ne utterly foryeten weeping mourning set mine hert forbrake entencion entended yet sayne thing qd thou art guideresse light thing thou hast said hitherto ben clere shewing divine looking hem thy reason ne mowen ben ouercommen thilke thyngs thou toldest whylom foryeten hem sorow wrong hath done yet neuerthelesse ne vtterly vnknowen mee namely right great cause sorrow yt gouernour thyngs good euils mowen way el yt euils passen without punishing thing worthie ben wondred vpon thou considrest wel thy self certainely yet thing yet another thing ioyned wondred vpon fellonie emperesse floureth full richesse vertue ni onely without medes cast downe eke fortroden vnder foot fellonous folke abieth turments steed wicked fellons thing wight may maruailen ynough ne complainen yt thynges done reigne god thynges wote thing may ne good thing said thus certes qd great maruaile abashing without end well horrible monster thou wenest saine yt right ordained house much father ordaynour meine vessel ben foule vile ben honoured heried precious vessel ben defouled vile thinges yt haue concluded little beforn ben kept whole vnaraced thou shalt wel know authoritie god whose reign speake certes good folke alway mightie shrewes ben alway outcast feeble ne vice neuermore without pain ne vertues ne bee without mede blisfulnesse commeth alway good folke infortune cometh alway wicked folk thou shalt well knowen many thing kind ceasen thy plaint strengthen thee stedfast sadnesse thou hast seen forme blisfulnesse haue whylome shewed thee thou hast knowen blisfulnesse set thing treated yt trow necessary put forth shall shewen thee way shal bringen thee ayen vnto thy house shall fixe feather thy thought may arisen height tribulacion ydone away thou guiding path sledes shalt mowen return hole sound thy countrie sunt enim pennae volucres mihi quae celsa conscendunt poli quas sibi cum velox men induit c thy swift feather yt surmounten height heuen swift thought hath clothed tho feather despiseth ye hateful earth surmounteth roundenesse yt great aire seeth cloudes behind back passeth height region fire enchaufeth swift moouing firmament till ariseth house bearen sterres joyneth way sunne phebus fellawshippeth way olde colde saturnus ymaked knight cleare sterre saine yt thought made god knight ye seeking clere trouth commen knowledge god thilke soule renneth circle sterres place yt shining night ipainted sain night yt cloudlesse night yt cloudlesse seemeth heauen painted diuers image sterres hath done inough shall forleten ye last heauen shall present wenden back swift firmament shall maked perfit worshipfull light god holdeth lord thing sceptre might attempreth gouernments world shining judge thing stable himselfe gouerneth swift cart waine saine circular mouing sunne thy way leadeth thee ayen yt thou broght thider wilt thou say countrey thou requirest thou ne haddest mind nowe remembreth well born wol fasten degree woll dwell thee liketh looken derkenesses yearth thou hast forleten shalt thou seene fellonous tyraunts wretched people dreadeth nowe shullen exiled thilke faire countrey turn ego pape inquam ut magna promittis nec dubito quin possis efficere tu modo quem excitaveris ne moreris c said thus wonder yt thou behetest great thyngs ne ne doubt thou ne mayst well perfourm thou behetest pray thee thou ne tarry tell thilk thing thou hast moued phil first qd thou must need know good folke alway strong mightie shrewes beene feeble deserte naked strength thing certes euerich hem declared shewed good euill two contrary good stedfast sheweth feeblesse openly thou know clerely freelenesse euill stedfastnesse good knowen much fayth sentence shall ferme haboundaunt woll gone one way woll confirme ye thing beene purposed nowe side yt side two thing beene effect deedes mankind standeth sayne power one two faileth ni nothing may bee done lacketh ni wight vndertaketh woll done power faileth wil ni idle stant naught thereof commeth yt thou see wight would getten yt may getten thou mayest doubt yt power ne faileth hauen would boe open clere qd ne ne may denyed manner p thou see wight qd hath done would done thou nilt doubt ne hath power done bo qd phi euery wight may men holden hem mightie thing insomuch man mighty thing insomuch men hold mighty ne may men demen feeble bo confesse well qd p remember thee qd yt haue gathered shewed yt foresaid reason yt entencion wil mankind lad diuers study hasteth commen blisfulnesse boet remembreth well qd hath ben shewed philoso recordeth yt naught qd blisfulnesse thilk good men requiren yt blisfulnesse required boetius recordeth nat qd haue alway memorie fixed philoso folke qd good eke bad enforcen hem without difference entencion comen good boetius consequence qd philos certain qd yt getting good men maked good boeti certaine qd philos getten good men yt desiren boe seemeth qd philosophie wicked folke qd getten good desiren ne mowen wicked bo qd philos one qd desiren good good folke getten good wicked folk doubt good folke ne mightie wicked folke feeble boeti yt euer douteth ne may consider nature thinges ne consequence reason philos ouer qd two thing yt haue one purpose kind one hem pursueth performeth thing naturall office ne may thilk office naturell followeth manner couenable nature yt accomplisheth purpose kindely yet ne accomplisheth owne purpose whether two demest thou mighty b yt conject qd yt thou woldest say algates desire yet herken plainly thee philosoph thou nilt denie qd moouement going ni men kind boeti forsooth qd philosophy ne thou doubtest qd yt thilk naturell office going ne bee ye office foot boe ne doubt qd philos qd wight bee mightie mooue goeth vpon foot another thilke naturell office foot lacketh enforceth go creeping hand wch two ought bee holden mightie right boeti knit forth qd remnaunt philosophy wight ne douteth may gone naturell office foot ne mightie hee yt ne may yt soueraigne good qd euen like purposed good bad good folke seeken naturell office vertues shrewes enforcen hem getten diuerse couetises earthly thing ni naturell office getten thilk soueraine good trowest thou otherwise bo nay qd consequence open shewing thing haue graunted need good folke moten ben mighty shrew moten ben feeble vnmightie phil thou rennest aright beforne qd judgment yt sain judge right leech beene woont hopen sicke folke apperceiuen yt nature redressed withstandeth yt malady see thee ready withstanding shall shew thee thilke continuell reason looke greatly sheweth feeblenesse infirmitie wicked folke ne mowen commen yt naturel entencion leadeth hem yet almost thilk naturell entencion constraineth hem demen shrewes thilk naturell helpe forleten hem naturell helpe entencion goth alway beforn hem great yt vnneth may ouercommen consider great defaut power howe great feeblesse wicked fellonous folke saieth greater thyng yt coueited desire accomplished yt lesse might coueiteth may accomplish thy philosophie saith thus soueraine good ne shrew ne requiren light medes ne vain game ne may followen ne holden faylen thilk summe height thing sain soueraine good ne wretch ne commen effect souerain good enforcen hem getten night day getting good strength good folk full well yseen right thou mightest demen mightie going goeth foot till might commen thilk place fro place ne lay way gone right must thou need demen right mighty getteth attayneth end thing desiren beyond end ni nothing desire power good folk men may conclude wicked men seemen barrain naked strength forleten vertues followen vice ni ne knowen good thing feble caitife blindnes ignorance el knowen well thing oughten followen lecherie couetise ouerthroweth hem mistourned certes doth distemperance feeble men mow wrastlen ayen vice ne know well forleten good wilfully tournen hem wilfully vice wise ne forleten mightie forleten vtterly wise yt forleten commune fine thing yt ben forleten also therewithal perauenture seemen folk meruaile sain shrew containen part men ne ne haue nathelesse thus stant thing shrew denie shrew denie simply plainly ne ne haue right thou mightest sain cerrain man dead man grant wel forsooth vicious folk ben wicked ne may absolutely simply grant ben thilk thing withholdeth order keepeth nature thilk thing hath wt thing fayleth say forleteth natural order forleteth thilk set nature thou wolt sain shrew mowen certes ne denie certes power ne descendeth strength feeblesse mowen done wickednesse ne might mighten dwellen form good people thilk power sheweth euidently mowen right naught haue gadered prooued litel beforn euill shrew may shrewdnes conclusion clere shrew ne mowen right naught ne haue power much thou vnderstondest strength power haue definished litel beforn thing ni mighty souerain good b sooth qd phil thilk souerain good may done none euil boe certes qd phil wight qd weneth men mowen done thing boe man qd wit phil certes shrew mowen done euils qd bo ye would god qd ne mighten done none p qd mighty done good thing may done thing ben mighty done euill thing ne mowen thing open thing manifest mowen done euil ben lesse power yet proue conclusion helpeth haue shewed beforn power numbred among thing men oughten require haue shewed thing oughten desired referred god right maner height nature mowen done euil fellonie ne may ben referred god euil number thing oughten ben desired required open clear power ne mouing shrew ni power thing sheweth well good folke ben certainly mighty shrew doubtlesse vnmighty clere open thilk sentence plato soth saith wise men may done desiren shrew mowen haunten hem liketh desiren sain come souerain good ne haue power accomplish shrew done hem list tho thing delighten wenen attain thilk good desiren ne getten ne attayne thereto vice ne commen blisfulnesse quos vides sedere celsos solii culmine reges purpura claro nitente c couerture vain apparailes might stripen prowd king thou seest sitten high chair glittering shining purpure enuironned sorrowfull armures menasing cruel mouth blowing woodnes heart seen thilk lord heaten within courage full strait chain lecherit tormenteth hem one side greedie venimes troublable ire araiseth hem flood troublings tormenteth side thought sorrow halt hem werie aught sliding deceiuing hope tormenteth hem therfore sith thou seest one head sayn one tyraunt bearen many tyranny ne doth thilk tyraunt desireth sith cast many wicked lord sain many vice haue wickedly lordship ouer vides ne igitur quanto coeno probra volvantur qua probitas luce resplendeat quo perspicuum est nunquam bonis praemia c seest thou great filth shrew ywrapped clerenesse good folk shinen sheweth well good folk ne lacketh neuer mo medes ne shrew lacken neuer tourments thing done thilk thing thing done seemeth right thilk thing mede thus man renneth stady forlong crown lieth mede crown renneth haue shewed blisfulnesse thilk good thing ben done thilk good purposed werks mankind right commune mede mede ne may disceuered good folk wight right thenceforth lacketh goodnesse ne shall cleaped good thing folk good maners medes ne forsaken hem neuer mo shrewes waxen wood hem list good folk yet neuerthelesse crown wise men ne shall fallen ne faden fro forrain shreudnesse ne benimmen fro courage good people proper honour wight rejoyced goodnesse taken fro without saith man goodnesse man certes yaue thilke goodnesse el wight might bynome much euery wight proper bounty yeueth mede erst shall faylen mede forleteth good last medes required men wenen good nolde deme right mighty good part lesse mede mede shall reguerdoned certes right fair mede right great abouen medes remember thee thilk noble corallary yaue thee little beforne gather together manner god blisfulnesse clere certain good people maked blisful good thilk people ben blisful accordeth conuenable god mede people day ne shall empairen ne wickednesse shall drinken ne power wight ne shall amenuse sain ben maked good sith thus good men ne faylen neuer mede certes man ne may doubt vndepartable pain shrew sain pain shrewes departeth hemself neuer mo good euil pain medes contrary mote need right see betiden guerdon good also mote pain euil aunswer contrary part shrew bounty prowesse ben mede good folk also shrewdnesse self tourment shrew whosoeuer entetched defouled payne ne doubteth entetched defouled euil shrew wollen praysen hemself may seemen hem withouten party tourment sith vttrest wickednesse say wicked thewes vttrest worst kind shreudnesse ne defouleth ne entetcheth hem enfecteth enuenimeth greatly also look shrew ben contrary party good men great pain fellowshippeth fouleth hem thou hast learned little beforn thing hath one thilk one good consequence seemeth well thing hath good sain saith vnity goodnesse one manner followeth thing faileth good stinteth haue manner wherefore shrewes stinten thilk form mankind sain form body without sheweth shrew whilom men wherefore peruerted tourned malice certes haue forlorn nature mankind bounty prowesse may enhauncen euery man ouer men mote need shrew shrewdnesse hath cast condicion mankind put vnder merit desert men betideth thou seest wight transformed vice thou maist wene man ardant auarice rauenour violence forrain richesse thou shalt sain like wolf fellonous withouten rest exercise tongue chiding thou shalt liken hound priuy awaytour hidde rejoyceth rauish wile thou shalt sain like fox whelp distempred quaketh ire men shall wenen deareth corage lion dredefull flying dredeth thing ne oughten dread men shall hold like hart slow astonied lache men shall hold like asse light vnstedfast courage changeth aye study men shall hold like bird piunged foul vnclene luxury withholden foul delices foul sow followeth forleteth bounty prowesse forleteth man sith ne may passen condicion god turned beast vela naricii ducis vagas pelago rate eurus appulit insulae pulchra qua residens dea solis edita semine c eurus wind arriued sailes vlixes duke countrey narice wandering ship see isle circe faire goddesse doughter sun dwelleth meddleth new ghests drink touched maked enchauntments hand mighty ouer herb chaunged ghests diuers manner one hem couered face form bore chaunged lyon countrey marmorike nayls teeth wexen hem newlych changed wolf howlyth would weep goeth debonairly house tygre inde godhead mercury cleped bird archadia hath mercy duke vlyxes besieged diuerse euils hath vnbounden fro pestilence hostesse algates rower marriners hadden ydrawen mouthes dronken wicked drink woxen swine hadden ychaunged meat bread eaten acorn okes none limmes ne dwelleth hem whole haue lost voyce bodye thought dwelleth hem stable weepeth bewayleth monstrous changing sufferen ouer light hand sayth feeble light hand circe enchaunteresse chaungeth body folk beast regard comparison mutacion maked vice ne herb circe ne mighty may chaungen limmes body algate yet may change heart within yhid strength vigor men secretor heart sain strength reason thilk venimes vice drawen man hem mightily venime circe vice ben cruel piercen thorow passen courage within though ne annoy body yet vice wooden destroyen men wound thought tu ego fateor inquam nec injuria dici video vitiosos tam si humani corporis speciem servent c said thus confesse aknow qd ne ne see men may say right shrew chaunged beast quality soul keepen yet form bodye mankinde would shrew thought cruel wood woodeth alway destruction good men leful hem done certes qd ne leful hem shall well shew incouenable place nathelesse thilk men wene leful shrew bynommed hem ne might annoien done harm good men certes great party pain shrew ben alledged releued ne seem credible thing peraduenture folk mote need shrew wretch silly may full done perform coueyten might accomplish coueyten wretchednesse wilnen done euil wretchednesse mowen done euil without mowing wretched languish without effect sith euery thing hath wretchednesse sain done euil mowing done euil mote need shrew constrained vnselinesses wollen mowen performen fellonies shreudnesses boet accord qd desire greatly shrew losten soon thilk vnselinesse sain shrew dispoyled mowing done euil philosophy shullen qd soner paraduenture thou woldest soner hemself wene ni nothing late short bond life long abide namely courage immortel shrew great hope hie compassings shreudnesse oft destroyed sodein end ware thing establisheth shrew end shrewdnesse shrewdnesse maketh wretch must need wretch longest shrew wicked shrew wold demin aldermost caytifes vnsely shrewdnesse ne finished least way vtterest death haue concluded sooth vnselinesse shrewdnesse sheweth plainly thilk wretchednesse withouten end certain pardurable bo certes qd conclusion hard wonderful grant know well accordeth moch thing haue granted beforne phil thou hast qd right estimacion euer wene hard thing accord conclusion right shew premiss ben false el mote shew collacion propoficions ni spedeful necessary conclusion ne premiss igraunted ni blame argument thing shall tell thee ne shall seme lasse wonderful thing bene taken also necessary faith followeth purposed beforne boec qd phil certes qd wicked shrew blisful el lasse wretch abien tourments haue deserued payne justice ne chastised hem ne ne say man might think maners shrewes coriged chastised vengeance brought right way drede tourment ne yeuen folkes ensample flyen fro vice vnderstand yet another maner shrewes vnsely ne punished al ne reason law correction ne none ensample looking boet maner shall qd hath tolde beforn ph haue graunted qd good folke ben blisfull shrewes ben wretch boet yes qd philosoph qd good added wretchednesse wight ny weleful ne hath medling good solitary wretchednes bo seemeth qd phil sayst thou qd thilke wretch lacketh good good ny medled wretchednesse yet ouer wickednesse wretch yet another yuel annexed knit shall men demen unsely thilke wretche vnselines releued participation good boet qd ph certes qd han shrewes punished somewhat good annexed hir shrewdnesse saine paine suffren good reason iustice thilke shrewes escapen without tourment haue somwhat yuel yet ouer wickednes han done saine default pain default payne thou hast graunted yuel desert felony boet ne may deny qd philos moch qd shrewes vnsely wrongfully deliuered fro payne punished rightfull vengeaunce open thing clere right shrewes punished wickednesse wrong escapen vnpunished boetius might deny qd philosop qd may man deny al right ne good also contrary wrong ne wicked boet certes qd thing cleere ynough wee haue concluded litell beforn pray thee thou tel thou accordest letten tourment soules body ended death saine vnderstandest thou aught soules haue tourment deth body philos certes qd yea right great soules qd trowe tourmented asprenesse payne soules trow exercised purging mekenesse counsaile ny nat determine paynes haue trauayled tolde yet hyderto thou shouldest know mowing shrew mowing thee semeth vnworthy ny mowyng eke shrewes thou playnedest yt ne punished yt thou woldest see ne neuer mo withouten tourments wickednesse lycence mowing doen euill thou praydest might sone ended thou wouldest fayne lernen ne shoulde longe endure shrewes vnsely lenger duringe moste vnsely perdurable haue shewed thee vnsely ben shrewes escapen without rightfull payne ben punished rightfull vengeaunce sentence foloweth shrewes constrayued last greeuous tourment men wene ne punished boetius consider thy reason qd ne trow nat men saine thing verely tourne ayen study men whome shoulde seeme yt ne nat onely leuen thing eke gladly herken hem philoso certes qd men may nat haue eyen wont derkenesse earthly thinges ne may nat lift hem vp light cleare soothfastnesse like birdes night lightneth looking day blindeth hem men looken ordre thinges lustes talent wene eyther leue mowyng doen wickednes el scaping without payne welefull consider judgement perdurable law thou confirme thy courage best thing thou ne hast need judge yeuen thee price mede thou hast joyned thy selfe excellent thinges thou haue enclined thy study wicked thing ne seke foraine wrekerie thy selfe thou thy selfe hast thriste thy selfe wicked thing right thou mightest looken diuers time foule yearth heauen yt thing stinten fro without thou neither ne see nothing shuld seemen thee reason loking thou sterres earth people loketh thing shal approch v hem haue shewed like beast wouldest thou sain man forlorne sight foryeten euer saw wened nothing fayled perfection mankind mighten seene thing would saine blind ne also ne accordeth ye people yt shall saine thing susteyned strong foundements reason yt saine vnselie yt done wrong folke yt wrong suffren boet would hearen thilke reason qd philos deniest thou qd shrewes ne worthie haue tourment boetius nay qd phil qd certain many reason shrewes vnsely boetius accordeth qd phil ne doubtest thou qd thilke folke worthy tourment yt ne wretch boetius accordeth well qd phil thou set iudg knower thing whither trowest thou men tourmenten hem yt hath done wrong el hem suffered wrong boetius doubte qd nolde doe sufficient satisfaction hem haue suffered wrong sorrow hem hath done wrong phil semeth qd dooer wrong wretch suffred wrong boetius followeth well qd phil qd cause cause enforced roote filth sinne proper nature maketh men wretch sheweth well wrong men done ni wretchednesse receiueth wrong wretchednesse doeth wrong certes qd orator aduocates done contrary enforcen hem commoue iudges haue pitie hem done greevaunces wrong shrew couenable thing ye accusours aduocates wroth piteous debonaire ledden tho shrew haue done wrong judgment right men leden sicke folke leche shoulden seeken malady sin tourment couenant either entent advocate cessen el thoffice aduocates would better profiten men tourned habite accusacion saine shoulden accuse shrew hemself leful hem seen clift vertue haue forletten sawen putten adoune filthes vice tourments paine ne oughten right recompensacion getten hem bountie prowesse loste demen holde ilke paynes tourments hem eke woulden refuse attendaunce aduocates taken hemselfe iudges accusours betideth wise folk ni place iletten hate saine hate ne hath place among wise men wight nill haten good men ouermoch foole haten shrew ni reason right languishing maladie body right vice sin malady courage ne deme sick bodie worthy hated rather worthy pitie well worthy hated pitie thought constrained felonous wickednesse cruell languishing body quid tantos juvat excitare motus et propria fatum sollicitate manu si mortem petitis propinquat ipsa sponte sua volucres nec remoratur equos c deliteth exciten great mouing hatredes hasten busien fatal disposicion death proper hand saine battailes conteke yee asken death hasteth owne ne death ne tarieth swift horse men serpent lion tigre bere bore seken slean teeth yet thilke men seken slean euerich hem sweard lo maners diuers discordaunt mouen vnrightful hostes cruel battayles wilnen perish enterchaungyng dartes reason crueltie ny inough rightful wilt thou yelden couenable guerdon desert men loue rightfully good folkes haue pitie shrewes hinc ego video inquam quae sit vel felicitas vel miseria ipsis proborum que improborum meritis constituta sed hac ipsa fortuna populari c see qd eyther blisfulnesse el vnselinesse established desert good men shrewes ilke fortune people see somewhat good euil wise man leauer exiled poore needie namelesse dwellen citee flouren richesse redoubtable honour strong power wise clearly witnesfully office wise men treated blisfulnesse power gouernors shad amongs people neighbour subject sith namely prison law torment lawful pain rather owed felonous citizen selonous citizen pain established good people boet maruaile greatly qd thyngs misse enterchaunged torment felony pressen confounden good people shrewes rauishen medes vertue honor great estate desire eke weten thee semeth thee reason wrongfull conclusion would wonder well lasse trowed thing medled fortunous hap crepeth encreaseth mine astoniyngs god gouernour thing god yeveth oft time good men good mirth shrew euill aspre thing yeueth ayen good folke hardnesse shrew graunteth hem desiren difference may betweene god doeth hap fortune men know cause philosophie ne marueile qd though men wenen somewhat foolish confuse reason order unknowen although thou ne know cause great disposicion nathelesse much god good gouernour attempreth gouerneth world ne doubt thee thing doen right si quis arcturi sidera nescit mergatque seras aequore flammas propinqua summo cardine labi cum nimis sceleris explicet ortus cur legat tardus plaustra bootes c know sterres arcture tourned soueraine centure poinct saine tourned nigh soueraine pole firmament wote sterre bootes passeth gathereth waines drencheth late flambes sea bootes sterre vnfoldeth ouerswift arisings shall wondren lawe high aire eke ne knowe horne full moone waxen pale infect boundes darke night moone darke confuse discouereth sterres couered clere visage common errour moueth folkes maketh wearie basin brasse thilke stroke say maner people hight coribantes wenen moone eclipse enchaunted therfore rescue moone beaten basin ilke stroke ne man ne wondreth blastes wind chorus beaten stronds sea quaking floodes ne man ne wondreth weight snow harded cold resolued brenning heat phebus sunne seen men readily cause cause ihid saine heauen troublen ye brestes men mouable people astonied thing commen selde sodainly age troubly errour ignoraunce departeth fro v yt wisten cause soche thinges betiden certes shoulden cease seme wonder ita est inquam sed cum tui muneris sit latentium rerum causa evolvere velatas que caligine explicare rationes quaeso uti hinc decernas c thus qd thou haste yeuen beheight vnwrappe ye hidde cause thing discouer reason couered darknesse pray thee thou deuise judge matter thou vnderstand miracle wonder troubleth right greatly little smiling said thou clepest qd tell yt greatest al thinges mowen asked question vnneth aught inough leauen saieth vnneth thing aunswere perfitly thy question ye matter soch doubte determined cut away waxen doubt without number right heddes idre serpent waxen serpent hercules slough ne ne manere ne none end wight constrained doubt right liuely quicke fire thought saine vigour strength wit matter men wonte maken question ye simplicitie purueighaunce god order destinie sodayne happe knowing predestinacion diuine libertie freewill thinges thou thy selfe apperceiuedest well weight moch knowing thing manner porcion medicine thee haue little tyme doen yet neuerthelesse would enforcen shewen somewhat although nourishings ditee musike deliteth thee thou must suffren forbearen little ilke delite wene reason knit order boetius liketh thee qd doe philosophie tho spake shee right beginning sayed right thus engendering thinges qd progression moueable nature moueth maner taketh cause order formes stablenesse diuine thought ilke diuine thought set put towre yt saine height simplicitie god establisheth many maner gi thing doen maner men looken pure cleanesse diuine intelligence cleaped purueighaunce ilke maner referred men thinges moueth disponeth old men cleaped destenie thing wight looketh well thought strength one shall lightly mowe seene two thing diuers purueighaunce ilke diuine reason established soueraine prince thinges pueueighaunce disponeth al thing certes destinie disposicion ordinaunce cleauing moueable thinges disposicion ye purueighaunce knitteth thing order purueighaunce embraseth al thing heap although diuers although infinite destinie certaine departeth ordaineth thing singulerly deuideth mouing place formes tymes thus let vnfolding temporall ordinaunce assembled oned ye loking diuine thought cleaped purueighaunce thilke assembling oning deuided vnfolden let called destine beit thinges diuers yet neuerthelesse hanged yt one order destinably proceedeth simplicitie purueighaunce right werkman perceiueth thought forme thing yt wol make moueth effect werke leadeth looked beforne thought simply presently corporall ordinance certes right god purueighaunce disponeth singulerly stably thing yt doen administreth maners diuers time destinie ilke thinges hath disponed whether destinie exercised eyther diuine spirit seruaunts diuine purueighaunce el soul el nature seruing god el celestiall mouings sterres el vertue angel el diuers subtelty diuels el hem el hem destinable ordinaunce wouen accomplished certes open thing yt purueighaunce vnmouable simple form thing doen moueable bond temporel ordinaunce thinges diuine simplicity purueyaunce hath ordayned doen destinie yt thing put vnder destiny certes subject vnto purueiaunce purueyaunce destiny selfe subject vnder thing put vnder purueiaunce surmounten ordinaunce destiny tho thilke stably fixed nigh first godhed surmounten ye order destinable mouabilitee right circle turnen centre poinct thilke cercle innerest within joyneth simplesse middle centre poinct cercles turnen thilk vtterest compassed larger enuironning vnfolde larger space moch fertherest fro middelest simplicitie poinct thyng knitteth felowshippeth thilke middle poinct constrayned simplicity yt say vnmouability ceaseth ben shad flit diuersly right semblable reason thilke thing departeth furtherest fro first thought god vnfolden also submitted greater bondes destinie moch ye thing free loce fro destinie asketh holdeth nere thilke centre thing saine god thing cleaueth stedfastnesse thought god without mouyng certes surmounteth necessitie destinie soche comparison skilling vnderstanding thing yt engendred thing time eternity cercle centre right order mouable distinie yt stable simplicity purueighaunce thilke ordinaunce moueth heauen sterres attempreth elementes togither among hem selfe transformeth hem enterchaungeable mutacion thilke order neweth ayen thing growing falling adoune semblable progression seedes sex saine male female ilke order constraineth fortune dedes men bonde cause able vnbounden destinable cause passen fro beginnynges vnmovable purueyaunce mote need yt ne mutable thus thing well gouerned simplicitie dwelling diuine thought sheweth forthe order cause vnable bowed order constrayneth proper stabilitie mouable thinges el shoulden flete folilie thing semen confuse troubly v men ne mowen consider thilke ordinaunce neuerthelesse proper maner euery thyng dressyng hym good disponeth hem ni nothing dooen euill thilke thing doen wicked folke ni done euill shrewes haue shewed plenteously seke good wicked errour misturneth hem ne order coming fro poinct soueraine good ne enclineth fro beginning thou maiest say wt vnrest may worse confusion good men haue sometime aduersitie sometime prosperitie shrewes haue also thing desiren thing yt haten whether men liue soch holinesse thoght saith men wise soch folke demen good folke shrewes mote needes folke soch wenen maner dome men discorden thilk men yt folke deme hem worthy mede folke deme hem worthy turment let v graunt suppose yt man may well deeme know good people bad may know see thilke innerest attemperaunce courage hath wont sayd body saith may man speaken complexion attemperaunce body ne ne saith like meruaile miracle hem yt ne know yt swete thing couenable som body hole som people bitter thing couenable also people holpen light medicine people ben holpen bitter medicine nathelesse tho yt knowen maner temperaunce heale malady ne marueyleth nothing thing seemeth health courage bountie wt thing seemeth malady courage vice el keper good driuer away euill god gouernour leader thought god hath beholden yt high toure purveiaunce hee knoweth conuenable wight leaneth hem wot well yt conuenable hem lo hereof commeth herof done myracle thorder destinable god knoweth doth soch thing thing vnknowyng folke astonied constrayne saieth comprehend tell fewe thinges deuine deepenesse man reason may vnderstand thilke manne thou wenest right right keeping equitie contrarie yt seemeth diuine purueighaunce wote lucan familier telleth yt victorious cause lyked goddes cause ouercome liketh caton euer thou mayest seene yt done world unhoped el vnknowen certes right order thing thy wicked opinion confusion suppose yt man wel thewed diuine judgement judgement mankind accorden hem togider vnstedfast courage yt aduersitie come woll forleten parauenture continue innocencie ne may withholden fortune wise dispensacion god spareth man aduersitie might enpairen god wil trauaile trauail ni conuenable another man parfite vertues holy man nigh god purueighaunce god would deme felony hee touched aduersities yt would suffre soch man bodily malady moued said philosopher excellent sayd great vertues haue edified body holy man oft time betideth yt summe thinges done taken gouerne good folke yt malice habundant shrewes ben abated god yeueth departeth folke prosperity aduersities medled heap quality courage remordeth folke adversity ne shuld waxen proude long welefulnesse folke suffereth travayled harde thyngs confermen vertues courage exercitation vsage patience folke dreden oughten mighten well bearen dispise mowe bear thilk folk god leadeth experience hemselfe aspre sorrowful thing many folke haue bought honourable renome world price glorious death men ne mowe ouercomen tourment haue yeuen ensample folke yt vertue may ouercommen adversity thing ny doubt ne done rightfully ordeinly parfite good hem seen thing betiden certes adversity cometh somtime shrewes sometime desiren cometh foresaid cause sorrowful thing betiden shrew certes man ne wondreth men wene haue deserued ben wicked merite shrewes tourmente agasteth sometyme doen felony sometyme amendeth hem suffereth tourments prosperitie yt yeuen shrewes sheweth great argument good people thing demen thilke welefulnesse whiche prosperitie men seen ofte serue shrewes thing trowe god dispenseth parauenture nature man ouerthrowyng euill vncouenable ye needy pouertie houshold might rather agreue done felony maladie god putteth remedie yeuen richesse man beholdeth conscience defouled sinnes maketh comparison fortune himselfe dredeth paraduenture blisfulnesse vsage joyfull lesing thilke blisfulnesse ne bee sorowfull therefore would chaunge maners hee dredeth lese fortune forleteth wickednesse folkes welefulnesse yeuen vnworthily ouerthroweth hem destruction han deserued folke yeuen power punishen shall cause continuacion exercising good folk cause tourment shrewes ni none aliaunce betweene good folkes shrewes ne shrewes ne mowen accorden among hemselfe shrewes discorden hemselfe vice vice renden conscience doen oft tyme thinges thing haue done hem deme tho thinges ne haue doen thing soverain purueiance hath maked oft tyme myracle shrewes haue maked shrewes good men shrewes seene suffre wrongfully felony shrewes waxen eschaufed hate hem anoied hem retournen fruict vertue studien vnlike hem haue hated certes diuine might might yuels good vseth ye yuels couenably draweth effect good saieth yt yuel good onely might god might god ordeyneth thilke euill good one order embraceth thing wight departeth ye reason thilke order yt assigned algates yet slideth another order yt nothing lefull foly realme diuine purueiaunce sayeth nothing without ordinance realme diuine purueiaunce sith right strong god gouerneth thing world lefull men comprehende wit ne vnfolden worde subtell ordinaunce disposicion diuine entent onely ought suffice haue looked god himselfe maker nature ordaineth thing good hasteth withhold thinges hath maked semblance say withholden thing good himselfe good chaseth iuels fro bond comminalties thorder necessitie destinable followeth thou loke purueiaunce ordeyning thinges men wenen outragious haboundant yerthes thou shalt seen place nothyng iuell see thou art charged weight question weary length reason thou abidest sweetnesse song take draught thou art well refreshed refect thou shalt stedfast fly higher question thing si vi oelsi jura tonantis plura solers cernere mente aspice summi culmina coeli thou wise wolt demen thy pure thought right lawes hie thonder sain god looke thou beholde heightes soueraine heauen kepen sterres rightfull aliaunce thyngs old peace sunne imoued roddie fire ne distourbeth colde cercle mone ne sterre icleped bere enclineth rauishing course abouten soueraine height worlde ne sterre vrsa ni neuer mo washen deepe westren sea ne coueteth dien ames sea occian although see sterres iplonged sea hesperus sterre boodeth telleth alway late night lucifer sterre bringeth ayen cleare day thus maketh loue enterchaungeable perdurable course thus discordable battayle yput countrey sterres accordaunce attempreth euenlike maners element moyst thing striuing drie thing yeuen place stoundes colde thinges joynen hem fayth hote thinges light fire ariseth height heauy yearths auayleth weight cause flourie yeere yeldeth swete smels first sommer season warming hote sommer dryeth cornes autumpne commeth ayen heauy appels fleeting rayne deweth winter attempraunce nourisheth bryngeth forth thing beareth life worlde thilke attempraunce rauishing hideth benimeth drencheth vnder last death thing iborne among thing sitteth high maker king lorde weale beginnyng lawe wise iudge doen equitee gouerneth enclineth bridels thing tho thing sterreth gone mouing withdraweth aresteth affirmeth moueable wandring thing ne called ayen right going thing ne constrayned hem efte sone roundnesse enclined thing continued stable ordinaunce departen weale saine beginning fallen saine tournen nought common loue thing thing asken holden fine good elles ne mighten fasten ne come e tsones ayen loue retourned cause hath yeuen hem beyng saine god jam ne igitur vides quid haec omnia quae diximus consequantur quid nam inquit omnem inquit c seest thou thing followeth thing haue saied boetius thing qd philosophie certes qd vtterly fortune good boetius may qd philosophie vnderstand qd fortune wheder joyfull fortune aspre fortune yeuen eyther bycause guerdoning elles exercising good folkes elles bycause punishen elles chastisen shrew fortune good fortune certaine eyther rightfull elles profitable boetius forsothe full reason qd consider purueighaunce destinie thou oughtest little beforne sentence susteyned stedfast reason lyke vnto thee let v nombren hem emonges ilke thinges thou saidest little beforne ne able ben wened people philosophie qd boet common word men qd misuseth maner speech fortune saine oft tymes fortune wight wicked philosophie wilt thou qd approche little word people seme hem ouermoch departed fro vsage mankinde boetius thou wolt qd philosophie wenest thou qd thing profiteth good boetius yes qd philosophie certes thing exerceth corrigeth profiteth boetius confesse well qd philosophie good qd boetius qd philosophie fortune qd hem eyther put vertue battaylen agaynst aspre thing el hem enclinen declinen fro vice taken way vertue boetius ne may deny qd philosophie sayest thou merie fortune yeuen good people guerdon demeth ofte people wicked boetius nay forsoth qd demen soth right good philosophie saiest thou fortune qd although aspre restraineth shrew rightfull tourment weneth aught people good boet nay qd people demeth wretched thing may thought philosophie ware looke well qd least wee followyng opinion people haue confessed concluded thing vnable wened people boetius qd philosophie certes qd followeth commeth thing graunted fortune euer bee hem eyther possession vertue thencrease vertue el purchasing vertue thilke fortune good fortune right wicked hem dwellen shreudnesse saith thus weneth people boetius soth qd albeit man dare confesse ne know philosophie qd right strong man ne semeth abashen disdaynen oft tyme heareth noyse battail ne also seemeth wiseman bearen grieuously oft ledde strife fortune bothe one man eke ilke difficultie matter one man encrease hys glorious renome man conserue sapience say asprenesse estate therefore called vertue susteyneth enforceth strengthes ouercommen aduersities ne certes thou arte putte encrease height vertue ne hast commen fleten delices walken bodily lust thou sowest plantest full eigre battayle thy courage ayenst euery fortune sorrowfull fortune confounde thee ne merie fortune ne corrumpe thee occupie meane stedfast strengthes euer vnder meane ouerpasseth meane dispiseth welefulnesse sayeth vicious ne hath mede trauayle set hand sayeth lieth power fortune leuest say good iuel fortune semeth sharpe aspre ne exercise good folke ne chastise wicked folke punisheth bella bi quinis operatus annis ultor atrides phrygiae ruinis c werker atrides sain agamemnon wrought continued battayles ten yeere recouered purged wreking distruction troie loste chamber mariage brother say agamemnon wan ayen heleine menelaus wife brother meane thilke agamemnon desired yeuen sayles grekes nauie brought ayen windes blood vnclothed pitee father sorie priest yeueth sacrifiyng wretched cuttyng throte doughter say agamemnon let cut throte doughter priest maken aliaunce goddes haue wind might wenden troy itacus say vlixes bewept fellowes ylorne fellowes fiers poliphemus liggyng great caue fretten dreint emptie wombe natheles poliphemus wood blind visage yeld vlixes joy sorrowfull teares say vlixes smote iye poliphemus stoode forehead vlixes joy saw poliphemus wepyng blind hercules celebrable hard trauaile daunted proude centaurus halfe horse halfe man byraft dispoiling fro cruel lion say slough lion birafte skin smote birdes hight arpies certain arrowes rauished apple fro waking dragon hand heauy golden mettall drough cerberus hound hell triple chaynes ouercomer saied hath put vnmeke lord fodder cruell horse say hercules slough diomedes made horse fretten hercules slough idra serpent brent venim achileus flood defouled forehedde dreint shamefast visage stroundes say achileus could transfigure himselfe diuers likenes fought hercules last tourned bull hercules brake one horne shame hid hym riuer ouer hercules caste adoune antheus giaunt strondes libie cacus appeised wrathes euander say hercules slough monster cacus apeised death wrath euander bristled bore marked vomes shoulder hercules whiche sholders hie cercle heauen thrist last labour susteined heauen vpon neck vnbowed deserved eftsones heauen last ende trauayle goeth yee strong men great ensample leadeth nice men make ye back sayeth ye slowe delicate men see ye aduersities ne fight hem vertue winnen mede heauen mede ouercommen yeueth sterres saine yearthly lust ouercommen man maked worthy heauen pthus endeth fourth book boetius dixerat orationisque cursum ad alia quaedam tractanda atque expedienda vertebat b tum ego rectum quidem inquam c said turned course reason thing treated sped boetius said certes rightfull thine amonesting full digne aucthoritie thou saidest whilom question diuine purveiaunce enlaced many question vnderstand well proue thing aske thou wenest happe bee thing wayes thou wenest happe thing philosophie qd haste yelden assoilen debte behest shewen open way way thou maiest come ayen thy countrie albeit thinges thou askest right profitable know yet diuers somewhat fro path purpose doubt thou ne maked wearie misse wayes thou ne maiest suffice measure right way boetius ne doubt thee thereof nothing qd knowen thilke thing togider thing delite greatly shall steede rest sith ni doubten thynges following euery thyng thy disputacion shall hauen ben stedfast vndoubtous faith philosophie said manner woll doen thee beganne speaken right thus certes qd wight definishe hap maner saine hap betiding ibrought foorthe foolishe mouing knitting cause confirme hap ny right naught wise deeme vtterly hap ny ne dwelleth voyce sayeth idell woorde without significacion thynge committed voyce place might lefte dwellyng follie disordenaunce sithe god leadeth constrayneth thynges order sentence sooth nothing hath hys beyng naughte whiche sentence none olde folke ne withsayed neuer ne vnderstanden god prince beginner workyng easten manner foundement subject materiall saine nature reason thing waxen commen cause shall seeme thilke thyng commen woxen naught ne may done possible hap soche thing haue definished little beforne boetius shall bee qd ni nothing right may cleaped eyther happe el adventure fortune ought hidde fro people thing word couenable philosophie mine aristotle qd booke phisike difinisheth thing short reason nigh sothe boetius maner qd philosophie ofte qd men done thyng grace thyng another thyng thilke thyng menne entenden doen betideth cause icleaped happe right man dalfe yearth bycause tillyng field found gobet golde bedoluen wenen folke befall fortunous betidyng forsooth ni naught hath proper cause cause cours vnforeseen vnware seemeth haue maked hap tiller field ne dolue yearth hider golde ne hid golde place golde ne found cause abredgyng fortuit hap abredgyng fortuit hap commeth cause encountryng flowyng togither hemselfe thentencion doer neyther hider golde ne deluer field ne vnderstanden golde haue found saied betide ran togither dalfe hid golde may thus definishe hap hap vnware betidyng cause assembled thing doen thyng thilke order procedyng vneschuable betiding togither discendeth well purueighaunce ordeyneth thyngs place time maketh cause rennen assemblen togither rupis achimeniae scopulis ubi versa sequentum pectoribus figit spiculum c tigris eufrates resoluen springen welle cragges roche countrey achemenee fliyng battayles fixen dart retourning breast hem folowen hem sone riuers tigris eufrates vnjoynen departen water commen together assembled cleaped together course moten thilke thing fleten togider water thenterchaunging flood bringeth shippes stockes araced flood moten assemblen water imedled wrappeth emplieth many fortunell happes maners wandring happes nathelesse thilke declinyng lownesse yerth flowyng order slidyng water gouerneth right fortune seemeth suffreth slaked vngouerned bridle suffreth bridle saine gouerned passeth thilke lawe saine diuine ordinaunce animadverto inquam idque uti tu dicis ita esse consentio sed hac haerentium c vnderstand well qd accord right thou sayest aske liberty freewill order cause cleauen thus togither hemself el would weten destinall cheyne constrayneth mouyng courage men philosophie yes qd liberty freewill ne ne neuer nature reason ne liberty freewill euery thyng may naturally vsen reason hath dome decerneth deemeth euery thyng knoweth selfe thyngs flien thyngs desiren ilke thyng wight demeth desired asketh desireth flieth thilke thing troweth flien wherefore thyngs reason also liberty willyng nillyng ne ordayne sayeth ne graunt liberty euen like thyngs soueraines devines substaunces sain spirites judgement clere corrumpen mighty ready speden thing desired soules men moten needes free looken hem speculacion looking deuine thought lasse free sliden body yet lasse free ben gathered togither comprehended yearthly member last servage yeuen vice haue ifall possession proper reason haue caste away iyen fro light soueraine sothfastnesse low thing darcke anone darcken cloude ignoraunce troubled felonious talentes talentes approchen assenten heapen encreasen servage haue joyned hemselfe maner caytiues fro proper libertie thyng nathelesse lookyng deuine purueiaunce seeth thyngs beholdeth seeth fro eterne ordeyneth hem euerich merites predestinate said greke thyngs seeth thyngs heareth puro clarum lumine phoebum melliflui canit oris homerus c homer hony mouth saine homer sweet ditees singeth sunne cleare pure light nathelesse yet ne may infirme light beames breaken percen inwarde entrailes yearth el sea ne seeth god maker greate worlde looketh thyngs high ne vnderstandeth thyngs heauinesse yearth ne night ne withstandeth blacke cloudes thilke god seeth stroke thought thyngs shull come thilke god looketh seeth thyngs alone thou mayst saine sonne tum ego en inquam difficiliori rursus ambiguitate confundor c said thus confounded hard doubt philos doubt qd certes conject nowe soche thyngs thou art troubled b seemeth qd repugnen contrary greatly god knoweth beforne thyngs freedome libertie god looketh thyngs beforne ne god ne may deceyued maner mote need bee thyngs purueiaunce god hath seene beforne come god knoweth toforne onely werkes men also counsailes willes ne shall libertie arbitree ne certes ne may none deede ne ilke deuine purueiaunce ne may deceyved hath feeled beforne mighten wrythen away maner purueied ne stedfast prescience thing commen rather vncertaine opinion thing trowen god deme felony vnlefull ne ne proue ilke reason sayeth ne alowe ne prayse thilke reason men wenen mowen assoilen vnknitten knot question certes saine thing ni commen purueiaunce god hath seen beforne commen rather contrary thyngs commen therefore ne may hid fro purueiaunce god maner necessitie slideth ayen contrarie partie ne ne behoueth needes thing betiden ypurueighed behoueth need thing yt commen ypurueighed ytrauailed saith thilke answere proceedeth right though men trauaileden busie enquiren thing cause thing whether prescience cause necessitie thing commen el yt necessitie thinges commen cause purueighaunce ne enforce shewen betiding thinges iwiste beforne necessary maner yt order cause hath selfe although yt ne seeme prescience bryng necessitie betiding thing commen c te wight sitteth behoueth necessitie opinion sooth hym coniecteth sitteth ayenwarde also contrary opinion soothe wight sitteth behoueth necessitie sitte necessitie one one necessity sittyng certes necessity soth therefore ne sitteth wight opinion sitting soth opinion rather soth wight sitteth beforne thus although cause soth commeth side sayeth although cause sothe commeth sitting true opinion algates yet common necessity one thus semeth may make semblable skilles purueighaunce god thing commen although yt thing commen therefore purueighed certes purueighed therfore ne betide nathelesse behoueth necessity either thing commen beene ypurueyed god el yt thing purueighed god betiden thing onely suffiseth inough destroyen freedome arbitty yt saine freewill certes sheweth well farre fro sothe vp doune thing seen betidyng temporall thing cause eterne prescience wenen god purueyeth thing commen ben commen thing wene thilke thing betide whilom cause thilk souerain purueighaunce god hereto adde thinges right wote thing behoueth necessity thilke selfe thyng eke haue knowen thing shall betyden behoueth necessity thilke thinges betyde followeth betidyng thing iwist beforne ne may eschewed last wight wene thing otherwise ni onely vnscience deceiueable opinion full diuers farre fro sothe science wherfore thyng commen betidyng ne certaine ne necessary may weten beforne thilke thing commen right science ne may medled falsenesse saieth wote thing ne may false ne wote right thilke thing conceiued science ne may none otherwise conceiued cause science wanteth lesing saieth weting ne receyueth lesing wote behoueth necessity euery thing right science comprehendeth shall saine maner knoweth god beforne thinges commen ne certain deme commen vneschuably may possible ne shullen comen god deceiued trowen god deceyued speake mouth felonous sin god wote right thing commen shullen commen wote egally saith indifferently thing may done el ydone thilk prescience ne comprehendeth certayne thyng ne stable el difference prescience thilke jape worthy deuining tiresie deuinour sayd say qd eyther shall el ne shall el moche worth deuine prescience opinion mankind demeth thing vncertain men done dome men betiding ny certain none vncertaine thing ne may right certayne well thing betidyng certaine thilke thing hath wiste beforne fermely commen whiche followeth freedome counsailes werkes mankind ni none sith thought god seeth thyngs without errour falsenesse bindeth constrayneth hem betidyng necessity thing one igraunted receiued saine ni freewill sheweth well great destruction great domages folowen thing mankind idell purposed behight medes good folke pain bad folke sith mouyng free courage voluntarie ne hath deserued hem saine neyther mede ne payne seeme thilke thing alderworst demed aldermost rightful sain shrewes ben punished el good folk iguerdonned folkes sen proper ne sent hem one ne sayne neyther good ne harm constraineth hem certain necessity thing comen ne shullen ther neuer ben ne neuer vice ne vertue shullen rather confusion desert medled without discrecion yet followeth another inconuenience ne may thought felonous ne wicked thus order thing commeth purueiaunce god ne nothing ni leful counsailes mankind saieth men haue power doen nothing ne nothing followeth vice referred maker al good saith followeth god ought blame vice sith constraineth v necessitie done vice ni reason hopen god ne prayen god wt wight hopen god praien god sith yt ordinaunce destinie ne may enclined knitteth streyneth thing men may desiren done away thilke aliaunce betwene god man saine hopen prayen price rightwisenesse mekenesse deserven guerdon diuine grace yt inestimable say great ne may full praised maner say hope praiers seemeth men woll speak god reason supplicacion ben conjoined thilk clearnes ni approched rather men seken impetren men ne wene hope ne prayer ne strengthes necessitie thing comen received thing mowen conjoyned cleuen thilke soueraine prince thing behoveth necessitie linage mankind thou song little beforne departed unjoyned wele failen beginning saine god quae nam discors federa rerum causa resolvit quis tanta deus c discordable cause hath rent vnjoyned binding aliaunce thing saine conjunction god man god hath established great battaile betweene two soothfaste thing saine betweene purueyaunce god free singular deuided ne ne wollen beene meddled ne coupsed togeder ni discord thing cleauen alway certaine hemselfe thought man confounded overthrowne darke member body ne may fire darked looking saine vigour insight soule body knowen thinne subtill knitting thing wherefore eschaufeth great loue finden thilke note sooth ycovered saine wherefore eschaufeth thought man great desire know thilk notification ben ihid vnder couertures sooth wote ought thilke thing anguishous desireth knowe sayth nay man ne trauayleth weten thing wote therefore text sayth thus trauayleth weten thinges yknowe ne knoweth hem wt seeketh thilke blind thought hee hath desired thynges hee wote right naught saith desireth thing need somewhat knoweth el ne coud desiren may follow thing ne iwist though seeke thyngs shall find hem wight vncunning ignoraunt may knowe forme ifound soule beholdeth seeth high thought sayne god knoweth togither summe singularity sayne principle eueriche hem himselfe soule hid cloud darkenesse member ye bodie ne hath foryeten selfe withholdeth summe thynges leseth singularity seeketh soothnesse ni neyther nother habite wote ne hee ne hath foryeten yet remembreth summe thynges hee withholdeth asketh counsayle retreateth deepliche thinges iseene beforne sayne great summe mind mowe adden partes hee hath foryeten thilke party hath withholden tum illa vetus inquit haec est de providentia querela marco tullio c saied qd old question purueyaunce god marcus tullius deuided deuinacions saine bookes hee wrote deuinacions moued greatly question thou thy selfe haste isought much vtterly long yet ne hath determined ne isped fermely diligently cause darknesse difficulty yt mouing ye reason mankinde ne may mouen yt sayne applien joynen simplicitie diuine prescience simplicitie ye diuine prescience men mighten thinken manner yt sayne yt men mighten thinke comprehenden thing yt god seeth dwelled vtterly doubt reason cause difficulty shall assay last shew speeden haue first ispended answered thy reason thou art moued ask thou wenest thilke reason hem assoilen question ne spedfull inough ne sufficient solucion reason deemeth yt prescience necessity thing come saith way thus yt thilke thing prescience wote beforn ne may vnbetiden yt sayne moten betide prescience ne putteth none necessitie thinges commen thou thy selfe hast confessed beknow litle beforne cause saieth may cause end voluntarie thing mighten constrayned certaine betiding grace posicion yt thou may better vnderstand followeth suppose yt ne bee prescience aske qd much appertayneth shoulden thinges yt commen free constrained betiding necessitie boecius nay qd philoso ayenward qd suppose yt prescience ne putteth necessitie thing trowe thilke freedome shall dwellen hole absolute unbounden thou wilt sayne prescience ni cause necessity betiding thing commen algates yet signe thyngs betiden necessitie manner although prescience neuer yet algates least way certain thing end betidings thing commen shoulden necessary euery thing sheweth signifieth onely thing ne maketh thing signifieth behoueth first shew nothing ne betideth ne betideth necessitie may appear prescience signe necessitie el nere necessitie certes thilke prescience ne might bee signe thyng ni certes nowe certaine ye prooue ysusteined stedfast reason ne shall ben lad ne prooued signes ne argument taken fro without cause covenable necessarie thou mayst saine may thyngs ne betiden purueyed commen certes right trowen thyngs purueyaunce wote beforne commen ne betiden ne deemen rather although shall betiden yet ne haue necessitie kind betiden mayest thou lightly apperceyuen yt shall saine seene many thynges beforne eyen right men seene carter worching tourning attempring addressing cart chariot manner sayth maiest thou vnderstand werkemen necessitie saieth looking constrayneth compelleth thilke thing done boeci nay qd idle vain effect craft yt thyngs moued constrayning eyen sight philoso thing qd men done hem ne haue necessitie men done hem eke tho thing first done commen without necessitie ben thing betiden end betidings hem absolute quit necessitie certes ne trowe yt man would sayne thyngs men done ne betiden first ere done thilk thing although men hadden wist hem beforne yet haue free betidings right science thing present ne bringeth necessitie thing men done right prescience thing commen ne bringeth none necessitie thinges betiden thou mayest sayne thilke doubted whether thilke thing ne haue none issue betidings necessary thereof may ben prescience certes seemen discorden thou wenest thing seene necessitie followeth hem necessitie fayleth hem ne might beene wist nothing may comprehended science certaine tho thing ne haue certain betidings purveighed certayne darknesse opinion soothfastnesse science thou wenest diuers fro holinesse science man deeme thyng bee otherwise selfe cause errour thyngs euery wight hath knowe wene tho thyngs knowe onely strength nature thynges wist knowe contrarie euer knowe rather comprehended know strength nature yc facultie yt sayne power nature hem knowen thyng shewe short ensample roundnesse bodie otherwise sight eye knoweth otherwise touching looking casting beam waiteth seeth afarre bodie together without mouing selfe touching cleaueth round body moueth enuironning comprehendeth party roundnesse man himselfe otherwise beholdeth otherwaies imaginacion otherwise reason otherwise intelligence wit comprehended without forth figure bodie man vnstablished matter subject imaginacion comprehendeth onely figure without matter reason surmounteth imaginacion comprehendeth vniuersall looking common speech eye intelligence higher surmounteth enuironning vniuersitie looketh pure subtiltie thought ilke simple forme man perdurable deuine thought whyche ought greatly bee considered highest strengthe comprehenden thynges embraceth contayneth lower strength lower strength ne ariseth manner higher strength wit ne may page duplicate page duplicate comprehend nothyng matter ne imaginacion ne looketh vniuersall speces ne reason ne taketh simple forme intelligence taketh intelligence looketh abouen hath comprehended forme knoweth deemeth thynges beene vnder forme knoweth hem thilke manner comprehendeth thilke simple forme ne may neuer bee knowen none say none tho three foresayed strengthes soule knoweth vniuersitie reason figure imaginacion sensible materiall conceyued wit ne ne vseth ne reason ne imaginacion ne wit withoutforth beholdeth thyngs shall say stroke thought fermely without discourse collacion certes reason looketh thing vniuersell ne vseth imaginacion ne wit algates yet comprehendeth thynges imaginable sensible reason shee definisheth vniuersall conceit right thus man reasonable twofooted beast knowing vniuersall yet ni wight ne wote well man thyng imaginable sensible considereth well reason ni imaginacion wit looketh reasonable concepcion also imaginacion albeit taketh wit beginning seen formen figure algates although wit ne present yet enuironneth comprehendeth thing sensible reason sensible deeming reason imaginatife seest thou thing knowing vsen facultie power done facultie power thing ben knowen ne wrong euery judgement deed yt demeth behoueth euery wight performe werke entencion forraine power proper power quondam porticus attulit obscuros nimium sene c porch say gate towne athens philosopers hadden congregacion dispute thilk porch brought sometime olde men ful dark sentence say philosopher highten stoiciens wende image sensibility say sensible imaginacions el imaginacions sensible thing emprinted soules fro body withoutfoorth sayth thilke stoiciens wenden soule naked mirrour cleane perchemine figure musten first commen fro thyngs fro without soules ben emprinted soules right ben wont sometime swift pointel fixen letter emprinted smoothnesse plainenesse table waxe parchemine hath figure ne note glose argueth boece agaynst opinion sayth thus thriuing soule ne vnpliteth nothing saine ne doth thing proper mouing suffreth lieth subject figure note body without forth yeeldeth image idle euill vaine manner mirrour whence thriueth whence commeth thilke knowing soule discerneth beholdeth thing whence thilke strength beholdeth singular thing el whence strength deuideth thing yknowe thilke strength gathereth together thynges deuided strength choseth enterchaunged way sometime heaueth head yt say yt heaueth vp entencion right high thing sometime discendeth right low thyngs returneth himselfe reproueth destroieth false thing true thing certes strength cause efficient much mightie seen known thing thilke cause suffreth receiueth note figure impressed manner matter algates passion yt say sufferaunce wit quicke bodie goeth exciting mouing strength thought right clearenesse smiteth eyen moueth hem seeene right voyce soun hurleth eares commoueth hem hearken strength thought moued excited cleapeth forth semblable mouings speces halt within selfe addeth speces note thynges withoutfoorth medleth image thing withoutforth thinges hid within himselfe quod si corporibus sentiendis quamvis efficiant instrumenta sensuum c bvt body feeled say taking knowing bodily thinges albeit yt quality body yt object fro withoutfoorth mouen entalenten instrument wit yt passion bodie saine wit sufferaunce goeth beforne strength worching courage passion sufferaunce clepeth foorth deede thought selfe moueth exciteth meane formes resten withinforth sensible body haue said courage ni taught oremprinted passion know thing demeth knoweth owne strength passion sufferance subject body much tho thing absolute quicke fro talent affection body god angel ne followen discerning thinges object fro without forth accomplishen speden deed thought reason commen many manner knowing diuerse differing substaunces wit bodie wit naked dispoiled knowing thilke wit commen beastes ne mowen mouen hemselfe disters muskles shellfish sea cleauen nourished rock imaginacion commeth remouable beast seemen haue talent flien desiren thing reason onely linage mankind right intelligence onely diuine nature followeth thilke knowing worth either sen knoweth proper nature subject saith ne knoweth appertaineth properly knowing knoweth subject knowing shall wit imaginacion striuen ayen reasoning sayne thilke vniuersall thing reason weneth seene ni right naught wit imaginacion sayne sensible imaginable ne may vniuersall either judgement reason sooth ne ni nothing sensible el reason wote well many thyngs ben subject wit imaginacion concepcion reason vain false looketh comprehendeth sensible singular vniuersall reason would aunswere ayenst two say wit imaginacion say soothly self sayne reason looketh comprehendeth reason vniuersalitie sensible imaginable thilke two saine wit imaginacion ne mowen stretchen hemselfe knowing vniuersalitie knowing hem ne may exceeden ne surmounten bodily figure certes knowing thyngs men oughten rather yeuen credence stedfast perfite judgement manner striuing haue strength reasoning imaginacion wit say reason imaginacion rather praise cause reason sayeth cause wit imaginacion semblable thing reason mankind ne weneth diuine intelligence beholdeth knoweth thyngs come right reason mankind knoweth hem thou arguest thus ne seeme men thing haue certaine betidings ne may wist certainely betiden prescience thilke thyngs trow prescience thyngs nothing betideth necessitie might haue judgement diuine thought partner reason right haue demed behoueth imaginacion wit beneath reason right would deemen rightfull thyng man reason ought submit selfe beneath diuine thought may sayth may counsail enhaunce v height thilke soueraine intelligence shall reason well seene ne may behold selfe certes thus manner prescience god seeth thing definisheth although haue certain betidings ne none opinion rather simplicitie souerain science shet within manner bound quam variis terras animalia permeant figuris namque alia extento sunt corpore c beast passen earth full diver figure hem haue body straught crepen dust drawn hem trace forough continued say neders snail beastes wandering lightnesse wing beaten windes ouerswimmen space long aire flying beast gladden hemself diggen trace steppe earth going foot gone either greene fieldes el walken vnder wood thou seest discorden diuers formes algates face enclined heauieth dull wit linage man heaueth highest high head standeth light vpright body beholdeth earth vnder thou earthly man waxest euill thy wit figure amonesteth thee askest heuen thy right visage hast areised thy forehead bearen vp high thy courage thy thought ne heauied ne put lowe vnder foot sith thy body high areised quoniam igitur uti paulo ante monstratum est omne quod scitur c therefore haue shewed little beforne thyng wist ni known nature proper nature hem comprehenden let v looken much lefull v saieth let v looken may estate diuine substaunce may well know eke wt science common judgement creature reasonables god eterne let v consider eternity certes shall shewen v togider diuine nature diuine science eternitie perfit possession together life interminable sheweth clearely comparison collacion temporall thyngs thing liueth time present proceedeth fro preterities future sain time passed time comming ne ni nothing established time may embracen togither space life certes yet ne hath taken time morrow hath lost yesterday certes life day ye ne liuen right moouable transitorie moment thilke thing suffereth temporall condicion although neuer began ne though neuer cease aristotle demed world although life stretched infinite time yet algates ni thing men might trowen right eterne although comprehend embrace space life infinite yet algates ne embraceth space life altogither ne hath future yet ne ne hath lenger preterities ben done passed thilke thing hath comprehendeth togider plenty life interminable ne fayleth nought future ni nought preteritie escaped passed thilke ywitnessed prooved right ben etern behoueth necessitie thilk thing alway present himselfe competent sayth alway present himselfe mightie right pleasaunce haue present infinite moouable time wherefore men trowen wrongfully heren seemed plato world neuer beginning time neuer shall haue fayling wene thilke manner world maked eterne maker saith wene world god maked together eterne wrongfull wening thing lad life interminable plato graunted world thing embrace togither presence life interminable thing clere manifest diuine thought ne ne seeme v god elder thing maked quantitie time rather prosperitie simple nature ilk infinite mouings temporall thing followeth presentarie estate life immouable ne may countrefeten ne faine ne euenlike immobilitie say eternitie god faileth faileth moouing fro simplicitie presence god disincreaseth infinite quantity future preterity may haue togider plentie life algates yet much ceaseth neuer ben manner yet seemeth somedele v followeth resembleth thilke thing ne may attaine ne fulfillen bindeth selfe manner presence little moment presence little swift moment beareth manner image likenesse aye dwelling god graunteth manner thyngs betideth semeth hem thyngs haue ben ben presence little moment ne may dwell therefore ravished tooke infinite way time say succession manere done continue life going life ne might enbrace plentie dwelling thy wollen put worthie name thyngs followen plato let v say soothly god eterne world perpetuell sith euery judgement knoweth comprehendeth nature thyngs subject vnto god alwayes eterne presentarie estate science ouerpasseth temporall moment dwelleth simplicitie presence embraceth considereth infinite space time preterities time future looketh simple knowing thyngs preteritie right ydone presently right thou wolt thinken aduise prescience whych knoweth thyngs thou ne shalt deemen prescience thyngs commen thou shalt deemen rightfully science presence instance neuer ne fayleth whych ni ycleped prouidence rather cleped purueyaunce established full ferre fro right low thyngs beholdeth aferre thyngs right fro hie height thyngs askest thou disputest thou thilke thyngs done necessitie whych yseene yknown diuine sight sith forsooth men ne maken nat thilke thyngs necessarie whych seene ydone sight addeth thy beholding necessitie thilke thyngs whych thou beholdest present bo nay qd phi certes qd men mighten maken digne comparison collacion presence diuine presence mankinde right ye seene thyngs temporall presence right seeth god thyngs eterne presence wherefore diuine prescience ne chaungeth nature propertie thyngs beholdeth thyngs present ward shoulden betiden ward time commen ne ne confoundeth judgement thyngs one sight thought knoweth thyngs commen well necessary necessary right ye seene together man walke earth sunne arisen heuen ye seene together one yet neuerthelesse wee deemen discernen one voluntary necessary right deuine looking beholding thing vnder ne troubleth nat qualitie thyngs certainly present ward condicion time forsooth ben future followeth ni none opinion rather stedfast knowing ystrengthned soothnesse god knoweth thyng ne vnwote nat thilk thyng wanteth necessitie sayne god knoweth thing betide hee wote well ne hath necessity betide thou seest thilke thyng god seeth betide ne may nat vnbetide sayeth betide thilke thyng ne may nat vnbetide betiden necessity thou strein name necessity certes well confessen beknowen thing full sad trouth vnneth shall wight seene come thereto beholder divine thought answere thee thus thilke thyng future referred diuine knowing necessary certes vnderstanden owne kind men seene vtterly free absolute fro necessity certes ben two manner necessity one necessity simple behoueth necessity men mortall deadly another necessity condicionell thus thou wost man walketh behoueth necessity walke thilke thing wight hath iknow ne may nat none otherwise knoweth condicion ne draweth thilke necessity simple certes necessity condicionell proper nature ne maketh nat adjection condicion maketh necessity ne constrayneth man gone goth proper goth necessary goeth right manner purueyaunce god seeth thyng present mote thilk thing necessity although ne haue necessity owne nature certes future betiden freedome arbitry god seeth hem togider present thyngs referred diuine sight maked necessary condicion diuine knowing certes thilke thyngs considered hemselfe absolute necessity ne eten ne ceasen liberty owne nature certes without doubt thyngs shulien done god wo e beforne ben commen betiden free arbitry free betiden yet algates ne lese proper nature first done hadden power haue betidde boetius sayne qd thyngs ne necessary proper nature commen manner likenesse necessity condicion diuine science philosophy difference qd tho thyngs purposed thee little beforn sunne arising man walking while thilke thyngs done ne might vndone nathelesse one hem done behoueth necessity done right thyngs god hath present withouten doubt shullen hem discendeth nature thyngs sunne arising discendeth power doer man walking boetius said wrong thynges bee referred diuine knowing necessary considered hemself absolute fro bonde necessity right thyngs appereth sheweth wit thou referre hem reason vniuersall thou looke referre selfe singular thou saist thus power chaungen purpose shall voiden purueyaunce god peraduenture shall haue chaunged thyngs knoweth beforne philosophy shall answeren thee thus certes thou maist well chaunge thy purpose much present soothnesse diuine purueyaunce beholdeth thou maist chaunge thy purpose whether thou chaunge whiderward thou tourne thou ne maist eschew diuine prescience right thou ne maist flid sight present eye although thou tourne thy selfe thy free diuers action thou maist sayne ayen thus shall shall diuine science ben chaunged disposicion one thyng another thyng thilke prescience ne see meth enterchaunge stounds knowing saith ne shall seemen v diuine prescience enterchaungeth diuers stounds knowing know sometime one thyng sometime knoweth contrary thing philosophy forsooth qd diuine sight renneth beforne seeth future clepeth hem ayen retourneth hem proper prescience proper knowing ne enterchaungeth thou wenest stounds foreknowing dwelling aye commeth beforn embraceth stroke mutacions prescience comprehenden seen thyngs god ne hath taken betidings thyngs commen proper simplicity hereby assoiled thilke thyngs thou puttest little beforne sayne vnworthy thyng sayne future yeven cause prescience god certes strength diuine science embraceth thyngs presentary knowing establisheth manner thyngs ne oweth latter thyngs sith thyngs ben thus sain necessity thyngs diuine prescience freedome arbitry dwelleth hole vnwemmed mortal men ne law ne purposen wicked medes pain willing men ben vnbounden quite necessity god beholder foreweter thyngs dwelleth aboue present eternity sight renneth alway diuers quality deed dispensing ordeining medes good men tourments wicked men ne idle ne vain ne put god hope prayer ne mowen vnspeedfull ne without effect ben rightfull withstand eschew thou vice worship love thou vertues areise thy courage rightfull hope yeeld thou humble prayer high great necessity prowesse vertue encharged commaunded ye nill dissimulen sith ye worchen done saine deed werks beforne eyen judge seeth also demeth thyngs deo gratias pthus endeth book boetius consolation philosophy book commonly entituled chaucer dream person mourning knight sitting oak meant john gaunt duke lancaster greatly lamenting death one entirely loved supposed blanch dutch haue great woonder light liue day ne night may sleepe welnigh nought haue many idle thought purely default sleepe trouth take keepe nothing commeth gothe ni nothing lefe lothe yliche good ioy sorrow haue feeling nothing mased thing day point fall adoun sorrowfull imaginacioun alway wholly mind well ye wote kind liuen wise nature would suffise none earthly creature long time endure without sleepe sorrow ne may ne night ne morrow sleepe melancolie drede haue die defaut sleepe heauinesse hath slaine spirit quickenesse haue lost lustyhead fantasy ben mine head best men might aske may sleepe nathelesse aske leseth asking truly seluen cannot tell sooth truly gesse hold sickenesse haue thing smale among found tale thought wonder thing tale king hight seys wife best might beare life queene hight alcione befell thereafter soone king woll wenden ouer see tellen shortly see thus wise tempest gan rise brake mast made fall cleft ship dreint hem neuer found tels bord ne man ne nothing el right thus king seys lost life speake alcione wife lady left home hath wonder king ne come home long terme anon hart began yerne thought euermo wele thought longed king certes pitous thing tell heartely sorrowfull life noble wife ala loued alderbest anon sent east west seeke found nought ala qd wrought whether lord love dead certes nill neuer eat bread make vow god mowe lord sorrow lady tooke truly made booke pitie routh rede sorrow trouth farde worse morrow thinken sorrow lady coud word man might find lord full oft swowned said ala sorrow full nigh wood ne coud rede one downe knee sate anone wept pitie mercy sweet lady dere qd iuno goddesse helpe distresse yeve grace lord see soone wete bee fareth wise shall make sacrifice holly become shall good body hart thou wolt lady swete send grace slepe mete sleepe certaine sweuen may know euen whether lord quicke dead word hing downe head fell swowne cold stone woman caught anone brought bed naked forweped forwaked weary thus dead sleepe fell tooke keepe iuno heard boone made sleepe soone praide right done indeed iuno right anone called thus messengere erraund come nere come thus go bet qd iuno morpheus thou knowest well god sleepe vnderstand well take keepe say thus halfe hee go fast great see bid thing take seis body king lieth full pale nothing rody bid creepe body gone alcione queene lieth alone shew shortly nay dreint day body speake right right wonted while aliue go fast hye thee bliue messenger tooke leue went vpon way neuer stent till came darke valley stant betweene rockes twey neuer yet grew corne ne gras ne tree ne naught aught beast ne man ne naught el saue wels came renning fro cliffes adowne made deadly sleeping sowne rennen downe right caue rocke ygraue amid valley wonder deepe goddes lay asleepe morpheus aud eclympasteire god sleepes heire slept none werke caue also derke hell pitte ouer good leyser rout vye might sleepe best hing chin vpon brest slept vpright head yhed lay naked bed slept while day last messenger come renning fast cried ho ho awake anone naught heard none awake qd lieth blew horne right ear cried awaketh wonder hye god sleepe one eye cast vp asked clepeth qd messengere iuno bade thou shouldest gone told done told need rehearse went way saide anone god slepe abraide sleepe gan go bidde tooke vp dead body soone bare forth alcione wife queene lay right even quarter day stood right bed fete called right hete name said sweet wife awake let sorrowfull life sorrow lyeth rede certes sweet love dede ye shall never live ysee good sweet hart looke yee bury body tide ye mowe find see beside farewell sweet world blisse pray god sorrow lisse little blisse
