lasteth eyen vp casteth saw naught ala qd sorrow vsed within third morrow said swowe may nat tell long dwell first matere tell wherefore haue told thing alcione seis king thus much dare say wele bolden every dele dead right defaut sleepe ne red take kepe tale next tell wherfore ne might bote ne bale sleepe redde tale dreint seis king god sleeping red tale wele overlooked everydele thought wonder never heard speake tho god coud make men sleepe ne wake ne knew never god one game said anone yet lift right euill pley rather dey defaut sleeping thus would giue thilke morpheus goddesse dame iuno wight el ne rought make slepe haue rest giue alther best yest ever abode liue onward right blive woll make sleepe alite downe pure doues white woll yeve featherbed raied gold right well cled fine blacke sattin doutremere many pillow euery bere cloth raines slepe soft need turne oft woll yeve fals chamber hals woll paint pure gold tapite hem full manyfold one sute shall haue wi caue make sleepe soone goddesse queene alcione thus like god morpheus may wil mo fee thus ever wan iuno goddesse shall trowe shall hold paid vnneth word ysaid right thus haue told suddainly nist lust anone tooke sleepe right vpon booke fell sleepe therewith even mette inly sweven wonderfull never yet trowe man wit conne well sweden rede ioseph without drede egypt rad kinges meting pharao coud least v ne nat scarcely macrobeus wrote avision met king scipion noble man affrican meruailes fortuned trowe arede dreames euen lo thus sweven thought thus may dawning lay met thus bed naked looked forth waked smale foules great hepe afraied slepe noise sweetnesse song met sate among vpon chamber roofe without vpon tyles eueriche song wise solemne seruise note ever man trow heard hem song low high one accord tell shortly word never heard sweet steven thing heven merry sowne sweet entunes certes towne tewnes noide heard hem sing chamber gan ring singing ermony instrument melody heard yet halfe swete accord halfe mete none hem fained sing ech hem pained find many crafty note ne spared nat throtes sooth saine chamber full well depainted glas windowes well yglased full clere nat hole ycrased behold great joy holly story troy glaising ywrought thus hector king priamus achilles king laomedon eke medea iason paris heleine lavine wals colour fine paint text glose romaunt rose windowes shit echone glasse sunne shone vpon bed bright bemes many glad glidy stremes eke welkin faire blew bright clere aire full attempre sooth neyther cold ne hote na ne welkin cloud lay thus wonder loud thought heard hunt blow tassay great horne know whether clere horse sowne heard going vp downe men horse hound thing men speake hunting would slee hart strength hart vpon length much enbosed anon right heard would hunting gone right glad vp anone tooke horse forth went chamber neuer stent till come field without ouertooke great rout hunter eke forresters many relay limers highed hem forrest fast hem last asked one lad lymere say fellow shall hunt qd answered ayen sir emperour occtonyen qd fast god halfe good time qd go fast gan ride come forest side euery man right soone hunting fell done maister hunt anone fote hote horne blew three mote vncoupling houndis within hart found hallowed rechased fast long time last hart rouzed stale away fro hound preuie way hound ouershot vpon default yfall therewith hunt wonder fast blew forloyn last go walked fro tree went came whelpe fawned stood yfollowed coud good came crept low right yknow held downe head joyned eares laid smooth downe heares would haue caught anone fled fro gone followed forth went downe floury greene went full thicke grasse full soft sweet floures fele faire vnder foot little vsed seemed thus flora zepherus two make floures grow made dwelling trow behold though earth enuy wold gayer heuen mo floures seuen welkin sterres forget pouerte winter cold morrowes made suffer sorrowes foryeten seene wood woxen greene sweetnesse dewe made waxe need eke axe many greene greues thicke tree full leues euery tree stood himselue fro well tenne foot twelue great tree huge strength fortie fiftie fadome length cleane without bowe sticke crop brode eke thicke inch asunder shadde vnder many hart many hind behind fawnes sower buckes full wood many roe many squirrel sete full high vpon tree ete manner made feast shortly full beast though argus noble countour sate recken countour recken figure ten tho figure newe ken craftie recken number tell euery thing number yet faile recken even wonder met sweven forth romed right wonder fast downe wood last ware man blacke sate yturned backe oke huge tree lord thought may bee eyleth sitten anon right went nere found sitte even vpright wonder welfaring knight manner thought good mokell right yong thereto age foure twentie yere vpon beard little heere clothed blacke stalked even vnto backe stood still ought sooth say saw nought hing head adowne deadly sorrowfull sowne made time ten verse twelue complaint himselue pitie routh ever heard trouth great wonder nature might uffer creature sorrow ded full pitous pale nothing red said lay manner song without note without song full well rehearse right thus began sorrow great wone joy get neuer none see lady bright haue loved might fro dead agone thus sorrow left alone ala death eyleth thee thou noldest taken thou tooke lady swete goodnesse none mete faire fresh free good men may well see made thus complaint sorrowfull hart gan fast faint spirit wexen dead blood fled pure dread hert maken warme well feeled heart harme wete eke adrad kind make glad member principall body made hew chaunge wexe greene pale blood seene manner limme anon therewith saw farde thus euill sete went stood right fete grette spake nought argued owne thought wit disputed fast life might last thought sorrowes smert lay cold vpon heart sorrow holy thought made heard nought welnigh lost mind though pan men clepeth god kind sorrowes never wroth last saine right sooth ware stood hood ygret best coud debonairly nothing loud said pray thee wroth heard thee saine sooth ne saw sir truly ah good sir force qd right sorry haue ought distroubled thought foryeve haue misse take yes thamends light make qd lithe none thereto nothing missaide lo goodly spake knight another wight made neyther tough ne queint saw gan acqueint found tretable right wonder skilfull reasonable thought bale anon right gan find tale looke might ought haue knowledging thought sir qd game done holde hart gone hunt see force thereof qd thought thereon neuer adele lord qd trow wele right thinketh chere sir thing woll ye thinketh great sorrow see certes sir ye would aught discure wo would wise god helpe amend may ye mowe prove assay trouth make hole woll power whole telleth sorrowes smart paraunter may ease hart semeth full sicke vnder side looked aside saith nay nill graunt mercy good friend qd thanke thee thou wouldest may neuer rather man may sorrow glade maketh hew fall fade hath mine vnderstanding lorne wo borne may nought make sorrowes slide remedy ovide ne orpheus god melodie ne dedalus playes slie ne heale may phisicien nought ipocras ne galien wo liue houres twelue woll assay hemselue whether hert haue pite sorrow let see wretch death hath made naked blisse ever maked iwroth werste wight hate dayes night life lustes loth fare wroth pure death full fo would die follow flie would nill pain without reed alway dying deed tesiphus lieth hell may sorrow tell wist trouth sorrow routh pitie sorrow smart man hath fiendly heart whoso seeth first morrow may saine hath met sorrow sorrow sorrow ala tell thee sorrow tourned plaining laughter weeping glad thought heauinesse trauaile mine idlenesse eke rest wele wo good harme euermo wrath tourned playing delite sorrowing mine heale tourned sicknesse drede sikernesse derke turned light witte foly day night loue hate slepe wakyng mirth meales fastyng countenaunce nicete abawed peace pleding werre ala might fare werre boldnesse turned shame false fortune hath played game cheffe ala trayteresse false full gyle al behoteth nothing halte gothe vpright yet halte baggeth foule loketh fayre dispitous debonaire scorneth many creature ydole false purtraiture woll sone wryen monstres heed ywryen filth ouer ystrowed floures worship floures lyen nature without faith lawe mesure false euer laughing one eye weping brought vp set al downe liken scorpiowne false flattering beest head maketh feest amid flattering taile sting enuenim enuious charite aye false semeth wele turneth false whele nothing stable fire table full many one hath thus yblent play enchauntement seemeth one false hath trowest thou lord thee say chesse gan play false draughtes full diuers stale toke fers sawe fers away ala couth lenger play said farewell sweet ywis farewell euer therewith fortune said checke mate mid point checkere paune errant ala full craftier play athalus made game first chesse name god wolde one twise iconde know jeoperdise coude greke pythagores shulde haue plaide bet ches kept feers bet thereby though whereto trewly holde wishe worthe fire neuer bet fortune many wyle fewe begile eke lasse blame selfe wolde haue god ought excused say yet thereto god might haue feers caught wolde haue drawe draught also wise god giue reste dare well swere toke best draught haue sorne blisse ala borne euermore trowe trewly lust wholly turned ye done lorde die sone nothing leaue nought liue die right thought ny planet irmament ne ayre ne erth none element ne yeue yeft echone weping alone aduise wele bethinke euerydele lieth rekening sorrow nothing liueth gladnesse may glad distresse haue lost suffisaunce thereto haue pleasaunce may say haue right nought al falleth thought ala ouercome done come haue sorrow tantale herde tell tale thus pitously tell vnneth might lenger dwell mine herte much wo good sir qd say nat haue pite nature fourmed creature remembreth socrates counted three strees nought fortune coude qd good sir yes parde qd ne say truely though ye lost feerses twelus ye sorrow murdred selue ye dampned caas good right medea slough child iason phillis also demophon hing sefe welaway broke tearme day come another rage dido queene eke cartage slough selfe eneas false foole ecquo died narcissus nolde nat loue right thus hath many another folly done dalida died sampsone slough himselfe pillere man aliue would feeres make wo qd thou wotest full little thou menest haue lost thou wenest may qd good sir tell holly wise wherefore ye haue thus blisse lore blithely qd come sit doun tell thee vpon conditioun thou shalt holly thy wit doe thine entent hearken yes sir swere thy trouth thereto gladly hold shall right blithely god saue holly wit haue well goddes halfe qd began sir qd sith first couth haue manner wit fro youth kindely vnderstanding comprehend thing loue mine owne wit dredelesse haue euer yet tributarie yeue rent loue holly good entent pleasaunce become thrall good body hart put seruage lord homage full deuoutly praide tho beset mine heart pleasaunce worship lady dere long many yere ere mine hart set thus nist trowe came kindely paraunter thereto able white wall table ready catch take men therein make whether men portrey paint werkes neuer quaint thilke time fared right able haue learned tho haue conde well better paraunter either art letter loue came first thought therefore forgate naught chees loue first craft therefore laft tooke yong age mallice courage time turned nothing mokell knowledging time youth maistresse gouerned idlenesse first youth tho full little good couth werkes flitting time thought varying yliche good knew tho thus stood happed came dey place sey truly fairest companie lady euer man eie seene togither place shall clepe hap either grace brought fortune lien full commune false traiteresse peruerse god would could clepe werse worcheth full wo woll tell soone amongs lady thus echone sooth saine saw one like none rout dare swere without dout summer sunne bright fairer clerer hath light plannet heuen moone sterres seuen world surmounten hem beaute maner comlinesse stature well set gladnesse goodly heed wel besey shortly shall sey god holowes twelue swete right selue stedfast countenaunce noble porte maintenaunce loue well harde bone espied thus sone full soone thought helpe god cought sodainly ne toke maner counsaile loke mine herte eyen gladly trowe mine herte seyne purely tho mine owne thought said better serue nought another wele soth euery dele anone right tell thee sawe daunce comely carol sing swetely laugh play womanly looke debonairly goodly speke freendly certes trowe euermore na sene blisfull tresore euery heer heed sothe say reed ne neither yelowe ne browne na thought like gold eyen lady debonaire good glad sad simple good mokel wide thereto loke na aside ne ouertwhart beset wele drewe tooke vp euerydele gan behold eyen semed anone wold haue mercy folly wenden neuer rather na counterfeted thing owne pure loking goddesse dame nature made hem open measure close neuer glad loking folish sprad wildely though plaid euer thought eyen said god wrath al foryeue therewith list well liue dulnesse adrad na sobre ne glad thing measure neuer trowe creature many one loke herte sate full litel herte knew nothing thought whether knew knew nought algate ne rought hem stree get loue nere na woned home inde formest alway behinde good folke ouer laued man may brother loue wonder large skilfull place bere charge visage thereto ala herte wonder wo ne discriuen lacketh english wit vndo full eke spirites bene dull great thing deuise haue wit suffise comprehend beaute thus much dare saine white rody fresh lifely hewed euery daie beaute newed nigh face alderbest certes nature soch lest make faire truly chiefe patron beaute chiefe ensample werke monstre neuer verke thinketh see euer mo yet ouer though tho euer liued liue ne would haue found discriue al face wicked signe sad simple benigne soch goodly swete spech swete liues lech frendely well ygrounded vpon reason well ifounded tretable good dare swere well ood eloquence neuer fonde swete sowning faconde ne trewer tonged ne scorned lasse ne bet coude heale masse durst sweare though pope songe neuer yet tonge man ne woman greatly harmid harme hid ne lasse flattering worde purely simple recorde found trewe bond trouth man hond ne chide could neuer dele knoweth world ful wele fairenesse necke swete bone brecke na none seen misse satte white smoth streight pure flatte without hole canel bone seming none throte haue memoire semed round toure yuoire good greatnesse grete faire white hete lady name right thereto faire bright name wrong right faire shoulder body long armes euer lith fattish fleshy nat great therewith right white hand nailes rede round brestes good brede lippes streight flatte backe knew none lacke limmes nere pure sewing ferre knowing thereto could well play list dare say like torch bright euery man may take light ynough hath neuer lesse maner comelinesse right farde lady dere euery wight manere moght catche ynough wold eyen behold dare sweare well among tenne thousand wolde haue beste chefe myrrour feste though stonde rowe men eyen could haue knowe men plaide waked thought felowship naked without saw one crowne without stone trewly mine eye solein fenix arabie liueth neuer one ne ne know none speake goodnesse trewly moch debonairte euer hester bible possible soth sayne therewithall witte generall whole enclined good al witte sette rood without malice vpon gladnesse thereto sawe neuer yet lesse harmefull doyng say ne knowyng harme el could good thinketh trewly speake trouth routh thereof moch dele dare saine swere wele trouth himselfe ouer al al chose maner principall resting place thereto grace haue stedfast perseueraunce easy attempre gouernaunce euer knew wist yet pure suffraunt wit reason gladly vnderstood folowed wel could good vsed gladly wese maners euery dele therewith loued wel right wrong would wight wight might shame loued wel owne name lust hold wight hond ne thou siker wold fond holde wight balaunce halfe worde ne countenaunce men wold vpon lye ne sende men walakie pruise tartarie allsaundrie ne turkie bidde fast anon go hoodlesse drie see come home carrenare sir right ware may saine worship ye come againe ne vsed soch knackes smale therfore tell tale right haue said wholly loue laid certes swete wife suffisaunce lust life mine hope mine heale blesse world welfare goddesse wholy euery dele lorde qd trowe wele hardly loue wel beset might haue bet bet ne wel qd trowe sir qd parde nay leue wel sir leue wel trewly thought best behold alderfairest loked eyen mine nay seyen said swore though ne would tho haue loued best lady free though al beaute euer alcibiades al strength hercules thereto worthinesse alisaunder al richesse euer babiloine cartage macedoine rome niniue thereto also hardy hector haue joy achilles slough troy therefore slayne also temple two slaine antilegius saith dare fregius loue polixena ben wise minerua would euer without drede haue loued must nede nede nay trewly gabbe nought nede woll tellen good mine herte wold eke loue holde fayrest hest good haue rest euer penelope grece noble wife lucrece best telleth thus romane titus liuius good nothing like though story autentike algate trewe wherefore tell thee first lady sey right yong soth sey full great need lerne mine herte wolde yerne loue great emprise wit wolde best suffise yong childely wit without drede beset loue best wise wurship seruise coude tho trouth without faining eyther slouth wonder faine wolde see mokell amended mee sawe amorowe warished sorowe day till eue thought nothing might greue sorowes neuer smert yet sit mine herte trouth nold nought world thought leaue lady trewly trouth sir qd thinketh ye haue chaunce shrift without repentaunce repentaunce nay fie qd shuld repent loue nay certes well worse achitofell antenor haue joy traitour betrayed troy false ganelion purchased traison rouland oliuere nay liue nil foryet never mo good sir qd tho ye haue well told need reherse ye saw first would ye tell manere first speche thereof would beseche knew first thought whether ye loved nought telleth eke ye lore herde tell ye said thou notest thou meanest lost thou weenest losse qd tho nil love ye ought done amis hath lefte goddes love tell god qd shall say right said love laid yet nist never dele longe time leve wele right siker durst nought world tell thought ne wolde wrathed trewly wost thou lady body herte hath may asterte keepe fro ydlenesse trewly businesse make songes best coude oft time song hem loude made songes great dele although coude nat make wele songes ne knew arte al coude lamekes son tubal found first arte songe brother hamers ronge vpon anvelt vp downe thereof toke first sowne grekes saine pithagoras first finder art aurora telleth thereof force hem two algates songes thus made feling mine herte glade lo alther first werst lord maketh mine herte light thinke swere wight semely one se wish god might wold hold knight lady fayre bright told thee soth say first song vpon day bethought wo sorowe suffred tho yet wist nought ne tell durst thought ala thought rede tell dede tel say right soth dradde woll wroth ala shall debate wo thought mine hert brast twain last sothe saine bethought nature ne formed never creature much beauty trewly bounty without mercy hope may tale tolde sorowe never sholde nedes maugre mine heed must tolde deed well began full yvell reherce eke helpe god withall trow dismall ten woundes egipt many word overskipt tale pure fere lest wordes misse set sorowfull hert woundes dede softe quaking pure drede shame stinting tale ferde mine hew al pale full oft wexte pale reed bowing hing heed durst one loke wit manner gone said mercy na game sate sore last soth saine whan mine heart com againe tell shortly speech hole harte gan beseech wolde lady swete swore hertely gan hete ever stedfast trewe love alway freshly newe never lady worship save best coude sware ever evermore mine hertswete never false mete nyl wise god helpe tale ydo god wote acompted stre tale thought tell shortly right trewly answere well countrefete wordes grete answere said nay vtterly ala day sorow suffered wo trewly caisandra bewayled destruction troy illyon never soch sorow tho durst say thereto pure feare stale away thus lived full many day trewly need ferther beddes heed never day seche sorrow found ready every morrow loved gere befell another yere thought one would fonde doe know vnderstonde wo well vnderstood ne wilned thing good worship keepe name thing drede shame busie serve pitie sterve sith wilned harme iwis lady knew lady yave holly noble yeft mercy saving worship way dredelesse mene none way therewith yave ring trowe first thing mine harte iwaxe glad need axe helpe god blive raised fro death live happes alderbest gladdest rest truely swete wight wrong right would alway goodly foryeve debonairly youth chaunce tooke gouernaunce therewith alway true joy ever iliche newe hertes even paire never na one contraire wo sothe iliche suffred tho blisse eke sorow bothe ilich glad wrothe v one without thus lived full many yere well tell sir qd qd stinte anone therewith woxe dedde stone saied ala bore losse tolde thee lorne bethinke thee said beforne thou woste full litle thou menest loste thou wenest god wote ala right ala sir may dedde nay yes trouth losse god routhe worde right anone gan strake forth done time harte huntyng thought kyng gan homeward ride vnto place beside v lite long castell walles white sainct iohan rich hill mette thus fill right thus mette tell castell bell smitte houres twelue therewith awoke selue found lying bedde booke redde alcione seis kyng goddes sleping found mine hond full even thought queint sweven would processe tyme fond put sweven ryme best anon sweven done explicit master c christ king asked troth sothfastnesse worde answerde asking saith man true gesse therefore though hight expresse sorow wo mariage dare writen wickednesse lest selfe fall eft soche dotage woll say chaine sathanas knaweth ever dare saine paine would bounden never thilke doted foole eft hath lever ichayned prison crepe god let never fro woe discever ne man hym bewayle though wepe yet lest thou doe worse take wife bet wedde brenne worse wise thou shalt sorow thy flesh thy life ben thy wife thrale sain wise holy writ may suffice experience shall thee teach may happe take way leuer taken frise eft fall wedding trappe little writte prouerbes figure sende take keepe rede vnwise wele endure thou siker put thee drede wife bathe pray ye rede matter honde god graunt lyfe freely lede fredome foule bonde explicit assembly fowl fowl gathered nature valentine day chose make formell eagle belovd three tercel requireth year respite make choice upon trial qui bien aime tard oublie loveth well slow forget lyfe short craft long lerne thassay hard sharpy ye conquering dreadful joy alway flit yerne mean love yt feeling astonieth wonderful werkyng sore wi think naught wete wel whether flete sink know love dede ne wot quiteth folke hire yet happeth full oft bookes rede myracles cruell ire rede well woll lorde sire dare say stroke sore god save soch lorde vsage lust lore bookes rede told wherfore speake naught yore agon happed behold vpon booke iwritten letter old vpon certain thing lerne long day full fast radde yerne old fieldes men saith commeth al new corne fro yere yere old bookes good faith commeth new science men lere purpose mattere rede forth gan delite day thought lite booke make mencion entitled right thus shall tell tullius dreame scipion chapiter seven heaven hell yearth soules therein dwell shortly treate sentence woll saine greate first telleth scipion come affricke meteth massinisse joy armes hath inome telleth speach blisse betwixt hem til day gan misse auncester affrikan dere gan slepe night til appere telleth sterrie place affrikan hath cartage shewed warned grace said man lered eyther leude loveth common profite well itheude blisfull place wend joy without end asked folke dede life dwelling another place affrikan said ye without drede present life space ment maner death wt way trace rightfull folke shull gon die heaven shewed galaxie shewed ye little yerth yt regard heaven quantite shewed hym nine speris melodie heard commeth thilke speres thrise three welles musicke melodie world cause armonie said sen earth lite full tourment hard grace ne world delite told certain yeres space every sterre come place first mind world done mankind prayed scipion tell way come heaven blisse said first know thy selfe immortall loke aie busely thou werche wisse common profite thou shalt misse come swiftly vnto place dere full blisse soules clere breaker law soth saine likerous folke dede shall whirle world alway paine till many world passed drede foryeven wicked dede shullen come yt blisfull place comen god send thee grace day gan failen darke night reveth beastes businesse beraft booke lacke light bedde gan dresse fulfilled thought busie heauinesse thyng nold eke ne thing wold finally spirite last weary labour day tooke rest made slepe fast sleepe met lay affrikan right selfe aray scipion saw tide come stode right bed side wearie hunter sleping bedde wood ayen mind goeth anone iudge dremeth plees spedde carter dremeth carte gone rich gold yt knight fight fone sicke mette drinketh tonne lover mette hath lady wonne saine cause radde affrikan beforne made mete stood thus said thou hast thee wel borne looking mine old booke torne macrobie raught lite dele thy labour would quite citherea thou blisfull lady swete thy fire brond dauntest lest madest sweven mete thou helpe thou maist best wisely seigh north northwest began sweven write yeve might rime endite aforesaid affrikan hent anone forthwith gate brought right parke walled grene stone ye gate letter large iwrought verse ywritten thought either halfe full great difference shall say playne sentence men gon ye blisful place hart heale dedly wound cure men gon ye well grace grene lusty may shall ever endure way good auenture glad thou reader thy sorow cast open passe spede thee fast men gon spake side vnto mortall stroke speare disdaine danger gide never tree shall fruit ne leaf beare streme ledeth ye sorowful fish pryson dry eschewing onely remedy verse gold asure ywritten weare gan astonied behold one encreased feare gan hart bold one het cold wit errour chese enter flie save lese right betwene adamant two even weight peece yron set ne hath might move ne fro one may hale let fared nist bet entre leave till affrikan gide hent shove gate wide said standeth written thy face thine errour though thou tell dread thee come place writing nothing meant thee ne none love servaunt bee thou love hast lost thy tast gesse sicke man hath swete bitternesse natheles although thou dull thou canst doe yet mayst thou see many man may stand pull yet liketh wrestlyng demeth yet whether doe bet thou haddest connyng tendite shall thee shew matter write yt hand toke anon comfort caught went fast lord glad well begon ouer mine iyen cast tree clad leaues yt aie shal last eche kind colour fresh grene emeraude joy sene bilder oke eke hardy asshe piller elme coffer vnto caraine boxe pipe tree holme whip lasshe sailing firre cipres death plaine shooter ewe aspe shaftes plaine oliue peace eke dronken vine victor palme laurer diuine gardein saw full blosomed bowis vpon river grene mede sweetnesse euermore inough floures white blewe yelowe red cold welle streames nothing dede swommen full smale fish light finnes rede scale silver bright every bough birdes heard sing voice angell armonie busied hem birdes forth bring little pretty cony play gan hie gan espie dredful roe ye buck hart hind squirrel beast small gentle kind instrument stringes accord heard play ravishing swetnesse god maker lorde ne heard never better gesse therewith wind unneth might lesse made leaf grene noise soft accordant foules song loft aire place attempre never ther greuance hot ne cold eke every holsome spice gras ne man may waxe sicke ne old yet joy thousand fold tell ever could might ever clere day never night vnder tree beside well sey cupide lorde arrowes forge file feete bowe already lay well doughter tempred heddes well wile couched hem serve slea wound carve tho ware pleasance anon right array lust beauty curtesie craft hath might done force wight done folie disfigured lie himselfe vnder oke gesse sawe delite stood gentlenesse saw beauty nice attire youth full game jolitee foole hardinesse flatterie desire messagerie mede three name shall tolde vpon pillers great jasper long sawe temple brasse ifounded strong temple daunced alway woman inow faire hemself hem gay kirtils disheueled went office euer fro yere yere temple saw white faire dove sitting many thousand paire temple doore full soberly dame peace sat curtaine honde beside wonder discretly dame pacience sitting fonde face pale vpon hill sonde alther next within without behest arte folke rout within temple sighes hote fire heard swough gan ren sighes engendred desire made euery harte bren newe flambe well espied cause sorowes drie come bitter goddess ialousie god priapus saw went within temple souerain place stond soch array asse shent crie night sceptre hond full busilie men gan assay fond vpon hedde set sondrie hewe garlandes full freshe floures newe priuie corner disport found venus porter richesse full noble hauten port darke place lightnesse sawe lite vnnethes might lesse bed golde lay rest till hote sunne gan west gilte heeres gold threde bound vntressed lay naked brest vnto hede men might see sothly say remnaunt couered well pay right little kerchefe valence thicker clothe defence place gaue thousand sauours soote bacchus god wine sate beside cere next doeth hunger boote said middes lay cupide knee yong folkes cride helpe thus let lie farther temple gan espie dispite diane chaste full many bowe ibroke hing wall maiden soch gone time waste seruice painted ouer many storie touch shall fewe calixte athalant many maid ye name want semyramus candace hercules biblis dido ti e piramus tristram soude paris achilles helaine cleopatre troilus sylla eke mother romulus paynted side loue plite dide commen ayen place spake soote grene forth walked tho seluen solace tho ware sate quene light sommer sunne shene passeth sterre right ouer measure fairer creature laund vpon hill floures set noble goddesse nature branch halle boures wrought craft measure ne na foul yt cometh engendure ne prest presence take dome yeue audience sainct valentine day euery foul cometh chese make euery kind men thinke may huge noise gan make yearth sea tree euery lake full vnneth space stand full place right alaine plaint kind deuiseth nature araie face soche aray men might find noble empresse full grace bad euery foule take owne place wont alway fro yere yere sainct valentine day standen say foules rauine highest set foules smale eaten nature would encline worme thing tell tale water foule sat lowest dale foules liueth seed sat grene many wonder sene might men royall egle find sharpe looke perseth son egles lower kind clerkes well deuisen con tyrant fethers grene mean goshauke yt doth pine birdes outragious rauine gentle faucon yt fete distreineth king hand hardy sperhauke eke quales foe merlion peineth full oft larke seke doue iyen meke jelous swan ayenst deth yt singeth oul eke deth bode bringeth crane ye geant tromps soune theif chough ye chattring pie scorning iaie eles foe heroune false lapwing full trecherie stare counsaile bewrie tame ruddocke coward kite cocke horiloge thropes lite sparow venus son nightingale cleapeth forth fresh leaues new swalow murdrer bee smale maken honie floures fresh hew wedded turtell harte true pecocke angel fethers bright fesaunt scorner cocke night waker gose cuckowe euer vnkind popingeie full delicasie drake stroier owne kind stroke wreker aduoutrie hote cormeraunt ful glotonie rauin crowe voyce care trostell old frostie feldfare say foul euery kind world haue fethers stature men might place assembled find noble goddess nature eche busie cure benignely chese take accorde formell make poinct nature held hond formell egle shape gentillest euer among workes fond benigne eke goodliest euery vertue rest farforth nature selfe blisse looke oft beeke kisse nature vicare almightie lord hote colde heuie light moist drie hath knit euen nomber accord easie voice began speake say foules take hede sentence pray ease fordring need fast may speak speed ye know wel valentine day statute gouernance ye doe chese make flie away hem pricke pleasaunce nathelesse rightfull ordinaunce may let world win worthiest shall begin tercell egle ye know full wele foule royall aboue degre wise worthie secret true stele haue formed ye may see euery parte best liketh mee nedeth shape deuise shall first chese speaken gise order shall ye chese kind euerich liketh hap shall ye win lese loue entriketh god sende sorest siketh therewithall tercell gan call said sonne choise thee fall nathelesse condicion must choice eueriche agree election fere vsage alway fro yere yere may time haue grace inblisfull time came place hed enclined ful humble chere roial tercell spake taried nought vnto soueraine lady fere chose chese hart thought formell hand wel iwrought whose euer serue doe luste doe liue sterue besechyng mercy grace ladie souerain let die present place certes long may liue pain harte coruen euery vain hauing regard onely trouth dere harte haue wo routh found vntrue disobeisaunt wilfull negligent auauntour processe loue newe pray judgement foules rent ilke day euer find vntrue gilte vnkind sith none loueth well although neuer loue beher ought mine mercy bonde none knet well wo neuer shall let serue farre wende say list tale ende right fresh redde rose newe sommer sunne coloured right shame waxen gan hewe formell heard neither answerde well ne said amis sore abashed till nature said doughter drede assure another tercell egle spake anon lower kind said loue better ye doe sainct iohn least loue well ye lenger haue serued degree haue loued long louing alone guerdoning dare eke say finde false vnkind jangler rebell wise jelous doe hang halfe beare seruise well wit suffise fro poinct poinct honour saue take life good haue third tercell egle answerde tho sir ye see little leaser euery foule crieth ago forth make lady dere eke nature self ne tarying half would sey speake must sorrow dey long seruice auaunt nothing possible die day wo hath sanguishing twenty winter wel happen may man may serve better pay half year although man doth hath served full yore ne say ne service may lady please dare say trewest man dome fainest wold please short wordes till death cease whether wake winke trewe hert may bethinke al life sith day borne gentle plee love thing ne herde never man beforne leiser conning rehearse chere speaking morrow gan spech last till downward went sunne wonder fast noyse foules deliverd loude rang let v wend well weend wood al shiverd come cryd ala ye u shend shal cursed pleding end iudge either party leue ye nay without preue goo duck cuckow also socried keke keke cuckow queke queke hie mine eares noise went tho goo said al ny worth flie shape hereof remedie say verdite faire swithe water foule whoso wroth blithe worm foule said fole cuckow mine authorite common spede take charge deliver u great charite ye may abide yet perde qd turtel wight may speak good still sede foule one vnworthiest wore well leest comming better wight tonge rest entremete neither rede sing doth full foule acloyeth office vncommitted oft annoyeth nature alway eare murmure lewdenesse behind facond voice said hold tongue shall soone hope counsaile find deliver fro noyse vnbind charge euery flock ye shall one call say verdite foules assented conclusion birdes foules ravine chosen first plaine election tercelet faucon define sencence lust termine nature present accepteth glad enrent tercelet said manere full hard preve reason loueth best gentle formell everich hath replicatioun skils may none brought adoun cannot see argument availe seemeth must battasle ready qd eagle tercel tho nay sir qd durst say ye wrong tale ydo sir taketh nat greefe pray may ye would way voice charge hand iudges dome ye must stand therefore peace say wit would thinke worthiest knighthood lengest vsed estate blood gentillest fitting lest three wote selfe trow light know water foules head laid togider short avisement everiche verdite said said soothly one assent goo facond gent desireth pronounce nede shal tel tale praid god spede water foules tho began goose speake cakeling said peace take keepe every man herken reason shall forth bring witte sharpe love tarrying say rede tho brother love let love another lo parfite reason goose qd sperhauke neuer mote thee lo thing tongue lose parde foole yet better thee haue held thy peace shewd thy nicete lieth nat wit sooth said fool cannot still laughter arose gentill foules right anone seed foules chosen turtle true gan hem call prayed say sooth sad matter asked rad answerd plainly entent would shew soothly ment nay god forbede lover chaunge turtle said wext shame red though lady evermore straunge yet let serve alway till deed forsooth praise goose reed tho died would none make till death take well yhourded qd duck hat men love alway causelesse reason find wit daunceth merry mirthlesse recke retchlesse ye queke yet qd duck full well fair mo sterres skie pair fie churle qd gentle tercelet dunghill came word aright thou canst see thing well beset thou farest love dwles light day hem blindeth full well see night thy kind low wretchedness love thou canst se ge tho gan cuckow put forth preace foule eateth worme said bliue qd may make peace retch long ye strive let ech hem soleine live rede sen may nat accord short sesson needeth record ye glutton filde paunch well said emerlon thou murdrer heysugge braunch brought thee forth thou ruful glutton live thou solein wormes corruption force lack thy nature go leud thou world may dure peace qd nature commaund heard opinion effect yet neuer nere finally conclusion selfe shall election list wrothe blithe cheseth shall haue swithe fith may discussed loveth best said tercelet woll done favour shall right hert set hert hath knet iudge nature may lie none estate none eye counsaile chuse make reason would counsaile royal tercell take said tercelet full skilfully gentillest worthy wroght wel plesaunce ought ben suffisaunce dredeful voice formel answerd rightful lady goddess nature sooth ever yerd everich creature must life may dure therefore graunt first boone mine entent woll say right soone graunt qd right anone formel eagle spake degree almighty quene unto year done aske respite avisen mee choice free would speak sey ye get although ye dey woll seruen venus ne cupide forsooth yet manner way sen may none way betide qd nature say would foules away ech make tarying lenger said hem thus ye shall speke ye tercelet qd nature beth good hert serveth three yeare long endure ech paine degree well god wote quit fro year fo befall entremes dressed fro werk brought end every foule nature yave make even accord way wend lord blisse joy make ech hem gan wing take neckes ech gan wind thanking alway noble goddess kind first chosen foules sing yere yere alway vsaunce sing roundel departing nature honour pleasaunce note trow maked fraunce word ye may find next verse mind qui bien ayme tard oublye welcome summer thy sunnes soft hast winter weather overshake saint valentine thou art full high loft driuest away long night blake thus singen smale foules thy sake well cause gladen oft sen hem recovered hath make full blisful may sing awake shouting song foules made flight away woke bookes took rede upon yet rede alway hope ywis rede day shall mete something fare bet thus rede nill spare explicit floure courtesie made john lidgate book set forth rare vertues certain lady made john lidgate think behalf gentlewoman court feuerier frosty moone horned full phebus fiery light gan reyse stream soone saint valentine upon blisful night duty glad every wight foules chese void old sorrow eueriche make vpon next morrow time heard larke sing full lustely morrow gray awake ye lover slumbring glad morrow haste ye may observaunce doth vnto day choise ayen heart renew confirming ever trew ye chosing large lusty day custom nature take vpon blisful holy charge serve loue life may dure heart body busie cure euermore venus cipride disposeth god cupide joy owe plainly obey vnto lord mighty ordinaunce mercilesse rather dey euer founden variaunce thogh life medled wth greuaunce heart closet wound bethe alway one ye bound heard listed long deuout heart lusty melodie heavenly comfortable song agreeable ermonie rose anone fast gan hie toward grove way take foules seen euerich choose make yet full thrusty languishing mine ague fervent hete aurora drery complaining distill chrystal teares wete vpon soyle silver dew swete durst shame appeare vnder light phebus beames clere anguish paine kene constraint sighes sore set downe laurer grene full pitously alway beheld holts hore gan complain mine inward deadly smert aye sore crampish mine hert drery paine sate beheld every tree foules sit alway twaine twaine thought thus ala may euery foule hath liberte freely chuse desire eueriche make thus fro yere yere sely wren tytemose also little redbrest free election flyen yferre together go hem list enuiron kind haue inclination nature empresse guide euery thing list prouide man alone ala hard stound full cruelly kind ordinaunce constrained statute bound debarred pleasaunce meneth purveiaunce god againe right kind without cause narrow man bind thus may seene plaine ala woful houre disauenture dulfully stond caas ferre behind health cure wound abideth like sursanure fortune felly list dispose harm hid dare disclose hert set place neuer likely spede farre hindred grace saue danger haue none mede thus ala shall rede ne mine helpe shape remedy male bouche false envy twaine aye ondeth wey maliciously false suspection cause also dey ginning root destruction fele conclusion traines woll shend labour death make end yet die hert thought god loue auow make best dere bought sleepe wake boreas doth leaf shake hight plainly till sterue wele wo shall serve sake holy time saint valentine somewhat shall write although nat rime curiously craft endite yet leuer haue put wite vnconning negligence whatever say excellence whatever say dutee soothfastnesse presumption ensure shall see vnder correction rehearse commendation shall blive vertues discrive right example summer sunne passeth sterre beames shene lucifer among sky dunne morrow sheweth void night tene verily withouten wene lady passeth taketh hede tho alive speake womanhede ruby hath soveraignty rich stone regaly rose sweetnesse beauty fresh floures without lye right sooth goodly eye passeth bounty fairenesse manner eke gentlenesse fairest best reken soothfastnesse every vertue rest furthermore speake stedfastnesse root seemelinesse mirrour governaunce example withouten variaunce port benigne wonder glad evermore trew advertence alway reason desire brideled aye wit providence thereto wit high prudence well aye devoid pride vnto vertue selven guide dalliaunce lowly discreet wise goodly glad attemperaunce every wight high low degree glad heart shortly shall lye named floure courtesie speake feminity least mannish comparison goodly abashed aye pity hem ben tribulation alone consolation arne mischeefe nede comfort hem womanhede aye vertue busie charge sad demure word dredefull also rongues ben large eschowing aye hem listen hew head word shew dishonestly speake wight deadly hateth hem sight hert honest ahd cleane entent faithfull entere ne may world sustene suffer eares word friend foe neither ferre ne nere amisse resowning hinder name wexeth red shame truly meaning set without chaunging doublenesse bounty beauty together knet person faithfulnesse void newfanglenesse heart aye one ever persever sette never dissever rude vertues everychone cunningly discrive write well ye wore colour none like discretion craftely endite say lite wherefore thus excuse acquainted muse rhetoricke stile gouerne preise commendation blind highly discerne goodnesse make description save thus say conclusion shall shortly commend naught nature amend good like polixene fairenesse queene helaine stedfast heart dorigene wifely trouth shall nar faine constaunce eke faith may attaine cleopatra thereto setrone troy white antigone hester meke like iudith prudence kind alceste marcia catoun grisilde like patience ariadne discretioun lucrece rome toun may likened honeste faith vnto penelope faire phillis hipsiphile innocence womanhede seemlinesse vnto canace speake goodlyhede passeth rede word deed naught ne fall accord vertue werkes though dido wit sage time stedfast enee hastinesse yet outrage iason also medee lady avisee bounty beauty demaine maketh bounty alway soveraine meane bounty goth afore lad prudence hath soverainte beauty followeth ruled sore ne fende degree one goodly fresh free surmounting withouten good faire one persone yfere though ignoraunce ne may discrive vertues yet day remembraunce onely supported mercy quaking hond shall full humbly highnesse rudenesse quite little ballade beneath endite ever surprise mine hert alway feare betwixt drede shame least lose word astert mytre make seeme lame chaucer dead name faire making without wene fairest tongue laurer grene may assay countrefete gay stile woll well drie licour swete clye caliope first woll excuse ground goodlihede thus say vntill womanhede pballade simple might bestentent faith yt mighty god kind yave sith hee mee soule knowing sent chese bond ever bind love best life mind thus heard foules dawning vpon day saint valentine sing yet chese ye beginning entent love though mercy find list died would assent ever twinne quicke line suffiseth seene feather ynde thus heard foules morning vpon day saint valentine sing mine heart lust bent honour onely wood bind holly yeve never repent joy wo wind tofore cupide eyen blind foules titan spring devout heart thought heard sing plenuoye princesse beauty represent simyle dity rude making heart faithfull mine entent like day foules heard sing phere endeth floure courtesie hereafter followeth pity dead buried gentle heart pity sought yore ago hert sore full busie paine worlde never wight wo without death shall nat faine purpose pity complaine vpon cruelty tyranny love trouth doth dye length certaine yeres ever one sought time speake pity ran bispreint teares prayen cruelty awreake might word breake tell paine smert found dead buried hert adowne fell saw herse dead stone swoone last vp rose colour full diverse pitously mine eyen cast neerer corse gan preasen fast soule shope pray lorne say thus slaine sith pity dead ala day ever fall maner man dare hold vp head shall sorrowfull hert call cruelty hath cast slee v idle hope folke redelesse paine sith dead shal complain yet encreaseth wonder new wight wore dead many men time knew yet died suddainly sought ever full busily sith first wit mind dead ere coud find herse slooden lustely withouten mo thought bounty perfitely well armed richely fresh beaute lust iolite assured manner youth honeste wisedome estate drede governaunce confedred bond alliaunce complaint written hond put pity bill company fond rather would cause spill doe helpe held plaint still folke withouten faile without pity may bill availe leave vertues save onely pity keeping corse ye heard saine confedred hond vntill cruelty assented shall slaine put complaint vp againe foe bill dare shew effect saith thus word humblest heart highest reverence benigne floure croune vertues sheweth vnto royall excellence seruaunt durst call mortall harme ifall nought onely wofull fare renome shall declare standeth thus contrary crueltie allied ayenst regallie vnder colour womanly beautie men know tyrannie bountie gentillesse courtesie hath depriued place hie beautie appertenaunt grace kindly heritage right ye annexed euer vnto bountie verely ye ought doe might helpe trouth aduersitie ye also croune beautie certes ye want twaine world lore saine eke auaileth manner gentillesse without benigne creature shall crueltie gouernesse ala heart may long endure wherefore ye rather take cure breake perillous alliaunce ye sleen hem obeysaunce ye suffer renome fordo throw shall man pitie ala euer renome fall low ye also fro heritage ithrow crueltie occupieth place dispaired seeken grace haue mercy thou herenus queene haue sought tenderly sore let streame light seene loue drede euer lenger soothly saine beare sore though conning plaine god loue haue mercy paine paine desire haue ne nothing like thereto euer setteth desire mine hart fire eke side go maner thing may encrease wo haue ready vnsought euery lacketh death bere needeth shew percell paine sith euery wo hart may bethinke suffer yet dare plaine well wore though wake winke ye recke whether flete sinke nathelesse yet trouth shall susteine vnto death shall well sene saine euer though ye slea crueltie fo algate spirit shall neuer disceuer fro seruice paine wo sith ye yet dead ala thus death may wepe plaine hart sore full busie paine la belle dame sans mercie aleyn secretary king france framed dialogue gentleman gentlewoman finding mercy hand dieth sorrow halse dreame fully well awaked golden sleep wrapped vnder wing yet thy rose well nigh naked suddainly selfe remembring matter leauing thing must doe withouten delay hem durst disobay charge translate thing forgiue part pennance book called la bel dame sans mercy maister aleine made remembrance cheefe secretarie king france hereupon stood musing selfe greatly imagining wise perform said processe considering good aduisement vnconning great simplenesse ayenward strait commaundement thus mine entent vexed tourned vp doun yet last conclusioun cast clothes went way forsaid charge hauing remembrance till came lustie greene vallay full floures see great pleasaunce boldly benigne suffraunce rede book touching matere thus began please long agoe riding easie paas fell thought joy full desperate great disease paine louers vnfortunate sith dart cruell full hate death hath take lady maistresse left sole thus discomfite mate sore languishing way distresse said thus falleth cesse either rime dities make surely make full promesse laugh wepe clothes blake joifull time ala doeth slake selfe feele manner ease let written fortune take neither none doth please mine entent constrained joyfull thing write pen coud neuer know ment speak thereof tongue hath delite tho mouth laugh much lite mine eien shuld make countenance vntrue heart also would haue thereof dispite weeping teares haue large issue sick louers leue hem longs lead life hope allegeance say make ballade song euery hem feel greuaunce joy pleasaunce whose soule pray god mercy saue hath mine heart ordinaunce sieth within tombe ygraue fro time forth time hold pee wearieth matter trete let louers put hemselfe prees season time forgete fortune strength forcer hath vnshete wherein sperde worldly richesse good haue gete best time youth lustinesse loue hath kept vnder gouernance misdid god graunt forgiuenesse well yet felt pleasance caused neither joy heauinesse died maistresse welfare made purchase death hath shet bond witnesse nothingmine hart shal neuer pase great thought sore troubled mind alone thus rode morrow tide till last happed find place wherein cast abide ride went lodging puruay right soone heard little beside garden minstrel gan play anon went backer selfe thought inow twain friend espied yet wore came awayward drow somwhat force somwhat request wise could selfe rescow need must come see feast comming lady euerychone bad welcome god wore right gentilly made euery one one great deale better worthy grace shewed great courtesie good disport shold mourn day bode still companie gracious sojourne bords spred right little space lady sat hem seemed best deadly seruants place chosen men right goodliest perauenture freshest saw iudges full demure without semblaunt either lest notwithstanding hem vnder cure emong one gan espy great thought ful often came went one ben rauished vtterly language greatly dilligent countenance kept great turment desire farre passed reason euer eye went entent full many time season make chere sore himselfe pained outwardly fained great gladnesse sing also force constrained pleasaunce shamefastnesse complaint heauinesse came voice alway without request like soune birdes doth expresse sing loud frithe forrest serued hall none like mine aduise pale somwhat lean withall speech also trembled fearefull wise euer alone seruise blacke ware deuise plain thought wit could suffise heart nothing demain feast hem dilligence well coud right seemed euermore presence chere done nolde none schoolemaister authorite bode still place speake coud vpon beaute looked still right pitous face head tourned last behold lady euerichone euer one set eye stedfast thought vpon eyen shot knew anone fearful right humble request self said god alone one saw jest prease went full easely make stable heauie countenance wote ye well sighed wonderly sorrowes wofull remembrance himselfe made ordinance forthwithall came bring messe judge wofull penuance god wote pitous entremesse dinner anone hem auanced daunce aboue folke euerichone forthwithall heauy man danced somtime twain somtime one vnto hem chere one fell auenture euer among drew alone dread liuing creature mine aduise good purueiance chose mai resse alone hart set pleasance much beauteous person euer setteth trust vpon report eyen withouten might dead grauen vnder stone euer heart ease restore failed nothing coud gesse one wise priuie apert garrison goodlinesse make frontier iouers hert right yong fresh woman full couert assured wele port eke chere wele ease withouten wo smert vnderneath standerd dangere see feast wearied full sore heauy joy doth sore heart trauaile prease withdrow therefore set downe alone behind traile full leaues see great meruaile greene wreath ybounden wonderly leaues thicke withouten faile throughout man might espy lady came full courtesly thought time dance trace set herber made full pleasantly rested hem fro then little space nigh hem none certain compace onely farre coud see saue traile chose place hem two heard louer sighing wonder sore aye sorer sought inward paine coud keepe store speake hardie nought leech greater mused sore conquer desire thought man may pennance broght heat bring ye fire hart began swell within chest sore strained anguish paine peeces almost brest one sore constraine desire bold shame gan refraine one large full close little charge laid certaine keepe werre haue many fose full oftentimes speak pained shamefastnesse drede said euer nay yet last sore constrained full long put delay lady right thus gan say dredeful voice weeping half rage purueyed vnhappy day first sight visage suffer pain god wote full hote brenning cause death true seruise see well ye recke thereof nothing take heed kind wise speake best aduise ye set nought make thereof game though sewe great enterprise peireth worship fame ala prejudice man doe loue faithfully worship eschewing euery vice verely challenge nought right reason hole submit vnto seruice right list right bind self fraunchise lamant though cannot deserue haue grace alway liue drede yet suffer loue serue withouten maugre goodlyhede faith trouth giue womanhede seruice without calling loue hath bound without wage mede man leue thing la dame lady heardall language gaue answere ful soft demurely without chaunging colour courage nothing hast measurably thinketh sir thoght great folly purpose ye nought labour cease thinketh while ye liue matter set heart pea lamant may none make peace ye ground cause war eyen letter written defied put farre pleasaunt looke lodestarre made heraud thilke defiaunce vtterly behight barre faithfull trust mine affiaunce la dame liue wo hath great fantasie heart also slipper hold onely beholding eie cannot abide peace reason would ye list ye may behold eien made look whyshold spare take keepe neither yong ne old feeleth smart counsail beware lamant one hurt another sore defaut feleth greuaunce right man may doe yet reason would remembraunce sith fortune onely chaunce hath caused suffer paine beautie circumstaunce list ye haue great disdaine la dame person ne haue disdaine neuer truly ne nought haue right great loue hatred certaine counsail know god saue loue mind igraue little thing may doe displesaunce beguile make raue cause encombraunce lamant euer yt hath thus purchased wening hath deceiued certaine feruent loue sore hath ichased vnware casten chaine sith fortune lift ordaine welfare hand fall eschewing mischeeuous paine soonest dieth care least la dame sicknesse right easie endure people causeth die meane know sure comfort draw remedie plaining full pitously fele god wore alther greatest pain loue hurt greeuously leste harm one sorowful twain lamant ala madame might please much better way gentilnesse one sorrie make twaine well ease destroy liueth distresse desire neither lesse seruice doe pleasaunce eschewing manner doublenesse make two joy steed one greuance la dame loue seek neither pleasaunce ease haue therein great affiaunce though ye sick doth nothing please also take heed pleasaunce chese herts aduaunce free free endure ruled man gouernaunce earthly good nay ensure lamant loue joy sorrow doth depart hath set lady seruage largely doth graunt hem part lordship rule euery manner age poor seruant nought hath auauntage may get onely purchesse one loue doth homage full oftentimes dere bought richesse la dame lady simple thus meane dull wit sotted folly word said splene faire language painted full pleasauntly ye mo hold schooles daily make hem great wonder suppose soone away head wrie faire speech lightly eares close lamant man jangleth busily setteth heart mind therefore reason may plaine pitously hath much heauinesse store whose head hole sayth sore fained chere hard keepe mew thought vnfained euermore workes preueth word shew la dame loue subtill hath great await sharp working gabbing great plesance venge deceit would feele know secret gouernance maketh hem obey ordinance cherefull way hem supposed fall repentance rage counsaile disclosed lamant sith much god eke nature hath auaunced loue high degree much sharpe point thus sure yet greeueth faut euer hath cold heat hath deinte one asked expresse pleasaunce knoweth none certainete one thought heauinesse la dame pleasaunce alway one think swete think bitter pain ye may constrain yet right none lust loue vaine challenge loue right neuer seine hert assent bond promise strength force may attaine standeth enfeoffed franchise lamant right faire lady god neuer please seeke right case shew plainly disease mercy abide eke grace purpose honour deface euer god fortune shend neuer vnrightfully purchase one onely joy vnto liues end la dame ye sweare othes fast condemne cursen df ro full sikerly ye wene othes last lenger wordes ben ago god eke saint laugh also swearing stedfastnesse wretch haue full trust thereto weepe wailen distresse lamant hath courage man truly seecheth pleasaunce worship dispise called forth worthy yearth touch aire kind wise trusty hert mouth without feintise thus strength euery manner name layeth faith little prise leseth worship fame la dame cursed hert mouth curteise full well ye wote according yet fained chere right sone may hem apeise mallice set working full false semblant bere true seming name fame tongue fained worship hem put forgetting nought repented wise complained lamant thinketh ill good may befall god grace grant man desart loue among thought thinke vpon wofull sorrowes smart paine whether tender hart sweet pitie therewith agreued grace discouart mean soon releued la dame lightsome hert follie pleasance much better lesse abide make think bring trance sickenesse soone remedide respite thought put aside full good disport werieth day helpe hurt aplide troweth let passe away lamant hath bird faucon hound followeth loue euery place cherisheth kepeth full nd sight enchace set wit cace alone withouten chaunge put vnder much farther grace lesse set straunge la dame thogh make chere euery man worship mine owne fraunchise nill doe withouten doubt eschewing manner prejudise wote ye well loue little wise bileue lightly brought taketh owne deuise thing god wote yt serueth nought lamant loue trew seruise lese good chere stranger haue alway whereof shall serue trouth wise lesse commeth goeth day holdeth nothing nay also lost seeming courtesie reason say loue loue lawfull desiring la dame courtesie alied wonder nere worship loueth tenderly bound praiere gift say verely good chere depart full largely liketh conceit fall guerdon constrained gift done thankfully twain neuer accord neuer shall lamant guerdon seeke none cace desert hie wherefore ask pardon grace sith behoueth death mercy giue good wanteth truly reason courteise manere owne much better worthy stranger shew hem louely chere la dame call ye good faine would wist pleaseth one another smerteth sore owne large list giue much lese good name therefore one make grant little ne request right well according worship kept set left little thing lamant world founden neuer none vnder heauen creature ibore neuer shall saue onely persone worship toucheth half sore haue season lesse ne youth ne age still seruice haue eyen wit mouth store giuen office la dame full great charge hath withouten fail worship keepeth sikernesse daunger setteth trauail feffeth others businesse longeth honour noblesse vpon none await owne much hath lesse much followeth conceit lamant eyen hath set print fele within hert euer go doe thing souneth vnto wele need must come fro fortune wele wo life endure mercy abiding right thinke also worship aboue thing la dame worship see well nede ye spend season vaine touching mine rede take hede folly put selfe paine ouercome good restraine heart deceiued follily worse break bow certaine better bow fall sodainly lamant faire lady thinke sith first began loue hath set mine hart vnder cure neuer might ne truly ne none serue shall endure free wise thereof make sure may withdraw nay must abide manner aduenture may neither put take away la dame hold gift soothfastnesse one offereth forsake gift abandoning expresse worship ayen may take hath hert full fell list make gift lightly put refuse wise conceit slake need neither study ne muse lamant muse hath seruice spent lady honourable spend time entent yet least reprouable fained hert thinke vnable mistooke made request loue hath enterprise notable many herts gotten conquest la dame ye list counsaile seeche fairer higher fame seruice loue preuaile thought according hurteth worship name follily twaine trouble also leseth game surely cannot set point double lamant counsail ought see better said done mine aduise though beleeue forgiue mine hart hole without feintise ne may giue credence wise thing souning vnto truth counsaile see fantasise save grace shew pity ruth la dame hold wise worketh folly list leave part therefro conning learne truly would himselfe conduit cannot counsaile sute putteth disperaunce good fall lost dead cleane remembraunce lamant yet woll shew matter faithfully while live ever chaunce hap truth dye death shall displeasaunce hard suffraunce shall dye true great paine yet shall much lesse grevaunce live false lover certaine la dame get ye right nought fable neither hard streit right man customable thinke ye sure conceit seecheth sorrow receit counsaile feele see learne cast await thereof let assay lamant one must assayed nay reputation true love right honour pay free hart gotten due raunsome free holdeth opinion great dutesse discomfort keepe hert strait prison hath one body disport la dame know many cause marvelous must need reason thinke certaine aventure wonder perillous yet well comming back againe good worship thereof seldome seene ne make array find pleasaunce barraine shall cost dere first assay lamant ye cause doubt matter meue fantasie put farre straunger goodnesse thinke well advise made aprise every wise truth sheweth open evidence long abiding true service may well knowen plaine experience la dame right may called true must take every place discerne let ne knew keepe good may purchase prayeth swereth cace right well ye wote trouth preved soch hath ben getten grace lese sone acheved lamant truthe cause vertue soverain shewe good love alway find contrary cherish steeth pain lovely adversary yt pity long sleep doth ary hath set fine hevinesse yet comfort necessary shall set sure stablenesse la dame wofull wight wt may think say contrary joy gladnesse sicke body thought alway felen sore sicknesse thus hurtes diver businesse love hath put great hindraunce truth also put forgetfulnesse full sore begin sigh askaunce lamant god defend harmelesse worship good may befall werst tourneth leudnesse gift grace thing lady vouchsafe vpon call cherisheth honourable wise defaute ever fall deserveth death suffre twise la dame judge yset soch trespace right love may recovered one curseth fast another doth manace yet dyeth none farre see kepe course alway one degree ever labour doth encrease bring lady great subteltee others gilte sorow disease lamant one doth great offence dedde put justice right well wote gayneth defence must end full mischevous wise ever said god dispise falshed full cursednesse worship may never enterprise reigneth hath wilfulnesse la dame yt great fere adaise soch say maintain thereto stedfast truth nothing praise hem kepe long wele wo busie herts passen fro well reclaimed lure well learned hem withhold also al chaunge love best endure lamant one hath set hert stable wise place good true flit doe forth service alway withouten chaunge newe soone love beginneth remewe pleasaunce gothe anone little space party shall eschue soule abideth place la dame love truely ought right ye may mistaken doubtlesse ye foule disceived sight light vnderstanding gesse yet may ye well repele businesse reason attendaunce moch better abide folie simplenesse feble soccour disperaunce lamant reason counsaile wisedome good advise vnder love arested everichone accorde every wise rebell still stone mine medled one therwith bounden strong chain hem departing shall none pity breake mighty bonde atwaine la dame ye love selfe ever ye bee love stand subject every place wo ye pitee others pitee bileve purchace fully assured cace alway vnder one ordinaunce better trust grace leveth take pleasaunce lamant hope sure stedfast lady lacke pity ala shyt vp fast daunger sheweth cruelty see vertue fayle true service though doe faile also wonder surete must suffre way ever go la dame leave purpose rede best lenger ye kepe vaine lesse ye get hertes rest rejoyce shall never attaine ye abide good hope make faine ye shall found asotted dotage end ye shall know certaine hope shall pay wretch wage lamant ye say falleth pleasaunce power great see hope shall never remembraunce fele great adversitee nature hath set plentee goodnesse vertue grace never assembled hem seemed mee put pity dwellyng place la dame pity right ought reasonable wight great disavauntage nede profitable pitous shewing domage lady doe great outrage shew pity cause owne debate soch pity commeth dispitous rage soch love also right deadly hate lamant comfort hem live comfortlesse harm comfort name ye hert soch duresse faire lady must affirme durst say ye winne defame cruelty sitteth full ill pity may attain high herte may rest tary still la dame ever saith loveth paraventure leve well ought wrothe blamed though would medled soch moe might called pity mercilesse afterward live woe repent late gesse lamant marble herte yet hard parde mercy may perce labour strong bowe mighty tree availeth shew great rigour pleaseth see die houre iyen disport play shewe comfort soccour respite death chaseth alway la dame disease ye may allegeaunce mine let slake also ye shall dye pleasaunce heale surety make hurt selfe others sake wepe laugh sing warrant matter vndertake none hem shall make therof avant lamant skill love god alone cause wepe presence well ye wote avauntour none certainly love better silence one love hertes credence sure kepe secretly vauntour reverence tongue enemy la dame male bouch court hath great commaundment eche man studieth say worst may false lover time present serue best jangle iay secrete iwis yet men say mistrusted partise wherfore lady wt men speake say bileved wise lamant good ill shall alway world soch yearth plain good profe shewth every day otherwise great villony certain reason though one tong distain cursed speech shame soch refuce wrongfully remain vpon good renomed fame la dame soch nought tidings new ech trespas shall lightly pardon pursuen good true set none ill disposition continue every good condicion first fallen domage full freely hertes habandon little faith soft faire language lamant know well certaintee one truely yet shall shent sith maner iustice pitee banished lady entent cannot see one stent good ill vice eke vertue soch good soch haue punishment trespace hem liue untrue la dame power greuaunce punish none creature eschew encombraunce kepe u hold sure false semblaunce hath face full demure lightly catch lady wait wherefore must endure make right good watch lo conceit lamant sith grace goodly word one may alway kept store appeale god may hear mone duresse greueth sore pitee complaine furthermore forgate ordinaunce el life haue ended sone put remembraunce la dame hert haue done forfeit ye complain kind nothyng hurteth conceit iudge self ye shall find thus alway let sinke mind desire shall never recovered ye noye sore wasting wind haue said ynough seemeth lamant woful man rose vp paine departed weping countenaunce woful herte almost brast twaine full like dye walking forth traunce sayed death come forth thy self auaunce mine hert forget property make shorter woful penaunce poore lyfe full aduersity fro then went whither wist nought part drew soothfastnesse lady thought daunce anone gan dresse afterward one tolde thus expresse rent heer anguish paine toke great heauinesse dedde within day twaine lenuoy true louers thus beseech soch aduentures flye hem euery wise people defamed ye hem call truely great prejudice castels strong stuffed ordinaunce long time office whole countrey loue obeysaunce ye lady estate ye worshyp hath choyse dwellyng place goddes loue cruelty wise ne foule trace named rightwisely reason seemeth cace may called la belle dame sans mercy go litle book god send thee good passage chese well thy way simple manere looke thy clothing like thy pilgremage specially let thy prayere vnto hem thee rede thou art wrong help call thee correct part pray hem also thine humble seruice thy boldnesse pardon cace el thou art able wise make thy self appear place furthermore beseech hem grace favour supportacion take gree rude translation god wote standeth ful destitute eloquence metre colour like beast naked without refute vpon plain abide manner shower ask hem socours whose request thou made wise commanding body seruice right thus make end pro besechyng hath balaunce true man vexed causelesse man wch remembraunce done faithful observaunce trouth purpose endure pray god send hem better auenture explicit queen annelida false arcite arcite theban knight forsaketh queen annelida loved intirely taketh new lady whereupon annelida maketh great complaint thou fiers god armes mar rede thy frosty countrey called thrace within thy grisly temple full drede honoured art patrone place bellona pallas full grace present song continue gie beginning thus thee cry full depe sonken minde pitous hert english endite old story latine finde queene annelida false arcite elde frete bite hath freten many noble story hath nigh devoured memory favourable eke thou polimnia pernaso hath thy sister glade elicon far cirsa singest voice memorial shade vnder laurer may fade doe ship winne first follow stace corinne jamque domos patrias cithiaepost aspera gentis praelia laurigeo subeuntem thesea curru laetifici plausus missusque ad sidera vulgi c theseus warres long great aspre folke cithe ouercome laurer crowned chaire gold beat home country house ycome people blisful criden sterres went honouren entent duke sign victory trompes come baner large image mar token glory men might see treasure many charge many bright helm many spere targe many fresh knight many blisful rout horse foot field ipolita wife hardy queene cithia conquered emely young suster shene faire chaire gold lad ye ground chair sprad brightness beauty face fulfilled largesse grace triumph laurer crowned thus floure fortune yeuing lete noble prince theseus toward athene way riding fonde woll shortly bring slye way gan write queene annelida false arcite mar furious course ire old wrath iuno fulfill hath set people hertes fire thebe grece euerich kill bloody speres rested neuer still throng among hem euerich slue wroth amphiorax tideus ipomedon partinope also dedde slain proud campaneus wretched theban brother two slain king adrastus home ago desolate stood thebe bare wight could remedy care old creon gan espy yt blood royal brought adown held citee tyranny gentils regioun friend dwell toun loue awe noble folke towne ydrawe among annelida queene ermony towne dwelling fairer sonne sheene throughout ye world gan name spring see every wight liking trouth none liche woman world riche yong queene twenty yere old middle stature soch fairnesse nature ioy behold speaken stedfastnesse passed hath penelope lucresse shortly may ben comprehended might nothing amended theban knight eke sothe sain yong thereto withall lusty knight double love nothing plain subtill craft ouer wight conning wan lady bright ferforth gan trouth assure trusteth ouer creature sain loueth arcite absent throw anone thought herte brast atwo sight bare low wende hert yknow false na fayned chere nedeth soche crafte men lere neuerthelesse full mikell businesse er might lady winne swore would dien distresse witte said would twinne ala routh sinne upon sorrowes would rue nothing thinketh false doth true fredome found arcite soch manere hath moch lite ne creature made cheer liked arcite lack might wite ferforth yeuen please liked ease na maner letter sent touched loue maner wight ne shewed brent plain full might nyl hide nothing knight lest vntrouth vpbreyde without bode herte obeyd eke made ialous ouer man sayd anon would praien swere word make yuell apaid wende witte braid sleight flatterie without love fained jelousie tooke debonairly al thought skilful thing ever lenger loved tenderly honour king herte wedded ring ferforth vpon trouth entent goth herte went shal eat thought well vnneth meate toke keepe rest brought thought alway till slepe whan absent priuely doth wepe thus liueth faire annelida queene false arcite tene false arcite newfanglenesse lowly trewe tooke lesse deintee stedfastnesse saw another lady proude newe right anon clad hewe wote whether white reed grene falsed faire annelida queene neverthelesse great wonder none though false kind man sith lamech long agone love false euer first father began loven two bigamye found tent first men lye false arcite somewhat must faine whan false coueren tratoury right horse yt bite plaine bare honde treachery swore coude doublenesse espye falsenesse ment thus swore thefe forth way went ala herte might endure routhe wo sorrow tell man hath conning wit wt man might within chambre dwell rehersen shall hell suffreth fayre annelida queene false arcite tene wepeth waileth swouneth pitously ground deed falleth stone crampisheth limmes crokedly speketh witte agone colour ashen hath none ne none word speketh moch lite mercy cruell herte mine arcite thus endureth til mate ne hath foot wch may sustene forth languishyng ever estate arcite hath neyther routh ne tene hert el newe grene wo ne deineth think recketh never whether flete sinke new lady holdeth narowe vp bridel staues end every word dred arowe daunger made bothe bowe bend luste made turne wend ne graunted liuing grace hath sing droue forth vnneth list know seruaunt vnto ladyship lest proude helde lowe thus serueth without meate sip sent land ship yaue daunger fill therfore owne ensample ye thrifty woman take hede annelida false arcite list dere herte call meke therefore loved lite kinde man herte delite thing straunge also god save may get wold turne annelida ayen pyneth day day languishing saw ne gate geyn vpon day sorowfully wepyng cast make complainyng owne hand gan write sent theban knight arcite complaint annelida false arcite thir led ye point remembraunce swerde sorowe whette false pleasaunce mine herte bare blisse black hew turned quaking daunce sewerty waped countenaunce sen avayleth nought ben trew trew shall rew serueth love doth observaunce alway one chaungeth new wote selfe well wight loved one mine hert might self hundred thousand sith called hertes lyfe knight ferre right glad blithe disease death swithe ayen trouth hath plight evermore hys lady kithe false ala causeles wo routhles worde list one daine bring ayen sorowfull herte pee caught vp another lee right list laugheth paine ne mine hert estraine loue yet alway ueuertheles plaine shuld playne ala hard stound vnto foe yaue myne hert wound yet desireth myne harme certes ferther woll neuer found none helpe sore sound desteny hath shaped full yore woll none medecine ne lore woll ben aye one bound haue said said euermore ala become gentilnesse word full pleasance humblesse obseruaunce lowe manere awayting besinesse ye called maistresse soueraine lady world ala neyther worde ne chere ye vouchsafe vpon myne heuinesse ala loue bye dere certes swete though ye thus causelesse cause deedly aduersite manly reason ought respite slee frende namely neuer yet degre offended wissy wote wo soule quite playne arcite workes moch lite besie delite myne honour saue meke kinde fre therefore ye put wite ala ye retche mite though swerde sorow bite wofull hert cruelty sweet ye shame thinke ye furthered name loue newe ben vntrewaye put slander blame aduersitie grame loue god thou wost alway yet turne ayen yet playne day shall mi ben game foryeue lyue may lo hert myne al saine whether shall pray el playne way done trew eyther mote haue chayne deth ye mote depart v twayne bethe none meane wayes new god wisely soule rewe verely ye slaine payne mowe ye see vnfained mine hewe thus ferforth haue deth sought selfe murder priuie thought sorow routh vnkindnesse wepe wayle fast helpeth naught voide joy speake aught voide company flie gladnesse may auaunt better heuineffe plite haue ye brought without gilte needeth witnesse pray weiuen womanhede nay rather death foule dede aske mercy giltlesse nede plaine lyfe lede recketh know drede vnto mine othes bede mine excuse scorne shall mede chere floureth woll sede full long agon might haue taken hede though morow agayne might well hold aprill rayne holde maken stedfast almighty god trouth souerayn ye trouth man hath slayn hem loueth shall hem find fast tempest rotten mast tame beest aye fayne renne away lest agast mercy sweete missay haue aught sayd way witte away fare doth songe chantepleure plaine pley mased dey arcite hath borne away key world good auenture world creature walking discomfiture ne sorowe endure sleepe furlonge way twey thinketh figure stante clad asure efte profre newe assure ben trewe mercy prey long night wonder sight ydrie day affray die right naught ywis ye retche ne neuermore mine eyen ben drye routh trouth crye well away ferre fetch thus holdeth desteny wretch rede drede gye ne may wit weake stretch end thus sith may yeue vp euermore shall neuer efte putten balaunce sikernesse ne lerne loue lore swan haue herde say full yore ayenst deth woll sing penaunce sing destinie chaunce arcite annelida sore hath thrilled ye point remembraunce annelida wofull queene hath
