hand written wise face deed betwixt pale greene fell swoune sithe gan rise vnto mar au oweth sacrifise within temple sorowful chere shapen ye may plainly explicit assembly lady gentlewoman dreameth seeth great number lady put bill complaint judge promiseth relieve grievance septembre falling lefe fresh season altogider done corne gathered shefe gardine twaine noone lady walking wone foure nombre mind doth fall fifth simplest hem gentilwomen fayre also disporting hem euerich gise crosse alies walking two two alone fantasie thus occupied diuerse wise yet trouth alone knight squire many one whereof serued one hem asked said ayen fell thought walke mase certainte woman nothing rought asked ayen sought colour pale forsoth qd thereby lithe tale must wete qd anone tell let see make tarying abide qd ye ben hastie one let wete litel thing bicause ye haue great longing desire processe shall tell plaine matere happed thus noone felawship one assent besinesses doone passe time mase went tooke way eche entent went inward went gon stood mid looked soth say full ferre behind right anon ferforth best mased mind alwaies good hem host eest west thus went forth little rest courage hem sore assaile wrath step ouer raise sought hem selfe fro gate selfe little auantage forweried might go though right gret viage came forth strait passage brought herber fair grene made bench full craftie cleane thought might creature deuise better dewe proporcioun safe closed well ensure masonry compace enuiroun full secretly staires going middes place turning whele certaine vpon pot margelaine margarets growing ordinance shew hem selfe folke went fro behold great pleasance accompanied mo ne momblisnesse sonenesse also poure pen disloged ne god wote place euery flore bench paued fair smoth stone square many diuers hew well joyned say soth semed one none knew vnderneth stremes new new siluer bright springing wise whence came ye coud deuise little alone beholding well delectable place felawship comming euerychone must need abide space remembring many diuers cace time passed sighes depe set downe fell aslepe slept thought ther came gentill woman metely stature great worship seemed atyred well high measure countenaunce full sad demure colour blewe vpon came mo selfe alone gown wel embraudred certainly stone owne deuise purfill word bien loyalement coud deuise praid maner wise name might haue remembrance said called perseuerance furthermore speake bold dwelled prayed say againe full curtessy told dwelling hath many day lady lady pray great estate thus warne qd call ye name loyalte office stand ye degree qd wold wete right faine qd vnworthy though bee chambre husher certaine rodde beare token plaine like ye know rule soch seruice apertaining office charged commandement warn felawes euerichone ye come present counsaile shall anone seuen day commen gone furthermore bad say excuse might none delay another thing forget behind wise wold ye knew remembre well beare mind felawes ye must come blew eueriliche able mater sew pray thinke vpon word selues euerychon abashed maner wise many ben soch high presence make request ye best deuise gladly woll yeue audience grefe maner offence wherein ye fele hert displeased help right sone ye shal eased right glad qd ye tell none v yt knoweth ye way way qd shall mi ye shall haue gide day day felawes cannot better say soch one shall tell way full right diligence gentilwoman hight woman right famous gouernaunce well cherished tell certaine felawship shall great pleasaunce porte soch maners trew plaine glad chere wold besie paine bring farwel haue done abide said ye may go sone qd haue ferre go yeue warning many diuers place felawes mo well ye wote haue litell space nowe yet qd ye must tell cace shall men vnto v call one qd may come amongs one said eigh benedicite haue done pray tell life trowe well qd euer bilieue somewhat say trouth question may nothing large meddle charge thus qd vnderstand place lady dwelling forsoth qd one sought land fairer none though king deuised well euery thing toures hie full pleasaunt shall ye find phanes fresh turning euery wind chambres parlers sort thought baie windowes goodly may bee daunsing wise disport galeries right well ywrought well wote ye thider brought take good hede thereof euery wise ye woll thinke paradise hight ye place qd say pleasaunt regard qd tell plain trouth qd wote ye may right well called certaine furthermore wold wit right sain soone come may best enquere gentilwoman porter yate shall ye find name countenance ye hap ye come early late wer good haue acquaintance tell ye shall auance come lady presence word rede ye geue credence time parte fro good faith haue great businesse wote right well qd thanke great gentilnesse comfort hath yeuen hardinesse shall bold withouten faile aduice good counsaile thus parted left alone saw beheld aside woman come goodly one forth withal aspide thought anone gide name anone enquere full womanly yaue answere qd simple creature sent court name diligence sone might come ensure taried licence come presence looke seruice may commaund say thanked praied come nere would see araid gown blew dressed good manere deuise word also said tant que je puis well apaid wist withouten full true herde though toke little space full good qd coud gesse farre qd haue vnto place day journey qd littel lesse wherefore rede outward dresse suppose felawship past nothing wold last departed ye springing ye day forth went soft easie pace till last iourney far outward might see ye place let u rest qd littel space say devoutly pater noster saint iulian al herte assent good moch better shal spede done taried said euery dyl day past farre none saw place thider came sone round closed wall seeming full like hospital found one brought al mine aray gentil woman mine acquaintaunce haue meruaile qd maner way ye knowlege al ordenaunce yes yes qd herde perseueraunce warned felawes euerichone aray ye shoulde haue upon loue qd pray sith ye haue take upon paine ye would help mine aray wit ye well wold gone right faine praier needeth certaine qd come hie sone ye shall see anone shall done dout greatly wote ye felawes passed gone warne qd nat shall assemble euerichone notwithstanding counsaile anone make redy tary harme though ye dressed mine aray asked whether well right well qd unto pay ye nede nat care place euer ye go while debated came diligence saw blew sister qd right well broke ye new discrecion purueiour went forth met auenture yong woman officer seeming name qd good creature discrecion qd without lesing qd abiding haue qd office purchace chiefe purueiour longeth place acquaintance herbyger faire loue qd ordenaunce name herbigere forsoth qd name acquaintaunce woman right gracious manere thus qd wt stranger haue ye qd high degree ne low ye first ferforth know countenaunce porter thus tale came streight ye yate yong woman departed gone came diligence knocked fast thereat without qd countenaunce anone truly qd faire sister one one qd therewithal lough diligence ye know wel inough opened gate go wordes faire said full gentilly ye welcome ywis ye mo nat one qd saue woman qd pray hertely take chambre rest till felawes come hold best thanked forth go euerichone till chambre without wordes mo came diligence toke leaue anone euer ye list qd may ye go thanke right hertely also labour god mede iesu spede countenaunce asked anone felawship qd forsoth qd comming euerichone know certainte without may hem window se stand awaiting euer among well wote long thus stode musing full busily thought take good hede aray gowne blewe wote verely good facion furred wel gray vpon sleue worde nay said thus penne endite moy que je voy written letter white forth withal came streight wordes qd fain would yt knew forsoth qd ye shall well know see worde haue none trewe inough clothing blew commaundement right well content largesse steward tell pray hertely steward say wt name hight largesse say surely faire lady right noble fame whan ye see ye reporte bid welcome belchier marshal hall ye fary still mater ye may wel haue mind tel ye brought bill ye ye qd el behind one tell may find yt may shew mater plain surely qd unto chamberlain remembraunce chamberlaine chamberlaine qd say ye trewe ye verely said mine advise nat aferde unto lowly sewe shall done qd ye devise ye must know name wise trewly qd shew substaunce withouten faining name remembraunce secretary may yet forget doth right moche every thing wherfore rede ye wtther ymet matere hole tell without faining ye shall find full good full loving tell name qd gentlenesse good sothe qd avisenesse qd passing good every bill sedule must see good qd come stand stood felawes comming yonder yape say ye soth qd yape nay nay say certain se come togither twain twain ye say ful sothe qd nay see comming goodly company ben soch folke qd dare say list love think verely love pray faithfully time upon call ye wol good frende hem frendship qd shal misse ease put thereto paine god yeld qd take shal know ye chamberlaine shal ye wel know word certaine worde sister pray say plus ne pourroye thus writeth alway thus stode togider euen yate felawes echone met hem thought goodly badde hem welcome one one came forth countenaunce anone full hertely faire sister qd ye right welcome countre counsaile take litel rest chambre pleasaunce ye thinke best go cal perseveraunce bicause acquaintaunce also tell every thing ye shal ruled comming felawes one advise wel agreed like said began dresse u gise folke say nat unpurueid good wager among u laid u atired goodlest u praised best porter came brought perseverance welcomed u curteise manere think ye long qd attendance go speke unto herbigere purvey lodging go unto chamberlain speke come anone departed gone saw folk comming without wall great people yt nombre coude none lady gentelwomen clothed blewe echone worde withal know word devise came thick yt ne might wise anone came perseverance stode came streight ye ben qd mine old acquaintance enquere bolder would bee word bere eche degree pray tell secrete wise shall keepe close warrantise ben five lady qd fere gentlewoman foure company begin open mattere shall ye know wordes none verely tolde countenaunce mine array blewe needeth qd woll go againe ye may knowledge wt ye shuld soth qd ye wold take paine ye right moch u ye rather speed soner may go great coste alway tarying long sewe wery thing parted came anone ye must qd come chamberlaine redy qd everychone folow whan euer ye list certaine none eloquence tell plaine beseeching may excused trewe meaning refused went forth perseverance see prees wonder cace passe great combrance people stode thick every place stand ye still qd littel space ease somewhat shall assay make better way forth goeth among hem everychone making way yt might thorough passe ease done beckend u come folowed la brought u streight unto ye chamberlain left u went salued reason would full humble beseching great goodnesse matter would good lady maistresse ye welcome qd sothfastnesse see please redy may ease folowed vnto chamber dore sister qd come ye mee wete ye well paued flore goodliest wight might see furthermore loked wee eche corner vpon euery wall made burel cristall wherein grauen story many one first phillis womanly pite died piteously loue demophone next story tisbe slewe self tree yet saw right pitous caas antony slaine cleopatra side hawes shene full untrewly disceiued baine also annelida queene vpon arcite sore complaine story graued certaine many mo reherse long tell fere bicause walles shone bright fine umple al ouer sprad entent folke shuld hurt sight story might rad went lad sawe without faile chaire set full rich apparaile fiue stage set fro ground cassidony full curiously wrought foure pomelles gold round set saphirs good coude thought wot ye sought suppose fro country inde another soch right hard finde wete ye well right nere durst beholding aboue rich cloth estate wrought needle ful straungely worde theron thus said truely endure tell word great letter better hem knew thus stode dore opened anone gentilwoman semely stature bering mace came selfe alone sothly thought goodly creature speake nothing lowde ensure hastely goodly warning make rome qd lady comming anone saw perseveraunce helde vp tapet hand saw also right goodly ordinaunce great lady within tapet stand comming outward wol ye vnderstand noble company coude tell nombre sikerly name wolde nothing enquere soch wolde sewe vnto save lady chauncellere attemperaunce sothly name v nedeth moche matter alway forth tell furthermore lady beauty discrive conning simple verely never yet day live inly faire seene none truly estate assured vtterly wanted nought dare well assure longed goodly creature furthermore speake array shall tell manner gowne cloth gold full rich nay colour blew right goodly fashioun taberde wise sleves hanging adoun purfill wise shall devise sort coller vent like armine made purfeling great pearles full fine orient couched one worching diamond steed powdering sleeve purfell assise made like every wise necke sort faire ruby white floures right fine enamaile vpon head set fairest wise cercle great balais entaile earnest speake without faile young old every manner age world looken visage thus comming forth sit estate presence kneeled everychone presenting billes ye wote full humbly tooke hem one one done came anone manere kneeling one rising fere set place chamberlaine vnto call goodly comming vnto apace entent knowing nothing void backe prease qd vp wall make large roome looke ye tary take billes secretary chamberlaine commaundment came againe bid secretary present billes delivered also many mo lady good advise againe anone withall called chamberlaine woll qd first thing ye secretary ye make come anone billes thus also presence rede hem everychone may take good advise theron lady ben onr counsaile looke done withouten faile chamberlain wist entent anone secretary call let billes qd present lady madame qd shall presence ye hem call good ready qd pleasure commandeth vpon made ordinaunce came first billes red full gentilly said perseveraunce reason soonest sped anone withall vpon tapet spred secretary laid hem downe echone billes first redde one one first lady bearing devise sans que jamays thus wrote bill complaining sore full pitous wise promise made faithful hert broken ayenst manner skill without desert alwaies party matter desiring remedy next folowing word wise un sans changer thus complaine though guerdoned service yet nothing like tooke paine wherfore coud wise restraine case sue vntill presence reason would recompence furthermore speake twaine one hem wrote fantasie onques puis leuer tell plaine complaint full pitous verely said great reason remember matere shall tell processe fere bill made complaining gise joy comfort gladnesse surety manner wise said therein point stablenesse ill wele sikernesse full humbly desiring high grace soone shew remedy case fellaw made bill thus said plaining wise loved best whether wroth wele apaid might see woll fainest wroth earnest tell word ferforth wote entierement vostre right thus wrote vpon made great request hert might done vntill might redresse best mind might find soone remedy boone rehearsing said beseeching might like wise done gentlewoman company put billes tell one hem wrote cest sans dire verely matere hole specifie within bill put writing said ye shall knowing said god wote full pitously like disposed hert misfortune tooke grevously one joy smert sometime thanke good desert comfort wanted none comming vsed greeued nothing desiring lowly beseeching would seke better way ben day living stedfast trewe alway felaw somewhat shall say whose bill red next forth withall meant rehearsen shall en dieu est wrote devise thus said withouten faile trouth might take wise like thouyt wherfore mervaile trouth somtime wont take availe every matere ago pity suffred much wherof shuld complain thoght great encombraunce much write therfore certain god put affiaunce word made remembraunce beseeching would cace shew vnto favour grace third wrote rehersing grevaunce ye wote ye pitous thing thoght felt great displesaunce one might right wel perceive chere wonder sate passing nere yet loth put writing need woll course every thing soyes ensure word certaine thus wrote little space loved labour vaine set another place full humbly desiring cace good comfort sorrow appease might live heart ease fourth surely thought liked wele port behaving bien moneste ferre coud fele word till well belonging wherefore prayed thing full heartely say substaunce would send good continuaunce ye rehearsed billes let see somwhat entent may hap paraventure ye shall pray present ye shall knowledge parde ment say trouth make fable case selfe inly lamentable well wote ye woll think like say ye heard bill good tel saint iame abide yet yet must ye wete reason skill sith ye haue knowledg yt thus said without word nothing lefe death come finall end sorrowes paine desire seeme ye ye knew aforne certaine wote ye would tell plaine without help hath thing cure cannat thinke may long endure trouth hath proued wele say sooth say full long time suffered euerydele patience keepe store goodnesse beseeching therefore might haue thanke wise desert serueth justise billes rad euerychone lady tooke good aduisement hem answere one one thought much entent wherefore yaue hem commaundement presence come one yeue hem answere generall suppose ye verely spake self said manere haue well seene billes hem pitous woll therefore ye know fere within short time court parliment shall hold pallais present wherein find greued shall ye find open remedy wise ye shall releeued ye rehearse throughly date ye shall know verely ye may haue space comming diligence shall tell writing thanked humble wise felawship ech one one assent submitting v lowly till seruise thought trauail spent wise held v content v tooke sleue forthwithall take leue suddainly water sprang anone visage therewithall woke thought gone mased vp gan loke anon went made boke thus simply rehearsing substance shuld remembrance verely dream passing good worthy remembraunce though stand long stood none encombraunce tooke therein inly great pleasaunce tell wt ye book call must wete right good ye shall booke say right name tell certainte lassemble de dame thus hight thinke ye name good parde go farewell call felawes must sone rede well dreme tale done conclusion astrolabie book written son year lord king richard standeth good day especially horizon oxford opinion learned cannot amended little lowis sonne perceiue well certaine euidences thine abilitie learne science touching number proportion also well consider thy busie prayer especiall learne treatise astrolabie much philosopher saith hee wrapeth friend condiscendeth rightfull prayer friend therefore haue giuen thee sufficient astrolabie orizont compouned latitude oxenford vpon mediation little treatise purpose teach thee certaine number conclusion pertayning instrument say certaine conclusion three cause first cause trust well conclusion haue founden el possibly might found noble instrument astrolabie ben vnknowen perfitly mortall man region suppose another cause soothly cart astrolabie haue yseene ben conclusion woll thyngs perfourme behest hem beene hard thy tender age ten yeare conceiue treatise deuided fiue part shewe woonder light rule naked word english latine ne canst thou nat yet smale little sonne neuerthelesse suffiseth thee true conclusion english well suffiseth noble clerkes greekes conclusion greeke arabines arabike iewes hebrewe latin folk arche day arche night ylike long sun twise euery yeere passing signet head two sommers two winter yeere haue foresaid people almicanteras astrolabie streight line hath shewed figure vtilities know ascencions signes right cercle trust well mediacions thilke ascencions astrologiens table instrument knowen verely ascencion euery degree minute zodiake embolyfe cercle shall shewed note foresaid right orizont cleped orizont rectum deuideth equinoctiall right angle embolyfe orizont whereas pole enhanced vpon orizont ouercommeth equinoctiall embolyfe angle conclusion know ascension sign right circle circulus directus set head signe thee list know ascending right cercle vpon line meridionall wait thine almury toucheth bordure set pricke tourne thy reet westward till end foresaid signe set vpon meridionall line eftsones wait thine almury toucheth bordure set another pricke recken nombers degree bordure betwixe prickes take ascencion signe right cercle thus maist thou werke euery porcion zodiake know ascension sign embolyfe circle every region mean circulo obliquo set head signes thee list know ascencion vpon east orizont wait thine almury toucheth bordure set pricke tourn thy reet vpward till end signe set vpon east orizont wait eftsones thine almury toucheth bordure set another pricke recken number degree bordure betwixe prickes take ascencion signe embolyfe cercle vnderstand well signes zodiake head aries vnto end virgo cleped signes north equinoctiall signes arisen betwixe east north orizont generally euer sign head libra vnto end pisces cleped sign south fro equinoctiall sign arisen euermore betwixe east south orizont also euery sign betwixe head capricorn vnto end gemini ariseth orizont lesse two hour equalls sign head capricorn vnto end gemini called tortuous sign crooked sign risen embolyfe orizont crooked sign obedient sign right ascencion sign right ascencion fro head cancer vnto head sagitary sign arisen vpright doth therefore called soueraign sign euery hem ariseth space two hour sign gemini obeyeth cancer taurus leo aries virgo pisces libra aquarius scorpio capricorn sagitary thus euermore two sign like far head capricorn obeyeth euerich hem know justly rhe four quarter world east west south north take altitude thy sun thou list note well quarter world sun time asymutes tourne thine astrolabie set degree sun almicanteras altitude thilke side sun standeth manner taking hour lay thy labell degree sun recken many degree sun line meridionall point thy labell note well nombres tourn thine astrolabie set point thy great rule thou takest thine altitude vpon many degree bordure meridional point thy labell line meridionall womb side take thine astrolabie hand sadly slyly let sun shine hole thy rule slyly thilke shining lay thine astrolabie couch adown euen vpon plain ground meridionall line thine astrolabie euen south east line lie euen east west line west north line north thou werke softly auisely couching thou hast thus four quarter firmament c know altitude planet way sun whether north south way aforesaid look planet line meridional altitude height degree sun day planet way sun hath latitude altitude planet higher degree sun planet north way sign south quantite latitude sheweth thine almicanteras altitude lesse degree sun planet south way sun soch quantite latitude sheweth thine almicanteras saine way sun euery place zodiake morow sun another degree know signet arising sun fain party orizont sun ariseth thou must first consider sun ariseth east signet sometime north east sometime south east sothly sun ariseth euermore east orizont head aries libra thine orizont departed party thy minute significacion part world though shipmen recken party wait minute sun entreth arising take signet rising sun manner division thine astrolabie thus enjoyned case first deuided four place principally line commeth fro east west another line goeth fro south north deuided small party minute east east south first minute aboue east line forth fro party party till thou come east line thus thou might vnderstand signet euery sterre party ariseth know party firmament conjunction consider time conjunction kalender thus many hour conjunction fro midday day sheweth canon kalender recken nomber bordure thine astrolabie thou wont knowing hour day night lay thy labell ouer degree sun point labell sit vpon hour conjunction look minute degree sun sitteth party firmament conjunction know signet altitude sun say time day take altitude sun minute hee ascendeth thou might see party firmament hee wise might thou see night sterre wheder hee sit east west south part betwixe name minute sterres standeth know sothly longitude moon planet hath latitude time ecliptike line take altitude moone reken thyne altitude vp among thyne almicanteras side moone standeth set pricke take anone right upon moones side altitude euery sterre fixe thou knowest set cercle upon altitude among thyne almicanteras sterre founden waite degree zodiake prick altitude moon take degree moone standeth conclusion soth starres thine astrolaby standeth trouth treatise astrolaby maketh none excepcion whether moone altitude none whether side moone altitude sterre found note moone shewe selfe day thou mayest woorche conclusion sunne well starre fixe werching conclusion know whether planet direct retrograde take altitude sterre cleped planete note well anone right take altitude sterre fixe thou knowest note well also come third fourth night next folowyng thou shalt perceyue well meuyng planete whether meue forward backward waite well sterre fixe altitude thou tooke first altitude foresaid planet note well trust well planet right side meridional line second altitude lesse first altitude planet direct west side condicion retrograde planet east side altitude take second altitude first altitude retrograde west side lyne meridional direct contrary moving party cours moone sothly moone moveth contrary fro either planet ecliptike line none maner conclusion equacions house astrolaby set beginnyng degree ascendeth upon end viii houre inequall lyne second house sit upon line midnight remeue degree ascendeth set upon end x houre inequale beginning iii house sitte upon midnight lyne bryng againe degree ascendeth first set hym upon east orizont beginning iiii hous sit upon midnight lyne take nadere degree ascendeth first set hym vpon end ii houre inequale beginnyng v house sit upon midnight lyne take nadere ascendent set hym upon end iiii hour inequal wil beginning vi house sit vpon midnight line beginning vii house nadere ascendent beginning viii house nadere second beginnyng ninth house nadere third beginnyng tenth house nadere iiii beginning eleuenth house nadere fifth beginning xii house nadere sixt house another maner equacions house astrolaby take thyne ascendent thou hast fower angle well thou wotest opposite thine ascent say beginning seuenth house sit vpon west orizont beginning tenth house vpon lyne meridional opposite vpon line midnight lay thy labell upon degree ascendeth reken fro point thy labell degree bordure till thou come meridional line departe thilk degree three euen part take euen porcions three house lay thy labell ouer euery three party thou might see labell zodiake beginning three house fro ascendent say twelue next aboue ascendent eleuenth house tenth house upon meridional line first said wise werche fro thy ascendent line midnight thus thou hast three house say beginning second third fourth house nadire three house beginning three house followeth find line meridional dwell fix certain place take round plate metal warpyng border better make upon iuste compace little within bordure lay round plate vpon euen ground euen stone euen stock fit thy ground lay euen rule centre compace sticke euen pinne wire upright smaller better set thy pinne thy wire plomme rule end vpright even let pinne lenger quarter thy diameter compace fro ye line wait busily tenne eleuen clocke sunne sheweth shadow pinne entereth thing within cercle compace one heere brede make prick ynke abide still wayting sunne one clock til shadow pinne wire passe thyng cercle compace bee never little set pricke take compace measure even middle betwixt prickes set pricke take rule draw strike even fro pinne vnto middle pricke take line meridonall evermore place thou draw crosse ouerthwarte compace justly yc line meridionall haste thou east west perconsequens oppositife south north description meridional line longitude latitude city town well climate lyne meridional manner discription lyne imagined passeth vpon pole ye world signet hedde cleaped signet place man tyme yeere sunne meuyng firmament commeth meridionall place midday cleape noone therefore cleaped lyne midday take heed evermore two citees two townes one approcheth nerer east doth towne trust well thilk two tounes diver meridian take kepe also arche equinoctial conteyned bounded betwene two meridian cleaped longitude toune yt two tounes meridian like one meridian distaunce hem bothe like farre maner chaunge meridian sothly chaunge almicanteras haunsing pole distaunce sun longitude climate may cleaped space ye earth fro beginning first climate unto laste end climate even directe pole artike thus say auctours clerk say men cleap latitude center arch meridian yt conteined intercept betwixe signet equinoctiall say distaunce fro equinoctiall unto end climate even ayenst pole artike longitude climate south know degree zodiack planet ascendeth orizont latitude north south know thine almanack degree ecliptike signe planet rekened bee cleaped degree longitude knowe also degree latitude fro ecliptike north south ensamples following especiall thou mayest wirche every signe zodiake longitude peraventure venus another planet capricorne latitude hem northward degree fro ecliptike line toke subtil compas cleaped one point compace f tooke point set ecliptike line zodiake degree longitude heddes say head capricorne set point f upward signe altitude north vpon latitude venus say degree fro heed capricorne thus degree betwixe two prickes laid doune softly compace set degree longitude upon orizont tooke waxed labell maner pair table receive distinctly pricke compace tooke forsaid labell layed fix degree longitude tooke compace point waxe labell coud gesse ecliptike line end yc longitude set point endlong labell vpon space latitude inward zodiake yt say northward fro ecliptike laied doune compace looked well way upon ecliptike f tourned reete till pricke f sate vpon orizont saw well body venus latitude degree septentrionals ascendeth end degree fro yt heed capricorne note maner thou mightest werch latitude septentrional signes sothly latitude meridional planet capricorne may take little space betwixe ecliptike bordure astrolabie sikerly signes may take also degree peraventure iupiter planet first degree pisces longitude latitude degree meridionall tooke point set first degree pisces ecliptike set ye point dounward f yt sign latitude south degree yt say fro heed pisces thus degree betwixt prick set degree longitude vpon orizont tooke labell laid fixe vpon degree longitude set point labell even ecliptike line end degree longitude sette point f endlong labell space degree latitude outward fro zodiake say southward fro ecliptike toward bordure tourned reete till point f sate vpon orizont saw well yt body iupiter latitude degree meridionall ascendeth degree pisces horescopo maner thou mayest wyrch latitude said first saue capricorn thou wilt ply craft arising moone looke thou reken well course houre houre dwelleth degree longitude little thou woste well neuerthelesse thou legen well meuing table alter course houre houre thou shalt well ynough vmbra rectum thou wilt wirche vmbra rectum thou might come base toure manner shalt thou wirche take altitude toure hole rule lye even point ensample thus see poynt fower mete space betwixe toure find twenty foote behold fower twelue find third part twelve right space betwixe thee toure third part altitude toure thrise twenty foot highest toure addition thine body fro thine eye rule fall fiue fiue time twelue highest toure vmbra versae thou mayest come base toure thou fixe nomber one set pricke thy foote go nere toure see point two set prick behold one hath twelve thou shalt find hath twelve sithes behold two xii thou shalt find sixe sithes therefore space betwixe two prickes sixe time thine altitude note first altitude one thou settest pricke afterward thou seest two thou settest prick thou findest betwene foot thou shalt find tenne eight part foote altitude toure fall upon another poynt thus falleth sixe seconde takyng falleth fower shalt thou find sixe second part twelve fower third part twelve third part say space betwixe two prickes twise height toure difference three wold three time height et sic de singulis maner werchyng vmbra rectum thou mayest come base toure wirche wise sette thy rule upon one till thou see altitude set thy foote pricke set thy rule upon two manner look difference betwixe one two thou shalt find one measure space betwixe two prickes twelfth part altitude toure vmbra rectum thy rule fall vpon eight point right shadowe make figure eight looke much space yt foot betwixe thee tour multiply twelve thou haste multiplied nomber devide nomber eight keepe residue adde thereto thy height vnto thyne iye residue shall height toure thus mayst thou worche side one twelve c vmbra rectum another maner working vpon side looke vpon point thy rule falleth thou seest top toure two hole mete space thy foote base toure right nomber point hath twelve right ye mesure betwixt thee toure hath ye height toure ensample thus set case thy rule fall vpon eight eight two third partes twelve space two third partes toure vmbra versa know height point vmbra versa thy rule fall vpon thou seest top toure set prick thy foote standeth go nere till thou mayst see toppe point iiii sette another pricke mete many foote betwixe two prickes height vp thine iye shall height toure note iii fowerth part xii iiii third part xii passeth iiii nomber iii distaunce therfore space thy height thyne eye height toure two three distaunce nombers measure betwixe prickes twise thrise height toure vmbra rectum know height thou maist come base thing set thy rule vpon wt point thou wilte thou mayst see toppe ye thyng two hole make marke thy foote standeth go nere ferther till thou mayst see another point make another marke looke wt difference betwixe two point scale right difference hath xii right space betwix two markes hath hym height thyng ensample set case thou seest point iiii point iii passeth nomber iiii nomber iii distaunce one right difference one hath twelve right measure betwixe bothe markes hath height thyng putting thereto height thy selfe thine eye thus maiest thou werke one twelve vmbra versa ferthermore thou wilt know vmbra versa crafte vmbra rectum suppose take thine altitude point four makest marke thou goest nere till thou haste point three makest another marke must thou deuide four nomber yt cometh thereof shal deuide three nomber yt cometh thereof looke difference betwixe yt shalt thou find right hath space betwixe ye two prick hath altitude thyng phere endeth conclusion astrolabie complaint black knight heavy complaint knight cannot win lady grace may flora ye fresh lusty quene soyle hath cladde grene red whight phebus gan shede stremes shene amidde bulle al beames bright lucifer chace away night ayen morow orizont hath take bid lover slepe awake hertes heavy recomfort drerihed heavy night sorow nature bad hem rise hem disport ayen goodly glad grey morow hope also sainct iohan borow bad dispite daunger dispaire take holsome lusty ayre sigh gan abreide stomber sodainly vp starte ala nigh sorow deide sicknesse sate aye nye hart finde soccour smart least release peine sore halte every veine rose anone thought would gone wodde heare birdes sing misty vapour agone cleare faire morning dewe also like silver shining vpon leaf baume swete till firy titan persant hete dryed vp lusty licour new vpon herbes grene mede floures many diver hew vpon stalkes gon sprede splay leves brede againe sunne gold burned spere doune hem cast beam clere river forth gan costey water clere birell cristall till last found little wey toward parke enclosed wall compace rounde gate small would frely might gone parke walled grene stone went heare birdes song branch plaine vale loud sang wood rong like shiver peeces smale thought nightingale great might voice gan wrest right hert love would brest soile plaine smoth wonder soft oversprad tapettes nature made selfe covered eke aloft bowes greene floures cure beauty may long endure assaut phebus fervent fere sphere hote shone clere ayre attempre smothe wind zepherus among blosomes white holsome nourishing kind smale buddes round blosomes lite maner gan brethe delite yeve v hope fruite shall take ayenst autumpne redy shake saw daphene closed vnder rinde greene laurer holsome pine mirre also wepeth ever kinde cedres hye vpright line filbert eke lowe doth encline bowes grene yearth adoun vnto knight called demophoun sawe eke fresh hauthorne white motley swote doth smell ashe firre oke many yong acorn many tree mo tell beforne sawe little well course gan beholde vnder hill quicke stremes colde gravel gold water pure glasse bankes round well environyng soft velvet yong grasse therevpon lustely came springyng sure tree compassyng shadow cast closing well round herbes growing ground water holsome vertuous might herbes growyng beside like welle narcisus slaine vengeaunce cupide covertly hide graiue death vpon eche brinke death mote folow ever drinke ne like pitte pegace vnder pernaso poetes slept like welle pure chastite diane nimphes kept naked water lepte slowe acteon hondes fell onely came nigh well welle rehearse holsome would aswage bollen hertes venim pearce pensifehed cruell rage refresh visage hem werinesse great labour fallen distresse daunger disdain drye thrust thought would assay taste draught welle twain bitter langour might alay banke anone doune lay mine hed vnto welle raught water dranke good draught wherof thought refreshed wele brennyng sate nigh hart verely anone gan fele huge parte released smart therewithall anone vp start thought would walke see forth parke holtes hore laund yede pace gan fast behold found anone delectable place belet tree young old who name shall told amidde stood herber greene benched colour new clene herber full floures gende beholde gan betwixt hulfeere woodbende ware saw lay man blacke white colour pale wan wonder deadly also hewe hurtes grene fresh woundes new overmore distrayned sicknesse beside full grevoussy vpon hore accesse day day shooke full pitously constrayning malady hertely wo thus lying alone death hear grone wherof astonied fote gan withdraw greatly wondring might lay felaw ne coud wight see wherof routhe eke pite gan anone softly coude among bush prively shroude might wise aspy cause deedly wo pitously gan cry fortune vre also might layd eare every word marke said swough amonge abraid bur first make mencion person plainely discrive sothe without excepcion speake manhood one best llve may man ayen trouth strive tyme age also proved men shuld ado one ye best therto bread length well ymade good proporcion deliver strength thought sicknesse occasion thus lay lamentacion gruffe ground place desolate sole himselfe awhaped amate seemeth fitting wordes put remembraunce heard complayning ground wofull chaunce withall may pleasaunce woll anone lyke sayd rehearce everichone shall helpe complain shall stile gy lede niobe let thy teeres rain penne helpe eke nede thou wofull myrre yt felest hert blede pitous wo mine hand eke quake write mannes sake vnto wo accordeth complayning dolefull chere vnto heavinesse sorow also sighing weping pitous mourning vnto drerinesse shall write distresse party needeth know feelingly cause roote soch malady ala witte dull knowing soch matere discrive write full wofull complaint yt ye shall even like doth skriuenere shall write maister beside doth endite right fare sentement say right naught conclusion herde present man complaine pitous soun even like without addicioun disencrease eyther lesse reherse anone woll dresse place fele love brenning fervence hindred lady grace false tonges pestilence slea trewe men neuer offence worde deed ne entent soch present let routh lay audience doleful chere sobre countenaunce man full hye sentence mortall wo perturbaunce complayning lying traunce lookes vpcast rufull chere theffect ye shall thought oppressed inward sigh sore painful life body languishing woful gost hert rent tore pitous chere pale complayning deedly face like ash shining salte teares mine eyen fall percel declare ground paynes whose hert ground blede heuinesse thought receit wo complaint brest chest dole drerinesse body eke feeble faint hote colde mine ax maint chiuer default heat hote glede sodainly sweat hote fire colde ash deed hote cold cold heat againe colde yse cole reed heate brenne thus betwixe twaine possed forecast paine heate plainly fele greeuous colde cause euery dele colde inward hie disdayn colde dispite colde cruell hate colde yt euer doth besie payn ayenst trouth fight debate colde fire abate trewe meaning ala harde colde woll begile euer better trouth ment might faithfully serue herte diligent lesse thanke ala deserue thus trouth danger sterue one death mercy let hath made dispite new swerde whet growes file take vengeaunce wilfull cruelte tonges false sleightly wile han gon werre stinted false enuie wrath enuite haue conspired right law malice trouth shall slaw male bouch gan first tale tell sclaunder trouth indignacion false reporte loude range bell misbeleefe false suspecion haue trouth brought dampnacion ala wrong fully dieth falsenesse place occupieth entred trouthes londe hath thereof full possession rightfull god first trouth fonde may thou suffre soch oppression falsheed haue jurisdiction trouthes right slee gyltles fraunchise may lyue pee falsly accused fone forjudged without answere absent damned may excused cruelte sate judgement hastinesse without aduisement badde disdaine execute anone judgement presence fone attourney may none admitted excuse trouth ne worde speke faith othe judge list seen gaine wreke lord trouth thee call clepe may thou see thus thy presence without mercy murdred innocence god art trouth soueraine seest lie trouth bound sore knit loues fyrie chaine euen death gyrte many wound likely neuer sound troutham dampned death abyde draw along breath consider see thine eternal right mine herte professed whilom trewe full might onely one ala volunte without trespas accusours hath taken vnto grace cherisheth hem death purchace meaneth wonder vre purueyaunce shall call god loue false hem assure trewe ala downe whele ben fall yet sothe worst falshed wrongfully troth hath name trouth yenward falshed beareth blame blind chaunce stormy auenture loue hath experience doth trouth cure shall mede finde offence serueth loue diligence fayne vnder lowlyhede ne fayleth finde grace spede loued one full long sith agone mine herte body full might deed herte gone heste hold hath hight though banished sight mouth dampned shall dey vnto hest yet euer obey euer sith world began liste looke story rede shall aye find trewe man put abacke whereas falshede yfurthered loue taketh none hede slea trew hath hem charge false goeth frely large take record palamydes trewe man noble worthy knight euer loued payne relees notwithstanding manhood might loue vnto full great vnright aye bet cheualrie hindred enuie aye better euery place knighthood busie payne ferder lady grace mercy might neuer attayne death coud refrayne daungere aye obey serue best coude plainly till sterue fine also hercules conquest worthinesse strength alone peerles like bookes list expresse set pillers hye prowesse away gades signifie man might passe cheualrie pillers ferre beyond inde set gold remembraunce set behinde hem loue list feebly auaunce set last vpon daunce helpe may strife trouth lost life phebus also pleasaunt light went yearth lowe vnto hert venus sight ywounded cupides bowe yet lady list knowe though loue herte blede let go toke hede shall say yonge piramus trewe tristram hye renowne achilles antonius arcite palomoune end passioune sorow death graue lo guerdon louers haue false iason doublenesse vntrewe colkos medee theseus roote vnkindnesse two eke false enee lo thus false aye one degree loue lust saue falshood none skill thebe eke false arcite demophon eke slouth lust might delite falshood great vntrouth thus euer loue ala routh false liege forthereth may sleeth trewe vngoodly day day trewe adon slaine bore amidde forest grene shade venus loue felt sore vulcanus mercy made foule chorle many night glade mar knight man find mercy comfort none also yonge freshe ipomedes lustly free corage serue hert ches athalant faire visage loue ala quite wage cruell daunger plainly last death guerd nlesse past lo fine loues seruice lo loue seruaunts quite lo faithfull men dispise slea trewe men false respite lo doth swerde sorow bite herts soch lust obey saue false trewe dey faith othe worde ne assuraunce trewe meaning awaite businesse still porte ne faithfull attendaunce manhood ne might armes worthinesse pursute worship hie prowesse straunge land riding ne trauaile full litell nought loue doth auaile perill death see ne land hunger ne thrust sorow ne sicknesse ne great emprises take hand sheding blood ne manfull hardinesse ne oft wounding saute distresse parting life death also nought loue taketh heed thereto lesings flatterie falshede doublenesse tale new many fained lie false semblaunt counterseit humblesse vnder colour depaint stedfastnesse fraud couered vnder pit u face accept rathest vnto grace himselfe best magnifie fained port presumption haunce cause false surquidrie vnder meaning double entention thinke one opinion say another set himselfe aloft hinder trouth scene full oft thing buy deare thanked venus god enpide seene mine oppressed cheare arrowes sticken side saue death nothing abide fro day day ala hard euer dart list file wofull hert riue atwo faut mercy lacke pite causeth paine wo list one grace see vnto trouth cruelte complaine hath joy laugh paine wilfully hath death sworne guiltlesse wote cause saue trouth aforne alone serue faithfully god loue vnto thee cry thy blind double deite great wrong complaine vnto thy stormy wilfull variaunce iment change great vnstablenesse vp renning thy chance thee trust may sikernesse wite nothing thy doublenesse archer blend marketh nothing shooteth wend hath discretion without aduise let arrow go lacke sight also reason shooting happeth oft hurt friend rather fo doth god sharpe flone trew sleeth letteth false gone wounding worst hurt doeth cruell wretch maketh licke cry call vnto soe leche hard man seche vpon point death jeoperdie vnto foe find remedie thus fareth euen foe gaue hert wound mote aske grace mercy pite namely none may found sore leche confound god kind hath set mine vre liues foe haue wound cure ala borne euer saw bright sonne see full long aforne borne desteny sponne parcas sisterne slea conne death shopen shert trouth may astert mighty goddesse also nature vnder god hath gouernaunce worldly thing committed cure disposed haue wise purueiance giue lady much suffisaunce vertues therewithall puruide murder trouth hath take danger gide bounte beaute shape seemelihede prudence wit passingly fairenesse benigne port glad chere lowlihede womanhede right plenteous largenesse nature fully empresse wrought alther last disdain hinder trouth made chamberlain mistrust also false suspection misbeleue made cheefe counsaile conclusion exile trouth eke pite court make mercy flee dispite holdeth forth rein hasty bileue tale men fein thus trouth ala murdred slain word sharp kene guiltlesse god wote trespas lie blede vpon cold grene mercy swete mercy liues quene grace mercy yet prey seruice man may dey shall die algate shall none mercy haue yet death let date wil broght graue hastely list saue sharpe wound ake blede mercy charme also womanhede charme plainly none mercy helpe case though wound bleed euer one life death standeth grace though guilt nothing ala aske mercy best entent ready die ye assent shall neuer striue word ne werke plainely ne may leuer haue aliue die soothly pay ye though day euer list deuise suffiseth die seruise god knowest thoght euery wight right euery thing thou maist see yet ere die full might lowly pray graunt vnto mee ye goodly faire fresh free onely slea defaut routh die ye may know trouth sooth sufficeth know euery circumstaunce well paid list death vengeaunce vnto vnder lygeaunce sit doome disobey lust wilfully dey without grutching rebellion word holy assent manner contradiction fully commaundement die testament herte send spirit also whatsoeuer list hem alderlast womanhede mercy recommaund lie betwixe hope drede abiding plainly list commaund utterly ni demaund welcome lasteth breath right choice life death matter might saine sith hand life death joy paine finally hest hold shall till spirit desteny fatall list fro body wend haue trouth thus make end word gan sigh sore like hert riue would atwaine held peace spake word see wo mortal paine teares gonne fro mine eyen raine full pitously inward roth saw long wishing troth selfe kepte close among bowes selfe gonne hide till last wofull man arose lodge went beside may custome tabide sole complaine paine kene yere yere bowes grene bicause drew night sunne arke diurnal ypassed persaunt light bright beames stream vvere waues water fall vnder bordure occian chaire gold course swiftly ran twilight rowes rede phebus light deaurat alite penne tooke gan fast spede wofull plaint man write word word endite like heard coud hem tho report haue set hertes disport ought misse lay wite worthy beare blame thing misse reported make ditie seeme lame mine unconning sain like manne complaint expresse aske mercy forgiuenesse wrote thought saw aferre ferre west lustely appere esperus goodly bright sterre glad faire persaunt eke chere mean venus beames clere heauy hertes releue wont custome shew eue fast fell adown knee euen thus gan prey lady venus faire upon see let man trouth dey joy thou haddest thou ley vvith mar thy knight vulcanus fond chaine unvisible bond togider tway court aboue celestiall shame gan laugh smile ah faire lady welly fond comfort carefull goddesse immartall helping thy diligence let streames thine influence descend downe forthering trouth namely hem lie sorrow bound shew thy miyt wo haue routh ere false daunger slea hem confound specially let thy might found couer thou may true man herber lay true forther sake glad sterre lady venus mine cause lady grace take herte stele mercy encline ere thy bemes go vp decline ere thou go fro u adoun loue thou haddest adoun gone rest rose anone home bed went weary thought best praying thus best entent trew daunger shent mercy may release paine recured ere may come este againe ne may lenger wake farewell ye louers trew praying god thus leue take ere sunne morrow risen new ere haue ayen rosen hew may haue grace owne lady armes embrace meane thus honesty without ye may togider speake ye list good liberty may heart breke ielousies onely wreke hath long mallice enuy werred trouth tiranny plenuoye princesse pleaseth benignitie little ditie haue mind womanhede also see man may mercy find pity eke long hath behind let againe provoked grace trouth kind false daunger occupy place go little quaire vnto life queene heart soueraine right glad shall thee seene thy grace ala paine left behind plaine mercy ruth grace eke pite exiled may attaine recure find mine adversite explicit praise woman altho thee list woman evill speak sain hem worse deserve pray god neckes break som evil death mote tho janglers sterve every man holden hem serve hem worship honour servise every manner best coud devise ought first think wt manere bring v forth wt pain endure first birth sith fro yere yere busely done busie cure keepe v fro every misaventure youth might selfe keepe neither day night ala may say hem wele fostred ybore ben succour ever true stele sake full oft suffer sore without woman joy lore wherfore ought woman obey goodnesse say wel knowne hath ben woman ben cause lightnesse knighthood norture eschuing mallis encrease worship worthinesse thereto curteis meke ground goodnesse glad merry true every wise gentill hert thinke devise though would trust vntruth faire word would aught assent good faith thinketh wer great ruth woman shuld gilt shent never knew ne wist nouyt entent ne list heare faire word ye write ye paine fro day day tendite may beware tale vntrue ye busily paint endite ye swere ye never knew ne saw woman neither much ne lite save ye delite serve ever ye sey love must ye need dey ye swere ye knew never love ne dredfull observaunce ye feele wound sore wherfore ye put governaunce love hath ordeind serve plesance wth al miyt litle life space endeth soone grace bed soone draw soone sicke ye faine swere fast lady hath slaw brought suddainly inso high paine yt fro death may man restraine daungerous looke eyen two death must ye need go thus ye morne thus ye sigh sore though hert anon two wold brest swere fast ye may live mine owne lady might ye lest bring mine hert somedele rest list mercy thus vntrouth ever mercy crave thus woll ye plain tho ye nothing smert innocent creature beguile swere hem wounded hert love ye may live scarsly long one might go mile hieth death bring end soverain lady list amend routh comfort wise pity false othes sere innocent weneth yt devise weneth heart may thus comfort somwhat chere woll janglers deme full ill saine ye fully lo ready tonges prest speake harme woman causelesse ala might ye well say best deme hem thus guiltlesse hert iwis gentilnesse gilt list thus woman fame trouth think ye blame woman cometh worldly wele wherfore ouyt worship hem evermore though mishap one ought hele false lore day night paine v evermore many oth woman beguile false tale many wicked wile falshede reckened told woman iwis full trouth men thousand fold fro vice iwis stand cleare thing could heare enticing men make hem flatteren connen never slake would fain wete euer ye coud without men tising wt woman amis forther ye may get hem ye lie fro yere yere many gabbing ye make hem iwis could neuer heare ne knowen ere euer ye coud findin place euer woman besought grace ye pain ful might heart businesse pleasen hem day night praying hem grace gentilnesse haue pitie upon great distresse yt wold paine haue routh slea sen ye meane trouth thus may ye see ben faultlesse innocent werkes slie craft touch falsenesse know hem ne may hem espie sweare ye ye must need die would womanhead vpon rew ere ye dead lady herts queene ye call hem therewith ye sighe sore say lady trow seene plite haue liued full yore hope ye woll paine suffer dwell goodnesse twis ye well lo painted processe ye make harmlesse creature beguile slepe ye paine wake bethinke many wicked wile ye shall see day ye shal curse ye busily entent hem beguile falshed neuer ment ye know wel though would lie woman trouth stedfastnesse good faith neuer hem sie much worship bountie gentilnesse right comming faire full mekenesse good glad lowly ensure goodly angellike creature hap man disease doeth businesse full paine al might comfort please fro disease might restraine word ne deed ywis woll faine might doth businesse bring heauinesse lo gentillesse woman haue could know rudenesse busie u keepe saue heale also sicknesse alway right sorrie distresse euery manner thus shew routh hem goodnesse trouth sith find hem gentilnesse trouth worship bountie kindnesse euermore let neuer gentillesse slouth kind trouth aught forlore woman hath ben full yore reuerence heauens queene ought worship woman yt beene creature yt euer wer get borne wote ye well woman best recouered blisse lorne woman shall come rest ben ysaued selfe lest wherefore thinketh grace oughten honour woman every place therefore rede liues end fro time forth yt haue space haue trespaced pursue amend praying ladie well grace bring u unto blisful place good woman shal fere heauen aboue among angel clere explicit house fame book shewed deed men woman good bad carried report posterity god tourne u euery dream good wonder thing rood wit causeth sweuens morrow euens effect followeth shal neuer come auision reuelation dreame sweuen euery man liche euen fantome oracle miracle cause know bet define certainely ne ran hem ne neuer thinke busie wit swinke know signification gendres ne distinction time hem ne cause yeue folkes complexion make hem dreame reflection else thus saine great feeblenesse brain abstinence sicknesse prison strife great distresse el disordinaunce natural accustomaunce men curious studie melancolius thus inly ful drede man may bote rede el deuotion contemplation causen dreames oft cruell life vnsoft hem loues leden oft hopen much dreden purely impression causen hem haue vision spirit han might make folke dreame night soule proper kind perfite men find wote come warneth eueriche auentures auisions figure flesh hath might vnderstand aright warned derkely cause wote well worth thing clerkes treaten werkes none opinion nill make mention holy rood tourne v euery dreame good neuer sith borne ne man el beforne mette trow stedfastly wonderfull dreame tenth day december remember woll tellen euerydele beginning trusteth wele woll make inuocation deuout speciall deuotion vnto god sleepe anone dwelleth caue stone vpon streame commeth fro lete flood hell vnswete beside fulke men clepe cimerie sleepeth aye god vnmerie slepie thousand sonnis alway sleepe wonne god rede pray woll spede sweuen tell aright euery dreame stand might mouer euer shall giue hem joy dreame yere stand grace hem leuest stond shield hem pouertie shond euery vnhappe disease send hem may hem please taketh well scorneth nought ne misdeme thought malicious entention presumption hate scorne enuie dispite yape fellonie misdeme pray iesus good dreame barefoot dreame shood euery harme man hath sith world began befall thereof sterue graunt may deserue lo right conclusion auision cresus king lide high vpon gibbet dide praier shall haue bette charite herken haue sayd mette abrayd december tenth day night slepe lay right wont done fell asleepe wonder sone weary forgo pilgrimage mile two corpes saint leonard maken lithe erst hard slept mette within temple ymade glas mo image gold standing sundry stage mo rich tabernacle perre mo pinacles mo curious portraiture queint manner figure gold worke saw euer certainly nist neuer well wist venus redely temple portreiture saw non right figure naked fleeting see also head parde rose garland white red combe kembe hed doues dan cupido blind sonne vulcano face full browne romed vp downe found wall thus written table bra woll sing armes also man first came destinie fugitife fro troy countrie itaile full much pine vnto stronds lauine tho began story anone shall tellen echone first saw destruction troy greeke sinon false vntrue forswearing chere lesings made horse brought troy troyans lost joy graued ala ilion castle assailed king priamus slaine polites sonne certaine dispitously dan pirrus next saw venus saw castle brend downe heauen gan discend bad sonne eneas flee fled escaped prees tooke father old anchises bare backe away cry ala welaway anchises hand bare tho god land thilke vnbrenned saw next fere crusa dan eneas wife loued life yong sonne iulo eke ascanius also fledden eke drerie chere pitie forrest went tourning went crusa ylost ala rede sought ghost bad flie greekes host said must itaile destinie sauns faile pitie heare spirit gan appeare word saied keepe sonne praied saw grauen eke father eke meine ship gan saile toward countrey itaile streight mighten go saw eke cruell iuno art dan iupiters wife hast yhated thy life troyan blood ren cry thou wood eolus god wind blowen kind loud drench lord lady groome wench troyans nation without saluation saw tempest arise euery hert might agrise see painted wall saw eke grauen withall venus ye lady dere weeping full wofull chere praying iupiter hie saue keepe nauie troyan eneas sith sonne saw ioues venus kisse graunted tempest lisse saw tempest stent pipe went p iuely tooke riuage countrey carthage morrow knight height achate metten venus day going queint array hunter esse wind blowing vpon tresse eneas began plaine knew paine ship dreint el ylost nist gan comfort tho bad cartage go folke find sea left behind shortly thing pace made eneas grace dido queene countre shortly tellen became loue let wedding longeth speake quaint paine word paint speake loue woll cannot faculte eke tellen manere first acquainted long processe tell ouer long dwell saw graue eneas told dido euery caas tidde vpon see est grauen made shortly word life loue lust lord reuerence laid dispence woman might wening swore hereby demed good seemed ala harme doth apparence false existence traitour wherefore slow selfe ala lo woman doth amis loue vnknowen christ lo thus fareth gold glareth also brouke well mine head may vnder goodlihead couered many shreud vice therefore wight nice take loue onely chere speech friendly manere shall euery woman find man pure kind woll shewen outward fairest till haue caught lest woll cause find swere vnkind false priuie double say eneas dido nice lest loued soone guest wherefore woll say prouerbe fully knoweth herbe may safely lay eie withouten drede lie let v speake eneas betraied ala left full vnkindly saw vtterly would trouth faile wenden itaile gan wring handes two ala qd wo ala euery man thus true euery yere woll haue new long time endure el three parauenture thus one woll haue fame magnifying owne name another friendship sayeth yet shall third taken delite lo el singular profite word gan complaine dido great paine mette dreaming readily none authour alledge woll ala qd sweet hart haue pitie sorrowes smart slea go away wofull dido welaway qd vnto selfe tho eneas woll ye loue ne bond ye swore right hond ne cruell death qd may hold still haue ye death pite iwis mine owne deare hert ye know full well neuer yet farre euer wit agilt thought ne dede haue ye men goodlihede speech neuer dele trouth ala euer routh woman false man see well tell wretched woman art certaine part thus serued euerichone sore ye men grone anon receiued certainly deceiued though loue lest season wait vpon conclusion eke ye determine part define welaway borne name lorne mine act redde song ouer land euery tong wicked fame ni nothing swift lo sooth euery thing wist though couerde mist eke though might duren euer haue done recouer neuer ne shall said ala shamed eneas shall thus judged lo right hath done woll done estsoones hardely thus say people priuely done ni done complaint ne mone certaine auailed stre wist soothly forth ship agone chamber went anone called suster anne gan complaine said cause first loued ala first counsailed thereto said roft seluen hart deide wound smart manner deide word seide know hath purpose rede virgile eneidos pistels ouide wrote dide nere long endite god would write welaway harme routh hath betide vntrouth men may oft bookes rede day seene yet dede thinken tene lo demophon duke athenis forswore falsely traied phillis wickedly king doughter thrace falsely gan tearme pace wist false hong selfe right halfe done vntrouth lo wo routh eke looke false recheles briseida achilles paris oenone iason hipsiphile eft iason medea hercules dianira left iolee made take death parde false eke theseus storie telleth v betraied adriane deuill soules bane laughed yloured must haue deuoured adriane ne pite made fro death escape made full false jape within left sleeping isle desart alone right see stale away let bee tooke suster phedra tho gan ship go yet sworne euer could swere saued life would taken wife desired nothing el certain booke v tels excuse eneas fulliche great trespas booke saith sauns faile god bad go itaile leauen affrickes regioun faire dido toun tho saw graue itaile dan eneas gan saile tempest began lost steresman sterne tooke keepe smote ouer bord sleepe also saugh sibile eneas beside isle hell went see father anchises free found palimurus also dido deiphebus eueriche tourment eke hell saw long tell paine list know must rede many row vergile claudian daunt tellen tho saw eke ariuaile eneas made itaile king latin treate battailes himselfe knight iwonne right turnus reft life wan lauina wife maruellous signal god celestials maugre iuno eneas sleight compas acheued auenture iupiter tooke cure prayer venus pray alway saue v v aye sorrowes light seene sight noble temple thus hey lord thought madest v yet saw neuer noblesse image richesse see grauen church nought wote hem worch ne ne countree gone see right wicket seene ought stering man may tellen dore came fast beheld saw large field farre euer might see without toune house tree bush grasse eared land field sand small men may see eye desart lybye ne manner creature yformed nature ne saw rede wisse christ thought blisse fanton illusion saue deuotion mine eyen heauen cast tho ware lo last fast sunne hye kenne might mine eye thought saw egle sore seemed much egle yseine sooth death certaine gold shone bright neuer saw men sight heauen ywonne new god another sonne shone egles fethers bright somewhat downward gan light explicit liber primus hearken euery manner man english vnderstand listeth dreame nowe erst shall ye lere sely dredefull vision say neither scipion ne king nabugodonosore pharao turnus ne alcanore ne metten dreame faire blisfull cipris fauour time ye tendite rime helpeth pernaso dwell beside elicon clere well thought wrote met tresorie set braine shall men see vertue thee bee tell dreame aright kithe thy engine thy might egle haue told feather shone gold high gan sore gan behold seene beauty wonder neuer dent thunder ne thing men call sendre smite sometime toure poudre swift comming brend swithe gan downward discend foule beheld roume field grim pawes strong within sharpe nailes long fleyng swappe hent sour againe vp went carying clawes starke lightly ben larke high cannot tellen came vp nist neuer astonied asweued euery vertue heued sour dread feeling gan dead great affray thus long clawes lay till last spake man voice said awake agast shame called tho name better abraid awake thus said right voice steuin useth one neuin voice sooth saine mind came goodly said na neuer wont herewithal gan stere foot bere till felt heat felt eke tho mine hart beat tho gan disport gentle wordes comfort said twice saint mary thou art noyous thing cary nothing needeth parde also wise god helpe thou harme shalt haue case betiddeth thee thy lore thy prow let see darst thou looke yet full ensured boldely thy friend therewith gan wonder mind god qd madest kind shall none otherwise die whether ioue stellifie thing may signifie neither enocke ne helie ne romulus ne ganimede bore men rede heauen dan iupiter made god buteler lo tho fantasie bare gan aspie thought said thou deemest thy selfe amis ioue thereabout dare thee put full doubt make thee yet sterre ere beare thee much ferre tell aud whider thou shalt came thou take good herte feare quake gladly qd well qd first foot haue thou hast feare wonder dwelling god thonder men callen iupiter doth flien full oft fer commaundement cause hath sent thee herke thy trouth certaine hath thee routh thou hast truely long serued ententifely blind new cupido faire venus also without guerdon euer yet nathelesse hast set thy wit although thy head full little make bookes song dities rime el cadence thou best canst reuerence loue seruaunts eke haue seruice sought aad seke painest thee praise art although thou haddest neuer part wherefore also god blesse iouis halt great humblesse vertue eke thou wilt make might full oft thine head ake thy study thou writest evermore loue enditest honour praisings folkes furtherings matter deuisest ne folke dispisest although thou maist go daunce hem list auaunce wherefore said ywis iupiter considreth well also beausire thing thou haste tidings loues folke glade ne nothing el god made onely fro ferre countree tidings commen thee thy neighbour dwellen almost thy dores thou hearest neither ne thy labour done hast made thy reckenings stead rest new thing thou goest home thine house anone also dombe stone thou sittest another booke till fully dased thy looke liuest thus hermite although thine abstinence lite therfore iouis grace beare thee place hight house fame sport game recompensation thy labour deuotion thou hast lo causelesse god cupido rechelesse thus god merite manner thing thee quite thou wilt good chere trust well thou shalt ben commen say mo wonder thing dare lay loues folke mo tidings soothsawes lesings mo loues new begon long serued till loue mo louers casuelly ben betide man wote blind man starteth hare jolite welfare find loue stele thinke men ouer wele mo discord mo iealousies mo murmures mo nouelries also mo dissimulation eke fained reparation mo berdes two hour without rasour sisours ymade graines sand eke mo holding mo hand also mo renouelaunces old forseten aqueintaunces mo loue day mo accord instrument ben cord eke loue mo exchaunges euer corne graunges vnneth maiest thou trowen qd helpe god wi qd qd impossible wit though fame pry realme aspies yet heare espien yes yes qd preue reason worthy leue thou giue thine aduertence understand sentence first shalt thou dwelleth right thine owne booke telleth palais standeth shall say right euen amiddes way betweene heauen earth see whatsoeuer three spoken priue apert way thereto ouert stant eke place euery sowne mote pace commeth tong rowned red song spoken suertie drede certaine mote thider nede hearken well tellen thee proper skill worthy demonstration mine imagination geffray thou wotest well euery kindely thing hath kindely stede may best conserued vnto place euery thing kindely enclining meueth come away therefro thus lo thou maist al day see take thing heauie bee stone lead thing weight beare neuer hie height let go thine hand falleth downe right say fire sowne smoke thing light alway seeke upward height light thing downward charge euerich hem large cause thou maist well see euery riuer unto see enclined go kind skilles find haue fish dwelling flood see tree eke earth thus euery thing reason hath proper mansion seeketh repaire nat appaire lo sentence knowne couth euery philosopher mouth aristotle dan platone clerkes many one confirme reasoun thou wost well speech soun el man might herke woll thee lere sowne eyre ybroken euery speech spoken loud priue foule faire substaunce aire flame lighted smoke right sowne eyre ybroke may many wise thee devise sowne commeth pipe harpe pipe blowen sharpe eyre twist violence rent lo sentence eke men harpe string smite wheder much lite lo stroke eyre breketh right breaketh men speketh thus wost thou well thing speach henceforth thee teach euerich speech voice soun multiplicatioun though piped mouse mote need come fame house proue thus take heed experience thou threw water stone well wost thou make anone little roundell cercle parauenture broad couercle right anone thou shalt see wele whele cercle wil cause another whele third forth brother euery cercle causing broader himselfe thus roundell compas ech going causeth others stering multiplying euermo till farre go brinkes bee although thou may see aboue yet gothe alway though thou thinke great wonder saith trouth vary bid proue contrary right thus euery word iwis loud priuie yspoken moueth first eyre mouing dout another eyre anone moued haue water proued euery cercle causeth right eyre leue brother euerich eyre stereth speech vp beareth voice noise word soun aye multiplicatioun till house fame take earnest game told thou haue mind speech sowne pure kind enclined upward meue maiest thou fele well preue stede iwis euery thing enclined hath kindliche stede sheweth without drede kindely mansioun euerich speeche euery soun either foule faire hath kind place aire sith euery thing iwis kind place iwis moueth thider go away therefro haue proued thee sheweth euery soune parde moueth kindely pace kind place place tell fame list dwell sette amiddes three heauen earth eke see conseruatife soun conclusion euery speech euery man thee tell first began moueth vp height pace kindly fame place tell faithfully haue proued thus simply without subtelte speech great prolixite termes philosophy figure poetry colour rhetorike perde ought thee like hard language hard matere incombrous one wost thou well answered said yes ah ah qd lo leudly unto leud man speke shew skilles may shake hem billes palpable shoulden tel pray thee thinketh thee conclusioun good persuasion qd lyke right thou hast proued god qd leue thou shalt haue eue euery word sentence profe experience thyne eares hearen well toppe tayle eueridell euery word spoken commeth fame house ywis haue said wilt thou word upper sore began said saint iame speake game farest thou qd well qd see qd thy trouth yond adowne thou knowest towne house thing thou hast ought knowing looke thou warne anon shall tell thee farre thou art therefro adowne gan loken tho beheld field plaines hils mountaines valeis forest unneth great beests riuers citees townes great tree shippes sayling see thus soone hee flowen fro ground hye world mine eye semed pricke el eyre thicke might discerne spake yerne said seest thou token ought world spoken said nay wonder qd neuer halfe hye na alexander macedon king ne rome dan scipion saw dreame point deuise heauen earth helf paradise ne eke wretch dedalus ne childe nice icharus flewe hie hete wyngs molte fell wete midde sea dreint made great complaint tourne upward qd thy face behold large place eyre looke thou ne bee adrad hem thou shalt see regioun certayne dwelleth many citezeine speaketh dan plato ben eyrishe beests lo tho sawe menie gone also flie lo qd cast thyne eye see yonder lo galaxie men clepe milky way white parfay callen watling streete one brent hete sunnes sonne rede hight pheton would lede algate father cart gie cart horse gan well aspie coud gouernaunce gan leape praunce beare doun till saw scorpioun heauen signe yet fere lost wit let reynes gone horse anone soone mount downe discende till bothe eyre earth brende till iupiter lo last slew fro carte cast lo great mischaunce let foole haue gouernaunce thing demaine word sothe saine gan alway upper sore gladded faithfully spake tho gan looke beheld eyrish beests cloudes mistes tempest snowes hayles raynes windes thengendring kindes way came god qd made adame moch thy might noble tho thought upon boece writeth thought may flie hie fethers philosophy passen euerich element hath far ywent may seen behind backe cloude earth yt spake tho gan wexe said wote well whether body goost ywis god thou woost clere entendement na neuer yet ysent thought marcian eke anticlaudian sothe descripcion heauens region far saw preve therefore hem leue egle gan cry let qd thy fantasie wilt thou learne sterres ought nay certainly qd right nought qd old el would thee haue told qd sterres name lo heauens sign force qd yes parde qd wost thou thou redest poetry goddes stellify birde fishe rauin ariones harpe fine cassor polexe delphine athalantes doughters seuen set heuen though thou haue hem ofte hand yet nost thou nat stand force qd need well leue god speed hem writen matere though knew place eke semen bright shenden sight looke hem may well qd forth hare tho gan cry neuer herde thing hie hold thine heed well saint iulian lo bonue hostell see house fame lo mayst thou qd great sowne qd rombleth downe fame house full tidings fayre speech chiding false sothe compouned herken well rowned herest thou great swough yes perde qd wel ynough sowne like qd peter lyke beating see qd roches halow tempest done shippes swalow man stand doute myle then route el lyke humbling clappe thuisoring iouis hath eyre ybete doth feare swete nay drede thee thereof qd nothing byten thee thou shalt haue harme truely worde nigh place arrived men might cast spere niste strete set faire feete said walke forth pace tell thine aduenture case thou shalt finde fame place qd haue space speake go fro thee loue god tell sothe thee lere noyse haue herde thee tell folke done earth dwell commeth wise thee herd deuise liues body ni house yonder maketh loude fare qd saint clare also wisse god rede thing warne thee thou wilt haue wonder lo house fame yonder thou woste commeth euery speach needeth efte reach understand right well speach ycomen vp palais anone right wexeth like wight worde earth spake clothed reed blake hath likenesse spake worde thou wilt gesse body man woman wonder thing yes qd tho heauen king worde farewell qd abide thee god heauen send thee grace good learne place tooke leaue anone gan forth palays gone explicit liber secundus god science light apollo thy great might littell last booke thou gie maistrie art potenciall shewde rime light lewde yet make somewhat agreable though verse fayle sillable diligence shewe craft sentence deuine vertue thou wilt helpe shewe heed ymarked lo meanen house fame discriue thou shalt see go bliue vnto next laurer see kisse thy tree entre brest anone egle gone gan behold vpon place certaine passe woll shappe deuise house citee wise gan place approch stood vpon hie roch hyer standeth none spayne vp clambe moch payne though climbe greued mee yet ententife see poren wondre low coude wise yknow maner stone roche lyke limed glas shone full clere congeled matere niste redely last espied found euerydele roche yse stele thought saint thomas kent feeble foundement builden place hie ought little glorifie hereon bilte god saue tho sawe hall ygraue famous folkes name fele moch wele fame wide yblow well vnneth might know letter rede name drede almost thawed letter one two molte away euery name vnfamous wexe fame men say may euer last tho gan mine hert cast molte away heate away stormes beate side sey hill northward ley written full name folke afore great fame old time yet fresh men written hem self day houre hem gan poure well wiste made conserued shade writing sie castell stoode hie stoode eke cold place heate might deface tho gan hill gone found coppe wone men liue ne han conning discriue beaute ilke place ne coud caste compace soch another make might beauty make ne wonderly rought astonieth yet thought maketh witte swinke castell thinke great beautie caste crafte curiositie ne deuise witte ne may suffise nathelesse substaunce haue yet remembraunce thought saint gile stone berile castell toure eke hall euery boure without peeces joynings many subtell compassings babeuries pinnacle imagery tabernacle saw full eke windowes flake fallen great snowes eke pinnacle sundry habitacles stooden withouten full castle abouten manner min rale iestours tellen tale weeping game longeth vnto fame heard play harpe souned well sharpe orpheus full craftely side fast sat harper orion gacides chirion harper many one briton glaskirion smale harper glee sate vnder hem diuers see gone hem vpward gape counterfeited hem ape craft counterfeit kind tho saw standen hem behind farre hem hemselue many thousand time twelue made loud minstralcies cornmuse shalmies many another pipe craftely began pipe douced rede ben feast brede many floite litling horne pipe made greene corne haue little heard gromes keepen beast brome saw dan citherus athene dan proserus mercia lost skinne face body chinne would enuien lo pipen bette apollo saw eke famous old yong piper dutch tong learne loue daunces spring reyes straunge thing tho saw another place standing large space hem maken bloody soun trumpe beme clarioun fight bloodsheddings vsed gladly clarionings heard trumpe messenus speaketh vergilius heard ioab trumpe also theodomas mo vsed clarion casteloigne aragon time famous learnen saw trumpen saw sit see playing vpon sundry glee cannot neuen mo sterres ben heuen nill rime ease losse time time ylost know ye way may recouered saw p aying iogelours magiciens tragetours phetonisses charmeresses old witch sorceress vsen exorsisations eke subfumigations clerkes eke conne well magicke naturell craftely doe entents maken certaine ascendent image lo magike maken man ben hole sike saw queene medea
