circe eke caliophia saw hermes ballenus limote eke simon magus saw knew name art done men haue fame saw coll tragetour vpon table sicamour play vncouth thing tell saw carry wind mell vnder walnote shale make lenger tale people sey could tell till domisdey folke behold found loose hold amused long vpon wall berile shone lighter glas made well kind thing fame anone gan forth roman till fond castell yate right hond well coruen neuer another na yet auenture ywrought great subtill cure needeth tellen make long dwellen yates florishings ne compaces ne karuings ne hacking masonry corbets imagery lord faire shewe gold behewe went anone met cry many one large large hold vp well god saue lady pell owne gentill lady fame hem willen haue name v thus heard crien fast commen hall shoke noble starling crowned king crownes wrought full losinges many ribans many fringe clothes truely tho last espied purseuauntes heraudes crien riche folkes laudes euery man hem tell throwe vesture men clepe coate armure embroudred wonderly riche though yliche nought mote thriue discriue armes thus coates impossible men might make hem bible twenty foote thicke trowe certain coud know might armes seen famous folke affrike europe asie sith first began cheualrie lo tell ne hall eke need tellen euery wall rofe flore plated halfe foote thicke golde na wicke proue wise fine ducket venise lite pouche set thicke ouches fine finest stone fayre men reden lapidaire grass growen mede long rede name therefore pace lustie riche place fame hall called full moch prees folke na ne crouding moch prees hie aboue dees satte see imperiall made rubie royall carbuncle ycalled sawe perpetually ystalled feminine creature neuer formed nature soch another thing saie alther first soth saie thought lite length cubite lenger seemed thus soone self tho wonderly streight foot therthe reight hedde touched heauen shineth sterres seuen thereto yet wit saw great wonder yet vpon iyen behold certainly hem neuer told fele iyen fethers vpon foules beast foure goddes trone honour writeth iohn apocalips heer owndie crips burned gold shone see sothe tellen also shee also fele vp standing eares tonges beast heares feete woxen sawe partriche winges redily lord perrie richesse saw sitting goddesse heauenly melodie songes full armonie heard trone ysong palais wall rong song mighty muse cleped caliope seuen sisterne eke face seemen meke euermore eternally song fame tho heard heried thou thy name goddes renoun fame tho ware last mine iyen gan vp cast ilke noble queene shoulder gan sustene armes name tho large fame alisander hercules sherte life lese thus found sitting goddesse noble honour richesse stinte thing tellen tho saw stande thother side streight doune doores wide dees many pillere metall shone full clere though richesse yet made great noblesse hem great sentence folke hie digne reuerence tell fonde vpon piller sawe stonde alder first sie vpon piller stonde hie lede iron fine secte saturnine ebraike iosephus old iewes gestes told bare shulders hie fame vp iurie stoden seuen wise worthy neuen helpen beare vp charge heauy large written battayles well maruayles therefore lo pillere tell leade iron iwis iron martes metall god battayle leade withouten fayle lo metall saturne hath full large whele turne stand forth either rowe hem could knowe though order hem tell make long dwell gan rede saw stand drede vpon iron piller strong painted endlong tigres blood euery place tholason height stace bare thebe vp name vpon shoulder fame also cruell achilles stode withouten lee full wonder hie vpon piller iron great omer dare titus eke lollius guido eke colempnis english galfride eke iwis ech haue joy busie heare vp troy heavy thereof fame beare game yet gan full well espie betwene hem little enuie one said omer made lie feyning poetry greekes fauourable therefore held fable tho saw stand pillere tinned iron clere latine poete virgile hath bore vp long fame pius eneas next piller copper venus clerke duide hath sowen wondrous wide great god loues fame bare vp well name vpon piller also hie might see mine iye hall whereof rede woxe height length brede well thousand deale erst saw weale tho saw piller iron wrought full sternely great poet dan lucan shoulder bare vp hie might see fame iulius pompee stoden clerkes write rome mighty werkes would name tell long must dwell next piller stood sulphure liche wood dan claudian sothe tell bare vp fame hell pluto proserpine queene derke pine tell hall full iwis hem written old jestes tree rokes nestes full confuse mattere jestes write hight beheld sight herde noise approchen bliue fareth bee done hiue ayenst time flying right soch maner murmuring world seemed mee tho gan looke see come entring hall right great company withall sondry region kind condicions dwell yearth vnder moone poore riche soone come hall gan knee doune fall ilke noble queene said graunt v lady sheene eche v thy grace bone hem graunted sone warned well faire graunted contraire asking vtterly say truely grace nist folke full well wist good fame eche deserued although diuersly serued right sister dame fortune wont serue commune herken gan pay hem gan grace pray yet lo companie saiden soth lie madame said bee folke besechen thee thou graunt v good fame let workes haue good name full recompensacioun good worke giue v good renoun warne qd anone ye get good fame none god therefore go way ala qd welaway tell v cause may list qd wight shall speake iwis good ne harme ne ne worde gan call messenger hall bad faste gone vpon paine blind anone eolus god winde trace ye shall finde bid bring clarioun full diuers soun cleped cleare laude wont heraude hem list ypraised bee also bid hee bring eke clarioun height sclaunder euery toun wont diffame hem list doe hem shame messenger gan fast gone found caue stone countree height trace eolus harde grace helde windes distresse gan hem vnder presse gone beres rore bound pressed hem sore messenger gan fast crie rise vp qd fast thee hie till thou lady bee take thy clarious eke thee speed thee fast anone tooke one hight tritone clarion bearen tho let certaine winde go blewe hidously hie ne left skie welken long brode eolus brode till come fame feete eke man triton heete stode still stone herewithall came anone another huge companie good folke gan crie lady graunt v good fame let workes haue name honour gentilnesse also god soule blesse han well deserued therefore right quit thriue qd ye shall fayle good workes shall auayle haue good fame wote ye graunt ye shall haue shrewd name wicked loo worse fame though ye good loo haue well deserued goeth way serued thou dan eolus qd take forth thy trumpe anone let see ycleped sclaunder light blow loo euery wight speake hem harme shreudnesse stede good worthinesse thou shalt trumpe contraire haue done well faire ala thought auentures haue sory creature among pres thus shamed giltles must needes eolus tooke blacke trumpe bra fouler deuill gan trompe blow world ouerthrow throughout euery regioun went foule trumpes soun swifte pellet gonne fire pouder ronne soch smoke gan wende foule trumpes ende blacke blue grenishe swartish rede doth men melte lede lo hie tewell thereto one thing saw well ferther ranne greater wexen beganne doth riuer well stanke pitte hell ala thus shame yrong giltlesse euery tong tho came third companie gone vp dees hie doune knee fell anone saiden euerichone folke han full truely deserued fame rightfully prayed might know right forth blow graunt qd list good workes shall wist yet ye shall haue better loo right dispite foos worthy anone let qd thy trumpe gone thou eolus blacke thine trumpe take hight laude blow world fame go easely fast knowen last full gladly lady mine saied trumpe gold braied anone set mouth blewe east west south north loude thonder euery wight hath wonder brode ran stent certes breath went trumpes mouth smelde men potte full baume helde among basket full rose fauour loses right gan espie came fowerth companie certaine wonder fewe gonne standen rewe saiden certes lady bright haue done well might ne keepe haue fame hide workes name goddes loue certes wee haue surely done bountee manner thing graunt asking qd let workes dedde tourned hedde sawe anone fifth rout lady gan lout doune knee anone fall tho besoughten hiden good workes eke said yeue leke fame ne soch renoun contemplacioun goddes loue wrought ne fame would nought qd ye wood wene ye good haue fame haue ye dispite haue name nay ye shall lien euerichone blowe thy trumpe anone qd thou eolus hote ring folkes workes note world may heare gan blowe loo cleare golden clarioun worlde went soun also kindly eke soft fame blowe aloft tho came sixt companie gan fast fame crie right verely manere saiden mercy lady dere tell certain haue done neither ne idell life hath nathelesse yet pray may haue good fame great renome knowen name haue noble jestes acheued questes well loue thing v neuer broche ne ring ne el fro woman sent ne one hert yment maken v onely frendly chere mought temen v bere yet let v people seeme soch world may v deeme woman louen v wood shall u moch good harte moch auaile counterpeise ease trauaile labour dere bought honour regard great ease yet ye must u please let u hold eke therto worthy wise good also rich happy vnto loue goddes loue sitteth aboue though may body haue woman yet god saue let men glewe v name suffiseth fame graunt qd trouth eolius withouten slouth take thy trumpe gold qd blowe haue asked euery man wene hem ease though go full badde lease eolusgan blowe world know tho came seuenth route anone fill knee euerichone sayed lady graunt v soone thing boone nexte folke haue done fie qd euerichone ye mastie swine ye idle wretch full rotten slow tetches false theeues ye wold famed good nothing nold deserue ne neuer thought men rather hangen ought ye like slepie cat would haue fish wost thou woll nothing weate clawes euil thrifte come iawes myne graunt fauour auaunt eolus thou kyng thrace go blowe folke sorie grace qd anone wost thou shall tell thee right say ben would honour haue kin labour ne good yet haue laude men wende belle saude ne coude hem loue werne yet grint querne good ease herte eolus anone vp sterte blacke clarioun gan blasen soun loude belleth winde hell eke therewith sothe tell sowne full iapes euer mowes ape went world euery wight gan hem shout laugh wood soch game found hood tho came another company ydone trechery harme great wickednesse herte couden gesse prayed haue good fame nolde hem shame giue hem loo good renoun blowe clarioun nay wi qd vice al b iustice st ne nill graunt tho came leaping rout gan clappen euery man vpon crowne hall gan sowne said lady lefe dere ben soch folkes ye may tell tale aright hen shrewes every wight haue delite wickednesse good folke haue goodnesse ioy knowen shrewes full vice wicked thewes wherefore pray rowe fame soch yknow thing right graunt qd ywis art thou saiest tale wearest thy hose pale thy tippet soch bell madame qd sothe tell ilke shrewe iwis brent temple isidis athene lo citee wherefore diddest thou qd trouth qd madame wolde faine haue name folke towne although great renowne vertue thewes thought great fame haue shrewes though nought shrewdnesse good folke haue goodnesse sithen may haue one nyll forgone get fame temple set fire done loo blowe swithe wisely thou euer blithe gladly qd thou eolus here thou prayen v madame yes full well qd trumpen parde tooke blacke trumpe fast gan puffen blast till world end gan wend one stode right backe thought full goodly spake said frende thy name arte thou come hider haue fame nay forsothe frende qd come hither graunt mercy soch cause heed suffiseth deed wight haue name honde wot selfe best stonde drie thinke woll selfe drinke certaine part ferforth mine art dost thou qd qd woll tell thee cause stand new tidings lere new thing tidings eyther loue thing glade certainely made come hyder said mee sholde bothe heare see place wonde thing soch tidings meant qd answerde parde well wote euer yet sith first wit folke han desired fame diuersly loo name certainly nist ne fame dwelled ne eke descripcion ne also condicion ne order dome knew till hider come lo tidings thou hether brings thou hast herde qd mee force well see thou desirest lere come forth stande lenger woll thee without drede soch another place lede thou shalt many one tho gan forth gone castell sothe sey tho sawe stand valey vnder castell fast house domus dedali laborintus ycleped na made wonderly ywis ne halfe queintly ywrought euermo swift thought queint house went neuermo still stent came great noyse stonde upon dyse men might haue heard easily rome trowe sikerly noise herde world right ferde doth routing stone fro thengin letyn gone house rede made twigges salow rede green eke white men cage twhite maken paniers el hutch dosser swough twigges house also full gigges also full eke chickinges many werkings eke house hath entree many leues ben tree sommer greene rofe yet men may seene thousand hole wel mo letten sowne go day euery tide bene dores open wide night eche one unshet ne porter none let maner tidings pace ne neuer rest place ni filled full tidings eyther loude whispering euer house angle ful rownings iangles werres peace mariages restes labour viages abode death lyfe loue hate accord strife losse lore winning heale sicknesse lesings faire wether eke tempest qualme folke beests diuers transmutacions estate eke region trust drede iasousie witte winning folie plenty great famine chepe derth ruine good misgouernement fire diuers accident lo house write syker ye na lite sixtie myle length al tymber strength yet founded endure lift auenture mother tidings sea welles spring shapen lyke cage certes qd mine age ne saw soch house wondred ywis vpon house tho ware mine egle fast perched hie upon stone gan streight gone said thus pray thee thou abide mee goddes loue let seene wonder place bene yet paraunter may lere good therein somewhat lefe went peter mine entent qd therefore dwell certaine one thing thee tell bryng thee therin ne shall thou neuer conne gin come doubt faste whirleth lo sith ioues grace haue said solace finally thing vncouth sighes tidings passe thine euinesse soch routh hath thy distresse thou suffredest debonairly woste seluen vtterly desperate blisse sith fortune hath made misse swete thine hertes rest languish eke poynt brest mighty melite wil thee ease al lite gaue expresse commaundement obedient fo ther thee might wish teach thee aright thou maist tidings thou shalt many one lere word right anone hent bytwene tone window brought house thought therewithall thought stent nothing went set floore adoun great congregacioun folke sawe rome within without na neuer seene ne shall efte certes world ni lefte many formed nature ne need many creature wel vnneth place foote brede space euery wight sawe rowned euerich others cere new tiding priuely el told openly right thus said nost nat thou betidde lo right qd tell told swore thereto soth thus hath said thus doth shal thus herde say shal found dare lay folke liue ne haue conning discriue tho thinges herde loude eere wonder one herd thing ywis came streight another wight gan tellen anon right told forlong way old gan somewhat eche tiding speche euer spoken nat sone departed na tho fro ne mette third erhe sette stound told hym alse tidings sothe false yet wold tell natheles euermore mo encrees erst thus north south went euery tiding fro mouth mouth encreasing euermo fire wont quicken go sparcle sprongen amis till citie brent vp full vp sprong waxen euery tonge euer went anone vp window gone might passe gan crepe creuasse flewe forth fast none sometime saw one leasing sadde sothe sawe gonnen auenture drawe window pace metten place achecked two neyther might go ech gonne croude till ech hem gan crien loude let gone first nay let mee woll ensuren thee vowes thou wolt shall neuer fro thee go thine owne sworne brother woll meddle v eche man neuer wrothe shall haue one two bothe one beside leue come morowe eue cryde still yrowned thus saw salfe soth compowned togider flie tiding thus hole gonne wring euery ridyng streight fame gan yeue eche name disposicion yeue hem eke duracion wexe wane soone doth faire white moone let hem gonne might seen winged wonder fast flien twenty thousand route eolus hem blewe aboute lord house time full shipmen pilgrimes scrippes brette full leasings entermelled tidings eke alone hem selue many thousand time twelue saw eke paadoners currours eke messaungers box crommed full lie euer vessell lie alther fastest went mine entent playen lere eke tiding herde countree shall told mee need redely folke sing bet al mote late rathe sheues fathe herde great noise withall corner hall men loue tidings told gan thitherward behold saw renning euery wight fast hadden might everich cride thing said neuer hepe tho behind gonne lepe clamben faste noyse highen caste treden fast others heles stampe men done eles last saw man nought ne seemed man great auctorite therewithall abraide slepe halfe afraide remembring well sene hie ferre bene goost great wonder god thonder let knowen began write like ye herd endite wherefore study rede alway purpose day day thus dreaming game endeth litell booke fame phere endeth booke fame prologue testament love many men eres openly sprad moch swalowen deliciousnesse iestes ryme queint knitting coloures goodnesse badnesse sentence take litle hede el none sothely dull witte thoughtful soule sore haue mined graffed spirites soch craft enditing woll nat acquaintaunce rude wordes boistous percen hart herer intest point planten sentence thinges littel helpe able spring booke nothing hath great flood witte ne semeliche colour doluen rude wordes boistous drawe togider maken catcher therof ben ready hent sentence men painten colour rich vers red inke cole chalke yet good matter leude people thilke chalkie purtreyture hem thinketh time afterward sight better colour yeuen hem joye first leudnesse soothly leude clowdy occupation praise leud commenly leude leudnesse commendeth eke shall yeue sight precious thing shall reuerence latin french hath many soueraine wit great delite endite haue many noble thing fulfilde certes speaken poisie mater french speche french men haue good fantasie haue hearing french men english many term ben english unneth english men connen declare knowledging french man borne termes conne iumpere matter iay chatereth english right truly understanding english men wol stretch priuie termes frenche euer bosten straunge langage let clerk enditen latin haue propertie science knowing facultie lette frenchman french also enditen queint termes kindely mouthes let u shewe fantasy wordes learneden dame tongue although booke little thanke worthy leudnesse trauaile yet writing exciten men thilk thing necessary euery man thereby may perpetual mirrour seene vice vertues thing lightly may conceiued escheue peril necessary catch auentures haue fallen people person certes soueraignst thing desire creature reasonable haue el haue full appetite perfection unreasonable beast mowen sith reason hath hem working reasonable woll comparisoned unreasonable made like hem forsooth soueraigne finall perfection man knowing sooth withouten entent deceiuable loue one god inchaungeable know loue creator nowe principally meane bring knowledging louing creatour consideration thing made ye creatour thilke thynges beene made understanding wit arne unseen priueties god made u sightfull knowing contemplation understonding thing forsooth much bringen u ye full knowledging sooth yt parfite loue maker heuenly thing lo dauid faith thou hast delited making saith haue delite tune god hath lent consideration thy making whereof aristotle booke de animalibus sayth naturel philosopher great liking loue knowing creatour also knowing cause kindely thing considered forsooth formes kindely thynges shape great kindely loue haue werkemen hem made crafte werkeman shewed werke herefore truely philosopher liuely studye many noble thing right precious worthie memorie written great swete trauaile u leften cause property nature thing therefore philosopher joy lyking heartie lust kindely vertues matter reason perfection busie studie know haue treasour richesse vaineglory passed emperours prince king hadden therfore name hem booke perpetuall memorie vertue peace arne written ye contrary sayne styxe foule pitte hell arne thilke pressed goodnesse hated booke shall loue prime cause stering passion disease wanting desire booke cleaped testament loue thou reader thilke scorne laugh heare dwarfe el halfe man say wil rend swerd hercules handes also hee set hercules gades mile yet ferther hee power strength pull speare alisander noble might never wagge passing thing mayster fraunce might ye noble gracious edward third great prowesse victory ne might yet conquere certes wote well shall made scorne iape unworthely clothed togither ye cloudie cloude vnconning putten prees speke loue el ye cause yt matter sithen greatest clerkes han ynough done laith gathered cleane toforne hem sharpe sithes conning mowen made great rekes noble full plenty feed many another enuy forsooth commendeth nought reason hath haine neuer trustie although noble reaper good workman worthy hire han draw bound vp sheues made many shockes yet haue ensample gader small crums fullin wallet tho fallen bourde among small hound notwithstanding trauaile almoigner yt hath drawe vp cloth ye remissailes trenchours releefe beare almesse yet also haue leaue yt noble husband boece although stranger conning come doctrine great worke men gleane handful shedding hand faile ought full encrease portion yt shall draw priuities shockes slye seruaunt owne helpe often muche commended knowyng trouth cause thyngs hardier first seechers sayth aristotle lighter u han followed passing study han freshed wit vnderstanding han excited consideration trouth sharpnesse reason vtterly thynges dreames ne yapes throwe hogges lifelyche meate child trouth betiden pilgrimaged kithe winter weather measure boistous wylde winde boreas kinde asketh drying cold maked wawes decian sea arise vnkindely ouer commune bankes point spill earth pthus endeth prologue hereafter followeth first booke testament loue testament love book imitation boetius de consolatione philosophiae first part whereof love way legacy doth bequeath follow lore knowledge truth errour whereby may rightly judge cause cross fortune adversity befall whether suit love otherwise end obtain wished desire second part reacheth knowledge one god creatour also state grace state glory good thing figured margarite pearl chaucer compile book comfort great grief conceived rash attempt common joyned thereby fear lose favour best friend also therein set end writing commanded venus appeareth gower end eighth book entituled confessio amantis one venus clerk even gower made confessio amantis last work shrift former offence ala fortune ala sometyme delicious houres wont enioy blisfull stoundes driue vnhappy heauinesse bewaile sundry euils tene truly leue mine herte writte perdurable letter ententions lamentation ynempned manner disease outward sobbyng manner weth sorowfull yexing within thus comforte ginne spill sith sollace ferre fro presence certes absence hell steruyng death thus wo myneth endelesse care throughout mine heart clenched blisse ioy oft murthed tourned gall thinke thing may armes hent mirth chaunged tene swinke ther continually rest wont soiourne haue dwelling place thus witlesse thoughtfull sightlesse looking endure pennaunce dark prison caitisned fro friendship acquaintaunce forsaken worde dare speake straunge hath way intrusion made home reason heard neuer later yet heartely ladye precyous margarite haue mind thy seruaunt thinke disease lightlesse liueth sithe beames brennende loue thyne eyen arne bewet worldes cloud atweene v twey wol suffer thought hem enlumined thinke one vertue margarite precious amongs many sorrowful comfort yet sorrowful comfort luste haue nought el time deede ne death ne manner trauyle hath power myne heart much fade heare twinckling disease ah god forbede yet let dey let sterue withouten measure pennaunce rather myne hartely thinking comfort ought diseased may seruice aueile absence seruice accept nat endlesse sorrow thinke yes yes god wote mine heart breaketh nigh asunder howe ground without kindely noriture bringen forth fruit howe shippe withouten sterne great sea gouerned withouten blisse heart desire ioy goodnesse endure contrarious prison yt thinke euery houre day hundred winter well may eue sayne adam sorrow fallen wealth driuen art thou paradise sweate thy sustenaunce beswinke deepe pining pitte wo ligge ystocked chaynes linked care tene high thence lie common yearth ne cable land maked might stretch draw blisse ne steyers steye none yt without recouer endlesse endure wote well purueide art thou friendship sometime laughande chere madest face countenaunce wardes truely nowe art thou went towne euer thinketh weareth old clothes soule life friendship drawne spirit farewell friendship farewell felawes thinketh ye han taken eaue force one lady loue ye wote meane yet thinke thy seruaunt thy loue spilleth thyngs haue forsake follow en thyne hestes reward wyth thought though ye doe naught el remembraunce loue lithe sore vnder breast yt thought commeth mynd gladnesse thinke goodnesse merry cheare frendes sorrow thinke wretch daunger whych christ saue great ioy haue meditation bounty vertues nobley printed sorrow hell commen one suppose veined thus care sorrow tene shapt meyne end death make good goodly thinke wretched foole fallen lowe heate brenning tene hathe defaced ye lady set prise foule filth conning thin witte exiled like foole naturell comparisoned truely lady mercie wote well labour idle mercie passeth right god graunt yt proposition verified trust good hope mow come hauen ease sith impossible colour quality chaunge forsooth wote well wemme ne spotte may abide noble vertue haboundeth defacing verily imaginable countenance goodnesse encresing vertue knit abide necessary manner yet riuers might fall ayenst kind wote well mine herte ne therfore naught flit ye least point geometrie sadly fonded yt away seruice loue may depart loue shall pleased charitie shall leased good goodly shall dice tourne full vertue doe chaunce comfort vpward fall loue wolt thou think thy seruaunt outcast al welfare abide day death el see sight might welling sorrowes voide flood make ebb disease mowen well duresse sorrow make life unbodie die certes ye ladie full perfection loue knitte soule death maye thilke knotte unbinde ne depart ye saule together endelesse blisse dwell shall soule full eased may haue presence shew entent desire ah dear god shall great joy nowe yearthly goddesse take regarde thy seruaunt though feeble thou art wont prayse better would conserue loue full meaner king prince woll haue vertue mind precious margarite thy noble vertue hall drawne loue firste wenyng thereof haue blisse galle aloe muche sprong sauour sweetnesse may atast ala benigne eyen mercie seemeth haue noriture nill way tourne clearenesse mercie mee ward ala brennande vertues shinyng amonges folke enluminyng people haboundance encreasing sheweth smoake light thynges thinke mine heart maketh euerye daye weepyng myne eyen renne liggen backe sore importable burden mee seemeth backe charged maketh mee backeward meue step common course euen foorth pretend thynges also ryght side left haue mee enuolued care wanuehope helpe throughout mee ronne truely leue gracelesse fortune whyche euer sheweth mee ward cloudye disease ready make stormes rene blisfull side halt still awayward woll suffer mee ward turne force yet woll beene conquered ala nobley muche among creature commended flowyng streme manner vertues woonderfull whyche let flood come soule wherefore purely mated sorrow sought selfe crie goodnesse haue pittie captife inrest degree sorrowe disease left without goodly helpe recouery sorrowes may susteyne forrowe shoulde bee tolde ward shewed although muche space betweene v twayne yet thynketh suche joleinyng wordes disease ginneth ebbe truely thynketh sowne lamentation weepyng right nowe flow youre presence cryeth mercye grace whyche thynge mee seemeth thee lift none answer yeue deinous cheare ye commaunded auoyd god forbid woord spring haue little ruth parde pitie mercye euery margarite closed kinde amongs many vertues quality comfort comfort mee right naught worth withouten mercye pittie alone thynges hastely god graunt mercye rehearsing thynges many without time moment rest mee seemed anguish disease togither rauished cannot tell holly passion feeling weten lost seemed time suddainely manner drede light mee one nought feare folke haue enemie mightye would hem greue dooen hem disease trowe well knowe many person otherwhile man soueraignes presence manner feardnesse creepeth heart harme goodly subjection namely menne readen aungels aferde sauiour heauen parde ne ne may passion disease meane aungels adradde fiend drede sithen perfitely blissed affection wonderfulnesse service obedience ferde also han louers presence loues subject aforne soueraines right ferdnesse mine hert caught suddainely astonied entered place lodged lady seeme liche goodly sight euer toforne appeared creature truly blustering look yaue gladnesse comfort suddainly wit right shee dooth euery wight commeth presence goodly thought mine hert began somdeale enbolded wext little hardye speake yet quakingvoice durst salued enquired shee worthie sight dained enter foul dungeon namely prison without leaue keeper certes although vertue deed mercy stretchen visiten poor prisoner hem faculty comfort seemed ferre fallen miserie wretched hid caitifenesse mee precious thing neigh also tha sorrow euery wight beene heavie wish recouerie lady somedeale apperceiued well wordes chere thought busied within good womanly countenance said word norie nest thou manner foryet friend seruaunts nay qd full entent visite comfort friendship ally well time perturbation propertie blisse mee shall vnkindenesse neuer bee founden also sithen haue especiall true day wherefore may well leisar come hem deseruen comming may thing auail wete well woll come often good lady qd art faire looke ryning honey thy wordes blisse paradise arne thy looking joy comfort thy mouings thy name mokell werking vertues enpight seemeth none creature euer saw mine eyen disciple qd wondereth thy word thee little disease hast foryetten name wost thou well loue first thee brought thy seruice good lady qd worship thee thyne excellence come foule place parde sometime tho prosperitie forraine good enuolued mokell doen drawe thee mine hostell yet many wernings thou madest ere thou lift fully graunt thine home make dwelling place thou commest goodly thine owne vise comfort wordes ginne remember passed gladnesse truly lady ne wote whether shall say welcome none sithen thy comming woll much mee tene sorrow gladnesse mirth see comforteth thinke passed gladnesse anoyeth eft thus thy comming gladdeth teneth cause much sorrow lo lady howe comforted comming gan tear distill tenderly weepe certes qd loue see well overthinketh wit thee fayleth art point dote truly qd ye maked ever rue wotest thou wel qd every sheepheard ought reason seeke sperkeland sheepe arne ron wildernesse among bush peril hem pasture ayen bryng take hem privie busie cure keepping tho unconning sheep scattered would lost renning wildernesse desert draw el woulden put swallowing wolfe yet shall shepheard businesse trauaile put forth shall let lost way good sheepheard putteth rather life lost sheepe thou shalt wene werse condicion truly everiche folk tho ward knit condicion woll rather die suffer hem errour spilt list liketh mine shepheardesse cleaped wost thou well failed never wight refused would negligently go unkindnesse yet parde many holpe releved oft beguiled ever end discended neck hast thou radde kind paris priamus son troy iason falsed fals behest sesars sonke left tene till troned blisse service qd maked love day betweene god mankinde chese maid nompere put quarell end lo travailed haue thanke side yet list rest might find werche truly mine disciple thee found assayes thy ready mine hestes followed hast ben true margarite pearle one thee shewed alway ayenward hath made daungerous chear come proper persone put thee errours make thee glad wayes reason sorrow ne disease shall hereafter thee amaistrie wherethrough hope thou shalt lightly come grace thou long hast desired thilke iewel hast thou heard many ensamples comforted releeved schollers lore hath worthied king field hath honoured lady houre perpetuall mirror truth service hath caused worthy folke void vice shame hath hold city realm prosperity thee lift cleape ayen thine olde remembraunce thou coudest every poynt declare especiall say thy maistres cause causing thing many mo iwis madame qd thyngs know well selfe thyne excellence passeth understanding u beast mannes wit yearthly may comprehend thy vertues well qd see thee disease sorrow wote well thou art one mine nories may suffer thee make sorrow thine owne selfe shend self come thy fere thine heavy charge make seem lesse wo alone sorry moned sorrowful wight great gladnesse right sick friendes sick sorry cannot el sorrow make till hem releeved wise gladnesse maner counterpaising shall restore mokell joy passed heavinesse beforn tene also qd servaunts alone solitary place yet ever busied hem comfort heart taught hem make song plaint blisse enditen letter rhethorike queint understanding bethinke hem wise might best lady good service please also learn maner countenaunce word bearing ben meek lowly every wight name fame encrease yeue great yefts large renome may springen thee thereof excused thy losse great costages wherethrough thou art needy arne nothing unknowen hope god somtime shall amended thus saied norture taught mine courtesie made hem expert lady heart winne would endeynous proud envious wretch acquaintaunce hasteliche voided schoole vice truly hate vertues worthinesse power auaunce ah worthy creature qd juste cause name goddesse dignely ye mowe beat thee lithe grace creature worlde hath goodnesse truly manner blisse preciousnesse vertue thee springen wellen brooke river procceden spring like water kind drawen sea kindly thinges threst full appetite desire drawe thy steppe thy presence approch kindely perfection howe dare beast world aught forfete ayenst thy divine purueighaunce also lady ye knowen privy thoughtes heartes counsayle may hidde knowynge wherefore wate well lady ye knowe selfe conscience willyng service coud never doe yet forsooth fayned never love otherwise myne heart coud made cheare one ythought another many done day afore mine eyen trowe would vailed certes qd haddest thou done would thee visited ye wete well lady eke qd plaid raket nettle docke weathercocke waved truly ye set accord conscience would fly till ye reason apert strength maden mine hert tourne good faith qd knowe thee ever tho condition sithen thou wouldest much thee made mee privy thy counsaile judge thy conscience though forsoke tho dayes till saw better time would never god yt faile ever woll ready witnessing thy sooth place ever shall ayenst tho woll contrary susteine much naught vnknowen ne hid thy privy heart hast thou tho thynges made mee open full hath caused comming prison void webbes thyne eyen make thee clearely see errours thou hast men diver condition adradde say sooth sooth anone ready fight also may selfe beene place withsay thilke men thee speaken otherwise sooth woll charge thee vertue obedience thou mee dwest writen wordes set hem writing mowe witnessing beene noted among people bookes written neither dreden ne shaman ne strive conne onely shewen entent w ter yeve remembraunce hearer woll thy presence say thing tho writer looke boldly trust mar answere full certes shall enforme trouth thy love thy conscience helpe thou shalt vary thy neede trowe strongest best may found woll transvers thy word whereof wouldest thou dreade greatly tho gladded word saith wexen somedele light hert authority witnesse also sikernesse helpe foresayd beheste said truly lady well gladded comfort wordes nowe liking vnto nobly shewe folke diffame servant sith service ought thynges beene commended yet qd see well thy soule amased cloud thee better heare thing thee might light thine heavy charge knowing thine owne helpe stirre sweet wordes suche reason heare thoughtfull soule namely one thou art wol yet thing sinken come therefore let seene thy heavy charge may lightlier thy comfort purveigh certes lady qd comfort might haue vtterly w te bee sure heart margarite serve thinke done might life dureth qd mayst thou thereafter wise mispleasaunce ne enter good fayth qd shall mispleasance caused trespace side doe thee weten qd set never yet persone serve place hee caused contrary default trespaces hee ne sped service mine owne yearthly lady quod tho yet remember worthinesse long sithen many revolving yeares time october leave ginneth take november sheweth sight berne ful good qutte every halke good lond tiller ginneth shape yearth great travayle bring forth corne mannes sustenaunce ayenst next yeares following time plenty hee hath home wise list wander mar vailes seech bee constrayned excited lothe thyng done excitation mannes opinion whiche woulden fayne myne abiding take heart lust travayle see windyng yearth time winter woodes large streetes small pathes swine hogges hadden made lane ladels maste seech walked thinking alone wonder great whyle great beastes wood haunten adorneth maner forrests heards gone wisd ere ware neighed sea bank ferde beast shipcraft cride lady trow ye wete well self nothing werse beastes n beene tame catche wisdnesse ginne waxe ramage thus forsooth aferde shippe hied ynow lach mine handes drawe shippe many kn well name sight first lust another thought thirde eke mayster broughten mee wythin boorde shippe travaile sayle sprad ship gan mooue wind water gan rise ouerthwartly tourn welkin wawes seemden kist together often vnder colour kissing mokell old hate priuely closed kept storm strangely deuouring manner gan fast v assail supposed date death haue made ginning vnder wawe abouen shippe great mokell duresse weather stormes great auowing pilgrimage driuen isle vtterly wend first haue rescowed truly first beginning seemed perillous hauen catch grace comforted life full despaired truly lady ye remember aright manner thing self came hastely seen v sea driuen weten first ye deignous cheare ye gone better alight euer thought ye liued great dreade disease seemed chear certified name lenger looked goodly dradde euer mine hert opened little time ship minde lady ye lad ware beastes fish great number thronging togider among muskle blew shell enclosed margarite pearle precious best euer toforne came sight ye tolden self ilke iewel kind good vertuous better neuer finde sought thereafter worldes ende yt helde peace great whyle euer sithen haue bethought man sought precious margarites founden one liking sold good buy iewel iwis thought yet thinke haue founden iewel mine herte desireth whereto seeche truly nowe wol stint margarite set mee euer also sithen wist wel seruice take desire thing neuer haue blisse liueth none hath disease might brought seruice cause sorrow ioy wonder word ye saine bringen men ioy parde ye wote well default ne trespace may reasonable put ward fer conscience knoweth disease list speak enform manner blisse ye haue throng truly wene gladnesse ioy mirth beshet vnder lock key throw place thet may bee found brenning hath altered al hew sleep wallow thinke mee disport thus combred seeme folk mased also lady mine desire hath long dured speaking haue el least haue enmoised sight wanting thing mouth would durst plein right sore sithen euils goodnesse arn manyfold holden wonder lady truly saue euermore reuerence ye mow shame thing suffer seruaunt multiplied wherefore kneelyng low heart pray rue caytife nothing may serue good lady list help shew pryuiest seruauntes assay time vnder wynges protection help ward shapen shall straungers wyse succour looke pryuie yet helpe doe fayle maye thus prisone abide bondes chaynes holden ladie ye see well self reniant foriudged hath half care thus sighyng sobbyng waile alone nere comfort presence ryght would sterue yet little gladded goodly grace none happe haue hent graciouslye finde precyous margarite left menne buye therefore sell substaunce wo many let game purpose breaker beene maked wayters prysoners euermore ouerlooke hinder lettours hard iewell winne lady honour thy deity thynketh ryght suche people shoulde haue maystry ne ouerlookers ouer none thy seruauntes truely leful unto goddes would playne ye rule diuine purueighaunce amonges seruauntes nothynge yee shoulde also ladye moeble insuffisaunte counteruayle price iewell el make eschaunge eke wight worthy pearl weare king prince el peer iewell vertue woulde adorne make fayre realme nobley vertue much goodnesse ouer commended would waile might rich haue vertue thereof prison may deliuer nought el therethorowe holpen see self withouten recouery although might hence void yet would would abide day desteny hath ordeined suppose without amendment sore mine heart bounden may thinken none thus straight lady hath sir daunger laced stock leue see taken little heed thinketh woll maken might vertue mercy margarite stretch ye mow well case list blisse mirth arn felde sickenesse sorrow alway ready cope tene wound body standing mee best vnneth may ligge pure miseasie sorrow yet little ynough earnest siluer forward bargain treble fold mokell must suffer er time come mine ease worthie wealth may woe suffer certes heauie think thing shall yeue water ynough drink least mine eyen drie renning streames teares shall waylen mee myne happie heavinesse shall counsayle mee liking tene goodly harse euer brenne coveit sorrow thirst gladnesse shall yeue contrarious drink staunch thurst blisfull bitternesse lo thus bren drench shiuer sweat reuersed yuell neuer yet ordained salue forsoth lech ben vnconning saue margarite alone remedy puruey word brast weep euery tear mine eyen greatnesse semed boren ball sight water outronne thought loue gan litle heauy miscomfort chear gan soberly easie manner speak well auising said commonly wise speaken easily soft many skils one wordes better beleeued also easie speaking auisement men may catch put forth holden also authoritie easie wordes eke yeuen vnderstanding intention matter right ladie easily soft manere gan say wordes meruayle qd great manner semblaunt ferre espie thou list haue recour euer thou playnest sorrowest way remedy foolish wilfulnesse thee list seech enquire thy next friend thine inwit mee haue ben thy maistresse recour fine thy disease disease gladnesse joy full vessell helded quencheth feeling first tenes thou wont thing remember thine heart also fool thereof enfourmen adnulling errours destroying derk opinion comfort sear thought canst thou comfort thine soul thinking thing hast thou long commensall hast mikell eaten potage foryetfulnesse dronken ignoraunce old souking thou haddest mee arne maistred lorne fro manner knowing worthy person helpe cannot counsaile wordes pure strong shame wox reed seeing mee astonied diver stounds suddainly thing kind hateth gan deliciously comfort sugred word putting full hope margarite getten followed hests gan fair cloth wipen tear hingen cheek said wise well wisedom welth withouten thee may nothing ben learned thou bearest key priuie thing vain trauail men catch stedship ye lady first lock vnshet ye lady learn v way bypath heauen ye lady maken heauenly body goodly benignely done course gouernen v beast earth ye armen seruaunts ayenst debate imperciable harneis ye setten herts insuperable blood hardnesse ye leaden hem parfit good yet thing desireth ye werne man help wele done lore grant little grace sorrow cease mine seruant qd truly thou sittest nie mine hert thy bad chere gan sorely greue among thy plaining word thought thou alledgest thing letting thine helping thy grace hinder wherethrough thinketh wanhope crope thine hert god forbid nice vnthriftie thought come thy mind thy wit trouble sithen euery thing coming contingent wherefore make thy proposition impossible pray thee rehearse ayen tho thing thy mistrust causen thilk thing think reason distroyen put full hope thine hert vnderstandest thou qd thou saidest many let game thine ouerlookers also thy moeble insuffisaunt thou thereof meanest truly qd first say janglers euermore arn speaking rather euil good euery age man rather enclineth wickednesse goodnesse advance also false word springen wide stering false lying tongue fame al swiftly flieth ear faith many wicked tale soon shall falsenesse ben leued trouth great sothnesse qd thinketh thilk jewel precious wretch would vertue thereof extend also feeble worldly joy jewel countreuail people worldly joy han set highest degree reuerence ben accepted false wening maketh felicity therein supposed caitiues euermore ben hindred certes qd take good heed shall reason thee shewen thing mow let thy purpose least point wight coude prick remembrest nat qd ensample one strongest maner preue mannes purpose nowe ensample enduce thee proposition nat proued strength yes forsooth qd well qd raddest thou neuer paris troy helaine loued togider yet entrecommuned speech also acrisius shete dane doughter toure suertie wight haue maistrie service yet iupiter signes without speech purpose ayenst father many mo haue knitte trouth yet spake neuer togider thyng enclosed vnder secretnesse priuitie twey person entremellen herts sight power knowing thing preuen shall nat vtterly yeuen beast many thing precious matter reserued iudgement diuine purueyaunce among liuyng people mannes consideration mowen determined wherefore say envye iangling welnie people vpon seruaunts maken efte rather cause esploite hindering qd suffer ye wrong moun ye list lightly yuels abate seeineth great vnworship qd hold thy peace haue founden many han vnkind truly woll suffer euery wight wise haue disease continue ende well truly hem woll helpen one myne blisse wend martial greece ycrowned god nat strongest rathest come lengest abode continued iourney spared nat trauayle long play lest thilke person profered nowe seruice therein anone voydeth ready another one thinketh nowe another water entreth anone respireth suche one liste mee nat parfite blisse seruice bryng tree oft set diuers place woll kinde endure bring forth fruit looke nowe pray thee howe myne olde seruauntes time passed continued seruice follow thou steppe myght thou fayle case thou worche wise certes qd nothing liche worlde time passed eke country hath one manner another countrey hath another maye nat man alwaye put eye salue hee healed heele sooth betwyxe two thynges lyche oft diuersitie required qd soothe diuersitie nation diuersitie lawe maked manye reason diuersitie commeth contrarious malice wicked people han envious heartes ayenst truely lawe seruauntes euer hath general whiche may fayle ryght mannes lawe ordeined many determination may knowne good badde till assay people han proued end draweth sheweth necessitie thereof el impossibilitie right ye law seruaunts well hath proued general hitherto hath fayled wist thou well lawe kinde lawe god ordayned establyshed dure kynde reasoun wherefore lawe mannes wit purveied ought vnderput lawe kinde whych yet hath commune euerye kindely creature statute lawes kyndely arne generall people old doyngs many turning year vsed people manner proued mowen lightly defaced new doings contrariaunts old often causen disease breaken many purpose yet say nat therefore ayen new mischeef men ordaine newe remedie alway looke contrary old ferther mallice stretcheth followeth olde doings loue han ben vniuersal exploit thee vsed wherefore wold yet lawes nothing annulled thy purpose iangelers looker wayters game think ought mowe dere yet loue well alway set hem nought let thy port low euery wight presence readie thine heart maintaine thou hast begonne little thee fayne meeknesse wordes thus sleight shalt thou surmount dequace yuel herts wisdome yet seme flie otherwhyle man woll fight thus suche thyngs tongue euil shall stilled el fully graunt thy full meaning forsooth euer euer shall mine enemy aferde trust fighting therefore haue thou coward heart seruice sometime thou haddest contrary thou drede ianglers thy voyage make vnderstand well dreadeth raine sow cornes shall haue thin berne also afearde clothes let daunce naked nothing vndertaketh namely seruice nothing atcheueth great stormes weather often merry smooth much clattering mokell rowning thus iangling wordes commeth huisht peace still good lady qd see seuen yeare passed haue graffed groubed vine wyth way could sought fede grape fruit haue none found also haue seuen year serued laban wedded rachel doughter blear eyed lia brought bed alway engendereth tene full child tribulation care although clippynges kissyngs rachell shoulde seeme sweet yet barraine yt gladnesse ne ioy way wol spring yt may weep rachell may counsayled sollace sithen issue myne heartely desire fayled pray sone freedom grace thys eight yeare eyghteth mow kynreste masseday seauen werke day trauaile follow christen lawe euer ye doe el thilke margarite holden lady pryuye chamber case none person committed look qd case none person committed look qd thou perseuer seruice haue thee grounded yt thilke scorne thy enemy mowe thus thy person soothed lo man began edifie foundement bad end may nat bring meeknesse countenaunce manly heart deed long continuance conisance livery retinue deliuered wenest thou yt list aduaunce person louen ye first sitting feast ye highest stole church hall loutings people market fair vnstedfast bide one place together wening wit excellent scorning manner device owne nay nay god wote shall nothing parten blysse truely manner heretoforne hath beene worship blisse lion field lambes chamber eagle assaute maiden hall fox counsaile still deed protection graunted ready bridge banner ar ered like wolf field thus way shull men auaunced ensample david yt keeping sheepe drawn vp order kingly gouernaunce iupiter bulle beene europe fere iulius cesar lowest degree rome maister earthly prince eneas hell king countrey rome stonding thee say thy grace bering thereafter may set thee plight iangling may greeue leaste tucke thy hem iangles nought counte cresse thy disaduantage ever qd hath people worlde desired haue great name worthinesse hated foule beare fame one obiections thou alledgest ayen thine hertely desire ye forsooth qd commonly people woll lie bring enfame nowe quod men leasinges put enfame wenest thy selfe thereby enpeired wening wrong see much lyen thy merite encreaseth make thee ben worthy hem knowen thee sooth thing thou art apeired mokell thou art encreased thy beloued friend soothly wound thy friend lasse harm yea sir better false kissing deceiuable glosing thyne enemie aboue well thy friende maketh enfame ergo thou art encreased nat apeired lady qd sometyme yet man disease ye estimation enuious people ne looketh nothing desert men ne ye merites doings auenture fortune thereafter yeuen sentence looken voluntary heart therafter telleth iudgement taking heed reason ne qualitie thus man rich fulfild worldly welefulnesse commenden saine lent iust cause yt hath aduersitie saine weaked hath deserued thilke annoy contrary thing men holden also saine yt rich prosperitie purveied vnto confusion vpon matter many authority many great witted clearkes allegen mensayne though good estimation forsaken folke yt han aduersitye yet merite encrease blysse purpose arne wonderful vnderstanding truly mine aduersitie sentence ye indifferent people iudgen fame therefore qd wight yeue true sentence matter ye cause disease mayst thou see well vnderstand thereupon end draweth yt sayne good bad ought haue fame goodnesse enfame badnesse euery reasonable persone namely wise man wit ought without reason toforne heard suddainly matter iudge ye saw wise thou shalt iudge ne deme toforne thou know lady qd ye remember well laud praising certain saint holy church rehearsen conuersation bad good rehersed perpetual mirrour remembraunce worshipping tho saintes good ensample misdoers amendment turned roman zedeories fro roman hannibal ayenst kind nation afterwards seeming romaine ye next degree confusion turned old ally whose wit hannibal discomfited wherfore enforme lady manner mean see youth draw assentaunt might helpyng certaine coniurations great matter ruling citezins thilke thynges beene drawer excitours tho matter werne painted coloured prime face seemed noble glorious ye people wening mikell merite haue deserued furthering maintenaunce tho thyngs busied laboured diligence werkyng thilke matter end truly lady tell ye sooth rought little hate mighty senatours thilke city ne commune mallice two skilles one comfort ben plite profite friend another common profit communalty peace tranquility gouernaunce proceden thilke profite sithen counsail mine inwit thought first paynted thynges mallice euill meanyng withouten good avaylyng people tyranny purposed pure sorrow meddling bad infame ronne tho teares lashed mine eyen thus away washe vnderhyd mallice rancour purposing envy fornecaste ymagined destruction mokel people shewed openly blind myne handes circumstaunce might well feeled tho persones thinges cast redresse wrath firste meddling shopen dwell pynande prison till lachases threade lenger would twyne ever sought list grace life freenesse prison shoulde openly confesse howe peace might enduced enden first rancour fully supposed knowing full tho matter lady thought every man way right rightfully done may helpe commune helpe saved thynge keepe thinges holde maintaine namely destroying wrong al therethrough enpeach myne owne fere guilty misdeed assentaunt maister ne friend may nought avayle soule hym falsenesse deyeth also nere desired wrath people ne indignation worthy nothyng ever wrought doings selfe el mayntenaunce foresayd errours hidyng privities thereof people heart holdyng errours side blind elde ferre forth beguiled yt debate strife maintayned distruction side whyche cause peace communalties desired point bee broken annulled also city london deare sweet forth growne kindely love place yearth every kindely creature hath full appetite place kindely engendrure wilne reste peace steede abide thilke peace thus broken wise commended desired know thing men desiren commen parfit peace everlasting must peace god commended maintain keepe peace angel voyce confirmed god entring world testament left friend retourned place whence came apostle admonesteth holden without man parfitely may none insight also god coming made peace alone heauenly earthly body also among u earth peace confirmed one heed love one body shoulde perfourm also remember well name athens rather god peace battaile shewing peace necessary communalties city stered way toforne nempned declared certain point wise first thilke person hadden mee drawen purpose witting privy entent meaning drawen also feeble witted people none insight gubernatife prudence clamure cry matter stirred point commune auantage embolded passife take active also stirred innocent conning cry thing qd may stand ben executours tho matter authority execution common election u delivered must enter strength maintenaunce degree put oppression old hinderers shall agayn surmounten putten subjection endlesse woe ye shull complain government qd citie left hand torcencious citizen shal bring pestilence distruction good men therefore let u commune administration abate yuels also qd worthy good commend thy guilty desert chastice citizen many ferd execution shall done extortion hem committed evermore ayenst purpose good meaning never latter lady truly meaning word fully appeached mighty senator hadden heavy heart misgovernaunce seen lady fell free election great clamour much people great disease misgovernaunce fervently stooden election yt hem submitted every manner face rather suffred manner rule hated governours notwithstanding contrary helden much commune meiny consideration voluntary lust withouten reason thilke governour forsaken fayning scorn undoing misrule time shope letted thilke election made newe chosen mokell rore arered thing lady knowen among prince made open people draweth amendment every degree shall ben ordained stand error coming hereafter men may lightly toforn hand puruay remedy wise peace rest furthered hold thing lady thilk person broughten answere toforne soueraigne judge coarted paining dures openly knowledgeden asked thereof grace apertly preveth wordes sooth without forging leasings greueth remember diuers sentence jangling sheepie people certes thinketh oughten maken joy sooth may knowe trouth conscience witnesse knowing soothe haue said harm ne malice tho person trouth sacrament liegeaunce charged king behalf see ye lady fellonous thought people couins wicked men conspiren ayen soothfast trouth see ye euery wight erronious opinion assentaunt help noise knewen thing better seluen apparailen finden new friend cleapen false studien mowen mouthes werse plite nempne god may thilk folk time maintenance might auayleth stretch foresaid matter tho commended yaue name trouth manifold maners nigh euery wight ear thilk people side thilk company sometime passed yeuing name bad loo tho people turned good bad bad good thing wonder knowing saying soth arn tempted reply old praisings knowen well doings ben trew sain openly false haue said many thing alleaged nothing false vntrew saue thilk mater knowledged party hemself god wot mater none ye also lady know thing trew auaunt praysing self thereby lese precious secre conscience ye see well false opinion people trouth telling false conspired mater judgment clerk hide sooth maner person maister ne wherefore would drede put consideracion trew wise comer hereafter shullen fully denwere soth know thing act wern haue put scripture perpetuell remembrance true meaning truly lady seemeth ought bear name trouth loue rightwisenesse haue thus submitten false fame clerk sain flieth fast doth fame trouth shall wide sprede till brought jewell mean shall hindred withouten measure trouth gan loue sadly behold said chaunged voice lower spoken time fain would qd thou holpen hast thou said thing thou might prouen pardee qd person euery thing haue said han knowleged hemself yea qd hadden naied wouldest thou haue mainteined soothly qd well wist amongst greatest realm profered body largely prouing tho thing mar haue judged thend sothnesse word durst thilk judg trust certes qd aboue fame world name marciall doings pleasen lady lore sithen thou ready thine aduersaries thy presence refused thilk thy fame ought born deed take end therefore euery wight drop reason hath heareth infame thing hath answer say trewly thou saidest thine aduersaries thy word affirmed thou haddest lied yet discomfited prise leaned thy side fame shall hold infame shall bring vpon none half greueth thee thine enemy sain shame thus arn discomfited yet quarell trew shall loo thy frends ayenward dequace thilk enfame say graunted sooth without stroke fighting many men battell discomfited ouercome rightfull quarrel goddes priuy judgement heauen yet although party yolden may word say quarrell trew yeeld contrary dread death compelled graunted stroke hath feled may creep away wise none excusacion indifferent folk say ye trew false knowledgeth tho thing thus euery side fame sheweth thee good bad yet qd say ne deth haue discouered maistresse vnkindnesse woll knet infame pursue thus enemy manifold maner woll sech priuy serpentines queintises quench distroy venime many business light trouth make herts murmour ayenst person haue hain withouten cause qd hear word thou shalt fully aunswered trow thinketh qd right thy word sacrament swearing say charging othe one cause make thee discouer malicious imaginacions tofore nempned euery othe knitting copulation must haue lawes trewe iudgment rightwisenesse thyng lacke oth iturned name periury make true serment must need thing follow ofte tymes man say soothe iudgement iustice folow forsworne ensample herodes holding serment dampned also say trouth rightfullithe judgment whyle forboden sothes saine therefore judgement trouth rightwisenesses euery creature bounden vpon payne periury full knowing make though person dread sinne word better die liue false al would peruerted people false report make vnkindnes entent thy fame reise light truth matter forth sprongen openly published among common shall soch dark enfame dare appear pure shame falsnesse men enfame none otherwise void el excuse hindring men fame none cause cleapen men false falsnesse mowen avaunsed el false sclaundring word men shendin true sclaunder make seem lasse soch men woulden iyen conscience reuoluen shoulden seen sentence legen spring side many branch impossible number therefore may said thing man thou demest therein thy self thou condempnest qd vnderstand word thou wene say thee worthy sclander matter tofore written truly would witnesse contrary say beames sclaundring word may done away till day dome yet amongs great plenty people many shrew sithen mo eight person no ship closed yet one shrew scorned father thing qd trow shewen false fame drede ne wise person accept namely thy margarite whose wisedom hereafter think declare wherefore wote well soch thing shall astert vnkindnesse thine othe hath thee excused full thou wouldst greue list thing shew say qd ye wol trow ye mean trouth profit time coming truly qd soth thou con well keep word inrest secret chamber thine hert fast hem close neuer flitt shalt thou find hem auailing look people hast thou serued hem time thine exile euer thee refreshed value least coigned plate walketh money sory made ruth thy disease hadden getten purpose thy mi aventure set haw lo thou enprisoned fast hied help thy deliueraunce wene thy death yeue lite looked thing lust thou list say sothe meinie brigge thee broughten lokeden rather thine help thee haue releued owen yet hem money common paidest thou dispences till tourned seland yaue thee euer ought riding thou madest yet pardie hem tooken money thy chamber put tho pen pourse vnweting renter lo company thou medlest neither thee ne self mighten help vnkindnesse bear name thou supposest hem haue might thou haue done thou diddest thou wouldest false quarell haue stinking martire wene thou fleddest long thou might priuitie conceal thing thou helest lenger thou shouldest thilk ought thee money pennie would pay wend thy return impossible might thou better haue hem proued thus thy needy disease hast thou ensample thou shalt meddle truly lore worth many goodes oft gan loue stern word think speach truely hereafter woll thee liking euer thou see fortune shape whele turne meditacion way reuolue certes fortune sheweth fayrest thinketh beguile thought toforne thou saidest thy loo loue thy rightwisenesse ought raysed allowed time coming thou might loue thee haue loo fame shull raysed thy freends comfort sorow thine enemy endlesse shull endure thou one sheep amongs hundred lost desert way erred flock art restored shepeheard hath thee joy thou ayen forrest tourn right sorrow anguish great time thine way going right joy gladnesse shall doubled seen thee conuerted lothes wife ayen looking hoole counsail sheep folowing grasse hearbs gader neuer later qd say thing wantrust haue supposing thee otherwise truely wote well thou art sette soche purpose thee list part say many men ben knowing men doings setten cure lightly desiren bad clatter rather good haue owne manner amende also hate old rancour lightly hauen soch thing abideth sodainly mouth proceedeth haboundance herte word stone stone throw wherfore counsaile euermore openly apertly place thou sitte counterplete therrours meaning far thou hem wistest false leaue wight make hem know euery body eare alway patient vse iacobs word euer men thee clappen shall sustain lady wrath haue deserued long margarite hath rightwised cause certes qd witnesse self thou thus conuerted sorrowest good meaning thine herte wolt vanity parfitely depart consolacion al good pleasaunce margarite thou desirest thyne herte manner mother pity shul fully accept thee grace right thou rentest clothes open sight openly sow hem worshyp withouten reproofe commended also right thou ensample moch fold error right thou must ensample manifold correction good fauour forgoing error destroying causeth diligent loue many plaited praysings follow shall first errours make following worship seeme hugely encreased black white set togider euery seemeth dothe euery thing contrary kind infame goeth alway tofore praysing worship cause following maketh rise thilk honour double wealth quencheth spot first enfame wenest say thing hindering thy name nay nay god wot pure encreasing worship thy rightwisenesse commend thy trouth seem woste well thy selfe thou inform making passeth adam eate apple thou passeth stedfastnesse noe eating grape became dronke thou passeth chastity lothe lay doughter eke nobly abraham god reproued pryde also dauids meeknesse woman made vry slaw also hector troy defaut might found yet reproued ne manhood suffred warre begon ne paris haue went grece gan sorow truly lacketh venime priuy consenting openly leaueth wrong withsay lo eke old prouerbe among many still seemeth graunted ensamples thou might fully vnderstand thing writ learning rightwisenes tho persones thus euery wight default committed made goodnesse afterwards done reuerence open shewing ensample songe holy church lo necessary adam sin dauid king gat salomon king vries wife truly reproof none thing writte right tho rehearse thy deed repreue thee neuer ne villany thee rehearsed worship thou continue well hereafter profite thy self rede thou hem thinke saied right thus lady unity accorde enuy wrath lurken thou commest place ye weten well selue done many administred office common ruling establishment amongs people defouled neuer conscience maner deede euer wit counsaile wisest matter drawen right endes thus truly lady haue desired soch cure certes seruice idle far soch cure stretcheth thing qd yt may draw many hertes noble voice common glory fame wretched fickle ala mankind coueteth leud wise rewarded good deed sith glory fame world hindering glory time comming certes qd yet hardest fame heauen yearth centre cercle heuen pricke wonderful little respect cercle yet prick may name born manner persing many obstacle water wildernesse straunge language onely name men ben stilled holden knowledging obstacle also city realm prosperity ben letted know reason hindred mowe ben perfitely men proper vnderstanding name singuler londenoys passe glorious name london many commended many lacked many mo place earth knowen knowen many countrees little london knowing speach yet among one manner people may soch fame goodnesse come many praisen commonly many lacken fie soch maner fame sleep suffre knoweth priuity hertes deale soch fame thilke place nothing ayenst soth shall neither speake ne dare appere atturney ne maner many great named many great worthinesse losed han tofore time yt memory slidden cleanly forgetten defaute writing yet scripture great elde defased perpetualty may hem judged thou wolt make comparison euer wt joy mayst thou haue yearthly name fair likenesse pee one grain wheat thousand ship full corne charged nomber one yet mowe nombred end recknyng haue truely may nombred nothing recken thilke may nombred oft thing ended made comparison one little great thing haue end end soch comparisoun may founden wherefore heauen losed god hath none end endles endureth thou canst nothing doen aright thou desire rumour thereof healed euery wightes eare dureth prick respect thou seekest reward folk small word vain praysings truly therein thou lesest guerdon vertue lesest greatest valour conscience unhap thy renome euerlasting therefore boldly renome fame yearth hated fame death desired werks vertue asketh guerdoning soul causeth vertue soul deliuered prison yearth worthy soch guerdone among haue euerlasting fame bodye causeth mannes yuils tway thing art thou answered thinketh qd loue thing doubt thy soul shew forth thine ignoraunce clear leaue shame certes qd ne body world aught could say reason ayenst skils leue wit fele well euil speaker bearer enfame may little greue let purpose rather soche thing quarel forthered yea qd proued also like jewel keeping shall stered lest moment might imagined soth qd well qd leueth declare thy insuffisaunce manner letting thus worthy thou shouldest climbe high thy moebles thine estate arne voided thou thinkest fallen soch misery gladnesse thy pursute woll thee discend certes qd soth right soch thought mine herte commonly spoken old prouerb ledged heweth hie chip may lese sight wherefore haue euer might study way remedy one side qd god forbede ere thou seek doings soch haue learned thee resting while hearbes planted garden thou shalt well vnderstand aboue man one god alone qd han men forne time trusted writ chauntements help spirites dwellen air thereby han getten desire first manly power daunced behind qd fie soch matter truely sacrilege shall haue sort seruants mine eyen shall soch thing looked often commanded passed wise yt one god shall men serue two god list haue mine help shall aske none help foul spirit ala man maked semblable god woste thou well vertue liueliche werking god purueighance vnderput reasonable creature yerth euery thing thishalf god made buxom man contemplacion vnderstanding heauen earth hell hath man stone soul wexing tree herb hath soul feling beast fish foul hath soule reason vnderstonding angel yt knit maner liuings reasonable proporcion also man made fower element uniuersity rekened alone hath god principality aboue al thing soul thousand mile hence farre nigh high low farre moment mountenance ten winter al man gouernance disposicion sheweth men lich vnto god child height sithen al thing vnderput reasonable creature god forbid man win lordship ask help thing lower himselfe namely foule thing innominable shouldest thou wene loue high sithen nothing thee aboue god alone truly wote wel ilk jewel manner euen line degree thou art thy selue nought aboue saue thus angel vpon angel man vpon man deuil vpon deuil han maner souerainty shal cease day dome say though thou put serue thilk jewel thy life yet seruage vnderputting maner travailing pleasance conquere get thou hast set hardest seruice thou deydest sorrow wanting thy desire truly heauenly body one voice shul come make melody thy comming say welcome fere worthy enter iupiters joy thou might hast ouercome death thou wouldest neuer flit thy seruice shul pray god row row make thilke margarite routh person vnkindly without comfort let thee dye shall beset self soch wise yearth part vengeaunce shall joy haue loues seruice dedde shall soul brought vp thy presence whider thou wilt chese thilke soule shall committed el thy death anone foresaid heauenly body one accorde shall nommen thilke perle vertues firste taken hath hem forfeyted thee seruaunt thy liue would suffer worche vertues withdrawen might high body shouldest thou wene thee liste looke vpon law kind order ordayned soothly none age none ouertourning time hitherto time ne power chaunge wedding ne knotte vnbinde two hertes one assent presence togither accorden enduren till death hem depart trowest thou euery ideot wot meaning priuy entent thing wene forsoth soche accorde may rose maidenhede plucked way way know nothing consente two hertes alone maketh fastning ye knot neither law kind ne man low determineth neither age ne quality person onely accord thilke tway truely time accorde consent herte ensealed put tresory amongs priuy thing ginneth name spousaile although breken forward bothe yet soch matter ensealed kept remembrance euer see spouse haue name anon accord though rose take aungell bad ioseph take mary spouse egypt wend lo cleped spouse yet toforne ne neither hem meant fleshly lust know wherfore word trouth accorden seruants shoulden forsake father mother adherand spouse two unity one flesh shoulden accorde wise two werne first little manner disaccordaunt higher one lower made euenliche gree stonde enforme thee ye liche goddes clerkes sain determinacion shewen three thing hauen name goddes cleped saine man deuil image yet one god goodnesse grace vertue commeth louing true euerlasting prime cause al thing men goddes louing true euerlasting adoption euerlasting god deuils goddes stirring manner liuing neither true ne euerlasting name godlihed han vsurpacion prophet saieth al goddes gentile say painims diuels image goddes nuncupacion neither liuing ne true ne euerlasting word clepen god image wrought men hand reasonable creature adoption alone art great god euerlasting therby thou art good cleped let thy father maners entre thy wit yt thou might follow much longeth thee thy father worship nothing thy kind decline ne nobley pouerty thus wise thou werche thou art aboue thing saue ood alone say thine herte serue hie place fvlly haue declared thine estate good thou follow thereafter objection first thee alleged worthinesse thy margarite shall thee let shall thee increase thee declare last objection nothing may greue yes certes qd greue let must need contrary may beene proued see nowe glorious worldly welfulnesse soch goodes wealth maken men riche tho draw compaignies loo prise name yeuen tho loureden blasours tho curreiden glosours tho welcomeden flatteres tho worshipped thilke deinen looke euery wight soch yearthly weale habundaunt hold noble precious benigne wise wt shall degree menne set soth yt contrary tho thinges ne neuer well behaue hath vertue habundant manifold maners wealthed soch yearthly goodes hold fool said wit sotted lo false euer hold true lo trew cleaped false wanting goodes also lady dignitees office maken men mikell commended thus good pere men find truely trowe soche praised one make know wise looked onely fool wel wot desiren soch new thing wherefore wonder thilke gouernour alone cause proceden gouerneth thing hath ordeined world werkes kindly body gouerned vnstedfast happious thing rule reason shewen course certain thing suffreth sliding chaunges misturnen soch noble thing men arne faire persel yearth holden vpperest degree vnder god benigne thing ye saiden right selfe shoulde neuer man haue set worthy place degree ordained noble ala thou knittest purueighaunce thing lookest thou amenden default see shrewes han wicked maners siten chair dome lambes punishen woolues punished lo vertue shined naturelly pouerty lurketh hid vnder cloude moon false forsworn know self auer yeftes hath vsurped shine day light peynture men praysings truly thilke forged light foully fade trouth away colour feyned thus night tourned day day night winter sommer sommer winter deed miscleapyng foolish people qd wenest thou thing felest thou thine hert governaunce commeth certes qd wote never fortune hath graunt abode lede end men liketh ah see qd entent thy meaning lo bycause thy worldly good fullich dispent thou berafte dignity office thou madest thy gathering thilke goodes yet diddest office counsayle wise thyng ended true unto hem whose profite thou shouldest looke seest many ilke heruest made thee mokell glosing deyneth thee nought forther enhaunsen fals shrewes witnessing truth thinges greeveth thine herte seene thy self thus abated frailty mankind ne setteth litle lesers soch rechesse never moche vertue thou wenest thy iewell renne dispite accepted grace shall thee nothing hinder qd first thou woste well thou lostest nothing ever mightest thou challenge thyne nature brought thee forth come thou naked thy mother womb thou haddest richesse thou shalte enter ende every fleshly body shalt thou thee every richesse thou haste time thy living ni leant thou might therein chalenge property see every thing man may therewith liketh yeue keep richesse thou playnest thee lost thy might stretched ferforth faine thou wouldes hem kept multiplied mo ayenst thy departed thee wherefore never thine thou laudest joyest wight stuffed soche maner richesse thou art beleeve beguiled thou wenest thilk joy selinesse el ease hath lost soche hap unseily ye forsoth qd well qd woll prove unsely wise praise tother contrary lacked qd unsely qd begileth sheweth entent working et e contra selinesse begileth prosperity shee maketh jape blindnesse windeth make sorow withdraweth wolte thou qd praise better sheweth thee hert tho bitande word dispitous gloseth thinketh absence thee many harmes certes qd one commend lack dispise ha qd right ease lasteth gloseth flattereth lightly voideth pleasantly sheweth ever absence dothee tene sorow hert unsely betande chere sheweth doth wherefore unsely doth beguile selinesse disceiveth unsely put away doubt one maketh men blind openeth iyen shewyng wretchednesse one ful drede lese owne sober maketh men discharged mokel heavinesse burthen one draweth man good haleth vertue hooke thought wenest thou thy disease hath done thee mokell winne ever yet thou lostest ever contrary made thee winne great good thy thinking know heart thy soothfast freends parde proved full true discevered false truely goyng thilke brotell joye yede away ilke thyne proper never lightly departed thine owne good therfore leaveth still thee good qd moch wouldest thou sometime bought knowyng thy frende flattering fly glosed thou thought thy selfe sely thou plainest losse richesse haste founden dere worthy thing thou cleapest vnsely hath made moche thing winnen also conclusioun frende nowe leaveth heart thine help margarite denieth suffre vertues shine thee wardes spreading beam farre farther thou sely worldly joy trewly say el deale blame ah peace qd speak mine heart breaketh thou touchest soche wordes well qd let v singen thou herest thing tyme pthus endeth first booke testament love hereafter foloweth second wealth may founden world well seene lo moste comforte wende moste supposed full aunswere contrary thoughtes suddainly vanished workes man faren wise folke wenen best entent willes perfourme anon chaunging lift side right halve torneth cleane another kind never shall come first plite wrongfull steering soone otherwised knowing purpose beginning dureth yet god grace tyme woll graunt think perfourme worke begone love thinne witte inspiracicion hildeth grace woll suffre grecuously god wotte haue suffred great throw romayn emperour vnity loue accord euery cause auance namely sith empire corrected many sect heresie faith seruice rule loues religion trewly shend erronious opinion may lenger suffre many men sain loue grauell sand sea ebbing flowing woweth rich sodainly wanisheth sain loue windy blast stoundmele tournerh phane glory renome lust variant people areysed stilled many also en sun moon sters loue founden among planet souerainly shinen dignity reuerence estate rather good han occupien full many also okes huge post supposen loue grounded strength might mowen helpen wretchednesse gin fall soch diuersity sect ayenst rightful bileue loue error een forth spred loues seruants trew rule stedfast faith place darn appear thus irrecuparable joy went annoy endlesse entred man aright deproueth soch error comfirmen word sain bad noble good goodnes bad folk prophet biddeth wo without end also many tongue great false teaching guiling maner principally time word also armes loues seruaunts professe religion trew rule pursewen confounden distroien much holy father christen faith aproued strengthed iews men reasonable diuinity learned proued thilk faith reason aucthoritees old testament new pertinacy distroy paynim beests hound hold put hem error miracle god shewed thing figured coming thangell sheepherds sterre painims king saith angel reasonable reasonable creature sterre myracle people bestiall learned wern sent enform louers clerk conning might trewly haue soch grace vertue myracles ne discomfite
