falsehedes suffiseth auctorities alone sithen heretikes maintainors falsity wherefore wot well sithen men reason approued hem clowd error hath reason bewond probable reason catchend wit rightfully may sitte trauayling study haue ordeined hem auctority misglosed man reason graunt shall enduced ginneth pen quake thinken sentence enuious people alway ready rider goer skorn jape leud book rancor hate heart shullen dispise although book leud yet shall leud holden wicked wordes many maner apaired certes thinketh sown bad speach right full mine eares good precious margarite mine heart weep wist ye token hede soch maner speach trewly wote well wisedom shall astert god maker kind witnesse took none enuy ne iuell haue draw matter togider goodnes maintain error falsetes distroy wherfore said reason think thilke foresaid error distroy dequace reason soch enduce men loues seruice trew beleeue parfite blisse yet full faith credence desert fully mow suffise sithen faith hath merit mede man reason sheweth experience vtterly reason parfite blisse loue way may make comprehended lo persell louers joy parfite science good service desire comprehend bodely liking soul nat glasse haue contemplacion time comming thilk first imagined thought face face beholding heart reason vnderstanding make heauen feeled know without assay certes none sithen loue commeth soch fruit blisse loue among vertues clerk sain seed soch springing place countreis world sowe wel away thilk seed forsake mowen suffred lond tiller set werk without meddling cockle bad wedes sometime stonken hath caught name loue among ydiotes bad meaning people neuer latter yet men cleap thilk king preciousest kind many eke name thing foule yeuen ilke noble name sheweth well maner men haue greate liking wurshipping thilke name wherefore work haue writ titled loues name haue auowed maner sacrifice euer rad mow merit excellence thilk name wex authority wurship taking hede entent ordained feeres mowen moued euerything ow occasion done end aristotle supposeth act euery thing maner finall cause finall cause nobler el euen noble thilk thing finally thilk end wherefore accion thing euerlasting deemed eternall temporal sithen final cause right act book loue loue noble wherefore though book leud cause stered ought done noble forsooth bicause conning yong yet creep leud b c haue set learning passen telling three yet god short time shall amend leudnesse joyning syllable thing dulnesse wit may three letter declare trewly say goodnesse margarite pearle would yeue matter enditing many clerk certes mercy swetter liuings wherefore lip mowen suffice speaking full laud worship shuld knowing order heauen putteth reason earth forsooth may blere eyen shining sun vertue bright whele margarite behold therefore yet may discriue vertue would time coming another treatise thorow goddes grace sunne cleerenesse vertue know enlumineth day think declare meane comfortable lady gan sing wounder mater enditing latine trewly noble colour rhetorike wise knit craftely conning woll stretche remembre sentence trowe somedele haue minde certes wonder sweete sowne touched lamentacion wise werbelles mirth lo thus gan sing latine may constrew english tongue ala heuenly body light course shewen nature yaue hem commaundement ginning first age thing free choise reason han none vnderstanding man ought passe thing right course kind ouerwhelmed soothnesse wrongfull title hath drawen sterre enuie gone side ciypes shinand sun oft sey wened thilk error thorow hem come mine default trewely therefore haue withdraw made dwelling land yle self occian closed yet sayn many haue harberowed god wote faylen thing greuen think namely paised gladnesse world wont disport high low failed wolden maistries haue thilk stounds heauen high aboue saturn sphere seasonable time lodged come queint counsailours house woll suffre sojourn whereof pitee yet sain haue celler wine shet garnere corne laid couered wheat sack sowed woll purse money fast knit among pan mouled wiche presse among clothes laid rich pelure araied stable among horse beast hog sheep nete maner wise thou maker light winking thine eye sun queint wost right well true name never thus herberowed sometime toforn sun seuenth party smiten bare crosse mitre yeue would pope went foot tho worshipped al holy church king baden crown holden law set shuld fore judg wel poor durst shew grefe rich money defended tho tailages ready poor pay made great feast time noble song maried damosel gentill feture withouten gold richesse poor clerk wit school set church made soch person preach tho seruice holy church honest deuout pleasaunce god people leud simony auaunted shendeth holy church steward achates courtior debate eschetour wrong losel song personer prouendre alone many thrifty encrease yet shrew bebind free hert forsake losengeour take lo accordeth voluntary lust haunten court ribaudry till midnight woll play wake church matins behind euill disposicion stomake therefore shuld eat bean bred sire estate therewith strengthen alter broke low lithe point gone yearth horse must easie hie hear ouer great water chalice poor hath rich cup towayl sheet god shall handled meat borde shall borde clothes towelles many pair masse serueth clergion fiue squiers hall poor chauncel open hole euery side bed silk tapites going chambre poor masse book leud chapelain broken surplice many hole good hound many hunt hart hare feed feests poor men haue great care euer craue nothing offren wolden haue hem doluen among legystres dare come sain maken hem needy ne wold nothing haue town tort forth naught worth haw pleasen men thilk greeuous torcious might thing toforn said mow well men list ryme trewly accord nothing moch thing shulden right ben gouerned sory see gouernance faileth thus seen smal low gouern hie body aboue certes polisie nought forbode gouernance treaten enformen right beastly wit subject reason earthly power self lower subject hier worth thy body gouerned thy soul right litel nought worth earthly power regnatife prudence heed gouern smal heed smal owen obey suffre gouernance soueraignesse ayenward think wise seruant creature deliuered lord defendor maister enformer possessor possession hem lich tree sparows shullen stelen birdes nourish foorth bring vnder suerty ayenst reueinous foul beast tyrant themself smal rest quiet heed well disposed owen souerains health prosperite pray doings maintenance thereof perform withouten administracion rule manner gouernance wit haue hem grace come soch thing yet cease till heed cleaped although profit pleasance follow trewly gouernance ne medling ought claim ne heed hem put trewly amongs cosinage dare come richesse mean soothly bodily good maketh nigh cosinage neuer propinquite ne aliance liue ne haue nere medling maners wherefore kindly leged pouert kinred behind richesse suffreth passe truly saith come never iaphets child whereof sory iaphets child pouert linage ben rekened cain child rich maked iaphets heir ala wonder change bitween tho two no child sithen iaphets offspring comden knight cain discended line seruage brother child lo gentilesse seruage cosins discended two brethern one body wherfore say soothnes gentilesse kinrede maken gentil linage succession without desert man self line alisaundrie noble el hector troy discended right blood line fro king artour parde sir perdicas king alisandre made heir greece king blood dame tombistere kinred gentils day trow therfore good gentilesse seemeth maner necessite input gentilmen shoulden varien fro vertues ancesters certes maner linage men ben euen lich birth one father maker goodnes enformed hem mortal folk one seed greyned wherto auant men linage cosinage eld father loke ginning god maker man person clerk ne worthy gentilesse norisheth corare vice vnresonable lust leaueth kind course end brought forth birth trewly vngentil among clerk may nempned therfore woll gentil mote daunten flesh fro vice causen vngentilnes leaue also reign wicked lust draw vertue place gentilnes gentilmen maketh speak feminine gendre general tho person reuerence one euery wight honoureth bounty noblenes ymade god dere moder became hath great worship nill nothing open declare thing ayenst sect may wene vertue worthines plesaunce hem haboundeth although would thing speak truly may find yuell hem maner mater right word stint lamentable melody gan liuely heart pray liking vnto noble grace would deyn declare mater firste begonne lefte stinte speake beforne ganne singe qd newe thing seene men desiren mater selfe caused void ah good lady qd victory strength proued aboue thing judgement esdram whose lordship ligne right emperour hem commaundeth whether thilke woman whose likenesse ye aperen right man halte principalite thing vnder masculine gender gender masculine feminine remnant gender grace faculty grammer right feminine woman holden vpperest degree thing vnder thilk gender contained bringeth forth king lord see yearth people woman born nourish hem raffen vine maken men comfort glad cheres sorrow death man heart without woman men impossible con sweetnesse cruel hert rauish make meek buxome benigne without violence meuing beauty eyen el manere fetures men desire ye gold precious stone either richesse degree lady self many heart men haue bounden parfit blisse womankind men wenen nothing el also lady goodnesse vertue woman property discretion well knowen littelnesse malice desire good asker way con warn ye woll passe kind werching sect general discrecion wot well y woll encline prayer grace request shall fully granted certes qd thus part fareth mankind pray cry woman grace fain many fantasy make herts encline desire sely woman freely kind beleuen word wenen gospell promise behest grant herts full fillen lust liberty maistership toforn thralled maked soueraine praid first seruant voice prayer vsed anon filled lust many trewe littel hede take ye soch kindnesse traisoun anon ye think hem beguile set light thing first ye maked wonder dere thing woman loue wight ere well know haue proued many half euery glittering thing gold vnder colour fair speach many vice may hid concealed therefore rede wight trust rathe men chere speach right guileful ful oft wherefore without good assay worth many trust truly right kindly euery man thinketh woman betray shewen outward goodnesse till haue performed lo bird beguiled mery voice foulers whistell woman closed net woll ye cause finden bear vnkindnesse hand falsety vpon put malicious traison soch thing excuse lo han woman none wreche vengeance blober wepe till hem list stint sorily mishap complain put wening men vntrew often haue men changed loues litel el failing wil place hem set frendship shal one fame another list haue third delite el lost pack clothes fair nay god wot may nat tel thousand part wrong trechery soch false people make neuer good bond set ye mite hert tourneth wenen sorrow dey pite false hert flow town ala therefore euer woman wold take wight grace till know full might assay trust woman con craft queint knowing vnderstand false disceiuable conjectments man beguilings lo fareth though ye men gronen crien certes disceit preueth well thends werking many woman haue lorn shame foul shent long lasting time thorow men gile haue disceiued euer fame shall dure deed rad song many londs han done recoueren shall neuer alway deemed lightly plite ayen fall slander tenes ye false men wicked cause right ought shame reproues holy discend thus arn ye nigh vntrew fair speche hert ful fickel cause han ye woman dispise better fruit ne sweter spice behoue mow ye find far worldly body stretchen loke forming making person god joy paradice goodnesse man propre body maked saw bible rehearsing god word wise good mankind make helper lo paradise help tree graffed linage man discendeth man noble fruit noble fruit sprongen blisse paradise men sory herts yet tree abideth noble help tree gentil jewel ben worshipped euery good creature hem anoieth doth shame comfortable perl ayenst al tenes euery company mirthed present truly wist neuer vertue woman therof root heauen worse tho sarazins lien faith vntrue tho renogates maken theron leasings fire doth wight bren blame wit put far heat fire gentillest element comfortable amongs fire cheef werker forthering sustenance mankind shall fire blamed brend fool disclaundring thilke hath hem gladded pleased impossible write nempne neuer later yet say knoweth way may lightly passe eke hearb proued may safely smertande sore laid say proued nothing soch euils gesse thing haue rehersed warne woman one lightly without good assay ye assenten man speach sun day light knowen moon shineth night thee thy self qd haue oft said know well thine hert thou art none tofore nempned people know well continuance thy seruice neuer sithen set thee werk might thy margarite pleasance freendship ne fairehede none point moued thine hert wherefore mine houshold hastely woll thou entre parfite priuite werking make know thy vnderstanding one priuy familiers thou desirest qd fain hear tho thing left ye forsooth qd great blisse qd thou shalt wene woman condicions fair spech thing belongeth thou shalt qd vnderstand first among thing cure seruice parfite blisse desired euery man herte neuer moche wretche euery man trauaileth diuers study seeke thilke blisse diuers way endes knitte selinesse desire parfite blisse soch joy men haue gotten liueth thing coueited desire soch perfection seruice kindly set louers herts yet erronious opinion misturn falsenesse wening although men vnderstanding misturned know shoulde beene way vnto person whither abideth yet wote loue euery wight weneth thing coueiteth come thilk loue parfite blisse seruants full blisse may lack thing blisse side eke followeth must haue full blisse lack blisse loue side therefore lady qd tho thilk blisse haue desired sothe forne self way rich dignite power renome wening tho thrages ben thilk blisse ayenst heer tourneth supposed best thilke blisse haue get come full purpose seruice sodainly hindred throwen fer abacke thinketh impossible come left woll well qd therefore hast thou failed thou wentest hie way littel misgoing ginning causeth mikell errour end wherefore thilk blisse thou failedst hauing richesse ne none thother thing thou nempnedst mowen make soch parfite blisse loue shall shew therefore worthy thilke blisse yet somewhat must cause way thilk blisse ergo soch thing way littel vsage openly iknow felest thine hert seruice thou art entred wenest aught thy self yet hie way blisse shall shew thee thou shalt con say contrary good lady qd altho suppose hert yet would hear thine word ye meanen matter qd shall good ilke blisse desired somedeal ye knowen altho perfitely kindly entencion leadeth thereto three maner liuings way shewed euery wight world haue blisse one ilk three way liues must proceede opinion great clerk arn name cleaped beastiallich reasonablich blisse ye long han desired wherefore truly life reason high way blisse think openly declare hereafter neuer latter yet little comfort thy heart shewing wt way thou art entred thy self thy margarite may know thee set high way woll enform thee wise thou hast failed thy first purpose thou wentest wrong leftest high way thy right side thus thou lookedst worldly liuing thing thee beguiled lightly therefore little assay thou songedst turned thy purpose shewed thee part high way tho thou abode therin death ne ferdnesse none enemy might thee thilke way reue euer one thine heart come thilk blisse thou arrested first time emprisoned thou wer loth change thy way thy heart thou wendest haue thou shouldest ruth seen thee miscaried wist well thine ablenes seruice encrease come self without mean visit thy person comfort thy hert parde coming thou greatly gladded time disease care tene might moue thy hert yet glad greatly enpited continually thou haddest mind good auisement thy conscience thy king prince huge word great looked variance thy speech euer thou ready sake pleasaunce margarite pearl many mo thy body oblige marces contraried thy saw stedfast way maketh stedfast heart good hope end truly woll thou well know see thee set changing heart haddest seruice made thou haddest grace thy king foryeuenesse mikell misdeed gracious king art thou mikell holden whose grace goodnesse sometime hereafter think enform shew ground moral vertue groweth brought thee werk brought grace made thy heart hardy truly haddest thou failed purpose neuer taken wise therefore say thou might well trust come thy blisse sithen thy ginning hath heard euer graciously thy heart desire hath proceeded siluer fined many heat men known true safely men may trust thee alway werking disease hath proued huge power holden yet might keep hemselue wretchednesse wretched king henry curtmantill ere died much couer member yet one greatest king normands offspring possession noble thing clear power founden mighty keep truly great fool thing would set knot thine heart also power realm thilk greatest power amongs worldly power reckened power han wretchednesse hemself followeth power feebler condition wretched wretchednesse ben cause knot euery wight hath reason wote well wretchednesse way may cause none knot wherefore power cause power haue wretchednesse hemself may right lightly preued power lacke side side power power wretchednesse power emperor king el realm power prince stretchen wide broad yet besides mokel folke hath commandement ne lordship lacketh power nonpower entreth vnder springeth maketh hem wretch power wretchednesse nothing el maner hath king portion wretchednesse power truly power vnmighty foreuer ben drede thilke power lesing may keeped sorrow drede sorrily prick euer herts little power whych careth feardeth selfe maintaine vnmighty wretchednesse entered feardfull wening wretch knot ymaked wretchednesse betweene wretch wretch thynge bewaylen wherefore knotte bewayled parfite blisse supposed ginning ergo power nothyng cause knottes wretchednesse kyndely property power way drede mowe eschew ne way liue sikernesse thou wost well qd hee nought mightye woulde done hee may done ne perfourme therefore qd king lord han suffisaunte full men thing mowen well ben holden nughty commaundements done neuer denied fool qd wot mighty wote nought mighty yt blind might wote footh qd wote must need adradde lesen wote might doubt hee mote needes lese leadeth dreade vnmighty retch le e little worth lesing reason retcheth nothing mighty power strength leasing ben withset commeth leasing may withsitte ergo thilke might leud naughty might arne ylike post pillar vpright stonden great might han beare many charge croke side little thyng maketh hem ouerthrow good ensample qd pillers postes haue seen ouerthrowed selfe hadden ben vnderput helpes lightly fall holdest thou mighty hath many men armed many seruaunts euer adradde hem heart gasteth hem sometime mote feare haue commonly agasteth ayenward werchen thus warnished mote warnish houre drede little might right leaude taketh heed seemeth qd famulers kinges great lord shul great might haue although sipher augrim haue might signification selue yet yeueth power signification clepe helpes post keep falling certes qd thilke skils eaud shore well grounded helpes shullen sliden suffer charge fall myght little auayleth thinketh qd poste alone stondyng vpright vpon basse may lenger great burthen endure croked pillers helpes ground siker sooth qd blinde bearing lame ginne stomble fall right pillers enuironned helpes fayling ground fayleth togider howe oft famulers pride prosperity ben suddainly uerthrown thou hast know many moment ferre ouerthrow recouer might neuer heauinesse falling cometh case fortune mow eschew might power strength thing void weiue lo whyche thing power tho men han ben agast time full hauing siker would weyue drede mowe little worthinesse fie therefore noughty thyng knot cause lo aduersity thilke foe glosed seemed friend wealth thus arne familiers foe enemy nothyng werse ne mighty annoy familier enemy thing may weiue truely might worth cresse ouer thing may withdrawe bridle fleshlye lustes wretched complaintes nowe thinke thy selfe truly mighty seen way lithe knot thilke people setten heart vpon might power often ben beguiled parde mighty may doe thing another may done selue men haue reat power ouer hym ouer justice deemeth men ayenward hath ben often deemed buserus slewe guest slayne hercules guest hugest betraished many menne collo betrayed swerd smiteth swerd shall smitten gan studien thyngs made countenaunce hand manner huisht let seene qd thinketh somewhat within thy soule troubleth thy vnderstanding say qd tho thinketh although man power haue might ouer mee haue ouer disprooueth might persone yet may haue power might neuer later see nowe qd thine leaudnesse mighty may without wretchednesse hee vnmighty may withsitte might ouer thee woll put wretchednesse thou might withsitte ergo thou seest thy selfe followeth qd wouldest thou scorn thou see flye han power done harme another fly thilke haue might ne ayenturning himselfe defend yes certes qd frayler thyng qd fleshly body man ouer whych haue oftentime flyes yet lasse thyng flye mokell myght greuaunce annoying withouten withsitting thi e mannes might sithen thou seest thine fleshly body kindely power fayle howe accident thyng surety substantiall wherfore thilke thing cleape power accident fleshly body may haue surety might whych wanteth substantiall body waye knot looketh aright high waye verely prooued richesse dignity power trew way knot rathe thing knot vnbound wherefore thing rede wight trust get good knot say renome people mouth shuld beene cause supposest thou thine heart certes qd yes trow slye reason dare safely say qd woll proue shrewes rathe shull ben knot good ayenst kind fayne qd would hear thinketh wonder renome well knit shrewe good persone renome euery degree hath auaunced yet wist neuer contrary renoume accorde shrewe may sinke stomacke till heare qd haue nat said always shrewes shull haue knot needeth qd reherse wote well euery wight kindely reason shrewes knitting woll eschewe qd good ought thilke knot haue el qd great harme qd good weiued put espoire knot desired qd ala thing thinke wene heauen weepeth see wrong beene suffered yearth good ought haue wight el goodnesse qd person may know outfoorth renome knower wherefore must renomed goodnesse come knot must qd el lost carpen soothly qd great harme good man might haue desire seruice thilke knot shrewe weined knowen generall lacking praysing renome consequence followeth shrew praysed knit good forsake vnknit ah qd tho haue ye lady ben abouten yet wold see grace argument better declared good bad accorden lacking praysing thinketh ayenst kind nay qd shalte thou see yerne element han contrarious quality kinde whych mow accord good bad quality accorde contrary quality accorden quality yearth dry water next earth wete dry wete ben contrary mowen accorde yet discordaunce bounde accorde cloud element ben cold right eyre next water wete eke hote eyre heat contrarieth water cold thilke contrariously oned moysture bee moist also fire next yearth encloseth dry wherethrough contrarieth eyre wete e accord hote thus accordaunces discordaunts joyned manner accordaunce accorden connection knitting togider accord commeth manner melody right noble right good bad arne contrary doings lacking praysing good lacked praysed badde lacked praysed wherefore contrariously accorde lacking praysing followeth though good neuer mokell praysed oweth ben knit bad el bad renome hath must taken well good oweth forsooth qd well qd renome way knot lo foole qd clerkes writen glory renoume glory glory thou art none thing thousand folke great sweller eares many one hath full great renome false opinion variaunt people fouler folke wrongfully beene praysed mallice people guiltlesse lacked needes shame followeth thereof hem wrong prayseth also desert praised villany reproofe disclaundreth good child qd echeth renome conscience wise man looketh measureth goodnes sleuelesse word people soothfastnesse conscience god nothing faire man name eched much folkes praysing fouler thing mo folke praysen said thee little beforn folke straunge country nought praysen suche renoume maye commen eares vnknowing obstacle sayed wherefore folke praysen right foule renome desireth wete lesse folk praysen renome enhaunce trow thank people naught worth remembraunce take ne proceedeth wise judgement neuer stedfast perdurable veine sleyng winde wasteth encreaseth truly glory ought hated gentillesse cleare thyng renome glorye enhaunce reckening thy linage gentillesse thy kinne seemeth gentillesse thy kinne praysing renome yt come thyne auncestres desert praysing renome desert make clear gentilesse mote need gentil gentle deed thou thy self commeth manner gentillesse praysing thy desert gentillesse thyne auncesters forrain thee maketh thee gentle vngentle reprooued thou continuest gentillesse therefore wise man one said better thy kin ben thee gentled thou glorifie thy kin gentillesse hast desert thereof thy self passing ye beauty fleshly body flittyng mouable flour summer thine eyen good linx yt may seen thorow many stone wals faire foule entrailes manner hewe appear thy sight yt foule sight fairnesse feeblesse eyen kind wherefore thilke way knot thilke went knot wendeth lo prooues none thyngs mowe parfitly ben vnderstanding beene way duryng blisse knot conclusion matter herkeneth word summer know ye winter shorter course draweth dayes december ye moneth iune spring may faden followen october thynges vnbounden old kind haue lost work proper estate men voluntarious withsit yt heuens gouerneth thing suffren thinges patiently werche man wt estate yet would ben chaunged thus queint thyngs blisse desired fruit commeth spring ni anguis bitter although whyle sweet may withhold hastely depart thus day fayleth thing yt fooles wend right thus hast thou fayled thy first wening yt thinketh sayle draw course starre de polo antartico shall neuer come northward ye contrary sterre polus articus whyche thing thou take keepe thy first outwaye going prison exile may cleaped ground falsed vnderneath haste thou fayled wight wene blameth hym stinteth misgoyng seecheth ready way blisse thinketh qd sufficeth shewing wayes dignity richesse renome power thou looke clearely arne wayes knot every argument lady qd tho ye han maked fore nempned matter mee thinketh hem full witte conceiued shall god wil contrary beguyled fayne would blisse knot declared might feele better howe hearte myght assent pursue end seruice hath begon qd melody heuen whych clerk cleapen armony breaking voyce manner sweet thyng kindly werching causeth ioy nomber recken joined reason wisedome quantity proportion knitting god made thyng reason witte proportion melody mow suffice shew written great clerk wise yt earthly thing lightly study trauayle yt knowing may getten heauenly melody mokell trauayle woll bring knowing right little sweetnesse paradice hath ravished seemeth ye slepten rested disease kindly heartes therein ygrounded blysse two heart full loue knitte may aright imagined euer contemplation ful thoughty study pleasaunce matter brynging comforte eueriche therefore earthly thyngs mokell matter lightly commeth learning knowledge vnderstanding nigh yee nigh ye couetise knitting heart soueraign desire hath euery wight little hearing heauenly conning mokell materiall purpose yearth right property seruaunts yt ben affyched stering little thing desire mokell matter lasse conscience blisse manner sowne delicious queint voice touched dinne note none impression breaking labour otherwise nempne wanting priuy word paradise terrestre full delicious melody withouten trauayle sown perpetuel seruice full joy coveited endure kind maketh heart vnderstanding sleep otherwise maye nempned ne manere name likyng sweetnesse nat declare sugar honey minstralcy melody soot gall comparison manner proportion recken respect blisful joy armony melody perdurable joy may nat heauens element twey kindly heart full knit trouth naturell vnderstanding withouten wening deceite heauens planet whych thing continually kindly accordaunces foryeteth al contrarious meuings passyue disease may sowne euermore thristeth werking thyngs proportion well joyned vndoeth thyng badnesse way may accompted certes qd thyng precious noble ala falsenesse euer wantrust euer mainteined joy void ala euer wretch thorow wrath enuy jangling dare make shoue melody far aback openly dare vsed truely wretch fulfilled enuy wrath wyght el flebring tale wretch dare appear openly euery wight eare full mouth charged mokell mallice moued many innocent shend god would soul therewith strangeled lo trouth blisse hid ouer al vnder couert hym hideth dare nat come place waiting shrewes commonly badness goodness amaistereth self soul joy would buy goodness much nobly melody qd wt goodness may accompted material world truly none shalt thou vnderstand euery thing good contrariaunt destroying euill el qd enuy wrath falsenesse generall qd yt wote euery man right mynd knot whych haue blesse contrariaunt distroyeth manner euils ergo good wt hath caused wight good dede find good knot cheefe cause needes mote good causeth many good deed euery cause worthier thing caused more possession thing lesse compted king people hath possession realme right knot good thou might recken thing lasse longeth oweth more cause worship tourne el rebell more defendyng voyde right euery goodnesse knot cause worship oweth tourne truely euery thyng hath profitably good nothyng hath profitably knot king maintayneth hem theyr power maintayne maketh misse amended good gouernaunce closeth herts togider rancour outthresten yt lengest keepeth lengest gladded trow qd heretikes misse meaning people hence forward woll maintain knotte therethrough shull maintayned vtterly woll tourne leaue old euill vnderstanding knit goodness profer fer seruice yt name seruaunts might haue jangle shall cease thinketh hem lacketh matter alledge certes qd loue good thus tourned thou sayest wollen truly perform yet shull abled party blisse haue wol yet shull servaunts werr wel susteyne mine help maintenaunce end good trauaile shullen reward meded endless joy body soul togider shullen abiden euer action blisse withouten possible corruption action perpetuell werke without trauayle euerlasting passyfe withouten labour continuell plite without ceasing coveited endure toung may tell ne heart may think least poynt blisse god bring thider qd continueth well qd end thou myght fail though thou speed yet shall passion thy martired life written radde toforne great iupiter yt god routh high hollownesse heauen sit trone euer thou shalt forward holden among heuins knight mightest pennaunce discomfited martir liuingly going gnawn bone certes qd good word comfort little mine heart rejoyced merry wise ye qd heauen feeleth joy first heard thereof speak qd wist sooth disease comfort would follow bliss ye haue often declared would well suffer passion better cheare thoughtful sorrow endless think cast welfare yet daineth euill none heart none heed meward throw thing would greatly wayes comfort disport weten selfe little ymoned sorrow peisen ballaunce ye weight pea slinges daunger heauily peisen drawe cause high yt eyen semen lite right little qd heauen sky foul cloud maken dark wether great tempest huge maketh merry dayes soft shining sonnes also year withdraweth floures beauty hearbes yearth year maketh springes jolity vere renouel painted colour earth seemed gay heauen see blasteth wawes throweth shippes liuing creature great perill hem dreden right see maketh smooth water golden sayling comforteth hem noble hauen first ferde hast thou qd learned thy youth iupiter hath wardrobe garment joy sorrow wost thou soon woll turne thee garment care clothe thee bliss parde ferre fro thee lo old prouerb alleadged many wise bale greatest bote nie bore wherof wilt thou dismay hope well serue well shall thee saue thy good bileue ye ye qd yet see reason bliss comming wote contingent may fall another qd haue mokell done clear thine vnderstanding void errours thy mind woll proue reason thy wo may alway enduren euery thing kindly qd gouerned ruled ye heuenly body hauen full werching earth course body course doings gouerned ruled kind thou wost well course planet dayes proceeden euerich singular houres enterchaunged stoundmele submitted worching naturally suffer whyche chaunges cometh transitory time maketh reuoluing yeares thus stoundmele euery hath full might worching till seuen han course worchings possession hour ye day week haue take name denomination seuen planet lo sunday ginneth first hour noon saturday hour sunne ful might worching sunday taketh name next followeth venus mercurius moon saturnus iouis mar ayen sunne forth xxiiii houres togider hour ginning ii day stant moone maister time rule munday taketh name course followeth day generally course nature body changing stinten certain term limitted first kind hem gouernments elemented world proceden spring constellation engendrures followen kind reason wherefore course followeth sorrowe joye kindely moten enterchaungen time alway one wele alway one wo may endure thus seest thou apertly thy sorow wele mote changed wherfore case better side euermore encline thou shouldest truly next end sorrow anone entreth joy manner necessity woll ne may none betide thy contigence disproued thou hold opinion thy wit right leud wherefore full conclusion al thilk margarit thou desirest hath ben thee dere thy hert hast thou suffered many thoughtfull disease hereafter shall cause mokell mirth joy look glad canst thou beene cease thy passed heavinesse manifold joyes woll blithely thee speaken thy mirth joy haue yheard thy sorowes thy complaint mowe aught thy joy encrease trouth side shall nat leaued manner trauaile might right blithely woll helpe euer ready please thanked lady goodly manner yt worthely coud truly greatly rejoiced mine heart faire behest profered slaw yt would ordain life lested thinketh qd ye haue right well declared way knot beene none disproovyng thing order purpose asketh ye shew way thither thilke way openly may sey high way full confusion thing thou shalt qd vnderstand one three liues first said euery creature mankind sprongen forth proceedeth liues thorow name departed threee manner kind bestiallich manlich reasonabliche two vsed fleshly body third soul bestial among reasonables forboden euery law euery seet christen euery wight dispiseth hem liueth lust delites thrall bounden servaunt thynges ryght foule beene compted werse men shall nat degree reckened ne one allowed heriticks saine chosen life bestiall voluptuously liuen first said thee manly reasonable liuyngs matter declare manlye life lyving flesh el fleshly wayes chese may nat blisse knot conquered reason proved wherefore reasonable life must need haue sith way knot nat first tway liues wherefore need mote third liue flesh nat flesh reasonablich manlych rekened clerkes therefore way commeth woll blithly declare see qd bodily good manlich liuings yeelden sorrowfully stounds smertand hour well remember end worchings ben thoughtfull sorry right bee hath honey anone flight beginneth sting thilke bodily good last mote away sting going wherethrough entreth clean voideth blisse knot forsooth qd thinketh well served shewing word although little respect among great worthy yet fair parcel thoght time forthering sustenaunce dured thought hauyng mokell honey mine estate richesse sufficiauntly weiue neede dignity reuerenced worship power thought keep fro mine enemy seemed shine glory renome manhood asketh mean wight mine administration coud none euils ne trechery soth cause put lady selue weten well tho confederacy maked soveraigns na seruaunt yet mokell meane folke woll fullye ayenst reason thilke matter mainteine maintenaunce glorien themself often ye hauen said thereof ought nothing euill laid ward sithen repentant tourned think neither tho thing ne none sustene vtterly destroy without meddling maner might cast sweetnesse blysse mischeeuously stongen passed joye sorrowfully must bewayle liue wretch euery tho joyes turned contrary richesse haue pouertye dignity enprisoned steede power wretchednesse suffer glory renome dispised foulich hated thus hath farne fortune suddainly ouerthrowen wealth dispoyled truly thinketh way entree right hard god graunt better grace ere passed way lady thought right sweet certes qd loue list chide aileth thy dark dulnesse woll clerenesse sharped haue many reason thee shewed bodily good failen yeue blesse might ferre fo th woll stretch shame qd say thou liest thy word thou ne hast wist right bodily good one commonly dwellen togither plenty hath rich kin ashamed another linage ryght noble well know pouerty handeleth leuer vnknowe another hath renome people praysing may haue ouer hated defamed thing right foule another faire semely dignity faileth yt hath dignity crooked lame el mishapen fouly dispised thus partable good dwellen commonly one houshold ilde lo wretched trust thing woll accord thinketh thou clepest thilke plite thou selinesse fortune thou sayest silinesse departed thou art wretch followeth vpon thy word euery soul reasonable man way dye death endeth selinesse maketh wretch needes fortune maketh end soules death body wretchednesse lyuen know many han getten blisse heauen death may life maken men blisful passeth yeueth wretchednes many time blisse life con liue wolt thou accompt fortune first hath done thee tene sorrow thou looke maner glad thing sorrowful thou maist nay yet namely thou standest noble plite good ginning good forth going hereafter thou wene wretch wealth passed art thou well fortunate badde thinges anguis wretchednes ben passed art thou come first hostry life el world art thou suddaine guest wretched exile wenest thyng yearth stable thy first arrest passed yt brought thee mortal sorrow ben mortal thing agone ignoraunce beastiall wit haste receiued reason knowing vertue comfort thy hert knowyng sikerly seruice grounded wost thou well said death maketh end fortune standest thou noble plite litle heed recking take thou let fortune passe ding el flie list thy liue parde man hath nothing lefe life hold doth cure dilligent trauaile say thou art blisful fortunate selie thou know thy good yt thou hast yet loued whych nothing may doubt yt ne ben worthy thy life qd good contemplation qd well vertue time comming plesaunce thy margarite pearle hastely thyne heart full blisse shall eased therefore dismay thee fortune hate greeuously ayenst thy bodily person ne yet great tempest hath sent thee sithen holding cable ankers thy life holden knitting fast yt thou discomfort thee nought time ne dispair thee time come yeuen thee comfort hope well doyng getting double thy lesing encreasing loue thy margarite pearle thereto hiderto thou hast full danger thou might amend yt misse defaultes yt sometime thou diddest thy time ilke margarite full seruice lore thine heart hath continued wherefore ought much rather encline fro daungerous seat thing ben yet knit holding anker thy liue holden mote god pray thing full performed anker holdeth hope thou shalt safely escape thy true meaning seruice bring dispite false meaners thee new haten true seruice thou art entered certes qd among thing asked question whych way knot truely lady tempt question answeres speaking first seruice full purpose pricke hert thilk seruice enprisonment alway bad naughty manner desired ne getting knot may nothing availe wise gentill heart looketh vertue none bodily joyes alone toforne tho wayes set wot well selfe haue erred blisse failed way hugely haue ron certes qd yt sooth thou hast miswent eschew yt path hence forward rede wonder truely mortall folke world seech way outforth priued self lo ye ben confounded errour folly knowing cause way goodness vertue thing thee precious thy self thou shalt haue thy power thou wouldest neuer lese way may taken fro thee thilke thing cause knot deth mowe reue yearthly creture thilk thing abideth thy self soul conclusion make knot thus getten abideth thing soul long last soul dieth neuer vertue goodnesse euermore soule endureth knot perfite blisse soule blisse endlesse shall enduren thus shull herts true knot eased thus shull soules pleased thus perpetually joy shul sing good truth qd good beginning yeue v way qd sayd thee long sithen reasonable life one three thing prooued soule euery soul reason hath two thing steryng life one vertue another bodily workyng soule maister ouer body manne maister himselfe man maister ouer liueth vertue goodnesse reason vertue teacheth soule body worching vertue togider liuen reasonable life whiche clearkes clepen felicity liuing therein hie way knot old philosopher hadden knowyng diuine grace kindely reason alone wenden pure nature without helpe grace might haue ishoned liuings reasonably haue liued thinke hereafter god woll haue space thilke grace leude knowyng declare leaue tyme said foorth looketh wayes knot conning know way foorth sleepeth time wherefore woll way know must leaue looking false way foorth open iyen conscience vnclose hearte seest hath trust bodily life busie bodily woundes annoint keeping smert may healed yt woundes true vnderstanding taketh heed knowing euen foorth sleepeth hard anone knowing awake ginneth priuy medicine healing true entent inwards lightly healeth conscience well handled must need wayes come soule steryng lyfe body el may man come perfite blisse knot thus way shall come knot perfite silinesse wende haue bodily good outfoorth ye qd shall haue knot rich power dignity renome manner way ye qd yt shall shew thee riche yt hath suffisance hath power man may amaistrien greate dignity haue worshippe reuerence hath glory renome whose name perpetuall duryng nomber comparacion thing men wenen getten foorth qd ye qd loken thing naught thereof ne party longe mowe gapen soth qd therfore qd yt sechen gold greene tree wene gader precious stone emong vine laine nettes mountaynes fishe thinken hunt deepe sea harte hinde sechen yearth thilke thing surmounteth heauen may hem say foolish ignoraunce misledeth wandryng wretch vncouth wayes shullen forleten maketh hem blinde fro right pathe true way yt vsed therefore generall errour mankinde departeth thilke goodes misse seching haue hole sought reason thus goeth beguiled sought hode men haue blowe iape qd man vertuous vertue liueth hath thing shall prouen qd power hath man let liuing vertue prisonment disease take paciently discomfiteth tiraunt ouer soule power may haue hath yt man tourmented soche power yt nill discomfite ne ouercome may sithen pacience soule ouercometh ouercommen soch thing may maistred hath neede nothyng hath suffisaunce inow helpe thilke thing thus hath power suffisaunce tiraunt may reue hath dignity sette naught thynges great dignity death may maistry wherefore thilke power suffisaunce enclosed dignity reason renome must haue thilk rich suffisaunce ye look thilke worshipfull dignity ye coueit thilke power might yee shuld trust thilke renome glory endlesse endureth ni substaunce vertuous liuing certes qd sothe see well vertue full gripe encloseth thing wherefore sooth may say trouth vertue margarite brought first seruice haue knitting jewell sodaine longynges ne folkes small wordes onely conuersacion togider seeyng thentent true meanyng flourishing vertue pacience yt vsed nothing euill quite wicked leasings false tongue oft haue laid haue sey selfe goodly foryeuenesse hath sprong hert vnity accorde aboue thing desireth good meeke maner suffreth many wicked tale truely lady great worship people mirth man vengeable wrath gouernance punishment ought haue plato cause seruaunt scourge yet cleped neighbour perform would least wrath maistred might haue laid moch euermore grounded vertue sheweth entent fro within truly wot well goodnesse vertue thou hast desired seruice pleasaunt well thy selfe thereto fully hast profered good lady qd vertue hie way knot long haue ihandled ye forsooth first way thy trauail idel touching second way see well thy meaning thou wouldest conclude thou coudest bicause brought thee seruice euery servant help come bliss said beforn thou saidest thy self thee seruice yet art thou seruant say thou might werch vertue hereafter shalt thou seruant seruant accompted habit maketh monke ne wearing guilt spur maketh knight neuer later comfort thine hert yet whether engendrure maked morrow eue thus saith kind perle precious margarite thou seruest sheweth self discended nobley vertue heauenlich dew nourished congeled meeknesse mother vertues werks men seen justification punished therefore grace goodness wight found sorrowful herts good meaning endure comforted vnite accord herts knit joy abide wenest thou rejoyce el accompt emong seruants pleaseth pallas vndoing mercury pallas knitte title law according reasonable conscience mercury haue grace suffered el weneth moon fairness eue sterre lo otherwhile night light moon greatly comforteth darke thought blinde vnderstanding loue yeueth great gladness list bileue sooth tale shewed adew adew bliss name entred wise folk worthy gentillesse vertue liuing yeuen full credence soothnesse loue good herte good euidence experience sheweth contrary thus mightst thou haue full prefe thy margarites goodnesse commendment jewel badnesse iuelnesse stoundmele disease yeueth seueral hour joy trouth qd well declared margarite good sithen good passeth many goodnes vertue wherethrough maner necessary must good goodnes margarite nothing el vertue wherefore vertuous failed vertue side lack vertue bad nothing el ne may lack want good goodnes haue lack sain bad may good good thinketh good consequence seemeth vertuous lack vertue haue sun know shine ne vertues herbes haue kinde werchyng ne vertue stretch goodnes profite another vertue wayes reason sithen mercy pity ben commended among vertues might neuer shewed refreshment helpe comforte need kind werking vertues trewly wene shall vary helpes fyre yeue none heat fire deemed sunne shyne sunne accompted water wete name shal chaunged vertue werch goodnes doth fail contrary ye name shall reversed impossible wherefore contradictory necessary need must leue certes qd thy person thy mouth word lien well said thine vnderstanding leued entent margarite alone spech conclusion word thynges qd list shewe openly shall founde matter thy sicknesse shall medecine may thy sorrowes liste comforte well thee amisse erred way walked droppe good amendement dwelled theyr heartes prouerbes salomon openly teacheth sometime innocent walked way blindnesse darke night whome mette woman lefelly say strumpet arayed redily purueyed turning thought vein janglings rest impacient dissimulacion term saying wise come dronken sweet pappes vse coueitous collinges thus drawen innocent oxe larder lady qd queint thing vnderstand pray parable declare entent innocente qd scholer learning lore seching blisse thing day thought turning enclineth eue sonne light fayling maketh darke night conning thus darknesse many douts walketh blindenes vnderstandyng ne wote wt way forsoth soch one may lightly begiled came loue fained clothed liuery vnlefull lusty habite softe spech mery faire honied word heretikes mi meaning people skleren wimplen errours austen witnesseth heretike first beginning man right expert reason sweet word werkes miscorden thus fareth fayned loue first werchinges thou knowest thing trew thou hast hem proued experience sometime doyng thine person thing thou hast found matter mokell disease fained loue redily purueyed thy wittes catch tourne thy good thought trewly hath wounded conscience many florishing mokell jangling word good worthe thanked glose glad prudence thou hast manly veined art thou moche holden thy kind course good meaning returne thy minde trow ne shewed thee thy margarite thou haddest neuer returned first good parfite joy euer fayned loue impacient water syloe whiche euermore floweth stilness priuy noyse till come nygh brink ginneth measure bolne nouelleries chaungyng storm course euery rennyng point spill circuit bank thus fayned loue priuely fullest flowyng new storm debate arayse mercurius often hole vnderstandyng knowen soch perillous matter yet veneriens lusty leude theyr wit soch thing right litell naught done fele wryten cryen fellow blisse joy thus one errour mokel folk drawen come sayne dronken pappes falla lying glose mowe souke milke health deadly venym poyson corruption sorrow mylke falla venym disceite milke lying glose venym corrupcion lo thing commeth pappes vse coueited collinges desire meddle false wordes sote sote false truely sorinesse fayned loue need surfets sicknesse must follow thus ox thy langoryng death wert thou drawn sote smoke hath thee defased euer ye deeper thou sometime wadest sooner thou found thee killed littell wonder side trew seruants faynen ne disceyue conne soothly doyng open foundement endureth ye burthen neuer great euer one lasteth yeueth lyfe blisfull goodnesse laste end though ginnings sharp thus two contrary contrary ben effect thilke margarite thou seruest shall seen thee seruice perillous tribulacion delyuered bycause seruice new disease fallen hope amendment last end joy gladded wherefore kinde pure mercy grace good helpe shall graunt el shall straine pity shall ben amaistred remembre thine heart horrible sometime thyne margarite thou trespassest great wyse ayenst thou forfeitest cleape ayen thy mind know thyne owne guiltes goodnesse thyne guiltes goodnesse bounty mokell followyng pity found thou time wert thou goodly accepted grace plucking foryeuenesse enclined stired draw thee house yet wendest thou vtterly euer haue ben refused well thou woste sithen yt soche sharp disease might greatly auayle wt thinkest thy witte ferre may wit stretch thou lach thy side woll make knotte certes thy good bering woll accorde psauter haue found david seruice true holy oyle peace rest long desired vtterly shall annointed trust well woll thee fayle lening first way good hert continuaunce yt see grounded purpose parfourme draweth maner constrayning needes must thine helper although mirthe taried shal come soch season thy thought shall joyed would neuer god sithen thyne hert reason arne assented openly haste confessed thine amisse going criest mercy mercy followed thy blisse shall ready ywis thou ne wost vntill end transitory time shewed true way fordoing badde ycleped time grace thing yeuen desert yelding one benefite another onely goodnesse ye yeuer grace thilke tyme well vnderstand shapen saued may vnderstande first errour misse goyng shewed sorrowful pine punished cried mercy second grace good way proued fayling without desert thilk first misse amending correction tho errours euen way bryng comforte welfare amendement wexing third joye blisse graunted well deserue hath sauour vnderstandyng tyme grace thus joye third booke shall matter till end speciall cause haue heart make processe aright let sen wight mowe louing well get thereof first nothing haue spring either must willing willing willing may haue sithen faileth matter forth bring matter faileth may thereof haue knowing till grace put heart thus willing may haue willing may haue parde euery conceit euery reasonable creature otherwise grant affirmatife willing way mow accord although louing woll come mine hert freenesse arbitrement book fully shewed yet owe therfore much allow free grace margarite leaned neither might without grace toforn going afterward following thilk grace get ne keep lese shall neuer free make willing otherwise grace hath granted right person taketh willing sober throweth away willing dronk el taketh drinking measure thing anone done maketh guilt free leseth grace thing therefore vpon nobley grace mote trusten busie cure set thilke grace keep free otherwise reason werch cause grace void thus must look free grace right naturel vsage engendering child may ben without father ne also mother neither father ne mother begetting may lack right grace free accorden without hem maye louing party getten yet free getting thing mokell thank worthy grace ne keeping therof much thank deserueth yet getting keeping done accord truly oftentime grace free helpeth fordoing contrary thing willing loue accorden strength aduersities withsit wherfore together grace oweth accepted willing deserueth free louing wise accorded remember well booke heed taketh considereth thing werchings mankind euenly accordeth tourning word loue trouth el rightwisenesse whether like thing falleth man helping free arbitrement thilk rightwisenesse take el keep man shall saued thing booke mention hath maked euery point thereof grace oweth thanked wherefore say euery wight hauing rightwisenesse rightfull yet therefore feel conscience rightful behoten blisse euerlasting hem rightful withouten vnrightfulnesse man degree may rightfully ben accompted chast men living yet janglers full enuy pressed hem shall blisse neuer ben deliuered right blisse without maner need right man shall yeuen rightful void maner vnrightfulnesse found man blisse shall followed rightful vnrightfulnesse bound degree fully know rightfulnesse much none euil cause manner goodnesse truly mother helpeth spirit withsit leude lust fleshly liking strengtheth mainteineth ye law kind otherwhile weneth harm precious thing follow ther nothing cause somewhat el commeth taketh heed rightfulnesse forsooth werne many holye saintes good sauour sweetnesse god almighty folk sauour death deadly end come saint rightwisenesse wicked men badnesse hath proceeded truly thilke lady loue learned affection nempne willing profitable thing euill fleshly lust consenteth ayenst reason soule thing clearely vnderstand know whence thilke vicious readye euill deed performe grace ginning ordained thilke goodnesse euer haue endured neuer badnesse haue assented men beleeue god thilk maked vicious first father adam eue vicious appetite vicious appetite consenting one thing kind thing done first man first assented hold profitable shew first condition reasonable creature woll considered apertly looked lightly cause may shewed intention god rightfully blessed reasonable nature ben maked keep neither blisfull ne rightfull might withouten rightfulnesse thilk rightfulnesse heretoforn shewed blisse thilk blisse euery manne hath thilke bliss thereof abiding bliss euery vnderstanding suffisaunce couenable commodity without manner need whether bliss angel el thilk grace first paradice suffered adam haue although angel bliss adam paradice yet may denied adam paradice ne suffisaunce bliss right great heart without manner coldness yet may another hearte heat haue right nothing defended adam paradice blissed without manner need although angel bliss much forsooth followeth lass another haue therefore needeth want thing behoueth may need cleaped adam first ginning god margarite weten mean forsooth need wretchedness god without cause toforn going made reasonable creature wretched vnderstand loue first maked god made therefore man blissed without manner indigence togither one tooke reasonable creature bliss blissedness rightfulness rightfulness selue liberty arbitrement free thilke rightfulness may keep lese wise ordained thilke two instrument cleaped heretoforn mention maked vse thilk rightfulnesse teaching soul good manner gouernaunce thought word vse blisse obedient manner withouten incommodity blisse forsooth man profit rightwisenesse worship god deliuered one rightfulnes yeven man might lese lost continuelly haue kept haue deserued aduancement fellowship angel thing lost neuer forward mow ayenward recouer well blisse angel blisse himwards comming nome one depriued thus fill man vnto likenesse vnreasonable beast hem corruption vnlusts appetite vnder throwen yet blisse dwelleth indigence good lost great wretchednes right ben punished thus weiued rightfulnes lost hath blisse fail desire commodity may commodity reasonable nature hath lost may haue false lust bestial appetite tourned folly vnconning hath beguiled wening thilk commodity owen ben desired affection liberty arbitrement enduced wiln thus thing maked evil vnrightful absence rightfulnes thing reason euer haue freenes arbitrement may wiln haueth thilke help keepe without grace may ben recouered commodity much vnrightfull maked willing euil lust willing goodnesse may wiln instrument affection thralled sithen thing may wiln instrument affection desireth yet cleaped instrument woll affection wilneth affection desireth thilk thing whereto instrument leadeth free vnlusty affection full seruant maked vnrightfulnes may releeue without rightfulnes full freedom may neuer haue kindly liberty arbitrement without vein idle forsooth wherefore yet say often haue said instrument lost hath rightfulnes manner grace may ayen retourn rightfulnesse wiln sithen nothing rightfulnesse alone wiln euer wilneth without rightfulnesse vnrightfully wilneth vnrightful appetite vnthrifty lust fly desireth mokel ben kind ben bad ben nrightf l bad ben reasonable creature way suffred vnreasonable beast neither ben euil ne vnrightfull kind knowne may well ben thinges toforne declared man hath alway thilke rightfulnesse duty right euermore hauen waye himselfe may get ne keepe hath lese recouer shall neuer without especiall grace wherefore commune sentence people opinion euery thing destiny ruled false wicked beleue tho predestination well good bad sithen said god hadnest made neuer ne wrought suffereth hem maked hardeth nought missayeth led temptation deliuereth wherfore none inconuenient maner said god toforn haue destenied bad bad werks hem ne euil deed neither amendeth ne thereto hem grace leveth speciallich predestination goodnesse alone said great clerk god doth goodnesse werchen negatife hereof badnesse holden lady loue hath learned aright book looketh vtterly predestination properly god may demed befornweting chapitre god befornweting loue rehearsed matter apertly may founden thing god ben togither presence truly presence predestination nothing disaccorden wherefore learned god weting free choice mowe stonden together thinketh reason leadeth destiny free accorden neither hem nothing contrarieth reasonablich may deemed often thing falleth free werching man another man wrongfully annoyeth wherefore sleeth constrained end mokel folk crieth saith lo destenied god toforn know thorow necessity fall otherwise might betide truely neither wrong wrought ne venged none thilk thing necessity wrought free willed neither wrought perfourmed vtterly grace free goodnes bringeth keepet fro badnes tourneth thinge thanke deserueth grace maketh sentence vertue abide wherfore body soul full plenty conning good deseruing euerlasting joy day dome shull endlesse dwell shull ben learned kingdom mokell affect loue grace least joy shall greatest glory rejoyce gladded joy wonder haue false louers little wenen haue right mokel lo instrument false true euenlich proportioned affection place goodnesse followeth think hereafter declare vse instrument taketh name wilned thing vtterly grace catch thy blisse desired rewarded thou must haue affection full vse time asketh wisely governed soothly disciple without feruent affection wil may man saued affection good seruice good loue may grounded without feruent desire thing coueited neuer retcheth haue haue affection hath resting place thing cometh mind taken heed commin come therfore place affection faileth thilk affection little thorow goodnes come grace littlenes wil suffer ail way help certes grace reason thilk affection followeth affection reason knit dureth euerich true heart euermore encreasing feardnesse strength may remoue truth heart abideth soothly falshede ginneth entre truth draweth away grace joy thilk falshed truth hath thus voided hath vnknit bond vnder standing reason hert bond vndoth vnknitteth purpose first accord knitteth contrary reason vnreason lo vnreason bringeth man blisse grace thing pure kind euery man ought shun eschew knot reason confirm thinketh qd thy studient look thou wenest word contrarien saying heretoforn place thou sometime affection thing han brought thee disease haue thee counsailed void thine hert discouer made thy wil ben changed thou wenest argue withhold keepe shortly say reuers word may ben found though dronkennes forboden men shul alway ben drinkelesse trow right thou thy reason tourn thy one reason vnbind say thy thy first purpose unreason closed construe forth remnaunt thee good liketh truly reason bee knit together free reason time thine hearte assentaunt thou might chaunge thou rule reason vary whych variaunce come thilke blisse desired contrariously thou werchest nothing may know reason loue alone thou void loue weuest bond knitteth need el right lightly gonne sondry wherefore thou seest apertly yt loue holdeth knot amaistreth hem bound thing ring circuit wreth ben knit thy soule without departing ah let let qd needeth rehersail make soul yet parfit blyss thinking yt knot truly lady haue ground well vnderstonde thing thilke spire yt tree shuld wexe expoune yt thyng ye thereof mean shall qd blithly take good heed ye word thee rede continuaunce thy good service long processe time full hope abiding without change wilne thine heart ye spire whych well kept gouerned shal hugely spring till fruit grace plenteously sprongen although thy good yet may therfore thilk blisse desired hastely thee discenden must abide sesonable time processe growing thy good travail shall wex till found mighty wind euil speech ne scornes enuy make nat trauail ouerthrow ne frost mistrust ne hailes jelousie right little might haue harming spring euery yong setling lightly smal storm apeired woxen somdele greatnesse han great blastes weather little might disauantage hem werch mine owne soueraigne lady qd welth mine hert liking vnto noble grace therethrough nat displeased suppose ye erren ye maken jelousie envy distourbour hem yt ben seruaunts haue learned oft toforn time yt euery louers hert great plenty jelousies greeues ben sow wherefore thinketh ye ne ought manner accompt thilk thing among welked winers venomous serpent enuy mistrust euil speech fool qd mistrust foly euil wil medled engendreth ye welked padde truly destroyed jelousie vndone euer yet manner jelousie wot well euer redy heart trew seruaunts thus jealous ouer least cause disease jealousie full thought euer kept ferdnesse lese loue miskeping thorow leudnes el thus least thou seruest feruently beset better liketh yt thy good seruice counteth nat cresse jealousy heart acceptable quality ben deemed oughten euery true louer kindly euermore hauen mind till fully yt grace blisse seruice discended yt jelousie catcheth el wening foolish wilfulness mistrusteth truly fantasie venime foule beguiled euil wil hath grounded thilk matter sorrow leud soul yet nat euery wight shuld trust ne euery wight trust ne euery wightfully misbeleeue ye mean thing owen vsed soothly withouten causeful euidence mistrust jealousie wened wise person commonly leud wickednes nat find yt wise euil nat acomered abide wel time til grace bliss seruice following haue mokel eased abiding tofore hand hath diseased certes lady qd tho nothing wondreth sithen thilk bliss precious kindly good well worthy kind medled loue reason ye toforn haue declared anon hie one sprong springeth ye tother anone ye one commeth receiueth ye euery thing yt kindly place full appetite euer commeth thiderward kindly draw kindly thereto constraineth ye kindly stede bliss medled vnbide need yt haue kindely wherfore thinketh anon yt wil shewed kind profereth thilk bliss shuld hie thilk receiue el kind goodnes worchen hem shuld lo sun neuer ferre euer hath kind werching earth great weight hye loft caried stinteth neuer till come resting place water ye seaward euer ben drawing thing yt light blithely sink euer ascendeth upward draweth thus kind euery thing kindly course place sheweth wherfore kind good anone sprong blisse thereon discend kind would dwelleden togider haue ye said self certes qd thine heart sitteth wonder sore bliss haue thine heart sore agreeued yt tarrieth long thou durstest thinketh thine word blisse wouldest thou blame yet say thilke blisse kindly good kindly place ye vnbide neuer ye later comming togider kind ordinaunce nat sodainly may betide must abide time kind yeueth leue man medled gon shew thilke blisse hast folowed lightly coming lightly cause going long time thrusting causeth drink delicious atasted qd many bliss see day mine eye first moment sight accord yea yet assenteth singularly reason faileth trauail none seruice time queint ease thereof atast commen foorth earth kind withouten man cure businesse traueil thilk herb men liuelode necessarily seruen without goodly life creature mowen enduren ben nourishen mankind without tilth yet good seed sow oft crop faileth bad seed neuer well traueiled thilk blisse thou spoke lightly comming truly nat necessary ne abiding better stamped venomous jeuse wrongen likely enpoysonen ye certes qd qd three quarter full pearl certes qd rich gift qd mokell azure qd precious gift full qd noble gift one good faith qd wanting english naming noble word cannot preciousnesse yeue name earthly rich may ben amended yeft hast thou yeuen know self thy margarite thilke gift hath receiued thing reward hath self bound thy gift said maner rich may amended wherefore thing may nat amended thou shalt thy margarites rightwisenesse rewarded right suffred yet neuer euery good deed sometime yold would thy margarite reward thee quite right neuer dieth thy mede merite woll puruey certes suddain blisse thou first nempnest right hem reward well worthy tho thine eye seemeth reward desert passe right send bitternesse euenly reward suddain blisse always reson great goodnesse may accompted blisse long long abideth endlesse woll last see thy wil endles thou lovedst euer thy euer tabide neuer change euen head reward must ben done right must need thy grace blisse endlesse joy vnbide euenlich disease asketh euenlich joy hastly thou shalt haue qd sufficeth alone good neuer well reason medled good seruice long trauailed seruice men come joy thinketh wexing tree ye first meued trouth qd hast thou conceiued thing thine heart hastely shalt thou bee able verye joye parfite blisse receiue wote well thou desirest knowe manner braunches tree spring thereof lady qd heartely pray leue woll right soone shall ataste fruite longe haue desired thou haste hearde qd wt wise tree toforn haue declared ground stock wexing first ye ground thy free full thine heart stock said continuance good seruice long time trauail till greatnesse right well woxen tree greatnesse hath caught haue rehersed branch yt ye fruit foorth bring speech must need voice prayer complaining wise vsed ala qd tha sorrowfully wounded hideth speech spareth complaint make shall speke care pain euen like hell sore hath assailed ferforth pain throng leue tree ser neuer shall fruit forth bring certes greatly eased dare preuy mone discouer true fellow conning hath might wherethrough pleint thing may amended mokel joied heart hardines dare complain lady care suffreth hope mercy grace auanced truly say sith came margarite serue durst neuer discouer manner disease well later hath mine heart hardied thing done great bounty worthy refreshment grace goodly without desert halue oft hath rekened nere goodnesse grace mercy medled passen desert trauels seruings degree might endite would wene without recouer getting blisse euer thus haue stilled disease thus haue couered care bren sorrowfull annoy gledes coal wasten fire vnder dead ashen well hoter fire ashen ouerlein right long wo haue suffred lo qd loue thou farest thinketh palsie euil hath acomered thy wit fast thou highest forward anon suddainly backward thou mouest shal nat yet thy leaudnesse thy brain dull ben thy skilful vnderstandings thy wil hath thy wit amaistred wost thou well qd euery tree seasonable time bourioning shew blomes fro within sign wt fruit spring el ye fruit yt year men halt deliuered ye ground neuer good tho stock mighty ye full branch seer burions shew farewel gardiner may pipe yuy leaf fruit failed wherfore thy branch must burionen presence thy lady thou desire fruit thy lady grace beware thy life thou wo delay vse asking thing stretchen shame might thou speed way espy vertue woll suffer villanye himselfe cours ere fruit able tasted shent shame foul rebuked speech fire brenning sore smarteth disease thinketh full long er water come fire quench men gon leche body buried lo seemly fruit wexeth thinketh thing nat thorow necessity thorow liberty saue necessity free tofore said thinketh vtterly declared thinketh lady qd nat displease euermore reuerence keep yt thing contrarien vnderstanding ye sain sometime thorow liberty also thorow necessity haue yet sauour without better declaration wonder qd thing sithen day thou shalt see thine eye many thing receiuen hemself reuers thorow diuers reason thus pray thee qd thing ben reuers commen gone bid thee come thou come bid thee go thou go thou reuersest fro thy first coming soth qd yet qd thy first alone diuers reason full reuersing vnderstand qd ne tetchen rose thou sekest okes thou shalt haue honey soukles thou leauest fruit soure dock wherfore thou desire blyss parfite joy thou must set thy purpose vertue followeth look bodily good sayed thou writyng thy second book thou hast set thy self noble place vtterly lowed thyne heart misgoyng thy first purpose setteles easier spryng lighter thy soul grace lissed truely thy desire say thy algates mote ben stedfast matter without chaungyng stedfast man may void yes parde qd may tourned friend disease manace threatening lesing life limmes many wise commeth mynd also mote oft thought remembraunce may hold one thyng continuelly heart neuer lusty desired see qd thou thy shall follow thy free grounded continuelly abide thy free thou louest hast loued yet shalt louen margarite pearle thy thou thinkest hold thy knitte loue chaunge new lust beside wyll teacheth thine hert manner varying although thou threatened death el wise yet thyne arbitrement chuse thy loue voyd el hold thilk arbitrement maner judgement desire thy heart thou deeme loue thy good fayleth art thou worthy blisse good deserue thou chuse continuance thy good seruice thy good abideth need blisse following thy good wil must come strength thilke judgement thy first taught thyne heart abide halt eschange thy reason accorded truly maner thus shall abide impossible tourne thy heart true euery man dilligently meanyngs consider shall well vnderstande good knitte reason false heart neuer voided power might keepyng good liberty arbitrement heart good keep may nat fayle eke fail sheweth selfe good keeping thus false putteth good anone constraineth heart accord louing thy good accordaunce false thyne heart falsity likened togither yet little woll say thee good wil thy good wils raise strength take heed qd thy willes thou shalt vnderstand right ye han body diuers member fiue sundry wittes euerich apart owne thing instrument ye vsen hand apart handle foot go tongue speak eye see right soule hath hym certayne steryngs strength whyche vseth instrument certain doyngs reason soule whych vseth thynges know proue whych vseth wilne yet neyther ne reason soule eueryche hem thyng soul right euerich hath thus singular instrument hemselfe han well diuers aptes diuers manner vsings thilke aptes mowen cleaped affection affection instrument willing appetite wherfore mokell folke saine reasonable creature soul thing feruently wilneth affectuously wilneth thus may tearm equiuocas three wayes vnderstand one instrument wylling another affection instrument third vse setteth werke instrument willyng ilke strength soul thee constraineth wilne right reason instrument reason ye vsen ye looken affection instrument thyng ye draw desirously thyng wilne coueitous manner time mind come thought thilke thing remember anon ye ben willing thilke done el haue thus instrument affection also wilne thing said wilne health nothyng thereon thinketh anone commeth memory affection wilne sleepe mynde anone remembred wilneth sleep time commeth doyng affection neuer accordeth sickness ne alway wake right true louers affection willing instrument wiln truth seruice affection alway abideth although sleping threatned el thereon thinkyng anone commeth mind anone stedfast abide vse instrument forsooth another thing haue ye ye willed thing affect instrument purposed desired manner vsage seruice wisely needeth ruled question cum minde grate lustie desire ladie enformed lewdnesse amende certes know men wittes aske aunswere shuld say leude self mokell learnyng yet mee behoueth haue made therefore could sufficiently would matter yaue sentence dull witte hindred stepmother foryetyng cloude vnconnyng stoppeth light margarite pearle wherefore may shine desire good reader also coueite pray good booke amender
