also pray euery man parfitely mow knowe intencion hert treatise haue draw sightful manna desert child israel spirituel meate bodily also men body nourished yet neuer later christ signified right iewell betokeneth gemine stone vertuous el pearle margarite woman betokeneth grace learning wisedome god el holy church bread vertue made holy flesh god saith spirite yeueth life flesh nothyng profiteth flesh fleshly vnderstanding flesh without grace loue naught worth letter sleeth spirite yeueth lifelich vnderstanding charitie loue loue charity god graunt v therein frended thus testament loue ended phere endeth testament loue lamentation mary magdalen treatise taken origen wherein mary magdalen lamenteth cruel death saviour christ plonged wawe mortal distresse ala wo shall complain shal deuoid great heuinesse fro woful mary woful magdalen lord gon ala wrought tein sodain chance perseth hert depe nothing waile wepe lord gone graue laied great passion death cruell hath thus betraied man tell become prince israel iesus nazareth ghostly succour parfite love hope honour creature hath hence caried might sodainly befall would taried haue purpose bought ointment full precious royal wherewith hoped corp anointed thus gone mind dispointed therefore aduertise behold pitous chaunce presence full little maruaile though hert cold considring lo lordes absence ala full negligence sould found come late men may say infortunate cause sorow may vnderstand quia tulerunt dominum meum ne may fonde wote nere ubi posuerunt eum thus must bewayle dolorem meum hartie weping better deserue till death approch hert kerue hert opprest sodaine auenture feruent anguish wrapped long lyfe may endure soch paine soch mortall wo neuerthelesse party shall go hope find myne owne turtill true liues ioy souerain lorde iesu sith ioy call presence thus remoued full mone ala made prouidence mishap wherefore sigh grone succour find place might gon fain would man hert breake may complaine speake alone stand full sory full sad hoped haue seen lord king small cause haue merie glad remembryng bitterfull departing world creature liuing good gracious loue also gold precious full sore sigh without comfort cure saluacion brenning loue hert doth constrain ala wofull permutacion whereof find joy consolacion therefore payne onely confesse death feare woll end heauinesse wo anguish intollerable bide life sustaine go hence paine vncurable find know place certain thus thing twaine may take may refuse hert wounded hereon think muse shall stand mournyng hope vision would appere loue might tell good tidyng joy might chaunge wepyng chere trust grace mercy dere least though therewith kill shall spare waile wepe fill die soch auenture welcome chaunce bone shall rest sepulture lyfe death ordinaunce shal told euerlastyng remembraunce thus departe shame also thereof nothyng blame hope hath course ytake thus shall die see right well lorde hath forsake conceipt cause know none though farre hence nothyng nye yet wofull hert hym doth seeke causeth teares ren doun cheeke thinkyng ala haue lost presence world sustenance cry call herty diligence wight giueth attendance certifie myne enquirance wherefore world wray lord slaine borne away though mourne great wonder sithe joy speciall thinke farre asonder see feare neuer shall helpeth call ne enquire coste ala thus gone loste iewes thinke full misery set malice busie cure force might gileful trechery hath entermined lordes sepulture borne away precious figure leauing nothing haue done marred ala shall vengeaunce insaciable haue entreated reporte lamentable beate body toppe toe neuer man borne felt soch woe wounded ala greuance blood doun reiled habundance bloody rowes stremed doune ouer assayled maliciously scourge stroke bestiall spared smote incessantly satisfie malice full busie spit face smote groned full sore sweate many tere crouned thorn sharp kene veines rent blood ran doun apace blood ouercome iyen bolne stroke blessed face entreated men without grace kneeled made many scorne like hellhound haue torne vpon mighty crosse length brede turmentors shewed cursednesse nailed without pitie drede precious blood brast largenesse strained along men mercilesse jointes mine apparence riued asonder great violence beholding mine iyen twain stode beside rufull attendaunce euer thought pain loked deadly countenaunce said speciall remembraunce farwel magdalen depart must need hen hert tanquam cera liquescens rufull sight gan behold witte almost destraught tare heere hand wrang fold sight hert drank soch draught many fall swouning caught brused body falling ground whereof fele many greuous wound wretch ful al frowardnesse gaue drinke eisel tempred gall ala poison full bitternesse loues chere caused appall yet thereof might drinke spake wordes thought best father heauen consummatum est kneeled doune paine outrage clipping crosse within mine armes twain blood distilled doune visage clothes eke droppes distain haue died would full fain auayle sith suspensus patibulo thus lord full dere disguised blood pain wound many one veines brast joynts riued partyng asonder flesh fro bone saw hing alone cum inquis deputatus est like man like leprous beest blind knight men called longias speare aproched vnto souerain launsing side full pitously ala precious hert claue twain purple blood eke fro herts vain doune railed right fast rufull wise christal water brought paradise beheld wofull passion wote sodain auenture hert peersed compassion remayned life nature stroke death felt without measure death wound caught wo opprest brought point hert shuld brest wound hert blood darling shall neuer slide fro memoriall bitter paine also tourmenting within soule grauen principall speare ala sharpe withall thrilled hert felyng body soule departyng soone might releued vp againe breth coude well restore felyng selfe drowned great paine body soul thought al tore violent falles greeued right sore wept bledde selfe fared one life nothing cared lokyng vp rufull roode saw first visage pale figure pitous sight spotted bloode saw neuer yet liuyng creature exceeded bound measure man mind wit fiue nothing able paine discriue gan mine armes vnbrace vp liftyng handes full mourningly sighed sore sobbed place heuen earth might haue herd cry weping said ala incessauntly ah sweet hert ghostly paramour ala may nat thy body socour blessed lord fierse cruell cursed wight hath thee slaine keruing ala thy body eueridell wound within wound full bitter thy pain wold might thee attaine nayle body fast vnto thy tree payne thou might go free report ne make rehersaile demening circumstaunce well wote speare euery naile thirled soule inward resemblaunce neuer shall remembraunce lyfe woll cause waile oft remembre bataile ah ye iewes worse dogges rabiate ued thus cruelly aray neuer displeased caused debate loue true herts coueyted aye preched teched shewed right way wherefore ye like tyrant wood wayward haue thus slaine reward ye ought haue remembred one thing special fauour grace magnificence prince borne lord ouer ye toke small reuerence full meke suffring offence neuertheles ye deuoured one assent hungry wolf doth lamb innocent pite people mercilesse arming self falsheed treason lord ye haue shewed woodnesse like men beestes without reason malice suffred season payn woll come thinke slack man without mercy mercy shall lack ye traitours maintainer madnesse vnto folly ascribe paine ye haue depriued joy gladnesse dealing lord soueraine nothing shuld need thus complaine liued peace tranquillite ye haue slaine iniquite farewel noblenesse somtime rain farewel worship glory fame hereafter liue hate disdaine maruaile ye trespace blame vnto shame tourned good name vpon woll wonder euery nation people vile reputation wicked wretch hound hell haue told playne sentence content dere loue thus quel yet must embesile presence perceyue couert violence haue conueyed displeasure lafte naked sepulture wherefore trouth rightful judgment malice againe may acquited verdite auisement false murdre shall endited theft also shall respited hast shall hanged draw woll selfe plede cause law ala trewe attendaunce still abidden lordes corse kept still trewe perseueraunce befal wofull deuorse paine welcome force shal songe euer go departing ground wo see right well paine smart wound greuous dolour wound carefull hart sith haue lost thus paramour sweetnesse tourned sour mirth heart nothing may conuey beareth thereof loke key ioy excellent blissed paradise may ala wise comforte song angel nothing may suffise min harte make disporte al refuse might resorte vnto loue well goodliheed whose longing trowe shal deed painful labour tourment corporal make thereof none exception paine hell wol passe ouer loue find mine affection great delectacion thousand time martred would bee blessed body one might see world large compasse shal spare renne life foot also shall rest one place til loue may heare tiding whose absence hand wring thinke cease shall neuer mind gentil iesu shall thee find ierusalem wol serch place fro place sion vale iosaphat also find space mount oliuet bethany wol go wayes wol wander many mo nazareth bethleem mountana iude trauaile shall paine see blessed face might see finde serch would euery coste countrey fardest part egipt hote inde shulde little iourney thus gone taken away knew full trouth certente yet care released might wildernesse thinke best go sith tydings may life lede fro may dwel man apere towne ne village woll come nere alone wood rockes caues deep may mine wil waile weep mine eyen twaine withouten variaunce shall neuer cease promise faithfully weepe great aboundaunce bitter teares renning incessauntly teares medled full petously blood euer shall renne also expressing mine hart greeuous wo worldly fode sustenaunce desire none liuing find soch woll take rootes growen craggy stone shall suffice water lake thus may say lord sake fuerunt mihi lachrymae meae deserto pane die ac nocte body clothe maketh force mourning mantel shal sufficient greuous woundes pirous corse shal full royal garnement departed thus best content crosse nailes scourge withall shal thought paine speciall thus wol liue haue told may long tyme endure fere death ouer bold purpose sure paynes encrease without measure long lyfe lay reason thing mortal hath season sigh full sore ferre yfet mine herte feele bledeth inwardly blody teares may wise let sith paine find remedie thanke god die perfourmed hold content soule let haue hath lent lenger endure intollerable woful harte inflamed huge sorow myne comparable sith mind finde refuge yet require rightful iudge deuoide fro inwarde sorow lest liue next morow within mine hart impressed full sore royal forme shape semelines porte chere goodnes euermore noble persone gentilnes well part fitnes redemer mankind loue best hart soule mind absence paynes full bitter right well may fele inwardly wonder though hurte slee cause crie rufully mine hart oppressed wonderfully onely bright blee ala trowe shall neuer see ioy translate full farre exile mirth chaunged paynes cold lyfe thinke endureth anguish payne behold wherfore hand thus wring fold graue loke call pray death remaineth life borne away must walke wander god wot partes shall dresse quaking hart weepyng many tere seek loue sweetnes wolde wist mortall heuines mine hart reneweth wold nat keepe pite long store without may long endure loue sore worketh within brest euer wepe sepulture sighing full sore mine harte brest lyfe shall obtayne rest mourne wepe euer go making complaint al mortall wo fast crie audience comming hider please soule opprest absence ala list set mine harte ease wherefore payne self al disease shal spare till take grace el shall sterue place one might speake al ioy parfite pleasaunce might herte breake shuld anone deuoid al greuaunce blisse recreaunce ala nothing steed ioy naught haue wo noble corse within mine hart rote deep graued shall neuer slake gone place ne wote mourne wepe al sake sith past vowe make hartely promise thereto bind neuer cease till may find vnto mother thinke go haply comfort may take one thing yet feareth mo mencion make wordes wold trimble quake coud blame hauing one son borne away mother wol mone sorowes many hath suffred trewly sith first conceiued bare seuen thing specially drowneth hert sorrow care yet lo wise may compare one knew wold paine euerichone renew great sorrow mennes saying whan temple simeon iustus shewing word prophesiyng tuam animam pertransibit gladius also herode tyrant furious childe pursued euery place life went neither mercy ne grace mourned knew gone full long sought found ayen whan went death crosse vpon sight rewful paine whan hong thereon theues twaine speare vnto herte thrust right swouned ground pight whan deed bloody lappe lay blessed body hand fete tore cried said wel away thus araide neuer man whan hast made body bore vnto sepulture remaine vnnethes wo coude sustaine sorowes seuen like swerds euery one mother herte wounded fro syde syde knew sonne thus gone world shuld death ride care coude lenger abide hauing joy consolacioun standing stacioun wherefore see dare nat presume fro presence wol selfe refraine yet leuer die consume mother haue pain neuertheles sonne would see ful fain presence ioy sweetnes absence sorrow heauines sith may nat mete desire aboue thing nede must take sour swete noble corse tiding full oft cry hand wring myne herte ala relenteth paine brast senew vaine ala vnhappie woful hour wherein thus mispended seruice mine intent eke true labour none effect may come wise ala thinke doe dispise list take simple obseruaunce death finaunce haue called sed non respondet mihi wherfore mirth tourned mourning dere lord quid mali feci tibi comfort find erthly thing ala haue compassion cry yf fro faciem tuam abscondis consumere vi within myne herte grounded thy figure world horrible tourment may aswage without measure brenning feruent remember lord haue bin diligent euer thee please onely mo myne herte thee euer go therefore dere darling trahe post te let stand thus desolate quia non est qui consoletur myne herte thee disconsolate paine also nothing moderate list thee speake aliue come hast herte asonder riue thee profer lo poore seruice thee please mine owne entent offer deuout sacrifice boxe replete pretious oyntment myne eyen twaine weeping sufficient myne herte anguish fulfilled ala soule eke redy loue pa naught el haue thee please pay mine herte gold pretious stone thine without delay hertely chere thou shuld haue anone suffrest thou stand alone thou hast trow weeping disdaine el thou knowest nat paine thou withdraw thy noble daliaunce ought euer displeased thee thou knowest right wel ignorance knowledge certainte haue offended lord forgiue glad make full repentaunce thing hath bin thy greuaunce myne herte ala swelleth within brest sore opprest anguish paine peeces forsooth woll brest see thy blessed corse againe life ne death nat refraine thou make delay thou maist sure myne hert woll leape sepulture ala lord farest thou thus tribulation yet haue mind thy mercy thy pite euer trusted thee find sometime thou good kind let please thee prayer accept teares haue bewept thou oughtest haue routh sith thee mourning sith thee yplighted first trouth neuer varied discording knowest thou best owne darling constrainest thou thus waile wo forsooth thee nothing availe haue endured without variaunce right thou knowest thy louer iust trew hert thought aye thine ordinance like saphire alway one hew neuer chaunged thee new withdrawest thou presence sith thought thine absence hert intier sweet lord crie thee encline thine ear petition come voliciter exaudi remember mine herts dispositioun may endure conditioun therefore paine libera thou art pone juxta te let behold iesu thy blissed face thy faire glorious angellike visage bow thine eares complaint ala conuey rage ala lord take fro dommage desire mercy condiscend none thou may greuance amend yet good lord thee beseech pray thou raised brother lazarous death life fourth day came ayen body soule precious great thing maist thou shew vnto v thy selfe power thy godhead thou lying graue dead mine hert wounded thy charite brenneth flameth incessauntly come dear lord ad adjuvandum long paine multiplie least mean time depart die thy grace put hope confidence pleaseth thy high magnificence flood death tribulatioun soule feele entred full deepe ala consolatioun euer waile euer mourne weepe sorowhath wounded mine hert ful deepe deare loue maruaile though die sagittae tuae infixae sunt mihi wandring place wildernesse comfort haue ne yet assuraunce desolate ioy replete faintnesse answere receiuing mine enquiraunce mine herte also greued displeasaunce wherefore may say deus deus non est dolor sicut dolor meus mine herte expresseth quod dilexi multum may endure though would faine solum superest sepulchrum know right well huge paine thus loue may life sustaine god muse ayleth thee quod sic repente praecipitas ala see wol none otherwise must take leaue euermore bitter paine hath almost discomfite loues corse wise restore ala wo euer bore tombe must die starue death heart carue testament woll begin make god father soule commend iesu loue died sake heart giue send whose loue life maketh end body also monument bequeath boxe ointment will lo make last right place within sepulture woll buried dead past vpon graue woll haue scripture within resteth ghostly creature christ true louer mary magdalaine whose hart loue brake peeces twaine ye vertuous woman tender nature full pitie compassion resort pray vnto sepulture sing dirige great deuotion shew charitie condition sing pitie let herts weepe remembring dead layd sleepe ye begin part fro ended haue mourning obseruance remember wheresoeuer ye go alway search make due enqueraunce loue mine herts sustenaunce euery towne euery village ye may noble image happe grace last ye true loue find cost say magdaleine dead past pure loue hath yeelded vp ghost say thing loued might death eschew may paine sore euer renew token loue perpetual buried place present take mine hert root al close within boxe ointment deare loue make thereof present kneeling downe word lamentable message speake faire tretable say selfe commend thousand time herte free poore token say send pleaseth goodnesse take gree right fee asked said long giue thy heart desire adue lord loue faire face adue turtle doue fresh hew adue mirth adue sollace adue ala sauiour lord iesu adue gentillest euer knew adue excellent paramour fairer rose sweeter lilly flour adue hope pleasure eternall life wealth prosperitie mine heart gold perle orientall mine adamant perfite charitie cheefe refuge felicitie comfort recreatioun farewell perpetuall saluatioun farewell mine emperour celestiall beautifull prince mankind adue lord heart liberall farewell sweetest soule mind louing spouse shall neuer find adue soueraine gentilman farewell dere heart hertely thy word eloquent flowing sweetnesse shal ala mind recomfort wherfore life must end bitternesse world shall neuer resort thee mine heauenly disport see ala woll none farewell ground dignitie adue fairest euer bore ala may see blessed face welaway shall see thy blessed visage replete grace wherein printed perfite sollace adue mine hertes root euer farewell must thee disceuer soule anguish full thursty faint right sore heauinesse lord spouse cur dereliquisti sith thee suffer distresse causeth thee seeme thus mercilesse sith thee pleaseth make end manus tuas spirit commend pfinis prologue remedy love seeing manifolde inconuenience falling vnbrideled prosperitie tempred mortal prudence nothing wealthy youth freeltie moued right equitie youth wele somewhat write whereby may himselfe safecondite first note thing noyous vnto youth greeuous maladie among u called loue encombrous vexing yong people straungelie oft force causeth hem die age eke turmented loue bineath girdle aboue wherfore werk right laborous age need nat hond take youth oweth obsequious begin thus worke sake may feruence loue aslake louer mitigatiue none preseruatiue mighty lord gouerneth youth meane measure pace euery matter concerneth first behouefull woll aske grace forthwithall place ere begin woll kneel sa word helpe pray flouring youth hast auauntage strength body lust beaute also precelling hast aboue age many singular commodite howbeit one thing hath beyond thee thy profite greatest auaile shuld conduit mean sad counsaile yet good lord presumption nill depraue thy might deitie liue vnder thy protection thy subiect weare thy liuerie thou art ground prosperitie freshest floure garland singular aid well vnderstand oweth lord best seruise entire faith honour support right speake none wise knowledge selfe one least sort thy seruannts elder comfort draw sad counsaile thee thou list thee thy power may resist fie age vnder word erronious opinion spekest saith vntrue youth ill dispositioun dampneth v without exceptioun colerable auauntage saith resteth counsaile sage well may sad counsaile rest yet deed ben ferre therefro may say parish priest say selfe know one two well striken age neighbourhed woll neighbour wiues bed presence young man clippe kisse ye doune lay bleare eye thus saieth suffer ye old morel play haue doen may thus saieth husband queme man misdeme word deed nedeth coy impossible doe amisse yong man speake anone saith boy rebuke age beseemeth thee iwis thus old face aye warrant sleight subtiltee ferre reason tell thee shortly age aboue age impotent resistence age vnweldie may fight flee age without defence sad counsaile saist thou giueth assistence reason freshest wherefore thy saying thou art blame sith reason rather accompanied vnto age whith opinion euery wise man denied sith sad counsaile proceedeth reason sad counsaile hath cheef mansion nay end thy suasion doest entend age compare vnto thine excellence nill presume dignifie ye egall howbeit experience auauntageth certainly teacheth thing contrary oft foresee warely eschew thou neuer assaidest yet knew experience maketh man certaine thing yearthly necessite sad counsaile requireth certaintie plaine ferre moue thus whereto need purpose thou commandest shortly mine entent thus none vnder thy license counsaile brother shuldest thou giue counsail yong lacking experience vnto thine owne speach report wote well thy tong wil serue thee right wel teach doubt lest thy wit woll reach youth experience thou saist conuert shouldest thou teach well vnexpert scripture witnesseth yt god oft shitte fro hie witted man shew child meane witte presumeth debonaire mild counsaile entend vertue bild mine elder part haue borowed part experience wch haue sorowed wel thou lettest fare shew forth thy doctrine agast woll thee support looke thou spare maugre age though frete gnast aske age counsaile herein wast boldely begin go forth processe feare sith thou art surenesse graunt mercie lord sith thee doeth like license woll dare boldly assail purpose scripture autentike werke woll ground vnderset fortefie aspire beginning thou wood furie alecto thy susters especiall mother ielousie iuno call explicit prologus remedy love book drawn part proverb solomon warning take heed deceitful company woman werke shall see rede incongruitie impeche ordinately behoueth first procede deduction thereof manner leche patient siknesse oweth first seche known medicin applie shortly shape remedie right counsaile willing thee exhort yong man prosperous doth abound thy floures lust belongeth thee sort first consider root ground thy mischeefe plainly found woman farced fraud deceit thy confusion allectiue bait fly miswoman least thee deceiue thus saith salomon tauyt fully falshed woman day conceiue lip strumpet ben sweeter hony throte saith soupled oil flatery howbeit end effect bitterer wormwood gall fly miswoman louing thy life ware straungers bland eloquence straunge call thy wife beauty haue concupiscence countenaunce pretending beneuolence beware signes eye amiable hold ferme ben deceiuable lo ensample woman signes countenaunce shortly woll shew thee louers three loued one woman right entirely ech knew others maladie wherefore daily labour coud approch next fauour sundry season fortune requireth seuerally came see welfare one happened loue fireth see lady would spare others coming none ware till mette whereas place lady saw desired face supper set full smally eat full sober demure countenaunce taried none hem meat lady giue attendaunce secret wise signifiaunce loue haue perceiuing fetely executed thus properte due season alway espied euery thing execute conueniently one louer first friendly eied second offred cup courtesly third gaue token secretly vnderneath bord trade foot entrailes tikled hert root leaue might ask question maisters selve loues trace likely belongeth solution three stood grace clerely answere ye would ask long space matter doubtfull opinable acertaine woll selfe enable foresaid three selfe one man answere better hertely v beloued none wattes packe bare last selfe gan aspie time thought left daunce thoughtfull hert great thy greuaunce hence fro hence endite halpe aye afore ye mus nine whilom ye wont mine light penne direct braine illumine lenger ala may sewe doctrine fresh lustie metre wont make haue afore vtterly forsake come hither thou hermes ye fury fer ben vnder v nigh nether pole pluto reigneth king infernall send thine arpies send anguish dole miserie wo leaue ye sole right present must pain eke turment pale death beseemeth absent call lothsome sort pain tencrease sorows augment worthie bare comfort thus sith haue consumed mispent day fold talent lord committed cant recompence may derely abie negligence path penaunce yet woll reuert well grace mercy fetch despisest god meeke contrite hert cock crow ala would retch yet late second wetch mercy shall purchase incessaunt cry mercy lord euer shall sing well maist thou wail wicked woman thou shuldest deceiue thus innocent recompence sinne al men wol make leue monument shewing part thy falshed mine entent much cannot well wote cause sheweth plainly yt thus wrote ye yearth parchment scribable speedie hand manner wood hewed proportioned pen able water inke damme flood euery man parfit scribe good cursednesse yet deceit woman coud shewed meane pen flie odious resemblaunces deuils brond call woman might whereby man encensed mischaunces stinking rose faire sight deadly empoyson like sugar white sweetnesse causeth man tast sodainly sleeth bringeth last manner vse language doctrine may lawfully woll holly ground authoritie sage willing wisedome vertue edifie wine woman apostasie cause wisemen fall say wisedome cause forget way wherefore wiseman doth thee aduise whose word found leasing straunger sit wise thy wife fall clipping beware eke kissing keep wine altercation least thine hert fall inclination may man thinkest hide safe lay fire bosome without empairement brenning clothes whider may walke hote cole foot brent saith nay whereby ment foresaid prouerbe similitude thou ridde thee plainly denude flatterer forgetting gide gide youth mean shamefastnes shuld cause maidenhead abide god behest eke full recheles retching committeth forgetfulnes neither god ne shame hauing place need must woman lacke grace neigh way sinne tourne grace shall lacke influence pathes life come wherefore first friend thee sapience remembring god prudence thine owne weale thee keepe vnto thine hert least word creepe book take ground prouerbes sage salomon telleth tale plainly found fifth chapiter whider deed meekely feined instruction let clerkes determine sure much like thing haue vre window saith looked fair yong people saw many among hem looked yong man fortuned lent mine eye estraunged mind likely street corner nigh hous went eye right curious day light gan withdraw night approched twilight woman came met saw talking vnder shade night blessed god qd might hath fulfilled mine heart desire assaked paine hote fire yet mine authour skill follow must tell arrayment full nice soules like spill nice countenaunce yet garment jangling rest impatient wandring still place stode restlesse yode house strete corner standeth await incessauntly busie pray gete bring lure doth lait left vnto matter strait woll tourne againe mette sweetly kissed friendly hem grette word curtesie many diuerse right part haue told purpose reherse flattering said visage bold haue made vowes offering manifold thy sake mine hert loue dere day thanke god performed therefore came made thus astart desirous welfare see haue seene pleased mine hert faith shall none haue loue ye true pray hertely dere hert come home man welcome good faith sooth say comming ran thought herke eare bed fresh gay haue behanged tapettes new bought egipt far country brought steined many lustie fresh hue exceeding gold iasper value chamber strowed mirre insence sote sauoring aloe sinamome breathing aromatike redolence surmounting olibane man dome ye shall betweene breast rest ye come let v haue desired halsing may safe till morning mine husband home went forth journey farre way hence bagge money hath hent thought needfull expence vnto word giue faith credence moone yong light dull ere come home woll full thus craftely hath besette lime roddes panter snare selie soule caught nette sugred mouth ala nothing ware thus left gracelesse bare helpe comfort ghostly succour furthermore saith mine authour beast led death doth pant yong man followeth stound wanton lambe full ignorant pulled drawen bound vnto time hath death wound like bird hasteth grin knowing perill life therein gentle sonne saith salomon take hede word thy breast keepe make fast let thy mind way mislede deceiued lese thy tast many hath wounded many doune cast many strong hath lost breath way way hell leading death little narration precedent woman manifold gilt attend yong man ala hath shent deceiued husband next friend god doth offend break spousail weight furdermore shew woman craft sleight woman dore sate stall see folke passe street cite eye countenance eke gan call prety one come nere come hither ye piggesnye ye little babe last said yong man hartlesse deceit vnware defencelesse much sweeter saith acceptable drinke stollen priuely tha taken forme auowable bread hid gotten jeoperdously must need sweet semblably venison stolne aye sweeter ferther narrower fet better woman saith salom festes yong man woteth doth fede dark deepnesse hell ben ghests beware yong man therefore thee rede cheefly thy good spede werk compile haue take charge must pity charity enlarge selie man thus begiled husband mean woll wepe waile painfull infortune whereby reuiled causelesse neuer conuaile euery man yong old woll assaile word occasion loth name ala good soule nothing blame coud ill wold blame demerite leaue opprobrous name cokold aproper dispite ransake yet would might worde true ortographie discent ethimologie well ground first inuencion know ortographie must deriue coke cold composicion reason nigh contriue written know beliue yet lo reason ground two wordes compound one cause giue judgement themilogie let v first behold eche letter hole word doth represent c put colde old k knaue thus diuers men hold first parte name haue found let v ethimologise second first finder ment sure c calot haue l leude demeanure craft enuentour ye may see lo one name signifieth persones two colde old knaue cokold himselfe wening eke calot leude demeaning second cause thimposicion foresaid name jealousie jelouse greatest occasion cokold men aspie though passion firie continuell feruence heete pacient aye suffreth cold feete jelous aye drede full melancolie gallie ire wiues nose misse trede woll cut ye conspire death woll desire perceiuing brasteth gall anone great woodnesse doth fall soone hath knit knot tame ramagious mekely sitteth doune taketh lot layed lookes furious late cocke bataylous hote quarell auenge bold called coke cold saying curtesie dissonant seemeth malice grewe rude treatise woll plant parcell thereof onely shewe opinion talcatife shrewe ill saying euer merie man thereof werie parcell booke woll graffe sad counsaile whereby wedded man daigne looke better shall mowe gie prouide said infortunie haue said complaine woll partener great paine expedient weale would jelousie abject jelous conceale labour circumspect know wayes seeme suspect breake one word broken woll misse woll wroken forbid thou noldest haue looke thing forbod thing prone namely ill good till executed nigh wood soch woman soch feat craft craft labour defeat thou hereafter single man shouldest jelous thou haddest wife wedde thou trust woman el shouldest lede carefull life thou lothest full rife yet nill gainesay matrimonie melius est nubere quam uri say better wedlocke wife take church doth kenne vnder flesh yoke fleshly lust alway brenne said jelous menne liue chaste hold lasse ill wedde self spill single man yet wedde wedded man thus rede warne farre spedde late forbedde let take owne need soch counsaile told word folowing eke behold thy water keep wiseman doth teach thou wise let haue issue narow rifte way woll seach semblably woman vntrue giue free walke al wise eschue large thine hand walke woll thee shame thou shalt balke wedded single thus saith wiseman day night euermore lithe thy bosome wife yet lemman loue hote least thou repent sore least thee bring ill lore thy wife loue yet nill support thou dote thus thee exhort lo thou loue loue eke thine honestie idell woll betide sit idell necessitie mind woll search ferre eke wide namely accompanide accompanied yong men maiden meane woman maiden seruants right conuenient house helpe doe seruice may vse commaundement season owne deuice teach hem good yeue thine aduice make huswiues thus businesse may yet refraine idlenesse bide thou wolt haue thine entent might letting craftely encourage thereto meanes commending moch duely menging praise blame thy reason first praise wisely place season faithfull hert full tender one thing call remembraunce though wit slender power suffisaunce purpose make purueyaunce sith woman nature vnchaungeable freale ware also disceiuable thy wife excellently good none better disposicion processe time might turn mood misse liuers instigacion diuers men thilke occupacion aplien daily minde eke hert goodnesse woman peruert thou aspie suspect person draw thy wife beware wise thy suspeccion breake one worde though thine herte agrise kindle fire smoke woll arise though corrupt entent perauenture assent explicit complaint mar venus gladeth ye louers morowe graie lo venus risen among row rede floures freshe honour ye daie sun vprist wold sprede ye louers lie drede flieth least wicked tongue aspie lo yonde sun candell jelousie tear blew wounded hert taketh leue saint iohn borow apeseth somewhat paine smert time cometh eft yt cessen shall sorow glad night worth heauy morow saint valentine foule thus heard sing vpon thy day sun gan vp spring yet sang foule rede awake ye haue chosen humble wise without repenting cheseth make yet least renoueleth seruice ye haue full chosen deuise confermeth perpetually dure paciently taketh auenture worship high feast yet woll briddes wise sing sentence complaint least wofull mar made departing fro fresh venus morowning phebus firie torch rede ransaked hath euery louer drede whilome three heauens lorde aboue well heauenlich reuolucion desert hath wonne venus loue hath take subiection maistresse taught lesson commaunding neuer seruice bold louer dispise forbade iealousie cruelty boste tyranny made lust humble tall dained cast iye tooke patience liue die thus bridleth maner nothing scorning chere reigneth blisse venus hath worthy knight gouernance singeth mar serueth thus faire venus causer pleasaunce bint perpetuel obeysaunce binte loue euer trespace disceuer thus kint reignen heuen loking fell tide assent set steuen mar shall entre fast may glide next palais abide walking course till ytake prayed hast sake said thus mine herts lady sweete ye know well mischief place sikerly till meete life stante auenture grace see beaute face drede death may smert lust ease mine hert hath great compassion knight dwelleth solitude till come stode ilke time wight counsailed ne said welcome nigh wit sorow ouercome wherfore spedded fast way almost one day tway great ioy betwix hem two mette may tong tel unto bedde go thus ioy blisse let hem dwell worthy mar yt knighthood well floure fairnesse happeth arm venus kisseth mar god arm soiourned hath mar rede chambre amidde palais priuely certaine time till fell drede phebus yt commen hastely within palais yates sturdely torch hond yt stremes bright venus chambre knockeden ful light chambre lay fresh queene depainted white bole grete light knew shon shene phebus cam bren hem hete silly venus ny dreint teares wete enbraseth mar said ala die torch come al world wol wrie vp sterte mar list sleepe lady herde complaine nature weepe instede teares eyen twaine firy sparcles sprongen paine hente hauberke lay beside flie wold nought ne might hide throweth helme huge weight girt swerde honde mighty speare wont feight shoketh almost wonde full heuy walken ouer londe may hold venus company flie least phebus espy woful mar ala maist thou sain palais thy disturbaunce art left behind peril slain yet double thy penaunce hath thine hert gouernance passed halfe stremes thine eyen thou nere swift wel maist thou wepe crien flieth nenus ciclinius tour void corse fear phebus light ala hath socour ne found ne sey maner wight eke littel might wherefore selven hide saue within gate fledde caue darke caue smoking hell nat two paas within yate stood naturel day darke let dwell wol speake mar furious wood sorow wold haue seene hert blood sith yt might haue done company ne rought mite die feble wext hete wo nigh swelt might vnneth endure passeth sterre day two neuertheles al hevy armure foloweth liues cure whose departing tooke greater yre brenning fire walketh softly paas complayning pitie saide lady bright venus ala euer wide compas sphere ala shall mete hert dere twelve dayes april endure ielous phebus misauenture god helpe sely venus alone god wold happed weping venus made mone ciclinius riding chyuanche fro venus valanus might palais see venus salueth maketh chere receiueth frende full dere mar dwelleth forth aduersite complayning ever departing wt complaint remembreth therefore lusty morowning best wol saine sing woll leaue take god yeue euery wight ioy make complaint mar order complaint requireth skilfully wight shal plain pitously mote cause wherfore yt men plain men may deme plaineth folily causeles ala wherfore ground cause al pain troubled witte may attain wol reherse haue redresse declare ground heuinesse first time ala wrought certain effect hider brought lorded intelligence yaue trew seruice thought euermo dere haue bought great excellence wight yt sheweth first offence wroth taketh cure may long ioy love endure fained mater tell lady sour well beaute luste fredome gentilnesse rich array dere men sell disport frendly dwell loue play benigne humblesse sowne instrument al sweetnesse thereto well fortuned thewed yeworld goodnes shewed wonder though set seruice soch one may knet wele wo sith lithe might therfore myne hert euer hette ne trewly death shall lette ben trewest seruaunt knight flatter nat may wete euery wight day seruice shall dye grace see neuer eye shall plaine distresse may help may hert redresse shall complaine vnto lady free nay certes hath soch heauinesse feare eke wo gesse littel time would bane bee safe force mee ala euer louers endure loue many perilous auenture though louers trewe metal forged newe many case hem tideth oft sorowe somtime lady woll nat hem rewe somtime ielousie knewe might lightly lay heed borow somtime enuious folk tongs horow deprauen hem ala may please befalse louer hath ease auaileth soch long sermonun auentures loue vp doun wol retourne speaken paine point distructioun right lady saluacioun affray plaine herte sweete lady soueraine disease ought wel swoun swelt though none harme ne drede felt fine made god sit hie beneth loue companie straineth folke loue mauger heed ioy aught espie ne lasteth twinckling eye haue neuer ioy till deed meaneth mistiheed wherto constraineth folke fast thing desire last though made louer loue thing maketh seem stedfast yet putteth soch misauenture rest ni yeuing wonder iust king doth hardnesse creature thus whether loue breake el dure algates hath loue done hath wo chaunged moone seemeth hath louers enmite like fisher men may day se baited angle hoke pleasance til many fish wood till ceased therwith erst hath desire therwith mischaunce though line breke hath penance hoke wounded sore wage hath euermore broche thebe soch kinde full ruby stone inde euery wight set eye wende anone worth mind sore beaute wold hert bind till thought must die dry soch wo drede aye welnigh feare mad fro possession double wo passion faire jewell hath forgo yet broche conclusion cause confusion wrought enfortuned euery wight shold haue wo therfore worcher vice coueitour nice fareth louers though lady haue great beaute mad till gette grace cause mine aduersite wrought mote thee put soch beaute face made coueiten purchase mine owne death wite die mine vnwit ever clambe hie hardy knight renowne sith ye devistowne al worthy great name yet saine clerkes patrone therfore ye ought haue compassion disease take nat game proudest may made ful tame wherfore pray gentilesse ye complaine mine heauinesse ye lady true stable way kind ye ought ben able haue pite folke paine haue ye cause cloth sable sith empres honorable desolate wel ought plaine holy teares fall raine ala honour emprice nigh deed drede ne cheuice complaineth eke ye louers fere unfained humble chere euer redy socour complaineth yt euer hath dere complaineth beaute freedome manere complaineth endeth labour complaineth thilke ensample al honour neuer gentilnesse kytheth therfore kindnesse complaint venus ni high comfort pleasance heauinesse haue ayser remembraunce vpon manhood worthinesse vpon trouth stedfastnesse whose al may dure ought blame creature euery wight praiseth gentillesse bounte wisdome gouernaunce wel man witte gesse grace hath wolde ferforth auance knighthood parsite richesse honour honoureth noblesse thereto well hath fourmed nature foreuer ensure euery wight praiseth gentillesse nat withstanding suffisaunce gentil herte great humblesse word werke countenance serue besinesse sette sikernesse thus ought blisse well mine auentour sith list sernen honour euery wight praiseth gentillesse certes loue right couenable men ful dere abie thy noble thing wake bedde fasten table weping laugh sing complainings downe cast visage looking often chaunge visage countenaunce play sleeping dremen daunce reuers glad feeling ielousie hanged cable wold al know espying doth wight nothing reasonable al ni harme imagining thus dere loue yeuing oft yeueth without ordinaunce sorow ynough little plesaunce reuers glad feeling little time yeft greable full accombrous vsing subtel ielousie disceiuable full often time causeth distourbing thus ben euer drede suffring certaine languishen penaunce haue wel oft many hard mischance reuers glad feling certes loue say soch wise scape ace ment long haue seruice lete neuer assent force though ielousie tourment suffiseth see may therfore certes ending day loue best shal neuer repent certes loue well aduise estate yt man may represent haue ye made franchise thefe best euer earth went loue well hert look thou neuer stent lette iealous put assay paine woll say nay loue best shall neuer repent herte thee ought ynough suffice loue high grace sent chose worthy wi e agreable vnto mine entent seek ferther neither way ne went sith ye haue suffisaunce vnto pay thus wol end complaining lay loue best shall neuer repent plenuoy prince receiueth complaining gree vnto excellent benignite direct litel suffisaunce elde spirite dulleth mee hath enditing subtelte welnigh berafte remembraunce eke great penaunce sith rime english hath soch scarcite folow word word curiosite gransonflour hem make fraunce explicit letter cupid letter made thomas occleve office privy seale chaucer scholar termed treatise conversation men woman little island albion got hatred among gentlewoman court inforced recant book called planctas proprius cvpid vnto whose commaundement gentill kinrede goddes hie people infernal obedient mortall folke seruen busely goddesse sonne cythera onely tho deite subject hertely greeting send general woll ye know lady honour reuerence gentilwomen hauen sowe soch seed complaint audience men hem outrage offence eares grieueth pitous theffect matere passing londes litell yle cleped albion complaine say crop rote guile con tho men dissimule faine standing dropes eyen twaine hertes feeleth distresse blinden woman doublenesse word spoken sighingly pitous chere countenaunce euery wight meaneth trewly deemeth herte haue greuaunce say importable penaunce lady lust shew hem grace right anone must steruen place ah lady mine say ensure doth grace shall euer life may last endure humble low ech degre possible keep thing secre right selfe list el mine herte mote brast two ful hard know man herte outward may man trouth deme word mouth may none sterte reson semed euery wight queme said herte would seme faithful woman full innocence thou art disceiued false apparence processe moueth oft woman pite wening thing men sey graunt hem grace benignite men sake dey good hert sette hem wey blisfull loue keepe conne thus otherwhile woman bethe ywonne man pan hath stele fully possessioun woman keepeth dele may finde toun woman blind affectioun vnto bestow yuel mote preue man othes hard beleeue euery false man hath make unto euery wight light know traitour woman hath forsake fast spedeth unto felow til herte low false disceit may suffise traison telleth wise faire auaunt honour man accuse thus diffame good confesse traitour bring woman sclandrous name tell body hath shame worship may thus conquer great disclaunder vnto nay yet reprefe vertue wrought brewed hath mischefe spake faire fa inward thought sclaunder reson ought vnto thanke perpetuell soch need help well although men sleight subtilty sely simple innocent woman betraied wonder sith city troy orie tell betrayed disceit man set fyre downe ouerthrowe finally destroied men knowe betray nat men city great king wight shape remedy ayenst falsely purposed thing crafte soch craftes espy man whose witt ever redy taply thing sowning falshede woman bethe ware false men rede farthermore men vsage nat likely speed soch ben double visage procuren pursewe need prayeth cause proceed largely guerdoneth travaile litel wote woman men hem assaile another wretch vnto felow saith thou fishest faire thee hath fired false inconstaunt hath faith rode folke desired horse fro day day hired thou twinnest fro company commeth another blered thine eye pricke fast ride thy journey thou art behind thy back liberall woll nothing withsey smattly another take smack thus fare woman pack hem trusteth hanged mote bee ever desire chaunge nolveltee whereof proceedeth envy himselfe ne winne may speaketh reprefe villany man blabbing tonge wont alway thus diver men full oft make assay distourbe folke sondry wise may obtaine emprise many one eke would good hath love time spent vsed men wish lady asking withstood ere plainly refused waste vaine mused wherefore none remedy lady shaperh ly cvery woman saith light gete none say nay well ysought may leiser trete purpose shall fayle nought madnesse depe brought shende open homelynesse loven woman doten gesse slaunder woman thus may profite gentillesse namely hem arme defence woman hem delite ordre gentillesse wold man list gentill hold must eschewe thereto contrary sclaundrous tonge great adversary foule vice tonge light moch clappeth gabbeth oft tonge man swift wight reised vp loft reason shewed slowly soft never ouertake may lord men trusty assay albeit men find one woman nice inconstaunt rechlesse variable deignous proude fulfilled mallice without faith love disceivable sly queint false vntrust coulpable wicked feirse full cruelte yet followeth soch woman high god aungels fourmed among hem none founden malicious bad yet men wote many one pride fill fro heven anone shuld men thy yeve al angel proud name nay thee susteineth blame twelve apostle one traitour remnant yet good trew hap men find percaas woman false soch good eschew deme yt therfore vntrewe see well men owne falsenesse hem causeth woman trust lesse every man ought herte tendre vnto woman deeme honorable shape thicke slendre good badde fable every wight wote wit hath resonable woman discended shame speake amisse wicked tree good fruite may none forth bring soch fruite tree take heed thou toke thy beginning let thy mother mirrour vnto thee honour thou wolte honoured bee dispise manere lest thereby thy wickednesse appere old proverbe sayd english bird foule full dishonest hold full churlish vseth defoule owne nest men say well woman best naught dispise hem ne depraue woll honour keep saue lady ever complain hem clerk made bookes diffame dispise woman werks speak hem great reprofe shame causelesse yeve hem wicked name thus dispised every side disclaundred blowen full wide tho sory bookes maken mencion woman betraide especiall adam david sampson salomon many one mo may reherse hem treason shall world malice may comprehend clerkes saine hath none end ouide boke called remedy loue great reprofe woman writeth wherein trowe great foly euery wight yt soch case deliteth clerkes custome enditeth woman prose time vers say wicked know reuers boke scholers lerned childhede woman beware age loue hem euer drede sith disceiue set corage say perel men cast thauauntage namely soch men haue bewrapped many man woman hath mishapped charge clerkes saine writing doe cure labour trauayle vaine betweene lady nature shall suffred world may dure thus clerkes cruell tyranny selie woman kithen maistry whilom many hem cheine tied vnwedly age vnlust may loue atteine saine loue dotage thus hemselfe lacken courage folke excite wicked sawes rebell ayenst lawes mauger hem blame woman force mine impression sodainly fell boste wrong imagination shall election foulest lutte toune refuse lust con muse herte brenningly desire though duchesse queene folkes hertes set sire list send hem joy teene woman whet kene sharpe persing stroke smite shul fele know kerue bite parde clerke subtill ouide many another disceiued haue woman know full wide men great deinty excellent clerke mo couden full well preach betrapped aught yt coud teach trusteth well maruaile woman knowen plainly entent wist softly coud assaile hem falshede hert mente thus clerkes daunger hente venime another destroied thus clerkes oft anoied lady ne gentile neuerthelesse none tho wrought wise soch vertulesse quitten thus old clerkes wise clerkes lesse ought suffise dispraue woman generally worship shull none gette thereby men louers hem pretend woman faithfull good true dredde hem disceiue offend woman loue hem would eschue euery day hath man herte newe one abide forse wight beguile men beare eke woman vpon hond lightly without paine wonen wight withstond disease list hem complaine freele may hem refraine liketh hem may lightly haue hertes easie graue maister iohan de moone suppose leude occupacioun making romante rose many sigh imaginacioun perilies rollen vp doun long processe many slight cautell disceiue sely damosell nought say ne wit comprehend art pain subtilty saile conquere sone make end men feble place shall assaile sone also vanquish battaile wight may make resistence ne herte hath none make defence mote follow necessitee sith art asketh great engine paine woman disceiue bee constaunce baraine clarkes saine woman ought bee sadde constant fulfilled pitee frendly medea iason conquering flece gold falsly quit true affection victory gate wold may man shame bold falsen fro death shame kept gate great prise name troy also traitour eneas faithlesse wretch forswore dido queene cartage releued smertes sore gentillesse might haue herte vnfained kidde mischief therof betidde legend nature may men find liketh therein rede othe ne behest may man bind reprouable shame haue drede mannes herte trouth hath stede soil naught may trouth grow woman namely vnknow clerkes saine also malice vnto woman wicked crabbidnesse woman shalt thou thy self cheuice sith men thee soch harme witnesse beth ware woman sikelnesse kepe thine owne men clappe crake hem shall smart vndertake malice woman drede slea man destroy citees ne oppresse folke ne ouerlede betray empire realmes duchees ne bireuen men land ne mees enpoison folke ne house set fire ne false contract make hire trust parfite loue entire charitee feruent entalented corage thewes good sitteth well bee haue woman euer custome vsage well conne man ire asswage soft word discrete benigne inward shew outward signe woman herte vnto cruelty enclined charitable pitous deuoute full humility shame fast debonaire amiable dredefull wordes measurable woman haue parauenture followeth way nature men saine first mother nathelesse made mankind lese libertee naked joy doubtlesse goddes heste disobeyed presumed taste tree god forbad eate therof ne deuill would enuious swelling fend foe vnto man herte wealth sent serpent made goe disceiue eue thus man wealth birafte fende stealth woman knowing disceipt god wote full ferre conceipt wherfore say good woman eue father adam disceiued nought may man disceipt preue properly herte thought compassed first wrought soch impression men may call disceipt reason ne wight disceiueth purpose fend disceipt cast nothing wrong deeme suppose harme cause wyte fende maugre excused haue innocence saue onely brake obedience touching full fewe men vnnethes dare safely say fro day day men may day see heste god disobay haue mind sir pray ye discrete reasonable ye woll hold excusable men say man stedfastnesse woman courage vnstable may adam beare soch witnesse telleth chaungeable case semblable saue willing fende disceiued eue adam leue yet sinne happy mankind fende disceiued sleight aught coud sleight wind trespace came fro heauen height god discharge man weight flesh blood tooke virgine suffred death deliuer pine god may nothing hid woman knowen soch malice men recorde hem generalte lady life reperatrice nolde haue borne vice voide full vertue well wist endowed borne list heaped vertue hath soch excellence leane man faculte declare therefore suspence due praysing put need must thus say verely next god best frend man longeth key mercy girdle hongeth mercy hath euery man soch need resing farewell joy man power taketh right good heed mercy may well purchase displeaseth honoureth woman woman sake ye doe sorow shall awake booke also ye find werkes death life iesu spelleth maketh mind woman forsoke wo strife wight ententife woman proued none apostle forsoken euerichone woman forsoke fayth holy church woman left onely lee thus holy writ sayth looke ye shall finde hardely therefore may well preue thereby woman reigneth stable constaunce men chaunge variaunce thou precious gem martirs margarite thy blood dredest none effusion thou louer true thou maiden mansuete thou constant woman thy passion ouercame fendes temptacion many wight converted thy doctrine vnto faith holy god thou virgine vnderstandeth onely commend nought encheson virginity trusteth came never thought ever werre ayenst chastity ever shall lo meveth loving herte constant lay drive remembraunce ne may holdeth ferme ly true commendacion woman tel flattery ne bicause pride elacion onely lo entencion yeve hem courage perse veraunce vertue honour avaunce vertue lasse pride vertue digne noble kind vice woll fere abide putteth vice cleane mind flieth fro hem leaveth hem behind woman vertue art hostresse great thy honour thy worthinesse woll thus conclude define commaund minister echone ready ye hestes encline false men rebell fone ye punishment anone voide hem court banish hem ever therein come never fulfilled ceasing delay looke none excusacion written lusty moneth may paleis many million lover true habitation yere grace joyfull jocond thousand foure hundred second explicit ballade commendation lady thousand story coud mo rehearce old poetes touching matere cupide hertes gan pearce servauntes setting hem fere lo fyne therrour fere lo love guerdon greuaunce ever wth wo seruaunts auaunce wherfore plainly wol stile dresse one speake need woll faile ala dole ne ne may expresse passing prise mervaile winde grace blowe unto saile auriate licour cleo write penne euspire woll endite ala unworthy unable love soch one woman surmounting benigne merciable pity well eke spring wherefore laude praising supported grace right thus say kneeling tofore face sterre sterres thy streames clere sterre sea shipmen light gide lusty living pleasaunt appere whose bright beam cloudes may hide way life go ride hauen tempest surest vp riue haue mercy thy joyes fiue rightful rule bote holinesse lightsome line pity plain original beginning grace goodnesse cleanest conduit vertue souerain mother mercy trouble restrain chamber closet clennest chastity named brough deity closet garden void weedes wicke cristallin welle clerenesse clere consigned fructified oliue oiles faire thick redolent cedre dere worthy digned remember sinner yt thee assigned wicked fendes wrath hem wreche lanterne light thou liues leche paradise pleasaunce gladsome al good benigne braunchelet pine tree vinary enuermailed refresher blood licour ayen al langour palled may blisful blomy blosome biding bountee thy mantel mercy misery sprede er wo awake wrap v vnder thy wede rody rosier flouring without spine fountain filthlesse byrel currant clere som drop thy graceful dew v propine light without nebule shining thy sphere medicine mischeues pucel without pere flame doun doleful light thine influence remembring thy seruants thy magnificence christen protectrice tutele retourne exiled put proscripcion hem yt erren pathe sequele wery forwandred tent pauilion faint fresh pausacion vnto vnresty rest remedy fruitful tho affie hem rennen thou art itenerary blisfull brauy knight thy warre wery werkmen diourne denary mede vnto mariner haue sailed farre laureate croune streming starre hem yt put hem palastre thy sake cours conquest thou white lake mirth martyr sweter sitole confessours also richest donatife vnto virgines eternal lauriole afore woman hauing prerogarife mother maide widow wife world none thou alone sith thou may succour mone trustie turtle truefastest true curteyse columbe replete mekenesse nightingale thy note newe popiniay pured clennesse laueroke loue singing sweetnesse phebus awaiting till thy brest light vnder thy wing domesday v dight ruby rubified passion thy sonne v haue among mind stedfast diametre duracion feres time might thou find none founden half kind hardy herte louing creature loue made thee endure semely saphre depe loupe blew ewage stable loupe ewage pitee say freshest visage thou louest unchaunged hem seruen thee offence varying hem bee thou art ay redy vpon wo rue hem receiuest herte full true goodly gladded gabriell joy thee grette may nombred half blisse coude write tell holy ghost thee obumbred wherthrough fends biterly encombred wemlesse maide embelished birth man angell thereof hadden mirth lo blosme budde glory prophet long spake beforne lo fame memory esay long borne lo dauid delicious corne lo ground life builde becomming man ransome yelde glorious viole vite inuiolate firy titan persing thy bemes whose vertuous briytnes brest vibrat al world embelished leams conseruatrice king duke realm isaies seede sweet sunamite mesure mourning mine margarite soueraignest sought sion cockle gold dewe aboue berained dew bush vnbrent firelesse fire set flaming feruence heat pained daisie weather stained fleece vndefouled gentilest gedion fructifying fairest yerd aaron mighty arch probatise pi ine laughing aurore peace oliue columpne base vp bearing abym nere conning discriue chosen ioseph took wiue vnknowing childing miracle manly figure tabernacle haue none english conuenient digne mine heart heale lady thee honour iuory clean therefore resigne thine hand till thou list soccour helpe making florish flour shew loue brend song making thy name commend coud thine excellence singen loue would fele euer standen lady thy presence shew open loue wele sith although hert made stele withouten disceueraunce jay vous toute fiance might loue euer better beset lilly liking behold lace loue bond well thou knit may see thee mine hert cold passe day old tofore singing euermore vtterly eyen two wol slea sodainly loue langour blissed soch sicknes sith hertily suffisaunce el say distresse faire one hath mine herte gouernance begin esperaunce feble entune though thine hert perce yet thy sake letter reherce god wote musike gesse ala might say sing loue mine souerain maistresse euer shall without departing mirrour beauty ring remembraunce eke eyen clere thus fer souerain lady dere would god loue would sith sake sing day day herte nilt thou breake atwo sith lady dwell ne may thus many roundell many virelay fresh english laiser find record haue mind lady mine sith loue drede vnchaunged euer find degree whose grace ne may fly fro womanhede disdaineth remember mine herte bleedeth may see sith ye wote meaning desirous plores pour moy sil vous plaist amoureus maruaile though pain departed soueraine fortune ala dont vient la destenie wise ne may attaine see beauty eyen twain wherefore say tristesse doth grame tant fait mal departir de dame nere wissing brought esploit might say joy presence mon coeur ce quae voulloit mon coeur highest excellence euer wight sith mine aduertence reweth paine smert sore wounded herte liue well merry two louers yfere may say withouten blame man wild coud teach tame let go loue see game bridled vnto sobernesse woman cheef princesse euer thought hert shuld enbrace vnto best remedy look goodly fresh face merry mirrour coud neuer espy coud would magnifie neuer none faire ifound reken hem also rosamound finally mouth present double eye without repentaunce mine hert yeue lady entent ye shall holly therof haue gouernaunce taking leaue herts obeysaunce salve regina singing last helpe thee call loue idlenesse saue loue alone might thereto attaine woll haue name gentillesse coun le loue faine thou sweet lady refute euery paine whose mercy auaileth gie grace fortune faileth nought may told withouten fable high renome womanly beaute gouernaunce worship able putteth euery herte ease degree violet floure desiree sith amerous estreignes moy de coeur joyeus feruent herte brest hath brost fire lardant espoer en mon coeur point est mort dauoir lamour de celle que je desire meane sweet pleasaunt port et je say bien que ce nest yearth sitte hem well pity grace yet must tempored manere finden cause mattere vpon point afterward betide law right shall laid aside may king warre voyage ordaine take thereto hold claime ask rightful heritage place withhold otherwise god wold affirme loue peace king peace best aboue earthly thing good eschew war nathelees king may make war vpon right battaile final end pee thus stant law worthy knight vpon trouth may go fight might chese better peace may man lese stere peace ought euerich liue first sette leige lord rest eke men ne striue land may stand best king would worthiest might deadly war cease worthinesse increase peace chiefe world welth heauen leadeth eke way peace soul life mannes health pestilence doth war away liege lord take heed say war may left take peace hand may without goddes sand peace stant euery creature rest without peace may life glad aboue good peace best peace hath werre al bestad peace safe warre euer drad peace charity kay hath life soule way liege lord thee list seech soth ensamples wt war hath wrought thou shalt well wise mennes speech deadly warre turneth nought old book well ysought miyt thou se thing war hath conquest conquerour also vain honour world good whilome strong war made wher bethink well thy mood day gone night derke fade cruelty made hem glade sorrowen yet haue nauyt blood shad man mayrestore warre mother wrong sleeth priest holy church masse forlith maid doth flour fall warre maketh great city lasse doth law rule ouerpasse ther nothing wherof mischeef may grow caused warre trow war bringeth pouerty heel whereof commen people sore greued war hath set cart thilk wheles fortune may nat beleued men wene best haue atcheued full oft new begin warre hath nothing siker tho win thy worthy prince christ halue part whose faith thou hast guide ley old sore new saue warre away betide purchase peace set thy side suffer nat thy people deuoured shal thy name euer stand honoured man euer ayen peace thy preuy counsailour let god thy counsaile caas put away cruel warriour god man creatour would men slough creature without cause deadly forfaiture needeth behoueth looke lord thy war without time passed heed tooke good home see right well euermore worst dout thou mightest parfite peace attaine cause plaine king good counsaile preise aboue thing vailable yet king within shall peise seene thing reasonable upon shall wit stable among men set peace euin loue king heuin well shed neuer blood cause rightwisenesse king peril vnderstood slee people gesse deadly warres heauinesse whereof peace distourbed full oft time cease soft king fulfilled grace knighthode remember vpon point christ sake peace profered vnto thy manhode thine honour saue let forsake though thou war darst well vndertake reason yet temper thy courage knowing heard nightingale say good cuckow go somewhere away let v singen dwellen euery wight escheueth thee thy song elenge good fay qd may thee aylen thinketh sing well thou song true plaine though cannot crakell vaine thou dost thy throte wot neuer euery wight may vnderstand mee nightingale may done thee thou hast many nice queint cry haue thee heard saine ocy ocy might know ah foole qd wost thou say ocy ocy ywis meane would wonder faine shamefully yslaine meanen ought againe loue amis also would tho dede thinke loue life lede wol god loue serue dare well say worthy sterue skill ocy ocy woodnesse louing office despaire one thing therein faire getteth loue little blisse alway therewith ywis may full soone age haue haire nightingale therefore hold thee ny leue well thy queint cry thou ferre long fro thy make thou shalt forsake thou shalt hoten doe fie qd thy name thee god loue ne let thee neuer ythee thou art worse thousandfold wood many one full worthy full good naught ne loue ybee euermore loue seruants amendeth euill tach hem defendeth maketh hem brenne right fire trouth worshipfull desire liketh joy inough hem sendeth thou nightingale said still loue hath reason oft time vntrue folke easeth true folke bitterly displeaseth defaut courage let hem spill tooke nightingale keepe cast sigh deepe said ala euer bore tene say one word right word brast weepe ala qd hert woll scorned alone came nightingale mee said friend forsooth thanke thee thou hast liked rescow one auow loue make may woll thy singer thanked right well apaied ye qd thou dismaied tho thou haue herd cuckow erst liue shall amended next may affraied one thing woll rede thee also ne leue thou cuckow ne loues hath said strong leasing nay qd thereto shall nothing bring loue hath doe much wo ye vse qd medicine euery day may thou dine go looke vpon fresh daisie though thou wo point die shall full greatly essen thee thy pine looke alway thou good trew woll sing one song new loue thee loud may crie began song full hie shrew hem loue vntrue song end farewell qd mote wend god loue right well may much joy send thee day yet louer euer send thus taketh nightingale leaue pray god alway joy loue send vertue may long endure thinketh eke vice vertue debate haue ben shall world may dure euer vicious auenture ouerthrow thinketh euermore god lord vertue figure goodnesse therfore follow lore maister chaucer god soule saue language curious said ye father dead graue biqueth nothing vertue hous vnto child therefore labourous ought ye beseeking god grace yeue might vertuous whichye miyt haue part place may ye see vertuous noblesse commeth way auncestry commeth lefull businesse honest life slogardry wherefore youth rede edisie house vertue manere age may keepe gie fro tempest world wawes thinketh betwixe vertue estate parfite blessed mariage vertue cause peace vice debate man soule full courage cherisheth vertue vice outrage driueth hem away let hem haue wonning soules leseth heritage god hath yeue vertuous liuing take heed also men poore degree vertue haue beset great honour euer haue liued great prosperity cherishing vertuous labour thinketh also many gouernour called estate hath set full low misusing right errour therefore cousaile vertue know thus ancesters ye may nothing claim maister chaucer saith expresse temporal thing men may hurt maime god stocke vertuous noblesse sith lord blessednesse made u u deide followeth vertue full businesse thing herke maister seide first stocke father gentilnesse man claimeth gentill must follow trace wit dresse vertue looke vice fly unto vertue longeth dignity reuers safely dare deme weare mitre corowne diademe first stocke full rightwisenesse true word sobre pitous free cleane ghost loued businesse ayenst vice sloth honesty heire heires hem queme weare mitre croune diademe lo heare noble poete brittaine lightly vertuous sentence losse youth vertue complaine therefore pray diligence profite god reuerence tempereth fully vertue gouernaunce wening calme would last yere yere right fare ignoraunce shame know reason ebb ther cometh flood ful rage ye wise youth passeth season commeth crooked unweldy palied age sone comen kalends dotage youth haue vertue provided men woll say fie vassalage thus hath sloth fro worship hem deuided boecius clerk men may rede see saith booke consolation man de reth vine tree plenteous fruit reaping season must euer eschue doe oppression vnto root yong grene thus may ye see well inclusion youth vertulesse doeth much tene seeth ayenst vertuous noblenesse rooted youth good perseueraunce driueth away vice wretchednesse slogardry riot distaunce seeth eke vertue causeth suffisaunce seeth eke vertue voideth vice hath vertue hath habundaunce wele farre reason deuise take heed tullius hostilius fro pouert came high degree vertue redeth eke iulius conquerour poore man yet vertue humility many countrey gouernaunce thus vertue bringeth man great degree eche wight lust entendaunce rede ayenst nero vertulees taketh heed also proud balthasare hated vertue equity pee looke antiochus fill fro chare skin bone tare look mischance vice woll signes beware dare well say infortunate nice say hereby may ye see vertue causeth parfite sikernesse vice exilen prosperity best ech man chose gesse doeth list excuse expresse would right sorry ye mischese god confirme vertuous noblesse negligence ye lese explicit sometime world stedfast stable man word obligatioun false deceivable word deed conclusioun nothing like tourned vp doun world mede fikelnesse lost lack stedfastnesse maketh world variable lust men haue dissension among v man hold vnable collusion doe neighbour wrong oppression causeth wilfull wretchednesse lost lack stedfastnesse trouth put downe reason hold fable vertue hath domination pity exiled man merciable couetise blent discretion world hath made permutation fro right wrong fro trouth fikelnesse lost lacke stedfastnesse lenvoye prince desire honourable cherish thy folke hate extortion suffer nothing may reprouable thine estate done thy region shew forth yerd castigation drede god law loue trouth worthinesse wed thy folke ayen stedfastnesse explicit good counsail chaucer fly fro prease dwell soothfastnesse suffise vnto thy good though small horde hath hate climbing tikelnesse prease hath enuy wele blent ouer sauour thee behoue shall rede well thy selfe folke canst rede trouth thee shall deliuer drede paine thee ech crooked redresse trust tourneth ball great rest standeth little businesse beware also spurn againe nall striue doth crocke wall deme thy selfe demest others dede trouth thee shall deliuer drede thee sent receiue buxomnesse wrastling world asketh fall home wildernesse forth pilgrime forth beast thy stall looke vp high thanke god weiue thy lust let thy ghost thee lede trouth thee shall deliuer drede explicit ballade village without painting plaintife fortune wretched worldes transmutation wele wo poor honour without order due discretion gouerned fortune errour nathelesse lacke fauour ne may doe sing though die lay tout pardu mon temp labour finally fortune defie yet left sight reasoun know friend fro foe thy mirrour much hath yet thy tourning vp doun ytaught knowen hou r truly force thy reddour ouer himselfe hath maistre suffisaunce shall succour finally fortune defie socrates thou stedfast champion might neuer thy turmentour thou neuer dredest oppression ne chere found thou fauour thou knew deceit colour worship lie know eke false dissimulour finally fortune defie answer fortune man wretched himselfe wene ne hath himselfe suffisaunce saist thou thee kene hast thy selfe gouernance say thus graunt mercy thine habundance thou hast lent thou shalt striue wost thou yet thee woll auance eke thou hast thy best friend aliue haue thee taught deuision betweene friend effect friend countenaunce thee needeth gall hine cureth eyen darke pennaunce seest thou clere ignoraunce yet holt thine anker yet thou maistarriue bounty beareth key substance eke thou hast thy best friend aliue many haue refused sustene sith haue thee fostred thy pleasaunce wolt thou make statute thy quene shall aye thine ordinaunce thou born art reigne variaunce whele must thou driue lore bet wicke thy greuaunce eke thou hast thy best friend aliue answer fortune thy lore dampne aduersity frend maist thou reue blind goddesse thy friend know thanke thee take hem againe let hem go lie presse niggardes keeping richesse pronoslike thou wolt toure assaile wicke appetite commeth aye sicknesse general rule may faile fortune thou pinchest mutability thee lent droppe richesse liketh withdraw shouldest thou royalty oppresse sea may ebbe flow lesse welken hath might shine rain hail right must kithe brotilnesse generall rule may fail plaintife lo execution majesty purueigheth rightwisenesse thing fortune clepen ye ye blind beast full leaudnesse heauen hath property sikernesse world hath euer restlesse trauaile last day end mine entresse generall rule may faile thenuoye fortune prince pray gentilnesse let man thus cry plain shall quite businesse ye liste releue pain pray ye best frende noblesse better state may attain lenuoy broken statute hie heauen create eternally tendure sithe see bright goddes seuen mowe wepe waile passion endure may yearth mortall creature ala fro whens may thing procede errour die almost drede word eterne whilom shape fro fifth cercle manere ne might teares doune escape weepeth venus sphere teares wol drench v ala scogan thine offence thou causest deluge pestilence hast thou said blaspheme goddis pride thy gret rekelnes thing law loue forbode thy lady saw thy distresse therfore thou yaue vp mighelmesse ala scogan olde folke ne yong neuer erst scogan blamed tong thou drew scorne cupide eke record thilke rebell word thou hast spoken woll lenger thy lord scogan though bow broken woll arowes ywroken thee ne ne none figure shall haue neither hurte ne cure certes frend drede thine vnhape lest thy gilte wreche loue procede hem hore round shape likely folke spede shall labour haue mede well wot thou wolt answere say lo old grisell list renne play nay scogan say excuse god helpe rime doubtles ne thinke neuer sleepe wake muse rusteth sheath still pee yong put forth prees shall passe men prose time take euery man tourne time scogan thou knelest ye stremes hedde grace thee sapience bishop able minister doctrine lorde true counsaile yeue audience womanhode chastity euer encline knight let thy deedes worship determine righteous iudge sauing thy name rich almose lest say jangle thou art slougarde never thrive shall suffre hem speke trust right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis befall thou take wife woll falsly say entent thou art likely ever live strife voide rest without aledgment wife ben maistres judgment suffren spech trust right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou faire excellent beaute yet woll say thou art amourous thou foule vgly see woll affirme thou art vicious people language dispitous suffre spech trust right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis parfitenesse thou hast vowed live chastitee woll folke thy person expresse thou art leane megre fashion call thee nigard opinion suffre speake trust right wel wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou rich woll yeve thee laude say commeth prudent governaunce wol saine commeth fraude
