neither grace find yet sorrowful hart dede arace loue doth smart thorow see without remedy death may wise astart sothly hight woll reherse name bounty set womanhede sadnes youth beauty pridelesse plesaunce vnder gouernance drede surname eke faire ruthelesse wise eknit vnto good auenture loue sleeth guiltlesse loue best shall may dure bet self hundred thousand dele world rich creature hath loue bestowed wele loue neuer shal haue part ala right thus turned wheele thus slaine loues furious dart loue best swetest loue hath taught art serue alway stinten wo true carefull hert much wo little blisse wo euer bore thing desire misse euer would wisse find ready euermore plaine might bring ne recheth nought whether weep sing little ruth hath vpon paine ala sleeping time lo wake daunce fere lo quake heauy life lede lo sake though ye thereof wise heed take mine herts lady hole liues quene truly durst say fele seemeth sweet heart stele whetted kene dere hert best beloued fo liketh wo haue done greueth said serue loue mo whilest liue euer therefore swete ne bethe euill apaid good faire ye right great wonder ye seruaunts good bad best worthy neuerthelesse right lady swete though vnkonning vnmete serue coud best aye highness yet none fairer would hete ease else bete wist highness might good haue ye fele none world liuing none fainer would herts fulfill loue eke drede sore algates mote haue done full yore better loued none ne neuer shall yet would beseech leueth well wroth therefore let serue forth lo nought hardy ne wood desire ye louen well wote ala may little worthy ye good ye one worthiest liue vnlikely thriue yet weteth ye right well ye ne seruice driue ne aye wit fiue serue truly wo fele set hic upon wheele though ye neuer upon rew must loue euer trew man may liue love goodly free lasse find ye loue ala shall hard wit amend womanly pite gentlenesse debonairte ye nothing thereof upon spend hole sweet great haue serue certes ye let thus sterue yet haue ye wonne thereon small knowing nought thus beseech heartely euer ye find while ye liue truer seruant leueth sleeth hardely death forgiue ye find truer verely woll ye suffer thus spill manner gilt good good vntrue true explicit ballad declaring woman chastity doth much excell treasure worldly womanhede auctours write thing commended honesty thing slaunderous noble atwite woman hasty fraelty ex eeden bond wifely chastity auaileth linage royall blood liuing report good holy bed defoyled marriage one defoiled may recouered vice goeth forth froward language many realme many great cite sclaunder hath custome great true fals contrarious soune one areised goeth lightly downe lechour force maistry defouled hath virgines cleanesse widdowes oppressed lie aduoutry assailed wiues stood stablenesse may slaundrous harme redresse good name hurt report fame lost one neuer haue resort thefe may rob man richesse meane make restitucion man may disherite oppresse poore man possession make againe satisfaction man may restore degree maid robbed virginite man may also beat castell doun built fresh sight exile man regioun reuoke whether wrong right man hath power ne might restore palais virginall chastity broken wall men may also putten seruice officer remeue place day fortune list deuise may restored grace ni time nother set ne space neuer story neither rad ne saine maidenhed lost recouered againe men haue conscience rewen heart repent sore remorse great offence rauish thing may restore said hath said full yore emeraud greene parfite chastite stole one away may recouered hard rauish treasour nature recuparable lordship may king emperour reforme thing nat reformable rust defame inseperable maidenhede lost new yore man liue may againe restore romanes old thorough patience suffered tyraunts tyranny city great violence people oppresse robbery punish set great espies false auouterers well couth widowes rauish maiden youth explicit court love book imitation romaunt rose shewing subject love impediment soever contrary containing also twenty statute observed court love timerous heart trembling hand drede cunning naked bare eloquence vnto floure porte womanhede write none intelligence metre hath ne floures sentence saufe list writing conuey please high nobley blosomes fresh tullius gardein soot present matter born poemes virgil taken root ne craft galfride may sojourn pleasaunce approching full sadde ripe courage loue arted obseruaunce estate done obeisaunce commaunding court loue see alite beside mount citharee citherea goddesse quene honoured highly majeste eke sonne mighty god wene cupide blind dignite louers worship kne bid paine death pere mercury winged messengere went strange fer countrees enquiring aye coast drew court loue thiderward bee last see people gan pursue thoght wight yt knew court holden ferre nie full fast gan hie anone ouertooke said heile friend whither purpose ye wend forsooth qd ofte answered liche maid loues court go gentle friend place qd fellow hend citheron sir said without dout king loue noble rout dwelleth within castle rially apace journed forth among said fond truly beheld toures high strong high pinacles large hight long plate gold bespred euery side precious stone stone werke hide saphire inde rube rich price lacked emeraud grene bale turkes ne thing deuice may castle maken shene bright sterres winter bene phebus shone make peace ageine trespas done high estate tweine venus mar god goddesse clere found armes cheined fast venus full sad hert chere phebus beam streight mast vpon castle ginneth cast please lady prince place signe looketh loues grace ni god heauen hell ywis hath ben right soget vnto loue ioue pluto whatsoeuer ne creature yearth yet aboue reuers may wight approue furthermore castle descrie yet saw neuer none large hie vnto heauen stretcheth suppose within depeinted wonderly many thousand daisie rede rose white also saw verely tho daisy might signifie tell safe quenes floure alceste kept sojoure vnder venus lady quene admete king soueraine place obeied lady good ninetene many thousand bright face yong men fele came forth lusty pace aged eke homage dispose coud well disclose yet nere nere forth gan dress hall noble apparaile arras spred cloth gold gesse silke esyer auaile vnder cloth estate sauns faile king quene sat beheld passed joy helise field saint haue comming resort seene king rially beseine purple clad eke quene sort head saw crownes tweine stone fret paine withouten meat drink stand see king honour rialtee treat state king ben councel cheef quene king danger nere standing quene loue disdain sene faith shall god wene neuer straunger none degree quene casting eye stood perceiuing apart eke beames shining eyen thought shapen lich dart sharp persing smal streight line haire shone gold fine dishiuil crispe hanging backe yard length soothly spake bright regina made thee faire made thy colour vermelet white wher wonneth god far aboue ye aire great craft great delite maruell nothing ye hight quene loue occupie place cithare sweet lady thy grace mewet spake nought astart condition word might hard inward thought gan aduert oft said wit dull hard beauty thus god wot ferde doth man yrauished sight beheld cristall eyen bright respect hauing best done till right anone beholding spied friend mine full sone gentlewoman chamberere vnto quene hote ye shall philobone loued life sey led forth blife demanded wise thither come errand seen court qd guise eke sue pardon grace mercy aske great trespas none erst come court loue foryeue ye god aboue well said qd philobone indede ye assomoned appere mercurius drede yes gentill feire qd ye yet tho though true dere free ye haue come vnsent ye deme ye shent ye reigne youth lustinesse pampired ease jalous age duty farre gesse loues court dressen viage soone nature maketh sage ye may know woman swan foot growen halfe span sith ye wilfull negligence xviii year hath kept self large greater trespas offence neck mote bere charge better ye ben withouten barge amidde sea tempest raine biden receiuing wo paine ordained absent fro loues court yeres long fele ley life ye shall full soone repent loue r iue colour lust hele eke ye must bait many heauy mele force ywis stirred long agone draw court qd little philobone ye shall well see rough angry face king loue shew ye se mine aduise kneel ask grace eschewing perill aduersite well wote woll none comfort none ne counsell ease ye king loue displease mercy god qd iche repent caitife wretch hert thought shall mine hole entent serue please dere yt loue bought yet sith haue mine pennance ysought humble sprite shall receiue though ye king loue life bereiue though feruent loues qualite neuer wortch truly yet obeisaunce humilite benigne hert shall serue till die lord might great hie right list chastice correct punish trespace thus infect word said caught lap led forth till temple round large wide blessed hap good auenture right soone found tabernacle reised ground venus sat cupide side yet halfe drede visage hide eft againe looked beheld seeing full sundry people place mister folk might weld lims wele thought wonder case temple shone window glass bright day many fair image see fresh queene cartage dido brent beauty loue false eneas weimenting annelida true turtle doue arcite fals peinting many prince many doughty king whose martirdom shewed wals fele loue suffred fals sore abashed astonied tho folke tide asked wonned diuers court qd beside sundry clothing mantill wise full wide arraied sacrifise vnto god goddesse guise lo yonder folk qd kneele blew weare colour aye euer shall signe euer trew withouten chaunge soothly yonder ben black mourning cry call vnto god loues bene som sick dede som sharp kene yea qd wt done priest nonnes hermites freres tho sit white russet grene forsooth qd waylen wo mercy lord may come go freely court haue liberty yea men condition degre woman eke truly none exception made ne neuer ne may court ope free euerichone king loue say nay taketh poore rich array meekely sew vnto excellence hert reuerence walking thus philobone see come messengere hie streight king let command anone throughout court make ho cry new come folke abide wote ye king lust seene sone come nere let see mote need done gan present tofore king trembling fere visage pale hew many louer kneeling abashed sore till vnto time knew sentence yeue entent full trew last king hath behold sterne visage seid doth old thus ferre ystope yeres come late vnto court forsooth liege qd hundred time haue ben gate afore time yet coud neuer espie mine acqueintaunce mine eie shame fastnesse away gan chace submit vnto grace well pardoned condition thou true henceforth thy might seruen loue thine entention sweare ferre right thou shalt haue grace thy quenes sight yes faith owe croun swere though death therefore thir th spere king hod seene v euerychone let commaund officer hie take faith shew v one one statute court full busily anon booke leid eie rede see thing must obserue loues court till die sterue lettred red statute hole loues court hall first statute booke spred true thought deed vnto king loue lord ryall quene faithfull kind coud thinke hert mind second statute secretly kepe councell loue blowing euery know let sinke flete may sowne euery wight ere exiling slaunder aye drede fere lady loue serue true kind grace deserue third statute clerely writ also withouten chaunge liue die none loue take wele ne wo blind delite ernest game without repent laughing grame biden still full perseueraunce hole king ordinaunce fourth statute purchase ever stirren folke loue beten fire venus auter preach loue hote desire tell loue quiten well hire must kept loth displease loue wroth passe ease fift statute daungerous thought would reue slepe sight ouer squemous verely statute kepe turne wallow bed wepe lady cruelty would heart exilen pity sixt statute vse alone wander void company lady beauty muse thinke force liue die eft againe thinke remedie grace might anone attaine tell wo vnto soueraine seuenth statute patient whether lady joyfull wroth word glad heauy diligent wheder helden lefe loth hereupon put mine oth serue lowly obey shewing chere ye xx sith aday eight statute remembraunce speaken pray lady dere hourely labour great entendaunce loue hert entere desire make joyfull chere right surmouning euery faire beauty well gentle debonaire ninth statute letter writ gold sentence euer dread ouerbold displease truely shall ben content thing may fall meekely take chastisement yerd offend euer ben aferd tenth statute egally discerne betwene lady thine ability thinke thy selfe art neuer like yerne right mercy equity grace womanly pity though thy selfe noble thy strene thousand fold noble thy quene thy liues lady thy soueraine hath thine hert al hole gouernaunce thou mayest wise taken disdaine put thee humbly ordinaunce giue free reine plesaunce liberty thyng woman looke truly el matter crooke xi statute thy signes know eye finger smile soft low couch alway show drede spy winken oft secretly bring sigh aloft still beware ouermuch resort parauenture spilleth thy sport xii statute remember obserue paine thou hast loue wo lite mercy deserue thou musten think whereuer thou ride go mortall wound suffer thou also sake thinke well besette vpon thy loue may bette xiii statute whylome thinke thing may best thy lady like please thine herts bottome let sinke thing deuise take thine ease send may hert appease hert ring letter deuice precious stone spare price xiiii statute eke thou shalt assay formely keepe part thy life wish yt thy lady thine armes lay nightly dreme thou hast thy night herts wife sweetly armes strayning blife thou seest fantasie see thou sing ouer merely much joy hath oft wofull end longeth eke statute hold deme thy lady euermore thy friend thinke thy selfe wise cokold euery thing doth construe best beleeue tale new many lye told seemeth full trew think bounteous faire coud false imagine algate think tonges wicked would appair sclandering name worshipfull estate louers true setten debate though thou seest faut right thine eye excuse bliue glose pretily xv statute vse swere stare counterfeit lesing hardely saue thy lady honour euery put thy selfe fight boldely say good vertuous ghostly clere entent heart yea thought argue reason ne skill againe thy lady pleasure ne entent loue countrepleted indede say saith shalt thou shent crow white ye truly rede aye wt thing thee forbede eschew giue soueraintee appetite follow degree xvi statute keepe thou may seuen sith night thy lady please seuen midnight seuen morrow day drinke caudle earely thine ease keep thine head disease win garland louers euer came court euer shall full think statute hold keep truely reason giueth fele louers rather fall asleepe take hand please oft wele lay none oth statute adele keep might gaue corage get garland lusty folke age win may ye lusty folke youth garland fresh floures red white purple blew colour fell vncouth shall croune king delite court sight louer true ne adrede expresse hath heard statute rede xvii statute age approcheth lust laied fire queint freshly thou shalt begin fonne dote loue image paint thy remembraunce till thou begin faint first season thine hert began desire though thou ne may ne performe thy liuing actuell lust regester thine remembraunce rust eke thou maist keep thy thing yet speake talke pleasaunt daliaunce yt shall make thine hert rejoice daunce thou maist game assay statute bid thee pray may xviii statute holy commend please thy lady thou eschew sluttishnesse thy selfe offend jollife fresh fete thing new courtly manner thy due gentill port louing cleanlinesse thing liketh thy maistresse wander liche dulled asse ragged torne disguised array ribaud speech measure passe thy bound exceeding thinke alway woman tender heart aye lightly set pleasure place misthinke lightly let passe xix statute meat drinke forgete ech day see thou fast loue court liue withouten mete saue cometh venus aboue take none hede pain great reproue meat drinke vaine onely liue sight soueraine xx statute last euerychone enroll thyne herts priuitee wring waile turne sigh grone thy lady absent thee eke renew word twain hath said chere thee hath made thy liues lady dere see thine hert quiet ne rest sojourne till time thou seene thy lady eft south east west thy force see left diligent till time thy life reft thou mayest thy lady see statute old antiquitee officer high authority cleped rigour made v swere anone na corrupt partiality fauour prayer ne gold clerely shone ye shall qd sweren echone yong old kepe may statute truly day god thought hard make oth power shall obserue world na matter halfe loth sweare though body sterue might hole obserue herken case befell oth made troth tell tourned leaues looking booke statute woman shene right forthwith rigour gan looke full angerly sayed vnto queene traitour charged let may man qd starute know long woman hie degree ne low secret wise kepten full close soune echone liberty friend pleasaunt owne purpose wote wight god fiend ne naught shall wit vnto world end queen hath yeue charge pain die neuer rede ne seene myne eie men shall nere counsaile bene womanhood ne knowen guise ne wt think ne wit giue report salomon wise mighty sampson beguiled thrise dalida wote throw may man statute woman know perauenture may right befall bound nature deceiue spinne weep sugre strew gall hert man rauish reiue whet tongue sharp swerde gleue may betide ordinance must lowly doen obseruaunce keepe statute yeuen kind loue hath yeue hem life men may wete turneth euery wind waxen wise inquisitife know secret maid widow wife theytheir statute haue reserued neuer man know hath deserued dresse forth god loue guide qd rigour seek temple bright cithera goddesse beside beseech influence might vertue teach aright serue lady please ye sped set hert ease ye ben vnpurueyed pray eke comfort soone grace destiny ye may set hert ye may like place loue may honour worship felicity aye goeth one assent graunt mercy sir qd forth went deuoutly soft easie pace see venus goddesse image gold found thousand knee fresh faire deadly behold sundry mantils new old painted flame red fire outward shew inward hote desire dolefull chere ful fell complaint cried lady venus rew vpon sore receiue bils teares bedreint may weepe store wo pain v fretteth thou blisseful planet louers sterre shene haue routh v sigh carefull bene punish lady greuously pray false vntrue counterfeit pleasaunce made oth true liue dey chere assured countenaunce falsely footen loues daunce barraine routh vntrue saied lust pleasure alaied yet eft againe thousand million rejoycing loue leading life blisse sayd venus redresse diuision goddesse eternell thy name ihired loues bond knit thing iwis beast vnto beast yearth water wan bird vnto bird woman vnto man life joy resembling life heauenly paradise loue exiler aye vice sinne loue maketh herts lusty deuise honour grace haue euery wise loues law obedient loue maketh folke benigne diligent aye stering drede vice shame degree maketh honourable sweet loue beare name loue faithfull true stable loue pruneth semen amiable loue hath faut erercised sole yt loue dispised honour thee celestiall clere goddesse loue thy celsitude yeuest v light fer doun thy spere piercing heart thy pulcritude comparison none similitude may thy grace made degree hast v set loue vnitie great cause haue praise thy name thee thorough thee liue joy blisse blessed thou soueraine see thy holy court gladnesse may misse thousand sith may rejoyce ben thine hert yfere enflamed thy grace heauenly fere musing tho spaken wise bethought remembraunce mine orizon right goodly deuise pleasauntly herts obeisaunce beseech goddesse voiden greuaunce loued eke saufe yt wist yet downe set sayd ye shall fairest euer bee licour light pensife creature mine hole affiaunce lady free goddesse bright fortune vre yeue yeeld hert thee full sure humbly beseeching lady thy grace bestow blessed place vow faithful true kind without offence mutabilitie humbly serue haue wit mind mine hole affiaunce lady free thilke place ye signe sith thing new yeue aye loue serue needly must obey merciable thy fire grace fix mine hert beauty routh hote loue determine place saufe onely god trouth troubled slumber slepe slouth night visioun see woman roman vp doun meane stature semely behold lustie fresh demure countenaunce yong well shape hair shone gold eyen cristal ferced pleasaunce gan stirre mine hert lite daunce suddainly vanish gan right thus may say loue wote ne dwelling yet fele loue distreineth might iche know would faine god wot serue obey benignitie destinie wise shall neuer see graunt best may liken glad rejoyce liue parfite hele deuoid wrath repent variaunce able doe may wele vnto lady herts hie pleasaunce mighty goddes thy purueiaunce wit thoght lust loue guide thine honor may prouide set mine hert place may like gladly serue affection great paine mine heart doth sticke till sped thine election helpe lady goddesse possession might haue life clepen shall quene heart wife court loue dwell aye done thee sacrifice daily diane eke fight fraye holden werre might suffice goddesse chast keepen wise serue figge chastity law religiousity thus gan finish prayer laud preice youe venus knee mine hert ponder peice gan anone image fresh beautie heile figure sweet heile thee cupide qd rose yede wey temple yede sey shrine surmounting stone rich force pleasaunce mine ey diamond saphire neuer liche haue none seene ne wrought wonderly met philobone hie gan demaund sepulture forsooth qd tender creature shrined pity name saw egle wreke flie pluck wing eke game tender hert hath made die eke would weep mourn right pitously seene louer si ffer great distresse court na none gesse coud louer halfe well auaile ne wo torment rage asken sure withouten faile greef coud heat assuage steed pity speedeth hote courage matter court dead report womanhead weil weep cry speak pray woman would haue pity thy plaint ne mean ease thine hert conuay thee receiuen owne talent say pity causeth thee consent reuth take thy seruice thy paine thou maist please thy soueraine counsaile keepe secretly qd nolde world queene loue wist wite ye matter springen court lenger dout dwellen shame life endry keepe close qd hardely well well shall ye seen said fairest lady vnder sunne come demean lich maid shamefast drede ye shall speak ywis mirrour joy blisse somewhat strange sad demean beware countenaunce seen ouer light ne rechelesse ne bold ne malapert ne renning tong obeisen behold demand ye hence long court without resort among rosiall name hote aright whose heart yet yeuen wight ye also vnderstond loue light auanced word might ye hap freedom maken bond fall grace wele accord well might ye thank ye god loue lord ye saw dreame appere loue one nere yet wote ye remembraunce yeueth ye faine ye say ye loue neuer acquaintaunce saue dream riyt late day yes parde life durst lay ye caught vpon heath saw complain sigh full pitously within herber gardein faire flower grow herbes vertuous sauour swete aire self full hote amorous iwis ye nice daungerous would ye repent loue new nay troth said neuer knew goodly wight whose shal aye guide lord loue hath made forth went chamber gay rosiall womanly see whose streames sotell piercing eye mine hert gan thrill beauty stound ala qd hath yeue wound drede speake till last grete lady reuerently wele sigh gone ouerpast doun keen ful humbly gan knele beseeching feruent wo kele tooke full purpose mind vnto grace painfull hert bind shall fully discriue head round compasse nature haire gold passed liue lilly forehed creature liueliche browes flawe colour pure betwene ye meane disceueraunce euery brow shew due distaunce nose directed streight euen line forme shape thereto conuenient goddes milk white path doth shine eke eyen ben bright orient smaragde vnto judgement yet sterres heauenly small bright visage louely rede white mouth short shit little space flaming somedeale ouer redde mean pregnant lip thick kisse percace lippes thinne fat euer lene serue nauyt worth bean basse full delite maximian truly thus doth write purpose say white snow teeth order stond one stature eke breath trow surmounteth odour euer found sweetnesse body face hond sharpely slender head vnto foot womanhead hold peace thing hidde shall soule tong bewray arraied ye bidde shall well discouer say bend gold silke full fresh gay intresse broudered full wele right smoothly kept shining euerydele necke flower fresh deuise ruby set lusty sene goun light summer wise shapen full wele colour grene aureat sent side clene diuers stone precious rich thus rayed yet saw neuer lich ioue lady seine tho calixto ne yet alemenia neuer hadden armes leine ne loued faire eurosa ye ne yet dane ne antiopa beauty stood rosiall seemed lich thing celestiall bounty fauour port seemelinesse pleasaunt figure mirrour delite gracious seene root gentilnesse angell visage iusty redde white lack saufe daunger alite goodly fresh rule gouernaunce somdele strange pleasaunce truly sone took leaue went enquired impressen gan dent loues dart beheld face eft againe come seeken grace vp put bill sentence clere followeth rede ye shall ye fresh beauty root nature hath formed wele made prince quene ye yt may boot langour word glad ye wounded ye made wo bestad grace redresse mortall greefe ye harme causer caught vnware suddainly persaunt streames eye clere subject seruen mekely man iwis lady dere abiding grace require mercilesse ye cause sterue guerdon liche may deserue troth day breath hert patient meeke suffer death require rue vpon smart swere neuer shall start loues court none aduersitie ye would rue distresse desteny fate houre blisse haue set obedient onely floure iwis trust venus neuer repent euer redy glad diligent ye shall find seruice grace till death life body race humble vnto excellence digne enforcing aye wit delite serue please glad hert benigne troylus troyes knight antonie cleopatre bright neuer thinkes renay shall keepe vnto mine ending day enprint speech memoriall sadly prince salue sore think would becommen thrall owne haue sayd ye must pity cherish man tender desert giue courage expert one hath set hert fire findeth neither refute ne pleasaunce ne word comfort death quite hire ala none allegeaunce wo ala great greuaunce loue vnloued ye lady dere wise may gouerne matere truly gramercy friend good profer humble wise seruice take keep still ye say ought well cherise greefe remedy deuise know nam acquainted well ne wot sothly ye dwell art loue write song make may song honour king quene loue vndertake sadde shall tull merry sing daungerous ben euery thing beseech seene rede let answere put drede name rehearse pray whence condition ye let see come say faine would know disposition ye haue put old entention ye meane serue ne wote saufe ye say ye loue wonder hote name ala hert make thou straunge philogenet calld fer nere cambrige clerk neuer think chaunge fro heuenly stremes clere rauish mine hert ghost infere since first write bill grace thinke see mercy face wt mene god al hath wrought bill maketh small mention ye lady mine inward thought mine hert withouten offencion best loue sith begon draw court lo might say yeeld vnto nobley offend wilfully pompe hert precept disobay done againe unskilfully greuen earnest play correct ye right sharply pray seene vnto womanhede rew el nam dede nay god forbede fesse grace word sugred eloquence haue compassion little space time yt v hen ye shall find insolence eye may ye suffre sight may ye looke vpon candle light clerer hotter mine eie yet ye sayd beames perse frete shall ye candle light endrie well wote ye hath sharper hete ye bid correct bete ye offend nay may done come yt speden sone withdraw eie withdraw presens eke hurt selfe foly look would sorry make sicke woman beware eke took ye beth clerke go serchen well book woman ben light winne nay bide tho ye kinne sone ye may win mine hert truth guise court seen stedfastnesse done haue vpon reuth owne desert lowly gentilnesse reward joy heauinesse tho ye waxen pale grene dede ye must vse withouten drede accept grutchen wise ye heartely desire lene loue thinke ye wise cease language cease require hath twenty yeare ben may obtaine maruaile ye bold loue treat ah mercy hert lady loue rightwise princesse liues guide may plain venus aboue ruthlesse ye gaue wound wide haue done may betide trouth may receiued ala daunger cruelte wofull houre got welaway wofull houre fostred ifedde wofull houre iborne ne may supplication sweetly haue spedde frosty graue cold must bedde without ye list grace mercy shewe death axe fast doth hewe great disease littell littel joy felte neuer yet wo fortune ginneth smile neuer earst felt harde fit confounden ben spirites wit till lady take cure loue beste erthly creature like may come plain haue habondaunce sorrow thought sit wonder nie withhold might pleasance yet turne againe worldly suffisaunce lady bright saufe faithfull true die yet one vpon rewe fell sound dede stone colour slaine wanne asshe pale hand caught vp anon arise qd haue ye dronken dwale slepen ye nitertale mercy sweete qd iwis affraied thing qd hath made dismaied wote well ye louer hew witnesse thing said ye secret ye might know qd curteise kind shuld alaid mine hert al haue missaid shall amend set hert ease word qd doth please charge yt ye stent keepe breke slouth ignoraunce gan smile laughen depe iwis qd pleasaunce xvi statute doth great greuaunce ye must releasse modifie graunt qd truly softly colour gan appere rose red throughout visage wherefore thinke accordyng right cleped rosiall thus haue word great small goodly worde loue best trust shall yet sette mine hert rest goth said philobone take man lede within court shewe sake louers dwell within rout officer shew dout straunger yet come qd philobone philogenet must ye gon stalkyng soft easie pace saw kyng stonden enuiron attendaunce diligence felow fortherer asperaunce many one dred offend stood alone eke cruell aduersair louers foe cleped dispair vnto spake angrely fell said lady disseiue ne shall trowest thou qd yt tell true nay nay vnder hony gall thy birth nothing egall cast thine hert word white good faith loueth thee alite eke remembre thine habilite may compare well thou wot ye came hope said frend let beleue dispaire ginneth dote ala qd cold hote one biddeth loue toder nay thus wote best say well wote lady graunted truly woundes remedie gentilnesse may infected doublenesse thus trust till die cast voide dispaires company taken hope councel friend yea keep well qd philobone mind beside within bay window stod one grene ful large bread length beard black fethers crow name lust wonder might strength delite argue thinkth opinion loue sinne hath begon reason fast ledge auctoritie nay qd delite loue vertue clere soule progresse holdeth blind apetite lust doth often stere sinne reason lacketh thou dost think thy neighbour wife win yet thinke well loue may sinne god seint loue right verely void sinne vise know well affection flesh sinne truly verray loue vertue fele loue may thy freill desire ackele verray loue loue withouten sinne stint qd lust thou spekest worth pinne left arguing roming ferther castell wide corner lier stode talking lesings fast flatery beside said woman weare attire pride men found nature variaunt could false shewen beaw semblaunt flatery bespake said ywis see goth patens faire fete doth right well prety man rometh truly drink ne mete nede haue mine hert joy doth bete behold goodly fresh semeth loue hert tender nesh court lusty folke glad well becommeth abite array sory sad complaining thus blacke white gray freres ben monkes good fay ala routh great dole seene see thus bewaile sory see cry wring hand white sone went religion eke nonnes vayle wimple plight thought ben confusion ala sain fain perfection clothes wide lacke libertie sinne mote frends venus wote wold faine ye bene attyred welbesene desiren man soue degre ferm faithful right wold quene frends wick tender youth grene ayenst made v religious cause mourn wa len thus said monk freres tide wel may curse abbe place statute sharpe sing cope wide chastely keepe v loues grace neuer fele comfort ne solace yet suffre heate loues fire haply desire fortune cursed wherefore hast thou said berafte v libertie sithe nature yaue v instrument store appetite loue louers mote suffer soch aduersite diane serue venus refuse ful often sithe matter doth v muse serue honour sore ayenst chastite goddes queene v leefer venus biden still haue reward loue soget bene vnto woman courtly fresh shene fortune curse thy wheele variance well thou reuist plesance thus leaue voice plaint care raging wo cry full petously yede full naked full bare behold looking dispitously pouerty dedly cast eye welaway cried faine ne might glad desire attaine lacke richesse worldly good banne curse weep sain ala pouerty hath v hent yt whilom stood herts ease free good case dare shew self place ne v embold dwell company hert wold loue right faithfully yet againward shriked euery nonne pange loue straineth crie wo time qd boun hatefull ordre nise done v die sighe sobbe bleden inwardly freting self wth thoght hard complaint nie loue waxen wood faint stood beholding ware sort full languishing sauage wild loking chere mantelles clothes ey tering oft nature complaining member lacked foo hand visage wry blind vnderstand lacked shape beauty preferre themself loue said god kind hath forged worshippen sterre venus bright leften behind werkes clene mind full shape beauty qd deformity nie company haue susters waried missaide meane three fatal destiny worker sodenly abraide gan cry affraide curse qd euer hath nature iformed v wofull life endure eke contrite gan repent confessing hole wound cithere hath darte hote desire sent loue must subject held skornes vanity said louers held blisful life yong men old widow maid wife bereue goddesse qd thy might skornes skoffes haue power moken wight thy seruice dwell raue know well right god saue shal chief post thy faith loue uphold reuers saith dissemble stode ferre troth party mantil party hode hose said vpon lady routh aud thus wound gan glose entent ful double suppose world said loued wele ay thought loued nere dele eke shamfastnesse tooke hede blushed rede durst nat ben aknow louer thereof drede stode hing visage downe alow sight seene trow rose rody stalke coud wight spy speak talk loues art gan abashe ne durst vtter al preuity many stripe many greuous lashe gauen wolden louers hindered sore simple cominalty wise durst grace mercy craue need ask haue aprochein speke shamefastnesse returneth thinke secret counsel breke lady wil haue scorn v certein perauenture thinken great disdein thus shame fastnesse may bringe dispeire dede toder heire come forth vaunter ring thy bel spied sone god make vowe loked blacke fendes doth hell first qd euer wowe within worde come wotte armes lady free hath ben thousand mo england britain spain picardy artois fraunce vp hie holand burgoine naples italy nauerne grece vp hethen lond neuer woman yet wold withstond ben commaundement wold lacked neyther siluer coigne ne gold met estate broched trow lo goeth one mine wotte ye fresh attired haue laid full lowe soch one yonder eke right well know kept statute lay ifere yet yon hath made right good chere thus hath vaunter blowen euery al knoweth thousand fold auncestry kinne lier first maketh promise hold lady councel vnfold wherfore secret doth vnshitte lieth world may witte falsing promise behest wounder sore hath fantasie lacketh wit trow beast bet reason gie mine aduise loue shall contrary auaile eke dishonour court shall sojour take heed qd little philobone enuy rocketh corner yond sitteth dirke ye shall see anone leane body fading face hond himselfe fretteth vnderstond witnesse ouid methamorphosose louers fo glose louer thinketh promote enuy grutch repining wele swelleth sore herts rote wise cannot liue hele faithful lady stele enuy noise ring round sey much worse done dout priuy thought rejoysing himselfe stood ferre thence abite maruellous yon thought spirit elfe subtill image curious qd shaded thus yonder cloth colour nere went gan lere pore framed question full hard qd thing thou louest best bote vnto thy paine hard thinke thou liuest great vnrest thou wandrest aye south east west east north ferre see place court may holden thee followest thou thy hertiset demaund asoile thee require thought qd creature may let ben desire absence hath done fire mery thought kindeleth yet againe bodely thinke soueraine stand speake laugh kisse halse thought comforteth ful oft think god wote though al world false true thinke also soft lady speach loft bringeth min hert joy great gladnes priuy thought alayeth mine heauines wt thinke man earth tell iwis eke ni swalow swift ne swan wight wing ne half yerne flie bene right sodenly heuen hell paradise lady desire counsell ferre wide wote lorde lady theyr preuitie wotte colde hote shall speake without licence mine soch seasonable first thing thought within yt hart er word mouth astart word thought bad farewel yede eke forth went seene court guise doore came god spede twenty courteours age assise liche high brode aduise golden loue leden loue hight tone sad toder glad light yes draw heart force might lustinesse benas ye haue seid thinke drope fauour hight ne neuer vnto desire obeid till sodenly thought affraied seene ware dede countenaunce pite bade done pleasaunce shrine rose death liue mine care full priuely spake doth seruaunt hen away driue rosial qd mine hert drake tenderich found moch lacke person selfe bethought saide man myne hearte hath sought gramercy pity might suffise yeue due laude vnto thy shrine gold god wotte would sith thou rise death liue behold thanken thousand time told eke lady rosial shene hath comfort set mine hert iwene make mine protestacion depely swere mine power bene faithful deuoide variacion forbeare anger tene seruiceable worldes quene al reason intelligence done honour high reuerence spoke sone worde souerain thanke hertely said abide ye shall dwell still till season come may truly king loue company shall hold feste full rially well bode till season fell may day larke began rise matens went lusty nightingale within temple shapen hauthorn wise might slepe nightertale domine labium gan cry gale lippes open lord loue cry let mouth thy preising bewry egle sang venite body let v joy loue health deske anon gan fall came late preced stealth sayd ye faucon herts wealth domine dominus noster wote ye god done v brenne thus hote coeli enarrant said popingay might told heauen firmament came gold finch freshe gay said psalme hertily glad intent domini est terra laten intent god loue hath yerth gouernaunce ye wren gan scippen daunce jube domino lord loue pray commaund well lesson rede legende woulden dey marters loue god yet soul spede thee venus sing drede influence thy vertue great besechyng thee keepe v heat second lesson robin redebrest sang haile god goddes lay lectorn amorously sprong haile qd eke fresh season may moneth glad singen spray haile floures rede white blewe vertue maketh lust new third lesson turtil doue toke thereat lough maui scorne said god mote dine suppe folish doue giue u al horne ben right better borne rede lesson well eke hote loue degree turtil doue said welcom welcom may gladsom light louers ben trew thanke thee lord loue doth puruey rede lesson al dewe good soth corage pursue serue make till death v must depart tu autem sang apart te deum amoris sang thrustel cocke tuball himselfe first musician key armony coude locke swete tewne thrustel lorde loue praysen qd done al foules great lite honour may fals louers dispite dominus regnauit said pecocke lord loue mighty prince iwis receyued euery iubilate sing meaneth said linet welcome lord blisse stert owle benedicite meaneth mery fare qd laudate sang larke voice ful shril eke kight admirabile quere wil thorow mine ear pers thril welcome may season qd honour lord loue mote hath feste solempne hie amen said al said eke pie forth cockow gan procede anon benedictus thanking god hast may would visite echon gladden feast shal last therewithal laughter brast thanke god shuld end song seruice hath ben long thus sang seruice fest done right erly dome forth goth court lest fetch floures fresh braunch blome namely hauthorn brought page grome wth fresh garlants party blew white rejoysen great delite eke ech threw floures bright primerose violete gold beheld royall fight lady gan sodenly behold trewe loue plited many fold smote heart bliue venus yet thanke aliue explicit chaucer dream never printed year heretofore hath gone name dream book dutch death blanch dutch lancaster dream devised chaucer seemeth covert report marriage john gaunt king son blanch daughter henry duke lancaster long love time whereof poet feigneth dead end consent friend happily married figured bird bringing bill herb restored life also shewed chaucer match certain gentlewoman although stranger notwithstanding well liked loved lady blanch lord chaucer also gladly concluded marriage flora queen pleasaunce whole achieued thobeysaunce fresh new season thorow euery region mantle whole couert winter made discouert auenture without light may lay vpon night alone lady thought lord wrought couth well entayle imagery shewed great maistry little space made body face great beauty swich feature creature thought lay lodge way beside well forest hunting tooke rest nature kind wrought halfe sleepe brought gan dreame thinking mind knowliche like making dreamed thought saw slept nought wherefore yet full beleeue good spirit eue meane curious port bare saw payne sport whether woke slept well wot lough wept wherefore woll remembraunce put whole payne pleasaunce axen hele would god ye wist euery dele least ye might night another haue sight although payne yet morow ye would fayne wish might long dure might ye say ye good cure dreames wenes see much better yet may hee wit eke lasse woll hindere thinke see mine eene iwis may dreame kene signe signifiaunce hasty thing souning pleasaunce wise vpon night ye haue heard without light wakyng ne full sleepe houre louers weepe cry lady grace befell wonder cace ye shall heare wise wholly deuise playne english euill written sleepe writer well ye witten excused though mi one waking wherefore gentilnesse requyre boistousnesse ye let passe thing rude heareth woll conclude endityng taketh heed ne tearmes god speed let passe nothing thus befell shall within yle thought wall yate glasse closed round leauelesse none come ne vncouth straunge behold euery yate fine gold thousand fanes aie turning entuned briddes singing diuers fane paire open mouth thaire sute toures subtily coruen floures vncouth colour aye neuer none seene may many small turret hie man liue could non sie ne creature saue lady play theyr array thought goodlihead passeden womanhead behold daunce sing seemed like none earthly thing vncouth countinaunce euery play right vsaunce one age euerichone seemed saue onely one vvhich yeeres suffisaunce might neyther sing ne daunce yet countenaunce glad fewe yeeres lady little dere lustines laugh tale full stuffed male disports new playes fayre day maistresse seemed well lusty companie might ensure one conningest creature said euerichone euer knew fayled none sober well auised euery fault disguised nothing vsed faith truth na young great ruth euery ech place gouerned grace stode alway poore riche word none liche ne halfe able maistres lusty companie befell auised yle suffised whole state euery lusty yle wonder deuise ioieux paradise dare well say floure ne tree ne thing wherein pleasaunce might bee fayled none euery wight desired day night rich heale beauty ease euery thing might please thinke haue cost country bene ne heard tell life creature might dwell thus yle auised throughout state arayed heart wexe well payed selfe assured body well vred sith might haue grace see lady place faire ensure dome though nature would euer striue paine con ne mowattaine least feature amend though would conning spend beauty might auaile paine lost trauaile part natiuity alarged beauty eke thing notable vnto death ay durable beauty dure neuer seene creature saue onely trow hath wist ne know wherefore praise conning beauty rich thing liues certaine quite euery paine wend thus haue seene state rich might beene thought impossible see one thing beauty glad conning serue auaile might thing sodainly stood lady couth much good vnto came smiling chere said benedicite yere saw neuer man tell ye come hider name ye dwell ye seeke eke mote ye tell ye come place soth well told may cause grace el ye mote prisoner vnto lady haue gouernaunce yle word gan smile lusty rout lady stood madame qd night past lodged slept fast forest beside well tell vvot whose ordinance onely fortune purueiance vvhich put many gesse trauaile paine businesse lettes nothing truth sleeth eke ruth wherefore doubt brittilnes variance vnsteadfastnes yet afraid beyng amaid wonder thing seemeth thus many fresh lady see faire cunning yong man dwelling among hider come madame qd faine long processe seeme princesse please commaund say obay power fulfill prisoner bide till duly enformed euery thing ye aske lady right well apaid hand tooke said welcome prisoner aduenturus right glad ye haue said thus ye doubt displease assay ease word ye anon lady euerichon assembled counsaile went soone sent said manere word word ye shall see v thinke maruaile without bote saile subtilty wyle ye get haue entre yle yet shall ye see gentill woman bee loth displease wight notwithstanding great right ye shall well vnderstond old custome lond hath continued many yere ye shall well wete v ye may bide cause twaine purposed saine thone ordinance long continuance woll sothly tell man among v dwell wherefore ye mote need retourne wise may sojourne thother eke queene realme ye may seene may v charge let goe large cause doubt doe fault suffer may noysaunce againe old accustomaunce cause twaine heard god paine sodainly mine hart came one smart creeping soft steale doe robbe mine heale made thought fraid courage stode dismaid standing thus grace lady came apace huge prease told queene without ariued would come well thider might twin hied would abide bridling horse ride fiue sixe two three one abode queene meet euerichone went bode one soft pase imagining purchase grace queene bide till good fortune happy guide send might would bring borne wonning way ne foot knew none ne witherward nist gone sea yle wonder though list smile seeing case vncouth straunge like perilous chaunge imagining thus walking alone saw lady euerichone might somwhat offer sone drew nere tho ware queene lady kneene joyous word gladly aduised welcomed suffised though prince hole enuironed see thus auising chere sad sodainly glad greater joy mote thriue trow neuer man liue tho ne heart light lady sight queene come one clothing knight also well beseene saw come queene whome lady yle huge wonder long till last right soberly queene selfe full cunningly soft word good wise said lady young nise sister hath befall trow ye know one long time haue beene within yle biding queene liuing ease neuer wight parfit joy haue ne might gouernance found whole pleasance euery thing ye know custome low first found trow ye wote manere queene yle haue long ech seuen yeeres vsage visit heauenly armitage rocke high stonds strange sea londs make pilgrimage called long perillous viage wind good frend journey dures end vndertakes twenty thousand one scape vpon rock growth tree certaine yeeres beares apple three vvhich three apple may haue displeasaunce saue seuen yeere may fall wote well one first apple bext growth vnto next hath three vertues notable keepeth youth aie durable beauty looke euer one best euerichone second apple red grene onely lookes yene nourishes pleasaunce better partidge fesaunce feed euery liues wight pleasantly sight third apple three groweth lowest tree beares may faile pleasaunce may auaile pleasure beauty rich youth euer liche truth cunning weale hath aye floured good heale without sicknes displeasaunce thing noysaunce haue goddess liued aboue princess befall ye may see gather said apple three haue failed againe day thitherward take way wening speed oft come find aloft sister stand hauing apple hand auising nothing said looked well paid stood behold thinking joyes cold sith apple haue ne might euen came knight armes aware tooke ship bare said though neuer seen yet long lady vvherefore wend would liues end seruant gan sing one wonne rich thing tho spirit fro gone sodainly euerichone appeared death felt neither life ne breath ne good ne harme none knew sodaine paine new hasty grace lady fro tree gentilnesse hied comfort died three apple one mine hand put anone vvhich brought againe mind breath recouered death vvherefore hold thing wold lech smart great paine quite mine hart god wote right ye heare comfort friendly cheare prowesse might truly eke knight couth oft said wo ill paid cursed ship brought mast master wrought ech thing mote haue end sister brother frend con word womanly knight entreat conningly mine honour also said go ship brought vvhich wonderfully wrought cleane rich araid content paid comfort please mine heart put ease toke great paine little thus hath brought v yle ye may see wherfore echone pray thanke one one heartily ye deuise imagine wise tho men might seen world lady fall kneen lady vvas left none standing rout altogither went one kneele spared stone ne estate ne blood well shewed couth much good lady made feast word least friendly faithfully said cunningly wonder seing youth language couth wholly gouerned thanking lady said maundement commaundement great joy winning towne troy hardy greekes strong wan slege long see lady place receiued talked yle lady lady altogither queene selfe began play aged lady say seemeth good sith altogither ordaine deuise best set knight rest woman feble wight rere warre knight sith place lift danger grace great vi tiranny faine would ye owne country peace ease way v please might beseech hereof fall speech lady tho began smile auising little glad chere said anone madam vnto gone speake fele desire euery dele soberly lady tho selfe lady two tooke sad chere said knight manere sir prince yle pleasance many mile ye sought haue vnderstond till last ye haue fond sent hath lady twaine heare thing ye saine cause ye haue sought faine would wote whol thouyt wo cause euery wight vnware force ye ship bare nigh agone mind ne speech none painfull creature dying abode aduenture see indure paine weell say vnto plaine right selfe ye amisse seing prince knight cowth good right truth meued blood pale woxe lead lookt would dead blood none nother cheke worldlesse semed sicke proued well without mouing paas sodainely thing dying fell downe sowning wo lady fraid vnto queene hyed said cometh anon haue blisse ye wise thing amisse knight dead soone lo lyeth swoone without word answering haue said thing wherefore doubt blame might hindering name floured hath many yere long nothing would wise dyed wherefore good ye hyed life saue least wo ceast commaund void dwell wise dare mell thing wherein perill like fall queene right tho full great feare lady present vnto knight came lay made lady say lo queene awake shame doe good game lye mind well seene wit blind see many lady ye make none chere ye set nought arise loue bought said word one spake ne answere gaue none queene pitty tho worship like also saue paine quoke feare gan saine woe ala shall doe shall say man vnto die lost name shal play perillous game thing amisse shall said rigour whereby name impayre might like die eke knight word band laid vpon brest said awake knight lo speake tell ye fare thus paine endure seing ye country sure among friend would heale heart ease eke weale wist might ease know thing might please ensure faile heale might auaile wherefore heart pray ye rise let v talke play see many lady comen make good chere nought still stone lay word spoke none long might braid queene said wist word last mercy twise cried fast pitty voice heare behold painefull cheare fained well sein visage eyn queene cast sighed would brast shright wonder see wo sith paine first named neuer wofull paine attained voice dead gan plaine himselfe word saine wofull wight full malure worse dead yet dure maugre paine death fell breath nam dead sith ne serue sith lady sterue art thou death art thou agast well shall meete yet last though thou thee hide nought thou dwelst thou shalt sought maugre thy subtill double face die right place thy dishonour mine ease thy manner wight please need thee sith thee seche thee hide paine eche well wost thou liue would world giue haue cowardise lost joy heale seruise made soueraigne lady liues trow fo euer end thus haue neither joy ne frend wote whether hast sloth hath caused troth hermitage full hie saw first mine iye hied till aloft made pace small soft till mine armes fast ship bare last whereof displeased endlesse seemed wo thereof great fere repent come hast trow gan displease cause disease word gan cry death death twy thry motred wot slouth euen queene routh armes tooke said mine owne knight euill apaid lady sent haue knowledge entent good faith meant well would ye wist euery dele ywis word gan kisse prayed rise said would welfare truth told disease right sory faine would please life saue word tho said many mo comforting paine would deliuered faine knight tho vp cast een saw queen word said right wo gan braid vp dress knele queene aussing wonder wele rose ouerthrew wherefore queene yet eft anew armes anon tooke pitiously gan looke nothing said ne spake like well paid ne chere made sad ne light one euery wight seene conning estate without noise debate saue onely looke piteous womanhead vndispiteous showed countenance seemed heart obeisance reine recure peine heart put large entent barge bring eue certaine lady take leue pray gentilnesse suffer thenceforth peace prince thence forth euermore would worship wise gentilnesse might deuise paine wholly fulfill honour pleasure thus knight wo present queene mo lady many another wight ten thousand ship sight saw come ouer wawy flood saile ore ood behold gan maruaile might come many saile sith time bore nauy seene ne arayed sight heart played fro within brest joy long would rest sailes full floures castels huge toures seeming full armes bright wonder lusty sight large toppes mastes long richly depeint rear among certaine time gan repaire small bird downe thaire ship bound sate song voice full ballade layes right joyously cowth harmony write see mine excuse may matter long name bird write song whereof anon riding vnto queene soone brought many ala many doubt shewing ship without tho gan aged lady weepe said ala joy sleepe soone shall brought ye long night discried knight certes may none yond companie come seche word failed speche vvithout remedy destroid full oft said gan conclude holy last best shit yates fast arme good langage done old vsage fayre wordes make shot counsaile knot purpose tooke none armed thus forth gone toward walles yle come long met great lord boue called god loue auised chere right angry auailed wall glasse mighty lord let passe shutting yates fast ordained wast ship found land lord anon bow hand yle huge prease hied fast would cease till came knight lay queene ne lady way tooke heed forth past yet followed last came lay knight well shewed great might forth queene called anone lady euerichone said thus routh see seruaunt trouth thus leane thus sicke paine wot vnto plaine saue onely one without mo might heale fo word heauy brow shewed queene looked row mighty lord forth tho anone looke fault echone shew little speech commaunding leech withouten shortly say thought queene soone obay hond shoke bow said right soone would know long refused seruice lawes vsed let wit wroth bent bow forth goth pace two euen large draught vp eare drew arrow ground sharpe new queene wound gaue piersed vnto hart afterward full sore gan smart whole many yeare euen good cheare knight qd thee hele thee restore parfite wele paine thou hast endured haue two joy thou art cured forth past rout sober cheare walking said thought heare well wist seruaunts passed anon fond lady tooke hond made chere goddes beaute called prince bounty eke gaue name said nothing blame vertuous sauing would pity vse cause sought put far thought sith whole richesse womanhead friendlinesse said nothing fitting void pity owne legging gan preach play beauty told aie said creature name endure bookes full pleasaunce put euer remembraunce thought friendly vnto lady goodlely spake appuls trow possession wherefore long procession many pace arme vnder welke none would commaund say forthwith need must obay desired lest lady request long together beene brought lady queene said god speed shew grace consent need lady tho full conningly right well auised womanly downe gan kneele vpon floures vvhich aprill nourished shoures mighty lord gan say pleaseth woll obay restraine thought ye woll thyng shall wrought word kneeling quoke mighty lord armes tooke said haue seruaunt one truer liuing none vvherefore good seeing trouth paine ye routh purpose heare speech fully auised leech one thyng ye may sure may dure word right game thought lough told name vvhich maruaile fere nist ne whether bet none abide thus gone well wend lady wold imagen deme told counsaile whole made complaint vnto lord mighty saint verily thyng vnsought said knowne thought told trouth mine vnease bet couth haue mine ease though studied weke well wist lord seke would leched wonder faine man blame mine paine lord said long lady plaid gan smile spirit glade answere made put double peine ne seine wist ne best ferre heart fro rest thought smiling signe token heart encline would request reasonable smiling fauorable euery thing shall thriue thought tho anon bliue wordlesse answere toun tane obligatioun ne called surety wise amongst called wise thus joyous dout sure vnsurest rout right mine heart thought lesse wexe fere one thought made wele another shent euery dele till last couth purposed serue truly liues space awaiting euer yeare grace vvhich may fall yet sterue please serue serued haue woll euer thyng none leuer seruice whose presence mine heauen whole absence hell full diuers paine vvhych death full oft straines thus thought stood vnneth felt harme ne good saw queene little paas come mighty lord kneeled downe presence lady vvith sober countenaunce auised word well suffised lord anon present bill wherein whole entent vvas written besought knew euery thought godhead grace would forgyue old trespace vndispleased time past would euer stedfast seruice death vse euery thought breath sight wept said vvithin written sore whych bill lord gan smyle said would within yle lord syre east west cald new conquest great councell tooke queene long tale betweene ouer bill read thrise wonder gladly gan deuise feature faire visage bad good thrift image sayd trowed compleint cause corseint sleeue put bill none knew forth walke apace beholding lusty rout halfe thought smiling chere till last ye shall turned vnto queene ageine said morne pleine woll ye purposed ben weare flour lusty colour vse may excuse ne none wise able seruise said haue lord euermore yle haue shall ioy peace ease pleasaunce liues vse without noysaunce state seene turned visage queene giue knowledge full answere bill nay ne word none obeisaunt seemed echone queene vvell seemed great fere tooke lodging euery night vvas none departed night read old romance occupied pleasance make verelaies lay diuerse play romance tooke reading booke thought sphere run rising sun prees piaine assemble gone great paine one might go ne stand ne none take hand vvithouten distourbed huge great prees within two houres mighty lord floures diuers colour many paire estate vp aire vvell two fathom hight set sight queene knight lady euery wight hast sent neuer one vvas absent come echone thus assembled ye haue heard say vvithout tarrying hight seene euery wight vp stood among prees aboue counsayler seruaunt loue vvhich seemed well great estate shewed debate owe ne goodly might vsed gentilnesse excused vvherefore said lord vvas euery wight still pee one accord thus commaunded word tongue swiche language turne yet mine age heard neuer conningly man speake ne halfe faithfully euery thing said seemed insealed approued trew swiche cunning language new well according chere thinke yet alway mine one place may alone first con lusty yle thastate little rehearse wholly euery thing caused lord comming euery wele euery wo cause ech thing vvell shewed easie speech sicke need leech whole grace told plainly thing last con conclude voided euery language rude said prince mighty lord departing would accord party present fine entent vvitnesse presence sight vvhich sits among might kneeled downe withouten word spake tho gan mighty lord dresse vvith cheare auised largesse said vnto knight ye shall joy restored ye haue ben true ye twaine graunt euery paine thousand joy euery weeke looke ye lenger seeke lady lo hem take ech beeth good chere happy day new begun sith rising sun place graunt wholly stand grace serueth truely without slouth auaunced trouth tho knight downe kneele vvening doe wonder wele seeing lord great mrrcy v hath enriched openly deserue may neuer least part euermore vvith soule body truely serue till sterue lady stood knight couth mikel good vvent hast also ioyous glad tho also rich euery thought hath ought nought besought humble wise v taccept seruice shew v friendly cheares vvhich treasure many yeares kept v great paine told seruants twaine vvere would euer death chaunge would neuer ne doe offence ne thinke like ill fill ordinance made othes fresh new old seruice renew wholly euermore vve become might well awaiting slouth vve made ne fault ne trouth ne thought ensure vvith may dure season past againe eue lord queene tooke leue said would hastely returne good leisure sojourne honour ease commaunding fast knight please gaue statute paper ordent diuers officer forth ship night went soone sight morrow aire attempred wonder faire early rising sun night away run playing v riuage lady spake voyage said made small journies held straunge country forthwith queene went shewed wholly entent tooke leaue cheare weeping pitty see parting queene paine martyr new yssaine woe tender yet weepe oft remember offerd resigne lady eight time nine thastate yle shortly tell might please dwell said euer linage lady doe homage hole withouten ye euermore nay god forbid lady oft many conning word soft said euer thing beene consent queene estate well named wise attamed would faine hert befell smert doe thing might please wise ease kissed bad good night leue wept many wight might men lady praised name araised cunning friendlinesse beauty gentilnesse glad friendly cheare vsed yeares wonder euery wight say well might prees vpon morrow ship brought sorrow made vnder saile ye wist ye would meruaile forth goeth ship goeth fond wood man vnbond doubt behind sea withouten fere anon ran till waw sodenly ouerthraw water fro backward forward trauailed mind breath nigh gone good ne harme knew none til last hooke tweine men ship mikel peine saue life trauaile ye wist ye would meruaile ship drew hie saiden would die laid long downe mast clothes cast made testament wist selfe ment said would mast wo told tane leaue euery wight closed mine eyen lost sight auised die without speech remedy seech grace new great need lady paine tooke heed bethought trouth see die great routh came sober wise softly said pray rise come let fare shall wel haue ye care obey ye fulfill holy lord long ago list commaunded againe resistence may without great offence therefore say friendly aye rise vp behold auauntage graunt inheritage peaceably without striue day liue apple sleue one put took leue word said good hele made send wele wherewith paine one tooke leaue bone new durense pleasaunce couth desired daunce whole wight vp rose joyous heart light hole vnsicke right wele ease forget disease lady plaid went anone said joy person please first ordained parfite ease euery pleasure depart send madame large part good plenty done beauty hele may thought send wrought madame quoth seruaunt trew haue ben long yet new without chaunge repentaunce wise variaunce thriue euer thing none leuer please euer fare mine heart lady welfare life mine hele lech also euery thing doth wo helpe need surete euery joy longs succour whole wise may thought man deuise grace madame haue found need bound euer christ saue heale liue haue wherefore reasoun serue due obeisaunce till sterue dead quicke euer late early hour tho came lady small alite plaine english con consite word whole entent shewed ment meward euery wise wholly came deuise without processe long trauell charging keepe counsell would grace attaine commaundement faine wherefore passe ouer time counsell cord well rime eke oth haue swore breake better vnbore untrue euermore hold neuermore place report thing auaile might comfort mewards wise andech wight would dispise couth repreeue thing sore greeue wherefore hereof mencion make ne long sermon shortly thus excuse rime councell refuse sailing thus two dayes three lady towards countrie ouer waues high greene large deepe betweene vpon time called said hele well paid queene yle talked long seene state queene lady name name two houres mo game till last wind gan rise blew fast wise ship euery wight say madame er eue day god tofore ye shall ye would fainest ye doubt within sixe hour ye shall word gan smile said long set vp rose ship gose made good cheare euery wight till land sight sight glad god wot abashed aboot aud forth goeth shortly tell accustomed dwell receiued good right joyous cheere heart light glad new auenture pleasaunt euery creature landing tho woke found chamber full smoke cheekes eke vnto eares body weat teares feeble wise vnneth might rise fare trauailed faint neither knew kirke ne saint ne ne ne auised way would go venturous grace rise walkt sought pace pace till winding staire found held vice aye hond vpward softly gan creepe till came thought sleepe mine ease preace good leisure peace till somewhat recomfort trauell great feare endured thought without wight witlesse faint without chamber paint full story old diuers rehearse vnto bed full soberly might full sothly pace nothing said till last downe laid mind would giue leue dreamed eue rehearse right child schoole verse doth thinketh thriue right liue thought haue remembraunce paine pleasaunce dreame whole befell ye tell thus thought lay happy unhappy day wot haue blame two name befell thought processe new sleepe brought gouerned againe within yle thought whereof knight lady sight assembled greene knight lady queene assembly said content paid wholly thing knight king would sure witnesse wedded lesse remembraunce without thus consent euermore concluded knight depart night forthwith tooke voiage journey marriage returne host wedded might least concluded written sealed might repealed wise aie firme within tearme without excusation feast coronation knight thereof charge anon little barge brought late eue tooke leaue barge man thought pleasure brought queene selfe accustomed aye barge play needeth neither mast ne rother haue heard another maister gouernaunce hie sayled thought pleasaunce vvithout labour east vvest one calme tempest went request first prayed fest vvhen came countree passed wauy see hauen deepe large left rich noble barge court shortly tell went wont dwell receiued good right heire worthy knight vvith state lond vvhich came anon first sond vvith glad spirit full trouth loth fault slouth attaint wise rich old seruise vvhich euer trew fond sith first inhabit lond receiued king forgotten thing owe done ne might please ne soueraine lord ease shortly say custome done aye seuen yere past father old wise hore king land tooke leue baron eue told dayes past vvere comen last hertily prayed hem remember sonne yong tender borne prince returne countree might aduenture grace vvithin time space true friendly aye bene alway thus prayd without tooke leaue euermore knowen tender age young prince great viage vncouth straung honour seche tooke hond little speeche vvhich seeke prince desired rich great name floured time mo estate ne well named borne none euer blamed prince somewhat haue spoke thus befell ye shall heare vnto lord made cheare joy present see troth ment glad ech one among one desired rich lord prince might please faire fast desired heire said great surety ywis speaking prince himselfe auised plaine english vndisguised shewed hole journey counsell gan prey told ensured day might passe vvithout diffame great blame euer shame counsell auise prayth twise would within ten day auise ordaine way displeasaunce ne realme ouer great grieuaunce haue might feast sixty thousand least intent within short returne vnto yle came fro kepe day nothing would away counsaile tho lord anon chamber euerychone togither went deuise might best wise puruey lord pleasaunce realmes continuaunce honor continued euermore last found way within next ten day might paine diligence done cast dispence might draw conclusion made ech thing prouision done wholly tofore prince lord come shewed done couth reason find within ten day might depart way would fifteene least returne might feast shewed euery reason might hastily desired ne day might keepe way diuers cause wonder great vvhich heard heat fell sorow seke still bed whole weke nigh tother shame doubt blame might aret oft vpon brest said ala mine honour aye haue lost cleane day dead would ala name shall aye henceforth shame dishonoured repreued neuer shall beleeued made swich sorow trouth behold great routh endured dayes fiftene till lord euen come told ready shewed word wise purueyd estate said twenty thousand knight name fourty thousand without blame come noble ligine togider compane vvere lodged riuers side pleasure tabide prince tho joy vp rose lodged go vvithout night supper made right bode till dey forthwith take journey leuing streight holding large till came noble barge prince lusty knight vvith people armes bright vvas comen thought pa knew well none abiding behind present forthwith anon intent told made cry ofte day twise commaunding euery liues wight present sight morow riuage vvhere begin would viage morrow come cry kept night slept trussed purueied morrow fault ship sorrow saue barge two ship saw mo thus douths stood waxing sea comming flood cried ship goe euery wight hie hie might barge thought echone went without left one horse male trusse ne bagage salad speare gard brace ne page lodged roome ynough shipping thought lough gan maruaile thought euer ship wrought people encrease ne neuer thicke might prease roome one lodged ill trow selfe last one lodged mast looked saw rome lodged towne forth goth ship said creed knee good speed downe kneeled euery wight praied fast yle might come safety prince company worship without blame disclaunder name promise retourne within time sojourne lond biding host prayer least keepe day might appointed queen returne without slouth assured trouth fault prince knight time slept night wo disease doubt queene displease forth goeth ship speed right prince great need desire would thought till vnto yle brought hast vpon sand people tooke land herts glad chere light weening heauen night passed entring toward yle clad blacke chere piteous lady neuer dispiteous life tofore sory chere hert tore vnto prince gan ride come said abide abide haue hast fast retourne reason ye sojourne vntruth hath v discried vvo worth time v allied vvith soone vntrew ala day knew ala time ye bore lond lore accursed hider brought joy turnd nought acquaintance may complaine vvhich cause paine ala madame quoth tho knight horse light vvith colour pale cheekes lene ala mene vvhat haue ye said ye wroth displease would loth know ye well promesse made haue princesse vvhich perfourme mine intent mote speed haue ment trew without change thought new also fully seruand creature man liuand may lady princesse mine heauen whole richesse lady mine heale world joy weale may whence coms speech tell madame beseech fith first liuing fearfull nothing heare speake doubt feele mine heart breake say madame tell remnaunt good ill ala qd ye bore loue land lore queene dead ruth sorrow great vntruth two partes lusty rout lady wont talke play dead cleane away vnder earth tane lodging new ala euer ye vntrew time ye set past queene counsaile sone hast doe said great blame acquaintaunce cause would shame lady auise prayed need wise eschewing tale song make would ill tongs sey lightly conquest prayed poore feast foule worship weiued vnwisely conceiued rich treasour heale famous name weale put auenture sclaunder euer dure like without helpe appele wherefore need counsele euery wight would say closed yle open way become euery wight well appreued knight ala without paysaunce soone acheued thobeisaunce moued counsell thrise concluded daily twise bet die without blame lose rich name wherefore death acquaintaunce chese left haue pleasaunce doubt liue repreued soone beleeued made othes one accord eat ne drinke ne speake word neuer euer weping bide place without parting vse dayes penaunce without desire allegeaunce truth anon con preue queen forth leue toke present defauts fully repent died withouten thus lost euermore hereof reherse comen within come see herse ye shall see piteous sight euer yet shewen knight ye shall see lady stond ech great rod bond clad black visage white ready smite wepe make countenaunce slepe bet blew cloth died new parfite repentance thus keepe ordinance euer death endures breath knight tho armes twaine lady tooke gan saine ala birth wo worth life euen drew knife gowne doublet shert made blood come hert set downe vpon greene full repent closed eene saue one drew breath vvithout thus tooke death cause lusty hoast vvhich battaile coast sorrow cry gan rere thorow company heauen heard sowne vnder therth al fer adowne wild beast feare sodainly afrayed doubt might dure ran liues vnsure wood vnto plaine valley high mountaine sought ran beast blind cleane forgotten kind wo ceased counsaile went lord lady sent auise done besought say would sone vveeping full sore clad blake lady softly spake said lord trouth mischiefe flouth ye judge would right prince knight ye ben astate echone die fault one one hold promesse done longs gentilnesse fulfilled prince behest hasty farme bene feast vnrecouerable v slaunder aye durable vvherefore say counsaile none may auaile ye list remembraunce puruey make ordinaunce queene meke woman dede seke might land chappell haue remembraunce graue shewing end pity notable old city nigh unto high way euery wight might pray haue ben trew euen changed hew twise wished death sight thus passed breath said lord host conclude least would euer house thacke liues lead weare blacke forsake pleasaunces turn joy penaunces beare dead prince barge named haue charge hearse lay queen remnaunt went kneen holding honds high gon crie mercy mercy euerish thrie cursed time euer slouth haue masterdome trouth barge long mile hare forth lady one one company brought echone past sea tooke land new herses sand put brought anon vnto city closed stone vsed aye king land lay raigned honour writ conquerours abbey nunnes blake accustomed wake vsage rise ech night pray euery liues wight befell guise ordeint said seruise prince queen deuoutly might herses many orison verse without note full softely said full heartily night till day people church con pray vnto holy trinity soules haue pity night past ronne new day begonne yong morrow rayes red sunne ouer con spred atempered clere faire made time wholsome aire befell wonder case strange among people gan change soone word euery woo vnto joy two bird fedred blew greene bright rayes like gold betweene small thred ouer euery joynt full colour strange coint vncouth wonderfull sight vpon queen herse con light song full low softely three song harmony vnletted euery wight till last aged knight seemed man great thought like set thing nought visage ein forwept pale man long vnslept herses stood hasty hondling hood vnto prince past made bridde somewhat agast wherefore rose left song depart u among spread wing passe place entred hast shortly tell hurt backeward downe fell window richly peint liues many diuers seint bet wing bled fast hurt thus died past lay well houre till last briddes score come sembled place window broken made swiche wamentacioun pity heare soun warble throtes complaint note joy cleane reuersed one glas soone persed beke colour nine herbe brought flourelesse grene full small leaues plaine swart long many vaine fellow lay thus dede hearbe laid hede dressed full softily hong head stood thereby hearb lesse halfe houre gan ouer knit floure full wexe ripe seed right one another feed would beake tooke graine fellowes beake certaine put thus within third vp stood pruned bird dead sight togither forth flight tooke singing v leue none disturb hem would ne greue parted gone thabbesse seed soone echone gadred hand herb tooke well auisand leafe seed stalke floure said good sauour common herb find well approued vncouth kind vertuouse vvho haue might vse need flowre leafe graine heale might certaine laid downe vpon herse vvhere lay queene gan reherse echone seene taling thus sede wex greene dry herse gan spring vvhich thought wondrous thing floure new seed people tooke heed said great miracle medicine fine triacle well done assay might ease way corse torch light waked night soone lord consent people thereto content easie word little fare made queenes visage bare shewed wherefore swoone fell whole rout sorry least long weping ceast lord remembraunce vnto displeasaunce liue called paine true plaine good abbesse graine gan dresse three finger cleane small queenes mouth tale one full easily put full conningly shewed soone vertue preued medicine true smiling countenaunce queene vprose vsaunce wont euery wight made good cheere sight people kneeling stone thought heauen soule bone prince lay went make assay queene vnderstood medicine good prayed might haue graines releue paine endured went cured within little space lusty fresh liue good hele hole speech lough said gramercy leech joy throughout town great bel sown afraied people journay city euery way come asked cause rongen stately queene thabbesse made diligence would cesse lady soone rout sewing queene called name echone told none forgetten young ne old might men see joyes new medicine fine trew thus restored euery wight well queene knight vnto perfit joy hele fleting wele folke would wise desire perfit paradise thus passed sorrow mikle joy soone morrow king queene euery lord lady one accord generall assembly great cry country intent turned parliament ordained auised euery thing deuised please might least concluded feast within yle hold full consent young old wise thing withouten shipped thither went straunge realmes sent king queenes duchess diuers prince princess linage pray might like day mariage sport come see yle disport joust turnaies armes done way signifying ouer day aprill within may auised lady tweine good estate well beseine certaine knight squiers queenes officer manner embassade certain letter closed made take barge depart seeke lady euery part till found thing charged haue queene king lady maistres beseke gentilnes day oft recommaund queen prayes loues hast come woll wast feast businesse without joy lustinesse tooke token good speed praid god send need forth went lady knight fourteene day night brought lady barge well sped done charge whereof queene hartily glad soth joy ship approched lond lady sond met armes constraine wonder behold twaine dome twelue houres neither heat ne watry shoures departed company sauing themselfe none gaue laysour ease rehearse joy disease pleasure courage
