young tender age many knight brought night parted pleasaunce content hert countenaunce queene maistresse night businesse morrow huge rout prince lord come lady said comming glad well apaid full commingly thanked full heartily lough smiled said ywis doubt safety commaunded diligence spare neither gold ne spence make ready morow wedded saint iohn borow would withouten let wite lese morow come seruice mariage wise said honour neuer prince ne conquerour wedde ne company gentilnesse chiualry ne lady great rout ne beseen abouts certifie life withouten lie feast hold tentis tell mine entent rome large plaine vnder wood champaine betwixt riuer well neuer abbay ne sell ben ne kirke house ne village time man age dured three month feast one estate neuer ceast early rising sonne till day spent yronne justing dauncing lustinesse sowned gentilnesse thought second morrow ended old sorrow surety euery wight lady slept night prince queene rest vnto lady made request besought oft praied mewards well apaied consider mine old trouth paine haue routh accept seruise forme wise might one thus prayed queene euerichone nay stint justing day pray lady requere content fere good heart make friendly cheare said happy yeare smiled said ywis trow well seruaunt would welfare trist would would wist knew trouth continue would without slouth ye report restraining courage sport couth consent request named fest vsaunce obeying pleasaunce request consent please entent eke soueraine aboue commanded hath loue prefer prince may wer power ouer raigneth would nought paineth sith one contrary shall none tho thought promise marriage mese desired euery wight made night put away maner douts euery wight thereabouts morrow euery thought euery sorrow dislodged mine hert euery wo euery smert vnto tent prince prince thought brought maistres said full age conclude marriage lady knight squiers great host minister instrument sounes diuerse long rehearse tent church perochiall ordaint especiall feast sacre archbishop archdiacre song full seruise custome guise church ordinaunce dine daunce brought diuers playes speed ech prayes merry least said amended feast right glad lady lord marriage thaccord wished v heart pleasaunce ioy hele continuaunce minstrils made request encreasing fest would touch cord new joyeux accord mooue people gladnesse praiden gentilnesse ech paine day shew cunning play tho began sownes meruelous entuned accord joyous round tent vvith thousand instrument euery wight daunce pained merry none fained vvhich sowne troubled sleepe fro bed forth lepe vvening feast woke seast na lady ne creature saue wals old portraiture horsmen haukes hound hurt deere full wound like bitten hurt shot dreame seemed wake knew trouth ye seen routh trow ye would haue wept weke neuer man yet halfe seke went escaped life fault sword ne knife find ne might life tabridge de thing kerued ne edge vvherewith might wofull pain haue voided bleeding vains lo blisse lo paine vvhich lady complaine grace mercy require end wo busie feare accept seruise seruice auise dreame substaunce might turne cognisaunce cognisaunce preue full consent good leue el without pray night day mote vnto dreame returne sleeping forth aie sojourne yle pleasaunce vnder lady obeisaunce seruice wise please may deuise grace one accept like dreamed slept dure thousand yeare ten good amen amen fairest faire goodliest liue secret plaine shriue requiring grace complaint healed martyred saint trouth sweare booke ye may heale slea looke go forth mine owne true hert innocent humblesse thine obseruaunce thy lady thy knee present thy seruice new think great pleasance liue vnder thobeisance may look soft giue thee blisse thou desirest oft diligent awake obey drede wild thy countenaunce meeke glad thy nature feed thing yt may pleasance vvhen thou shalt sleep haue aie remembrance thimage may lookes soft giue thee blisse thou desirest oft thou name find written booke el vpon wall looke thou seruaunt true kind thine obeisaunce therewithall faining loue breeding fall grace whose lookes soft may giue blisse thou desirest oft ye ballade read shall pray keepe fall flower leaf gentlewoman arbor grove seeth great company knight lady dance upon green grass ended kneel honour daisie flower leaf afterward gentlewoman learneth one lady meaning hereof honour flower thing fading every blast look beauty worldly pleasure honour leaf abideth root notwithstanding frost winter storm follow vertue quality without regard worldly respect phebus chaire gold hie whirled vp sterry sky aloft boole entred certainely shoures sweet raine discended oft causing ground fele time oft vp giue many wholesome aire euery plaine clothed faire new green maketh small floures springen field mede good wholesom shoures renueth old dede winter time euery sede springeth hearbe euery wight season wexeth glad light glad season swete happed thus vpon certaine night lay bed sleepe full vnmete vnto ne might rest ne wist na earthly wight suppose heart ease nad sicknesse disease wherefore meruail greatly selfe long withouten sleepe lay vp rose three houres twelfe springing day put geare mine array pleasaunt groue gan passe long bright sonne vp risen okes great streight line vnder grasse fresh hew newly sprong eight foot nine euery tree well fro fellow grew branch brode lade leues new sprongen ayen sunne shene red glad light grene thought right pleasant sight eke briddes song would haue rejoyced earthly wight couth yet manere heare nightingale yeare ful busily herkened hert eare voice perceiue coud last path little bread found greatly vsed forgrowne grasse weed well vnneth wight might se thoght path whider goth parde followed till brought right pleasaunt herber well ywrought benched turfes new freshly turued whereof grene gras small thicke short fresh hew like vnto green well wot hegge also yede compas closed greene herbere sicamour set eglatere wrethen fere well cunningly euery branch leaf grew mesure plaine bord height see neuer thing ensure well done tooke cure make ytrow peine make passe tho men haue seine shapen herber roofe prety parlour also hegge thicke castle wall list without stond go though would day prien fro see wight within one within well might perceiue tho yeden without field euery side couered corn grasse doubt though one would seeke world wide rich field coud espide coast quantity good thing plenty pleasaunt sight sie thought sodainly felt sweet aire eglentere certainely heart deme dispaire ne thought froward contraire ouerlaid soone haue bote one felt sauour sote stood cast aside mine eie ware fairest medle tree euer yet life sie full blossomes might therein goldfinch leaping pretile fro bough bough list eet bud floures sweet herber side joyning faire tree haue told last brid began sing eaten eat wold passing sweetly manifold pleasaunt coud deuise song ended wise nightingale merry note answered wood rong sodainly sote stood astonied song thorow rauished till late long ne wist place ne ayen thought song euen mine ere wherefore waited busily euery side might see last gan full well aspie sat fresh grene laurer tree side euen right gaue passing delicious smell according eglentere full well whereof inly great pleasure thought surely rauished paradice desire ferther passe day sote grasse sat downe mine entent bird song conuenient pleasaunt manifold meat drinke thing thereto herber fresh cold wholesome fauours eke comforting demed sith beginning world neuer seene pleasaunt ground none earthly man sat bird harkening thus thought heard voice sodainly sweetest delicious euer wight trow truly heard life armony sweet accord good musike voice angel like last groue euen right goodly pleasant sight sie came singing lustily world lady tell aright great beauty lieth might ne array neuerthelesse shall tell part though speake surcotes white veluet wele sitting clad semes echone manner garnishing set emerauds one one many rich stone set purfles dout color sleues traines round great pearles round orient diamond fine ruby red many another stone went name euerich head rich fret gold without dread full stately rich stone set euery lady chapelet head fresh greene wele wrought meruellously noble sight seene laurer full pleasantly chapelets woodbind sadly agnus castus also chapelets fresh many tho daunced eke song full soberly yede manner compace one yede mid company soole selfe followed pace kept whose heauenly figured face pleasant wele shape person beauty past hem euerichone richly beseene manifold also euery manner thing head full pleasaunt behold crowne gold rich king braunch agnus castus eke bearing hand sight truly lady company began roundell lustely suse le foyle de vert moy men call seen mon ioly cuer en dormy company answered voice sweet entuned small thought sweetest melody euer heard life soothly thus came dauncing singing middest mede echone herber sitting god wot thought wel bigone might auise hem one one fairest coud best dance sing womanly thing daunced little throw heard ferre sodainly great noise thundring trump blow though haue departed skie within sie ye groue ye lady come men armes comming rout men earth ben assembled place wele horsed none stering fast earth trembled speake rich stone men horse trow large wones pretir iohn ne tresory might vnneth haue boght ye tenth party array list heare shall rehearse alite groue spake sie come first clokes white company ware delite chapelets fresh okes seriall newly sprong trumpet euery trumpe hanging broad banere fine tartarium full richely bete euery trumpet lord armes neckes great pearles sete collers brode cost would lete would seem schochones echone set many precious stone horse harneis white also next one company came king armes mo clokes white cloth gold richly chapelets greene head hie crown yt scochones bere set pearle ruby saphere eke great diamond many one horse harneis geare sute according euerychone ye haue heard ye foresaid trumpet seeming nothing lere guiding manerly hem came great company herauds purseuaunts eke arrayed clothes white veluet hardily thing seke hem harneis set euery man chapelet scochones eke horse harneis indede sute hem hem yede next hem came armour bright saue head seemely knight nine euery claspe naile sight harneis red gold fine cloth gold furred ermine trappors stedes strong wide large ground hong euery bosse bridle paitrell worth would wene thousand pound head well dressed crownes laurer grene best made euer sene euery knight riding three henshmen awaiting euery short tron houn lord helme bare richly dight worst worth ransoun king second shield bright bare necke thred bare vpright mighty spere full sharpe ground kene euery child ware leaues grene fresh chapelet vpon haires bright clokes white fine veluet steed trapped raied right without difference lord hem many fresh corsere came armed knight rout besprad large field ware degree chaplet new made laurer grene oke tree honds bare bough shene laurer okes kene hauthorne woodbind many mo mind came horse freshly stering bloody sownes trompes loud sie many vncouth disguising array knight proud last euenly coud took place middes mede euery knight turned horse hede fellow lightly laid spere rest justes began euery part brake spere drew hors man field astray steed ran behold rule gouernaunce ensure great pleasaunce justs last houre tho crowned laurer grene wan prise dint sore none ayenst hem might sustene justing left clene fro horse ninth alight anone remnant euerichone forth yede togider twain twain behold worthy sight toward lady greene plaine song daunced said right lady soone goodly might brake song dance yede meet hem ful glad semblance euery lady tooke full womanly hond knight forth yede vnto faire laurer stood fast leues lade boughes great brede dome neuer indede man seene halfe faire tree vnderneath might well haue hundred person owne plesance shadowed fro heat phebus bright haue felt greuance raine ne haile hem hurt might sauour eke rejoice would wight sicke melancolius good vertuous great reuerence enclining low tree soot faire hew within little throw began sing daunce new song loue plaining vntrew enuironning tree stood vpright euer yede lady knight last cast mine eye aside waxe lusty company came roming field wide hond hond knight lady lady surcotes richely purfiled many rich stone euery knight green ware mantle embrouded well surcotes euerich chapelet hed right well vpon shining made goodly floures white red knight eke hond led sute hem ware chapelets euerychone hem went minstrel many one harpes pipe lute sautry greene head bare diuers floures made full craftely sute goodly chapelets ware dauncing mede fare mid found tuft ouersprad floures compas whereto enclined euerychone great reuerence full humbly last began anone lady sing right womanly bargaret praising daisie thought among note swete said si douset la margarete answered fere passingly well pleasauntly blisful noise happed suddainly noone sonne feruently waxe hote prety tender floures lost beauty fresh colour shronke heat lady eke brent yt ne wist hem might bestow knight swelt lack shade nie shent within little throw wind began sturdily blow goeth floures euerichone mede laft one leues save succoured among fro euery storme might hem assaile growing vnder hedge thicke greues came storme haile raine fere withouten faile lady ne knight nade threed drie dropping weed ye storm cleane passed away tho white stood vnder tree felt nothing great affray greene without ybe yede routh pite comfort great disease faine helplesse ease ware one hem grene crowne rich well sitting wherefore demed well quene tho greene awaiting lady white comming toward knight fere began comfort hem make hem chere queen white great beauty took hond queen yt grene said suster haue right great pitie annoy troublous tene wherein ye company haue bene long ala please go shall ease pleasure may whereof tother humbly might thanked right ill array storm heat behight euery lady anone right white one took grene hond ye knight sene likewise ech tooke knight clad greene forth hem fare hegge anon right make justs would spare boughes hew eke tree square wherwith made hem stately fire great dry clothes wringing weat hearbs grew made blister ye sunne brenning good wholesome ointment new yt yede sick fast anointing yede gadering pleasaunt salade made hem eat refresh great vnkindly heat lady leafe began pray floure seeming array soupe eke thing people bring ayen right goodly manere thanketh friendly cheare saying plainely would obay hert commaundement anon without lenger delay lady leafe hath one ysent palfray intent arrayed well faire harneis gold nothing lacked long shold company made puruey horse euery thing needed full lustily euen herber sitting passed pleasantly nging would haue comforted wight sie passing wonder sight nightingale day laurer sete might whole seruice sing longing may sodainly gan take flight lady leafe forthright flew set hond softly thing marueled greatly goldfinch eke fro medle tree fled heat bush cold vnto lady flower gan flee hond set wold mine death point chase g gracious maid modir neuer bitter earth see full sweetnesse mercy euer help mine fader wroth speake thou ne dare see haue done earth ala certes thou mine succour sinke eterne mine ghost exile h vouchedefafe tell become man alliaunce blood wrote blisfull bill vpon crosse generall acquetaunce euery penitent full criaunce therefore lady bright thou v prey shalt thou stent greeuaunce maken foe failen prey wote well thou wilt succour thou art full bounty certaine soule falleth errour thine pity goeth haleth againe makest thou peace wch souerain bringest crooked strete thee loueth shall loue vaine shall find life shall lete k kalenderis enlumined world lighted thine name goith thee right wey drede soule lame queen comfort sith thou art ye seech medicine let mine fo bill vp bede world awaiteth euer thine goodnes thou ne failedest neuer wight nede p purpose haue sometime enquere wherefore holy ghost thee sought gabrielis voice come thine ere werre v swich wonder wrought save v sithen bought needeth v weapon v saue onely v ought penitence mercy aske haue q queen comfort right bethink agilt haue thee mine soule worthy sinke ala caitife wheder shall flee vvho shall vnto thine sonne mine mean vvho thine selfe art pity well thou hast routh aduersitie world might tongue tell r redresse moder eke chastise certainly faders chastising ne dare abiden wise hideous full reckening moder joy gan spring ye mine judge eke soules leech euer pity abounding pity beseech sooth ne graunteth pity vvithout thee god goodnesse forgiueth none like vnto thee hath thee made vnderneming best may ye put prison oft god law augustine rule doe amisse would amend ye put coueit ye shrift burying men parishens none sacrament falleth christian folke busie ye heare shrift poor folke well rich lord lady sith mow haue plenty shrift father poor folke mow say ye gospel house bedred men ye rich men mow goe church heare gospell couet bury poor folk among sith holy ye saine ye pouerty ye diriges ye haue rich men sith god praiseth hem doth men thy prayer worth sith thou wilt take therefore chapman yee need bee wise dread simony cause hast thou thou wilt preach gospel god saith thou shouldst sith best lore also beleeue vvhy ye euill apaid secular priestes preach gospell sith god himselfe hath bodden hem vvhy hate ye gospell preached sith ye much hold therto ye win yeare principio rule euer patrones made minstrel better ye contrarien mirth maken ye contrarien gospell word deed freer thou receiuest peny say masse whether sellest thou god body peny thy prayer el thy travell thou saist thou wolt trauell say masse peny certes sooth thou louest little meed thy soule thou sellest god body thy prayer simony art become chapman worse iudas sold thirty penny vvhy writest thou hir name thy table yeueth thee mony sith god knoweth thing semeth thy writing god would reward thou writest thy table god would el forgotten vvhy bearest thou god hand slanderest begged meat sith lord ouer vnwise haue begged haue need thereto freer lawe rulest thou thee findest thou god lawe thou shouldest thus beg vvhat maner men needeth beg oweth men beg vvhy beggest thou thy brother thou saist haue need thou dost perfection el least el meane perfection thy brother man needed beg man beg needed least perfection louest thou men thy selfe thou art well charity sith thou shouldest seek perfection thy power liuing thy self god thus leauing imperfection thou shouldst beg good mean thus beg thou dost man good mean yet mean granted may neuer grounded god law lerid leaud mean degree world go beg ye certes well nigh world go beg ye done ten beggers one yeuer vvhy procurest thou men yeue thee almes saist needful thou wilt thy selfe win thee meed vvhy wilt thou beg poor ye faren pharisee sain one contrary name ye patron order confiteor ye begin masse saint apostle martyr holy church hold glorious hem clepe hem patron auowries freer whether francis making rule set thine order foole liar else wise true ye sain foole wise ne liar true shew contrary suggestion pope ye said rule francis made hard ye mow liue hold without declaration dispensation pope deed ne let patron foole made rule hard man may well keepe eke deed prooueth liar saith rule tooke learned holy ghost might ye shame pray pope vndo holy ghost bit ye prayed dispense hardnesse order freer foure order frier best man knoweth best would faine enter best none thou saiest thine best saiest thou none good thine ech freer three order wooll say thou liest selfsame maner ech freer wooll say order best thus ech foure order bin three contrary point say sooth one alone may one best foure followeth ech order answered question thou doest three false one true yet man wite thus seemeth part freers bin liar point answere thereto say another order freers better thine good tooke ye rather thereto better thou mightst haue chose beginning eke shouldst thou apostata leaue thine order take thee better goest thou thine order freer perfecter rule religion christ godds sonne gaue gospel brother religion iames epistle maketh mention say yes puttest thou christ wisedome god father vnkunning vnpower euill could make rule good vnkunning might make rule good man might vnmighty god would make rule perfect bin euill willed namely himselfe might could would haue made rule perfect without default god sonne almighty rule perfecter christes must christes rule lacke perfection much perfecter default christ failed making rule put default failing god blasphemie thou say christes rule religion iames maketh mention perfectest holdest thou thilke rule without clepest thou rather francis dominiks rule religion order christes rule christes order freer canst thou default assigne christes rule gospell taught men likerly saued kept ending thou say hard saiest thou christ lied said rule yoke soft burden light thou say christes rule light may assigned default better may kept thou saist default christes rule gospell sith christ saith light easie need patron freers adde thereto make harder religion saue freers religion christes apostle disciple helden saued woulden freers saten aboue apostle heauen harder religion keepen would sitten heauen aboue christ himselfe strict obseruations better christ mischance go foorth fraine clerk ground ye god law gif iacke answer ye han assoiled haue said sadly truth shall soile thee thine order saue thee heauen freers kun mow excuse hem question asked hem seemeth horrible gilty god hir euen christian gilt default worthy order call order fordone woonder men susteine hem suffer hir liue maner holy write biddeth thou well meeke giue wicked forbed giue hem bread least made thereby mightier chaucer word unto scrivener adam scriuener euer thee befall boece troiles write new vnder thy long lock thou maist haue scall making thou write trew oft day mote thy werke renew correct eke rubbe scrape thorow thy negligence rape et sic est finis thus thing keeping substaunce sentence hole without variaunce voiding chaffe soothly saine enlumining true piked greine crafty writing sawes swete fro time mete first pilgrimes soothly euerychone tabarde assembled one one fro southwerke soothly sey canterbury riding wey telling tale rehearse liche host assigned euery man none hardy bidding disobey thus pilgrimes ley canterbury well lodged one sooth may call hap fortune conclusioun befell enter toun holy saint plainely visite sickenesse vowes acquite cope blacke grene palfray slender long lene rusty bridle made sale man toforne void male fortune tooke mine inne anone pilgrim lodged euerychone time gouernour host stonding hall full wind bost liche man wonder sterne fers spake saied anon dan pers dan dominike dan godfray clement ye welcome newly kent thogh bridle haue nother boo ne bell beseeching ye tell first name countre without shortly ye looke pale deuoid blood vpon head wonder thredbare hood well arrayed ride late answered name lidgate monke bury nie fifty yeare age come toune doe pilgrimage haue hight haue thereof shame dan iohn qd well brouke ye name thogh ye sole beeth right glad light praying soupe v night ye shall haue made deuis great pudding round hagis franche moile tanse froise monke slender coise ye haue sicke dare mine head assure let feed faint pasture lift vp head glad take sorrow ye home ride v morrow say ye rested haue fill supper sleepe done none ill wrap well head clothes round strong nottie ale make rout take pillow ye lie low need spare blow hold wind mine opinion engender colles passion make men greuen rops haue filled maw crop toward night eat fennell rede annis commin coriander sede like power haue might charge rise midnight though moone shine clere selfe orlogere morrow earely see time forth parcell afore prime accompany parde shall doe good looke vp monke cockes blood thou shalt merry say nay morrow anone day ginne east daw thou shalt bound new law going canterbury toun lien aside thy professioun thou shalt chese thy selfe withdraw mirth found thy maw like custome company none proud dare deny knight knaue chanon priest ne nonne tell tale plainely conne assigne see time oportune purpose woll contune homeward custome vse thou shalt plainely thee excuse well ware study well night heart light thy wit shall sharper bet anon supper set serued well vnto pleasance soone good gouernance vnto bed goeth euery manner wight toward morrow soon light euery pilgrime bet wors bad host tooke anone hors sunne rose east full clere fully purpose come dinere vnto ospring breake fast werne fro canterbury past nought space bowe draught host hast hath bridle raught saied game come forth dan iohn christen name let v make manner mirth play shete port twenty deuill way disport patere say woll make lip wonder dray tell tale make thereof jape rouncie thou shalt escape preach none holinesse ginne tale mirth gladnesse nodde thine heauy becke tell v thing draweth effect onely joy make lenger let saw would bet obeyed vnto bidding law bound thing coud pale cheare tale gan anone ye shall heare finitur prologus de thebe et sequitur quoque par prima libri beginneth history destruction city thebe sir qd sith courtesie entred companie admitted tale tell hath power compell meane host gouernour guide echone riding beside though wit barrain dull rehearse story wonderfull touching siege destruction worthy thebe mighty royal toun built begonne old antiquitie vpon time worthy iosue diligence king amphion cheefe cause first foundation fame neuer shall away honour floureth yet vnto day story remembred preised wals height reised wonder marueile list shall platly lere manner hole platly sentence vnder support patience write mine author bochas two rede bookes ye shall find king prudent amphion sweetnesse melodious soun city built whylome strong armonie sweet song vertue onely werbles sharpe made mercury harpe strengs touched soft whereby wals reised aloft without craft man hand full yore ago midde greekes land thing poet told neuer yseine nother yong old bocchas list specifie cleare expouning darke poesie sith mercury god eloquence yafe might heauenly influence vnto king nativite glad aspect excellent craft rhetorike world none like signifieth hem ben prudent musical lusty instrument mean harpe melodious yove king mercurious song author teach nothing crafty speech king ycalled amphion whereby made country environ lust word sweet pleasant favourable meet eares shortly none disobeisaunt king gone wheresoeuer list assigne chere port eft benigne stering exhortatioun went first build toun forsooke ech man country one assent make city royall rich liche none thus wals made lime stone reised first singing king liche poetes feine writing passing rich royall entaile may ye see much may availe goodlihede lowlinesse king specially cheare speaking liege bearen faire apport shew debonaire strange ne solein countenaunce outward ne disdein causeth oft advert great hatred people hert therevpon prively woll rowne prince doth vpon hem frowne shortly deme excellence emong hemselfe presence everiche conclude liche fantasie thus full oft gendred enuy folkes heartes soleinte pride list one looke aside reward hem low loute againe kind doute head record wise foot disdaine despise beareth vp take heed susteineth need piller supportaile finally ne pooraile bearer vp supportation farewell lordship domination throughout land every high estate wherefore seemeth fortunate mercury soote sugred harpe mar swerd whetted kene sharpe accepted aspect good god lookes wood goodlihead prince availeth win heart people humble speech glad countenance may prince soothly aduance emong people heart win inward love twin gold richesse pride tyranny disdaine daunger surquedy lord clerkes report loue crowne doe support fine conclusion take record king amphion example good king amphion built thebe eloquence pride violence noble rich like none thus wals made lime stone reised first singing king like poet feinen writing opinion authours king cadmus built first city thebe soothly yet expositours grounding hem upon old authours saine cadmus famous old man full long afore city first began ground building sette bound compasse mette thong kerue buls side enuiron stretch might wide get land full large space vvhereupon build dwelling place country boece took first name bull skin called thebe king cadmus exiled thebe prowess king amphion called soile thus getten vvhylome boece buls skin name thebe tourned cadmus hath long sojourned like story compiled shortly fro thence exiled never dwell toun knighthood amphioun vvhich vp perfourmeth rich none city thebe mighty square stone told lite heretoforne cadmus thus kingdome hath lorne scepter crowne power roiall told vnto ground ye well know information clerely pith exposition matter clerkes tell vaine lenger dwell tarry mattere sith tale ye shall vpon way last long space sooth suppose vii mile ye know first amphion built began city toun reigning long rede procede purpose first began telling line ran line amphion descent conveyed king laius fro king king succession conveying downe stock amphion seriously line discent leaue plainly intent tell forth bookes rede laius processe gan succede beginneth story king laius iocasta wife beare ye crowne mighty land holding scepter thebe hand manly wise life iocasta called wife full womanly story saith certaine time though barraine till laius full humble wise child sacrifice first apollo chaire bright iupiter hath great might beseeching hem devout reuerence graunt influence request executed may specially goddess three besought pallas iuno diane help also defrauded boon prayer accepted full soone finally rite old even like heart would queen iocasta hath anone selfe houre natiuite foryet heauenly mansion clearely searched smale fraction first second terce eke quartes augrime stone white carte ipriued diligent labour table correct deuoid errour iustly sought disposition heaven nativity edippus finally conclusion found saturne scorpion heauie chered melancolike loth wood mar furious wroth holding sceptre capricorne houre child borne venus direct contrarious depressed mercurious hous dome judgement finall clerkes speake speciall fatall sort may withdraw swerd father shall slaw fate edippus disposed slea father may man helpe ne excuse thing king gan sore muse cast would side againe dome himselfe prouide shape away remedy toforne bidding quene child wer borne without mercy moderly pite dead may none hast like hath sent obeied commaundement wofull heart pitous looke face pale yong sonne tooke tender grene flesh bone certaine men ordained none fro point point manner thing execute bidding king durst delay abide forest stood beside tooken way fast gan speed king performe indeed hauing thereof passing heauinesse beheld fairenesse child excellent beautie heart great pitie plainly cast emong hem strife child haue life anone high upon tree place man might see heng vp story reherce first foot gan perce bowes tender tough smale knitte vp shortly tale preserue beast wild rage tooken voyage toward thebe hast may fortune thilke day hound searching vp doun hunt went king polibon forrest gan find aforne come behind gan search seeke wonder sore emong hill holts hore rengen trench heard noise pitous cry hunt king polibon found child forrest presented unto king child honging tree one drough hem see left till haue found tooke doune foot vnbound bare home vnto polibon king archadie famous region child first see wound great pitee behold tender foot blede called edippus rede saine platly fage bored foot language first king royall hall made men norice call young child foster keepe milke mought ne weepe leech charged eke also till whole deuoir fully purpose child feire day maken heire cause onely taketh heed sonne none line succeed wife none find therefore let gone processe day yeres edippus emong playing feares port passing full pride none might peace abide heart inly surquidous melancolike contrarious full despite high disdaine wight durst shortly withsaine till day gan one debate specially great hate rancour hasty tene might pride sustene gan vpon cruelly braid vnto felly thus said whereto qd art thou proud port contraire also euer disport froward fell lasting euer one thou lord v euerichone presumest fully werking like thou sonne vnto king descended royall blood whether thou wroth wood thou art nothing thee list take hede appertaining vnto kinrede forrest founden vnknow thou wer yong therfore bear thee low vtterly remember thee thee list thy birth blood two vntwist fine shortly tale wherewith edippus gan wexe pale chaunge also cheare countenaunce gan apeint remembraunce word word forgat right nought felly mused aboue thought cast would without tarrying trouth enquire polibon king saw oportune space king secret place sought lowly knee request benignely see request edippus unto king polibon would plainly spare birth true ground declare make sure thing anone sonne none polibon onely gentillesse beheld great heauinesse edippus wofull paine gan dissimule manner faine liche ben verely heire falleth dispeire downe ayen knee gan fall conjuring god tell trouth nothing hide affirming eke abide lenger riden enquere till time may sooth lere part hap fortune importune desire king without abode curiously told stode answer king unto edippus forrest first found vpon tree foot ybound cast conclusion make king region day shortly tell edippus would lenger dwell tooke leaue hast gan ride temple fast beside apollo story told whose statute stood chaire gold wheeles foure burned bright shene within spirit full vncleane fraud onely fals illusion answere yafe euery question bringing people full great errour false honour rite vsed old dawes custome paganims lawes edippus full humble chiere apollo made priere beseeching knee low signe might know euidence shortly comprehended kinred discended edippus great deuotion finished fully orison fiend anon within inuisible voice dredefull horrible bad hast take voyage toward thebe linage hearen shall certified way anone hath hied hasty journey horse constrained day day till hath attained vnto castle pilotes ycalled rich strong wele aboue ywalled adjacent site country apertinent thebe city king laius present hold manner turnement knight yong couragious folke desirous preue hemselfe shortly tell force might excell get name prowesse euerich hem businesse horsebacke eke foot found full vnsoot rather play warre peace vvhere edippus put himselfe preace aie ready debate enforcing enter gate maugre tho would let preace auenture met edippus slough father ignorance castle pilotes king laius cruelly slough though story telleth hough ne wight company signe verily aspy whose hond king slaw edippus gan hast withdraw kept coy entencioun great noise pitous soun castell slaughter king dole complaint sorrow weeping saw heauines thought ayenst death auaileth lite nought ordaine rite full royall feast called funerall eke custome day old corp brent ash cold vessell round made ball closed gold metall busie cure thebe make sepulture richly hem list lenger let ash enclose shet matter sayen edippus retourne ayen enhasteth aie day day toward thebe euer may brenning hert whote fire fine know fatall desire failed guide way went fer aside wild wast countree mountaine stood vpon see edippus passed hill monster lay called sphinx monster many diuers kind conuersant story find among soothly one inly cruell man durst gone dread death forth passage monster mortall rage also discripcion body foot fierce lion like maid soth head face destruction foul monster fell looke cruell manace odious countenaunce sight rede sphinx monster hight worse tigre dragon serpent suppose enchauntement ordained hill tabide slea tho passeden beside specially faile expoune misty deuinaile probleme eke word plaine bare without auise fully declare life might escape sooth plainly jape declaration yaue thereupon cleare exposicion hast none mene slaen monster cruell tene may mercy none graunt edippus ignoraunt dreadful hill stonding roch ware ful nigh gan approch perillous platly wend sodainly monster gan descend stoppen way letten passage thus abreding fell courage word foul monster said haue hert inly great disport fortune hath brought thee fort make preefe thou may endure fatall end auenture set fine soothly day old case told charging well ware wise get palme beare away prise touching thing set atweene v tweine life death shall dreine monster dispitous cheare probleme gan thus ye shull heare probleme sphinx put edippus beast merueilous see sooth natiuitee might tender grene may himselfe sustene vpon foot though sworne moder borne afterward processe age foure foot maketh passage vpon three shall faine alder last goeth vpright twaine diuers port wonderfull cheares till length many sondry yeares naturally goeth ayen three sithen foure may none bee finally trouth plein recouereth kindly ayein matter came fro lo probleme ido muse hereupon without warre strife declare el lese thy life edippus thing aduert vvell assured manly hert gan herte serch vp doun prudence cast reasoun great auise thing may bee seing also may flee counsaile non ne rede tell trouth el dede full good deliberacion thus answered conclusion thou sphinx qd false fraudolent thou foul monstre thou dragon thou serpent hill like conceiue liest waite folkes deceiue trust well thy sleghty witt thy false fraude shall anon quitt liste whispre neither roune thy probleme shall anon expoune openly thou shalt go therefro lo take good heed thereto edippus expounded probleme sphinx put thilke beast thou spake toforne euery man world iborne may go limmes soft moder beareth aloft armes doeth crie weepe ginneth creepe fower foot tender youth experience ofte couth aforne irekened hand two processe thou maiest consider also two feete thy fell tene hath staffe himselfe susteine goeth shortly vpon three alderlast must need bee voidyng staffe walketh vpon tweine till age attaine luste youth wasted spent hand taketh potent three feete thus goeth ayen dare affirme thou mayst withsein sone vnweldy might influence nature right experience euery man may know like child fower crepeth low may sojourne yearth ayen must hast retourne came fro may remew world man may eschew sothe shortly doubt whele kind cometh naturally hath cours ironne circuite doeth shere sonne man child high low estate gaineth make debate time isette must fine atropos malice doeth vntwine liues thred cloto first compouned lo thy probleme expouned af euery metyng toke honde law thou must need stonde haste mine honds deie reason thou canst withseie sphinx awaped amate stood dismayed disconsolate chere doun cast heauy ledde edippus anone smote hedde fende stinking vnswete countree set holly quiete whereby hath soch price wonne fame euery coast ronne al lond monstre slaw line right thebe gan draw well receiued worthinesse manhood prowesse seigh seemely knight well fauoured euery man sight saw also thebe mighty toun onely regioun destitute gouernour ayen foon hauing succour hem defend queene alone emong hemselfe making full great mone none bookes specifie sceptre croune occupie lordes one assent within toune set parlement shortly concluding might prudently treate queen namely held hem selfe sage condescend way mariage joyned manly knight passing prudent famous eke might holle man discerne worthy citee keepe gouerne counsail lord desire plainly fall accorded without tarying thebe edippus shall king full assent none sayed nay time set ayein certain day emong hem selfe finally deuised wedding thebe solempnized full rially need must vnthriue onely moder tooke wiue vnwist blood ignoraunt shortly stood toforne father slaw wedding law tofore god neither faire ne good acceptable blood touch blood cause hath great confusion many lond many region ground root vnhap mischaunce fine concluding alway vengeaunce men haue sein clere experience holy writ recordeth sentence herode falsly life violence tooke brother wife fayre pleasaunt sight kept still force might although title non sake holy man sainct iohn trouth prison lost hedde wherefore rede euery man take hede vvhether lord prince king beware eschue soch wedding ere swerde vengeance manace lest lese hap fortune grace taking ensample maner thing edippus thebe crouned king wrought ignoraunce full derke blind wofull chaunce vnwist innocence ye haue herde fell soch offence punished brought low worthy errour know knot list absteine spousaile god man vnclene sem ne thereof deuise demeth self prudent wise eke edippus haueth emong mind wedding like ye may find vnhappy passing odious infortunate eke vngracious werie thereof write hatefull processe also endite passe ouer fully entent imeneus present lucina list shine ne none mus nine one accord maken melody song heauenly armony neyther clio caliope none sustren nomber thrise three philolaie ascended vp high aboue skie wedded lady vertuous vnto lord god mercurius matrician inamed de copelle booke wedding tell concluding marriage poete whilom sage lady called sapience iwedded vnto eloquence sat well heauenly purueiaunce hem joyned knot alliaunce two soothly entent wedding thebe absent caused great aduersity finall end solempnity sorrow wo destruction vtter ruine roiall toun may man helpe ne succour time joy though floure name people wedding king edippus jocasta queen wedding plainly tell cerberus chief porter hell herebus fader hatred present holle kinred wife also browes blacke doughters sorow make hidously chered vgly see megera thesiphonee alecto eke labour enuie drede fraude false tretcherie treason pouert indigence nede cruell death rent wede wretchednesse compleint eke rage fearfull pale dronkenesse croked age cruell mar many tigre wood brenning ire vnkind blood fraternall hate deepe set roote saufe onely death na boote assured othes fine vntrew folke weddyng new make toune desolate bare story shall declare aie thebe walles strong edippus reigneth many day long mine aucthor write word plain iocasta sonnes twain ethiocles also polimite bookes sondry clerkes write doughters two full goodly see one hight antigonee called imein beauty inly souerein edippus aie deuoid warre strife iocasta ledde mery life till fortune iniquity enuy prosperity shone rich renoun whele plunged adoun joy sodein wo wont frowardly namely hem setten affiaunce hartely trust variaunce king passing great might sat quene vpon certain night casuelly folke echone chamber sodeinly gone ere ware iocasta gan behold carectes wound old vpon foot emprented wonder depe tournyng face brest wepe secrely might espie anon fell fantasie aie thing musing bedde gan sighen sore king conceiueth distresse gan enquere heauinesse fully cause thoccasion wite conclusion eileth fared lord qd without wordes mo percell cause sodein rage tender age lord inamed laius king toune man right vertuous sonne right wonder feire likely successour heire bicause diuinours told birth sothly life fatall destinee slaen fader might none king fate eschue bad men hast thought due slea child haue thereof roth anon bad without sloth certain men vp pein judgement execute commaundement king yaue hem charge forth gone forest large adjacent vnto countree persing foot heng tree performyng thexecution compassion left resorted home ayen beyng doubt vncertein repeire tolden child afterward befall saufe said huntes found ladden forth foot vnbound coast coud declare percel mine euil fare ground cause mine heauy chere considered eke woundes appere vpon foot wot mene thing aie mine hart greene lord ala new date king laius slaine late castell nigh countree vpon comming citee yweied rekened one maketh mine hart heauie stone counsell none ne red word king lift vp hed abreid sharpe sighes smert thing order aduert curiously good auisement signes clere euident conceiueth well sore gan repent iocasta ment king sigh maners pleine goddes gan constreine shew cause affray expoune make delay croppe roote shortly entred first countre whens came region put delusion doen none till last brast one vnto queene gan processe make first forest take wounded foot forth euery thing cherishing polibon king holle cause forsooke wise way tooke toward thebe apollo bad fortune lad sphinx kept mounteine also slowe certeine king laius castell gate toward night full late thebe gan spede find stocke kinrede vnto gan wexe couth processe greene youth found wele rekening life moder wife night suyng morow betweene hem two began new sorrow vnto pitous tell thereupon yif dwell long space would occupy ye may read tragedy tragediae senecae de egypto reg thebax morall senek fully ending dooll mischief compleining sorrow vnweldie age edippus fell dotage lost witte worldly delite sonnes despite disdaine tooke keepe eke bookes saine iyen wepe mine aucthour liketh deuise sonnes rebuke despise vpon day certaine place hedde iyen gan race cast hem boote malice trade vnder foote fully deuoid loue dread edippus mischief thus ded within pitt made earth low cruelty sonnes gan throw worse serpent tigre wood cursed stock commeth vnkind blood storie ye may rede heretoforne although rose grow thorne thus edippus blind old wretched end haue plainly told shortly man child rede wele ware take hede kindly right conscience doe honour due renerence every man ought duty reverence father mother else fall vengeance father moder estate bee certaine el shull neuer thee hem debonaire speach porte treat hem faire hem obey honesty drede hem cherish nede dare affirme excepting none estate shall first infortunate werke sea lond thing take hond time froward contraire wast good plainly appaire finde plenty conteke warre strife vnhappy end shortnesse life gracelesse hath hatred god man also therefore man thereof recheles make mirrour ethiocles brother called polimite soch thing greatly wite ye shall hem fill descended doun hill passed lowe vaile shall begin remnaunt tale explicit prima par istius codialli immediate sequitur secunda par ejusdem passed thrope broughton blee kalender gan anon see sunne full clere gan shine clocke drew nine sawe also siluer dropes shene dewe like perles grene vapoured vp aire aloft zepherus blowing soft weder made lustie smooth faire right attempre holsome aire houre holle route pilgrimes riding round aboute tale gan procede rehearsing forth dede edippus buried graue sonnes kingdome haue son edippus debated crown emong hemselfe full mortall hate croune gonne debate hem justly shall succede scepter toune possede auerting nought neither right ne wrong eche hem make partie strong querele proudly susteine whose herts deuoided clene brotherhood faithfull aliaunce false couetise made hem distaunce fully werching destruction ruine noble toun hote brent hatred enuy two pompous surquedy neither would pleinly poinct forbeare stode soch disjoinct like birth foreins till toune noble citezeins knight baron many worthy lord shope way make hem accord set hem quiete pee part ethiocles alledge gan first borne ought reason go toforne citee crouned king sith law letting vnto longeth heritage discent title age controversie two brother polimite full high disdaine openly gan reply againe part said especiall reason none haue regaly dominatioun lordship wholly toun right nought city liue sile pouerty concluding without fere drede rather suffer would dede thus ala enuious strife ende euerich lost life great mischief ye shall thilke time lord fere full besily diligence great auise full high prudence set hem quiet rest counsailyng hem plainly best leue strife wisedome reason condescend conclusion might auaile finally gouernaile common union two brother lordes tho present haue hem brought one assent one hert brother vnto brother euerich hem reigne yeere yeere commeth toun shall absent fully yeere gie manhood chiualrie haunt deed marciall brother see riall holdeth sceptre citee gouerne yeere cours hath run yerne come shall haue repeire reigne thebe like lord heire receiue fully dignitee voideth citee paciently taking auenture till ayen honour may recure thus enterchange euery yeere shall one ascendeth hath fall must obey hert take well like one resorteth wele holle composicion betwene brother conuencion fully knit vp great auisement tofore goddes othe sacrament neuer grutche ne varie accomplish shortly tarie like thaccord enrolled toun poinct poinct made mencioun alder first reason age ethiocles auantage reigne aforne weare croune polimite hasting toune yere may none while brother satte rialte full richely vpon fortune whele rode forth armed bright stele polimite sothly rede himselfe alone riall stede without guide long day aferde keepe high way hert hauing suspecion brother malice treason lest pursue fals vnkind blood haue dedde couetise good alone might haue possessioun life fully toune hast hauing felaw polimite aside gan withdraw forest joyning see knowing right nought site countre full hilles high mounteines craggie roches pleines wondre dreadfull lothsome passage therewithall full beast rage holding way hert nothing light mate wery till draweth night day beholding enuiron neither saw castel toure ne toun thing greueth ful sore sodenly see began rore winde tempest hidiously tarise raine doun bete full grisly wise many beast therof adrad nigh fere gan wexe madd sempte wofull sownes tigres beres bore liones refute hem selfe saue euerich hast draweth vnto caue polymite tempest huge ala findeth refuge ne shrowde saw nowhere succour till passed almost midnight hour large space sterres clere cloudes voided heauen appere knight forest large gan approch londe arge polimite first came lond arge seing palaice mighty building adrastus called king lusty man rich wondre sage yronne somdel age borne isle called chifon somtime sonne king cholon witte story couth chosen tendre youth arge crouned king thiefe greece record writing descente succession alonely free election held arge sceptre hand worthy greekes land loued drade wisdome iustice story plainly deuise worthy king doughters two passing faire right good also long beaute descriue argiue deiphile doughters tweine king adrastus eldest called argiue deiphile ynamed second adrastus like found worthy king sonne none succede gone life triste hert add passingly pensife holy trust hope stood alliance worthy blood brought mene doughters twein shal relessed peine recomfort high mariage sothly yet full oft courage troubled occasion sweuene vision dream king adrastus wild boar fers lion shewed vpon certein night thought inward sight slept clere inspection wild boore fers lion possede shul bestes rage doughters two bond mariage short time within certein day brought hert full great affray thing soth destine hath shape world ful hard tescape marueilous man eschue fate polimite spake late tempest bete bereined grate onely citie hath atteined adrastus full stately degree thilke time held roiall see troubled might merke obscure hath brought knight auenture citie enclosed wall vnto palaice chief principall king chambre aloft lay bed slept wonder soft eke al folke chambres take like fortune parauenture shape selfe time late casuely porter gate right none porch built square stone full mightely enarched enuiroun dome ples toun executed lawes king knight without tarying wery mate stede alight hanging reine hast might vpon arme sure keepe leid doun gan anon slepe semed time best lay thus rest auenture came knight riding one worthiest world liuing curteis lowly right vertuous saith mine auctour called tideus virous armes manly werking birth sonne vnto king callidoine lond great renoun ala regioun exiled brother slow stage thebe writ manere al malice ment day hunting went forest harte hind stood great lind casuely lete arow slippe slough brother called menelippe mortall sort hand begiled banished exiled law narow sette charge caas came first arge porch polimite slepe auenture ere toke kepe night hidously besein tempest thondre rein felt also anoy great damage forest holding passage polimite toforne perrell oft likely lorne bestes rage set euery side till grace without guide rode arge great mighty toun streght vnto palaice chief dongeon like told polimite lay comming made great affray blind derkenesse night guie ne fond light vvhen came priket ne torche till vnwarely entred porche would haue take herbergage polimite sterte vp rage sodenly awaked rede nying proud stede first beheld knight armed brest sheld gan manere ray aduerte veray ire vpon horse sterte cruelly gan tideus enquere whens come bad hast answere deuise tideus full humble wise answered ayen verray gentillesse said soth high distresse tempest derke night driuen like errant knight need onely great necessity constrained great aduersity take lodging might court therfore alight without thinking none outrage ne wight meaning damage polimite malice pride told shortly abide ne lodge though sworne qd toke vp beforne keepe al night sey thee platly maugre thy might qd tideus curtesie deuoid rather villenie yef ye take hede seeme gentil knight suppose ye haue title right lodging way heritage haue fell rage parde yet shal disease till morow though ye ease gentillesse onely leue suffre shall litel greue aye tideus spake faire polimite froward contraire shortly saith geineth striue force shall deuoid bliue vtterly atwene hem two thing try must haue tideus seing better mene ful like knight stele armed clene without abode fast gan spede wondre liuely stride stede thus knight pompous elate litel cause fellen debate tideus polimite striuen lodging ronne togider horsebacke either first spere brake full surquedous pride sharpe swerdes togider ride full irously mighty champion fury like tygres lion hurtel al palaice shooke king adrastus sleepe wooke made hast chambreleins call court worthy knight al commaunding hem descend see report might bee wonderful noice court night seigh two strang knight fight plate thicke bright maile without iudge great meruaile dismaied vncouth thing found told king adrastus darknesse night chambre many torch light court descended downe meine stonding enuiron knight hauing great wondre manhode put hem first asondre hem commanding like gentill king leuen strife cessen fighting entred knightly looke first hem swerdes tooke affirming eke fantasie rage great folie wilfully liues jeopart withouten iudge quarel depart specially derke night neither might haue sight charging hem vp peine life disseuere stinten strife tho tideus hast might full humbly steed alight right mekely chere countenance put holly gouernance adrastus manere thing polimite eke made tarying high also would withsey king bidding lowly obey ought due reuerence stood presence gan enquere first estate cause also debate countrees sothly age asked hem eke touching linage descent stocke born tideus answere yaue beforn told plainly made lesing sonne vnto king calcidoine rightfull heire thereto exile cause told also ye haue herd story rad polimite chere face sad vnto king touching countree said borne thebe citee iocaste great famous queene moder without wene father whilom king lord shame spake neuer word onely yif shall feine fader brother tweine soth full loth tell eke king would compell gentillesse bad without blame birth haue shame holly caas knew euery dele touching kin knew ground fulwele like full cleere report enforcing comfort might besie peine manly king knight tweine hem said stood wist well full woorthy blood descended touching kinred made hast officer lede straunge knight debate palaice chambre estate ech take ease euery thing soth might hem please offred hem like estate disarmed plate cushens greues sabaton harneis voided habergeon two mantel vnto hem brought frette perle rich stone wrought cloth gold violet crimsin full richely urred ermin lap hem ayens cold morrow rage night sorrow take rest till sonne arise king full prudent wise first al rekeles knight herts sette pee euer dare wele ech trew stele life word dede vndre knotte bound brotherhede adrastus worthy king famous feast made rich plenteous knight himselfe thereat present mete full goodly hath sent noble king doughters dere gentillesse make chere knight come fro ferre like soth lucifer sterre gladeth morrow vprising lady comming stremes eyen clere goodly apport womanly manere countenance excellent fairenesse court broughten gladnesse freshnesse heauenly cheres agreable vnto straungeres entree especial hem thought like thing celestial enhasting hem full knightly wise ayenst hem goodly arise met humble countenaunce ful conningly obseruaunce hem conueying sitting place sothely haue leiser none ne space reherse put remembraunce holly manere daliaunce long abide well wot god cupide influence mighty hond feruence firy brond meeting first fortuned hath wele arowes gold stele yperced han knight herts tweine brest lusty peine ther abode sharpe spere launce depe yficched point remembraunce may lightly rased away thus joy driue forth day pley reuel knight sake toward night chambre take ue time fader bad weie knight hem lad reuerently vp many staire taking leue gan anon repaire lodging ful stately toure assigned hem herbeiour ipices plenty wine cuppes great wrought gold full fine without tarying bedde straight gon touching rest wheder sleepe non demeth ye louers maner thing experience haue fully knowledging declared booke find king night wooke thoughtfull hert story specifies musing sore full fantasy first aduerting great worthinesse knight semelinesse lusty youth force manhode come roial blode gan reuolue hert hauing maner doubt atwene two hanging balance wheder make aliance atween doughters knight tweine one thing ay heart gan constreine remembraunce auision aforne made amencion touching lion wild bore nedeth reherse casting alway fantasie might clerely signifie darke dreame hid close morow adrastus vp arose temple right way tooke gan pray deuoutly booke goddes dreme specifie bede homward hie behold knight sheeldes fell beast painted field shall cleere inspection full plainly making declaracion dreme night adrastus enhasted full right sheelds wisely behold saw goddes told sheelds hanging vpon hooke beast rage mortall crookes purpos like write bochas polimite ful streite enbraced hide fierce lioun tideus aboue habergeoun gipoun hidous sharpe hoor wrought bristels wild boore beast story leres wrought bete vpon baneres displaide brode whan fight wherefore king whan sight repayre hert full glad face full demure sad lord temple knight lad whan circumstaunces rite old done obseruaunces home court retourne ayein hall rich well besein worthy king hert liberall made feast solempne riall deintees surely excell vein euery cours tell straunge sewes soteltees ne sat like degree lacke time let ouerslide meate adrastus took aside knight two like prudent man secree wise thus tale gan adrastus spake knight secret touching marriage daughter sir qd ne doubt nought fresh grene ay thought first goddes ordinaunce next fate purueiance werking fortune hond ye brought lond tweine last night who comming full glad light first selfe shortly expresse consider see likelinesse person circumstaunces holle maner gouernaunces seing full well whereto feigne yee likely hereafter atteigne great estate habundance good birth rial blood ye may faile ye haue wrong ye manly right strong set hertes rest purpose hope best variance make knot alliance atwene doughters two yf herts accord wele thereto fully despeire succede haue heire therefore ye shall haue possession life halfe region forth hond day man thereto shal say nay sothly graue ech shall part haue kingdome haue prouided say shall diuided atwene two euerich crouned property equite compouned egaly euery man sight ech enjoy shall right witte ye shall lond amend manhood knightly defend ayens enemy mortall foon dayes passed goon desire lusty youth full set make couth ye shall haue like mine opinioun gouernaunce regioun entent seemeth best ye gouerne liue rest fully follow lust desire hunte hauke wood riuers euer haue thereto pleasance haue none attendance vnto nothing mine ease shortly yif agree please haue said ben wise according vnto auise delayeth wordes plein seemeth yeue answere ayen adrastus tale fined tideus hed full low enclined veray gentill knight power full might full humbly thanked king touching profre high thing party said would assent fully hert neuer repent euer king hath said polimite also appaid story comprehended euery part fully holle descended king fulfill dede point point vpon procede whether euer winne lese tideus made brother chese gentilnesse curtesie fantasie sister haue wiue soth chosen hath argiue eldest full womanly se tideus tooke deiphile beaute souereigne excellent adrastus throughout lond hath sent lord baronage present mariage knight make letting ech one come bidding goodly wise meke full benigne ayein day assigne thidre come full many lusty knight full wele besein many lady bright euery coste many fresh squier story seith many communer behold great rialte manere solempnite tell circumstaunces reuel diuers daunces feast riche yeftes great peinfull sighes feruent heat loues folke brenning glede deuise many solein wede touch stole amorous lokes sotell craft leide line hokes ielous folke traien begile awaites many sondry wile soth descriuen ne wele newe fame ranne meane swift passage vnto thebe marriage report trew fained tho thereof eares hath attained mine auctour writ ethiocles touching honour great encres polimite highly magnified newly allied adrastus lond arge thing greatly gan charge dreading inly marriage shall time turne dammage sore musing casting vp doun great power high renoun adrastus greek lond power soget hond least polimites sake would vpon new warre make like conuentioun time set deliuer vp toun brother bond oth sworne couenaunt assured toforne ye remember late told purpose hold best cast vary thereupon list lenger tary liche desire shape remedy first sent next ally affiaunce lord gouernaunce kingdome come anon present euerichon said plainly wening best hert shall neuer rest sorrow maner dread till brother vtterly dead thebe roiall sete might alone reigne quiete meant himselfe shortly none vnpertourbed polimite brother counsell diuerse entent find written thre folkes present soth faithfull trew also change new eke betwene tweine couertly could vndre colour feine commendation trouth first seid aboue thing trouth long vnto king worde variable plein hool contre stable trouth preferred book esdre aforne king woman wine trouth first without wene chief piller may king susteine joy honour lede life trouth sometime prerogatife esdre booke specifie record take prudent neemie worthy king great pride wine woman eke set aside power dominacion hauing reward comparison trouths might trouths worthinesse esdre pleinly expresse taketh hede place influence sothly grace trouth alone old neemie gat licence reedifie walles new hierusalem treasure chief euery realme salomon write thing tweine trouth mercy linked cheine trouth mercy preserven king adversity preserue king like decree al mischiefe al aduersitee ala therefore doublenesse variaunce elles vnsikernesse chaunge doubleness king change word mutabilite fraud disceite instabilite king haue domination causen destruction king redeth story doun rowe seeth many haue ben ouertrowe falshod fortune whele vnto god pleaseth neuer adele king double entent may happe world went ful oft sith sleight werking thus truth god seeth euery thing right may cloude toforne sight trouth shroude may clipsed derked deceipt false engine ligging aweite serpent vndermine last cleerly shine saith nay shew bright beames soth kingdomes realmes bearer vp conservatrice al mischief sothfast mediatrice god aboue list se keepe king prosperite euery side afferme dar ye king lord beeth wele war behest justly hold thinketh thebe walles old destroied platly le doublenesse ethiocles people sore bought onely nat conseil wrought hem trew wise list werke auise left trouth set fantasie gouerned false flatterie counsell false flatterer bad thinke knight hold force right life lordship toun lese possession bonde hestes made toforn let brother blowe horne list pipe rede counseil platly rede soch list say soth falsly flatre word smoth whan hadde holle tale fined ethiocles fully enclined whosoeuer therat laugh weepe like counseil possession keepe saith nay grutcheth ayein contraire thought vein year come ethiocles reigned thebe sheene sonne xii signes round ronne sith ethiocles rekening thebe crouned lord king holding sceptre diademe reason would seeme time full complete space couenant void place polimite eke journey make toward thebe possession take due title wrong thought soth yere wondre long exile come hert maner doubt least brother falsehed found acquite himselfe like bound adrastus gan declare herte beseching matter aduert therevpon yeue counsell sone touching right best done whether best go abide like knight manly ride alone make message chalenge rightfull heritage within thebe either pee strife thereupon jeoperd life thus set fers brother adrastus sothly thought another bet send gone lest trapped among mortal fone hauing brother suspect caas fraude falla would werke destructioun hardy entre toun prudently take heed fully concluding speed thebe sent perceiue fully thentent ethiocles inward signe crowne resigne thilke yeere like made oth whan knew purpose goth thereupon werken procede thus adrastus wisely gan rede tideus took upon message polimite brother treat vpon mattere tideus manly chere said vtterly brother sake message would vndertake whole themprise thenbassiate welefull infortunate spare whatsoeuer betide adrastus side polimite conclusion contraire opinion said soothly hem thought right sith well proued knight discended worthy blood nold none yearthly good thebe regalty put body jeopardy al thing auaileth right nought wil forth deare bought taking leaue first estate armed maile sure plate shope forth vpon journie made sorrow deiphile sorrow deiphile tideus went toward thebe city bitter teares dewed face full oft sithes swouning place trist mourning blacke wede saw tooke stede inwardly encreased gan mone seeing lord riding forth alone vpon way worthy tideus hast story telleth v speedeth making delay space day high toures thebe gan see entred citee wisely enquiring pallaice stode like knight thider streight rode marked full well many man sight like mar himselfe stele armed bright till attained hath cheefe dongeon king held mansion throgh palaice knightly looke hall right way tooke stede light adoun aferde hardy lioun king lord great rout hall sitting round entred manfull courage execute fine message thought conuenient due full cunningly gan king salue requiring kingly excellence goodly wise yeue audience disdaine neither port ne chere sith come messangere polimite owne brother dere ginning tale thus ye shall wisely knightly tideus message qvod vnto worthinesse purpose breefly expresse effect holly sentement message sent long processe make mattere ground take eschuing prolixity void away superfluity sith selfe best ought vnderstond cause fully haue hond eke conceiue entent meaning rightwisenesse longing king first considered ye take hede edippus old king dede selfe brother bliue crowne contagiously gan striue mortall foen full great hatrede two first succede till ye meanes reconciled ye reigne exiled toune yeares space ayeine resort place reigne king ye voiden tourn processe cometh eueriche patiently tendure thentrechaunging auenture put stood estate thereupon make debate liche couenaunt conuentioun enrolled vp lord toun reason may denied sithen ye haue yeare occupied request tideus made name polimite title convention polimite requireth right acquite true knight eschuing mortall warre strife sith ye prerogatife eldest brother reigne aforne thinketh ye arne sworne oth keepe make tarrying holly aduerting liche prudent king trouth comparison treasour region acceptable vnto god man richesse ye reken wherefore hast let slouth quiteth selfe justely trouth vnto brother auoiding citee let reigne royall see crowne thebe yeare occupie greece praise magnifie high renoun may say none ye acquite justly brother whole theffect sain answer expectant ye send ayain whan tideus told tale ethiocles triste wonder pale conceit first maner hath refreined dissimuling vnder colour feined shewing chere maner debonaire intent wonderly contraire inward hert wood furious tourning face towards tideus gan abreid last spake euen thus vnto spake answer king ethiocles haue great marueile qd thought message thou hast brought brother thou hast expouned desireth thebe crowned hauing regard abundaunce great plenty suffisaunce hath king arge seemeth little charge haue lordship dominioun bound little toun sith reigneth freshly flour surmounting predecessours new encrease fortune might wherfore heart right glad light fully trusting nede helpe without drede like brother find ward faithfull true kind supposing plainely euermore reigne set little store casteth short yeare brother exile liue pouerry great distresse suffer high noblesse token brother hede signe rather hatrede interrupt possession little poore region spake coud aduert scorne rooted hert hem seempt story teach surplus soothly speach might lenger restreine plainely said betwene v tweine meane thus polimite bond surete ne faith ymade may auaile claimeth yeue gouernaile city neither yeare ne day shall let soothly may shall title bond enjoy thebe halfe foot lond let keepe hath wonne purpose haue begonne reigne thebe henceforth liue maugre hem thereayen striue despite friend counsaile list call let sure know right wele manacing drede neuer dele sikerly deuise sheweth well thou art wise suppressed manere rage take thee surquedous message presumest doe high offence boldely speake presence fere auaile shall right nought tithings thou hast brought shall vnto disencreace better haue peace folly presumption ayenst seech occasion liue thereto mine hond said erst winneth lond wall toune may stond plainely doe thee vnderstond shull first beat full low toures earth ythrow ere thebe haue thing ado lo retourne say tideus saw feruent ire king anger set fire full despite melancolie conceiuing eke great fellonie apport like wood worthy knight little stood sad demure ere would ought seine last thus said ayeine knightly answer tideus yaue ayeine king certes qd conceiue new thee thy counsaile vntrew dare saine vow best ne thou art faithfull thy behest stable thy word yt thou hast said toforne deceiuable falsely eke forsworne eke perjurate thine assured oth whether thou lefe wroth say thee shortly hold fage shall tourne vnto thy damage trist well full cruell wise greekes lond shall vpon thee arise auenged manly redresse great vntrouth high falsenesse thou hast ayen thy brother wrought shall full deare bought verily indeed thou shalt lere king adrastus meddle matere lord enuiron bounden subjection prince duke many noble knight susteining thy brother right shall day spere shield ayenst thee gadred field knightly preue one assent thou art fals double entent thy promise atteint eke outrayed leue well shall delayed hast execute deede like thy desert thou shalt haue thy meede god aboue rightwisenesse open wrong shall hast redresse might collusion reforme ayeine extortion fine falshood shall vaile ayenst trouth field holden battaile wrong crooked halt lame anone brother name next allie querele shortly defie fully auised mine hole entent ye lord present require worthinesse say trouth beare witnesse time commeth justly record king falsely gan discord hest false variaunce thinke ye faith ligeaunce bound echone ye may go therefro obey serue two next yeare anon following lord true king polimite though absent accord made parliament deuise sitten row engrossed vp well know enrolled onely witnesse register void falsenesse none vary may new say vnt ew rede selfe acquite let time lenger lie respite one without tarrying manly force fet home king maugre fone like ye bound let slouth found put justly possession counsaile conclusion manly tideus departed king tideus message saied like charge saied list lenger sojourne fro king gan face tourne astonied heart aferde full proudely layed hond swerde dispite lefe loth sterne pace hall goth court manly toke stede thebe fast gan spede enhasting till large sped forth toward lond arge thus leaue riding forth while retourne ayeine stile vnto king hall stood emong lord furious wood heart wroth euill apaied word tideus saied specially hauing remembrance proud dispitous defiance while fat royall see vpon would auenged bee full cruelly euer befall ire gan call cheefe constable chiualrie charging fast hie worthy chose houshold knew manfull bold hast tideus sue tofore lond remue vp peine life lesing head without mercy anon dead falsely ethiocles laid ambushment way slain tideus repair knight fifty number mine author saith vnwarely comber armed echone maile thicke stele therewithall yhorsed wonder wele posterne forth gonne ride gein path lay aside secretly man hem aspy onely treason fellony hast hem forth long day cruell mallice stop way forest one assent full couertly tolay bushment vnder hill strait passage fallen auauntage way tideus gan draw thilke mount sphinx slaw nothing ware opinion compassed conspiration innocent like gentle knight rode aye forth till drow night sole without companie hauing man wise gie last lifting vp hede toward eue gan take hede mid way right line thought saw ayenst moone shine shield fresh plate burned bright enuiron cast great light imagining fantasie treason conspiracie wrought king journey lette nothing sette well assured manly hert list one aside diuert kept way shield vpon brest cast spere manly rest worthy tideus outrayed fifty knight lying await slaen first platly mette body proudly smette fell dead cheefe maister hem one vpon fall euery paas compasse enuiron tideus high renoun bloody swerde let glide sleeth killeth vpon euery side ire mortall tene meruell might sustene ayenst hem euery halfe beset swerde sharpe whet fomen found full vnsoot ala made light foot force grounded full great distresse knighthood high prowesse vp rose maugre fone came slough hem one one like lion rampant rage hill found narrow passage tooke full high prudence liche bore stonding defence fomen proudely assaile vpon plein blood made raile enuiron soile waxe redde fellen dedde lay one lay two three mercilesse crueltee thilke day vpon hem found one enemy confound stood mighty champion beside saw water tourned doun huge stone large round square sodainly ere ware lien none vpon foen rolled one ten hem wenten vnto wracke remenaunt amased drew abacke one one went mischaunce thus finally brought outrance hem euerychone tideus bliue none one left hem aliue himselfe yhurt ywounded kene harneis bleeding grene theban knight compas round valley slaine whole rout pitously againe moone gape none hem shortly might escape dead echone haue deserued saue one except reserued tideus entention king make relation knight haue journey sped euerich hem life left wed meeting haue hem borne tellen assured sworne tideus full lowly knee ensample openly ye may see truth little multitude hath ever fine victory falshood ayens trouth falshood hath might figh querels grounded vpon right without may victory euery man haue memory great power shortly conclude plenty good great multitude sleight engine force fellony arne feeble hold champarty ayenst trouth list take heed end falshood may speed tendure long ye shall find thus record take worthy tideus arted hond throgh troth excellence fifty knight slough defence one except late told sworne assured hand vphold king tenforme atteint tideus bleeding wonder feint mate weary great distresse ouerlayd feeblenesse might tho himselfe sustene tooke horse stonding grene worthed vp forth gan ride easie paas wound wide soothly yet opinion alway aferde treason anguishous full busie peine rode forth till atteine bound ligurgus lond worthy king manly hond tideus wounded came ligurgus lond full pale onely lacke blood tideus saw castle stood strong mighty built vpon roche toward fast gan approche conueighed thider clearenesse stone night ayens moone shone high toures crestes marciall joyning almost wall gardein little beside tideus gan ride aduenture gate small found reken lusty erber vnto deuise sweet fresh like paradise heauenly inspectioun first alight adoun goodly place beheld necke voided hath sheld drew bridle horse hede let go tooke manner hede garden enclosed pasture soot gras tideus heauy ledde vpon hearbes greene white redde thought time best layd downe take rest wearinesse desirous sleepe none await body keepe dreames grudged euer emong lay till larke song note new high vp aire glad morrow rody right faire phebus also casting vp beames high hils gilt streames siluer dew vpon hearbes round tideus lay vpon cold ground vprist shene sunne stoundmeale greene wound runne round soile depeint greene red meint ligurgus doughter found tideus sleeping herber forwounded euery morrow holesomnes aire ligurgus doughter make repaire custome aye emong floures new garden many diuers hew joy take hede stalkes seene hem sprede alures walking fro little go selfe alone casting vp sight beheld armed knight lay rest hearbes cold beside gan eke behold mighty stede walking anon fell manner fere specially saw blood sprad greene stood last caught hardinesse womanly gan dresse toward knight hauing manner drede great doubt least dede soothly chiefe thought make priefe stood man full oft forth goeth toucheth soft lay honds smale face deadly bleike pale liche man adawed swough vp stert swerde drought fully put vp ayeine anone hath lady seine beseeching onely grace haue pity trespace rew womanhede fray fall drede least assayled new thebanes preued full vntrue drede rechlees full humbly yeelding pee trist himselfe passed bound saw mortall wound routh gentillesse disease distresse nothing dismaied heart sorrifull affraied discomfort manner thing qd doughter king called ligurge greatly delite euery morrow garden visite passingly disport wherefore qd beth good comfort womanly lady acquit tideus disease wight touching voyage shall hinder ne doe damage ye list auenture plaine trouth vnto discure sooth doe businesse reforme greeuous heauinesse might whole diligence hope great offence ye shall haue helpe aduersite ferreforth lieth trusteth right well ye shall faut find saw kind womanly goodly benigne port many diuers signe vnto order spare auentures fully declare thebe first touching message hill woody rage wound hurt sore vaine rehearse told euerydele sooth liked neuer adele routh compassion mischeefe wrought false treason riding hast sue womanly thought due chamber led vp aloft full well beseine bed right soft richly abouten apparrailed cloth gold floure irailed length brede first lady womanhede woman bid goodly attendant vnto wounded man vnarmed shert made first wash wound smert tideus refreshed castle lady serch hem well diuers instrument made fette sundry ointment leech eke best coud find full craftely staunch bind euery thing may done ease suage peine wo tapease court castle sought bidding chamber wrought sake hath sent deinties conuenient nutritife phisickes lore hem seke wounded restore making woman eke taken keepe await night sleepe well ware nothing astart might lusty hart prayed abide till strong mighty ride castle play disport leiser home ayeine resort might welde large nought home arge tooke leaue next day without abode hast way lowly thanking vnto goodnesse freedome bounteous largesse womanly list take heed refresh great need behoting full might would seruant true knight liueth charge forth rode till come arge tideus repeired home arge full great hast would dwell rehearse either tell repaire coast pleines great roches high mounteines manere home comming meeting welcomming joy adrastus made suster wife glade whereto write enbraced armes white gadering prees sorrow polimites made himselfe see sore wounded greeuous hurt sore eke vnsounded deadly looke face pale
