ginne new tale sooth manner idlenesse himselfe order expresse first thebe hath borne ne king falsely forsworne thawait treason sette fifty knight way mette ye haue heard manere without tale long ynow adrastus made men seach euery coast many diuers leach come hast make tarrying vpon peine bidding king done craft recured force euery part assured echone cunning shew space dayes whole made sicknesse tho joy ther gladnesse throughout court al toun euery man hath opinioun tideus gentillesse manhood lowlinesse hold famous knight best beloued euery mannes sight throughout greece euery region must make digression tell shortly sentement thilke knight tideus hath sent thebe onely declare great mischeefe euill fare vnto king befall open trouth knight tideus hath slaine hem euerychone saue himselfe escaped none reserued sheding blood king tell plainely stood rehearsed euery poynt ethiocles stood disjoynt ethiocles sore astonied heard death knight hatefull ire wext nigh wood teene fell mood cruell mallice knight spake felly seid lacke manhode cowardise flaine mortall wise hanged high neck death slaughter reck compleine eyther one mischeefe befall doe force none astert sigh vpon false coward hert knight hath renoun brought confusioun full gracelesse full vnhappy nay qd knight nothing thine vnhap plainly many worthy warriours life neuer shame except querele taken thy name grounded rooted falsenesse cause soothnesse vnhap wot wele none thine vntrouth done vnto thy brother thou openly forsworne percell cause lorne fals breaking thine assured oth tho king mad almost wroth purpose slea knight onely said vnto right ala eue morrow suppressed deadly sorrow renning aye remembraunce pitous vnhappy chaunce great mischeefe misauenture touching death discomfiture fieres himselfe also shamefast importable wo mortall strife weary owne life hent hath swerd aside stert roue euen hert king himselfe tho present rumour noise went thebe wood rage joyned linage knight slaine hill one one heart wold haue arisen throughout citie vpon king auenged death cheefe occasioun baron lord toun ful busie rumour disease high prudence stint appease quiete euery thing sette body home fette knight like ye haue herd afore yslaine bloody swerd tideus full sharpe whet ground field hem found onely loue affectioun solemnely brought hem toun like manere rite old first brent ash cold one yburied like degre lo kalends aduersite sorrow vpon sorrow destruction first king region lacke onely like told behest truly hold first ground root ruine story clearely shall determine tale hereafter shall lere list remnaunt finitur par secunda sequitur par tertia cruell mar full melancoly thy kind hote combust dry sparkle shewen ferre streames red sterre thy sphere goth cause thou wroth wth hem thebe throgh who feruent ire city brent set fire bookes old well rehearse conne cruell hate rooted begonne engendred story maketh mind onely blood corrupt vnkind infection called originall causing strife dredefull mortall mischeef al grece ran king adrastus alderfirst began hath cast conquest make vpon thebe polimites sake knightly wise preue might full entent recure right first sette parlement hath letter messenger sent greece many sundry king hem enhast make letting round made mention sent also many region prince duke earles baron taken vp city tounes chesen likeliest preued best manhood send hem vp ech one hond receiue pay anone adrastus thebe ride tho lord abide great purveyaunce king adrastus toward city thebe houshold still haue leaue take riden home retourne make country degre sustene hem take vp meine make hem strong knight squeres speres bow arbalasteres hast possible may returne best array tearme set full manly seine toforne arge moustren pleine king prince come adrastus rede full worthy degre thider come first prothonolope record writing archade sonne vnto king full prudent found warre pee came also king gilmichenes find full famous renoun thider come eke king ipomedoun passing knighthood name excelling worthinesse fame noble king called campaneus came eke arge story telleth thus proued full wele riden fer thider come king meleager king genor eke held royall see mine author saith lond greece king locris king pirrus eke king called tortolonus renouned many region come king called palenon oft assayed found manly knight broght stele armed bright full many worthy countre tideus knightly see noble man worthy werriour worthinesse flour master mirrour prowes hond hath sent also mighty lond calcedoine heire kingdome rich feire charging counsaile officer also hast may seeken best werriours famous knight proued souldeours al ye lond leid hem charge without abode come arge obey full lowly bidding enhasting hem made letting sped hem fast vpon journy thebe mighty strong city came doun knight wth many another man maugre king helpe considred first falshood treason ymeued onely trouth reason polimites sworne yore crowne justly restore large toun vnto arge descended doun like oth assurance bound ligeance come full lowly wise lowly done list deuise trouth full conceiued hath grace goodly hem receiued assigning hem place amid hoast assembled many diuerse coast finally company ygadred floure cheualry ychosen greekes lond knightly manfull hond trow sith world began seene many manly man wele horsed spere shield togider sembled soothly field men might see many strange guise arming new vncouth deuises euery man fantasie order specifie euery peece longing armure thereupon doe busie cure sooth almost dayes werke tearmes also derke rehearse hem clearely rime passe ouer lacke time tell forth lodging adrastus noble worthy king hath euery lord like degree receiued wele within citee like pleasaunce needeth fulsome habundance men horse plenty vitaile commaunding nothing ne faile noble worthy werriours high low poore souldiours yserued haue need adrastus presently tooke heed availeth king pay people truely fond full lich king touching tearme day toforne serued pay free list nothing restraine man cause complaine hunger thrust ne indigence thing ready vnto presence prince ful great repriefe suffer people liue mischiefe ful heauy greuous thought habound haue right nought may possede body hart rich seene people smart may body power wel constraine heart hath full long raine maugre might louen large may king heart set charge ne hem coarten libertee men saine ful often thought free ech prince lord gouernour specially ech conquerour let beware high noblesse bounty free dome plenty largesse one accord bridle lede least people hath nede defrauded alone late make mone court let first deuise exile scarcehead couetise likely freedome ginne loue people euermore winne reigne long honour contune aye encrease fauour fortune enemy manly oppresse loue great richesse love availeth king gold rich gold faileth oft loue abide life death lord side treasour shortly king stondeth loue aboue thing farewell lordship morrow eue specially loue taketh leue list mirrour make knightly freedome let ensample take adrastus manly king famous liberall bounteous vnto people time found made strong fomen confound loue enemy werrey greece made bidding obey one accord knightly side one thebe ride tauenge sith strong great injury importable wrong vnto sonne next allie ye forne haue heard specifie while greekes rest time pee resort vnto ethiocles thebe warely hath espied friend certified greekes wholly ordinaunce purpose eke purueyaunce thereof heart manner drede first tooke counsaile rede ethiocles made strong ayenst coming greek lord baron toun wisest regioun might maken resistence manly stonden defence strong dout country adjacent eke also forreine region hath withhold champion thereupon sent espies friend next ally worthy dwelling enuiroun young fresh lusty gadred toun maskewed wals toures stuffed hem manly souldeours round set many gonne great small large tonne hasty passing feruent heat spent treasour yaue yefts great vnto knight worthy men name euermore encrease fame yaue lord jewel manyfold clothes veluet damaske gold get heart soothly rede helpe great nede prudently purueyed toforne flesh fish wine corne set captaines early late full great stuff stonding euery gate made also werkemen trew barbican bulwerkes strong new barreres cheines ditch wonder deepe making auow city keepe liueth despite fone god mettall stone full oft swore hert thought shall first full deare ben ybought many man polax swerd knife towne shall first lese life shall eke many side blede ere brother possibly possede toun pee like greekes wene end trouth shall sene let beware wele toforne prouide adrastus side party negligent day held parlement lord sitting enuiron driue shorteley pleine conclusion vp tapoint fine entent thought full expedient ere procede werke thauise one full prudent wise circumspect werkes worthy bishop age fall called soothly name amphiorax great fame bishop amphiorax sent come unto greek throgh land east south among greekes passingly couth man sooth old antiquity accept authority first reason high estate eke fortunate werkes also secre god knowing priuite graunt bookes specifie spirit trew prophecie coud aforne full openly diuine thing begon fine eke craft calculation yeue doome euery question magike great experience find coud heauenly influence meuing high sterres finall doome conteke werres prophecy amphiorax bishop wist well god told greekes forth journey hold tourne shall platly fage great mischeefe great damage hem echone especiall blood right blood royall greece may withdraw voyage shortly shall slaw greekes wente euer wept bemente fine may succoured earth deuoured quicke knew certaine saw na none gaine saue life bette defence vtterly withdraw presence praying wife prouide sought hide womanly keepe close trouth conceiling purpose trust touching greuaunce full set purueyaunce hope god drede deceit womanhede true woman echone also close muet stone ne would mill stood discuren world good finally greekes entent drede haue bishop sent wife amphiorax conscience save oath discured husband soughten long ere might find cause wife kind surely hath locked vp corp manner remors selfe greuing conscience dreding fall great offence least soule perill lorne oth compelled sworne requiring coud tell lord bishop dwell discure heart full loth till time gan remember oth coud trouth custome denie also great conscience lie wonder heauy sorrifull face maugre lust taught hem place shitte vp toure alone hauing succour fell ere ware set vp full rich chare foole jeoparde life discure counsaile wife yet full sorry sake specially saw take hope heauinesse gan tassuage full soone processe short time gone tempest may lest euer one bishop force might vnto greekes conueyed full right hore grey chaire sitting full glad comming hauing trist full opinion cause occasion wisdome sapience vertue high prescience eschue aduersity possible fall journy story fully hath deuised full circumspect right wele auised hath pronounced parlement tofore lord president cleare conceit sikernesse entriked doublenesse dismall dayes fatall houres auentures sharpe shoures froward sort vnhappy stounds complaint deadly wound wofull wrath contrariosty fell mar cruelty meane grey mood shall shed worthy blood greekes may eschued purpose execute sued shall fine high noblesse shall draw decline grekes blood mischeefe sorrow wo selfe also fate hath disposed deepe ground shall enclosed locked vp derke vale cruell death lo tale bishop adrastus told counsailing purpose withhold escheuing mischeefe sorrow god tooke borrow theban greekes meet fine thereof shall vnsweet greece shall rew warning hem mischeefe knew shall follow man may lette would abstaine siege sette vnto thebe purpose leue whose word lord gan hem greue therein full small delite euerich heartely high despite abreide se vntrew contreuer prophecy new eke also long berd old dotard coward aferd rancour gonne defie calcling astronomie shortely said took therof none hede ne thing gouerne hem rede clamour noise euery coast high low throughout hoast specially poore souldiours lordes reigning flour estate effectuelly mene age tender grene haue marces influence werre great experience ye list ye may consider see coueiting great aduersitee youth perill cast aforne till mischeefe suddainly lorne age prouideth euery thing ere begin casten ending age youth diverse opinion youth gouerned large reine stert forth refreine head set one hurteleth ayenst hard stone broseth himselfe vnwarely perbraketh age expert nothing vndertaketh toforne good discretion make due examination tourne either bad good youth fast stirred blood taketh emprises hasty wilfulnesse ioy ginning end wretchednesse old prudent gouernaunce full long aforne maketh purueyaunce youth ala counseil werke full oft stumbleth derke thus selde seene trouth termine age youth draw line folly hath domination wisdome put subjection wisdom without supportation availeth little nought like bishop al high prudence cause might haue none audience wisedome prophecy greekes holden folly though plato wise socrates morall seneke diogenes albumaser prudent theolonee tullius soueraintee whylome rome eloquence though shortly sentence aliue cunning expert man list counsaile aduert sawes taken heed might auaile come need prudence find succour prouidence hath fauour farewell wisedome farewell discretion lacke onely supportation vnsupported locke hore amphiorax sighen gan full sore hed enclined many heuy thought saw counsail ood nought vtterly greekes told haue fully cast journey yhold made hem ready gonne hostey toward thebe city werrey greece lenger tarry forth hem amphiorax carry set chaire dolefull hert wist might astert fate disposition hosteying region ligurge greekes approche sundry lond many craggy roche way soothly gone horse ne man water none dry valleyes pleines yeare reines full great drought made mention lond searching enuiron great mischief greek default water nother found well ne riuere hem refresh water clere ala refute ne conne importable shene sonne hote hem foulds ley mischeefe men horse dey gaping full dry vpward south putten swerdes mouth speare head story told tassuage thurst yron cold life full many one despeired mischeefe home ageine repeired till day worthy tideus eke king campaneus purpose rode throughout countree might water see coast coast ferre nere till fortune entred herbere tree shadowed fro sunne shene full floures hearbes grene wonder holesome sight aire therein lady passingly faire sitting tho vnder laurer tree armes little child full gracious looke visage also wonder tender age sonne king borne succede called ligurgus story rede whose heart joy worldly eke disport mirth eke pleasance comfort child excellent fairenesse lady mirrour semelinesse sodainly cast vp sight vpon stede saw armed knight greatly abashed gan anon remue tideus gan fast sue tideus complained lady herber water said suster beth nothing dismaied selfe displeased affraied come onely place beseech mercy grace v succour great need declaring stand indeed fast almost hond worthiest greek lond king prince lodged field many polax shield mischeef perill great drede want water likely dede none high ne low degree hoast passed dayes three dranke ala except none estate fate infortunate praying womanly pitee benignely graciously see greece cheualry liues stonds ieopardy ye would womanhood tell ye know riuer spring well specially care gentillesse vnto v declare lo ye lust heare seine mine suster deare lady inly vertuous complaint heard worthy tideus pity chaungeth chere hew heart vpon wo gan rew full goodly seeing distresse said vnto heauinesse lady courteously taught tideus well certes qd large touching child haue charge hast doth greue power helpe releue onely routh compassion leue occupation conuey true guide riuer little beside dare much assure little child put aduenture fearefull depart sake yet shall doe part life death true affection prouide saluation tooke child leid lap richely clothes gan wrap couched among herbes sote leid many holesome rote floures eke blew rede supprised manere drede tideus forth anon went trouth treason ment wey would neuer dwell till brought right faire well riuer water full habound glad tho jocound tideus seeing riuer hast sent messanger adrastus abide downe descend riuer side hoast licour haue riuer liues saue enhasted hem making none abode one riuer rode drinke great lust appetite staunch thurst dranke found hem good feruent wood vpon water sikernesse vndiscreet hasty greedinesse measure water drinke fell dead euen vpon brinke naked riuer runne heat summer sunne bathen hem water cold also haue told meane tho prudent wise water dranke measurable wise thurst haue endured refreshed fully recured greekes high low degree profite commoditee compasse riuer christalin sight one accord tent pight rest hem reles peine onely space day tweine while grekes vpon riuer lay tideus vpon day full knightly hath done diligence yong lady great reuerence adrastus goodly present whose comming king himselfe went falling doun knee thestates tho present degree grekes lond absent one armes tooke vp anon thanking besinesse labour kindnesse behoting like hold thing pleinly wold may redy find also greekes story maketh mind thestates tho present thanked holle entent freshing done many greke part behight eke body good two list commaund hem redy partly faile auctour maketh rehersaile lady faire vpon se name isiphile adrastus told ye may rede lineally stocke kinrede sometime king doughter rehersing hal e caas first countree went shortly wol nat assent execute conspiracion made woman region thing contrary agein right ech hem vpon certein night one accord shall warely take kepe fader brother husband slepe kniues sharp rasours kene kitte thortes mortall rene vnto fi e bochas tell land found man slaine echoue conclusion woman might haue dominacion kingdome reigne liberte party interrupted lady passing debonaire matere froward contraire kept fader slawe death preserued withdraw ala fled countree pirat taken see king ligurgus brought dred trouth womanhed tooke yong child keepe herber left alone slepe tideus brought well ason bookes tell lady sonnes two hercules also toward colchos countree came raccomplish conquest kam list see story holle isophilee fadres name also write though sein named thorite bookes vermos eke call know auentures lady isophile faire faithfull aye inly debonaire loke boke iohn bachas made whilom woman rhetoriques glade direct full souereigne stile faire iane queene cesile rede r brike isophile trouth bounte full craftly compiled sake leue hath take adrastus homeward wey tideus gan conuey gardein till repeyred ala matere despeired joy wilfulnesse destitute mirth gladnesse w begin sharpe houres lady hath found among floures child slain foul serpent herber litel childe turned vp face slain serpent selfe place taile hurled scale siluer shene venim persing kene mortall eke perilous violence caused ala long absence slow homeward hie wepe waile crie nought sigh compleine wofully wring honds tweine dedly looke pale face chere gan rende gilt tress clere oft sithe gan say ala wofull wretch vnhappy caas shall whider shall tourne fine sojourne wote right well may escape piteous fa e shape soccour none ne none rede liche desert mote dede slouth negligence haue ala done great offence guilte may excuse shal king treason accuse offence slouth two sonne ded heire also loued al good treasour none nigh hert stood depe graue courage likely fallen rage mine odious offence reported vnto audience importable shall heauinesse well wot verray sothfastneise queen hath thing aspied mine excute may denied doubt nat geineth pite without respite auenged ala haue deserued death may preserued nother bill supplication rage transgression requireth death none mede thus ala quaking drede none helpe ne remedy dreint sorow grekes ran hertely woo face chere distreined cheekes weping albereined hie affray distraught furious tofore al thoste came tideus fell knee gan compleint make told pleinly grekes sake must ded shortly substaunce rehersing ground greuaunce first traines false serpent child flaine absent mischief vnderstood disjoint perill stood vnto full knightly behight helpe euer might pitious woo stinten appease find vnto disease hasty comfort went full great paas adrastus told caas vnhappy wofull auenture beseeching doon besy cure bound equite right eke aduertise haue sight quitte grekes toforne likely haue ben lorne succour void womanhede must knighthood take hede remedien vnhappy thing adrastus like worthy king taquite himselfe story maketh mind lady found vnkind neither coste ne trauaile besy might auaile succour considred thing thauife al worthy king grekes lond ben accorded thus prince duke hem tideus hold way one ride ligurgus dwelling beside one entent may purchace wise get grace lady called isophilee would assay might palaice full roially built stone worthy grekes came riding euerichone euery lord full freshly stede ligurgus example manlyhede anon knew comming tacquite himselfe like gentill king agein hem went mete hem way ful wel besein good aray receiuing hem full knightly chere adrastus said ye shall cosin qd gan embrace ye welcome owne place thanking hertely high noblesse goodly gentillesse towards ye list acquite selfe day cosin visite castell take lodging neuer yet glad thing life thereto trouth euermore shall slouth chambres large toures shall deliuered herberioures euery lord degree vnto lodging assigned shall bee officer let hem selfe deuise yf housing largely may suffise stretchen atteine none estate haue cause compleine host lodged beside ententifely vpon abide let hem fet auctority vitaile inough city al may hem succour saue word al euer haue full holle commaundement adrastus state grekes preiden ligurgus life isophile qd adrastus entent part cause comming come another thing certein gift requere benignely ye list may grekes passingly auaile request faile dare openly expresse withouten ye gentillesse graunt affirme conferme ratifie bold specifie qd ligurgus thing euer excepted onely thing three first touche life yong sonne pleinly wife take good ye list pro ide treasour set thing aside surplus compt nat mite adrastus astomed lite ligurgus conclusion sonne made exception while treat thus fere came forth one wofull chere face looke pale nothing red loud crieth king sonne ded ala whilom feire ligurgus borne ben heire ala hath yolden vp breath serpent stong vnto death wound new fresh greene herber lieth pity seene hath lien almost day ligurgus heard affray wist child dead mo little wonder though wo sodainly importable smart ran anon hent hart sorow king ligurgus made death child lamentation queen constreint deadly peine throughout felt coruen euery veine rage gan mine depe could sobbe sigh wepe noise lamentacioun quene distraught descended doun knew ground sorrow needed teares borow twenty time vpon row aswound fell earth low stoundmell mischaunce still stone lieth traunce child court brought tofore ligurgus ala wite nought vpon corp mortall face fell atones gan embrace sore grispe agein vp sert adrastus thing aduert kingly routh compassioun eyen teares fell adoun eke king duke stood onely pity gentill blood power teares restreine cheekes doune began reine day would suffise sorowes order deuise first king queene also tellen al neuer haue space almost houre stormes teary shoure weping somewhat ouergone litel corp grauen vnder stone adrastus tide ligurgus toke litel side full wisely prudent spech queene present gan tech sorow auaile may right nought murdre owne thought ayeinst death may recure though wo perpetually endure al helpeth soule go life thus taketh heed thereto exile pilgrimage ful turment bitter rage liche see renning fro suing ebbe flood litel space abiding full whose sojourne pope yeueth bull king none duke ne emperour may shroud ayenst fatal shour cruel death list manace marke man mortall mace geineth saluation neither franchise ne protection littel nought may helpen caas sauf ondir eyther supersedeas world loketh aright none great power might none rich shortly bold must die either yong old youth passeth passage escaped wood rage sorrow trouble present life replenished conteke warre strife selde neuer stondeth surete wherefore best seemeth man grutch high prudence sonde god taketh patience ye wise manly selfe drowne torment wo losse thing ye list see wise may recured bee great folly vndiscretioun thus adrastus hath conueyed doun substance whole would say till found ti pray conuement isophilee beseching haue pite hath offended highnesse wilfully reckelesnesse first would dome diuide mercy preferre set right aside request prayer hem vnhap mischeefe fall hasty rigour doe vengeaunce thinke aforne purueyaunce wretch doth mercy drede shall mercy find hath nede sith hath power might space let take lady grace lacke routh nat thus die tho quene gan replie queen algate serpent dead platly said matere auaileth neither request prayere pite mercy remission condicion serpent cause sorow labour lay hed borow finall vtter recompence find grace great offence elles shortly shede blood blood greekes answere vnderstood one actord best wise toke hem auenturous emprise loue onely isophile gon ride enuiron contre hilles valeis roches caues diches darke old graues euery cost serching vp doun till last full famous renoun worthy knight parthonolope first happed se hidous serpent riuer side great horrible sterne full pride vnder roch banke lowe hast bent sturdy bowe therein set arowe filed kene body spotted blew grene parthonolope slew serpent full mightely made glide hent swerde hanging side smote hed anon hent therwithal gan queene present wherethrough parcel gan tasswage thus prowesse high corage manly man parthonolope hath reconciled faire isophile vnto grace fully queene ire voided old tene adrastus mediacion king ligurgus graunted pardon lady daunger fre restored liberte palaice al life dwell though iohn bochas contrary tell auctour affirmeth drede child serpent dede durst great offence neuer come presence ligurgus entention fled anon region hert tooke childes death sore felle find ye haue herde aforne specifie kingdome bookes lie nota de ligurgo rege traceae licurgus called trace rede place mighty champion athene came palamon ayenst brother called arcite yled chaire iiii bolles white vpon hed wreth gold full fine find eke bachus god wine baccus deus vini king whilom debate onely pompous elate destruction vine first set alay wine meint water strong bacchus great wrong brake lims dreint see ligurgus ye get trouth ye list verifie rede goddes genealogie nota de duodecim arboribus libra bochacii de genealogia deorum lineally kinred degree ybranched vpon xii tree made bocchas decertaldo called among poetes itaile stalled next fraunceis petrarke suing certein vnto grekes retourne agein tell forth shortly con journey haue begon adrastus hath leaue take ligurgus browes blake departing seint ihon borow made wardes next morow wel besein mighty strong wondre early larke song trompet warned euery man ready hast remue letting make haue right wey take toward thebe grekes euerichone nombre gadred one worthy knight neuer aforn sein feere moustred plein ne stint none occasioun till comen euen afore toun pight tent prowdely rede vnder walles grene mede theban besette manly knight would haue priked haue scarmished hasty pride fomen ou side bidding ethiocles thilke night kept hemselfe pee onely late great wait set euery gate men armes night walking walles bidding king lest traine treason toures chief dongeon set men make mortall sownes brasen horne loud clariounes full entent watch kepe warde man ne slepe grekes proudly long night kindled fire made full great light set vp lodging vpon euery side like euer abide compas toun voide space set fomen manace while tofore cite ley euery coast sent forreie forrey greek made countrey thebe bren townes thropes vilages great rauing making pilages spoile robbe brought home vitaile manere sortes bestaile shepe nete cruell rage houndes slaine sauage herte hind bucke blacke bere wild ro fat swine tusky bore carrying home grekes store wheate wine auantage hay otes foddre forage kalendes hem thought due grekes gan theban salue ministring hem occasion fell siege set shortly tell full entent hateful pride life death thereupon tabide euer thereat agreued till fully purpos haue acheued may thereof made reles ful ware ethiocles gan party greatly merueile saw great apparaile grekes citee round himselfe manner dout point best thilke time stode abiding toun hert great suspecion lest toward vnstable brother party fauorable variaunce thebe among hemselfe cite variaunce vnto great mischance nede shortly ne wist vpon might trist nat one entent wherfore hath counseil sent lord old queene soch dempte pure clene holle one heart variable old expert alwey found stable requering hem wise openly tellen auise better pleinly sight brother treaten fight gaue full blunt sentence werre none experience said best ben aferde try right manly swerde also prudent spake vnto good auisement list spare conceite told best couenant hold perfourme hest made toforn brother lich sworn word wors make spede found variant dede none hatred rancour ne pride tho queene toke aside word worthy queen jocasta unto ethiocles told pleinly full vnfitting soch doublenesse finden king said eke although strong vnto brother wrong towne record dede bere witnesse come nede wherefore let v shape mene mattere grene ere querele thus gon volunte turne fine aduersite darreyned battaile trusteth may full lightly faile folie short auisement put strife martes judgement hard judge wood treate aforne without losse blood put mater holle marte swerd law doth coarte may hap ye glad wroth thou thy brother shull repent many another present trespas ben innocent many thousand perca shall complein debate onely tweine strife shall find full vnswote thou art ginner ground rote injury great vnright goddes hereof han sight thou shall accompts rekning make tho perishen thy sake cause driuen ferre sodeinly pee either hasty werre mot folow anon fatall chaunce life death dependeth balaunce thou ne maist craft restreine vpon one platly tweine sort mote fall ilke doth tourn euer thereat either laugh mourn thou art driuen narow stake thou maist mo delay make fight treat vtter fine none engin thou canst decline hasty caas folke sain ben wise redresse requereth full short auise trete long auaileth nought point sothly thou art brought either keepe thy possessioun hast deuoid toun wher thou therwith wroth wel appaid note well haue said counsell wisely condescend wrong wrought old newly amend time come may none wherefore hast treate thy brother make resistence thy lordes fully yeue credence whose counseill ithe sage let polimite enjoy heritage shall tourne thine auaill loo holle fine counsail treaty ethiocles sent unto brother shortly tho ire wroth though hereto froward loth according hearing prees algate shall treate pee must condicion haue dominacion first chiefe himselfe reserued thought well deserued saue holle souereintee vnder thebe citee graunt right good chere polimite reigne yeere tauoide resort agein claime vein would done onely sake otherwise none end make greekes fortune euer befall finally emong lord na one high low estate would gone ambassiat towne ne bet ne wors till iocasta made sadle hors cast self gon treate make end would done morow right time vpon howre drew prime went yonge doughters tweine antigone faire imeine meine full many one gate conueied purpose made first went horsebacke king adrastus tent lord fere receiue right glad chere shewing like degree euery halfe full great humanite polimitie rising place humbly moder gan embraee kissed antigone eke imeine excellent beaute passingly faire great pres concours repaire lady haue sight iocasta proceedeth anon right adrastus matere propose gan openly disclose entent ethiocles meane desireth pee reserue gan specifie honour whole regalie sceptre crown diuided whole hath prouided polimite conditioun vnder reigne toun soget suffrance brother grekes thoughten another knightly answer worthy tideus specially worthy tideus pleiuly affirming nat thus haue condition set aside excepcions nothing reserue speciall hole lordship regally polimites fully possede thebe crouned verely dede rightfull king put possession like couenaunts convencion ymade old assured ensealed shall new repealed stable holle strength stond let platly vnderstond first deuoid toune deliuere sceptre croune brother make therof shortly elles shall bought full sore matere brought end greekes none shul hen wend er right v denied life death darreined tried erst toun remewe list thing eschue mischiefe stinten appese either part may great ese thus meane auauntage deliuer vp hool trew heritage brother heire endure greekes shall fully assure bond list deuise yere complete best wise deliuer ayen possession without strife contradicion fine justly hold v fall let wait onely werre houre come deferre lo thus ye may report ayein ye bien que ce nest pa mon tort know well hurt jay tout perdu mon temp mon labeur altogether lost time labour jay en vous toute fiance repose trust je vouldray je vous dy say je vous dy sans doute say without doubt la belle dame sans mercy fair lady without mercy lardant espoir en mon coeur point est mort davoir lamour de celle que je desire earnest hope within heart dead love desire meulx un one best heart onques puis leuer never rise mon coeur heart mon coeur ce qui vouloy heart would pleures pour moy sil vou plaist amoreux weep please lovely lady plus ne pourroy qui est la qui bien aime
